APW_ENG_19941201.0001;0	Fire continued to burn inside the Achille Lauro early Thursday , a day after the flames forced the nearly 1,000 people aboard take to lifeboats and abandon the cruise ship off Somalia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;1	Two people were reported dead and one missing in the flight from the Achille Lauro , which gained notoriety in 1985 when Palestinian terrorists hijacked and killed a wheelchair-bound American passenger .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;2	Overflights by U.S. Navy helicopters at dawn Thursday found the ship listing but in no danger of sinking some 25 kilometers -LRB- 15 miles -RRB- offshore in the Indian Ocean , said Cmdr. T. McCreary , spokesman US Naval Forces Central Command in the Gulf .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;3	After fighting the blaze , the last 60 crewmembers abandoned the badly listing vessel Wednesday and boarded merchant ships helping in the rescue .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;4	The 23,478-ton vessel was 210 kilometers -LRB- 130 miles -RRB- south of the Horn of Africa when the crewmembers left .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;5	`` I just passed the Achille Lauro overhead and she is fully engulfed , almost now in flames .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;6	Flames have progressed far forward in the ship , '' said U.S. Navy pilot Lt. Paul Frost , who flew over the site Wednesday afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;7	Eight people were injured in the fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;8	The ship 's owner , Genoa-based Starlauro , said the blaze apparently broke out in the passenger area , but the cause was unknown .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;9	Capt. Ferdinando Lolli , a port official in Rome , said the ship was carrying 581 passengers and 404 crew .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;10	Most of the crew was Italian , and the passengers mainly South African , German , Dutch and British .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;11	Late Wednesday evening , Italian Coast Guard officials reported that one person from the Achille Lauro was still unaccounted for .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;12	The two reported dead were identified by Italian news agencies as a Briton and a German .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;13	The Panamanian oil ship Hawaiian King was one of the first ships to arrive at the scene and took on about 800 people , said a coast guard official in Rome , Adm. Eugenio Sicurezza .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;14	The Liberian-registered Bar Du , and a Greek ship , the Treasure Island , also were picking up passengers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;15	Two U.S. warships , the USS Gettysburg and USS Halyburton , reached the scene overnight and dispatched helicopters to ferry water , food and medical supplies to the survivors , said McCreary .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;16	The commerical and Navy ships will divide up the passengers Thursday and send them on , mostly to Mombasa , Kenya , and Djibouti , McCreary said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;17	Others reportedly will be taken to the Seychelles .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;18	All three destinations are about 1,930 kilometers -LRB- 1,200 miles -RRB- away from the Achille Lauro .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;19	The Achille Lauro left Genoa on Nov. 19 , stopped in Israel , and its next port of call was to be Durban , South Africa , on Friday , said Carla Gotta , a spokeswoman for the cruise ship 's owner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;20	The terrorists who hijacked the Achille Lauro in 1985 shot American Leon Klinghoffer and pushed him in his wheelchair off the ship .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;21	The hijackers escaped the vessel and boarded a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced it to land in Italy and the hijackers were captured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;22	The Achille Lauro resumed service as a cruise ship shortly after the hijacking .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;23	Klinghoffer 's convicted killer is serving a 30-year term in an Italian prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;24	Two other men are serving lesser terms and a fourth person , 17 at the time of the hijacking and tried as a juvenile , was paroled in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;25	George Bennett , spokesman for the U.N. operation in Somalia , said the Achille Lauro 's position was close to the small Somali fishing village of Eil , about 25 kilometers -LRB- 15 miles -RRB- off the coast .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;26	Launched in 1946 in the Netherlands , the Achille Lauro was acquired 20 years later by the Neapolitan shipping dynasty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;27	Its sides painted a royal blue , the Achille Lauro first transported Italian immigrant workers to and from Australia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;28	In 1970 it was outfitted for pleasure cruises .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;29	But it has had its share of problems : The liner rammed a fishing boat in 1971 off Italy , killing a Neapolitan fisherman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;30	On Dec. 2 , 1981 , fire broke out aboard ship off the Canary Islands .
APW_ENG_19941201.0001;31	Panicked passengers jumped into the sea , and two of them drowned .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;0	Prime Minister Jean Chretien has started a week-long trip to Europe as concerns about 55 Canadian peacekeepers detained in Bosnia threaten to overshadow his remarks today to the French Senate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;1	Chretien is only the second leader to be invited to speak to the French Senate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;2	The first was German Chancellor Helmut Kohl last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;3	While in Paris , Chretien will also attend a world summit on AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;4	In his remarks to the Senate , the prime minister plans to stress trade and commercial links with France while playing down concerns about Canadian unity , federal officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;5	But these comments may take a back seat to worries about Canadian troops who continue to be held by Serbian forces and wider concerns about the future of United Nations ' peacekeeping efforts in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;6	The prime minister arrived in Paris late Wednesday as a rift between the United States and other allies seemed to deepen over what role United Nations ' forces should play in the war-torn eastern European country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;7	`` The Americans want to control everything and fight down to the last Canadian and Frenchmen , '' Chretien said in an interview published Wednesday in the French daily Le Monde .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;8	Congressional leaders from the United States , which has committed no ground troops in the former Yugoslavia , said this week that UN peacekeeping efforts there are a failure .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;9	Chretien said again that the U.S. is in no position to criticize UN efforts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;10	But the prime minister also suggested in the interview that it 's time to reconsider the role of peacekeepers in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;11	`` The peacekeepers in Bosnia have become a sort of armed Red Cross in a badly defined role .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;12	To be in Bosnia is difficult for us .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;13	It 's a European problem and we are North Americans , '' he told Le Monde .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;14	A senior Canadian official in Paris , speaking on condition of anonymity , also said the prime minister would not turn down the opportunity to intervene personally if that would help win the release of Canadian soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;15	The Bosnian situation is evolving hour by hour and will top the agenda in meetings in France with President Francois Mitterrand and Prime Minister Edouard Balladur , the Canadian official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;16	Canada has about 2,000 peacekeepers in the former Yugoslavia , the third largest force from UN countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;17	In Bosnia , Canada has about 800 troops , Britain 3,517 and France 4,354 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;18	Bosnia is also expected to top the agenda when Chretien travels Sunday to Budapest for the Conference on Security and Co-operation in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;19	On another matter , the federal official said Chretien will answer questions about Canadian unity if they 're raised by French officials but wo n't broach the subject himself .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;20	In his interview with Le Monde , the prime minister repeated that Ottawa has no intention of trying to defuse separatist sentiments in Quebec with federal spending .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;21	`` I will not buy Quebecers ' votes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;22	I have too much respect for them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0002;23	Quebecers are not for sale , they are rational , they will consider coldly their main interests and those of their children . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0013;0	A year that began with bitter disappointment is ending in superb fashion for Todd Eldredge of the United States and Surya Bonaly of France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;1	Both skaters are on hot streaks early in this figure skating season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;2	They won the International Pro-Am Challenge on Wednesday , giving Bonaly her fourth successive win and Eldredge his second and third straight strong showing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;3	Viktor Petrenko , the 1992 Olympic champion , was first in the free skate , worth two-thirds the total score .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;4	But the Ukrainian was fifth entering the program and could move up only to third .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;5	Eldredge won the technical routine on Tuesday and , skating to music from the film `` Gettysburg , '' was tied for second behind Petrenko in the free skate , giving him the title .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;6	He also won Skate America last month , but this field was stronger , including defending Olympic champion Alexei Urmanov of Russia , who tied Eldredge on Wednesday night and was second overall .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;7	`` I had a very good short program and then I put a decent long program out there , '' Eldredge said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;8	`` I think everybody had a bobble here and there .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;9	`` With the past two Olympic champions , that makes it a tough field . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;10	Eldredge , 23 , won the 1990 and '91 U.S. titles , then sustained a back injury that disrupted his career .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;11	He was a stunning fourth at the nationals in January , failing to make the Olympic and world team .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;12	Bonaly , who struggled at the Olympics , then claimed home-ice judging cost her the world championship , won the free skate with all seven judges , passing Olga Markova of Russia for the title .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;13	Bonaly previously won the Goodwill Games , Skate America and Trophy of France this season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;14	The streak comes after she entered the Lillehammer Olympics as one of the favorites and finished a weak fourth , then was second at the worlds , held in Japan , to Yuka Sato .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;15	Bonaly , 20 , is trying to think only happy thoughts these days .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;16	It seems to be working for the four-time European champ who has been criticized for her lack of artistry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;17	`` I wish and hope I am going to be accepted , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;18	`` It 's a long time I have been working on it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;19	I hope one day they will realize I did my job well and did my work .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;20	I ca n't say it was 100 percent excellent today , but I did my job . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;21	Before a crowd of 6,414 , Bonaly delivered a solid performance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;22	She hit six triple jumps but did little in between , with virtually no footwork and little imagination to her program .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;23	`` It was OK .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;24	It can be better , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;25	`` I was a little tired .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;26	I will be in better shape for the next competition . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;27	Bonaly is the top-ranked woman in the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;28	Most of the better female skaters turned pro and China 's Lu Chen rarely has skated since winning a bronze medal at the Olympics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;29	Michelle Kwan , the top-rated American amateur skater , was second in the free skate and finished third overall .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;30	Kwan now will take time off from competition after finishing behind Bonaly in all four events this season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;31	The other disciplines went to Russian couples , with Americans challenging the world champions in pairs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;32	Evgenia Shishkova and Vadim Naumov barely edged U.S. champions Jenni Meno and Todd Sand in pairs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;33	Both couples performed superbly , as did third-place finishers Kyoko Ina and Jason Dungjen , also of the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;34	All three pairs received at least one first-place vote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0013;35	Anjelika Krylova and Oleg Ovsiannikov , in their first international appearance , were sensational in winning the ice dance with a flamenco presentation that earned first place from all of the judges .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;0	The mother of a British backpacker found murdered told a court Thursday that her daughter was `` bright and bubbly '' when they spoke on the phone days before she disappeared from a Sydney hostel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;1	Jacqueline and Ian Clarke , parents of Caroline Clarke , also identified a hairbrush police found in raids on the homes of suspect Ivan Milat and two of his brothers as identical to one their daughter had when she left their house in Northumberland .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;2	Clarke also said a sleeping bag recovered during the raids was similar to one he remembered his daughter having .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;3	Caroline Clarke and her traveling companion Joanne Walters were last seen April 19 , 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;4	Mrs. Clarke told Campbelltown Local Court she had spoken to her daughter by telephone a week to 10 days before Easter 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;5	`` She was quite bright and bubbly ... she sounded happy and everything seemed fine , '' said Mrs. Clarke , who has traveled from Britain to give evidence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;6	English stockbroker Stephen Wright also testified Thursday that a tent seized in the raids was the same one he gave Clarke when he , Clarke and Walters traveled together in Tasmania in 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;7	Wright said he recognized the tent by the address labels he used to make repairs after it was damaged by a knife he used while picking grapes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;8	Wright also identified a sleeping bag as one he saw Walters buy during their trip to Tasmania .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;9	The tent and the sleeping bag were allegedly found in the home of Richard Milat on the day police arrested Ivan Milat , 49 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;10	Milat was charged in May with the murders of Melbourne couple James Gibson and Deborah Everist , both 19 ; German backpackers Simone Schmidl , 21 , Gabor Neugebauer , 21 , and Anja Habschied , 20 ; and Britons Clarke , 21 , and Walters , 22 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;11	Milat has denied the charges .
APW_ENG_19941201.0004;12	If convicted , he could be sentened to life in prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;0	Survivors of the U.S. atomic bombing of Japan and anti-nuclear bomb activists said Thursday they are angry about a U.S. Postal Service plan to issue a stamp commemorating the attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;1	`` This is outrageous , '' said Sunao Tsuboi , acting director of the 30,000-member Hiroshima Prefectural Confederation of A-bomb Survivors Organizations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;2	`` It makes our blood boil with anger , '' he told the Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;3	Tsuboi was commenting on the stamp 's caption : `` Atomic bombs hasten war 's end , August 1945 . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;4	Many critics of the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki on Aug. 6 and 9 that year say there were more humane ways to make Japan surrender , ending World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;5	The stamp design , a composite of mushroom clouds created by the wartime bombings and nuclear tests after the war , is scheduled to be released next year around the 50th anniversary of the Allied victory of World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;6	About 140,000 of Hiroshima 's 340,000 residents died within five months after the Aug. 6 raid , while the attack on Nagasaki killed another 70,000 of that city 's 270,000 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;7	Japan surrendered on Aug. 15 , 1945 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;8	Tsuboi said his organization will consult with other anti-nuclear groups in Hiroshima and Nagasaki on what action to take against the stamp .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;9	`` The use of weapons of mass destruction like those dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki should never be legitimated under any circumstances , '' said Kazuya Yasuda , a top official of the Japan Council Against Atomic and Hydrogen Bombs , a private group campaigning to abolish nuclear arms worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;10	Local officials in both cities also expressed displeasure with the stamp .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;11	In October , Takashi Hiraoka , the mayor of Hiroshima sent a letter , to Vice President Al Gore contending that a U.S. Senate resolution seeking changes to a war exhibit in Washington next year was tantamount to condoning the 1945 atomic bombing of his city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;12	The exhibit , which will feature the first public display of the Enola Gay , the plane that dropped the bomb on Hiroshima , is planned for May 1995 at Washington 's Smithsonian Institution .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;13	The Smithsonian agreed to revise the script earlier this year after veterans groups said it was too sympathetic to wartime Japan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0005;14	They also said it was unjustly critical of the use of a device that may have saved thousands of lives by making a bloody invasion of the Japanese home islands unnecessary and hastening the end the war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;0	Chinese import and export of high-technology products reached a record level in 1993 at dlrs 20.59 billion , up 40 percent from 1992 , according to figures released Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;1	The statistics were the first ever China has released on its high-tech trade volume , said the Economic Information Daily .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;2	The State Science and Technology Commission released the statistics in the official Chinese-language paper .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;3	Computers , telecommunications equipment and similar products accounted for 10.5 percent of the country 's entire 1993 commodity trade volume of dlrs 195.7 billion , it said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;4	High-tech imports were up to dlrs 15.91 billion in 1993 , and exports rose to dlrs 4.68 billion , leaving a trade deficit of dlrs 11.23 billion , the newspaper said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;5	Exports of high-tech products increased by dlrs 680 million , or 17 percent , in 1993 , while imports jumped by dlrs 5.2 billion , or 48.5 percent , during the same year , the newspaper said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;6	The 1993 deficit widened from dlrs 10.71 billion a year earlier and was a big factor in China 's overall commodity trade deficit of dlrs 12.19 billion in 1993 , it said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0007;7	Computers and telecommunications equipment accounted for nearly 54 percent of all Chinese-made high-tech exports during the past year , the report said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0008;4	Promoter Bill Hartmann said Coquilla claims a record of 30-5-2 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;0	After months of hot debate , Beijing has passed a law meant to discourage raising dogs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;1	Under the new law , dog owners must pay a 5,000-yuan -LRB- dlrs 600 -RRB- dog registration fee -- or 3,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 360 -RRB- if the dog is registered within three months of when the law goes into effect on May 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;2	Annual renewal fees will be 2,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 240 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;3	That compares with the average annual income of about 6,000 to 9,000 yuan -LRB- about dlrs 725 to 1,100 -RRB- of Beijing workers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;4	The new law , passed on Wednesday , allows only one dog per family and bans `` large and fierce dogs , '' the Beijing Daily reported Thursday in its top front-page story .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;5	It did not say what breeds would be banned .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;6	News reports said small dogs will only be allowed outdoors between 8 p.m. and 7 a.m. , and bigger ones can never go out at all .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;7	Every dog will be banned from public areas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;8	Beijing newspapers and radio phone-in shows have carried both sides of a debate on whether and how to restrict dogs in the city and its suburbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;9	The proposed law put the registration fee at 6,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 700 -RRB- , and many people complained it was too high .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;10	The Beijing area has about 190,000 dogs , compared with 20,000 in 1986 , the Xinhua News Agency said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;11	It was not immediately clear how the city would enforce the new law .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;12	Xinhua quoted Zhang Liangji of the Public Security Bureau as saying 52,000 residents were bitten by dogs last year , and 89 people died of rabies from 1988 to 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;13	Dog-owning was considered decadent in China before the current economic reforms took hold over the past decade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0009;14	Xinhua noted on Wednesday that China has 120 million dogs who eat 15 billion kilograms -LRB- 33 billion pounds -RRB- of grain , enough to feed 40 million people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;0	China 's foreign exchange reserves increased 106 percent in the first 10 months of the year , reaching dlrs 43.7 billion , the China Daily reported Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;1	The foreign debt , meanwhile , is expected to top dlrs 100 billion by the end of the year , said Guan Tao of the State Administration of Foreign Exchange Control .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;2	China 's foreign debt surpassed dlrs 90 billion at the end of August , compared with dlrs 83.6 billion dlrs at the end of last year , the China Daily said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;3	Lin Zeti , deputy director of the administration , said the growing reserves show that China 's foreign exchange system reform has been working well , the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;4	With the country 's market economy taking shape , China will maintain a good balance of payments for the next few years , Lin said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;5	Guan attributed the fast growth of the foreign exchange reserves to the new foreign exchange system under which all institutions in China are required to sell their foreign exchange to banks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;6	Burgeoning exports , stimulated by the deprecation of the yuan at the start of this year , also brought more foreign exchange into the country , the report added .
APW_ENG_19941201.0010;7	In addition , foreign direct investment in the first nine months of this year has reached dlrs 22.7 billion , up 49 percent from the same period a year earlier , Guan said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;0	Parliament has enacted more power and independence to the Election Commission , but the effort to guarantee fair voting failed to satisfy the opposition or to end Bangladesh 's nine-month political crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;1	The law , passed unanimously late Wednesday , provides for voter identity cards and gives the Election Commission authority to punish officials involved in malpractice .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;2	It empowers the commission to stop voting at any polling station if it suspects `` coercion , intimidation and pressure . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;3	The legislation was rejected by the opposition , which has boycotted Parliament since March 2 , accusing Prime Minister Khaleda Zia 's government of election fraud , corruption and mismanagement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;4	Law Minister Mirza Golam Hafiz , concluding a brief debate on the bill , said `` it will help ensure free , fair and impartial voting , check false voting , and effectively protect the rights of the voters . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;5	But opposition spokesman Mohammad Nasim said the bill `` is nowhere close to our demand for free and fair polls under an interim government . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;6	The opposition wants the government to step down three months before elections , yielding to a neutral caretaker government that would supervise voting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;7	Mrs. Zia rejects the demand as `` unjustified and unconstitutional , '' but has offered to bring opposition members into a pre-election Cabinet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;8	The next election is scheduled for 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;9	After an international mediation effort failed last month to break the deadlock , opposition leader Sheikh Hasina called for an accelerated campaign of national strikes and demonstrations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;10	On Tuesday , a strike backed by a rail and road blockade choked off routine business in the capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;11	Hasina has called for a 48-hour general strike next week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0011;12	Businessmen have complained that the prolonged deadlock is hurting exports , discouraging foreign investment and diverting the government 's attention from its program of deregulating the economy .

APW_ENG_19941201.0014;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher is telling the NATO allies the Clinton administration has swung to their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;1	It is the first time in the post-World War II history of the alliance that the Europeans led by France prevailed over the United States in formulating a major policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;2	It is a difficult assignment for Christopher , putting him in the awkward position of shifting gears even while denying U.S. policy on the war has changed or that there is a trans-Atlantic rift .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;3	National Security Adviser Anthony Lake , in a speech Wednesday at Princeton University , acknowledged it is a path `` rife with frustrations and setbacks . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;4	Nonetheless , he said , `` it 's the best , the steadiest course .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;5	... Both sides face the same choice : They can perpetuate a bloody military stalemate or they can stop the senseless killing and come to terms . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;6	By chance , it is the U.S. turn to preside over a meeting today of the North Atlantic Council , NATO 's policy-making arm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;7	This puts Christopher under an even brighter spotlight , and he was responding both with a brief speech opening the session and a detailed one outlining the revised U.S. approach to the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;8	It is centered on a call for an international peace conference that would give the Bosnian Serbs an opportunity to demand changes in the peace plan they have rejected repeatedly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;9	They already have strong intimations of support from the Clinton administration in pressing for cross-border political ties to the Serb-dominated government in Belgrade -- a big step toward their goal of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;10	And even the peace plan map the Bosnian Serbs rejected is open to negotiations , Clinton administration officials promised in this week of candid admissions by Defense Secretary William Perry and other senior U.S. officials that the Bosnian Serbs can not be stopped in their territorial conquests by military force .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;11	The European allies , particularly France and Britain , have taken this position throughout the 31-month war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;12	They managed to limit NATO air strikes despite U.N. assurances that Bihac , the mostly Muslim town on the verge of falling to the Serbs , was a `` safe area '' from which heavy weapons were to be excluded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;13	They also hemmed in the 23,000 peacekeepers in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;14	Lake , in his speech at Princeton , stressed that NATO had chosen not to intervene directly in Bosnia and had given the lead to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;15	`` Right or wrong , that decision has consequences with which we must continue to struggle , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;16	Before leaving Washington , Christopher grumbled to reporters about NATO 's refusal to engage in a sustained bombardment of Serb positions in the northwestern region of the bloodied country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;17	But having threatened the Serbs in the past with NATO might , he abandoned the threat when asked what `` sticks '' the United States was using to persuade the Serbs to relinquish their grip on Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;18	If they kept fighting , Christopher said , they risked Serbia closing its border and a tightening of sanctions -- measures that are far less threatening than attacks by NATO warplanes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;19	Serbia has been the principal arms supplier to Serbs in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;20	And while Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic has promised to cut them off , a senior U.S. official said there was considerable `` leakage '' and arms were getting through .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;21	Seeking to limit the damage to the alliance , which successfully stood up to the Soviet Union but has caved on Bosnia , Christopher said he wanted to stress that `` the crisis in Bosnia is about Bosnia and the former Yugoslavia ; it 's not about NATO and its future . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;22	But NATO 's impotence has raised questions about NATO 's future .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;23	Senate Republican leader Bob Dole of Kansas suggested after meeting in Brussels with alliance officials that the alliance may have become irrelevant .
APW_ENG_19941201.0014;24	`` There 's been no pressure on the Serbs and until there 's some leverage , it 's going to be very difficult to stop the fighting and reach some kind of settlement , '' Dole said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;0	The 76-year-old schoolteacher carries her anger and disenchantment in her waistcoat pocket , in a little blue booklet and a shiny plastic card tucked among its well-worn pages .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;1	Fan Ximei received the booklet in 1958 , when she joined Taiwan 's ruling Nationalist Party , firmly believing in its doctrine of reunifying Taiwan with the Chinese motherland .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;2	She got the plastic card from the New Party , to which she deserted 13 months ago , feeling that the Nationalists had betrayed her most cherished beliefs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;3	The New Party split from the Nationalists last year to uphold the doctrine of reunification .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;4	On Saturday it faces its first major test in local elections that present the Nationalists with their sternest political challenge since they fled to Taiwan from Communist China in 1949 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;5	The polls for governor and mayors of Taiwan 's two largest cities are part of a shift toward democracy initiated by the Nationalists in 1987 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;6	Never before have Taiwanese elected their governor , and mayors have n't been elected in Taipei since 1967 and in Kaohsiung since 1979 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;7	The feverish campaigning testifies to the enthusiasm with which Taiwanese have grasped democracy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;8	Taipei 's streets are awash with banners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;9	Callers wanting to discuss election issues besiege radio phone-in shows .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;10	Campaigners roam the streets banging cymbals and drums , and gesturing `` V '' for victory to passersby .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;11	At election rallies , ordinary Taiwanese practically line up to discuss election issues with foreign reporters -- a far cry from the pre-1987 years of martial law , when Taiwanese were afraid to discuss politics even among themselves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;12	The New Party , which claims 50,000 members , is the smallest of Taiwan 's three major parties and is not considered a frontrunner in Saturday 's polls .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;13	But it could still play a crucial role by splitting the Nationalist vote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;14	That could open the door for a force people like Fan do n't want in power -- the Democratic Progressive Party , which wants to dump the constitutional tie with China and make Taiwan independent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;15	In Taipei , where its supporters are concentrated , the New Party 's Jaw Shau-kong could draw enough votes from Nationalist incumbent Huang Ta-chou and hand a historic victory to the DPP 's Chen Shui-bian .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;16	But despite that scenario , people like Fan say they can no longer support the Nationalists with a clear conscience .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;17	`` We are disgusted with everything Lee has done , '' said Fan , fixing her listener with jet-black eyes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;18	`` We are the only real Nationalists . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;19	She was referring to Lee Teng-hui , who took power in 1988 as the island 's first Taiwanese-born president and is credited with steering Taiwan peacefully from virtual dictatorship to democracy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;20	But for New Party supporters , Lee has betrayed Nationalist principles , particularly the dream of reunification .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;21	They fear that despite his denials , the secretly wants an independent Taiwan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;22	Others said they were sickened by the allegations of Nationalist corruption and vote-buying .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;23	Some also blamed both the Nationalists and the DPP for the excesses that have accompanied democracy , such as campaign violence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;24	`` Taiwanese democracy has developed too fast , '' said Lo Feng-hsiang , a medicine importer who was among several thousand New Party supporters at a rally in central Taipei Tuesday night .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;25	`` We need some peace . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;26	Many of those at the rally were worried about whether the Nationalists are veering toward declaring Taiwan 's independence -- a move Beijing says would provoke war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;27	`` I love the Nationalist Party , but it ignores our wishes , '' said a man who gave his surname as Huang .
APW_ENG_19941201.0016;28	He was switching his support to the New Party after 50 years as a Nationalist , he said , adding : `` We ca n't run away from reunification with the mainland . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0023;0	A threat by Bosnian Serbs to shell a Canadian peacekeeping camp near Sarajevo did not materialize Wednesday , but Canadians kept a wary eye on Serb army movements .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;1	The Serbs threatened Monday to shell the camp in Visoko within 48 hours .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;2	By dusk Wednesday , when no attack came , a cautious sense of relief spread through camp .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;3	Troops had been on high alert , filling sandbags , posting more lookouts and wearing flak jackets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;4	`` It 's still seen as a possibility but getting more remote by the day , '' said Capt. Tom Newton , a camp spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;5	`` There 's little reported activity in the camp area . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;6	On Sunday , a Serb rocket attack caused minor damage to a building .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;7	`` People are uncomfortable with the whole idea of shelling , obviously , but they get used to the idea and get on with their job , '' said Newton , 30 , a native of Victoria .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;8	Canadians monitor Serb army movements by several means , including radio reports from 55 Canadians detained for more than a week by Serbs at various locations near Visoko .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;9	Meanwhile , Prime Minister Jean Chretien expressed frustration in an interview with Paris daily Le Monde , saying : `` The peacekeepers in Bosnia have become a sort of armed Red Cross , in a badly defined role .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;10	`` To be in Bosnia is difficult for us .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;11	It 's a European problem , and we are North Americans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;12	The Americans want to control everything and fight down to the last Canadian and Frenchman . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;13	In Ottawa , Defense Minister David Collenette said it 's `` a shame and a disgrace '' that Canada is not in the five-country Contact Group trying to negotiate peace in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;14	He suggested Chretien will raise the matter in Budapest this weekend at the Conference on Security and Co-operation in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;15	Canada has one of the biggest UN contingents in the region -- 800 troops in Bosnia and 1,200 in Croatia -- while Contact Group members Germany and the United States have none there .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;16	Things went badly Wednesday for UN Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , who went to Sarajevo to work for a ceasefire and try to persuade Serbs to stop detaining more than 400 UN troops as insurance against NATO air strikes .

APW_ENG_19941201.0023;18	An orange alert at the Canadian camp at Visoko was being observed Wednesday and was to stay during the night , requiring personnel to wear flak jackets outside and cancel non-essential trips outside camp .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;19	The camp went to the highest level -- red -- Monday night , forcing personnel to sleep in bunkers and sea containers in two camp buildings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;20	About 400 Canadians stay in the camp at night .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;21	Since Monday , 100 non-essential personnel have slept in nearby Kiseljak , returning to the camp during the day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;22	Maj. Dean Milner , senior officer among Canadian detainees , makes daily contact with his soldiers and Serb commanders , said camp spokesman Newton .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;23	`` Everything has been pretty cordial so far and they 've been treated fairly , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0023;24	`` Everybody in camp just wants to give a call home and let everybody know they 're OK . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;0	After nearly half a century , South Korea on Thursday regained peacetime control over its armed forces from the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;1	The turnover was part of an effort to lower the profile of the U.S. military and push South Korea toward self-reliance in defending itself .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;2	`` I am here to express my happiness that we have earned back the right to control our own forces today , '' Gen. Lee Yang-ho , chairman of the joint chiefs of staff , said at an elaborate ceremony marking the change .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;3	Dozens of honor guards , some dressed in black and white traditional Korean costumes and others in brightly colored red and blue uniforms with gold braid , saluted Lee as a brass band played .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;4	Earlier Thursday , Lee received the `` baton of command '' from President Kim Young-sam , the head of the armed forces , at the presidential palace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;5	Shortly after the beginning of the Korean War in 1950 , South Korea turned over the command of its military to U.N. forces , headed by the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;6	Thursday 's transfer also has symbolic significance in South Korea 's continuing standoff against North Korea .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;7	The Communist North considers the South a `` puppet regime '' controlled by the United States , and has pointed to Seoul 's lack of command over its own armed forces as evidence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;8	The North has repeatedly used the argument to snub the South and refuse talks on improving relations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;9	The two Koreas never signed a peace treaty after their three-year war , and still have nearly 2 million troops along their border .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;10	Thursday 's ceremony followed Wednesday 's signing of a note of exchange to complete the transfer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;11	Under the agreement , the U.S. side reassumes command in times of crisis or war , and still controls certain functions even in peacetime , such as the early-warning system and joint military exercises .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;12	Some 35,000 U.S. troops are stationed in South Korea .
APW_ENG_19941201.0024;13	About 1 million American soldiers fought in the Korean War .

APW_ENG_19941201.0027;0	Unfazed by the prospect of a complete withdrawal of all U.N. peacekeepers , Bosnia 's rebel Serbs refused even to meet with the U.N. chief to discuss a nationwide cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;1	U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali said it may be time to send U.N. troops home after his six-hour mission to Sarajevo on Wednesday failed to move the two sides toward peace .

APW_ENG_19941201.0027;3	U.N. peacekeepers are being held hostage and the West is divided about how to respond .

APW_ENG_19941201.0027;5	But he said `` it will become impossible '' to sustain support for the peacekeepers in the Security Council unless the Serbs and the government agree to talk peace and cooperate with the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;6	In New York , French U.N. Ambassador Jean-Bernard Merimee said `` there is no question '' of a withdrawal now , `` but if the situation continues to deteriorate , it will be more difficult to keep the troops there . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;7	A withdrawal by peacekeepers would likely lead to more fighting and could be dangerous for the departing troops , as both Bosnian Serbs and government forces rush U.N. camps to seize equipment before it can be destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;8	It also would cause widespread hardship , Boutros-Ghali said , because the United Nations feeds an estimated 3 million people across the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;9	Most are in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;10	More than 200,000 people are dead or missing in the 2 -LCB- - year conflict launched by Serbs after Bosnia 's Muslim-Croat majority voted to declare independence from Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;11	Tens of thousands more have been forced to flee their homes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;12	Serbs have rejected a peace plan that would reduce their war-won land holdings to 49 percent from about 70 percent .

APW_ENG_19941201.0027;14	He said they have proposed a three-month cease-fire , but the Serbs want something more permanent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;15	Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic refused even to meet Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;16	The Bosnian Serbs would n't mind seeing the United Nations leave Bosnia , believing it would allow them to force the government to settle on Serb terms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;17	Boutros-Ghali 's visit followed admissions from top U.S. and NATO officials that they ca n't force a solution to the conflict without a huge ground force no one is willing to provide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;18	The impact of airstrikes is questionable .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;19	NATO struck three times last week on Serb positions near the U.N.-designated `` safe area '' of Bihac in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;20	The action only prompted the Serbs to take more than 400 U.N. soldiers hostage as insurance against more bombing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0027;21	NATO members provide two-thirds of the peacekeepers .

APW_ENG_19941201.0027;23	More than 100 Dutch troops have been hostage since Saturday .

APW_ENG_19941201.0027;25	Some 70,000 mostly Muslim civilians are trapped in the government-held town , which is supposed to be under U.N. protection .

APW_ENG_19941201.0030;2	After the signing , Tan led AIDS Day celebrations on the department grounds featuring papier-mache giants , red balloons , fireworks , two marching bands and a condom-shaped mascot .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;3	Meanwhile , the Alliance of Health Workers , a national association representing government workers , criticized the celebrations as an example of the health department 's `` excessive , unnecessary and extravagant '' program .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;4	Nilo Capangpangan , the alliance 's national vice president , said at a news conference that health workers in the provinces are being affected by erroneous policies , including a 1991 transfer of supervision of health workers to local officials .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;5	`` We can not guarantee to provide better health service because under the present setup -LRB- we are -RRB- at the mercy of the powerful mayors and governors , '' Capangpangan added .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;6	He said the policy also opened the health budget to corruption because local officials now sign for the acquisition of supplies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;7	Philippine health officials estimate that for every Filipino identified as carrying the AIDS virus , nine others remain unreported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;8	Since 1984 , the Philippines has identified 565 Filipinos as virus carriers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0030;9	Of those , 171 have developed AIDS and 96 have died of the disease , which attacks the body 's immune system .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;0	Australian rice is best suited for making Japan 's sweet-flavored bean paste , a private food research institute said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;1	The Central Miso Research Institute said bean paste made of Australian rice placed first among 26 entries in the sweet-flavored category in the institute 's annual miso contest last month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;2	Miso , or bean paste , is made by mixing steamed soybeans or rice with salt and a fermenting agent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;3	Miso , together with soy sauce , is the basic flavoring of Japanese cuisine .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;4	`` We hope this result of the contest is n't misunderstood to question the quality of Australian rice , '' said Mitsuyuki Mori , a director of the Tokyo-based institute for 1,700 miso manufacturers across the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;5	`` We came to know last year that Australian rice is as good as Japanese rice in cooking , '' Mori said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;6	`` Also , only good rice can make good miso . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;7	Last fall , Japan suffered its worst rice harvest since World War II and the government allowed imports of foreign-grown rice for the first time in many decades to make up a shortage of more than 2 million tons .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;8	For their dinner tables , however , most Japanese tried to obtain domestic rather than foreign rice .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;9	In the sweet-flavored category , Japanese rice placed second and third and Thai rice fourth , followed by Chinese rice , Mori said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0041;10	Makers normally use rice for sweet miso and soybeans for salty miso .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;0	Under a furious lobbying barrage from the Clinton administration and corporate executives , the U.S. Senate seemed headed toward approving a new world trade agreement in a vote Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;1	Senior administration officials were guarding their vote counts , but Treasury Secretary Lloyd Bentsen declared `` momentum is swinging our way '' and a smiling U.S. Trade Representative Mickey Kantor assured reporters , `` We 're in very good shape . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;2	Senate approval was the last legislative hurdle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;3	The House of Representatives endorsed the accord , negotiated under the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade , by a 288-146 vote Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;4	Thirty-three countries already have ratified the 124-nation accord and , according to Bentsen , the others will act before Jan. 1 if the United States backs it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;5	For that to happen , 60 of the 100 senators must vote to override a parliamentary objection lodged by Sen. Robert Byrd .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;6	According to an Associated Press survey , GATT proponents appeared to have achieved that number , when counting those who were leaning in favor but not firmly committed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;7	President Clinton hoped to widen the still-thin victory margin at a breakfast meeting Thursday with 20 lawmakers , including a late and crucial supporter , Senate Republican leader Bob Dole .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;8	Opponents ' only hope was to muster 41 votes in favor of the procedural hurdle imposed by Byrd , who charges the accord will increase the U.S. deficit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;9	Under Senate rules , the legislation approving GATT must offset all of the projected dlrs 43 billion in lost tariff revenues over the first decade of the accord .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;10	To make up for the lost tariffs , the administration is cutting farm subsidies and raising revenue with a number of measures , including changing the minimum rate on savings bonds and auctioning licenses for a new generation of wireless broadcast services .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;11	But Byrd said the bill falls dlrs 14.5 billion short and some senators said they would not vote to bust the U.S. budget .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;12	The administration counters that the tariff cuts , averaging 38 percent globally , will so stimulate economic growth that federal revenues will rise , not fall .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;13	The AP head count had 60 senators for or leaning toward waiving budget rules , 26 against or leaning against and 14 undeclared .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;14	Byrd and others also complain that a new Geneva-based World Trade Organization , created to referee trade disputes , will inevitably infringe on U.S. sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;15	But Dole , who had voiced the same concern , secured a promise from the administration to create an independent panel to review WTO decisions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;16	If U.S. interests were being harmed , the panel could recommend that Congress withdraw from the organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;17	The administration is predicting 500,000 new American jobs as a result of increased U.S. export sales under GATT .
APW_ENG_19941201.0033;18	In addition to bringing foreign tariffs closer to U.S. levels , it reduces barriers to trade in agricultural goods and services and protects U.S. intellectual property , such as computer programs , from being pirated .

APW_ENG_19941201.0038;0	Fire continued to burn inside the Achille Lauro Thursday , a day after the flames forced the nearly 1,000 people aboard take to lifeboats and abandon the cruise ship off Somalia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;1	Two people were reported dead and one missing in the flight from the Achille Lauro , which gained notoriety in 1985 when Palestinian terrorists hijacked and killed a wheelchair-bound American passenger .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;2	U.S. Navy personnel and commercial ship captains taking part in the rescue said the Achille Lauro was listing but in no danger of sinking Thursday morning .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;3	`` She is presently listing at about 20 degrees .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;4	There 's a tremendous amount of smoke and steam still coming from over three quarters of the length of the vessel , '' John Briand , captain of the oil tanker Lima , told the BBC .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;5	The fire started Wednesday , apparently in the passenger area , but the cause was not known , said the ship 's owner , Starlauro of Genoa , Italy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;6	Eight people were injured in the fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;7	About 60 crewmembers fought the fire before abandoning the 23,478-ton ship 210 kilometers -LRB- 130 miles -RRB- south of the Horn of Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;8	An official with the U.N. mission in Somalia put the ship 's position at about 25 kilometers -LRB- 15 miles -RRB- off the small Somali fishing village of Eil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;9	Capt. Ferdinando Lolli , a port official in Rome , said the ship was carrying 581 passengers and 404 crew .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;10	Most of the crew was Italian , and the passengers mainly South African , German , Dutch and British .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;11	Late Wednesday evening , Italian Coast Guard officials reported that one person from the Achille Lauro was still unaccounted for .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;12	Italian news agencies identified the dead as a Briton and a German .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;13	The Panamanian oil ship Hawaiian King was one of the first ships to arrive at the scene and took on about 800 people , said a coast guard official in Rome , Adm. Eugenio Sicurezza .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;14	Many had to spend the night on the Hawaiian King 's deck , Briand said , and other ships sent over food , blankets and toiletries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;15	Two U.S. warships , the USS Gettysburg and USS Halyburton , arrived overnight and dispatched helicopters to ferry water , food and medical supplies to the survivors , said Cmdr. T. McCreary , spokesman for the U.S. Naval Forces Central Command in the Gulf .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;16	`` Quite a few people were injured in the transfer -- there 's a few broken bones and some pretty tortured souls , '' Briand said , adding that many of the rescued passengers were elderly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;17	The commerical and Navy ships will divide up the passengers Thursday and send them on , mostly to Mombasa , Kenya , and Djibouti , McCreary said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;18	Others reportedly will be taken to the Seychelles .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;19	Briand said the transfer was expected to take most of the day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;20	His ship was taking on the Achille Lauro 's 50 Honduran crewmembers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;21	The Achille Lauro left Genoa on Nov. 19 , stopped in Israel , and its next port of call was to be Durban , South Africa , on Friday , said Carla Gotta , a spokeswoman for the cruise ship 's owner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;22	The terrorists who hijacked the Achille Lauro in 1985 shot American Leon Klinghoffer and pushed him in his wheelchair off the ship .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;23	The hijackers escaped the vessel and boarded a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced it to land in Italy and the hijackers were captured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;24	Launched in 1946 in the Netherlands , the Achille Lauro was acquired 20 years later by the Neapolitan shipping dynasty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;25	It first transported Italian immigrant workers to and from Australia and was outfitted for pleasure cruises in 1970 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;26	The liner rammed a fishing boat in 1971 off Italy , killing a Neapolitan fisherman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;27	And on Dec. 2 , 1981 , fire broke out aboard ship off the Canary Islands .
APW_ENG_19941201.0038;28	Panicked passengers jumped into the sea , and two of them drowned .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;0	In 10 years , a trip to a music store may involve sticking a card filled with computer memory chips into a vending machine , and downloading the latest hits into it , Japan 's NEC Corp. says .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;1	NEC announced Thursday that it has developed a Walkman-like pocket stereo that uses such memory cards instead of tapes to store music .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;2	The interchangeable cards are the size of fat credit cards , and contain rows of tiny computer memory chips .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;3	Each card can currently hold up to 24 minutes of high-quality music , the company says .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;4	But NEC says it will wait to commercialize the product .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;5	The reason : the `` flash '' memory chips used in the cards are still so expensive that 24 minutes ' worth , or 32 megabytes , currently costs about dlrs 2,000 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;6	Prices of the chips are expected to drop , however , and NEC predicts that 90 minutes of capacity will be priced at about dlrs 100 in the year 2000 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;7	The rest of the player will cost only about dlrs 50 to make , and the circuitry eventually could be incorporated into the memory card itself , resulting in a card-size player , NEC spokesman Mark Pearce said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;8	Since the music is stored digitally in memory chips , the players are lighter than conventional cassettes and do n't have any moving parts to wear out or skip .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;9	And unlike tapes , the chips allow instant random access to different music tracks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;10	The cards also could be used to store other kinds of information , including text , still pictures and moving images .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;11	NEC is considering a version that could also function as a debit card , with each music purchase subtracted automatically from the total credit on the card , Pearce said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;12	The player , which NEC calls Silicon Audio , uses a compression method called MPEG to reduce the size of the music data , which otherwise would require eight times as much memory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;13	NEC is Japan 's largest semiconductor maker .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;14	It announced earlier this week that it will invest 100 billion yen -LRB- dlrs 1.01 billion -RRB- over the next three years to build the world 's first line for making 256-megabit dynamic random-access memory chips .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;15	Those would hold 16 times as much information as the largest chips now on the market , which are 16 megabit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;16	The new line will also be used to make high-capacity flash memories , the type used by the music player , NEC said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0039;17	Unlike DRAMs , flash memories maintain their data even after the power is turned off .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;0	Two Christian zealots were sent to jail Thursday for killing a woman after a ceremony to exorcise demons they claimed were possessing her .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;1	The accused told police that Joan Leonora Vollmer spoke in voices other than her own , that she had enormous strength and that her face sometimes took on the appearance of a dog or a pig .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;2	Under sentences handed down in County Court , Leanne Merlyn Reichenbach , 32 , will serve four months in prison and David Andrew Klingner , 30 , will serve three months for the 1993 manslaughter of Mrs. Vollmer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;3	Two other defendants , Vollmer 's 56-year-old widower , Ralph Vollmer , and Matthew Paul Nuske , 22 , received suspended sentences of 12 and three months , respectively .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;4	Mrs. Vollmer , 49 , died of a heart attack on Jan. 30 , 1993 , at her farm in Antwerp , near Horsham , after a weeklong attempt to rid her of demons , according to court testimony .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;5	Her husband , Reichenbach , Klingner and Nuske held her on a chair for four hours in 102-degree Fahrenheit -LRB- 40-degree Celsius -RRB- heat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;6	They prayed over her , slapped her , forced her mouth open and massaged her neck and stomach .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;7	Prosecutors said the stroking of her neck , on the carotid artery , triggered the fatal heart attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0040;8	`` Unrestrained religious enthusiasm can well be , as we have found out here , a crime under our law and people should be made to know that it is , '' Judge Graeme Crossley told the defendants .

APW_ENG_19941201.0042;5	Eleven Chinese athletes , seven of them swimmers , recently were found to have tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs at the Asian Games in Japan in October .
APW_ENG_19941201.0042;6	The test results seemed to substantiate allegations made by coaches and athletes from other countries that the phenomenal success of China 's athletes may be due in part to the use of performance-enhancing drugs .

APW_ENG_19941201.0042;8	The Chinese women won all 15 of their races at the Asian Games , raising further suspicion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0042;9	Among those reported to have tested positive at the Asian Games were Yang Aihua , who won the women 's 400-meter freestyle at the World Championships , and Lu Bin , who won four gold medals at the Asian Games and set a world record in the women 's 200-meter individual medley .

APW_ENG_19941201.0042;11	`` This is an act by individuals , '' he said at a weekly briefing , adding that Chinese sports authorities practice `` strict prohibition , strict testing and strict punishment '' of drug use .
APW_ENG_19941201.0042;12	Chen reiterated China 's position that the stunning performance of its athletes was the result of hard , scientific training .
APW_ENG_19941201.0042;13	`` Their performance can not be denied , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0045;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher is telling the NATO allies the Clinton administration has swung to their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;1	It is the first time in the post-World War II history of the alliance that the Europeans led by France prevailed over the United States in formulating a major policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;2	It is a difficult assignment for Christopher , putting him in the awkward position of shifting gears even while denying U.S. policy on the war has changed or that there is a trans-Atlantic rift .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;3	At breakfast today with Douglas Hurd , the British foreign secretary , Christopher reviewed the warning U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali delivered Wednesday that unless warring Serbs and Muslims cooperate with the U.N. mission the peacekeepers might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;4	Christopher and Hurd said they may go to Belgrade , the Yugoslav capital , this weekend to preach reconciliation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;5	`` We will redouble our efforts to find a diplomatic solution , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;6	Asked if the troops would be withdrawn , Hurd replied grimly : `` We hope not . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;7	National Security Adviser Anthony Lake , in a speech Wednesday at Princeton University , acknowledged it is a path `` rife with frustrations and setbacks . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;8	Nonetheless , he said , `` it 's the best , the steadiest course .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;9	... Both sides face the same choice : They can perpetuate a bloody military stalemate or they can stop the senseless killing and come to terms . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;10	By chance , it is the U.S. turn to preside over a meeting today of the North Atlantic Council , NATO 's policy-making arm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;11	This puts Christopher under an even brighter spotlight , and he was responding both with a brief speech opening the session and a detailed one outlining the revised U.S. approach to the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;12	It is centered on a call for an international peace conference that would give the Bosnian Serbs an opportunity to demand changes in the peace plan they have rejected repeatedly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;13	They already have strong intimations of support from the Clinton administration in pressing for cross-border political ties to the Serb-dominated government in Belgrade -- a big step toward their goal of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;14	And even the peace plan map the Bosnian Serbs rejected is open to negotiations , Clinton administration officials promised in this week of candid admissions by Defense Secretary William Perry and other senior U.S. officials that the Bosnian Serbs can not be stopped in their territorial conquests by military force .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;15	`` This alliance will continue to be the anchor of American engagement in Europe , the linchpin of Trans-Atlantic security , '' Christopher said in a brief statement opening the North Atlantic Council session .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;16	He also assured the 15 foreign ministers that the Clinton administration was committed to keep 100,000 American troops in Europe `` as part of our continuing engagement . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;17	The European allies , particularly France and Britain , have taken this position throughout the 31-month war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;18	They managed to limit NATO air strikes despite U.N. assurances that Bihac , the mostly Muslim town on the verge of falling to the Serbs , was a `` safe area '' from which heavy weapons were to be excluded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;19	They also hemmed in the 23,000 peacekeepers in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;20	Lake , in his speech at Princeton , stressed that NATO had chosen not to intervene directly in Bosnia and had given the lead to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;21	`` Right or wrong , that decision has consequences with which we must continue to struggle , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;22	Before leaving Washington , Christopher grumbled to reporters about NATO 's refusal to engage in a sustained bombardment of Serb positions in the northwestern region of the bloodied country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;23	But having threatened the Serbs in the past with NATO might , he abandoned the threat when asked what `` sticks '' the United States was using to persuade the Serbs to relinquish their grip on Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;24	If they kept fighting , Christopher said , they risked Serbia closing its border and a tightening of sanctions -- measures that are far less threatening than attacks by NATO warplanes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;25	Serbia has been the principal arms supplier to Serbs in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;26	And while Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic has promised to cut them off , a senior U.S. official said there was considerable `` leakage '' and arms were getting through .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;27	Seeking to limit the damage to the alliance , which successfully stood up to the Soviet Union but has caved on Bosnia , Christopher said he wanted to stress that `` the crisis in Bosnia is about Bosnia and the former Yugoslavia ; it 's not about NATO and its future . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;28	But NATO 's impotence has raised questions about NATO 's future .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;29	Senate Republican leader Bob Dole of Kansas suggested after meeting in Brussels with alliance officials that the alliance may have become irrelevant .
APW_ENG_19941201.0045;30	`` There 's been no pressure on the Serbs and until there 's some leverage , it 's going to be very difficult to stop the fighting and reach some kind of settlement , '' Dole said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0048;0	Assault charges against five Aborigines charged with beating a teen-ager and a woman as tribal law punishment should be dropped , the Aboriginal Legal Service said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;1	Five Aborigines from the desert Jigalong community were charged with assault over punishment they inflicted last week on a 14-year-old girl and a 25-year-old woman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;2	Rob Riley , the service 's chief executive officer , said the five acted under the authority of community elders and should not have been charged under European law .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;3	The beatings were linked to the death of an elderly community member after he was hit by a truck .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;4	The two women were present when the accident occurred .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;5	Under Aboriginal law , if someone dies of an unnatural cause , another person is generally held responsible for the death and punished accordingly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;6	Both females were severely beaten with crowbars , the girl was speared through the leg and hand and the woman had her arm broken .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;7	A hospital staff member who treated the 14-year-old reported the attack to police .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;8	Riley said the two women faced further punishment as a result of the charges being filed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;9	The police officer who pressed charges , however , disputed Riley 's account .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;10	Det. Phillip Farris said community elders assisted police in laying the charges because the five acted without authority and did not properly inflict the punishment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;11	A mob of about 20 people attacked the girls at the man 's funeral and seven other people were speared during the attack , Farris said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;12	Riley said it was unfair for Australians of European descent to enforce white law on the entire population .
APW_ENG_19941201.0048;13	He noted white Australians were inconsistent in accepting some parts of Aboriginal culture , such as arts , while rejecting others .

APW_ENG_19941201.0049;1	India lead 1-0 in the three test series .

APW_ENG_19941201.0052;0	Fighting in the Bihac area of northwestern Bosnia could do more than cause a U.N. withdrawal from Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;1	It could draw Croatia back into war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;2	And that new fighting between Croatia and its rebel Serbs could mushroom into a much broader conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;3	Croatia is chafing that rebel Serbs still control over one-third of its territory , almost three years after a cease-fire ended six months of war between the two sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;4	It holds out the option of taking the territory back by force .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;5	Thousands of peacekeepers monitor an uneasy truce in Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;6	Bosnia 's Bihac region , surrounded by Bosnian and Croatian Serbs , is the softest spot of Croatia 's vulnerable underbelly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;7	Serb-held territory that borders the Bihac area is less than 15 miles from Zagreb , the Croatian capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;8	If Serbs control the area around Bihac , they will be able to cooperate more easily across the border , making it more difficult for Croatia to regain Serb-held territories .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;9	Negotiations between the Serbs and Croats have been stalled , although the Serbs ' self-styled government late Wednesday recommended that a Serb assembly today accept an economic agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;10	If accepted , it would be the first accord between the foes since they agreed on a formal cease-fire March 29 , and could help to reduce tensions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;11	Croatian officials say they were ready to intervene in Bihac when rebel Serbs from Croatia crossed the border to fight Bosnia 's Muslim-led army .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;12	But the Croat intervention was put off after NATO gave assurances it would prevent the fall of Bihac , said prominent hardliner Vladimir Seks , who is deputy speaker of parliament .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;13	Three NATO airstrikes did nothing to stop the Serbs there , however , and now the United Nations is threatening to pull its peacekeepers out all together .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;14	The Croatian parliament is working on a resolution that is expected to endorse intervention , but any decision would have to be made by President Franjo Tudjman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;15	Officials say the fighting in Bihac proves that Croats must look out for their own security .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;16	`` If the Croatian army intervenes , it will not be to save Bihac , '' said Fran Visnar , a military analyst in Zagreb , `` but to use the opportunity to regain some of its territories . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;17	However , if the Croatian government got involved , the Croatian Serbs would almost certainly get help from the Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;18	And it would be difficult for Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic to stay out of the conflict , despite his recent efforts to distance himself from his Bosnian Serb bretheren .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;19	The United Nations has slapped sanctions against Serbia for whipping up nationalist Serb sentiment that ignited wars in Croatia and Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;20	The Bihac fighting could also threaten Bosnia 's Croat-Muslim federation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;21	A U.S.-brokered agreement , signed last March with great fanfare , ended a year of fierce fighting between Muslims and Croats in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0052;22	Some Croats now say there appears to be little point to the federation .

APW_ENG_19941201.0054;1	Pena is only the second U.S. Cabinet member to visit the island since 1979 , when Washington switched diplomatic recognition from Taiwan to the rival Communist government in Beijing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;2	Carla Hills , the then U.S. trade representative , came in 1992 when Washington lifted a ban on Cabinet member visits in a battle with European and Asian countries for contracts in a massive plan to improve Taiwan 's infrastructure .
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;3	Welcoming the announcement of Pena 's visit , Foreign Ministry spokesman Rock Leng said Thursday it was `` a step to enhance understanding and pave the way for the development of better relations . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;4	In September , the United States announced a modest relaxation of restrictions on Cabinet-level contact between the two governments .
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;5	The change came in recognition of Taiwan 's economic might , which has made it the United States ' fifth largest trading partner , and of its rapidly developing democracy and improved human rights record .
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;6	Pena 's visit was seen likely to provoke protests from China , which regards Taiwan as a renegade province and has sought to keep it in diplomatic isolation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;7	Taiwan is the seat of the Nationalist government that fled the Chinese mainland in 1949 after losing a civil war to the Communists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0054;8	Two weeks ago , at a meeting in Jakarta , Chinese President Jiang Zemin warned President Clinton that any wavering on Taiwan would be `` an insult to the Chinese people . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0054;10	The annual conference is the same one that Hills attended in 1992 .

APW_ENG_19941201.0054;12	Hills met Lee when she was here .

APW_ENG_19941201.0055;1	Foreign Ministry spokesman Chen Jian said the United Nations decided in 1989 that Vietnamese boat people in Hong Kong should not be settled in the British colony and that the problem should be resolved by the end of 1995 , two years before Hong Kong reverts to Chinese rule .
APW_ENG_19941201.0055;2	However , Hong Kong 's colonial government has said recently that it can not repatriate the 24,000 Vietnamese still in refugee camps in the territory by the deadline .
APW_ENG_19941201.0055;3	Chen said , `` The British Hong Kong government has the responsibilty to settle this issue by the end of 1995 instead of leaving the burden to the future Hong Kong special administrative region '' under Chinese rule .
APW_ENG_19941201.0055;4	`` We will seek ways to urge the British side to settle this issue no later than the end of 1995 , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941201.0055;5	Asked what China would do if Vietnamese refugees remained in Hong Kong in 1997 , Chen said the deadline must be adhered to `` since it 's a decision of the United Nations , and China and Britain are both members .
APW_ENG_19941201.0055;6	Both countries are committed to this program of action . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0055;7	In response to Hong Kong 's assertion that some of the refugees are ethnic Vietnamese from China , Chen said the Beijing governmment was willing to take back those `` few people '' who are identified as Chinese citizens and who are willing to return to China .

APW_ENG_19941201.0058;1	Shahal spoke to Israel radio a day after a Palestinian axed a 19-year-old woman soldier to death and two days after Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin said he wanted to begin separating Palestinians and Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0058;2	Talk of dismantling small , isolated settlements was also growing this week , as Islamic militants opposed to the Israel-PLO peace talks escalate attacks on Israelis .

APW_ENG_19941201.0060;7	ASEAN was formed in 1967 at the height of the Cold War as a buffer against the spread of communism in Asia , represented by Vietnam and China .
APW_ENG_19941201.0060;8	It has become influential and active only in recent years since shifting its focus more heavily to economic cooperation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0060;9	The current members are Brunei , Indonesia , Malaysia , the Philippines , Singapore and Thailand .
