APW_ENG_19941201.0104;0	Irmgard Moeller , the Red Army Faction terrorist who blew up three American soldiers with a car bomb 22 years ago , walked out of prison Thursday after being freed early from her life sentence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;1	Wearing jeans , a leather jacket and red sweater , Moeller smiled , waved and gathered up bouquets from fans , who were singing 1960s anti-Vietnam War songs and chanting revolutionary slogans outside the blue steel prison gates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;2	`` It still feels unreal , '' she said , her words nearly drowned out by the chanting crowd of 200 , who carried red flags , champagne bottles and Christmas presents .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;3	Moeller , 47 , appealed for freedom for other `` political prisoners '' and thanked her supporters and friends for helping her cope through 22 years in prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;4	Then she was driven away in her lawyer 's car , while a loudspeaker mounted on a truck played `` Internationale , '' the revolutionary socialist hymn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;5	Moeller was convicted of driving one of two explosives-laden cars that blew up in a parking lot at U.S. Army Headquarters in Heidelberg on May 24 , 1972 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;6	Capt. Clyde R. Bonner and two enlisted men , Charles L. Peck and Ronald A. Woodward , were killed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;7	The U.S. State Department and relatives of the victims objected to her release .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;8	Moeller , the longest serving female prisoner in Germany , was freed because of her poor health , although she has shown no remorse and refused to cooperate with psychiatric evaluations to determine whether she is still dangerous .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;9	A court in the state of Schleswig-Holstein , where the prison is located , determined that she is not likely to commit another violent crime , and placed her on probation for five years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;10	Moeller 's release could lead to freedom for the seven other Red Army Faction terrorists still imprisoned in Germany .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;11	After its last actions -- assassinating a German official in 1991 and blowing up a new prison in 1993 -- the Red Army Faction said it was ending its 20-year campaign of attacks on what it called `` imperialist '' targets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;12	The Red Army Faction faction had issued a statement after the 1972 Heidelberg bombing , calling it a protest against `` genocide '' in Vietnam .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;13	Moeller was arrested six weeks after the attack and sentenced to life in prison plus 15 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;14	She lived through 12 hunger strikes and survived the night of Oct. 18 , 1977 , when three other imprisoned Red Army Faction leaders were found dead in their cells in what authorities said were suicides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;15	Moeller was found with four stabs in her chest , but survived .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;16	Politicians , theologians , authors and her prison warden campaigned for Moeller 's release on humanitarian grounds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;17	In a 1992 interview with the magazine Der Spiegel , Moeller was asked if she felt sympathy for the victims of Red Army Faction violence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;18	`` I ca n't deal with this so personally and individually , '' she replied .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;19	A striking black-haired woman when she went to jail at the age of 25 , Moeller 's lined face and graying hair now reflect her long life behind bars .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;20	She is also said to be in deteriorating health , suffering from skin , eye and other ailments .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;21	State prosecutors did not challenge the decision ordering her release .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;22	But the U.S. State Department said on Nov. 1 , before the court 's decision , that the U.S. government opposes freeing terrorists who show no remorse for politically motivated attacks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;23	U.S. Air Force Sgt. Charles Bonner , the 29-year-old son of victim Clyde Bonner , contacted German officials to protest against the decision .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;24	`` I was only 7 when my father was killed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;25	Our housing was just across from that parking lot .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;26	That 's something I 'll never forget .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;27	I think releasing her is ridiculous , '' he said in a telephone conversation last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;28	A daughter of strict Roman Catholic parents from Munich , Moeller became involved in the leftist student movement of the 1960s , got to know the founders of the Red Army Faction , Andreas Baader and Ulrike Meinhof , and went underground in 1971 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;29	Moeller could throw some light on the deaths of Baader , Jan-Carl Raspe and Gudrun Ensslin , who died in October 1977 in the top-security Stuttgart Stammheim prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;30	German authorities and foreign experts ruled the deaths suicides , but Moeller , who survived , has always maintained they were state-ordered murders .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;31	Early in her imprisonment , Moeller was held in isolation and harsh conditions in Stammheim , with no human contact apart from her guards and wardens .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;32	In 1980 , she was moved to the relative comfort of the Luebeck prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0104;33	There , she and two other convicted terrorists shared a special unit that includes a kitchen , a bathroom , a television room and a library .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;0	A contempt of court case against an American scholar and a Paris-based newspaper was postponed Thursday for five weeks , the state television reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;1	The case involves an article by Christopher Lingle published in the International Herald Tribune on Oct. 7 in which he criticized unnamed Asian governments and their court systems .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;2	In its suit on Nov. 11 , the government charged Lingle , who used to teach at the National University of Singapore ; the International Herald Tribune -LRB- Singapore -RRB- Private Ltd. ; the Tribune 's regional editor , Michael Richardson , an Australian based in Singapore ; and the Tribune 's publisher , Richard McClean .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;3	The case was scheduled to be held Friday in the High Court but was postponed to Jan. 9 to accommodate the Tribune , whose lawyer requested more time to prepare the case , the television reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;4	K. Shanmugam , the Tribune lawyer , was not immediately available for comment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;5	The case reflects the friction between the Singapore government and the foreign press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;6	The government controls the local media by issuing licenses to operate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;7	In the past , the government has temporarily restricted the circulation of the newspaper Asian Wall Street Journal and the magazines Time , Asiaweek and the Far Eastern Economic Review for articles it considered offensive or defamatory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;8	The International Herald Tribune , published jointly by the New York Times and the Washington Post , was threatened earlier this year with a defamation suit over an article that alleged nepotism in Singapore .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;9	The newspaper apologized but the two sides have not reached a settlement yet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;10	In the latest contempt case , the government has also named Singapore Press Holdings Ltd. , a local company that prints the Tribune 's Singapore edition .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;11	Contempt of court is punishable by a fine or imprisonment or both , but the law leaves the amount or term to the judge 's discretion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;12	Lingle is not expected to appear for the court deliberations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;13	He returned to his home in Atlanta , Ga. , on Oct. 21 , fearing arrest after police started an investigation against him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0105;14	He also resigned his year-old job teaching European economics at the university here .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;0	The Achille Lauro smoldered on a placid sea Thursday , a day after a raging fire forced the nearly 1,000 people aboard to take to lifeboats and abandon the cruise ship off Somalia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;1	Two people were reported dead from the Italian liner , which gained notoriety in 1985 when Palestinian terrorists hijacked and killed a wheelchair-bound American passenger .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;2	At mid morning on Thursday , the empty , scarred vessel was still afloat , listing badly to port .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;3	White steam and and gray smoke poured from its port side and smaller streams came drifting out of the lower starboard deck .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;4	Though her name was still visible on the stern , the cruise ship 's blue and white paint was scorched and mottled , the white stars on her two smokestacks blackened by heat and soot .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;5	Although crippled , the Achille Lauro appeared in no danger of sinking quickly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;6	`` She is presently listing at about 20 degrees .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;7	There 's a tremendous amount of smoke and steam still coming from over three quarters of the length of the vessel , '' John Briand , captain of the oil tanker Lima , told the BBC .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;8	The fire started Wednesday , apparently in the passenger area , but the cause was not known , said the ship 's owner , Starlauro of Genoa , Italy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;9	Eight people were injured in the fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;10	About 60 crewmembers fought the fire before abandoning the 23,478-ton ship 210 kilometers -LRB- 130 miles -RRB- south of the Horn of Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;11	The pilot of a plane carrying an Associated Press reporter and cameramen put the ship 's position at 160 miles east of the small Somali fishing village of Eil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;12	Capt. Ferdinando Lolli , a port official in Rome , said the ship was carrying 581 passengers and 404 crew .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;13	Most of the crew was Italian , and the passengers mainly South African , German , Dutch and British .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;14	Late Wednesday evening , Italian Coast Guard officials reported that everyone on the Achille Lauro was accounted for .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;15	Italian news agencies identified the dead as a Briton and a German .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;16	The Panamanian oil ship Hawaiian King was one of the first ships to arrive at the scene and took on about 800 people , said a coast guard official in Rome , Adm. Eugenio Sicurezza .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;17	Many had to spend the night on the Hawaiian King 's deck , Briand said , and other ships sent over food , blankets and toiletries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;18	Two U.S. warships , the USS Gettysburg and USS Halyburton , arrived overnight and dispatched helicopters to ferry water , food and medical supplies to the survivors , said Cmdr. T. McCreary , spokesman for the U.S. Naval Forces Central Command in the Gulf .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;19	`` Quite a few people were injured in the transfer -- there 's a few broken bones and some pretty tortured souls , '' Briand said , adding that many of the rescued passengers were elderly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;20	The commerical and Navy ships will divide up the passengers Thursday and send them on , mostly to Mombasa , Kenya , and Djibouti , McCreary said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;21	Others reportedly will be taken to the Seychelles .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;22	Briand said the transfer was expected to take most of the day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;23	His ship was taking on the Achille Lauro 's 50 Honduran crewmembers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;24	The Achille Lauro left Genoa on Nov. 19 , stopped in Israel , and its next port of call was to be Durban , South Africa , on Friday , said Carla Gotta , a spokeswoman for the cruise ship 's owner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;25	The terrorists who hijacked the Achille Lauro in 1985 shot American Leon Klinghoffer and pushed him in his wheelchair off the ship .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;26	The hijackers escaped the vessel and boarded a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced it to land in Italy and the hijackers were captured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;27	Launched in 1946 in the Netherlands , the Achille Lauro was acquired 20 years later by the Neapolitan shipping dynasty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;28	It first transported Italian immigrant workers to and from Australia and was outfitted for pleasure cruises in 1970 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;29	The liner rammed a fishing boat in 1971 off Italy , killing a Neapolitan fisherman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;30	And on Dec. 2 , 1981 , fire broke out aboard ship off the Canary Islands .
APW_ENG_19941201.0106;31	Panicked passengers jumped into the sea , and two of them drowned .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;0	A bid to salvage the near-bankrupt airline Iberia appeared doomed Thursday after overnight talks between management and pilots ended in total disagreement over pay cuts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;1	Management and representatives of the carrier 's two main unions had reached a tentative agreement Tuesday on a viability plan that entailed a wage freeze , salary cuts averaging 8.5 percent and a reduction of some 3,500 jobs through early retirements and pay-offs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;2	Acceptance by the pilots would have paved the way for the plan to be implemented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;3	The plan was considered crucial if the European Commission is to consider allowing the Spanish government to grant Iberia a 130 billion peseta -LRB- dlrs 1 billion -RRB- capital injection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;4	Iberia chairman Javier Salas said the state-owned company would hold meetings with other unions Thursday to evaluate the situation in view of the pilots ' rejection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;5	It was not immediately clear whether the lack of an across-the-board agreement meant a much more drastic plan touted last week by Iberia -- involving 5,200 job cuts and the sale of company assets -- might be implemented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;6	That proposal triggered an one-day wildcat strike that paralyzed Spain 's airports and affected more than 100,000 travelers here and abroad .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;7	Negotiations with the pilots reached a dead end as Iberia demanded a salary reduction of 15 percent based on 1992 earnings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;8	The pilots insisted that an existing wage agreement through 1995 must be implemented before the 15 percent salary cut could be enforced .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;9	`` The company has presented a generic plan that does not guarantee the future of Iberia and only concentrates on disproportionate salary cuts , '' said Armando Guajardo of the pilots ' union SEPLA .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;10	`` Management has let the situation rot to such an extent so that it could enforce such a plan worked out in advance , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;11	SEPLA said the company needed a complete overhaul and not just a reduction in salaries and staff .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;12	He said SEPLA had sent a letter to Iberia warning of drastic action by the pilots if the current wage agreement was broken .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;13	Pilots represent some 5 percent of the 24,000-strong staff .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;14	Salas has warned that the company would be technically bankrupt by March 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;15	Iberia has posted losses since 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;16	It ended last year 67 billion pesetas -LRB- dlrs 530 million -RRB- in the red while losses for this year are expected to top 40 billion pesetas -LRB- dlrs 300 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;17	Unions are to decide Thursday if a strike called several weeks ago for Friday still holds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0107;18	The company has said it would continue to operate all its flights on that day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;0	Police Minister Moshe Shahal recommended Thursday that Israel bar entrance to Palestinians living in the West Bank and Gaza until their self-rule government proved capable of preventing attacks on Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;1	Shahal spoke to Israel radio a day after a Palestinian axed a 19-year-old woman soldier to death and two days after Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin said he wanted to begin separating Palestinians and Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;2	Talk of dismantling small , isolated settlements was also growing this week , as Islamic militants opposed to the Israel-PLO peace process escalate attacks on Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;3	Thirty-two Israelis have been killed since Oct. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;4	`` There is no alternative other than to demand separation , '' Shahal said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;5	`` Separation means that we do not have to open the territory out of economic and employment concerns until the Palestinians prove that they can prevent attacks . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;6	Tens of thousands of Palestinians work in Israel and lose their only means of livelihood when barred from jobs during the border closings imposed in the wake of attacks on Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;7	The latest closing , which is gradually being lifted , sealed off the West Bank and Gaza following the Oct. 19 bombing of a Tel Aviv bus that left 22 civilians dead .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;8	Despite the strict restrictions on West Bank and Gaza residents entering Israel , Wednesday 's Palestinian assailant managed to sneak through army roadblocks into the northern Israeli town of Afula .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;9	Shahal said the permanent separation should be part of the second stage of the autonomy accord with the Palestinians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;10	The second phase includes elections of a Palestinian governing council and the expansion of self-rule beyond Gaza and the West Bank town of Jericho .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;11	Negotiations over the next stage are to resume next week in Cairo , Egypt .
APW_ENG_19941201.0108;12	The Cabinet is expected to discuss the upcoming talks during its weekly meeting Sunday , Shahal added .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;0	Police ousted hunger-striking politicians from government offices but the reformed East German communists declared Thursday they would continue their protest against a whopping 67-million-mark -LRB- dlrs 43-million -RRB- tax levy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;1	The Party of Democratic Socialism , or PDS , said 11 people , including party president Lothar Bisky and Gregor Gysi , leader of the party 's 30 members of parliament , were fasting Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;2	The protest spread to the eastern cities of Dresden and Schwerin , where hundreds of party members and sympathizers demonstrated Thursday morning at state legislatures .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;3	The party claims the government is trying to tax it into bankruptcy and political death , but authorities accused the PDS of over-simplifying a complex financial issue and of reneging on laws passed by the East German parliament in 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;4	PDS leaders began a hunger strike Wednesday afternoon in two government offices in Berlin to protest the tax bill .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;5	Late Wednesday , police removed the protesters , carrying some of them out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;6	The PDS members moved to their party offices at the Berlin city legislature and said the hunger strike would continue indefinitely under the motto `` We wo n't be taxed out of existence -- No expropriation of the PDS . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;7	The Party of Democratic Socialism was formed in 1990 out of the remnants of the collapsed East German Communist Party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;8	It got only 2.4 percent of the national vote in December 1990 in the first united German parliamentary elections , and appeared in danger of passing into history .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;9	But in the Oct. 16 national elections , the PDS grabbed 20 percent of votes in eastern Germany and 4.4 percent nationally , mostly on resentment among eastern Germans who feel they are second-class citizens in united Germany .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;10	Chancellor Helmut Kohl attacked the PDS as a group of `` red-painted fascists , '' and the party has been battered by accusations that Gysi was an informant for the East German secret police when he acted as defense lawyer for dissidents .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;11	The news magazine Focus this week devoted its cover story to Gysi , calling him `` Der Blender '' -- The Phoney -- and a `` clever demagogue . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;12	The tax levy is for a corporate tax in the first half of 1990 -- before German unification -- when the PDS as successor of the communists still held vast assets around the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;13	East German political groups entrusted their assets to an independent commission that is supposed to determine how much of the property they can keep and how much is national property .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;14	The PDS wanted its tax levy to be paid from its assets held by the independent commission , but the commission refused .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;15	The Treuhandanstalt , the trustee agency that is selling off East German state assets , said the independent commission was following the letter of the 1990 treaty of German unification and a law passed by the democratically elected East German parliament before German unification .
APW_ENG_19941201.0109;16	`` The -LRB- PDS -RRB- is fleeing into the pose of a victim when its active cooperation would be appropriate , '' said Wolf Schoede , spokesman of the trustee agency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;0	China has agreed to allow the United States to open an office of the Drug Enforcement Administration in Beijing , a senior U.S. official announced Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;1	Timothy Wirth , undersecretary of state for global affairs , is in Beijing for talks with Chinese officials on population , environment , women 's issues and narcotics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;2	His job was created under the Clinton administration , and Wirth said he came to China because `` what happens in China is going to affect everybody in the world . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;3	He said the Chinese government had agreed in principle to the opening of the DEA office , and the U.S. side was looking for an apartment for the American official .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;4	Under Chinese government regulations , foreign government employees in Beijing must live in one of four diplomatic compounds , which have long waiting lists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;5	Wirth said U.S. cities are seeing a resurgence of heroin use , with major supplies of `` very cheap and very pure '' heroin from Burma showing up in Los Angeles and New York .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;6	`` China has the most influence with the government of Burma .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;7	We have very little influence with the government of Burma , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;8	`` We want very much to engage the government of China in focusing on the narcotics problem and the Burma problem in particular . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;9	Southwest China borders Burma .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;10	The `` Golden Triangle '' region where the borders of Burma , Thailand and Laos converge produces most of the world 's heroin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;11	Wirth said China 's population and environmental problems can have worldwide consequences , but China can learn from some of the mistakes the United States has made as well as benefit from its technology and know-how .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;12	For instance , he said , the U.S. experience has shown that use of catalytic converters and unleaded gasoline in cars can substantially improve air quality , one of China 's worst pollution problems .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;13	Wirth said he also planned to look into China 's population policies , particularly at a new law promoting mother and child health that includes eugenics clauses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0110;14	`` We remain deeply concerned , as does most of the world , about any programs that involve coercive abortion policies , '' said Wirth , who was to meet with the head of China 's family planning commission on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;0	An explosive thrown during a clash between political rivals killed one person on polling day Thursday , during a state election considered to be a severe test for Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;1	Police said they also killed three militants of the Peoples War Group , an anarchist organization that carried out a series of sabotage incidents in the final weeks of the campaign to disrupt the voting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;2	At least 29 people were killed in land mine explosions blamed on the group .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;3	Aruna Bahugana , a senior police officer , reported that an election official was dragged out of his polling booth and stabbed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;4	Cases also were reported of looting ballot boxes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;5	The violence came during elections to the state assembly of Andhra Pradesh , Prime Minister Rao 's home state .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;6	There were no reports of election trouble in the neighboring state of Karnataka .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;7	Voting for state legislatures in the two south Indian states was seen as an important bellwether for Congress , which already has suffered setbacks in the north and must retain its support in the south .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;8	A loss in Rao 's own state of Andhra Pradesh could unleash rivalries in the governing party that he suppressed with difficulty last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;9	Results will be announced Dec. 9 for elections in Andhra Pradesh , Karnataka and two other states that voted last month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;10	The voting is staggered to allow police forces to move from one to another to protect polling stations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;11	The Congress campaign in Andhra Pradesh was thrown into disarray by the promise of an aging film star-turned-politician , N.T. Rama Rao , to sell rice to the poor at two rupees per kilogram -LRB- three cents per pound -RRB- -- six times less than the market rate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;12	Pursuing free market reforms , Rao could offer no subsidies to match his opponent 's challenge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;13	Rama Rao , 72 , who built a popular image by playing Hindu deities in classic films in the local Telugu language , campaigned with the help of his young crowd-pulling wife , whom he married last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0111;14	The prime minister put his own prestige at stake by campaigning hard in his state , but his party 's prospects were hurt by infighting among the local politicians .

APW_ENG_19941201.0112;1	Gold prices were down .

APW_ENG_19941201.0113;0	NATO foreign ministers met Thursday to begin laying the groundwork for the entry of former Warsaw Pact foes as new members in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;1	But their two-day meeting was likely to be overshadowed by the crisis in Bosnia that has put extraordinary strains on the relationship between the United States and its European allies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;2	During the talks , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher was expected to tell the allies the Clinton administration has swung behind their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the Bosnian conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;3	It marks a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the European allies , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;4	The change in U.S. policy will help heal an unprecedented rift within the alliance over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;5	Seeking to mend fences , Christopher told the allies :
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;6	`` Let me stress one important fact : The crisis in Bosnia is about Bosnia and the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;7	It does not diminish NATO 's enduring importance . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;8	The deep splits within the alliance were highlighted by a letter from Germany 's ambassador to NATO that accused the United States of sowing mistrust among the allies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;9	The letter from Ambassador Hermann von Richthofen accused the United States of acting behind the backs of its allies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;10	`` The alliance is divided and in crisis , '' concluded Richthofen 's cable to his Foreign Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;11	The letter was leaked to a leading German newspaper , the Suddeutsche Zeitung , which published extracts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;12	Opening the meeting , Willy Claes , the new secretary-general of the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization , appealed for unity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;13	`` We are now being put to -LRB- the -RRB- test , and I have every confidence that our solidarity will see us through now has it has in even darker circumstances . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;14	The foreign ministers are anxious their talks not be entirely hijacked by the Bosnian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;15	They intend to order a study that would set out the terms and conditions for the acceptance of East European countries as new members .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;16	`` We have a moral duty not to squander this historic opportunity to anchor the new democracies of central and eastern Europe permanently in the West , '' Claes said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;17	The decision to authorize the study will mark a cautious move forward in drawing former adversaries in Eastern Europe who are appealing for membership .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;18	`` Today , we take an important step in the process that will lead to NATO expansion , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;19	The study -- dubbed an `` owner 's manual '' for NATO membership -- will take a year to complete .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;20	It will not name candidates for membership , nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;21	Instead , it will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;22	To counter Russian worries about an eastward expansion of NATO , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Russia and agree to hold regular talks with Moscow on security matters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;23	Despite attempts to keep the focus on new members , the Bosnian crisis will no doubt occupy a large amount of the ministers ' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;24	At a breakfast with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd , Christopher reviewed the warning U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali delivered Wednesday that unless warring Serbs and Muslims cooperate with the U.N. mission the peacekeepers might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;25	Hurd said he may go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , this weekend to preach reconciliation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;26	Officials said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe may join him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;27	`` We will redouble our efforts to find a diplomatic solution , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;28	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that would let Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;29	That plan would require them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;30	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;31	On Friday , Christopher will meet with here his counterparts from France , Germany , Britain and Russia to discuss new plans to revive their moribund peace plan for Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;32	France and Britain have been criticized in the U.S. Congress for refusing to let the United Nations use the Western military alliance 's air power to the full .
APW_ENG_19941201.0113;33	In turn , Congress has forced the Clinton administration to seek a lifting of the arms embargo against Bosnia 's Muslim-led government , something the European NATO allies oppose for fear it would escalate the fighting .

APW_ENG_19941201.0114;4	A quake of magnitude 5 is capable of causing considerable damage .

APW_ENG_19941201.0116;4	Coulthard 's best performance was a second-place finish behind Hill in the Portuguese Grand Prix .

APW_ENG_19941201.0119;0	The Philippine economy , showing continued improvement , expanded by 5.5 percent in this year 's first nine months from January-September last year , officials reported Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;1	The National Economic and Development Authority said that in the third quarter alone , gross national product grew by 5.9 percent from a year earlier , compared with 2.2 percent growth in the same period of 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;2	The Economic Planning Agency said the latest quarter 's performance bettered the 5.6 percent annual growth in the second quarter and the 4.9 percent in the first quarter .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;3	`` Strong domestic production combined with continued higher net inflows of incomes from abroad led to the accelerated growth during the period , '' the agency said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;4	President Fidel Ramos attributed the growth , after years of sluggish performance , to the liberalization of the economy and other reforms such as breaking up cartels in such sectors as telecommunications , shipping and insurance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;5	He also cited recent moves deregulating foreign exchange trading , opening the banking industry to more foreign banks and improving revenue collection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;6	Ramos said the growth so far indicated that the economy would expand by 5.5 percent for the entire year , with the fourth quarter getting a further boost from good weather and Christmas spending .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;7	GNP grew by only 2.3 percent in all of 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;8	`` I am very confident of sustainable progress and sustainable development in the long term , '' Ramos said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;9	The industrial and agricultural sectors showed impressive performances , the planning agency said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;10	Agriculture , including fishery and forestry , posted an all-time high growth of 9 percent in the third quarter , compared with a 1.4 percent decline in the same quarter last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0119;11	Ramos said the manufacturing sector 's 4.4 percent growth in January-September , compared to its 0.5 percent decline in 1993 , makes it the `` engine for increased output and employment . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;0	A plan to salvage the near-bankrupt airline Iberia appeared doomed Thursday after talks between management and pilots ended in total disagreement over pay cuts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;1	Management and representatives of the carrier 's two main unions reached a tentative agreement Tuesday on a plan that entailed a wage freeze , salary cuts averaging 8.5 percent and a reduction of some 3,500 jobs through early retirements and buy-outs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;2	Acceptance by the pilots , who make up 5 percent of the airlines 24,000 employees , would have paved the way for the plan to be implemented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;3	The plan was considered crucial if the European Union is to allow the Spanish government to grant Iberia a 130 billion peseta -LRB- dlrs 1 billion -RRB- capital injection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;4	Iberia chairman Javier Salas said the state-owned company would hold meetings with other unions Thursday to evaluate the situation in view of the pilots ' rejection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;5	Iberia last week touted a more drastic plan that would cut 5,200 jobs and sell company assets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;6	The proposal triggered a one-day strike that paralyzed Spain 's airports and affected more than 100,000 travelers here and abroad .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;7	Negotiations with the pilots reached a dead end in overnight talks as Iberia demanded a salary reduction of 15 percent based on 1992 earnings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;8	The pilots insisted that an existing wage agreement through 1995 must be carried out before the 15 percent salary cut could be enforced .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;9	`` The company has presented a generic plan that does not guarantee the future of Iberia and only concentrates on disproportionate salary cuts , '' said Armando Guajardo of the pilots ' union SEPLA .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;10	SEPLA said the company needed a complete overhaul and not just a reduction in salaries and staff .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;11	Salas has warned that the company would be technically bankrupt by March 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;12	Iberia has posted losses since 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;13	It ended last year 67 billion pesetas -LRB- dlrs 530 million -RRB- in the red while losses for this year are expected to top 40 billion pesetas -LRB- dlrs 300 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0120;14	Unions are to decide Thursday if a strike called several weeks ago for Friday still holds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;0	A botulism outbreak , caused by poorly prepared fish , has killed five people in the past 10 days in the Georgian capital , officials said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;1	An additional 60 people have been hospitalized , including several in critical condition , said Nikolai Shavdia , chief sanitary doctor at Tbilisi 's Republic Hospital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;2	All five people who died had eaten home-smoked fish bought at a local market , Shavdia said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;3	Others fell ill after eating home-canned meat , also from city markets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;4	Power and natural gas shortages in the former Soviet republic have rendered many residents unable to cook at home , forcing them to go to markets for prepared foods .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;5	`` The situation is very difficult , '' Shavdia said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;6	`` We just can not control all the homemade food for sale in the markets and kiosks . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;7	Police , who are planning a series of market raids , say they will concentrate on those selling prepared fish or meat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;8	Botulism is a kind of food poisoning , usually caused by bacteria in improperly canned food .
APW_ENG_19941201.0121;9	Modern preserving methods have almost eliminated the disease in most parts of the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;0	Coastal police said they seized two tons of explosives and ammunition from a Chinese fishing boat Thursday and claimed they may have been intended for sabotaging Taiwan 's elections Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;1	Five Chinese men were arrested and the explosives , 5,000 detonators and 250 meters -LRB- 825 feet -RRB- of fuse were taken from the boat about 25 miles -LRB- 40 kms -RRB- off northern Taiwan , police said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;2	The boat was taking on water after being damaged in strong winds , they said , and the men gave themselves up when the boat was intercepted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;3	On Saturday , Taiwan will hold its largest-scale elections to choose a governor , provincial assembly , and mayors and city councils of Taipei and Kaohsiung .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;4	Wu Tung-ming , director of the Investigation Bureau , told the legislature two weeks ago that the government was investigating the possibility that China might try to sabotage the elections by offering money to candidates or fomenting public disorder .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;5	Officials have said China fears possible election victories by the pro-independence opposition .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;6	China regards Taiwan as a renegade province and opposes moves toward Taiwanese independence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;7	`` It is the largest amount of ammunition seized in recent years , and we suspect that it may have been meant for use in disturbing social order during the elections , '' Yang Wen-ning , chief of the Tamsui squad , said in an interview .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;8	The five men , Xiao Qingxiang , 34 , Xiao Liangyung , 22 , Xiao Wenlung , 44 , Xiao Qingguo , 29 , and Gong Guoyun , 21 , were likely to be sent to the Taipei District Court for further investigation Thursday night , police said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;9	They told police they were asked by unidentified men to deliver the ammunition to Taiwanese smugglers for a reward of 10,000 yuan -LRB- U.S. dlrs 1,175 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;10	They said they left China 's Fujian province Wednesday night and were unaware what the ammunition was for .

APW_ENG_19941201.0122;12	Most smuggled items are drugs , wine and farm products .
APW_ENG_19941201.0122;13	Taiwan is the seat of the ruling Nationalists who fled the Communist takeover of China in 1949 .

APW_ENG_19941201.0124;0	The Achille Lauro smoldered on a placid sea Thursday , a day after a raging fire forced the nearly 1,000 people aboard to take to lifeboats and abandon the cruise ship off Somalia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;1	Two people were reported dead from the Italian liner , which gained notoriety in 1985 when Palestinian terrorists hijacked and killed a wheelchair-bound American passenger .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;2	After a night aboard the oil tanker that picked them up , hundreds of passengers began transferring aboard an armada of commercial vessels and two U.S. Navy ships for passage to nearby ports , including Mombasa in Kenya , the Seychelles and Djibouti .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;3	The operation was '' very organized , '' said Cmdr. T. McCreary , spokesman for the U.S. Navy 's Central Command , based in Bahrain . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;4	Folks down there have a pretty good handle on the situation , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;5	The transfer was expected to last most of the day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;6	At mid-morning on Thursday , the empty , scarred Achille Lauro was still afloat , listing badly to port .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;7	White steam nd gray smoke poured from its port side and smaller streams came drifting out of the lower starboard deck .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;8	Though her name was still visible on the stern , the cruise ship 's blue and white paint was scorched and mottled , the white stars on her two smokestacks blackened by heat and soot .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;9	Although crippled , the Achille Lauro appeared in no danger of sinking quickly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;10	The ship was listing at about 20 degrees , John Briand , captain of the oil tanker Lima , told the BBC .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;11	The fire started Wednesday , apparently in the passenger area , but the cause was not known , said the ship 's owner , Starlauro of Genoa , Italy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;12	But Dmitrios Skapinkais , the Greek captain of the Treasure Island , said the liner 's captain , who came aboard to use his ship 's radiotelephone , said the fire started in the engine room .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;13	Eight people were injured in the fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;14	About 60 crewmembers fought the fire before abandoning the 23,478-ton ship 210 kilometers -LRB- 130 miles -RRB- south of the Horn of Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;15	The pilot of a plane carrying an Associated Press reporter and cameramen put the ship 's position at 160 miles east of the small Somali fishing village of Eil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;16	Capt. Ferdinando Lolli , a port official in Rome , said the ship was carrying 581 passengers and 404 crew .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;17	Most of the crew was Italian , and the passengers mainly South African , German , Dutch and British .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;18	Late Wednesday evening , Italian Coast Guard officials reported that everyone on the Achille Lauro was accounted for .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;19	Starlauro identified the dead as a Briton and a German .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;20	The Panamanian oil ship Hawaiian King was one of the first ships to arrive at the scene and took on about 800 people , said a coast guard official in Rome , Adm. Eugenio Sicurezza .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;21	`` Quite a few people were injured in the transfer -- there 's a few broken bones and some pretty tortured souls , '' Briand said , adding that many of the rescued passengers were elderly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;22	Many had to spend the night on the Hawaiian King 's deck , Briand said , and other ships sent over food , blankets and toiletries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;23	Two U.S. warships , the USS Gettysburg and USS Halyburton , arrived overnight and dispatched helicopters to ferry water , food and medical supplies to the survivors , McCreary said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;24	The Achille Lauro left Genoa on Nov. 19 , stopped in Israel , and its next port of call was to be Durban , South Africa , on Friday , said Carla Gotta , a spokeswoman for the cruise ship 's owner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;25	The terrorists who hijacked the Achille Lauro in 1985 shot American Leon Klinghoffer and pushed him in his wheelchair off the ship .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;26	The hijackers escaped the vessel and boarded a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced it to land in Italy and the hijackers were captured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;27	Launched in 1946 in the Netherlands , the Achille Lauro was acquired 20 years later by the Neapolitan shipping dynasty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;28	It first transported Italian immigrant workers to and from Australia and was outfitted for pleasure cruises in 1970 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0124;29	The liner rammed a fishing boat in 1971 off Italy , killing a Neapolitan fisherman .

APW_ENG_19941201.0124;31	Panicked passengers jumped into the sea , and two of them drowned .

APW_ENG_19941201.0133;0	A dog 's life just got tougher in Beijing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;1	The city government has passed a new law that restricts the hours dogs can go outside , bans them from public areas and imposes stiff fees on their owners , the official press reported Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;2	The law was proposed in October and has been the subject of intense public debate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;3	It also has driven down prices in Beijing 's dog markets , where some sellers are trying to give away puppies for free .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;4	At Beijing 's largest pet store , Pet World , a sales clerk said its last sale was a month ago .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;5	On Thursday , the day after the new law was passed , the store was empty except for two rows of cages housing pricey pedigree dogs including Maltese and Pekingese .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;6	Under the new law , dog owners must pay a 5,000-yuan -LRB- dlrs 600 -RRB- dog registration fee -- or 3,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 360 -RRB- if the dog is registered within three months of when the law takes effect May 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;7	Annual renewal fees will be 2,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 240 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;8	That compares with an average annual income of about 6,000 to 9,000 yuan -LRB- about dlrs 725 to dlrs 1,100 -RRB- for Beijing workers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;9	The new law allows only one dog per family and bans `` large and fierce dogs , '' the Beijing Daily reported Thursday in its top front-page story .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;10	It did not elaborate about what breeds would be banned .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;11	News reports said small dogs would be allowed outdoors only between 8 p.m. and 7 a.m. , and bigger ones could not go out at all .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;12	Every dog would be banned from public areas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;13	Beijing newspapers and radio phone-in shows have carried both sides of a debate on whether and how to restrict dogs in the city and its suburbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;14	The proposed law put the registration fee at 6,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 700 -RRB- , and many people complained it was too high .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;15	The Beijing area has about 190,000 dogs , compared with 20,000 in 1986 , the Xinhua News Agency said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;16	It was not immediately clear how the city would try to enforce the new law .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;17	Xinhua quoted Zhang Liangji of the Public Security Bureau as saying 52,000 residents were bitten by dogs last year , and 89 people died of rabies between 1988 and 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;18	Dog-owning was considered decadent in China before the current economic reforms took hold over the past decade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0133;19	Xinhua noted Wednesday that China has 120 million dogs who eat 15 billion kilograms -LRB- 33 billion pounds -RRB- of grain , enough to feed 40 million people .

APW_ENG_19941201.0141;1	A trickle of heavily loaded cars and trucks left the capital this morning as nervous civilians continued to head for the countryside , fearing an attack by Russian soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;2	Central Grozny was virtually empty following another nerve-jangling night of intermittent small arms fire from jumpy fighters around the city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;3	A single military jet roared over the capital as the Russian deadline passed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;4	Later , heavy machine-gun fire rang out from the city center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;5	The fighting pits forces loyal to Chechen President Dzhokar Dudayev , who has declared Chechnya independent from Russia , against rebels whom Dudayev says are armed and led by Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;6	Russian President Boris Yeltsin ordered warring Chechens to lay down their arms and release all prisoners by this morning or face Russian military intervention .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;7	The ultimatum has been met with defiance by Chechens .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;8	Russian media reported several transport planes have brought weapons and troops to the border of Chechnya , in the Caucasus Mountains region of southern Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;9	The conflict is the latest to underline the tensions among scores of ethnic groups in the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;10	The Caucasus region has been especially fractious , with recent fighting in the Ossetia and Abkhazia regions of Georgia and the Nagorno-Karabakh region of Azerbaijan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;11	For Moscow , which governs dozens of republics and regions in the Russian Federation , Chechnya has become a test of whether it is willing to use military might to hold the country together .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;12	No other region has gone as far as Chechnya and declared independence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;13	Yeltsin spokesman Vyacheslev Kostikov in Moscow said measures to resolve the Chechen conflict had `` begun to be implemented . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;14	He did not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0141;15	On Wednesday , opposition jets carried out a second day of air raids on the outskirts of Grozny , while Dudayev 's forces posted armed volunteers around the city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0142;0	A 22-year-old woman walking down a dark street suddenly found a naked , newly born baby being thrust into her hands .
APW_ENG_19941201.0142;1	She chased the young woman who had come up from behind and pressed the baby on her -- without saying a word -- but quickly lost her , Shiniichi Kawana of the Kanagawa Police Station said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0142;2	The umbilical cord still was attached to the infant girl , believed less than a day old at the time is was handed over Wednesday night in an area near Yokohama , south of Tokyo , Kawana said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0142;3	He said the baby was not even wrapped in a towel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0142;4	The baby now is all right in a hospital , he added .
APW_ENG_19941201.0142;5	He did not identify the woman to whom it was passed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;0	Overshadowed by the Bosnian crisis , NATO foreign ministers met Thursday to begin laying the groundwork for the entry of former Warsaw Pact foes as new members in coming years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;1	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher was using the two-day meeting to try to smooth extraordinary strains in U.S.-European ties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;2	He was expected to tell the allies that the Clinton administration has swung behind their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the Bosnian conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;3	It marks a major policy switch by Washington under pressure particularly from Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;4	Seeking to mend fences , Christopher told the allies :
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;5	`` Let me stress one important fact : The crisis in Bosnia is about Bosnia and the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;6	It does not diminish NATO 's enduring importance . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;7	`` We will redouble our efforts to find a diplomatic solution , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;8	Apart from inevitably dealing with Bosnia , the foreign ministers of the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization will move cautiously order a study to set out the terms for letting East European countries join .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;9	`` We have a moral duty not to squander this historic opportunity to anchor the new democracies of central and eastern Europe permanently in the West , '' NATO secretary-general Willy Claes said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;10	The study will take a year to complete .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;11	It will not name candidates for membership , nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;12	It will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;13	To counter Russian worries about an eastward expansion of NATO , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Russia and agree to hold regular talks with Moscow on security matters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;14	On Friday , Christopher intends to lay out the U.S. approach to the Bosnian war in a meeting with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd and foreign ministers Alain Juppe of France , Andrei V. Kozyrev of Russia and Klaus Kinkel of Germany .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;15	It centers on a call for an international peace conference that would let Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they have repeatedly rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;16	That plan would require them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;17	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;18	France and Britain have been criticized in the U.S. Congress for refusing to let the United Nations use the Western military alliance 's air power to the full .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;19	In turn , Congress has forced the Clinton administration to seek a lifting of the arms embargo against Bosnia 's Muslim-led government , something the European NATO allies oppose for fear it would escalate the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;20	Hurd said he may go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , this weekend to preach reconciliation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0143;21	Officials said Juppe may join him .

APW_ENG_19941201.0145;0	A Japanese seminarian who was reported missing has called his superior , saying he was safe in the central Philippine city of Cebu , another seminarian said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0145;1	Norihito Sako , 39 , of Sapporo , was reported missing Nov. 20 after failing to return to Manila from a visit to Pampanga province , where he was helping victims of the June 1991 Mount Pinatubo eruptions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0145;2	Fellow seminarian Edgar Zamudio said Sako called the director of the Claret Formation Center , the Rev. Carlos Rivas , Wednesday from Cebu , 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941201.0145;3	Zamudio said Rivas left for Cebu immediately after receiving the call from Sako and did n't tell the other seminarians why the Japanese went to Cebu .
APW_ENG_19941201.0145;4	`` As far as we know , he is in Cebu and he is alive , '' Zamudio said , adding that Sako had visited that city several times previously .
APW_ENG_19941201.0145;5	Sako has finished theology studies at Sophia University in Tokyo and belongs to the Diocese of Yokohama .
APW_ENG_19941201.0145;6	In May 1993 , he came to Manila for graduate studies at the Jesuit-run Ateneo de Manila University , leading to possible ordination as a priest in 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;0	Indonesia will become an oil importer in the next 20 years as domestic consumption overtakes declining production , the U.S. Embassy said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;1	Petroleum Report , issued annually by the embassy , said domestic consumption could exceed production as soon as the early part of the next decade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;2	The report said Indonesia , which produced an average of 1.5 million barrels of crude oil daily in l993 , lowered its crude exports by 3 percent to 776,000 barrels a day this year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;3	Daily consumption of petroleum fuels rose 7 percent to 262 million barrels last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;4	However , the report said oil and gas will continue to play a prominent role in Indonesia 's economy in years to come .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;5	Indonesia , the third oldest oil producer in the world after the United States and Russia , has an estimated 71.86 billion barrels of crude oil reserves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0147;6	Of that amount , 10.41 billion barrels -- 8.09 billion onshore and 2.32 billion offshore -- are proven and probable , the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;0	Cpl. Kenneth E. Ruiz , the last of three Marines to be tried in the May 1 stabbing death of a fellow Marine , has been sentenced to life in prison , the U.S. military said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;1	The 23-year-old Ruiz , of Linden , Calif. , was found guilty Wednesday of premeditated murder in the killing of Sgt. Michael A. Allen at Iwakuni Marine Corps Air Station near Hiroshima , a military statement said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;2	Cpl. Michael R. Stelling of Springfield , Md. , and Lance Cpl. Mark D. Jimenez of Lamont , Calif. , already have been sentenced in the stabbing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;3	Stelling was sentenced to 40 years and Jimenez to 30 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;4	In both cases , the full sentences of life in prison were reduced in line with pre-trial agreements .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;5	Prosecutors at Ruiz ' trial said the three Marines lured Allen to a secluded part of the air station and stabbed him repeatedly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;6	They then kicked Allen into a drainage ditch and left him to die , the release said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;7	According to the military newspaper Stars and Stripes , Jimenez testified at his trial that the three killed Allen because they thought he was giving investigators information about a Hispanic gang to which all four Marines belonged .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;8	Prosecutors had called for a life sentence , saying Ruiz was the driving force behind the conspiracy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;9	But at the trial Ruiz denied that : `` We all conspired to cover up the murder .
APW_ENG_19941201.0148;10	There were no leaders and no followers , just three idiots who became criminals . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0149;1	The ministers endorsed a 12-month program to consider financing , structure , nuclear and other issues related to the expansion of the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include Central and East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0149;2	Anxious not to upset Russia , the foreign ministers , according to an allied source , emphasized that the alliance was `` not trying to create a hostile bloc . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;0	A subsidiary of Japan 's Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. said Thursday it has agreed to buy German picture tube plants owned by Finland 's Nokia Consumer Electronics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;1	Matsushita Electronics Corp. would not disclose the amount it will pay for Esslingen , Germany-based Nokia Display Technics GmbH , a wholly owned Nokia subsidiary .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;2	Nokia announced in March that it would withdraw from the picture-tube business and shut down its Esslingen and Straubing picture-tube facilities by the end of 1994 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;3	Under the agreement , Matsushita Electronics will acquire Nokia Display 's fixed assets , a Matsushita official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;4	Nokia will lay off the current work force at the plants by the end of December , but Matsushita Electronics likely will rehire many of the workers , though it is not obligated to do so under the terms of the deal , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;5	Matsushita said the acquisition is aimed at extending supplies of cathode-ray tubes to Matsushita Group factories and to other television makers in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;6	With the purchase , Matsushita Electronics will have four production bases outside Japan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;7	Matsushita Electronics is a Japanese maker of semiconductors and cathode-ray tubes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;8	Its shares are n't listed on the nation 's stock exchange .
APW_ENG_19941201.0150;9	Its parent , Matsushita Electric Industrial , is the world 's largest maker of consumer electronics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;0	KABUL , Afghanistan -LRB- AP -RRB- - With a brief lull in the civil war , the United Nations is trying to send a large relief convoy into Kabul for the first time in six months , an official said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;1	A truck convoy carrying hundreds of tons of food , medicine and plastic sheeting recently left from neighboring Pakistan and is now south of the besieged city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;2	U.N. officials are trying to negotiate safe passage across the front line in south Kabul , said a U.N. official who requested anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;3	Opposition leader Gulbuddin Hekmatyar controls the main roads leading into the city and no large convoys can reach Kabul without his approval .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;4	And as winter descends on war-torn Kabul , the food situation is expected to deteriorate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;5	At present , the city 's food is being supplied mostly by small-scale traders who cross the front line daily to buy flour , wood and gasoline from merchants in opposition-held territory to the south and the east of Kabul .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;6	There 's enough food available , but prices have skyrocketed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;7	If the U.N. effort is successful , the convoy could reach Kabul this weekend .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;8	It would be the first U.N. relief convoy to reach the capital since June .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;9	Hekmatyar 's forces tightened their blockade last winter and food supplies were running low until U.N. Secretary Boutros Boutros-Ghali made a personal appeal to Hekmatyar , who then eased the roadblocks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;10	But many Afghans are critical of the United Nations , which removed its international staff from Kabul when heavy fighting erupted in January .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;11	A small staff made up entirely of Afghans now handles the limited U.N. operation in Kabul , while the U.N. 's international staff remains in Pakistan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;12	There were sporadic bursts of gunfire along the front line in southern Kabul on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;13	But compared to the usual salvos of rockets and mortar fire , the city has been relatively peaceful for the last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;14	President Burhanuddin Rabbani 's government controls most of the capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0151;15	But nine separate Islamic factions remain locked in a bitter battle that broke out after the groups ousted a Communist government in 1992 .

APW_ENG_19941201.0153;0	A moderate quake struck the Ionian Sea island of Levkas Thursday , causing some damage but no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;1	The Salonica University Seismological Institute said the quake had a preliminary magnitude of 5.2 and its epicenter on the seabed near Levkas , 300 kilometers -LRB- 186 miles -RRB- southwest of this northern city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;2	It occurred at 9:17 a.m. -LRB- 0717 GMT -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;3	It was followed a few minutes later by a quake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.6 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;4	Local authorities said some buildings were slightly damaged by the initial tremor , but there were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;5	It was the second quake to hit the Levkas region in two days .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;6	A quake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.3 hit the area Tuesday but caused little damage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;7	The region is considered to be earthquake prone .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;8	Officials at the Athens Seismological Institute , located in the capital , said they thought the tremors following Tuesday 's quake to be aftershocks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;9	A quake with a moment magnitude of 2.5 to 3 is the smallest generally felt by people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0153;10	A magnitude 5 can cause moderate damage while a 6 can cause severe damage under a populated area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0155;0	NATO foreign ministers on Thursday approved a proposal setting out the terms and conditions for the entry of former Warsaw Pact foes as new members in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0155;1	The ministers endorsed a 12-month program to consider financing , structure , nuclear and other issues related to the expansion of the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include Central and East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0155;2	Anxious not to upset Russia , the foreign ministers , according to an allied source , emphasized that the alliance was `` not trying to create a hostile bloc . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;0	The decision to support the expansion of the alliance came on the opening day of a two-day conference of allied foreign ministers whose talks were likely to be overshadowed by the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;1	`` Today , we take an important step in the process that will lead to NATO expansion , '' said U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher in addressing his counterparts at the opening session .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;2	`` The United States believes it is time to begin the process -- to begin deliberate consideration of the practical requirements for adding new members to the alliance , '' he said in the text of his speech .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;3	The decision to authorize the study , though , is a cautious move forward in drawing former adversaries anxious for membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;4	`` We have a moral duty not to squander this historic opportunity to anchor the new democracies of central and eastern Europe permanently in the West , '' said NATO Secretary-general Willy Claes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;5	The study -- dubbed an `` owner 's manual '' for NATO membership -- will take a year to complete .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;6	It will not name candidates for membership , nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;7	Instead , it will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0156;8	To counter Russian worries about an eastward expansion of NATO , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Russia and agree to hold regular talks with Moscow on security matters .

APW_ENG_19941201.0159;0	President Boris Yeltsin ordered the government to sell a minority stake in Russia 's largest state television and radio company .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;1	The government will keep a controlling 51 percent interest , however .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;2	Ostankino , once called commonwealth television , is broadcast throughout the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;3	Its Moscow broadcasting tower was the scene of the worst fighting during the political uprising in October 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;4	Twelve major companies and organizations are buying the 49 percent stake in Ostankino .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;5	They include ITAR-Tass , Menatep , Stolichny and Inkombank commercial banks , Aeroflot International Airlines and the Avtovaz car manufacturer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;6	Yeltsin 's decree Wednesday said the new venture , called Russian Public Television , would inherit Ostankino 's nationwide Channel One .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;7	Ostankino chief Alexander Yakovlev , who was the architect of `` glasnost '' under former Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev , told the ITAR-Tass news agency that the sale would help make Russia 's television independent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0159;8	Yeltsin 's opponents have complained that state television favors the government and offers biased coverage of political events -- charges that Russian broadcast executives deny .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;0	In a pre-emptive strike against rival Fox , NBC wants federal regulators to make it easier for U.S. media companies to get financing from foreign investors -- if existing foreign ownership limits are not enforced .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;1	`` If the rules on foreign investment and foreign ownership change , then they should change for everyone , not just for Fox , '' NBC said in a petition to the Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;2	The FCC , in a separate proceeding , is reviewing whether Fox 's acquisition of six TV stations , using money from a foreign corporation , that made up the foundation of the network violated foreign ownership limits .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;3	The provisions limit a foreign company or individual from owning more than 25 percent of a broadcast station .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;4	NBC says the FCC has not granted any waivers of the limits since their creation 60 years ago .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;5	If the agency decides to give Fox a waiver from such restrictions , all broadcast companies should be allowed waivers , Richard Cotton , NBC senior vice president and general counsel , said in an interview .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;6	The FCC approved the acquisition of those stations from Metromedia Inc. in 1986 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;7	The stations are in Washington , New York , Los Angeles , Chicago , Dallas and Houston .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;8	The NBC petition builds on a complaint filed earlier this year by the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People , which asserted that Fox violated federal foreign ownership restrictions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;9	According to Fox disclosures to the FCC this summer , all but 1 percent of the dlrs 600 million used to purchase the stations was put up by News Corp. , which is based in Australia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;10	Chairman Rupert Murdoch , who became a U.S. citizen to buy the stations , owns stock representing 76 percent of the voting rights of Fox Television .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;11	The remaining 24 percent is held by News Corp.
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;12	The key question facing the FCC is who owns the stations -- Murdoch or News Corp.
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;13	But Preston Padden , Fox Broadcasting Co. 's president of network distribution , said it does n't matter because Murdoch controls News Corp. `` It all leads back to a U.S. citizen -- Rupert Murdoch , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;14	Padden said in an interview : `` We do n't have a waiver .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;15	We have n't asked for a waiver .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;16	We do n't intend to ask for a waiver .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;17	We do n't need a waiver . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;18	The ownership of Fox stations complies with the restrictions , Padden said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;19	NBC 's filing -- the latest in a series of assaults against Fox -- is an attempt to sabotage a competitor , Padden asserted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;20	NBC said that if the FCC determines that Fox violated foreign ownership limits , Fox should not be given a waiver from the restrictions unless competitors are also allowed waivers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;21	`` What if we want a foreign partner ? ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;22	asked one NBC official , speaking on the condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;23	Cotton said NBC 's petition is not motivated by a desire to get an infusion of foreign capital , but to `` level the playing field , '' between NBC and Fox , Cotton said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;24	Cotton and other NBC officials say that the FCC , in an attempt to help nurture a fourth network , has given Fox breaks from broadcast regulations over the last several years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;25	`` Enough is enough , '' Cotton said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0160;26	`` The same rules should apply to all competitors . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;0	Queen Elizabeth II will visit South Africa in March , returning there for the first time since she made her 21st birthday broadcast from Cape Town in 1947 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;1	In a statement on Thursday , Buckingham Palace said the queen and her husband , Prince Philip , will be in South Africa from March 19 to March 25 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;2	As Princess Elizabeth , the queen accompanied her parents , King George VI , who died in 1952 , and Queen Elizabeth , now the 94-year-old Queen Mother , when they visited South Africa in 1947 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;3	She turned 21 in Cape Town and broadcast from there dedicating herself to the service of Britain and now 51-nation Commonwealth of its ex-colonies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;4	As international hostility grew to apartheid , no British sovereign visited South Africa after 1947 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;5	Philip represented the queen at the installation of President Nelson Mandela , South Africa 's first black president , in April .
APW_ENG_19941201.0161;6	The queen 's daughter , Princess Anne , was there Nov. 22-Nov .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;0	The death toll from Mount Merapi 's eruption last week has risen to 52 , with many more deaths expected among the 29 victims in critical condition , an official said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;1	Bambang Pramudia , an official at the Sardjito hospital in Jogjakarta , said little could be done for those badly burned by a cloud of steam and gas that spewed suddenly from the 2,968-meter -LRB- 7,952-foot -RRB- volcano on Nov. 22 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;2	`` Those who do survive will need major plastic surgery for burns , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;3	The volcano 's activity has begun to show signs of subsiding , said Atje Purbawinata of Jogjakarta 's geology office , but villagers have been told to stay at emergency shelters until the situation was really safe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;4	Purbawinata said heavy rains have stopped the search for other victims believed trapped inside destroyed homes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;5	More than 5,000 people have been evacuated from villages devastated by the eruption , which demolished homes , flattened forests , destroyed crops and wiped out livestock .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;6	Tons of ash were dumped on the surrounding area and some lava poured out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;7	Merapi , considered one of the world 's most active volcanoes , is one of 129 in Indonesia , a sprawling archipelago that lies along what is known as the Pacific Ring of Fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;8	Merapi has been active throughout the year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;9	Its last fatal eruption occurred in 1976 , when 28 people were killed and 1,176 left homeless .
APW_ENG_19941201.0163;10	Its most destructive eruption was in 1672 , when about 3,000 people were believed killed .
