APW_ENG_19941201.0165;0	The first international political summit on AIDS opened Thursday with appeals to governments to protect victims ' dignity and provide more money to combat the disease .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;1	`` I am issuing a general call to arms , '' U.N. Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali told officials from 42 nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;2	`` We are not meeting here simply to issue a further warning , but to declare a planetary emergency ... Every day , AIDS kills children , destroys families , drains economies , threatens communities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;3	We must act without delays . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;4	Twelve prime ministers , 17 health ministers and other Cabinet officials met to strengthen political commitments to fight AIDS and expand cooperation between developed and developing nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;5	A non-binding declaration to be signed Thursday evening pledges to promote international cooperation in research , partnerships between public and private sectors and increased safeguards for blood transfusions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;6	Participants will vow to reach out to children and `` empower women ... to reduce their vulnerability '' by engaging them more in policy-making .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;7	The summit was one of the focal points of World AIDS Day , being observed around the world with education programs and fund-raising events .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;8	Australians attended special church services in memory of the 3,500 compatriots killed by AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;9	In South Africa , where the disease is spreading rapidly , health officials and politicians wrapped a huge red ribbon around St. George 's Cathedral in Cape Town as part of efforts to increase awareness about AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;10	In China , a group with no government ties took to Beijing streets to distribute pamphlets about AIDS prevention .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;11	It 's rare for an independent group to be allowed to organize high-profile public activities such as passing out leaflets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;12	Federico Mayor , head of the U.N. Educational , Scientific and Cultural Organization where the one-day Paris summit was held , said nations must spend more to fight AIDS rather than rely on private charities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;13	`` In our budgets we have funds to pay the price of war , but we have made no provision for the cost of the fight against AIDS , '' Mayor said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;14	Boosted spending `` must be accompanied by ethical surveillance to prevent or check any measures -- including legislative ones -- that would tend to exclude or discriminate against people who are ill from the disease , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;15	Respect for AIDS sufferers was a common theme at the summit , attended by several AIDS activist groups .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;16	`` To us on the front lines , people living with HIV and AIDS and affected and vulnerable communities must have the right to assemble and form associations to fight the epidemic , '' said Richard Burzynski , an HIV sufferer with the AIDS rights group Icaso .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;17	`` This means that all laws which deny the freedom of people to cross borders because of HIV must be abolished , '' Burzynski said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;18	`` This means all laws which criminalize or discriminate against homosexuals , drug users , migrants and refugees , and sex workers must be abolished . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;19	Governments tend to ignore or marginalize sexual minorities , worsening rather than addressing the AIDS epidemic , said the International Gay and Lesbian Association .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;20	High-risk populations must be accepted and educated , the association said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;21	The World Bank , the world 's biggest donor in the campaign against AIDS , Thursday pledged dlrs 150 million annually to combat the disease in developing countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;22	The bank , which has already extended dlrs 600 million to anti-AIDS projects , mostly in the Third World , said the new aid would be in the form of low-interest , 40-year loans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;23	France recently announced it would increase its aid to international agencies that fight AIDS by more than tenfold to 132 million francs -LRB- dlrs 25 million . -RRB-
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;24	Currently , however , more than 90 percent of the money pledged to fight AIDS goes toward helping only the 8 percent of those afflicted in developed countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;25	Some 17 million people are known to have been infected with the HIV virus , about two-thirds in Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;26	Elements of the French media pronounced the summit a failure even before it began .
APW_ENG_19941201.0165;27	The daily Liberation criticized the final declaration as `` banal , '' predicted that little new funding would be generated , and said the French were rebuffed in efforts to lure U.S. Vice President Al Gore , British Prime Minister John Major and German Chancellor Helmut Kohl to the summit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;0	When it comes to having fun , the Irish are still Number One in the European Union .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;1	But what 's more , they are getting better at enjoying themselves than other Europeans , the EU statistics agency Eurostat said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;2	It issued figures showing the Irish -- who topped the fun meter in the 1980s -- continue to outspend the rest on entertainment , recreation , education and culture .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;3	The average Irish household devotes 12.1 percent of its consumer spending on these four areas `` that could loosely be described as the ` fun index ' , '' said Eurostat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;4	In the second half of the 1980s , the Irish scored 10.6 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;5	On the latest index , Britons are second -- at 10.2 percent , barely up from 9.5 -- followed by the Dutch and Danes , both virtually unchanged at 10.1 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;6	Across the 12-nation EU , the 380,000 Luxembourgers have the least good time , devoting only 4.1 percent of their consumer spending to things considered fun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;7	The Eurostat figures are part of wider survey into consumer spending .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;8	Without giving a margin or error , it reports figures for 1992 which show that :
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;9	- Italians spend most on clothes and shoes -LRB- 9.9 percent of their total consumer outlays -RRB- and the Danes least -LRB- 5.3 percent -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;10	- Germans spend most on cars -LRB- 5.4 percent -RRB- and the Irish least -LRB- 3.3 percent -RRB- -- EU citizens ' spending on food , beverages and tobacco is dropping .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;11	The average per EU household has gone to 19.1 percent of spending , down from 20.8 percent in the 1985-89 period .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;12	The Greeks top this department .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;13	Up to 36.7 percent of their consumer spending goes to food , drink and a smoke `` but the Irish are n't far behind -LRB- 34.8 percent -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;14	Third are the Portuguese -LRB- 33.6 percent -RRB- with the British -LRB- 21.6 percent -RRB- next . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;15	Eurostat reported these consumer spending scores of its ` fun index ' of entertainment , recreation , education and culture -LRB- with the 1985-1989 in brackets -RRB- :
APW_ENG_19941201.0166;16	Ireland , 12.1 percent -LRB- 10.6 percent -RRB- ; Britain , 10.2 -LRB- 9.5 -RRB- ; Denmark , 10.1 -LRB- 9,8 -RRB- ; Netherlands , 10.1 -LRB- unchanged -RRB- ; Germany , 9.4 -LRB- 9.0 -RRB- ; Italy , 8.8 -LRB- 8.6 -RRB- ; Belgium , 8.7 percent -LRB- 8.4 -RRB- ; France , 7.6 -LRB- 7.3 -RRB- ; Portugal , 7.1 -LRB- 5.9 -RRB- Spain , 6.6 -LRB- unchanged -RRB- ; Greece , 5.6 -LRB- 6.0 -RRB- and Luxembourg , 4.1 -LRB- 3.9 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;0	Russian officials have registered apprehension about the movement of NATO 's territory farther east , and alliance leaders have gone out of their way to try to strengthen separate ties with Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;1	`` Russia is a part of Europe , '' said the NATO source , who insisted on anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;2	`` You can not have a security system without the participation of Russia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;3	The ministers , he said , emphasized the importance of `` increasing the momentum '' of consultations between NATO and Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;4	The United States had initially proposed a six-month study of enlargement , but the Europeans , mindful of Moscow 's concerns , extended it to 12 months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;5	`` We should avoid premature enlargement that gives the impression that we seek a redivision of the European continent , '' said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe , according to a spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;6	The allies do not intend to identify candidates for membership , nor set a date for admission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;7	But the NATO source said , `` Central European states would be first . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;8	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;9	Despite attempts to keep the focus on new members , the Bosnian crisis will no doubt occupy a large amount of the ministers ' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;10	During the talks , Christopher was expected to tell the allies the Clinton administration has swung behind their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the Bosnian conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;11	It marks a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the European allies , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;12	The change in U.S. policy will help heal an unprecedented rift within the alliance over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;13	At a breakfast with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd , Christopher reviewed the warning U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali delivered Wednesday that unless warring Serbs and Muslims cooperate with the U.N. mission the peacekeepers might be withdrawn .

APW_ENG_19941201.0167;15	Officials said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe may join him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;16	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that would let Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;17	That plan would require them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;18	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;19	On Friday , Christopher will meet with here his counterparts from France , Germany , Britain and Russia to discuss new plans to revive their moribund peace plan for Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;20	France and Britain have been criticized in the U.S. Congress for refusing to let the United Nations use the Western military alliance 's air power to the full .
APW_ENG_19941201.0167;21	In turn , Congress has forced the Clinton administration to seek a lifting of the arms embargo against Bosnia 's Muslim-led government , something the European NATO allies oppose for fear it would escalate the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;0	He was a caring corner grocer , a Korean immigrant and church deacon who gave advice to neighborhood boys and organized an anti-crime petition drive .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;1	Then Moon Hwang went from crusader to victim : Police say he was beaten to death behind his one-story brick store by a gang of teen-agers out for money .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;2	They did n't know he carried none .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;3	Their take : two loaves of bread and a bag of bean sprouts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;4	Eighteen-year-old Richard Simons and six juveniles , all members of a gang that called itself the Black Gangsta Family , have been charged with murder , robbery and conspiracy in the Nov. 18 attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;5	Prosecutor Jeffrey Blitz said Wednesday that he would seek to try the juveniles as adults .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;6	Police said the assailants used a BB gun to shoot out a light that illuminated the gravel-and-dirt parking lot behind the store .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;7	When Hwang and his wife closed the store about 8 p.m. and headed to their car , police said , the youths attacked in the darkness .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;8	Hwang 's wife , Young , ran for help and escaped unhurt .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;9	Hwang , beaten over the head , died two days later .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;10	Police were n't sure what the murder weapon was .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;11	Hwang , 54 , had no money because he timed his deposits to avoid carrying cash at dangerous times , police said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;12	One of the juveniles also is charged with killing a 15-year-old girl less than a day later .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;13	Le-Ann Washington was shot in the forehead from point-blank range after arguing with the youth as she walked home from a mall .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;14	On Wednesday , Bolf 's Market was still closed , the neon `` Fresh Fruit , Produce '' sign still lit , the newspapers inside now almost 2 weeks old .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;15	Neighbors in this working-class community of 16,000 people 5 miles -LRB- eight kilometers -RRB- west of Atlantic City fondly remembered a man who cared about his customers and stuck to his principles , refusing to sell cigarettes and condoms to minors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;16	`` He would have father-and-son talks with the younger customers who came in , '' said Patrick Lee , a liquor store owner who met Hwang through the Korean Chamber of Commerce of Atlantic County , which Hwang founded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;17	`` He cared about local children and how they acted , '' Lee said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;18	`` He 'd say , ` You should n't do this ' and ` You should n't do that . '' '
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;19	Hwang cared about his fellow merchants , too .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;20	In October , he sent a letter and a petition with 55 signatures to the Atlantic City police chief listing four violent incidents , including the Oct. 15 killing of a convenience store worker in Atlantic City .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;21	Later , he met with Atlantic City police officials and persuaded them to patrol Korean-owned stores more frequently .
APW_ENG_19941201.0168;22	His motives were far from selfish -- his store is in Pleasantville .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;0	Conservatives ' hopes of avoiding a potentially destructive duel between their top presidential hopefuls were dashed Thursday by a parliamentary report saying a primary could not be organized before the April election .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;1	The report by a 36-member legislative commission increased the chances that Premier Edouard Balladur and Paris Mayor Jacques Chirac will compete for conservative votes all the way into first-round presidential voting on April 23 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;2	They are likely to be joined by a candidate from the center-right Union for French Democracy , as well as far-right and far-left candidates and the probable Socialist Party candidate , Jacques Delors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;3	A two-candidate runoff on May 7 will determine the successor to Socialist President Francois Mitterrand .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;4	Many conservatives fear that the bitter infighting between Balladur and Chirac , both members of the neo-Gaullist Rally for the Republic , will ensure Delors ' victory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;5	Delors , who steps down next month as chief executive of the European Union , has pulled ahead in recent opinion polls .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;6	The parliament commission , composed of lawmakers from both main conservative parties , said it would be impossible to organize a primary that would satisfy all candidates and produce broadly accepted results .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;7	`` In the absence of any legislation ... it would inevitably give rise to endless challenges and uncontrollable arguments , '' the commission 's report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;8	`` The result on public opinion would be disastrous , and the winner 's legitimacy would be seriously affected . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;9	The commission had studied the feasibility of drafting a primary law or of arranging a primary without legislation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;10	It examined problems related to voter lists , financing and access to the media .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;11	Given the unfeasibility of a primary , the right 's prospects for success `` depend on the willingness of the candidates to endorse unity and guarantee it publicly , '' the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;12	Interior Minister Charles Pasqua had been struggling in recent weeks to lay the ground work for a primary , but said Thursday the problem now lay with the political parties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;13	One of Pasqua 's allies , Parliament member Jean-Jacques Guillet , denounced the commission report as `` an assassination '' arranged in advance by those who opposed the idea of a primary .
APW_ENG_19941201.0169;14	Balladur , who has yet to officially declare his candidacy , said after learning of the report that it remained essential for the right to find a candidate who could unify all factions of the governing coalition .

APW_ENG_19941201.0171;0	Hyatt International Corporation on Thursday signed an agreement with the Greek state to build and operate a casino , a five-star hotel and conference center in Salonica , northern Greece .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;1	The casino , which will be able to seat 2,000 people at a time , is expected to be completed by mid-1996 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;2	The 150-room hotel and conference center are expected to be completed the following year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;3	The Chicago-based corporation 's Regency Casinos will operate the casino that will be built near Salonica 's airport .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;4	The hotel and conference hall will be a five-minute drive away , on the grounds of the city 's American Farm School .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;5	The chairman of Hyatt 's board , Jay A. Pritzker , said he expected the total investment to come to about dlrs 120 million or dlrs 125 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;6	This includes 7.8 billion drachmas -LRB- dlrs 33 million -RRB- paid up front as a license fee that will come to 1.2 billion drachmas -LRB- dlrs 5 million -RRB- annually .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;7	The state will also receive 30 percent of the casino 's revenues .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;8	The license has a 12-year exclusivity period and is of indefinite duration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;9	Hyatt is also bidding for a license to operate a casino in Athens , Pritzker told a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;10	`` We hope to expand and build more of these projects in Greece , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;11	The casino and hotel in Salonica will employ 1,000 people , Greece 's tourism minister , Dionysis Livanos , said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;12	U.S. ambassador Thomas Niles said he was `` delighted '' at the American investment in northern Greece and that he hoped more would follow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;13	`` This is a very important project for Hyatt and the U.S. economic relationship with Greece and for the region for where the project is going , '' Niles said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0171;14	`` The area of northern Greece has an enormous opportunity to become a major transport , telecommunications and economic center of this region , that would include the countries of the southern Balkans , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0172;1	In a statement in the EU Official Journal , it said Chanel has agreed , among others , to drop plans to grant retailers `` exclusive '' market rights .
APW_ENG_19941201.0172;2	Under EU rules , Chanel 's competitors have a month to comment on the Commission 's decision .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;0	Svetla Dimitrova , the European champion in the 100-meter hurdles , has been suspended by the Bulgarian Athletics Federation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;1	Federation chairman Plamen Krastev said Thursday that Dimitrova was sanctioned because she had left Bulgaria for Austria without leaving the federation an address where she could be reached .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;2	Austrian track officials said they had seen Dimitrova training in Vienna several weeks ago but had no other details on her whereabouts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;3	`` We are sending a message to the International Amateur Athletic Federation that Dimitrova is suspended , '' Krastev said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;4	`` According to IAAF rules , we have to know at any moment the place where our athletes can be reached . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;5	IAAF spokesman Christopher Winner said the Bulgarians appeared to be referring to an IAAF `` guideline '' which recommends that a national federation know the whereabouts of an athlete for possible random drug tests .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;6	`` The IAAF is not involved in what appears to be an internal disagreement between the federation and the athlete , '' Winner said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;7	Krastev said Dimitrova , 24 , is in the process of getting divorced from her trainer , Ilian Pishtikov .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;8	Pishtikov told Bulgarian newspapers that Dimitrova had been enticed to go to Vienna by her Austrian manager , Harald Edletzberger .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;9	Several years ago , Edletzberger invited another Bulgarian top athlete , Lyudmila Ninova , who left Bulgaria and now lives in Austria .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;10	`` This man -LRB- Edletzberger -RRB- is trying to make money from the results of our years-long hard training , '' Pishtikov said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;11	`` The Bulgarian Athletics Federation has informed the IAAF that it does n't want any more its athletes to be represented by Harald Edletzberger , '' Krastev said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0173;12	Dimitrova won seven races on the Mobil Grand Prix circuit this year and finished second in the overall standings behind Jackie Joyner-Kersee of the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;0	A Russian ultimatum demanding an end to Chechnya 's civil war expired early Thursday amid signs that Moscow was preparing to send troops into the breakaway southern republic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;1	A trickle of heavily loaded cars and trucks left the capital as nervous civilians continued to head for the countryside , fearing an attack by Russian soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;2	Central Grozny was virtually empty following another nerve-jangling night of intermittent small arms fire from jumpy fighters around the city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;3	A single military jet roared over the capital as the Russian deadline passed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;4	Later , heavy machine-gun fire rang out from the city center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;5	The fighting pits forces loyal to Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev , who has declared Chechnya independent from Russia , against rebels who Dudayev says are armed and led by Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;6	President Boris Yeltsin ordered warring Chechens to lay down their arms and release all prisoners by Thursday morning or face Russian military intervention .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;7	Chechens have defied the ultimatum .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;8	In Freedom Square outside the presidential building , several hundred volunteer fighters cradling Kalashnikov rifles and grenade launchers gathered to hear speeches while a tank maneuvered into position .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;9	Chechen elders in tall fur hats , tunics and high leather boots , danced in a circle , chanting , `` Freedom or death ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;10	Russian media reported troop movements around the borders of Chechnya , in the Caucasus Mountains region of southern Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;11	The Interfax and ITAR-Tass news agencies said Russian army units would support Interior Ministry forces to `` ensure stability in the region , safety of the population and avert the spread of the conflict . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;12	The conflict is the latest to underline the tensions among scores of ethnic groups in the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;13	The Caucasus region has been especially fractious , with fighting in the Ossetian and Abkhazian regions of Georgia and the Nagorno-Karabakh region of Azerbaijan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;14	For Moscow , which governs dozens of republics and regions in the Russian Federation , Chechnya has become a test of whether it is willing to use military might to hold the country together .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;15	No other region has gone as far as Chechnya and declared independence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;16	Moscow openly supports Dudayev 's opponents politically , but denies offering military assistance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;17	After Dudayev 's forces captured Russian fighters Saturday , Moscow said mercenaries were fighting on both sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;18	In Moscow , Yeltsin spokesman Vyacheslev Kostikov said Moscow had begun `` a series of measures '' to resolve the crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;19	`` All necessary measures are being taken to save the Russian soldiers , '' he said , referring to those captured on Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;20	He did not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;21	Most of those fleeing Grozny went only a few kilometers -LRB- miles -RRB- to stay with relatives in the countryside .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;22	`` Already , the majority of people have left the city , '' said 43-year-old Lyuba Ishkirchira , a Russian woman married to an ethnic Bashkir .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;23	`` I have no relatives to go to , and my father and mother are ill here -- I can not leave them . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;24	Grozny 's central bazaar , which once thronged with thousands of people , was nearly empty on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;25	A few old women trudged through the mud and wet leaves in search of bread .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;26	Although the Chechens are fighting among themselves , many agreed that they have one thing in common : Distrust of Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;27	`` I do n't like the opposition or Dudayev , but I 'll fight the Russians , '' said one restaurant owner who refused to give his name .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;28	Wrapped in an old leather coat and a thick , gray scarf , a 60-year-old Chechen woman walking among the bazaar 's empty stalls said Russia would have a tough time trying to overrun Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0174;29	`` Whoever fights the Muslims never wins , '' Tamara Ofsayeva said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0175;1	As Deportivo de La Coruna and Barcelona prepare for a titans ' battle Saturday , their respective Brazilian aces are ailing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;2	The match is vital for both teams .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;3	Deportivo , with 18 points , lies behind leader Real Madrid on goal difference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;4	Barcelona , the four-year defending champion , is two points back at No. 4 and still smarting from its first defeat at home in 10 months against Sevilla last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;5	That result followed the humiliating defeat by Turkey 's Galatasaray in European Champions League play which left Barcelona 's path to the cup 's quarterfinals in danger .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;6	Both Deportivo and Barcelona place much stock in their respective Brazilian World Cup aces , Bebeto and Romario .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;7	But on Saturday Deportivo at least will be without its top striker who was Wednesday ordered to stay indoors for at least two weeks while antibiotics work on a chest cold .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;8	The news was welcomed by Barcelona goalkeeper Carlos Busquets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;9	`` Bebeto is a magnificent player and it 's one less problem for us , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;10	But while Barcelona 's star Romario is likely to be physically fit for the game , he told a Brazilian daily this week that life at the top is wasting him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;11	`` It 's now that I 'm feeling the pressure of the responsibility I took on in the U.S. -LRB- World Cup -RRB- , '' Romario told the Journal de Brasil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;12	`` I promised to win a fourth world title for Brazil and that brought a lot of pressure on me .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;13	I 'm stressed out . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;14	`` The worst part is that there 's nothing I can do ... my hair is falling out non-stop , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;15	Romario , the league 's top scorer last season with 30 goals , has only managed to score three in 12 rounds so far , nine less than he had at the same point last season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;16	But under stress or not , Romario like his other teammates still had to endure a training session Wednesday reported to have been the longest and most excruciating since coach Johan Cruyff took over Barcelona .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;17	Cruyff is undoubtedly aware that although it is early days yet a defeat Saturday could allow Real Madrid and Deportivo to steal ahead and seriously impair Barcelona 's chances of winning a fifth title .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;18	Madrid on Saturday travels north to play a Real Sociedad struggling at No. 17 in the 20-team division and still recovering from the sacking of long-time coach Welshman John Toshack last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;19	While Madrid 's three defeats so far this season have been in away games , Sociedad has only managed to win one game at home out of six .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;20	One club likely to be hoping Madrid , Deportivo and Barcelona all trip up is No. 3 Zaragoza which lies a point behind the leaders going into its bout Sunday against No. 12 Sporting de Gijon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;21	Saturday sees two other first division games with Athletic de Bilbao traveling to Atletico de Madrid and Valencia hosting Albacete .
APW_ENG_19941201.0175;22	Other 13th-round games Sunday are : Oviedo-Betis ; Valladolid-Celta ; Tenerife-Logrones ; Compostela-Racing de Santander and Sevilla-Espanol .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;0	Russian prisons are inhuman and torturous , with underfed inmates crammed into stinking , standing-room-only cells , a U.N. report said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;1	It said conditions in pre-trial remand centers -- where first time offenders accused of petty crimes may wait for five years for a court appearance -- were even worse than labor camps for hardened convicts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;2	`` The oppressive heat , lack of oxygen , and the odors of sweat , excrement and disease created by gross overcrowding are overpowering , '' said Nigel Rodley , the author of the report and the U.N. 's special investigator on torture .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;3	At the invitation of the Russian government , Rodley spent two weeks in the Moscow and St. Petersburg area in summer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;4	He visited four remand centers , two police headquarters , one labor camp , one juvenile center and one hospital for seriously ill prisoners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;5	The Russian government estimates there are 500,000 prisoners in about 528 prisons and penal colonies throughout the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;6	Russia has the highest rate of detentions in the world , above the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;7	Rodley , a British human rights expert , said the rocketing crime rate following the end of Communist control had worsened acute overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;8	He criticized Russian authorities for trying to respond to public concern about crime by throwing petty offenders into jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;9	He recommended that President Boris Yeltsin should issue a presidential decree to release 71,000 non-violent , first-time offenders to try to ease the overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;10	`` It 's a radical proposal because it 's a radical problem which needs to be addressed urgently , '' Rodley told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;11	He said beatings and maltreatment were widespread .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;12	Rodley said even reading accounts of atrocious conditions did not prepare him for the appalling reality .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;13	`` The conditions are cruel , inhuman and degrading ; they are torturous , '' he wrote about cells in Moscow 's notorious Butryskaya prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;14	`` There is virtually no daylight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;15	There is insufficient room for everyone to lie down , sit down or even stand up at the same time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;16	Butryrskaya prison was constructed in 1771 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;17	There has been very little refurbishment since then .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;18	Built for 3,500 prisoners , it now holds 6,300 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;19	`` The food , not always available because of the indebtedness of the institutions -- is primitive , of a fat-saturated soupy nature .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;20	It is consumed in the cell and is excreted in the cell , '' the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;21	In another Moscow detention center , Matrosskaya Tishina No. 1 , conditions in quarantine cells for sick prisoners were atrocious .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;22	`` Despite the fact that several of the inmates had open , festering sores , severe fungal infections with decaying flesh , and extensive rashes , they reported that they had not seen a doctor in over a week , '' Rodley wrote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;23	He said conditions at a high-security labor camp he visited were better than those in the pre-trial remand centers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;24	He said the main problem seemed to be boredom among inmates because the economic crisis meant factories on the camp were not operational .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;25	He said a labor colony for young criminals he visited was humanely run .
APW_ENG_19941201.0176;26	However , he was surprised to find 15 and 16 year-olds there sentenced to several years for stealing a bicycle or computer fraud .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;0	A team from the International Monetary Fund arrived in Cairo on Thursday to evaluate Egypt 's progress in implementing its economic reform program .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;1	Relations between Egypt and the Washington-headquartered organization have been strained over IMF demands that Egypt devalue its currency and lower interest rates to boost economic growth .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;2	The government -- backed by many in the business community -- opposes devaluation , saying it will damage the nation 's already troubled export effort and worsen inflation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;3	The pound currently is trading at about 3.38 to the dollar , and consumer prices have been rising despite efforts to hold inflation below 10 percent this year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;4	Sources close to the talks said they expected the IMF team to put the contentious issues aside for the time being and concentrate on structural problems , such as Egypt 's export policies , customs regulations , tax system , and anti-inflation program .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;5	The team , headed by IMF Associate Director Saleh Nasouli , is to stay until Dec. 19 to review the extended credit facility approved in 1991 , IMF officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;6	The disagreement has held up action by the so-called Paris Club of Western donor nations , which has pledged to write off some dlrs 4 billion of Egyptian debt once the nation has fulfilled its promises to the IMF .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;7	The debt write-off had been expected in June 1994 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;8	The delay is costing Egypt some dlrs 350 million a year in interest payments , analysts say .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;9	Egypt also is at odds with the World Bank over the slow speed of privatizing dozens of government-owned companies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0177;10	Some 314 companies have been reorganized under holding companies to prepare them for sale , but only a handful have been sold .

APW_ENG_19941201.0181;0	Fed up with bogus bomb threats against schools , Moscow teachers threatened to hold classes on weekends or even holidays to make up for every lesson lost to pranks , a daily newspaper said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0181;1	Seven high schools in the Russian capital had to close Tuesday while police searched for explosive devices allegedly planted on their premises , Moskovsky Komsomolets reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0181;2	No bombs were found .
APW_ENG_19941201.0181;3	With bombs exploding in Moscow almost every day , police so far have taken phone calls about bombs at schools seriously .
APW_ENG_19941201.0181;4	But their patience is running thin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0181;5	Some officers say they waste time searching through school premises since no bomb threat has ever turned out to be real , the newspaper said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0184;1	Hisamori Tomita , executive manager of Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. , was arrested Oct. 4 for allegedly taking a bribe of almost 200 million yen -LRB- dlrs 2 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;2	NTT spokesman Tetsuro Nagai said Tomita has been fired .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;3	His trial has not started yet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;4	Nagai said the pay of NTT president Masashi Kojima will be cut by 20 percent for December through February , and that of chairman Haruo Yamaguchi and three other executives by 10 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;5	He did not disclose their present monthly pay .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;6	Meanwhile , he said , NTT will set up a system for double-checking purchasing contracts and the amount of money that department heads can approve will be reduced from the present 1 billion yen to 30 million yen -LRB- dlrs 10 million to dlrs 300,000 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;7	In 1989 , then NTT chairman Hisashi Shinto was arrested on bribery charges for receiving unlisted shares of Recruit Cosmos and quickly selling them for a profit when the stock was listed on the market .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;8	Shinto denied any special favors for Recruit Co. , an information services conglomerate , but he was given a two-year suspended sentence and a fine of 22.7 million yen -LRB- dlrs 227,000 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0184;9	At that time , the pay of six executives including then president Yamaguchi was cut by 15 to 20 percent for six months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;0	Pope John Paul II repeated his desire to visit Israeli during a meeting Thursday with Foreign Minister Shimon Peres , but he again declined to commit himself to a date , Vatican officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;1	The pope and Peres met for 30 minutes , with the Israeli renewing a long-standing invitation for a visit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;2	A Vatican statement said they discussed issues linked to the Middle East peace process , including relations with Palestinians , Lebanon and the '' future '' of Jerusalem .
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;3	On Jerusalem , a city holy to Jews , Christians and Muslims , the Vatican has insisted that access to religious sites be assured through international guarantees .
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;4	In a television interview broadcast by an Italian religious station earlier this week , Peres re-affirmed the Israeli position that Jerusalem will always be Israel 's capital and that politically the issue was closed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;5	But Peres said '' if we are talking about religious issues , we are ready to listen . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0185;6	Earlier , Peres presented his book '' The New Middle East , '' which has come out in Italian , to an audience of Italians and Israeli officials .

APW_ENG_19941201.0188;0	Argentina 's Velez Sarsfield , capitalizing on two crucial second-half blunders to teach soccer powerhouse AC Milan that fame and experience do n't always count , won the Intercontinental Cup 2-0 Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;1	`` We are n't a very well-known team yet , but it 's not the past that matters , '' Velez coach Carlos Bianchi said after winning the match to decide the world 's top club .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;2	`` It 's the present , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;3	`` We proved we are a team that deserves this honor . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;4	Captain Roberto Luis Trotta booted in a penalty kick to put Velez ahead 1-0 in the 50th minute after Milan defender Alessandro Costacurta fouled forward Omar Andres Asad in the box .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;5	Milan keeper Sebastiano Rossi then picked up a yellow card for bickering with the referee .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;6	Asad came back with a goal of his own seven minutes later , intercepting a back pass Milan 's Franco Baresi intended for goalie Rossi and slamming it into the net before nearly 48,000 spectators at Tokyo 's National stadium .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;7	`` I ca n't believe we lost , '' said Milan coach Fabio Capello .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;8	`` But the team that makes mistakes loses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;9	That 's soccer . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;10	Both sides played a cautious but rough first half marked by three yellow cards .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;11	Milan 's Montenegrin midfielder Dejan Savicevic , nursing an injured leg , got off a shot just 1:30 into the game , but Milan had only two other shots in the half .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;12	Velez , which had difficulty breaking Milan 's control of the midfield , had only one serious shot on the goal in the first 45 minutes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;13	Forwards Asad and Jose Oscar Flores , however , provided some excitement with dangerous breaks down the sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;14	`` Not very many of our players have experience in the big international games like this , so we were very nervous , '' said Asad .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;15	`` But we got over that as the game went on . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;16	Milan tried to battle back after giving up the two second-half goals , but was unable to turn its several deftly created shooting opportunities into goals .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;17	Milan outshot Velez 11-6 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;18	Thursday 's loss was especially disappointing for Milan , which has almost made Tokyo a second home .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;19	The Italians represented Europe in the cup for the fifth time last year , narrowly losing to Brazil 's Sao Paulo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;20	Milan has won the Intercontinental Cup , held here since 1980 as the Toyota Cup , three times -- in 1969 , 1989 and 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;21	Milan established itself as one of the world 's top teams under coach Arrigo Sacchi in 1988 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;22	Since then , the team has won , along with the two Intercontinental Cup titles , four league titles , three Champions Cups and two European SuperCups .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;23	But it has been struggling through this season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;24	Milan has already been eliminated from the Italian Cup and is on the brink of being knocked from the Champions League .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;25	The young Argentinian team -- their starters ' average age was 25 compared with 29 for Milan -- currently co-leads its domestic league with River Plate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;26	It defeated Sao Paulo in the Liberators ' Cup in August to win its berth in Thursday 's game .
APW_ENG_19941201.0188;27	`` I think this will be one of the games that I look back on after I retire , '' said Velez midfielder Roberto Fabian Pompei .

APW_ENG_19941201.0189;0	Aetna International Inc. 's application to form a joint venture insurance company in China is still pending , but Aetna President Michael A. Stephen was optimistic that his company would enter the Chinese market .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;1	Aetna International , a part of Aetna Life and Casualty of the United States , applied in May to form a Shanghai joint venture insurance company with China Pacific Insurance Co.
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;2	If approved , Aetna would become only the third foreign insurer allowed an operating presence in China .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;3	Stephen said Thursday he has not been given any indication of the application 's fate , but added that he was `` basically optimistic '' about his company 's prospects in the world 's most populous nation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;4	`` We 're continuing to be patient and to build relationships as we position ourselves to be active players when the markets open up , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;5	Both Stephen and Douglas Henck , senior vice president for Asia Pacific operations at Aetna International , felt Chinese authorities understood the need to reform and open the country 's financial services sector but still were gathering information before making a decisive move .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;6	`` If China wants to play a full role in the world , it has to reform several of its industries and the financial services industry is one , '' said Stephen .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;7	The People 's Insurance Co. of China now has a 98 percent share of China 's insurance market .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;8	Neither of the Aetna executives saw the opening of financial markets as a threat to the Chinese company .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;9	While it might lose market share to foreign companies or joint ventures , the total market will grow and PICC 's revenues will increase , they said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;10	In Taiwan , Stephen said , Aetna became the first foreign company to receive an unrestricted license to sell life insurance in 1987 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;11	Although the major Taiwanese life insurer lost about 5 percentage points of its then 60 percent market share , it benefited along with Aetna from overall market growth , he added .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;12	`` It 's important to remember that Asian insurance markets are n't mature , '' said Stephen .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;13	Unlike the U.S. or some European markets , Asian countries still have plenty of room for expansion , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;14	Another possibility is the privatization of state pension funds , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0189;15	Although Chinese officials did n't indicate they were contemplating such a move , Stephen said he thought this was an area in which Aetna 's expertise could make a real contribution to China 's welfare .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;0	Australia 's devastating drought will cut economic growth by nearly 1 percent , bump up food prices and more than halve production of winter crops , a top official said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;1	Primary Industries Minister Bob Collins also delivered more bad news for farmers , saying there was little chance the drought would break this summer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;2	The drought will cause national income to fall by dlrs 2.9 billion -LRB- dlrs US 2.2 billion -RRB- this year , equivalent to a 0.7 percent drop in economic growth , now running at more than 6 percent a year , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;3	Winter crop yields are expected to plummet by 54 percent to 13 million tons .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;4	Earlier forecasts had predicted a 40 percent reduction to around 17 million tons .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;5	Wheat production is expected to drop by more than 50 percent to its lowest level since 1972 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0191;6	`` These figures provide a stark illustration of the economic impact of this drought and I regret to say it shows no sign of breaking , '' Collins told Parliament .

APW_ENG_19941201.0192;1	The first meeting was proposed for Wednesday in Belfast , but the time and location has not been set , said a spokesman at Prime Minister John Major 's office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;2	The announcement came three months to the day after the IRA began observing a cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;3	That cease-fire has been marred only by the murder of a postal worker in a robbery carried out by IRA members on Nov. 10 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;4	British officials have said they will be pressing for a surrender of IRA weapons , but Sinn Fein argues that this is impossible before reaching an overall political settlement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;5	`` How we will take the gun out of Irish politics is by bringing forward agreement on political structures , '' said Sinn Fein 's Northern Ireland chairman , Mitchel McLaughlin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;6	`` Those who are talking surrender terms are being unrealistic , and I think are playing dangerous games with what is a genuine opportunity for peace in Ireland . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;7	But John Taylor , a member of the Ulster Unionist Party , Northern Ireland 's largest party , said : `` No one can enter into meaningful political talks , and carry the threat of renewed violence under the table . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;8	Britain will be represented by Quentin Thomas , an official in the Northern Ireland Office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;9	Sinn Fein said Martin McGuinness , the party 's second-ranking leader , will head its delegation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;10	Sinn Fein president Gerry Adams will be in Washington next week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;11	The White House announced Wednesday that Adams would meet with National Security Adviser Anthony Lake , the highest level of contact accorded to Adams in the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;12	Major 's spokesman , who spoke on condition of anonymity , said Britain had not changed its mind about excluding Sinn Fein from an investment conference in Belfast , despite pressure from American politicians to the contrary .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;13	On Wednesday , Adams and John Hume , Northern Ireland 's most respected politician , issued a statement pressing Britain to begin talking with Sinn Fein .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;14	`` There should be no more stalling , '' they said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;15	A series of meetings and joint statements last year by Adams and Hume , leader of the Catholic-based Social Democratic and Labor Party , helped pave the way for the IRA 's open-ended truce .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;16	Britain has refused to invite Sinn Fein officials to the foreign investment forum in Belfast on Dec. 13-14 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;17	President Clinton plans to send Commerce Secretary Ron Brown at the head of a U.S. delegation , but a congressmen visiting Ireland says Clinton should rethink that if Britain keeps shunning Sinn Fein .
APW_ENG_19941201.0192;18	`` Everyone seems to be acting in good faith except the British , '' U.S. Rep. Peter King -LRB- R-N.Y. -RRB- , said Wednesday in Dublin , the Irish capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;0	Former heavyweight champion Evander Holyfield , who hopes to fight again despite being on the medical suspension list because of a heart problem , has fired his manager .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;1	Shelly Finkel , who has been in Holyfield 's camp since 1984 and at the forefront since Holyfield fired business manager Ken Sanders in 1991 , received a termination letter Monday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;2	Finkel , who still manages a handful of fighters , most notably Pernell Whitaker , said Wednesday he was neither surprised nor bitter about the split , although he said the manner in which the firing was handled was unusual .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;3	`` The letter basically said , ` I wo n't be using your services .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;4	You 've been a great manager and a real good friend , ' and had all these compliments , '' Finkel said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;5	`` There 's no hard feelings on my part .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;6	I 've seen it coming .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;7	It was n't appropriate -LRB- to continue -RRB- because I 've been against him fighting again .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;8	I 'm sure it caused a gulf between us . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;9	Holyfield could not be reached for comment Wednesday and his spokesman , Ron Bell , declined to comment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0194;10	Holyfield hopes to be removed from boxing 's medical suspension list and licensed by the Nevada State Athletic Commission after recently passing heart tests at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester , Minn.
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;0	Russian prisons are inhuman and torturous , with underfed inmates crammed into stinking , standing-room-only cells , a U.N. report said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;1	It said conditions in pre-trial remand centers -- where first time offenders accused of petty crimes may wait for five years for a court appearance -- were even worse than labor camps for hardened convicts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;2	`` The oppressive heat , lack of oxygen , and the odors of sweat , excrement and disease created by gross overcrowding are overpowering , '' said Nigel Rodley , the author of the report and the U.N. 's special investigator on torture .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;3	At the invitation of the Russian government , Rodley spent two weeks in the Moscow and St. Petersburg area in summer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;4	He visited four remand centers , two police headquarters , one labor camp , one juvenile center and one hospital for seriously ill prisoners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;5	The Russian government estimates there are 500,000 prisoners in about 528 prisons and penal colonies throughout the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;6	Russia has the highest rate of detentions in the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;7	Rodley , a British human rights expert , said the rocketing crime rate following the end of Communist control had worsened acute overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;8	He criticized Russian authorities for trying to respond to public concern about crime by throwing petty offenders into jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;9	He recommended that President Boris Yeltsin should issue a presidential decree to release 71,000 non-violent , first-time offenders to try to ease the overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;10	`` It 's a radical proposal because it 's a radical problem which needs to be addressed urgently , '' Rodley told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;11	He said beatings and maltreatment were widespread .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;12	Rodley said even reading accounts of atrocious conditions did not prepare him for the appalling reality .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;13	`` The conditions are cruel , inhuman and degrading ; they are torturous , '' he wrote about cells in Moscow 's notorious Butryskaya prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;14	`` There is virtually no daylight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;15	There is insufficient room for everyone to lie down , sit down or even stand up at the same time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;16	Butryrskaya prison was constructed in 1771 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;17	There has been very little refurbishment since then .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;18	Built for 3,500 prisoners , it now holds 6,300 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;19	`` The food , not always available because of the indebtedness of the institutions -- is primitive , of a fat-saturated soupy nature .
APW_ENG_19941201.0195;20	It is consumed in the cell and is excreted in the cell , '' the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;0	The number of Americans filing the first time for state unemployment benefits dropped last week to the lowest level in two months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;1	The Labor Department reported Thursday that initial jobless claims totaled a seasonally adjusted 317,000 in the week ended Nov. 26 , the smallest number since Sept. 24 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;2	Initial claims dropped 12,000 from 329,000 in the previous week , the biggest decrease since July 30 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;3	That figure was revised upward from the 326,000 initially reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;4	The same report showed the four-week moving average of jobless claims declining for the first time in eight weeks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;5	The average was 326,250 , down 1,250 from the previous week 's revised 327,500 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;6	The initial report , released last week , put the figure at 326,750 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;7	The four-week average had not declined since Oct. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;8	Many analysts consider the four-week average a better indicator of hiring trends than the weekly number because it smooths out weekly fluctuations and is less volatile .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;9	The most reliable indicator , the monthly employment report showing hiring levels for November , is scheduled for release Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;10	Last month , unemployment dipped to a four-year low and hourly wages rose at the fastest pace in 11 years , among the factors that prompted the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates for a sixth time this year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;11	The October jobless rate was 5.8 percent , down from 5.9 percent a month earlier .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;12	Most economists expect the same number for November .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;13	An increase in the number of initial claims was reported in 48 states and territories in the week ended Nov. 19 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;14	Four reported decreases , while the number was unchanged in one .
APW_ENG_19941201.0196;15	State figures are reported a week behind the national ones .

APW_ENG_19941201.0198;0	The government has protested to the producers of a U.S. television comedy over what it called racist and sexist remarks about Filipino women .
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;1	The Department of Foreign Affairs said Thursday it objected to a line in the show `` Frasier '' where a co-star says his wife is getting a face lift for dlrs 25,000 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;2	The co-star 's father replies : `` For an extra five grand -LRB- dlrs 5,000 -RRB- you can get a whole new wife from the Philippines . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;3	`` Our people are not chattel , '' the department quoted Raul Rabe , the Philippines ' ambassador in Washington , as saying in a letter to David Angel , Peter Casey , David Lee and Cris Floyd , the Los Angeles-based executive producers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;4	He urged them to `` exert all effort to ensure that this particular feature is not inflicted upon your viewers . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;5	Portions of the show featuring the controversial line had been shown in promotional previews , the department said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;6	It aired in the United States on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;7	Rabe said the reference to Filipino women `` is not only unfair to a people who have done so much for the United States as its oldest ally in Asia , it diminishes the significant contributions that the large economically upscale Filipino-American community has made to the very fabric of this -LRB- American -RRB- nation . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;8	In a separate protest letter to KNBC-Channel 4 in Los Angeles , the Philippine Consulate there said a Philippine law passed in 1991 bans the mail-order bride business and other similar practices .
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;9	It said the episode shows the `` insensitivity and ignorance '' of the writers and `` perpetuates the kind of blindly negative stereotyping of other peoples and cultures reminiscent of a less enlightened period in American television and media . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0198;10	A dispatcher at KNBC before business hours Thursday said no one was available for comment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;0	NATO foreign ministers on Thursday approved an American proposal to draw up a blueprint setting out conditions for the entry of former Warsaw Pact foes as new members in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;1	The ministers endorsed a 12-month study to consider how to expand the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include Central and East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;2	Issues will include financing , integrating the newcomers ' armies and nuclear issues , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;3	Anxious to ease Russian fears about the expansion , the foreign ministers emphasized the alliance was not trying to create a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;4	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in a draft of their final communique .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;5	The plan to open up to the East was planned as the centerpiece of the two-day meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;6	But the unprecedented strains between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia overshadowed the talks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;7	In an effort to heal the divisions , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher was expected to tell the allies the Clinton administration has swung behind their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the Bosnian conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;8	That marks a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the Europeans , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;9	Seeking to mend fences , Christopher told the allies :
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;10	`` Let me stress one important fact : The crisis in Bosnia is about Bosnia and the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;11	It does not diminish NATO 's enduring importance . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;12	The deep splits within the alliance were highlighted by a letter from Germany 's ambassador to NATO that accused the United States of sowing mistrust among the allies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;13	The letter from Ambassador Hermann von Richthofen accused the United States of acting behind the backs of its allies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;14	`` The alliance is divided and in crisis , '' concluded Richthofen 's cable to his Foreign Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;15	The letter was leaked to a leading German newspaper , the Suddeutsche Zeitung , which published extracts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;16	Opening the meeting , Willy Claes , the new NATO secretary-general , appealed for unity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;17	`` We are now being put to -LRB- the -RRB- test , and I have every confidence that our solidarity will see us through . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;18	The foreign ministers are anxious their talks not be entirely hijacked by the Bosnian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;19	They ordered a study that would set out the terms for the acceptance of East European countries as new members .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;20	It should be ready when the ministers meet in Brussels a year from now .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;21	The United States had initially proposed a six-month study of enlargement , but the Europeans , mindful of Russia 's fears of isolation , extended it to 12 months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;22	`` We should avoid premature enlargement that gives the impression that we seek a redivision of the European continent , '' said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe , according to a spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;23	The study will not name candidates for membership -- although Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners -- nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;24	`` It is premature to discuss the timeframe for enlargement or which particular countries would be invited to join the alliance , '' the draft communique said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;25	Instead , the study will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;26	To counter Russian worries about NATO 's eastward expansion , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Moscow and agree to hold regular talks on security .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;27	Despite attempts to keep the focus on new members , the Bosnian crisis was taking a large amount of the ministers ' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;28	On Friday , Christopher will meet here with his counterparts from France , Germany , Britain and Russia to discuss new plans to revive their moribund peace plan for Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;29	British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd said he may go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , this weekend .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;30	Officials said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe may join him for talks with the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;31	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that may allow Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;32	That plan requires them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;33	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;34	France and Britain have been criticized in the U.S. Congress for refusing to let the United Nations use the Western military alliance 's air power to the full .
APW_ENG_19941201.0199;35	In turn , Congress has forced the Clinton administration to seek a lifting of the arms embargo against Bosnia 's Muslim-led government , something the European NATO allies oppose for fear it would escalate the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;0	The Association of Southeast Asian Nations has decided to accept Vietnam as its seventh member , officials at the organization 's Secretariat said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;1	The Secretariat 's foreign office in Jakarta , Indonesia , confirmed the decision after the Vietnamese government said it expected to enter ASEAN next year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;2	Vietnam has long sought membership in anticipation of trade and investment benefits from closer ties to the more developed ASEAN economies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;3	Earlier Thursday , a Vietnamese Foreign Ministry spokesman , Ngo Van Hoa , told a news conference that ASEAN Secretary-General Ajit Singh announced the decision in a recent interview with a Malaysian newspaper , the Star .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;4	Asked if Vietnam had received any direct notification of the decision from ASEAN , Hoa only smiled and said , `` I am asking you to read between the lines . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;5	But he indicated that Vietnam regards the decision as official and final .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;6	Again quoting the Star , he said ASEAN officials made the decision at a meeting in Brunei Nov. 3-5 , with the actual admission to take place next July when ASEAN foreign ministers hold their regular meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;7	Vietnam hopes for economic benefits from membership , but its admission also would dramatize the extent to which former Cold War divisions have melted away in the region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;8	ASEAN was formed in 1967 at the height of the Cold War as a buffer against the spread of communism in Asia , represented by Vietnam and China .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;9	It has become influential and active only in recent years since shifting its focus more heavily to economic cooperation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0200;10	The current members are Brunei , Indonesia , Malaysia , the Philippines , Singapore and Thailand .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;0	Americans ' income surged 1.4 percent in October , the ninth straight increase and the biggest jump in eight months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;1	The Commerce Department also reported Thursay that spending rose 0.7 percent in October , the strongest showing since it advanced 0.9 percent in August .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;2	Disposable income -- income after taxes -- also climbed 1.4 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;3	The overall income gain was the largest since it rose 1.7 percent in February .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;4	Income last fell in January , when it slipped 0.6 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;5	The increases reported Thursday for both income and spending were higher than many analysts predicted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;6	In September , personal income increased 0.6 percent and spending rose just 0.2 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;7	Consumer spending , which accounts for two-thirds of the nation 's gross domestic product , was up for the sixth straight month and eight of the last nine .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;8	The combination of incomes and spending meant that Americans ' savings rate -- savings as a percentage of disposable income -- climbed to 4.7 percent in October , from 4.1 percent the previous month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0201;9	The savings rate was the highest since April 1993 when it was 5 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;0	Flashy dressing is all right in the Senate , but men must wear a jacket and definitely should n't wear women 's clothes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;1	That was the message delivered Thursday night to Sen. Jim McKiernan , who turned up for a legislative session wearing a woman 's jacket .
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;2	During one of many votes on a package of bills relating to the world trade organization , McKiernan , who is noted for his flashy sartorial sense and his colorful ties , entered the chamber without a jacket .
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;3	The move sparked a mild and friendly reprimand from the temporary chairman of committees , Sen. Grant Chapman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;4	McKiernan accepted the rebuke and was wearing a jacket when he returned for the next vote , but he appeared to have it wrong again .
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;5	`` While I appreciate Senator McKiernan 's efforts to find a jacket , I would appreciate if he could find a male jacket before the next division , '' Chapman said to cries of `` Hear , hear ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0202;6	McKiernan protested , and said there was nothing in the Senate rules related to the color or `` gender '' of the jacket a senator may wear .

APW_ENG_19941201.0203;0	Fighting broke out again overnight around a U.N. `` safe area '' in northwest Bosnia , after it became clear that the peace mission by U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali had failed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;1	Unfazed by the prospect of a complete withdrawal of all peacekeepers , Bosnia 's rebel Serbs refused even to meet with the U.N. chief to discuss a nationwide cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;2	Maj. Herve Gourmelon , a U.N. spokesman , said heavy machine-gun and small-arms fire erupted late Wednesday around the town of Bihac , where the Muslim-led government is trying to hold off rebel Serb forces .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;3	Fighting continued early today , along with some shelling .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;4	The Bosnian army commander , Gen. Rasim Delic , pledged that despite recent heavy losses , Bihac would not fall into Serb hands and the government army would win the war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;5	His comments , published in a Sarajevo newspaper today , underscored the government 's unwillingness to compromise further to reach a cease-fire and a comprehensive peace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;6	In Brussels , Belgium , Secretary of State Warren Christopher told NATO allies that the Clinton administration now agrees with its European allies that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;7	Christopher and Douglas Hurd , the British foreign secretary , said they may go to Belgrade , the Yugoslav capital , this weekend to preach reconciliation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;8	`` We will redouble our efforts to find a diplomatic solution , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;9	At a breakfast with Hurd , Christopher reviewed the warning U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali delivered Wednesday that unless warring Serbs and Muslims cooperate with the U.N. mission , the peacekeepers might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;10	The threat reflects a growing frustration as the Serbs continue their assaults and the government refuses new concessions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;11	More than 350 peacekeepers are still being held hostage and the West is divided about how to respond .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;12	Boutros-Ghali said he will not recommend a pullout `` for the time being . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;13	But he said `` it will become impossible '' to sustain support for the peacekeepers in the Security Council unless the Serbs and the government agree to talk peace and cooperate with the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;14	In New York , French U.N. Ambassador Jean-Bernard Merimee said `` there is no question '' of a withdrawal now , `` but if the situation continues to deteriorate , it will be more difficult to keep the troops there . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;15	A withdrawal by peacekeepers would likely lead to more fighting and could be dangerous for the departing troops , as both Bosnian Serbs and government forces rush U.N. camps to seize equipment before it can be destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;16	It also would cause widespread hardship because the United Nations feeds an estimated 3 million people across the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;17	Most are in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;18	More than 200,000 people are dead or missing in the 2 -LCB- - year conflict launched by Serbs after Bosnia 's Muslim-Croat majority voted to declare independence from Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;19	Serbs have rejected a peace plan that would reduce their war-won land holdings to 49 percent from about 70 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;20	Boutros-Ghali 's visit followed admissions from top U.S. and NATO officials that they ca n't force a solution to the conflict without a huge ground force no one is willing to provide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;21	As insurance against further NATO bombings , Serbs have taken more than 400 U.N. soldiers hostage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;22	Forty-five Britons were released Wednesday , but some Canadian , French , Russian and Ukrainian peacekeepers have been held now for a week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0203;23	More than 100 Dutch troops have been held hostage since Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;0	Lowry Nelson Jr. , a former professor of comparative literature at Yale University , died following surgery in Tallinn , where he was doing research .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;1	Nelson , who lived in Bethany , Conn. , died Nov. 12 , the New Haven -LRB- Conn. -RRB- Register reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;2	The cause was thromboembolism , according to The New York Times .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;3	Nelson was instrumental in forming the Comparative Literature Department at Yale .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;4	Before retiring in June after 31 years at Yale , he published and edited several books on poetry and literary theory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;5	He received his doctorate from Yale in 1961 , and taught at Harvard and the University of California at Los Angeles before returning to Yale in 1963 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;6	Nelson was born in Provo , Utah , on May 21 , 1926 , and received a bachelor 's degree from Harvard in 1947 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;7	He is survived by two sisters , Ann Nelson of Charlotte , N.C. , and Janet Nelson Friedell of Lexington , Ky.
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;8	Services were held in Kentucky and a memorial service is planned at Yale in the spring .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;9	The Times said Nelson was in Estonia doing research on the Russian Symbolist poet Vyacheslav Ivanov .
APW_ENG_19941201.0204;10	He specialized in literature from the 13th to the early 20th centuries .

APW_ENG_19941201.0206;1	Dahmer probably was hit a total of four or five times in the head , Columbia County Coroner C. Keith Epps said Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0206;2	The blows that did the most damage were to the right side in the front of the head and to the left side in the back , Epps said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0206;3	Another inmate who was attacked with Dahmer Monday as they cleaned prison bathrooms , Jesse Anderson , died Wednesday after being taken off life support .
APW_ENG_19941201.0206;4	He suffered injuries similar to Dahmer 's , Epps said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0206;5	Dahmer , 34 , had confessed to killing 17 young men and boys , mutilating and sometimes cannibalizing or eating his victims .

APW_ENG_19941201.0207;0	Yasser Arafat 's government on Thursday took charge of tax collection in the West Bank in another step toward expanding Palestinian autonomy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;1	The transfer of the tax authority , and the handover of the health system set for later Thursday , complete the `` early empowerment '' enabling Palestinians to control most aspects of their lives despite continued Israeli occupation in the West Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;2	The PLO , which runs the six-month-old autonomy in the Gaza Strip and West Bank town of Jericho , has in recent months also taken charge of education , tourism and welfare in the West Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;3	`` What we have completed gives the Palestinians a first entrance to the West Bank , '' said West Bank military governor Brig. Gen. Gadi Zohar , signing over the tax department to Palestinian Finance Minister Mohammed Nashashibi .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;4	The move came days before Israel and the PLO were to begin difficult negotiations on stage two of autonomy -- redeployment of Israeli troops in the West Bank and Palestinian elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;5	Israel is concerned the safety of the 120,000 Jewish settlers could not be guaranteed once the army pulled out of Palestinian towns as stipulated in the Israel-PLO accord .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;6	There are calls to renegotiate the agreement , including a proposal Wednesday by Deputy Foreign Minister Yossi Beilin to skip the interim phase altogether and begin talks now on the final status of the West Bank , Gaza Strip and Jerusalem .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;7	This coincides with a growing desire among Israelis for greater separation from the Palestinians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;8	Police Minister Moshe Shahal on Thursday called for a complete closure of the West Bank and Gaza Strip once troops redeploy in the West Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;9	He spoke a day after a West Bank Palestinian axed a 19-year-old woman soldier to death in northern Israel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;10	`` There is no alternative other than to demand separation , '' Shahal said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;11	`` Separation means that we do not have to open the territory out of economic and employment concerns until the Palestinians prove that they can prevent attacks . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;12	A closure would prevent 1.8 million Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza , including tens of thousands of day workers , from entering Israel .

APW_ENG_19941201.0207;14	Palestinian tax officials said Thursday their goal was to make their impoverished autonomy administration self-sufficient .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;15	`` We can not depend for the rest of our lives on the donor countries and the foreign investors in building our Palestinian state , '' said Deputy Finance Minister Atef Alawneh .

APW_ENG_19941201.0207;17	Alawneh said he eventually hoped to raise dlrs 300-400 million annually in taxes , much more than raised by Israel , but the current system needed improvement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;18	`` We are not satisfied with the way taxes are paid in Gaza and Jericho .

APW_ENG_19941201.0207;20	and we did not use the proper ways of convincing '' residents to pay , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;21	During the six-year uprising against Israeli occupation , many Palestinians refused to pay taxes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;22	Israel retaliated by denying tax evaders documents such as drivers ' licenses and travel papers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;23	Soldiers accompanied tax collectors in night raids to confiscate goods from Palestinian homes in lieu of payment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;24	The West Bank town of Beit Zahour staged a collective tax revolt , becoming the target of many such raids .
