APW_ENG_19941201.0207;27	`` We have paid the Israelis enough .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;28	They ripped us off .
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;29	They were thieves with licenses . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0207;30	Alawneh said tax debts going back to the Israeli era would not be forgiven , and only fines and interest would be canceled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;0	Bosnian Serbs detained more peacekeepers , denied resupply convoys and fired missiles at Sarajevo on Thursday in a further challenge to the United Nations ' crumbling bid to keep control .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;1	A day after U.N. chief Boutros Boutros-Ghali 's failed peace mission , defenders and attacking Serbs also traded heavy machine-gun and small-arms fire around embattled Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;2	U.N. spokesman Alexander Ivanko said in Zagreb , Croatia , that Bosnian Serb units had made an incursion across the border into Croatia and kidnapped seven Ukrainian peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;3	They took the soldiers and a U.N. armored carrier into Bosnian Serb-held territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;4	The Ukrainians ' observation point is now occupied by the Serbs , Ivanko said , and the United Nations has not been able to make contact with its troops .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;5	More than 400 other U.N. soldiers are detained by the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;6	In Sarajevo , U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Serbs failed to react to 21 requests for convoy passage through Serb-held territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;7	He said food and fuel supplies for the United Nations were running increasingly short in government-held eastern Bosnian enclaves and in Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;8	Humanitarian convoys were also blocked .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;9	In downtown Sarajevo , two buildings of the Interior Ministry were hit by one and three anti-tank missiles respectively , and four people were wounded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;10	Sarajevo 's airport remained closed because Serbs denied flight clearance , ruling out any relief flights to the besieged Bosnian capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;11	Intransigence by both sides led Boutros-Ghali to suggest for the first time Wednesday that the U.N. peacekeeping mission might have to end .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;12	Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic told Boutros-Ghali that his government would negotiate only after Serbs accepted a peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;13	He reiterated his government 's offer of a three-month cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;14	Serbs want something more permanent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;15	Comments by the Bosnian army commander , Gen. Rasim Delic to the Sarajevo daily Oslobodjenje underscored the government 's unwillingness to compromise further .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;16	He said Bihac would not fall , and that the Bosnian army eventually would win the war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;17	Bosnian Serbs snubbed Boutros-Ghali altogether .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;18	Their leader , Radovan Karadzic , refused to come to the Sarajevo airport to meet him , and Boutros-Ghali rejected entering Serb-held territory for the meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;19	But the U.N. chief executive will be in Geneva Friday through Sunday to `` continue his intensive diplomatic efforts for a peaceful solution , especially for a cease-fire '' in Bosnia , his spokeswoman Therese Gastaut said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;20	Maj. Herve Gourmelon , a U.N. spokesman in Sarajevo , said heavy machine-gun and small-arms fire broke out around Bihac late Wednesday and in the predawn hours Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;21	Ivanko said later that Bosnian Serb forces kept the heat on the government 's hard-pressed 5th Corps , with significant fighting reported to the southwest and south of the Bihac pocket .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;22	But there was no immediate information on any changes in the frontlines .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;23	Serbs are holding 30-40 percent of the U.N.-declared `` safe area '' consisting of Bihac town and its environs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;24	One civilian was killed near the Bihac stadium by small-arms fire , while a number of shells exploded near the Bihac hospital , badly injuring one person , Ivanko said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;25	NATO ministers meeting in Brussels on Thursday were to hear a proposal from U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher for a new international conference on former Yugoslavia at which the Serbs could make demands for new peace proposals .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;26	Already , senior Western officials are proposing that the Bosnian Serbs be allowed links to Serb-led Yugoslavia , which they long have desired .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;27	That would be a step toward creation of Serb nationalists ' goal , a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;28	Bosnian Serbs have rejected a peace plan that would reduce their holdings in Bosnia to 49 percent from about 70 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0208;29	More than 200,000 are dead or missing in the 31-month conflict launched by Serbs who rebelled against a Muslim-Croat vote to declare independence from Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;0	Positive drug tests for 11 Chinese athletes were not evidence of regular drug use in Chinese sports , an official said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;1	`` This is an act by individuals , '' Foreign Ministry spokesman Chen Jian said at a weekly briefing , adding that Chinese sports authorities practice `` strict prohibition , strict testing and strict punishment '' of drug use .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;2	Chen reiterated China 's position that recent stunning performances by its athletes were the result of hard , scientific training .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;3	`` Their performance can not be denied , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;4	The 11 , including seven swimmers , tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs during the Asian Games in October in Hiroshima , Japan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;5	On Wednesday , in its first official comment on the affair , the Chinese national Olympic committee said it was `` shocked and upset '' by the test results .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;6	They followed allegations by coaches and athletes from other countries that the stunning successes of China 's athletes may be due in part to the use of performance-enhancing drugs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;7	Allegations of drug use among Chinese women swimmers escalated at the World Championships in Rome in September when they won 12 of 16 gold medals .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;8	The Chinese women won all 15 of their races at the Asian Games , raising further suspicion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;9	On Thursday , the Yomiuri Shimbun , Japan 's largest-circulation daily , identified the 11 accused of illegal doping .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;10	They include Yang Aihua , who won the women 's 400-meter freestyle at the World Championships , and Lu Bin , who won four gold medals at the Asian Games and set a world record in the women 's 200-meter individual medley .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;11	Yang already has been banned from competition for two years for a positive test in Hiroshima just before the games .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;12	The Yomiuri said the other swimmers include women 's 400-meter freestyle champion Zhou Guanbin ; male teammate Xiong Guoming , who also won four golds ; 50-meter freestyle titlist Hu Bin ; 200-meter butterfly gold medalist Xue Wei ; and Fu Yong , a bronze medalist .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;13	Also accused , it said , were women 's 400-meter hurdles champion Han Qing ; men 's canoeing double gold medalist Zhang Lei ; canoeing silver medalist Qiu Suoren ; and women 's cycling sprint champion Wang Yan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;14	Germany 's swimming federation responded by announcing plans to boycott the World Cup in Beijing and other events in China to protest the country 's doping record .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;15	But Chinese sports officials said Thursday there are no plans for a World Cup swimming competition in Beijing next month ,
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;16	The World Swimming Federation had assigned the dates Jan. 7-8 to Beijing for one stage of the World Cup competitions , held in several different cities each year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;17	But the Chinese Swimming Association said it has been unable to raise funds for the event .
APW_ENG_19941201.0209;18	`` We never even sent out any invitations , '' said an official who answered the phone at the association 's offices .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;0	An explosive thrown in a clash between political rivals killed one person Thursday during a state election considered to be an important test for Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;1	Police said they also killed three militants of the Peoples War Group , an anarchist organization that carried out a series of sabotage incidents in the final weeks of the campaign to disrupt the voting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;2	At least 29 people were killed in land mine explosions blamed on the group .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;3	Aruna Bahugana , a senior police officer , reported that an election official was dragged out of his polling booth and stabbed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;4	He was injured but it was not known how seriously .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;5	Cases also were reported of looting ballot boxes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;6	The violence came during elections to the state assembly of Andhra Pradesh , Rao 's home state .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;7	There were no reports of election trouble in the neighboring state of Karnataka .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;8	Voting for state legislatures in the two south Indian states was seen as an important bellwether for Rao 's Congress Party , which already has suffered setbacks in the north and must retain its support in the south .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;9	A loss in Rao 's own state of Andhra Pradesh could unleash rivalries in the governing party that he suppressed with difficulty last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;10	Results will be announced Dec. 9 for elections in Andhra Pradesh , Karnataka and two other states that voted last month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;11	The voting is staggered to allow police forces to move from one to another to protect polling stations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;12	The Congress campaign in Andhra Pradesh was thrown into disarray by the promise of an aging film star-turned-politician , N.T. Rama Rao , to sell rice to the poor at two rupees per kilogram -LRB- three cents per pound -RRB- -- six times less than the market rate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;13	Pursuing free market reforms , Rao could offer no subsidies to match his opponent 's challenge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;14	Rama Rao , 72 , who built a popular image by playing Hindu deities in classic films , campaigned with the help of his young crowd-pulling wife , whom he married last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0210;15	The prime minister put his own prestige at stake by campaigning hard in his state , but his party 's prospects were hurt by infighting among local politicians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;0	Russia 's foreign minister said Thursday that withdrawal of U.N. peacekeepers from Bosnia was not inevitable and that diplomatic alternatives remained to be explored .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;1	Andrei Kozyrev also called for intensified efforts to implement a ceasefire throughout Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;2	`` We see some elements which could be promoted , tendencies which are encouraging , '' Kozyrev told a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;3	He said the `` contact group '' of five nations that drafted a peace plan in July should `` capitalize on positive elements '' to resolve the crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;4	Ministers of the contact group , including Kozyrev , are to meet Friday in Brussels to try salvaging their diplomatic approach to ending the nearly three-year-old war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;5	Kozyrev refused to specify new initiatives the Russians were expected to propose in Brussels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;6	He spoke a day after U.N. Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali threatened to withdraw peacekeepers unless Bosnian Serbs and the Muslim-led government cooperate with the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;7	Serb advances on the Bihac pocket , a U.N.-declared `` safe zone , '' have made a mockery of the peacekeepers , ill-equipped to defend themselves or fulfill their mission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;8	`` We are in the process of discussing the security of the peacekeepers with the secretary general , and daily , if not hourly , considering withdrawing because we do n't want them to become easy targets or hostages , '' Kozyrev said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;9	However , he insisted the peacekeepers ' situation was not hopeless .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;10	Kozyrev suggested that sanctions against Belgrade be lifted as a reward for its decision to close Serbian borders to Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;11	He called the sanctions `` ridiculous '' because they were leveled when Serbia rejected the earlier Vance-Owen peace plan , which is now defunct .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;12	Serbia accepts the current peace plan , he noted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;13	`` We have to further recognize Belgrade 's positive input , '' Kozyrev said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;14	Kozyrev spoke on the final day of a five-day meeting of the Western European Union -- 10 nations that hope to become the defense arm of a new , expanded Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;15	In an address to the closing session , Kozyrev said the Russian and WEU approaches to the Bosnian crisis were `` very close . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;16	Russia , like France and Britain , would withdraw its peacekeepers if the arms embargo on Bosnia were lifted , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;17	The United States has pushed to lift the embargo so underequipped Bosnian Muslims could better defend themselves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;18	Referring to conflicts in newly independent states of the former Soviet Union , Kozyrev appealed for outside assistance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;19	`` Unfortunately , no international organization has yet been able to provide us assistance that could be at least comparable to our own efforts , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0211;20	Russia has 15,000 soldiers in the farflung areas , he said , while international contributions `` do not go beyond sending a handful of observers . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;0	A moderate quake struck the Ionian Sea island of Levkas Thursday , causing minor damage but no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;1	The Salonica University Seismological Institute said the quake had a preliminary magnitude of 5.2 on the Richter with its epicenter on the seabed near Levkas , 300 kilometers -LRB- 186 miles -RRB- southwest of this northern city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;2	It occurred at 9:17 a.m. -LRB- 0717 GMT -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;3	It was followed a few minutes later by a quake with a preliminary magnitude of 4.6 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;4	Authorities said some buildings were slightly damaged by the initial tremor , but there were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;5	It was the second quake to hit the Levkas region in two days .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;6	A quake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.3 hit the area on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;7	Officials at the Athens Seismological Institute said they thought the tremors following Tuesday 's quake were aftershocks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;8	A quake with a magnitude of 2.5 to 3 is the smallest felt by people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0212;9	A magnitude 5 can cause moderate damage while a 6 can cause severe damage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;0	When Joan Boltman first heard her son was aboard a sinking luxury liner for a second time , she feared his luck had run out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;1	`` There 's always the thought that he could n't survive this type of thing twice , '' she told The Associated Press in a telephone interview Thursday , a day after hearing her son , Robin , had been rescued from the burning Achille Lauro cruise ship off the coast of Somalia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;2	More than 250 South Africans were aboard the Achille Lauro , and anxious friends and relatives spent hours Wednesday trying to learn their fate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;3	A South African resident , Arthur Morris , was one of two reported deaths , but the rest of the almost 1,000 passengers and crew members were rescued , though some suffered broken bones and other injuries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;4	Morris ' daughter , Carina Rogers , told The Star newspaper in Johannesburg her father died after a piece of ship 's equipment fell on him in the lifeboat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;5	She failed to return phone calls Thursday from the AP .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;6	Robin Boltman was working as a magician on the Achille Lauro as it cruised from Genoa , Italy , to Durban , South Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;7	It was the same job he held on the Oceanos , a Greek-owned ship that sank off the southeast coast of Africa in August 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;8	The first time , Boltman was considered a hero for helping restore order on the sinking ship after some crew members fled in a life boat after an explosion ripped open the hull .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;9	All of the more than 500 people on board were rescued safely .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;10	So far , few details of what happened aboard the Achille Lauro have emerged .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;11	`` I was shocked to hear that this had happened twice to Robin , '' his mother said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;12	`` I guess this is a natural course of events for the mother of a magician . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;13	Robin volunteered for the Achille Lauro just three weeks after the Oceanos sinking , his mother said , despite the ship 's history of trouble -- an explosion in 1965 , a deadly fire in 1981 and a hijacking by Palestinians in 1985 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;14	`` He 's an entertainer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;15	That is his life and I 'm sure that he would n't have gone if he thought there would be a problem , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;16	Kevin Grinaker of Durban said his 72-year-old mother previously had traveled three times on the Achille Lauro .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;17	`` She 's super-superstititous , '' Grinaker told Associated Press Television .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;18	`` She has this traveling bag that 's her lucky charm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0213;19	I do n't think that she will ever travel again if that bag is n't recovered on this trip . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;0	Russian prisons are inhuman and torturous , with underfed inmates crammed into stinking , standing-room-only cells , a U.N. report said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;1	It said conditions in pre-trial remand centers -- where first time offenders accused of petty crimes may wait for five years for a court appearance -- were even worse than labor camps for hardened convicts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;2	`` The oppressive heat , lack of oxygen , and the odors of sweat , excrement and disease created by gross overcrowding are overpowering , '' said Nigel Rodley , the author of the report and the U.N. 's special investigator on torture .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;3	At the invitation of the Russian government , Rodley spent two weeks in the Moscow and St. Petersburg area in summer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;4	He visited four remand centers , two police headquarters , one labor camp , one juvenile center and one hospital for seriously ill prisoners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;5	The Russian government estimates there are 500,000 prisoners in about 528 prisons and penal colonies throughout the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;6	Russia has the highest rate of detentions in the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;7	Rodley , a British human rights expert , said the rocketing crime rate following the end of Communist control had worsened acute overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;8	He criticized Russian authorities for trying to respond to public concern about crime by throwing petty offenders into jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;9	He recommended that President Boris Yeltsin should issue a presidential decree to release 71,000 non-violent , first-time offenders to try to ease the overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;10	`` It 's a radical proposal because it 's a radical problem which needs to be addressed urgently , '' Rodley told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;11	He said beatings and maltreatment were widespread .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;12	Rodley said even reading accounts of atrocious conditions did not prepare him for the appalling reality .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;13	`` The conditions are cruel , inhuman and degrading ; they are torturous , '' he wrote about cells in Moscow 's notorious Butryskaya prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;14	`` There is virtually no daylight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;15	There is insufficient room for everyone to lie down , sit down or even stand up at the same time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;16	Butryrskaya prison was constructed in 1771 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;17	There has been very little refurbishment since then .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;18	Built for 3,500 prisoners , it now holds 6,300 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;19	`` The food , not always available because of the indebtedness of the institutions -- is primitive , of a fat-saturated soupy nature .
APW_ENG_19941201.0214;20	It is consumed in the cell and is excreted in the cell , '' the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;0	ISLAMABAD , Pakistan -LRB- AP -RRB- - The main opposition party on Thursday accused Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto 's government of paying millions of rupees -LRB- dollars -RRB- in bribes to win the support of key politicians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;1	The opposition leader , Nawaz Sharif , and Ms. Bhutto have been making charges and counter-charges of corruption for months , and the attacks have become increasingly personal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;2	Both have denied allegations of wrongdoing and none of the charges has been proven in court .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;3	Sharif told a news conference that Ms. Bhutto , her husband Asif Zardari , and President Farooq Leghari all took part in a scheme that set aside 260 million rupees -LRB- dlrs 8.5 million -RRB- of government money for personal use and for paying bribes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;4	`` The trail of corruption leads to the very top , including Farooq Leghari , Benazir Bhutto and Asif Zardari , '' Sharif said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;5	Sharif claimed a large chunk of the money was used to buy the support of independent legislators in the Northwest Frontier Provincial Assembly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;6	Sharif 's conservative Pakistan Muslim League headed a coalition that controlled the province until a number of independents defected earlier this year to support Ms. Bhutto 's liberal Pakistan People 's Party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;7	Ms. Bhutto 's coalition now controls the province , and Sharif said her party paid bribes to get the independents to switch sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;8	Ms. Bhutto is on a trip to London and was not immediately available for comment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;9	She has said repeatedly that her party is not guilty of corruption and has put a stop to abuses initiated by Sharif when he was prime minister from 1990-93 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;10	Even Pakistani politicians acknowledge that the country 's political system is riddled with graft , though they inevitably accuse their opponents of the worst offenses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;11	Ms. Bhutto 's government arrested Sharif 's father , Mohammed Sharif , last month on charges of fraud and tax evasion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;12	Ms. Bhutto also said that the Sharif business empire , one of the largest in Pakistan , was built through extensive fraud .
APW_ENG_19941201.0215;13	Sharif 's accusations Thursday were seen largely as a response to Ms. Bhutto 's charges against him and his family .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher is telling the NATO allies the Clinton administration has swung to their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;1	It is the first time in the post-World War II history of the alliance that the Europeans led by France prevailed over the United States in formulating a major policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;2	It is a difficult assignment for Christopher , putting him in the awkward position of shifting gears even while denying U.S. policy on the war has changed or that there is a trans-Atlantic rift .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;3	Trying to patch over the embarrassing dispute , Christopher pronounced the alliance strong and he charted a plan for growth through absorption of East European countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;4	A ceremony was scheduled to establish links to Russia , for decades the direct target of NATO 's massive military preparedness program .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;5	The plan was adopted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;6	Over the next 12 months , bureaucrats will study the financial , structural and nuclear implications of taking in Eastern and Central European countries -- despite Russia 's reservations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;7	Christopher told the allies in a speech that `` the tragedy of the war and bloodshed in Bosnia does not diminish our responsibility to build a comprehensive European security architecture . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;8	`` America 's interests in Europe have not changed , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;9	`` Neither have the basic principles guiding our engagement . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;10	And at the top of the list , Christopher said today , was that `` the United States has enduring political , military , economic and cultural links to Europe that must and will be preserved . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;11	Earlier , at breakfast with Douglas Hurd , the British foreign secretary , Christopher reviewed the warning U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali delivered Wednesday that unless warring Serbs and Muslims cooperate with the U.N. mission the peacekeepers might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;12	Christopher and Hurd said they may go to Belgrade , the Yugoslav capital , this weekend to preach reconciliation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;13	`` We will redouble our efforts to find a diplomatic solution , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;14	However , his aides spread the word a trip by Christopher to Belgrade was unlikely .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;15	Asked if the troops would be withdrawn , Hurd replied grimly : `` We certainly hope not . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;16	By chance , it was the Unites States ' turn to preside over a meeting today of the North Atlantic Council , NATO 's policy-making arm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;17	This puts Christopher under an even brighter spotlight , and he was responding both with a brief speech opening the session and a detailed one outlining U.S. plans for NATO 's expansion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;18	On Friday , Christopher intends to lay out the U.S. approach to the Bosnian war in a meeting with Hurd and Foreign Ministers Alain Juppe of France , Andrei V. Kozyrev of Russia and Klaus Kinkel of Germany .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;19	It is centered on a call for an international peace conference that would give the Bosnian Serbs an opportunity to demand changes in the peace plan they have rejected repeatedly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;20	They already have strong intimations of support from the Clinton administration in pressing for cross-border political ties to the Serb-dominated government in Belgrade -- a big step toward their goal of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;21	`` This alliance will continue to be the anchor of American engagement in Europe , the linchpin of trans-Atlantic security , '' Christopher said in a brief statement opening the North Atlantic Council session .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;22	He also assured the 15 foreign ministers that the Clinton administration was committed to keep 100,000 American troops in Europe `` as part of our continuing engagement . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;23	The European allies , particularly France and Britain , have managed to limit NATO air strikes despite U.N. assurances that Bihac , the mostly Muslim town on the verge of falling to the Serbs , was a `` safe area '' from which heavy weapons were to be excluded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;24	They also hemmed in the 23,000 peacekeepers in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;25	Christopher , having threatened the Serbs in the past with NATO might , abandoned the threat when asked what `` sticks '' the United States was using to persuade the Serbs to relinquish their grip on Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;26	If they kept fighting , Christopher said , they risked Serbia closing its border and a tightening of sanctions -- measures that are far less threatening than attacks by NATO warplanes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;27	Seeking to limit the damage to the alliance , which successfully stood up to the Soviet Union but has caved on Bosnia , Christopher said he wanted to stress that `` the crisis in Bosnia is about Bosnia and the former Yugoslavia ; it 's not about NATO and its future . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;28	The other foreign ministers eagerly joined in his campaign to smooth over the disagreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;29	`` We had a lot of tension in the past few days , '' Spanish Foreign Minister Javier Solana said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;30	`` Fortunately , this has passed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;31	We all agree the only way to end this conflict is in a negotiated way . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;32	Kinkel , the German foreign minister , acknowledged U.S. policy on Bosnia had changed , and on dealing with the expansion of NATO as well .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;33	German Ambassador Hermann von Richthofen had filed a cable to his foreign ministry accusing the United States of sowing mistrust over Bosnia and the eastward expansion of the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;34	It is `` divided and in crisis , '' he concluded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;35	But NATO 's impotence has raised questions about its future .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;36	Senate Republican leader Bob Dole of Kansas suggested after meeting in Brussels with alliance officials that the alliance may have become irrelevant and also that it may be time to withdraw U.N. peacekeepers from Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0216;37	In Paris , Kozyrev told reporters before flying here that the peacekeepers should not be withdrawn and that there `` alternatives '' to dealing with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;0	Crippled by defense cuts and sharply declining demand , a major aircraft factory has put most of its workers on leave until January , the ITAR-Tass news agency said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;1	The Komsomolsk Aircraft Factory , the main producer of the Su-27 fighter plane , ceased all production of military equipment in late November , though it continues to produce consumer goods and civilian aircraft .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;2	Viktor Merkulov , general director of the factory , said that production of military equipment has dropped to 5.5 percent of 1991 levels , ITAR-Tass reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;3	The factory , near Russia 's Pacific Coast about 6,000 kilometers -LRB- 3,600 miles -RRB- east of Moscow , is the largest defense enterprise in the Far Eastern region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;4	But it is now the latest victim of post-Cold War defense cuts , which have shaken up the former Soviet military-industrial complex .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;5	A few factories have completed successful conversion projects or have sought new markets for military technology , but most have simply slashed production and personnel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;6	The Komsomolsk factory made a deal to sell a number of planes to China in 1992 , an agreement which provided the plant money to expand its production into other spheres .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;7	The factory has since tried to stay afloat by producing color televisions and food products , as well as the civilian aircraft S-80 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0217;8	Employees in the non-military sectors of the plant will remain employed , the news agency said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;0	NATO foreign ministers on Thursday approved an proposal to draw up a blueprint setting out conditions for the entry of former Warsaw Pact foes as new members in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;1	The ministers endorsed a 12-month study to consider how to expand the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include Central and East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;2	Issues will include financing , integrating the newcomers ' armies and nuclear issues , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;3	Anxious to ease Russian fears about the expansion , the foreign ministers emphasized the alliance was not trying to create a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;4	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in a draft of their final communique .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;5	The plan to open up to the East , proposed by the United States , was to be the centerpiece of the two-day meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;6	But the unprecedented strains between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia overshadowed the talks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;7	Despite attempts to keep the focus on new members , the Bosnian crisis was taking a large amount of the ministers ' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;8	On Friday , Christopher will meet here with his counterparts from France , Germany , Britain and Russia to discuss new plans to revive their moribund peace plan for Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;9	British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd said he may go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , this weekend .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;10	Officials said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe may join him for talks with the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;11	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that may allow Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;12	That plan requires them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;13	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;14	The NATO study would set out the terms for the acceptance of East European countries as new members .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;15	It should be ready when the ministers meet in Brussels a year from now .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;16	The study will not name candidates for membership -- although Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners -- nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;17	Instead , the study will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0219;18	To counter Russian worries about NATO 's eastward expansion , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Moscow and agree to hold regular talks on security .

APW_ENG_19941201.0221;0	NATO foreign ministers on Thursday approved an proposal to draw up a blueprint setting out conditions for the entry of former Warsaw Pact foes as new members in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;1	The ministers endorsed a 12-month study to consider how to expand the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include Central and East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;2	Issues will include financing , integrating the newcomers ' armies and nuclear issues , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;3	Anxious to ease Russian fears about the expansion , the foreign ministers emphasized the alliance was not trying to create a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;4	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in a draft of their final communique .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;5	The plan to open up to the East , proposed by the United States , was to be the centerpiece of the two-day meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;6	But the unprecedented strains between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia overshadowed the talks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;7	Despite attempts to keep the focus on new members , the Bosnian crisis was taking a large amount of the ministers ' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;8	On Friday , Christopher will meet here with his counterparts from France , Germany , Britain and Russia to discuss new plans to revive their moribund peace plan for Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;9	British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd said he may go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , this weekend .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;10	Officials said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe may join him for talks with the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;11	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that may allow Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;12	That plan requires them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;13	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;14	The NATO study would set out the terms for the acceptance of East European countries as new members .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;15	It should be ready when the ministers meet in Brussels a year from now .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;16	The study will not name candidates for membership -- although Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners -- nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;17	Instead , the study will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0221;18	To counter Russian worries about NATO 's eastward expansion , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Moscow and agree to hold regular talks on security .
APW_ENG_19941201.0222;0	German officials confirm NATO has asked them to contribute jet fighters to U.N. mission in Bosnia .

APW_ENG_19941201.0223;1	The defendants were part of a money laundering cell that enabled tens of millions of dollars to flow between major U.S. and European cities , said Carlo A. Boccia of the Drug Enforcement Administration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0223;2	During an investigation , authorities seized dlrs 5 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0223;3	They arrested all but four of those named in a complaint that was sealed until Wednesday .

APW_ENG_19941201.0223;5	According to court documents , the leaders of the organization in the United States were Richard Spence , a businessman who was formerly a New York City firefighter ; lawyer Harvey Weinig ; and Robert Hirsch , Weinig 's law partner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0223;6	Hirsch has pleaded guilty to money laundering and other charges in a plea bargain with prosecutors .

APW_ENG_19941201.0223;10	Those arrested were charged with conspiracy and money laundering .

APW_ENG_19941201.0225;0	NATO has asked Germany to contribute fighter planes to the U.N. mission in Bosnia , officials confirmed Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;1	The move would engage Germany 's military in its first hot war in 49 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;2	Chancellor Helmut Kohl was likely to intervene personally in any decision .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;3	The request is highly sensitive because of Germany 's postwar pacifist tradition , and the history of Nazi atrocities in the Balkans , a defense spokesman said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;4	By the same token , it would be difficult for Germany to turn down the request because of its repeated assertions that it wants to bear its share of international peacekeeping actions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;5	The fighter planes would be part of the force that has bombed Serb targets to stop attacks on U.N. protected zones or peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;6	The German planes would replace British fighters that apparently will be transferred elsewhere .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;7	A July decision of the German supreme court enabled the military to engage in peacekeeping missions outside NATO .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;8	Kohl has pushed for Germany to take on new responsibilities so it can gain more power in international affairs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0225;9	German forces were deployed as supply troops in Somalia last year , but the Bosnia action would be their first deployment in a combat situation .

APW_ENG_19941201.0227;0	A Jerusalem court on Thursday barred eight Jewish extremists from entering the Temple Mount after they illegally prayed at the holy site earlier this week and were kicked out by angry Muslim guards .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;1	The eight may not visit the Temple Mount during Jewish holidays for the next six months , ruled Magistrate 's Court Judge Miriam Mizrahi .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;2	The Temple Mount stands on the ground zero of the Arab-Israeli conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;3	The raised platform , once site of the Jewish Temple that was destroyed in 70 A.D. , today houses the Al Aqsa Mosque , the third holiest shrine of Islam .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;4	Jewish extremists demand that Israel expel the Muslims from the Temple Mount and rebuild the Temple there .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;5	Generally , Jews can visit the Temple Mount , but not pray there in groups .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;6	Ultra-Orthodox Jews stay away from the area , saying no Jew should enter the Temple Mount until the coming of the Messiah .

APW_ENG_19941201.0227;8	They were grabbed by Muslim guards and worshipers and kicked out amid curses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;9	The leader of the group , Yehuda Etzion , said Thursday that Jews must demonstrate their presence on the Temple Mount .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;10	`` The right of Jews to pray on the Temple Mount is interpreted by us as an obligation and not just a right , '' Etzion told Israel radio .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;11	`` We will continue to realize this right and obligation in every way and on every occasion we can , '' Etzion said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;12	Etzion was a leader of an underground ring that waged a four-year campaign of terror against Palestinians in the 1980s , including car bombings that maimed two West Bank mayors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;13	He served four years in prison for conspiracy in an aborted plot to blow up the Dome of the Rock Mosque on the Temple Mount .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;14	Judge Mizrahi said Jews should be allowed to pray on the Temple Mount under the principle of freedom of worship , but that this right was less important than public safety , according to Israel radio .
APW_ENG_19941201.0227;15	She said Etzion 's group intended to incite riots , not to make use of the right to freedom of worship .

APW_ENG_19941201.0228;1	Thousands of East Timorese rampaged through the streets of Dili on Nov. l3 , looting shops , burning cars and smashing windows in protests against Indonesia 's rule of the territory , a Portuguese colony before Indonesia annexed it in 1976 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0228;2	Attention was focused on the territory and Indonesia 's human rights record while Asian-Pacific leaders , including President Clinton , were holding an economic summit meeting in Indonesia in November .
APW_ENG_19941201.0228;3	`` They were purely criminal acts and non-political , fights between groups , which were later used by anti-government elements to create disorder on the island , '' Gov. Abilio Jose Osorio Soares told the envoys .
APW_ENG_19941201.0228;4	He referred to fights between an East Timorese group and Indonesian traders from outside the island on the eve of the demonstration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0228;5	The rioting followed the third anniversary of the Nov. 12 , 1991 , massacre by Indonesian troops of unarmed civilians demonstrating for independence .
