APW_ENG_19941201.0265;0	NATO foreign ministers on Thursday agreed to try to restart negotiations to end the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;1	They also approved a proposal to study how to expand the alliance to include former Warsaw Pact foes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;2	The plan to open up to the East was to be the centerpiece of the two-day meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;3	But unprecedented strains between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia overshadowed the talks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;4	After a turnaround in U.S. policy , NATO ministers also agreed to relaunch diplomatic efforts to end the Bosnian war -- steering away from Washington 's previous calls to step up air strikes on the Serbs and end the ban on arms supplies to the Muslim-led government in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;5	In an effort to heal the divisions , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher swung behind the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;6	`` An agreement has been reached on the idea of relaunching the negotiations , '' French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;7	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that may allow Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;8	That plan requires them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;9	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;10	Juppe said he hoped a meeting Friday with Christopher and the foreign ministers of Germany , Britain and Russia would launch `` a new initiative '' to end the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;11	Juppe added he will travel to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , on Sunday with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;12	However , in an apparent attempt to beef up its air power over Bosnia , NATO has asked Germany to add its warplanes to the allied forces on hand in case air strikes are called against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;13	German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said his government was considering the request .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;14	The ministers endorsed a 12-month study to consider how to expand the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;15	Issues will include financing , integrating the newcomers ' armies and nuclear issues , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;16	Anxious to ease Russian fears about the expansion , the foreign ministers emphasized the alliance was not trying to create a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;17	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in their final communique .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;18	The study will not name candidates for membership -- although Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners -- nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;19	Instead , the study will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0265;20	To counter Russian worries about NATO 's eastward expansion , the allies intend on Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Moscow and agree to hold regular talks on security .

APW_ENG_19941201.0266;10	`` Is he going to be surprised . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0266;11	With four consecutive victories , seven in their last eight , the AFC 's best record and its best defense , the Steelers -LRB- 9-3 -RRB- are proving just as surprising .
APW_ENG_19941201.0266;12	Driven and dominant again , they finally may be capable of returning to ... dare the words be said ?
APW_ENG_19941201.0266;13	As Pittsburgh resident Fred Rogers might say , `` Can you say Super Bowl ? ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0266;14	`` There 's a lot of similarities here to what we had going in San Francisco , '' said cornerback Tim McKyer , who played in two Super Bowls with the 49ers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0266;15	`` We 're a closeknit team , everybody gets along ... and we feel like we 're going to win in the fourth quarter . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0266;16	Or , as McKyer said when he signed with the Steelers last summer : `` I 'm here to win a championship . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0267;0	NATO on Thursday asked Germany to send fighter planes to patrol the skies over Bosnia in a mission that would put the German military into its first hot war since World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;1	It will be a thorny decision for Chancellor Helmut Kohl and his aides , who have shied from involvement in Bosnia-Herzegovina because of the history of Nazi atrocities in former Yugoslavia , and anti-German sentiment among many Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;2	It will also be a difficult request for Germany to turn down because of Kohl 's repeated assertions that his nation , seeking more international influence , must bear its share of peacekeeping responsibilities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;3	Lt. Col. Joe Cato , spokesman for NATO 's European military headquarters in Casteau , Belgium , said that the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe `` has requested -LRB- that -RRB- the German armed forces provide some combat aircraft to support NATO air operations over parts of former Yugoslavia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;4	NATO requested German Tornado planes equipped with electronic gear that can locate and identify radar sites , and rockets designed to destroy such sites , a German defense official said , speaking on background .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;5	The Tornado planes could help prevent Serb attacks on NATO planes patrolling Bosnia to enforce the U.N. humanitarian mission , and also could protect supply flights to Sarajevo , the official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;6	He and other officials could not confirm a report in the weekly Rheinische Merkur newspaper that the German planes would replace fighters that Britain planned to withdraw .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;7	A July decision of the German constitutional court enabled the government to engage in peacekeeping missions outside the NATO area for the first time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;8	German supply troops were involved in missions in Somalia and Rwanda .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;9	`` Whether we , after the constitutional court ruling , should really choose former Yugoslavia as the place to step up our engagement , is something I believe we should consider very carefully , '' Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said in Brussels , Belgium .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;10	Kohl has said Germany can not send peacekeepers to former Yugoslavia because of the bitter memories over the hundreds of thousands of Serbs , Jews and others murdered by the German army and SS officers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;11	Earlier this week , Kohl described the Serb attacks and the NATO allies ' inability to stop them as a `` disgrace for civilized Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;12	Kohl added that he morally was in favor of lifting the embargo on arms shipments to the Muslim-led Bosnian government , but felt he had to support the embargo out of solidarity with European colleagues who have troops on the ground .
APW_ENG_19941201.0267;13	France , Britain and other governments oppose lifting the embargo because they fear it will expand the fighting and could bring Bosnian Serb reprisals against their soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;0	NATO foreign ministers on Thursday agreed to try to restart negotiations to end the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;1	They also approved a proposal to study how to expand the alliance to include former Warsaw Pact foes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;2	The plan to open up to the East was to be the centerpiece of the two-day meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;3	But unprecedented strains between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia overshadowed the talks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;4	After a turnaround in U.S. policy , NATO ministers also agreed to relaunch diplomatic efforts to end the Bosnian war -- steering away from Washington 's previous calls to step up air strikes on the Serbs and end the ban on arms supplies to the Muslim-led government in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;5	In an effort to heal the divisions , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher swung behind the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;6	`` An agreement has been reached on the idea of relaunching the negotiations , '' French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;7	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that may allow Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;8	That plan requires them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;9	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;10	Juppe said he hoped a meeting Friday with Christopher and the foreign ministers of Germany , Britain and Russia would launch `` a new initiative '' to end the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;11	Juppe added he will travel to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , on Sunday with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;12	However , in an apparent attempt to beef up its air power over Bosnia , NATO has asked Germany to add its warplanes to the allied forces on hand in case air strikes are called against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;13	German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said his government was considering the request .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;14	The ministers endorsed a 12-month study to consider how to expand the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization to include East European democracies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;15	Issues will include financing , integrating the newcomers ' armies and nuclear issues , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;16	Anxious to ease Russian fears about the expansion , the foreign ministers emphasized the alliance was not trying to create a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;17	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in their final communique .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;18	The study will not name candidates for membership -- although Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners -- nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;19	Instead , the study will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0268;20	To counter Russian worries about NATO 's eastward expansion , the allies intend on Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Moscow and agree to hold regular talks on security .

APW_ENG_19941201.0271;0	Governments worldwide must improve crop production or face shortage of food in the future because of population explosion , water shortage and shrinking amounts of cultivable land , scientists said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;1	`` At the moment there is no shortfall but looking 20 years down the road we see a different picture , '' Randolph Barker , the new head of the International Irrigation Management Institute told scientists at the 10th anniversary of the organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;2	`` There is an alarming complacency that everything is all right on the food front .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;3	But we must learn to make more food with less land and water , and the research must start now because science takes time , '' said Roberto Lenton , the outgoing director-general .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;4	`` The nightmare of world hunger that was stopped by the green revolution in agricultural production in the 1960s may return to haunt us , '' said M.S. Swaminathan , chairman of institute .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;5	Global population is projected to total 7.1 billion by the year 2010 , compared to 5.2 today , according to the World Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;6	The amount of water available for irrigation is declining due to increased demands from growing population .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;7	At present , 80 percent of the water is for irrigation , but competition is increasing from household and industrial consumers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;8	The Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research , the world body co-ordinating research on food production , is organizing a global initiative on increased water management to solve the problem .
APW_ENG_19941201.0271;9	The irrigation institute , headquartered in Colombo , has been designated the convening center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;0	A dark-haired man in a blue sweatshirt sits in front of a table strewn with automatic weapons , pistols and ammunition clips .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;1	A banner behind him reads : `` Only by blood will we liberate our country . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;2	Jamal Abdel Hamid Yussef , 23 , recounts operations of his unit of the Izzedine al-Qassam Brigades , the military wing of the Islamic group Hamas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;3	Yussef , who is wanted by both Israel and the PLO , describes the ambush of an Israeli jeep in which an officer was wounded and says his unit later kidnapped a soldier who was killed after being ordered to strip .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;4	`` Our suicide operations are a message ... that our people love death .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;5	Our goal is to die for the sake of God , and if we live we want to humiliate Jews and trample on their necks , '' he says .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;6	Yussef 's chilling confessions are part a videocassette which can be bought for dlrs 5 or rented for 30 cents in Gaza .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;7	Similar ones are available in the West Bank and the Old City of Jerusalem .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;8	The videos , along with books and audio cassettes , are part of a well-orchestrated propaganda campaign which is funded in part by money raised in the United States , Arab oil states and Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;9	It is designed to win over Palestinians , especially young ones , who have lost hope in PLO leader Yasser Arafat 's ability to deliver change .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;10	The videotapes , usually poor quality , appear to be made locally and began appearing in the open only after the Gaza Strip and West Bank town of Jericho became autonomous in May .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;11	They intersperse songs , speeches of militant Islamic preachers , rallies , and TV footage of riots and the aftermath of suicide attacks on Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;12	Some like the tape starring Yussef 's underground group also provide instruction on how to use weapons .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;13	After recounting the group 's attacks on Israelis , Yussef demonstrated how to assemble , load and fire the M-16 and AK-47 automatic rifles on the table in front of him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;14	The message in the videotapes is often far bloodier and direct than can be found in slogans painted on walls or even in underground leaflets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;15	The preachers promise a life of plenty in paradise -- where there are rivers of honey and 72 brides for any hero who is martyred fighting the enemies of Islam .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;16	An attractive afterlife is a powerful recruiting message to jobless youths in refugee camps who see no future .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;17	On one tape Sheikh Jamil Hamami , the leader of Hamas in Jerusalem , praises three Hamas activists who were killed during a siege of their hideout by Israeli soldiers in March , saying they restored pride to Palestinians who had been victimized by Israeli occupation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;18	`` There is a big , big difference between this group of martyrs who restored our dignity to us , restored our honor , and increased our confidence in God and our just cause , and the ones who want us to surrender and accept humiliation . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;19	He condemns the Israel-PLO peacemaking that brought autonomy to the Gaza Strip and part of the West Bank as a sellout of Palestinian dreams for statehood and independence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;20	Israeli officials see such videotapes as a threat and selling or possessing them can lead to arrest and jail terms of two to five years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;21	Because people regard the words and speeches of recognized religious leaders as authoritative religious commandments .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;22	In as much as people wish to be devout and obedient , they will strive to fulfill these demands , '' said Yigal Carmon , the government 's former terrorism adviser .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;23	Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin has declared war on Hamas , arresting more than 400 Hamas activists and warning that the peace process has been imperiled by attacks on Israelis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;24	Islamic militants are blamed for most of 94 people killed since September 1993 when the Israel-PLO accord was signed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;25	Two of those arrested earlier this month held American passports , although they have not been identified by name .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;26	They were carrying large amounts of money and indoctrination material , including videotapes , according to Palestinian and Israeli sources .
APW_ENG_19941201.0272;27	Israeli officials are calling on the United States and other nations to crack down on the activities of Islamic radicals .

APW_ENG_19941201.0273;1	The appointment will be part-time , and not tied directly to peace talks between Britain and Ireland , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0273;2	British Ambassador Robin Renwick , after a visit to the White House Thursday , said Mitchell 's appointment will `` help with economic involvement and the future of Northern Ireland and to help support the peace process . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0273;4	White House officials , speaking on condition of anonymity , stressed that Mitchell 's appointment does not mean the United States is getting directly involved in the peace process .
APW_ENG_19941201.0273;5	They said he will try to improve the country 's economic condition , a development that would aid the peace effort .

APW_ENG_19941201.0274;0	An elderly Briton who collapsed while being evacuated from the burning Achille Lauro was one of the two people killed on the cruise ship , officials said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;1	The Foreign Office identified the dead Briton as Arthur Morris , 68 , who -- like many of the 581 passengers -- lived in South Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;2	A German passenger also died after fire broke out Wednesday in the cruise ship .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;3	One British newspaper report said Morris hit his head while trying to get to a lifeboat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;4	Other reports said he collapsed from stress .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;5	One of the first British survivors to reach a rescue ship described how passengers , many still in evening dress , waited on the deck for hours as the fire billowed out of control , children sobbing and some passengers panicking .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;6	Tony Webb , 44 , who won the cruise as a competition prize , said his 2-year-old son Michael clung to him terrified as they looked back from a lifeboat `` at the Achille Lauro and the sight was amazing . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;7	`` The flames were leaping up and there was smoke all around , '' Webb , who now lives in Cape Town , said in an interview by radio with London 's Daily Telegraph .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;8	`` The fire was so big you had to fight through smoke which poured down towards the cabins . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;9	Webb added , `` As we waited the smoke became thicker and thicker .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;10	The crew were wonderful .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;11	They tried to keep us all calm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;12	At about 8 a.m. the captain said the fire was too strong and we would have to abandon the ship . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;13	Some 75 British passengers were taken on board a Greek cargo ship , Chios , on Thursday , the British news agency Press Association reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;14	Petankis Pringis , radio officer on the Chios , said most were in good spirits and would be telephoning relatives .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;15	`` Their relatives should not be worried .
APW_ENG_19941201.0274;16	They are better here than on the Achille Lauro , '' said Pringis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;0	When Irmgard Moeller went to prison 22 years ago for blowing up three American soldiers , the United States was fighting a war in Vietnam .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;1	When she walked out Thursday , she heard the same anti-war songs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;2	Just about everything else was different .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;3	`` It still feels unreal , '' she said after stepping out the blue steel prison gate into the crisp air of this Baltic city , freed early from a life sentence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;4	About 200 supporters waved red flags , chanted revolutionary slogans and presented flowers as Germany 's longest-held female prisoner walked free , wearing jeans , a black leather jacket and a red sweater .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;5	`` I have to think first about what I 'll do in future , '' Moeller told reporters as she hugged friends and leftist activists , bearing Christmas presents and flowers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;6	The fall of communism has blunted the leftist cause , for which Moeller had remained a powerful symbol .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;7	Gone is East Germany , where many terrorists on the run had found refuge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;8	United Germany is slowly assuming a more assertive role in world affairs , and its soldiers have served in peace missions abroad .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;9	With NATO now asking for German fighter planes for the skies over Bosnia , the country 's military involvement abroad could again send leftists into the streets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;10	Moeller , her activities subject to approval by a probation officer for the next five years , promised to work for the release of other jailed terrorists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;11	`` The others must not stay in prison as long as I have , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;12	`` Free all political prisoners , '' the crowd chanted and carried banners with the same message .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;13	As she was driven away in her lawyer 's car , a loudspeaker mounted on a van blared out `` Internationale , '' the revolutionary socialist hymn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;14	Moeller 's release could lead to freedom for the seven other Red Army Faction serving long sentences .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;15	Unlike some other previously released former Red Army Faction members , Moeller did not renounce her terrorist past .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;16	But authorities could be hoping that her release will cement a truce with the leftist group that once had been seen as a possible threat to democracy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;17	Three years ago , then President Richard von Weizsaecker said it was time to start a dialogue with former terrorists and to try to reintegrate them into society .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;18	After killing a German official in 1991 and blowing up a prison in 1993 , the Red Army Faction said it was ending its 20-year campaign of violence , during which it often targeted the American military and other symbols of what it called `` imperialism . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;19	Moeller was convicted of driving one of the explosives-laden cars that blew up in a parking lot at U.S. Army Headquarters in Heidelberg on May 24 , 1972 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;20	The bomb killed Capt. Clyde R. Bonner and two enlisted men , Charles L. Peck and Ronald A. Woodward .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;21	Moeller was arrested six weeks after the attack and sentenced to life in prison , plus 15 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;22	The Red Army Faction issued a statement after the bombing , calling it a protest against the U.S. military involvement in Vietnam .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;23	Moeller was freed because of her poor health , although she has shown no remorse and refused to cooperate with psychiatric evaluations to determine if she was still dangerous .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;24	A court in the state of Schleswig-Holstein , where the prison is located , determined that she was not likely to commit another violent crime .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;25	The state prosecutor 's office agreed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;26	The U.S. State Department and relatives of the victims objected to her release , but many Germans feel 22 years was long enough for Moeller , regardless of the seriousness of her crimes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;27	Most prisoners sentenced to life in Germany are released after 15 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;28	There was no domestic protest , and newspaper articles about the case in the past weeks have focused on Moeller 's history and prison conditions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;29	`` While we recognize the independence of German courts , we are disappointed that an unrepentant terrorist who murdered three U.S. soldiers has been freed from prison , '' said a U.S. State Department statement issued in Washington .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;30	`` Prior to this parole , the United States formally reiterated to the government of Germany our view that convicted terrorists should serve their full prison terms . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;31	In a 1992 interview with the magazine Der Spiegel , Moeller was asked if she felt sympathy for the victims of Red Army Faction violence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;32	` I ca n't deal with this so personally and individually , '' she replied .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;33	A striking , dark-haired woman when she went to jail , Moeller 's pale complexion , lined face and streaks of gay hair speak of the life behind bars .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;34	She is suffering from skin , eye and other ailments .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;35	Moeller lived through 12 hunger strikes and was the only survivor in the night of Oct. 18 , 1977 , when three other Red Army Faction leaders -- Andreas Baader , Jan-Carl Raspe and Gudrun Ensslin , committed suicide in the top-security Stammheim prison in Stuttgart .
APW_ENG_19941201.0275;36	Discovered with four stabs in her chest , Moeller has always claimed the terrorists were the victims of state violence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;0	The planned European Union-wide police force will not have its marching orders this year , as the dozen governments ended talks Thursday by failing to agree on rules for Europol .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;1	Despite growing public concern about organized crime and international drug trafficking , justice and interior ministers here for a meeting again spent it squabbling over details on how to coordinate their police forces .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;2	The ministers have already missed an October deadline for adopting a convention for the Netherlands-based Europol .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;3	Germany has sought an FBI-style agency , independent and with a long arm to track individuals or organizations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;4	But France wants national police forces to have easy access to Europol data , and would limit the exchange of information between member states .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;5	British officials are reluctant to feed sensitive information to a data bank that authorities in other member states can inspect any time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;6	Crime fighting remains the responsibility of individual governments , who have agreed to work together on the subject .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;7	Their lack of progress has caused frustration among EU officials , who remain powerless on the matter .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;8	Commissioner Padraig Flynn , the EU 's justice and immigration chief , railed against the ministers Thursday , criticizing their slow pace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;9	`` We have made no progress '' on Europol , he told reporters after the meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;10	`` There are some very obvious questions and they have to be faced up to . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;11	Flynn also complained that governments have not yet fixed immigration rules , and that `` nothing has happened '' with a plan to seal the union 's external frontiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0277;12	Both are necessary to allow free movement for people inside the trade bloc , a prime goal of the group 's border-free , single market that took effect Jan. 1 , 1993 .

APW_ENG_19941201.0280;0	Despite its public ban on war aid to Bosnian Serbs , Yugoslavia has assisted in a crucial attack on northwest Bosnia , according to Bosnian , Serb , and U.N. reports .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;1	The reports released this week raise doubts about Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic 's commitment to the aid cutoff he announced in August to pressure Bosnian Serbs into accepting a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;2	The attack on Bihac in northwest Bosnia called NATO 's bluff to use large-scale force against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;3	It has led to a rapid deterioration in the United Nations ' authority , and on Wednesday , U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali said the 24,000 peacekeepers might have to be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;4	In October , the Bosnian army 's 5th Corps broke out of the Bihac area where government forces are completely surrounded by Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;5	They pushed the Serbs back in a surprise attack to the east and south .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;6	But the Serbs counter-attacked furiously , and now control 30-40 percent of the U.N.-declared Bihac `` safe area , '' which encompasses the town of Bihac and environs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;7	Fighting there is continuing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;8	Classified U.N. reports , claims by the Bosnian government , and reports by media and reliable sources in Yugoslavia all suggest that fighters and supplies from Yugoslavia have been involved in the Bihac combat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;9	`` It is so obvious that ... Serbs received new weapons , fresh troops ... and fuel to move ` dry ' tanks , '' charged Gen. Jovan Divjak , a Serb who serves as deputy commander of the Bosnian army .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;10	`` Otherwise , they would n't have been able to put Bihac under such strong pressure . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;11	Bosnian government officials said intelligence reports indicated fuel and ammunition trucks had crossed the border into Bosnia from Serbia , the main republic in Yugoslavia , and that armor , helicopters and rockets all had been provided .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;12	In a visit to Sarajevo on Tuesday , Charles Thomas , the U.S. representative on a five-nation group seeking peace in Bosnia , told reporters that Milosevic 's clampdown was generally successful , but that the border was `` somewhat porous . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;13	Several hundred international monitors are assigned to check the roughly 500-kilometer -LRB- 300-mile -RRB- Yugoslav-Bosnian border for violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;14	Their reports so far have revealed no violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;15	But reports from Yugoslavia and from U.N. observers indicate that Milosevic may have used the involvement of Serbs from Croatia to get assistance to the Bihac combatants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;16	While Milosevic said he was cutting off help to the Bosnian Serbs , he did not make a similar pledge regarding the Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;17	Classified U.N. reports shown to The Associated Press in Sarajevo say that U.N. observers had noticed armed men crossing the border between Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia in vehicles with Belgrade licenses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;18	The presence of fighters from Yugoslavia in Bosnia also was reported in Milosevic 's Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;19	The Svet weekly , based in the northern Serbian town of Novi Sad , said a special Serbian police unit of up to 1,000 men headed by a top police officer had joined the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;20	The weekly said the policemen crossed into Bosnia as civilians , and traveled through Bosnia to Croatia , where they received weapons and uniforms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;21	A senior Serbian police official denied the Svet report .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;22	But reliable sources in Belgrade confirmed that Yugoslav army and police detachments actively took part in the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0280;23	Svet also claimed that the only other republic in Yugoslavia , Montenegro , had shipped a large supply of fuel to Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;0	Under a furious lobbying barrage from the Clinton administration and a small army of corporate executives , the Senate stood on the verge Thursday of ratifying a sweeping expansion of global free trade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;1	The climatic vote will not occur until the end of a second full day of debate , but supporters were claiming they now had an ample number of votes for the agreement itself and , more importantly , a small cushion for the three-fifths majority they need on a budget waiver .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;2	`` By the time the vote is actually taken tonight , we expect GATT will pass , '' said presidential press secretary Dee Dee Myers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;3	While administration officials and Senate supporters said their vote counts showed victory in their grasp , they did not let up in their lobbying efforts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;4	President Clinton met at the White House with a group of mostly undecided senators in an attempt to build the victory margin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;5	Sen. Kent Conrad said the president told senators `` they will regret the vote the rest of their lives '' if they oppose GATT .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;6	Treasury Secretary Lloyd Bentsen warned the accord 's defeat would have an `` adverse reaction '' in both the stock and bond markets , Conrad said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;7	Opponents , while conceding that the momentum was not going their way , did not let up in their efforts , either .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;8	A group of two-dozen protesters , one dressed as a lame-duck , chanted outside the White House as senators arrived for breakfast with Clinton .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;9	Sen. Fritz Hollings of South Carolina said that the new trade agreement was a bad deal that , by lowering trade barriers , would subject American workers to even more unfair competition from low-wage countries , further weakening the country 's economic standing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;10	`` The reality is that we are in decline .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;11	Everybody knows that , '' said Hollings , whose home-state textile industry will be one of the biggest losers in the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;12	`` Wake up , Washington . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;13	However , GATT supporters said that the Senate 's choice on the last day of the 103rd Congress was between continuing to hold a position of economic leadership in the global economy or retreating behind protectionist barriers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;14	The House endorsed the accord , negotiated under the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade , by a 288-146 vote on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;15	Thirty-three other countries already have ratified the 124-nation accord and supporters said other countries are poised to act before Jan. 1 if the Senate follows the House .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;16	According to an Associated Press survey , GATT proponents appeared on the verge of victory , when counting those who were leaning in favor but not firmly committed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;17	The AP head count had 60 senators for or leaning for waiving budget rules , 26 against or leaning against and 14 undeclared .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;18	Opponents ' only hope was to change enough senators ' minds to muster 41 votes in favor of the procedural hurdle imposed by Sen. Robert Byrd .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;19	Under Senate rules , the implementing bill must offset all of the projected dlrs 43 billion in lost tariff revenues over the first decade of the accord .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;20	To make up for the lost tariffs , the administration is cutting farm subsidies and raising revenue with a number of measures , including changing the minimum rate on savings bonds and auctioning licenses for a new generation of wireless broadcast services .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;21	Byrd said the bill falls dlrs 14.5 billion short and some senators , while declaring themselves in favor of free trade , said they would not vote to bust the budget .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;22	Byrd and others also complain that a new Geneva-based World Trade Organization , created to referee trade disputes , will inevitably infringe on U.S. sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;23	The administration is predicting 500,000 new American jobs as a result of increased U.S. export sales under GATT .
APW_ENG_19941201.0281;24	In addition to bringing foreign tariffs closer to U.S. levels , it reduces barriers to trade in agricultural goods and services and protects U.S. intellectual property , such as computer programs , from being pirated .

APW_ENG_19941201.0282;1	Billionaire Kirk Kerkorian , who owns 9 percent of Chrysler , also had asked the company to split its stock , but no split was announced .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;2	The quarterly dividend was increased to 40 cents a share from 25 cents .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;3	The company had announced 5-cent increases twice in the past year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;4	The stock repurchase program will start after the first of the year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;5	`` We remain committed to enhancing shareholder value , and this is a very effective method for doing so , '' Chrysler Chairman Robert J. Eaton said in the announcement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;6	The company 's `` poison pill '' anti-takeover provision was modified so that it is not triggered until a stockholder acquires 15 percent of the outstanding shares .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;7	The previous trigger was 10 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;8	Kerkorian has asked federal regulators ' permission to increase his stake in the company to up to 15 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;9	Eaton said the `` poison pill ' change was prompted by Kerkorian 's actions , but that the other measures had been under consideration for some time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0282;10	The company also announced it was increasing its five-year capital spending program to dlrs 22.9 billion from the current level of dlrs 20.8 billion .

APW_ENG_19941201.0285;0	A Pennsylvania company has found evidence of soil and groundwater contamination at U.S. Navy base on this British colony scheduled to close next year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;1	Curtis Kimbel , environmental director of Naval Air Station Bermuda , said petroleum products apparently leaked from some of the base 's 130 underground storage tanks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;2	The tanks stored jet fuel , diesel fuel and heating oil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;3	The 1,200-acre base , which opened during World War II , is scheduled to close next Sept. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;4	RT Environmental Services Inc. of King of Prussia , Pa. has been drilling and performing other tests for the last two months under a $ 480,000 contract with the Bermuda government , which will inherit the base property .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;5	A report from RT is expected in two weeks and the government has n't commented on the findings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;6	But Kimbel and other Navy officials said RT has shared information with them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;7	`` Their preliminary results have shown some soil contamination and some potential groundwater contamination , '' said Cmdr. Mike Donnelly , the Navy 's public works officer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;8	Donnelly said the Navy will study RT 's report before deciding how much cleanup is required .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;9	The Navy 's policy is to eliminate known risks to health and safety .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;10	Under an agreement with Great Britain , the Americans have occupied the land rent-free , also running Bermuda 's commercial airport on the base free of charge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;11	The Navy has placed a $ 140 million price tag on improvements it has made to the Naval Air Station and another smaller base on the island .
APW_ENG_19941201.0285;12	But Bermuda argues that the money spent will be more than offset by the cost of environmental damage and of demolishing or maintaining base buildings .

APW_ENG_19941201.0287;0	NATO foreign ministers approved an American proposal today to study expanding the alliance to include central and east European countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;1	Anxious to ease Russian fears about the expansion of the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization , the foreign ministers emphasized the alliance was not trying to create a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;2	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in a draft of their final statement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;3	The plan to move toward expanding NATO was planned as the centerpiece of two-day meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;4	But the unprecedented strains between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia overshadowed the talks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;5	In an effort to heal the divisions , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher swung behind the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;6	That marks a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the Europeans , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;7	With the policy turnaround , ministers agreed to relaunch diplomatic efforts to end the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;8	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe told reporters he hoped a meeting Friday with Christopher and the foreign ministers of Germany , Britain and Russia would launch `` a new initiative '' to end the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;9	Juppe added he will travel to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , on Sunday with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;10	Christopher has also said he may go .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;11	At the same time , in an apparent attempt to beef up its air power over Bosnia , NATO has asked Germany to add its warplanes to the allied forces in case airstrikes are called against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;12	German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said his government was considering the request .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;13	The request is highly sensitive because of Germany 's postwar pacifist tradition , and the history of Nazi atrocities in the Balkans during World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;14	The foreign ministers were anxious their talks not be entirely hijacked by the Bosnian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;15	They ordered a study that would set out the terms for the acceptance of east European countries as new members .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;16	It should be ready when the ministers meet in Brussels a year from now .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;17	The United States had initially proposed a six-month study of enlargement , but the Europeans , mindful of Russia 's fears of isolation , extended it to 12 months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;18	The study will not name candidates for membership -- although Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners -- nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;19	Instead , the study will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states , how much enlargement will cost and how to integrate the newcomer 's army into NATO 's command structure .
APW_ENG_19941201.0287;20	To counter Russian worries about NATO 's eastward expansion , the allies intend later today to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Moscow and agree to hold regular talks on security .
APW_ENG_19941201.0288;0	Princess Diana comforted a 4-year-old girl dying of AIDS on Thursday and joked with a man who has had the disease for 11 years , continuing a commitment to raise AIDS-awareness .
APW_ENG_19941201.0288;1	The princess , resuming more public engagements two years after her separation from Prince Charles , visited the new Mortimer Market Clinic in London on World AIDS day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0288;2	Chatting with one patient , Chris Keegan , who was diagnosed with AIDS in 1983 , she teased him that his tie and shirt not matching .
APW_ENG_19941201.0288;3	`` You obviously have n't seen my socks , '' replied Keegan , and proceeded to show her them .

APW_ENG_19941201.0289;19	Fiorentina is very young , with Batistuta , 25 , leading by example .
APW_ENG_19941201.0289;20	Five regulars are 24 or younger .

APW_ENG_19941201.0292;1	The lesson , he told his ruling Labor party 's central committee , was `` be careful about who you sell weapons to . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;2	He stressed the extremist Islamic movements financed by Iran were Israel 's worst enemies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;3	`` For the sake of employment , we , the state of Israel , once sold weapons to Iran , '' Rabin said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;4	He did not specify when the sales took place .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;5	Israel was accused during the Iran-Contra scandal of selling weapons to Teheran as part of an arms-for-hostages deal and during the Iran-Iraq war of the 1980s .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;6	Hezbollah , the militia fighting Israeli soldiers in south Lebanon since 1984 , has since fired Israeli-made 120mm shells at Israel , and four struck near the towns of Margaliot and Manara , Rabin said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;7	He did not say when the shells were fired or whether they caused any casualties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;8	It was the first time Rabin admitted Israel sold arms to enemy nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;9	But weapons experts have previously suggested the possibility , given Israel 's financially troubled arms industries and some illegal deals uncovered in the past .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;10	`` The most important thing is n't the existence of the defense industries but who we sell to , '' Rabin said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0292;11	State-owned defense firms , once a symbol of Israeli self-sufficiency and industrial prowess , are losing about dlrs 1 billion annually because of declining orders worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;0	A law enforcer called it `` white-collar crime at its worst . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;1	A Bulgarian diplomat , two lawyers , a policeman , a stockbroker , a firefighter and two rabbis were among those accused of laundering more than $ 100 million in drug proceeds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;2	The organization operated in Puerto Rico , New York , Los Angeles , Houston , Chicago and Miami as well as in Germany , Switzerland , Italy and Colombia , authorities said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;3	Carlo A. Boccia of the Drug Enforcement Administration said the defendants had a common motivation -- `` greed , a true example of how drug profits do corrupt at all levels of society . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;4	Boccia , special agent in charge of the New York office , said Wednesday that the defendants were part of a money laundering cell that enabled tens of millions of dollars to flow between major U.S. cities and Germany , Switzerland and Italy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;5	Boccia joined U.S. Attorney Mary Jo White , New York FBI head William A. Gavin and Police Commissioner William Bratton in condemning the alleged participation of otherwise respected professionals in the drug trade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;6	`` Money became the narcotic , '' Gavin said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;7	`` It shows the pervasive influence of drugs in our society . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;8	`` It is white-collar crime at its worst , '' White said , likening the defendants ' alleged deeds to those of street dealers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;9	`` The range of professions involved in this was surprising and somewhat depressing , '' said White , noting that a lawyer who was arrested practiced often at the federal courthouse in Manhattan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;10	A federal complaint charged 23 defendants with participating in a major international ring that laundered tens of millions of dollars in the last year alone .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;11	Among the group was an assistant manager at Citibank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;12	During the probe , investigators seized $ 5 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;13	They arrested all but four of those named in a complaint , which was sealed until Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;14	Some were arrested at their offices .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;15	According to court documents , the leaders of the organization in the United States were Richard Spence , a businessman who was formerly a New York City firefighter ; lawyer Harvey Weinig ; and Robert Hirsch , Weinig 's law partner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;16	Hirsch , 41 , has pleaded guilty to money laundering and other charges in a plea bargain with prosecutors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;17	White charged that the three arranged for the pickup of narcotics proceeds from street corners and hotel rooms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;18	Among those allegedly sent as couriers were police Officer Michael T. Kalanz , firefighter Charles Bruno , hospital administrator Gary Salerno , Los Angeles-based stockbroker Donald J. Hayden and rabbis Alexander Schwartz and Menashe Leifer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;19	Also arrested was Latchezar Christov , an honorary consul general for the Republic of Bulgaria .
APW_ENG_19941201.0293;20	Those arrested were charged with conspiracy and money laundering .

APW_ENG_19941201.0296;0	Ernesto Zedillo becomes president Thursday , promising profound political and legal reforms to match the market-opening that resulted in a free trade agreement with the United States and Canada .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;1	The 42-year-old U.S.-trained economist caps an unlikely journey when he assumes the red , green and white presidential sash to start a six-year term as leader of this country of 90 million .

APW_ENG_19941201.0296;3	Shops were closed and major boulevards nearly deserted for the national holiday .

APW_ENG_19941201.0296;6	Zedillo , a former Mexicali shoeshine boy achieved a Yale doctorate in economics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;7	Bypassed once for his party 's presidential nomination , he was thrust into the campaign by the March assassination of Luis Donaldo Colosio , first choice of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party , or PRI .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;8	He won the presidency Aug. 21 in the most credible elections ever held in Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;9	Zedillo has pledged to use the near-absolute powers of Mexico 's presidency to weaken his own office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;10	He says he will give greater independence to the congress , the courts and local governments as well as the PRI itself .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;11	He says he will end the practice of having the president select all top PRI candidates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;12	Zedillo , former budget and planning minister under President Carlos Salinas de Gortari , is sure to continue his predecessor 's free-market economic policies -- a commitment underlined by the Cabinet choices announced Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;13	Leading negotiators of the North American Free Trade Agreement were named heads of treasury , trade and foreign policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;14	Seven other free-market economists also were named to the 25-person cabinet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;15	Zedillo also showed signs of a political opening with the appointment of a conservative opposition party member , Antonio Lozano , as attorney general .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;16	The post is crucial for Zedillo , who made fighting government corruption a major part of his campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;17	His Cabinet includes three women -- the most ever appointed at the outset of a Mexican administration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;18	They are Norma Samaniego as controller ; Silvia Hernandez for tourism ; and biologist Julia Carabias for fisheries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;19	On Tuesday , Zedillo reached out to the left as well , meeting with leaders of the Democratic Revolution Party and promising reforms to help make Mexico more democratic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;20	Salinas never met publicly with leaders of that main leftist opposition during his administration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;21	The party apparently responded by pulling some 4,000 protesters out of the capital 's main plaza Wednesday , indicating an effort to avoid the confrontations that marred Salinas ' inauguration in 1988 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;22	The demonstrators were protesting alleged vote fraud in recent state elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;23	A protest was planned Thursday by leftist supporters of the Zapatista National Liberation Army rebels of southern Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;24	That rebellion , stalled since January by a cease-fire , is one of the toughest problems facing the new president .
APW_ENG_19941201.0296;25	Last week , a deputy attorney general investigating the Sept. 28 assassination of his own brother , a top PRI official , resigned angrily , charging that top government and party officials were involved in a cover-up .

APW_ENG_19941201.0307;5	`` It shows the pervasive influence of drugs in our society . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;6	`` It is white-collar crime at its worst , '' White said , likening the defendants ' alleged deeds to those of street dealers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;7	`` The range of professions involved in this was surprising and somewhat depressing , '' said White , noting that a lawyer who was arrested practiced often at the federal courthouse in Manhattan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;8	A federal complaint charged 23 defendants with participating in a major international ring that laundered tens of millions of dollars in the last year alone .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;9	Among the group was an assistant manager at Citibank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;10	The organization operated in New York , Los Angeles , Houston , Chicago and Miami in the United States as well as in Germany , Switzerland , Italy , Puerto Rico and Colombia , authorities said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;11	During the probe , investigators seized dlrs 5 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;12	They arrested all but four of those named in a complaint , which was sealed until Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;13	According to court documents , the leaders of the organization in the United States were Richard Spence , a businessman who was formerly a New York City firefighter ; lawyer Harvey Weinig ; and Robert Hirsch , Weinig 's law partner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;14	Hirsch , 41 , has pleaded guilty to money laundering and other charges in a plea bargain with prosecutors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;15	White charged that the three arranged for the pickup of narcotics proceeds from street corners and hotel rooms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;16	Also arrested were Leon Weinmann and his wife , Rachel , of Switzerland , who were lured to the United States for a meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;17	The complaint charged that the Zurich couple received cash and wire transfers and remitted them to bank accounts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;18	Among those allegedly sent as couriers were police Officer Michael T. Kalanz , firefighter Charles Bruno , hospital administrator Gary Salerno , Los Angeles-based stockbroker Donald J. Hayden and rabbis Alexander Schwartz and Menashe Leifer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;19	Also arrested was Latchezar Christov , an honorary consul general for the Republic of Bulgaria .
APW_ENG_19941201.0307;20	Those arrested were charged with conspiracy and money laundering .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;0	Sunburned and scattered on an improvised armada of U.S. Navy ships and cargo boats in the Indian Ocean , the nearly 1,000 survivors of a blaze that swept through the Achille Lauro began the first leg Thursday of their return home .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;1	The fire broke out Wednesday morning , reportedly in the engine room , on the bad luck cruise ship -- the Achille Lauro was hijacked in 1985 and an American passenger killed by Palestinian terrorists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;2	Passengers and crew who escaped the blaze by scrambling into lifeboats were transferred Thursday to 10 ships that would take them to Kenya or Djibouti .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;3	Many of the survivors , some dressed in evening or bed clothes , had spent hours aboard the deck of the oil tanker Hawaiian King and other merchant ships that had plucked them to safety immediately after the evacuation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;4	Two elderly passengers died -- an Englishman during the evacuation and a German man of a heart attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;5	Eight people were injured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;6	Starlauro , the Achille Lauro 's owners , said in Naples they were trying to determine if the German died because of the fire or if he had the attack before the early-morning blaze .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;7	`` The fire was so big you had to fight through smoke which poured down toward the cabins , '' one survivor , Tony Webb , was quoted as telling the London Daily Telegraph .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;8	Webb , a 44-year-old Briton who now lives in Cape Town , South Africa , had taken his wife and 2-year-old son on the cruise after winning a contest .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;9	He said he was still wearing his dinner jacket after a ship dance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;10	`` People were in their evening suits and dressing gowns , '' the paper quoted Webb as saying .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;11	Children screamed and people clung to each other as the Achille Lauro listed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;12	With his son Michael holding on to him in terror Webb looked back and saw flames `` leaping up and there was smoke all around . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;13	'' The crew was wonderful , '' Webb said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;14	`` They tried to keep us all calm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;15	At about 8 a.m. , the captain said the fire was too strong and we would have to abandon the ship . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;16	Starlauro , the cruise ship 's owners , said an SOS was sent at just before 7 a.m. local time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;17	It was unclear what time the fire began .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;18	`` Quite a few people were injured in the transfer -LRB- Wednesday -RRB- -- there 's a few broken bones and some pretty tortured souls , '' John Briand , captain of the oil tanker Lima , told the BBC .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;19	The Achille Lauro 's captain , Giuseppe Orsi , talking by phone Thursday aboard the Hawaiian King , told Italy 's transport minister in Rome that survivors ' morale was high but that clothing was needed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;20	Two Navy ships , the USS Gettysburg and the Halyburton , took on a total of 208 survivors Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;21	'' Many had tears of relief '' as they came aboard the Gettysburg , that ship 's commander , Capt. Pete Smith said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;22	They were offered '' a hot shower , the crew were feeding them ... -LRB- and -RRB- donating clothes for them to wear , as a lot abandoned ship in nightclothes . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;23	Many had bad sunburn after being exposed for hours on the deck of the Hawaiian King , Navy officials reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;24	By Thursday evening , survivors were spread aboard a total of 10 ships .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;25	Five vessels were headed for Djibouti , on the Horn of Africa ; and five for Mombasa , Kenya , with the first due , the Liberian-registered Bar Du , in Djibouti , at 2 p.m. local time -LRB- 1100 gmt -RRB- , the Italian Coast Guard reported Thursday evening .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;26	Others were due in later Friday or Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;27	The ship had carried 581 passengers and 404 crew .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;28	Most of the crew was Italian , and the passengers mainly South African , German , Dutch or British .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;29	RAI state TV said the Italian state airline , Alitalia , would dispatch jumbos to fly out the survivors , except for South Africans , to Italy once they reached port and had a chance to rest .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;30	The Achille Lauro set sail Nov. 19 from Genoa , Italy ; stopped in Haifa , Israel , and then plied on to Africa 's east coast .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;31	The ship had been bound for South Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;32	The Italian liner itself Thursday still hung on , although listing badly to port .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;33	White steam and gray smoke poured out of port side and smaller plumes of smoke drifted out of the lower starboard deck .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;34	The pilot of a plane carrying Associated Press cameramen and a reporter put the ship 's position at 160 miles east of the small Somali fishing village of Eil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;35	Heat and soot blackened the Achille Lauro 's two smokestacks , and its blue-and-white paint was scorched and mottled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;36	The ship 's captain reportedly has put the fire 's origin in the engine room , apparently contradicting the company 's initial assertion that the blaze began in the passenger area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;37	Starlauro 's director-general , Franco Zuccherino , told RAI TV Thursday that the fire 's dynamics were yet to be determined .
APW_ENG_19941201.0308;38	`` We have to talk extensively with the captain '' first , Zuccherino said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;0	Governments worldwide must improve crop production or face food shortages due to population growth , dwindling water supplies and shrinking amounts of cultivable land , scientists said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;1	`` At the moment there is no shortfall but looking 20 years down the road we see a different picture , '' Randolph Barker , the new head of the International Irrigation Management Institute told scientists at the 10th anniversary of the organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;2	`` There is an alarming complacency that everything is all right on the food front .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;3	But we must learn to make more food with less land and water , and the research must start now because science takes time , '' said Roberto Lenton , the outgoing director-general .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;4	`` The nightmare of world hunger that was stopped by the green revolution in agricultural production in the 1960s may return to haunt us , '' said M.S. Swaminathan , chairman of institute .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;5	Global population is projected to total 7.1 billion by the year 2010 , compared to 5.2 today , according to the World Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;6	The amount of water available for irrigation is declining due to increased demands from growing population .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;7	At present , 80 percent of the water is for irrigation , but competition is increasing from household and industrial consumers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;8	The Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research , the world body co-ordinating research on food production , is organizing a global initiative on increased water management to solve the problem .
APW_ENG_19941201.0309;9	The irrigation institute , headquartered in Colombo , has been designated the convening center .

APW_ENG_19941201.0311;2	In second place were U.S. Open champion Ernie Els of South Africa and Bernhard Langer of Germany , both at four-under-par 68 and three strokes ahead of British Open champion Nick Price of Zimbabwe and Americans Corey Pavin and Tom Lehman .

APW_ENG_19941201.0312;0	Despite its promise to stop delivering military aid to Bosnian Serbs , Yugoslavia has assisted in a crucial attack on northwestern Bosnia , according to Bosnian , Serb , and U.N. reports .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;1	The reports released this week raise doubts about Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic 's commitment to the aid cutoff he announced in August to pressure Bosnian Serbs into accepting a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;2	The attack on Bihac in northwest Bosnia called NATO 's bluff to use large-scale force against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;3	It has led to a rapid deterioration in the United Nations ' authority , and on Wednesday , U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali said the 24,000 peacekeepers might have to be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;4	In October , the Bosnian army 's 5th Corps broke out of the Bihac area where government forces are completely surrounded by Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;5	They pushed the Serbs back in a surprise attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;6	But the Serbs counterattacked furiously , and now control 30 percent to 40 percent of the U.N.-declared Bihac safe haven , which encompasses the town of Bihac and its environs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;7	Fighting there is continuing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;8	Classified U.N. reports , claims by the Bosnian government , and reports by media and reliable sources in Yugoslavia all suggest that fighters and supplies from Yugoslavia have been involved in the combat in Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;9	`` It is so obvious that ... Serbs received new weapons , fresh troops ... and fuel to move ` dry ' tanks , '' charged Gen. Jovan Divjak , a Serb who serves as deputy commander of the Bosnian army .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;10	`` Otherwise , they would n't have been able to put Bihac under such strong pressure . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;11	Bosnian government officials said intelligence reports indicated fuel and ammunition trucks had crossed the border into Bosnia from Serbia , the main republic in what remains of Yugoslavia , and that armor , helicopters and rockets all had been provided .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;12	In a visit to Sarajevo on Tuesday , Charles Thomas , the U.S. representative on a five-nation group seeking peace in Bosnia , told reporters that Milosevic 's clampdown was generally successful , but that the border was `` somewhat porous . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;13	Several hundred international monitors are assigned to check the roughly 500-kilometer -LRB- 300-mile -RRB- Yugoslav-Bosnian border for violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;14	Their reports so far have revealed no violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;15	But reports from Yugoslavia and from U.N. observers indicate that Milosevic may have used the involvement of Serbs from Croatia to get assistance to the Bihac combatants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;16	While Milosevic said he was cutting off help to the Bosnian Serbs , he did not make a similar pledge regarding the Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;17	Classified U.N. reports shown to The Associated Press in Sarajevo say that U.N. observers had noticed armed men crossing the border between Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia in vehicles with Belgrade licenses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;18	The presence of fighters from Yugoslavia in Bosnia also was reported in Milosevic 's Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;19	The Svet weekly , based in the northern Serbian town of Novi Sad , said a special Serbian police unit of up to 1,000 men headed by a top police officer had joined the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;20	The weekly said the policemen crossed into Bosnia as civilians , and traveled through Bosnia to Croatia , where they received weapons and uniforms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;21	A senior Serbian police official denied the Svet report .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;22	But reliable sources in Belgrade confirmed that Yugoslav army and police detachments actively took part in the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0312;23	Svet also claimed that the only other republic in Yugoslavia , Montenegro , had shipped a large supply of fuel to Bosnian Serbs .

APW_ENG_19941201.0315;1	Attorney General Silvestre Leite said Graca had listed details of his personal income from sources at home and abroad and had urged other members of his government to follow suit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0315;2	Graca , a 62-year-old doctor , campaigned for and won Oct. 2 elections on a ticket that focussed heavily on stamping out corruption on these idyllic but poor islands of 120,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0315;3	The move , which is supposed to permit justice officials to spot any irregularities in politicians ' accounts , was unprecedented in Sao Tome and rare for most of the rest of Africa .

APW_ENG_19941201.0316;0	National Hockey League officials began arriving Thursday in a downtown hotel for talks they hope will solve the labor dispute and save the North American ice hockey season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;1	`` I am always hopeful , '' commissioner Gary Bettman said Thursday as he walked past television cameras and into an elevator .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;2	`` It 's fair to say that with each passing day , the meeting that is coming up is more crucial , '' Boston Bruins general manager Harry Sinden said Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;3	To show how serious the negotiators are : They have reserved room space in a Chicago hotel for three days .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;4	Both sides agree that the latest meetings are pivotal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;5	`` There is an urgency , '' said Troy Loney , player representative of the New York Islanders .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;6	`` The meetings here in Chicago in the next couple of days are vital to find out whether there 's going to be a season or not , '' said Jeremy Roenick of the Chicago Blackhawks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;7	`` We have to make sure we let everybody know we did n't strike .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;8	The owners locked us out . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;9	`` It 's getting to the point where they are going to have to make a decision -LRB- on the Collective Bargaining Agreement -RRB- , '' a management source told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;10	The owners lockout has forced a work stoppage that is now in its 62nd day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;11	So far , 347 games have been called off .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;12	The schedule is already down from 84 to 60 games , following the cancellation of 24 for each of the 26 teams .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;13	Owners have said they will accept no less than a 50-game schedule .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;14	A settlement beyond the middle of December would sorely test that ideal , given the fact that players need at least two weeks to get ready for the season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;15	The main issue is the owners ' desire for a salary cap , a limit each team could spend on player salaries , as a way to control costs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;16	They have amended that to a `` luxury tax '' -- meaning teams could spend over a set limit , but must pay an additional `` tax '' into a pool that smaller-market teams could utilize to strenghen their rosters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;17	At one time strongly opposed to any kind of cap , players have softened their stance on a salary cap for first-year or rookie players .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;18	But they still have n't come to terms on the numbers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;19	Reportedly , owners would like a maximum cap for rookie salaries set at around dlrs 750,000 a season , while players would prefer around dlrs 1.5 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;20	Players on Thursday were expected to present the owners with their thoughts on other major issues such as free agency and salary arbritration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;21	The contentious luxury tax issue is another story , however .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;22	`` If the tax is on the table , there 's trouble , '' Loney said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;23	It may not get to that point if the negotiators can find a way to put a drag on rising salaries in other areas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;24	`` We just have n't finished the review process of anything outside of the tax , '' Sinden told The Canadian Press on Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;25	`` Until we do , I do n't think Bettman can make any statement about the tax .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;26	`` It depends if we can slow down the problems the league is trying to correct .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;27	But that has not been determined because we have not reached agreement on all these points .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;28	We have not had a chance to add it up . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;29	Until now , owners have insisted on a tax of team payrolls that go over the average team salary and give the money to those under the prescribed limit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;30	The players have been against such a tax , believing it has the same effect as a salary cap .
APW_ENG_19941201.0316;31	Players reportedly would accept a diminished version of the payroll tax if owners share the burden by taxing gate receipts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0319;0	The decision to support the expansion of the alliance came on the opening day of a two-day conference of allied foreign ministers whose talks were likely to be overshadowed by the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0319;1	`` Today , we take an important step in the process that will lead to NATO expansion , '' said U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher in addressing his counterparts at the opening session .
APW_ENG_19941201.0319;2	`` The United States believes it is time to begin the process -- to begin deliberate consideration of the practical requirements for adding new members to the alliance , '' he said in the text of his speech .
APW_ENG_19941201.0319;3	The decision to authorize the study , though , is a cautious move forward in drawing former adversaries anxious for membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0319;4	`` We have a moral duty not to squander this historic opportunity to anchor the new democracies of central and eastern Europe permanently in the West , '' said NATO Secretary-general Willy Claes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;0	The study -- dubbed an `` owner 's manual '' for NATO membership -- will take a year to complete .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;1	It will not name candidates for membership , nor will it set a deadline for admittance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;2	Instead , it will focus on such questions as whether NATO troops will need to be based in new member states ; how much enlargement will cost ; how to integrate the newcomers army into NATO 's command structure
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;3	To counter Russian worries about an eastward expansion of NATO , the allies intend later Thursday to endorse a sweeping military cooperation program with Russia and agree to hold regular talks with Moscow on security matters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;4	Russian officials have registered apprehension about the movement of NATO 's territory farther east , and alliance leaders have gone out of their way to try to strengthen separate ties with Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;5	`` Russia is a part of Europe , '' said the NATO source , who insisted on anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;6	`` You can not have a security system without the participation of Russia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;7	The ministers , he said , emphasized the importance of `` increasing the momentum '' of consultations between NATO and Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;8	The United States had initially proposed a six-month study of enlargement , but the Europeans , mindful of Moscow 's concerns , extended it to 12 months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;9	`` We should avoid premature enlargement that gives the impression that we seek a redivision of the European continent , '' said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe , according to a spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;10	The allies do not intend to identify candidates for membership , nor set a date for admission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;11	But the NATO source said , `` Central European states would be first . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;12	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and Slovakia are considered front-runners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;13	Despite attempts to keep the focus on new members , the Bosnian crisis will no doubt occupy a large amount of the ministers ' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;14	During the talks , Christopher was expected to tell the allies the Clinton administration has swung behind their view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the Bosnian conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;15	It marks a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the European allies , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;16	The change in U.S. policy will help heal an unprecedented rift within the alliance over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;17	At a breakfast with British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd , Christopher reviewed the warning U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali delivered Wednesday that unless warring Serbs and Muslims cooperate with the U.N. mission the peacekeepers might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;18	Hurd said he may go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , this weekend to preach reconciliation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;19	Officials said French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe may join him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;20	The latest American approach centers on a call for an international peace conference that would let Bosnian Serbs seek changes in the peace plan they repeatedly have rejected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;21	That plan would require them to cut their holdings in Bosnia from 70 percent to 49 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;22	The Clinton administration , officials say , is also leaning toward approval of political ties between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia proper -- a big step toward their aim of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;23	On Friday , Christopher will meet with here his counterparts from France , Germany , Britain and Russia to discuss new plans to revive their moribund peace plan for Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;24	France and Britain have been criticized in the U.S. Congress for refusing to let the United Nations use the Western military alliance 's air power to the full .
APW_ENG_19941201.0320;25	In turn , Congress has forced the Clinton administration to seek a lifting of the arms embargo against Bosnia 's Muslim-led government , something the European NATO allies oppose for fear it would escalate the fighting .

APW_ENG_19941201.0321;1	Bosnian Serbs were ... on the verge of military victory in Bihac -- and five major world powers seeking a peace settlement seem powerless to stop them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;2	The statement issued after ... French talks feebly demanded an immediate cease-fire -- and Washington , Moscow , Paris , London and Bonn are clinging to a facade of unity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;3	Pledges to continue diplomatic efforts are now not enough .
