APW_ENG_19941201.0321;7	Without such drastic action the Western alliance 's already discredited policy in Bosnia will completely collapse .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;8	Jerusalem Post on Bosnia :
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;9	The new sniping between Europeans and the United States over the humiliation of the United Nations in Bosnia is a disturbing sign of how deeply this cancerous war has eaten into the monolithic Atlantic alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;10	What has also emerged from the fall of the Bihac `` safe area '' is that European states have been tilting steadily toward a Russian , rather than American , foreign policy perspective .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;11	This is a development which has implications far beyond the mess in what was once Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;12	The grand coalition of over 30 states that converged to liberate Kuwait from the grasp of -LRB- Iraq 's -RRB- Saddam Hussein now seems as far away as the Cold War itself .

APW_ENG_19941201.0321;14	The conflict in Bosnia has revealed the true state of relations between the United States and Europe in the area of defense .

APW_ENG_19941201.0321;16	The Europeans , in contrast , fear that the rewards given to the aggressor will encourage him to pursue his policy of ethnic cleansing in Kosovo and Macedonia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;17	... It is high time to engage in a deep reflection on NATO , and that the Europeans and Americans become aware of the danger of this family quarrel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;18	Nihon Keizai Shinbun , Tokyo , on guns :
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;19	Recent shooting incidents like the one in which a waitress was shot in the head in a restaurant robbery are on the rise in Japan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;20	... What really points up the seriousness of the problem is that now it is n't just gangsters , but ordinary citizens who are being targeted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;21	What 's really terrifying about guns is that , compared with the powerful effort and will to kill required to murder with a knife or sword , there 's very little psychological deterrent for someone killing from a distance with a gun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;22	Serious discussion is needed to make sure that Japan , which was the safest country in the world , does not become a gun society like America .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;23	The Australian , Sydney , Australia , on Japan 's `` comfort women '' :
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;24	Japan 's rejection of the recommendation by the International Commission of Jurists that it should pay compensation to surviving `` comfort women '' forced into sexual slavery during World War II is regrettable .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;25	It indicates a return to the attitude that predominated among Japan 's immediate postwar generations -- to disguise the past by contriving not to discuss it -- and represents a setback for the gradual attempts of recent years to reflect on the war through more open , honest and mature debate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;26	The Geneva-based ICJ took 19 months to find that up to 200,000 women -- mainly from Korea but also from the Philippines , Taiwan and China -- were forced to work as prostitutes in military brothels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;27	However , the Japanese government rejected the report within 24 hours , saying it did not recognize the ICJ and would not be responding to its findings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;28	If Japan is serious about properly mending its international relationships , and participating fully in the regional economy on any footing other than economic mastery , it needs to do more to acknowledge its wartime record .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;29	Making due reparations to survivors of brutality in the occupied countries should be part of that .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;30	The Financial Times , London , on the European Union :
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;31	In the hearts of Europe 's policy makers , hope springs eternal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;32	Faster-than-expected recovery from recession has revived the idea that a group of countries centered on Germany could attain economic and monetary union as early as 1997 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;33	Yet there is an unfortunate corollary to the improved prospects for the European `` core . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;34	Economic divergences in the Continent 's periphery , particularly the European Union 's southern members , are increasing at a disconcerting pace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;35	Action to cope with the south 's economic challenges has been half-hearted or curbed by political difficulties or both .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;36	The south 's structural weaknesses can not be overcome without painful measures , particularly in reforming labor markets and welfare systems .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;37	... Yet without such restructuring , the task of adjustment will become still more difficult .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;38	If growth migrates permanently from the south , the EU is unlikely to be robust enough to enlarge itself to the east .
APW_ENG_19941201.0321;39	Al-Arab , Doha , Qatar , on the European Union :

APW_ENG_19941201.0321;41	The newest evidence of this orientation is the opening by the EU of a new chapter of understanding with Syria by lifting the arms embargo imposed in 1986 .

APW_ENG_19941201.0324;8	Sidhu and Tendulkar established a splendid 177 partnership in about three hours .

APW_ENG_19941201.0325;0	Speakers and activists at a 42-nation summit on AIDS pleaded Thursday for compassion for homosexuals , drug users and prostitutes often shunned by politicians and the public .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;1	Governments should redouble their efforts to end discrimination against these groups , at high risk of becoming infected with the HIV virus that causes AIDS , participants said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;2	`` All laws which deny the freedom of people to cross borders because of HIV must be abolished , '' said Richard Burzynski , an HIV sufferer with a Canada-based AIDS rights group , ICASO .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;3	`` This means all laws which criminalize or discriminate against homosexuals , drug users , migrants and refugees , and sex workers must be abolished . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;4	Governments tend to ignore or isolate homosexuals , worsening rather than addressing the AIDS epidemic , the International Gay and Lesbian Association said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;5	Homosexuals must be accepted , educated and protected by legislation , the group said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;6	Officials of the 42 participating nations endorsed a declaration pledging to strengthen cooperation between developed and Third World countries and to fight discrimination against those suffering from AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;7	`` We are not meeting here simply to issue a further warning , but to declare a planetary emergency , '' said U.N. Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;8	`` Every day , AIDS kills children , destroys families , drains economies , threatens communities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;9	We must act without delays . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;10	The non-binding declaration says signatories will act to `` ensure that all persons living with HIV\/AIDS are able to realize the full and equal enjoyment of their fundamental rights and freedoms . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;11	The declaration promised efforts to provide health care , jobs , education and housing to people with HIV or AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;12	It also supported `` empowerment of women '' by raising their economic and social status and including them in decision-making .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;13	The summit was a focal point of World AIDS Day , observed around the world with education programs and fund-raising events .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;14	Australians attended special church services commemorating 3,500 compatriots killed by AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;15	In the Ivory Coast , where AIDS is the leading killer of young men , 2,000 people marched through Abidjan with banners declaring , `` Condoms for life ; AIDS for death . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;16	In South Africa , where the disease is spreading rapidly , health officials and politicians wrapped a huge red ribbon around St. George 's Cathedral in Cape Town as part of efforts to increase AIDS awareness .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;17	In Paris , hundreds of teen-agers visited a `` village '' set up across the Seine river from the Eiffel Tower , with scores of stands offering brochures , condoms and other educational material .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;18	About 50 members of the AIDS group Act Up lay on the Champs Elysees to show solidarity with HIV victims .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;19	They blocked traffic for several minutes before leaving the boulevard .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;20	At the summit , there were numerous calls for more AIDS spending , starting with Federico Mayor , head of the U.N. Educational , Scientific and Cultural Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;21	`` In our budgets we have funds to pay the price of war , but we have made no provision for the cost of the fight against AIDS , '' Mayor said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;22	Funding `` must be accompanied by ethical surveillance to prevent or check any measures ... that would tend to exclude or discriminate against people who are ill from the disease , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;23	The World Bank , the biggest donor in the campaign against AIDS , pledged dlrs 150 million annually to combat the disease in developing countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;24	Britain announced an allocation of 230 million pounds -LRB- dlrs 358 million -RRB- on AIDS services for 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;25	Currently , however , more than 90 percent of the money pledged to fight AIDS goes toward helping only the 8 percent of those afflicted in developed countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;26	Some 17 million people are known to have been infected with the HIV virus , about two-thirds in Africa , the World Health Organization says .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;27	Up to 40 million will have been infected by 2000 , and 10 million will have died , according to WHO , co-sponsor of the summit with the French government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;28	Some French media pronounced the summit a failure even before it began .
APW_ENG_19941201.0325;29	The daily Liberation criticized the final declaration as `` banal , '' predicted that little new funding would materialize , and noted that senior U.S. , British or German leaders rebuffed summit invitations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;0	Despite its promise to stop delivering military aid to Bosnian Serbs , Yugoslavia has assisted in a crucial attack on northwestern Bosnia , according to Bosnian , Serb , and U.N. reports .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;1	The reports released this week raise doubts about Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic 's commitment to the aid cutoff he announced in August to pressure Bosnian Serbs into accepting a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;2	The attack on Bihac in northwest Bosnia called NATO 's bluff to use large-scale force against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;3	It has led to a rapid deterioration in the United Nations ' authority , and on Wednesday , U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali said the 24,000 peacekeepers might have to be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;4	In October , the Bosnian army 's 5th Corps broke out of the Bihac area where government forces are completely surrounded by Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;5	They pushed the Serbs back in a surprise attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;6	But the Serbs counterattacked furiously , and now control 30 percent to 40 percent of the U.N.-declared Bihac safe haven , which encompasses the town of Bihac and its environs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;7	Fighting there is continuing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;8	Classified U.N. reports , claims by the Bosnian government , and reports by media and reliable sources in Yugoslavia all suggest that fighters and supplies from Yugoslavia have been involved in the combat in Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;9	`` It is so obvious that ... Serbs received new weapons , fresh troops ... and fuel to move ` dry ' tanks , '' charged Gen. Jovan Divjak , a Serb who serves as deputy commander of the Bosnian army .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;10	`` Otherwise , they would n't have been able to put Bihac under such strong pressure . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;11	Bosnian government officials said intelligence reports indicated fuel and ammunition trucks had crossed the border into Bosnia from Serbia , the main republic in what remains of Yugoslavia , and that armor , helicopters and rockets all had been provided .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;12	In a visit to Sarajevo on Tuesday , Charles Thomas , the U.S. representative on a five-nation group seeking peace in Bosnia , told reporters that Milosevic 's clampdown was generally successful , but that the border was `` somewhat porous . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;13	Several hundred international monitors are assigned to check the roughly 500-kilometer -LRB- 300-mile -RRB- Yugoslav-Bosnian border for violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;14	Their reports so far have revealed no violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;15	But reports from Yugoslavia and from U.N. observers indicate that Milosevic may have used the involvement of Serbs from Croatia to get assistance to the Bihac combatants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;16	While Milosevic said he was cutting off help to the Bosnian Serbs , he did not make a similar pledge regarding the Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;17	Classified U.N. reports shown to The Associated Press in Sarajevo say that U.N. observers had noticed armed men crossing the border between Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia in vehicles with Belgrade licenses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;18	The presence of fighters from Yugoslavia in Bosnia also was reported in Milosevic 's Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;19	The Svet weekly , based in the northern Serbian town of Novi Sad , said a special Serbian police unit of up to 1,000 men headed by a top police officer had joined the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;20	The weekly said the policemen crossed into Bosnia as civilians , and traveled through Bosnia to Croatia , where they received weapons and uniforms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;21	A senior Serbian police official denied the Svet report .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;22	But reliable sources in Belgrade confirmed that Yugoslav army and police detachments actively took part in the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0326;23	Svet also claimed that the only other republic in Yugoslavia , Montenegro , had shipped a large supply of fuel to Bosnian Serbs .

APW_ENG_19941201.0329;0	The U.N. mediator for Angola was in Zaire Thursday trying to persuade UNITA rebel officials to return here for the first time in two years and help oversee a truce and power-sharing deal to end 19 years of war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;1	U.N. officials said Alioune Blondin Beye had left for Zaire late Wednesday , delaying a planned visit Thursday to New York where he was to brief the U.N. Security Council on the shaky 10-day-old truce .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;2	Both UNITA and the government have accused each other of violating the cease-fire called Nov. 22 , two days after a peace treaty was signed in Lusaka , Zambia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;3	But there has been a general reduction in fighting across the war-ravaged nation and the U.N. mission here has deployed its first military observers to six sites .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;4	A 7,000-strong U.N. peace keeping force has been promised to anchor the treaty that should lead to power sharing between government and rebels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;5	But blue helmeted troops will only be deployed once the truce is seen to be holding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;6	Angola 's war erupted on the eve of independence from Portugal in 1975 , has killed a half-million Angolans and left millions more threatened by starvation and disease .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;7	Peace accords in 1991 brought a brief respite but UNITA lost multiparty elections a year later , cried foul and returned to war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;8	Beye , broker of the year-long talks in Lusaka that produced the accord , last week announced UNITA officials would return to Luanda for the first time since losing the elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;9	But the rebels did not show , citing logistics difficulties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;10	Leaders of UNITA -- the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola -- have been on the run since their main base in the central city of Huambo fell to the government early November .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;11	Rebel chief Jonas Savimbi has not been seen in public for months , prompting rumors he had been killed or wounded in a government attack , or that he was seriously ill and was being treated in Zaire or Morocco .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;12	The U.N. mission in Angola has posted military observers in six cities : Uige , Huambo , Luena , Menongue , Saurimo and Lubango .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;13	Government sources working closely with the U.N. mission say initial plans foresee deploying 7,450 blue helmeted peace keepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;14	The largest contingents are to be posted in the war-torn north and center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;15	The central provinces of Huambo , Bie , Benguela and Cuanza-Sul will receive 2,000 peacekeepers , while Luanda and the north will get 1,800 , according to the plans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0329;16	The rebels ' former southern headquarters , Jamba , is also to be a peace keeping base , the sources said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0330;1	Town officials in the village of Champot where Debord lived announced an investigation Thursday into the suicide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0330;2	No details about how Debord took his life Wednesday were disclosed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0330;3	Little-known outside France , Debord denounced what he called `` the show-biz society '' and declared that performing arts should be based on powerful emotions , passions and sexual desire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0330;4	His ideas were influential among theoreticians and essayists who achieved prominence in the May 1968 student-led cultural revolt that shook French society .

APW_ENG_19941201.0332;2	He was 1-4 with six saves and a 7.65 ERA in 25 appearances last season .

APW_ENG_19941201.0332;7	It was his last pitch for the Phillies , the team he helped win the NL East championship and league playoffs in 1993 with 43 saves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0332;8	He was traded to the Astros in the offseason .
APW_ENG_19941201.0332;9	Williams has a career big-league record of 44-55 in 592 appearances , three of them starts , with 192 saves and a 3.51 ERA .
APW_ENG_19941201.0332;10	He started his career with the Texas Rangers in 1986 and pitched three years for them before joining the Chicago Cubs in 1989 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;0	Ernesto Zedillo becomes president Thursday , promising profound political and legal reforms to match the market-opening that resulted in a free trade agreement with the United States and Canada .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;1	The 42-year-old U.S.-trained economist caps an unlikely journey when he assumes the red , green and white presidential sash to start a six-year term as leader of this country of 90 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;2	Military bands struck up martial waltzes and Mexican mariachi musicians got set for a huge street fiesta , as hundreds of soldiers and eight armored personnel carriers guarded the post-inaugural parade route .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;3	Not all wanted to celebrate the national holiday declared for the occasion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;4	`` Out with Zedillo ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;5	and `` Zedillo No ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;6	more than 4,000 demonstrators , some of them with sticks and machetes , shouted in downtown Mexico City .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;7	The protesters , mostly farmers in straw sombreros , raised banners of the leftist Democratic Revolution Party , traditionally the biggest opponent of 65 years of uninterrupted rule by the Institutional Revolutionary Party , or PRI .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;8	But police did not intervene and the site of the protest was more than a mile from the ornate Chamber of Deputies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;9	Zedillo , his wife and five children headed in a slow-moving bus , followed by dozens of jogging and well-armed security agents to the chamber , where U.S. Vice President Al Gore , Cuba 's Fidel Castro and hundreds of others gathered .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;10	Meanwhile , eight military bands trumpeted and marched about the Zocalo square while hundreds of police in crisp blue uniforms and white gloves stood attention as a graying Castro and others entered the chamber .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;11	Zedillo , who shined shoes as a boy in Mexicali , achieved a Yale doctorate in economics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;12	Bypassed once for his party 's presidential nomination , he was thrust into the campaign by the March 23 assassination of Luis Donaldo Colosio , first choice of the ruling PRI .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;13	He won the presidency Aug. 21 in the most credible elections ever held in Mexico , pledging to use the near-absolute powers of Mexico 's presidency to weaken his own office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;14	He says he will give greater independence to the congress , the courts and local governments and end the practice of having the president handpick all top PRI candidates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;15	Zedillo , former budget and planning minister under President Carlos Salinas de Gortari , signaled he would continue his predecessor 's free-market economic policies -- a commitment underlined by the Cabinet choices announced Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;16	Leading negotiators of the North American Free Trade Agreement were named heads of treasury , trade and foreign policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;17	Seven other free-market economists also were named to the 25-person cabinet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;18	Gore , one of 63 foreign dignitaries attending , said 1994 brought `` unprecedented progress in the bilateral relationship between the United States and Mexico ... and we look forward to even greater improvement in the year ahead . '
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;19	Zedillo also showed signs of a political opening with the appointment of a conservative opposition party member , Antonio Lozano , as attorney general .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;20	The post is crucial for Zedillo , who made fighting government corruption a major part of his campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;21	Lozano 's appointment marks the first time a Cabinet post has been given to an opposition party member , and it `` opens the possibility of an important change , '' said Carlos Castillo Pedraza , leader of the National Action Party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;22	Despite Zedillo 's moves , discontent remains .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;23	A protest was planned today by leftist supporters of the Zapatista National Liberation Army rebels of southern Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0333;24	That rebellion , stalled since January by a cease-fire , is one of the toughest problems unresolved .

APW_ENG_19941201.0335;0	President Clinton will ask for an additional dlrs 25 billion for the military budget to help improve the readiness of forces and the quality of life for the troops , Pentagon officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;1	Clinton was slated to announce support for the increase at the White House later in the day , the officials said , speaking on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;2	The money , which would have to be approved by the new Republican-controlled Congress , would help cover a dlrs 40 billion shortfall over five years that had been created by a congressionally required pay raise , and by inflation , the officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;3	`` It focuses , however , on the issue of readiness -- making sure the force is able to conduct and win the nation 's wars , '' one of the senior officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;4	The move is also expected to help Clinton quell Republican charges that the administration has , through its budget cuts , hurt the nation 's defense posture .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;5	The Pentagon officials said it was unclear to them exactly where the administration hoped to glean the additional funds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;6	It comes just two weeks after the Army announced that due to operations in Rwanda , Haiti and elsewhere , had left three of the Army 's 12 divisions far below their peak readiness levels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;7	The new funds are expected to cover several initiatives that would also improve such things as housing and other quality-of-life programs , building on an recent announcement by Defense Secretary William Perry that more money would be put into such things , a second official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;8	Perry and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff , Gen. John Shalikashvili , were to be present for the announcement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;9	`` This means that there will be more flying hours for pilots , more steaming hours for ships , '' which helps the force remain ready to conduct combat operations at a moment 's notice , the second official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;10	They said the announcement will not include decisions about potential weapons program cuts that were being pondered by Deputy Defense Secretary John Deutch , and that had been expected to be revealed this month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0335;11	Deutch had been looking at the potential for canceling , stretching out or cutting back 10 major weapons programs , including such things as the Air Force 's F-22 fighter jet , the Army 's Commance helicopter , the TSSAM Tri-service Standoff Attack Missile and the Marine 's AAAV Advanced Amphibious Assault Vehicle .

APW_ENG_19941201.0336;0	NATO asked Germany on Thursday to send fighter planes to patrol the skies over Bosnia in a mission that would place the German military in a combat role for the first time since World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;1	It will be a thorny decision for Chancellor Helmut Kohl and his aides , who have shied away from involvement in Bosnia-Herzegovina because of the history of Nazi atrocities in former Yugoslavia and anti-German sentiment among many Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;2	But it will also be a difficult request for Germany to turn down because of Kohl 's repeated assertions that his nation , seeking more international influence , must bear its share of peacekeeping responsibilities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;3	One official said he assumed Kohl supported the mission or the request would n't have been made in the first place .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;4	But support was n't clear in parliament , which would probably have to approve the mission with a simple majority .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;5	Lt. Col. Joe Cato , spokesman for NATO 's European military headquarters in Casteau , Belgium , said that the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe `` has requested -LRB- that -RRB- the German armed forces provide some combat aircraft to support NATO air operations over parts of former Yugoslavia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;6	NATO requested German Tornado planes equipped with electronic gear that can locate and identify radar sites and rockets designed to destroy such sites , a German defense official said , speaking on background .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;7	The Tornado planes could help prevent Serb attacks on NATO planes patroling Bosnia to enforce the U.N. humanitarian mission and also could protect supply flights to Sarajevo , the official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;8	Supply flights to Sarajevo from Italy were broken off after Serbs fired missiles at two British Tornados last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;9	German officials could not confirm a report in the weekly Rheinische Merkur newspaper that the NATO request came after Britain decided to withdraw its fighters from the Bosnia mission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;10	A July decision of Germany 's highest court gave the government the green light for the first time in the postwar era to engage in peacekeeping missions outside the NATO area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;11	But `` whether we ... should really choose former Yugoslavia as the place to step up our engagement is something I believe we should consider very carefully , '' Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said in Brussels , Belgium .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;12	Kohl has said Germany can not send ground troops to former Yugoslavia because of the bitter memories over the hundreds of thousands of Serbs , Jews and others murdered by the German army and SS officers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;13	The opposition Social Democrats , in a statement , opposed any German combat mission in Bosnia , saying it would n't have a pacifying effect .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;14	`` Every Serbian family mourns a victim of the Germans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0336;15	I have to ask whether it makes a difference if we 're on the ground or in the air , '' said Walter Kolbow , a defense expert for the party .

APW_ENG_19941201.0340;0	Russia 's prisons are overcrowded and inhumane , with underfed inmates crammed into stinking , standing-room-only cells , a U.N. report said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;1	Conditions in pre-trial detention centers -- where first-time offenders accused of petty crimes can wait up to five years for a court appearance -- are even worse than labor camps for hardened convicts , the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;2	`` The oppressive heat , lack of oxygen , and the odors of sweat , excrement and disease created by gross overcrowding are overpowering , '' said Nigel Rodley , the U.N. 's special investigator on torture , who wrote the report .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;3	At the invitation of the Russian government , Rodley spent two weeks visiting prisons near Moscow and St. Petersburg , including four pre-trial centers , two police headquarters , one labor camp , one juvenile center and one hospital for seriously ill prisoners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;4	The Russian government estimates there are 500,000 prisoners in about 528 prisons and penal colonies throughout the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;5	Russia has the highest rate of detentions in the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;6	Rodley said the skyrocketing crime rate following the end of communist control has worsened already serious overcrowding in prisons .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;7	He criticized Russian authorities for responding to public concern about crime by throwing petty offenders into jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;8	He called on President Boris Yeltsin to issue a presidential decree releasing 71,000 non-violent , first-time offenders to ease the overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;9	`` It 's a radical proposal because it 's a radical problem which needs to be addressed urgently , '' Rodley said at a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;10	He said beatings and maltreatment were widespread .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;11	`` The conditions are cruel , inhuman and degrading ; they are torturous , '' he wrote about cells in Moscow 's Butryskaya prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;12	`` There is virtually no daylight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;13	There is insufficient room for everyone to lie down , sit down or even stand up at the same time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;14	Butryrskaya prison was constructed in 1771 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;15	Built for 3,500 prisoners , it now holds 6,300 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;16	`` The food , not always available because of the indebtedness of the institutions -- is primitive , of a fat-saturated soupy nature .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;17	It is consumed in the cell and is excreted in the cell , '' the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;18	In another Moscow detention center , Matrosskaya Tishina No. 1 , conditions in quarantine cells for sick prisoners were atrocious .
APW_ENG_19941201.0340;19	`` Despite the fact that several of the inmates had open , festering sores , severe fungal infections with decaying flesh , and extensive rashes , they reported that they had not seen a doctor in over a week , '' Rodley wrote .

APW_ENG_19941201.0341;2	But major Brazilian newspapers ran the story Thursday and reported the appointment as a done deed .

APW_ENG_19941201.0341;5	The stock market in Sao Paulo , Brazil 's biggest city and financial center , rose 3.5 percent in Thursday morning trading before slipping back to a 2.2 percent rise at midday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0341;6	Malan , 51 , is a former director of the Interamerican Development Bank , Brazil 's delegate to the World Bank and the country 's chief negotiator with private foreign creditors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0341;7	More importantly , he helped to elaborate the anti-inflation plan that Cardoso enacted as finance minister , before quitting to run for the presidency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0341;8	The Real Plan , named for the dollar-pegged currency created on July 1 , cut inflation from 50 percent a month in June to 3 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0341;9	Its success gave Cardoso a first-ballot victory in the Oct. 3 election .

APW_ENG_19941201.0341;11	He also said he hoped to retain his economic advisers , whom he called `` geniuses . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0341;12	Malan flew to Rio on Thursday and declined to confirm or deny his appointment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0341;13	But he admitted that he was a possible choice .

APW_ENG_19941201.0343;2	He did not elaborate , the paper said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0343;3	Dahmer , who admitted to killing 17 young men and boys , died Monday after being found in a pool of blood in a gymnasium bathroom at the Columbia Correctional Institution .
APW_ENG_19941201.0343;4	He was assigned to clean the bathroom while on a work detail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0343;5	Another inmate , Jesse Anderson , died Wednesday of injuries he sustained the same morning .
APW_ENG_19941201.0343;6	The Journal quoted the source as saying that a conspiracy is n't thought to involve prison employees .
APW_ENG_19941201.0343;7	Rather , other inmates are being investigated , including two brought to the gym for a recreation period when the bodies were discovered , the source said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0343;11	Dahmer , 34 , had confessed to killing 17 young men and boys , mutilating and sometimes cannibalizing or eating his victims .
APW_ENG_19941201.0343;12	He had been behind bars since July 1991 , when a handcuffed man escaped from him and led Milwaukee police to an apartment full of body parts .

APW_ENG_19941201.0347;0	A rebel Serb assembly that met Thursday was expected to endorse an economic agreement with Croatia despite two days of artillery duels between the two sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;1	Croatia 's army and Serbs lobbed artillery shells at each other most of the past two days , said U.N. spokesman Paul Risley .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;2	The two sides have had thousands of skirmishes and larger confronations since ending their 7-month war with an uneasy , U.N.-patrolled truce in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;3	On Wednesday , the Croatian army fired 33 shells at Serb-held territory over a six-hour period , U.N. spokesman Alexander Ivanko said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;4	Artillery duels continued Thursday in the same locations close to Knin , Risley said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;5	Reporters in the nearby Croatian port of Split saw unusual activity by Croatian army helicopters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;6	Negotiations between the two sides have been stalled , but the Serbs ' self-styled government late Wednesday recommended that the assembly meeting in this Croatian Serb stronghold approve the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;7	If accepted , it would be the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their seven-month war in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;8	The draft agreement under discussion at the closed-door Knin meeting calls for restoration of water and electricity supply and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;9	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;10	The deal , supported by powerful Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and drafted with the help of international negotiators , was viewed as a possible step toward the gradual reintegration of the Serb Krajina region into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;11	Croatian Serb leaders rejected the economic accord two weeks ago .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;12	Now , after meeting Milosevic , they have dropped those objections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;13	However , the session started amid fresh threats of possible new warfare between Croatia and rebel Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;14	Croatia is chafing at Serb control over one-third of its territory , and holds out the option of taking the territory back by force .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;15	And Croatian officials warned they were ready to intervene in the Bihac pocket in northwestern Bosnia when rebel Serbs from Croatia crossed the border to fight Bosnia 's Muslim-led army .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;16	They say the fighting proves that Croats must look out for their own security .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;17	Nevertheless , officials in Knin seemed in a positive mood .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;18	`` I expect the assembly to approve the agreement , '' Milan Babic , the Croatian Serb `` foreign minister '' told reporters before the session .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;19	He said that `` economic relations will not prejudge political solution . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;20	U.N. sources in Knin said that Borislav Mikelic , the rebel Serb prime minister , was expected to sign the agreement at a local U.N. headquarters on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;21	Croatian officials refused to sign the agreement Thursday because the first Yugoslavia , called The Kingdom of the Serbs , Croats and Slovenes , was formed Dec. 1 , 1918 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;22	The Croats are expected to sign at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , the Croatian capital , on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;23	Croatian authorities , who reject any reminder of former Yugoslavia , have already endorsed the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;24	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since a tenuous cease-fire was reached in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0347;25	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941201.0348;0	Gasoline prices and the salaries of government workers will go up by 20 percent , the military government said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0348;1	A statement said the government had been subsidizing pump prices of fuel despite increased prices on the international market .
APW_ENG_19941201.0348;2	`` Regrettably , this situation is no longer tenable , especially when the government needs to generate optimum resources to pursue the rebel war , '' the statement explained .
APW_ENG_19941201.0348;3	Last week , the government launched a huge offensive against southern-based rebels who have been fighting to overthrow the government since 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0348;4	Gasoline goes up by 20 percent to 1,650 leones -LRB- dlrs 2.75 -RRB- a gallon -LRB- 3.8 liters -RRB- immediately , while government workers will get pay rises from January .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;0	President Hafez Assad on Thursday again held Israel responsible for the deadlock in peace talks with Syria .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;1	Speaking in a joint news conference after talks with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak , Assad said `` the situation of peace talks on the Syrian track is still unchanged and no progress has been made . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;2	The Syrian leader said Israel was `` making demands that Syria can never accept . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;3	He did not specify the demands .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;4	Mubarak 's visit came a few days ahead of a scheduled trip to the region by U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher , his sixth this year in an effort to break the deadlock in the Syrian-Israeli negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;5	These have been stalled since February over Syria 's demand that Israel declare its willingness to make a complete withdrawal from the Golan Heights .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;6	Israel captured the strategic plateau in southwestern Syria in the 1967 Middle East war and annexed it in 1981 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;7	Israel has so far only offered a partial withdrawal phased over several years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;8	Damascus has rejected that .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;9	In reply to a question , Assad denied that `` any side has discussed with Syria the question of deploying U.S. forces in the Golan . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;10	President Clinton assured Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin last month that he would consider sending U.S. troops to the Golan as part of an international peacekeeping force .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;11	Egyptian sources , speaking on condition of anonymity , said Mubarak had been expected to brief Assad on the outcome of his recent tour of European capitals , where he sought financial aid for the Palestinian National Authority .
APW_ENG_19941201.0349;12	Mubarak flew back to Egypt after the news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;0	The U.N. mediator for Angola was in Zaire Thursday trying to persuade UNITA rebel officials to return here for the first time in two years and help oversee a truce and power-sharing deal to end 19 years of war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;1	U.N. officials said Alioune Blondin Beye had left for Zaire late Wednesday , delaying a planned visit Thursday to New York where he was to brief the U.N. Security Council on the shaky 10-day-old truce .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;2	Both UNITA and the government have accused each other of violating the cease-fire called Nov. 22 , two days after a peace treaty was signed in Lusaka , Zambia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;3	But there has been a general reduction in fighting across the war-ravaged nation and the U.N. mission here has deployed its first military observers to six sites .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;4	A 7,000-strong U.N. peace keeping force has been promised to anchor the treaty that should lead to power sharing between government and rebels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;5	But blue helmeted troops will only be deployed once the truce is seen to be holding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;6	Angola 's war erupted on the eve of independence from Portugal in 1975 , has killed a half-million Angolans and left millions more threatened by starvation and disease .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;7	Peace accords in 1991 brought a brief respite but UNITA lost multiparty elections a year later , cried foul and returned to war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;8	Beye , broker of the year-long talks in Lusaka that produced the accord , last week announced UNITA officials would return to Luanda for the first time since losing the elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;9	But the rebels did not show , citing logistics difficulties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;10	Leaders of UNITA - the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola - have been on the run since their main base in the central city of Huambo fell to the government early November .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;11	Rebel chief Jonas Savimbi has not been seen in public for months , prompting rumors he had been killed or wounded in a government attack , or that he was seriously ill and was being treated in Zaire or Morocco .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;12	The U.N. mission in Angola has posted military observers in six cities : Uige , Huambo , Luena , Menongue , Saurimo and Lubango .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;13	Government sources working closely with the U.N. mission say initial plans foresee deploying 7,450 blue helmeted peace keepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;14	The largest contingents are to be posted in the war-torn north and center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;15	The central provinces of Huambo , Bie , Benguela and Cuanza-Sul will receive 2,000 peacekeepers , while Luanda and the north will get 1,800 , according to the plans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0350;16	The rebels ' former southern headquarters , Jamba , is also to be a peace keeping base , the sources said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0351;1	The move completed the initial stage of handing over day-to-day affairs in the West Bank to Palestinians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;2	It also came amid growing calls in Israel for shutting off Palestinians from Israel because of a series of attacks in which 32 Israelis have been killed since early October .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;3	About 1,000 people gathered Thursday in the northern Israeli town of Afula for the funeral of the latest victim , 19-year-old woman soldier Liat Gabai , who was axed to death on Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;4	A suspect detained Wednesday , Wahib Abu Rub , 24 , from the West Bank town of Qabatiyah , has told interrogators he was from the Islamic Resistance Movement or Hamas , Israel radio said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;5	The same group claimed the Oct. 19 Tel Aviv bus bombing that killed 22 people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;6	`` I killed the soldier , '' Abu Rub confessed on Israel television , as he was led by police to a West Bank court Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;7	Police Minister Moshe Shahal responded by calling Thursday for completely shutting off the West Bank and Gaza Strip from Israel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;8	`` There is no alternative other than to demand separation , '' Shahal said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0351;10	A closure could also bring further violence , by preventing thousands of Palestinian day workers from entering Israel to earn a living .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;11	Palestinian and Israeli leaders have blamed growing support for Islamic radicals on economic troubles in the PLO-run Gaza Strip .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;12	Despite the violence , talks were expected to begin next week on stage two of the autonomy given Gaza and the West Bank town of Jericho last May -- redeployment of Israeli troops in the West Bank and Palestinian elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;13	Israel 's concern for the safety of 120,000 Jewish settlers has prompted some officials to propose skipping the interim phase altogether and negotiating the final status of these territories now , rather than in 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;14	Still , a gradual hand over of responsibilities to Palestinians proceeded in the West Bank where two ceremonies were held marking the transfer of the health and tax systems .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;15	The PLO has since August also taken charge of education , tourism and welfare in the West Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;16	`` What we have completed gives the Palestinians a first entrance to the West Bank , '' said West Bank military governor Brig. Gen. Gadi Zohar , signing over the tax department to Palestinian Finance Minister Mohammed Nashashibi in Ramallah .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;17	In Brussels , foreign donors this week released dlrs 125 million pledged earlier , mostly to help the Palestinians meet running costs for a few months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;18	Deputy Finance Minister Atef Alawneh said he hoped to collect dlrs 300-400 million annually in taxes , and remarked , `` we can not depend for the rest of our lives on the donor countries and the foreign investors in building our Palestinian state . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;19	George Rishmawi , a Beit Zahour textile factory owner , once jailed by Israel for boycotting military government taxes was hopeful about what he called the start of `` a new era .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;20	We have paid the Israelis enough .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;21	They ripped us off .
APW_ENG_19941201.0351;22	They were thieves with licenses . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0352;0	Egypt wants to buy 12 more Apache helicopters from McDonnell Douglas Helicopter Systems here in a deal valued at dlrs 318 million , federal officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0352;1	The Pentagon notified Congress on Wednesday of Egypt 's request .
APW_ENG_19941201.0352;2	Lawmakers have about a month after convening in January to approve the proposed sale .
APW_ENG_19941201.0352;3	If there are no objections from Congress , negotiations would begin between the U.S. Army and Egypt on the final price and delivery dates .

APW_ENG_19941201.0352;5	This is Egypt 's second Apache order .
APW_ENG_19941201.0352;6	The country has taken delivery of all 24 Apaches ordered in January 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0352;7	A total of 104 Apaches , which are the U.S. Army 's main attack helicopter , have been sold to Egypt , Saudi Arabia , United Arab Emirates , Israel and Greece .

APW_ENG_19941201.0353;1	The match was stopped twice -- for a total of one hour -- as West Indies skipper Courtney Walsh took his team off the field in the face of flying soft drink bottles , fruit and rocks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;2	Referee Raman Subba Row blamed the local authorities for poor crowd control .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;3	Police later ringed the field .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;4	It was not immediately clear why the crowd became irate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;5	`` We are lucky that no one was seriously hurt , '' Row said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;6	Stuart Williams was hit before lunch , while Phil Simmons at deep extra cover region was hit with a piece of fruit just after tea .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;7	In the morning , India , which won the opener of the three-test series , won the toss and opted to bat .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;8	Sidhu scored his sixth test century , including 17 fours , and Tendulkar added an unbeaten 81 in sharing a three-hour third-wicket stand .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;9	Sidhu was out for 107 offering a simple catch to wicketkeeper Murray off Carl Hooper .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;10	Tendulkar had a dozen boundaries off 155 balls in just over three hours .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;11	Venkatapathy Raju came in to bat as the night watchman after Sidhu was sent to the stands , but he could not stay long and fell to paceman Walsh caught by Brian Adams for two .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;12	Off-spinner Hooper struck as soon as he pressed into the attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0353;13	Bowling a good line and turning the ball just enough to beat the bat , he dislodged Manoj Prabhakar and Vinod Kambli in quick succession .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;0	Ernesto Zedillo , a mild-mannered economist whose rise to power capped a tragic and tumultous year of rebellion and political assassination , was sworn in Thursday as the 63rd president of Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;1	`` I assume the duties of president with honor , '' said Zedillo after taking up the red-green-and-white presidential sash in a ceremony before 1,500 Mexican and foreign leaders at the ornate Chamber of Deputies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;2	Zedillo vowed that the Mexican army will maintain the cease-fire in Chiapas state , where Indian rebels are threatening to resume fighting that erupted Jan. 1 at a cost of more than 145 lives .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;3	`` The Mexican army will unilateraly maintain the cease-fire , '' promised Zedillo , wearing a dark suit and silk tie in his first address to the nation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;4	`` There will not be violence in Chiapas . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;5	He added that he hoped the guerrilla fighters would not renew their violent campaign , saying Mexico must unite in a common fight to eradicate the poverty that sowed rebellion and open a dialogue for peace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;6	Zedillo promised to launch a war on poverty that would bring greater prosperity to millions of his 90 million compatriots untouched by the free-trade economic reforms of his predecessor .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;7	Former President Carlos Salinas de Gortari , who negotiated the North American Free Trade Agreement with the United States and Canada , was loudly applauded as Zedillo paid him tribute .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;8	`` Carlos Salinas de Gortari will always have my gratitude and the appreciation of the people of Mexico , '' said Zedillo after taking up the presidential sash , which he will hold through the end of the century .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;9	`` Mexico has prospered and our fathers achieved great advances .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;10	But those are n't enough .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;11	Millions of Mexicans are lacking the basics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;12	Millions live on the margin , millions live in undignified poverty , '' said Zedillo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;13	Outside the hall where Zedillo spoke , military bands struck up martial waltzes and Mexican mariachi musicians warmed up a huge street fiesta on the parade route to the National Palace , festive in red and green bunting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;14	Hundreds of soldiers and eight armored personnel carriers guarded the route on a national holiday when not all wanted to celebrated .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;15	`` Out with Zedillo ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;16	and `` Zedillo No ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;17	more than 4,000 anti-government demonstrators shouted , some of them brandishing sticks and machetes , during a protest a mile away in downtown Mexico City .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;18	The protesters , mostly farmers in straw sombreros , raised banners of the leftist Democratic Revolution Party , a vocal opponent of Mexico 's dominant rule by the Institutional Revolutionary Party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;19	But police did not intervene .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;20	U.S. Vice President Al Gore , one of 63 foreign dignitaries attending , said 1994 brought `` unprecedented progress in the bilateral relationship between the United States and Mexico ... and we look forward to even greater improvement in the year ahead . '
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;21	Cuba 's Fidel Castro also was on hand along with most Latin American leaders , inspiring a protest by about 50 opponents of his Communist government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;22	Zedillo has promised to further the economic reforms of Salinas , who negotiated NAFTA , sold off hundreds of money-losing state businesses , and turned the economy around from an inflationary crisis of the 1980s .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;23	Zedillo , a former Mexicali shoeshine boy achieved a Yale doctorate in economics .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;24	Bypassed once for his party 's presidential nomination , he was thrust into the campaign by the March 23 assassination of Luis Donaldo Colosio , first choice of the Institutional Revolutionary Party , or PRI .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;25	He won the presidency Aug. 21 in the most credible elections ever held in Mexico , pledging to use the near-absolute powers of Mexico 's presidency to weaken his own office and give his own party greater independence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;26	`` As president I will not intervene in the affairs of the PRI , '' he said of his party , which has governed for 65 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;27	Zedillo also said he will give greater independence to the congress , the courts and local governments and end the practice of having the president handpick all top PRI candidates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;28	Zedillo , former budget and planning minister under Salinas , signaled he would further free-market polices by his Cabinet choices announced Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;29	Mexico 's leading negotiators of NAFTA were named heads of treasury , trade and foreign policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0354;30	Seven other free-market economists also were named to the 25-person cabinet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;0	President Clinton on Thursday proposed spending dlrs 25 billion more for the military to help improve the readiness and working conditions of U.S. forces around the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;1	Flanked by the nation 's top military officers , Clinton announced support for the increase which would be spread over five years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;2	The proposal will be presented to the new Republican-controlled Congress next year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;3	Republicans have promised to increase defense spending while cutting back on other programs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;4	`` I have pledged that throughout the life of this administration our military will remain the best trained , best equipped , the best fighting force on earth , '' Clinton said at the White House .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;5	`` We ask much of our military and we owe much to them , '' Clinton said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;6	The president disputed a suggestion that his request for additional Pentagon spending was an acknowledgement that he had cut too much last year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;7	He said the request was because of unanticipated deployments to the Persian Gulf , Haiti and elsewhere .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;8	The money would help cover a dlrs 40 billion shortfall over five years that had been created by a congressionally required pay raise , and by inflation , the officials said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;9	The move is also expected to help Clinton quell Republican charges that the administration has , through its budget cuts , hurt the nation 's defense posture .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;10	Pentagon officials said it was unclear to them exactly where the administration hoped to glean the additional funds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;11	The announcement came just two weeks after the Army announced that due to operations in Rwanda , Haiti and elsewhere , had left three of the Army 's 12 divisions far below their peak readiness levels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;12	The new funds are expected to cover several initiatives that would also improve such things as housing and other quality-of-life programs , building on an recent announcement by Defense Secretary William Perry that more money would be put into such things , a second official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;13	Perry and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff , Gen. John Shalikashvili , were to be present for the announcement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;14	`` This means that there will be more flying hours for pilots , more steaming hours for ships , '' which helps the force remain ready to conduct combat operations at a moment 's notice , a Pentagon official said , speaking on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;15	Officials said the announcement does not cover decisions about potential weapons program cuts that were being pondered by Deputy Defense Secretary John Deutch , and that had been expected to be revealed this month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;16	Deutch had been looking at the potential for canceling , stretching out or cutting back 10 major weapons programs , including such things as the Air Force 's F-22 fighter jet , the Army 's Commance helicopter , the TSSAM Tri-service Standoff Attack Missile and the Marine 's AAAV Advanced Amphibious Assault Vehicle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0355;17	This year , the administration 's Pentagon 's fiscal 1995 budget amounted to dlrs 264 billion .

APW_ENG_19941201.0359;0	Russian Defense Minister Pavel Grachev said Thursday the ministry 's central office and general staff will be trimmed , but not by 30 percent as reported earlier .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;1	Grachev said the number of deputy defense ministers would be reduced , and several other areas of the ministry 's infrastrure would be reorganized , according to the Interfax news agency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;2	The cuts will take place in the near future , `` but not by 30 percent as the mass media reported earlier , '' Grachev was quoted as saying .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;3	According to newspaper reports last week , President Boris Yeltsin has drafted a decree ordering deep cuts in the defense ministry 's central office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;4	The draft decree has received preliminary approval of the Cabinet and Yeltsin 's Security Council , the daily Nezavisimaya Gazeta reported Tuesday , quoting well-informed sources .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;5	Yeltsin has already ordered cuts in the army rank and file .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;6	The army , which numbered 3.7 million men during the Cold War , is down to 1.9 million and is scheduled to gradually hit 1.5 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0359;7	Grachev said the reductions in the central office will be carried out by uniting several departments of the Defense Ministry and other `` organizational rearrangements '' to prevent duplication of labor .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;0	French petroleum group Total signed a three-year , dlrs 1 billion contract Thursday with China 's Sinochem on cross sales of petroleum and chemical products like resins , inks , adhesives and paints .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;1	Michel Chevet , Total 's representative in China , also stated that Total signed a frame contract to supply crude oil to Unipec , a joint subsidiary of Sinochem and Sinopec of China .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;2	The supplies in 1995 will be 60,000 barrels per day .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;3	Total meanwhile entered into a memorandum of understanding with the city of Dalian indicating its full backing for an oil terminal project in which Total will hold 24 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;4	The terminal will be able to receive crude oil from the Middle East and supply a nearby refinery in which Total has a 20 percent stake .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;5	It involves an overall investment of dlrs 100 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;6	Start-up is expected during 1995 , with Total to supply 50 percent of the crude oil requirements and receive 50 percent of the export products .
APW_ENG_19941201.0360;7	The joint venture involves Sinochem , the Ministry of Chemical Industry and two Chinese municipalities .
