APW_ENG_19941201.0391;0	An American collector paid more than dlrs 2.3 million Thursday for a `` lost '' manuscript by 19th century composer Robert Schumann , a record price for a music manuscript .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;1	The manuscript of Schumann 's second symphony , auctioned by Sotheby 's , contains a lost passage for the bassoon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;2	New York collector Robin Lehman paid 1,486,500 pounds -LRB- dlrs 2,334,000 -RRB- for the manuscript , bidding by telephone through London dealer James Kirkman , a Sotheby 's statement said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;3	Some scholars had believed the manuscript , written in 1846-47 , destroyed during Allied bombing raids on Leipzig during World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;4	In fact , it was sold into private hands in 1950 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;5	Sotheby 's would not name the seller .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;6	The manuscript is so heavily marked with revisions and deletions that on some pages , new passages had been pasted over .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;7	One passage was lost that way , although Schumann said he favored it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;8	In an 1846 letter to Felix Mendelssohn , who conducted the symphony 's first performance in Hamburg , Schumann said he had a `` particular fondness '' for `` my melancholy bassoon in the Adagio . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;9	It was not known what he meant until recently , when the passage was discovered underneath a pasted-in revision in the manuscript .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;10	Schumann , who died in 1856 from what is today believed syphilis , discusses in the letter how the symphony reflected the state of his mind .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;11	`` I wrote the symphony ... when I was still half-sick ; it seems to me that one must hear this in it , '' he wrote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;12	The previous record for a musical manuscript was set in 1989 for Schumann 's piano concerto in A Minor , which sold for 880,000 pounds -LRB- dlrs 1,382,000 -RRB- , Sotheby 's said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0391;13	The largest single price paid for a group of musical works was for manuscripts of nine Mozart symphonies , which brought in 2,350,000 pounds -LRB- dlrs 3,700,000 -RRB- in 1987 , it said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0393;0	Lane Tarleton sold his sewing factory this week , rather than face the foreign competition that GATT is expected to bring .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;1	Adobe Apparel Inc. made T-shirts , sweatshirts and dresses for companies like Russell Corp. , maker of the Russell Athletics brand .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;2	Tarleton said Wednesday he was lucky to have found a buyer for his Greenwood company in an industry he called `` a dying breed . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;3	`` I have spent the last five years trying to build a company , and in my opinion the government has destroyed the sewing machine industries by approving two things : NAFTA and GATT , '' he said , referring to the global General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade and the North American Free Trade Agreement signed this year between the United States , Mexico and Canada .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;4	Most textile and apparel shops are n't expected to close their doors if the Senate approves the GATT on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;5	The House of Representatives passed the measure Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;6	Even healthy companies , such as Arkwright Mills in Spartanburg , expect the 124-nation trade pact to hurt , although they acknowledge parts of it could help the industry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;7	`` I think it 's about the best they could have done , '' said Earl Gowan , a payroll clerk at Arkwright for 53 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;8	Other workers interviewed Wednesday said they had faith that expanded trade would keep their jobs from heading overseas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;9	`` We really do n't know what 's going to happen , but we 're hoping it 's going to bring more jobs to the South , '' said Reba Rothrock , 65 , a 25-year veteran at Arkwright .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;10	The mill 's president and treasurer , MacFarland Cates , expects his family-owned company will have to fight off competition from the Far East , long a producer of inexpensive cloth .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;11	GATT aims to lower tariffs worldwide , including those in the United States on imported cloth and on other foreign-made goods .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;12	It also would phase out quotas on imported textiles , another move expected to eliminate U.S. jobs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;13	Still , the agreement gives the industry a weapon it has wanted for years , making it illegal for garments assembled in China to be exported to the United States under the `` Made in Hong Kong '' label .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;14	For that reason , Cates and many others in the textile and apparel industries would like to see the treaty approved by this Congress .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;15	They feel it would offer at least some protection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;16	`` I 'd love to see GATT killed , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;17	But given the choice between this or a version without the rule of origin amendment , `` I 'd rather see them pass this now . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;18	Arkwright 's 300 workers make cloth used in sportswear , surgical towels , work gloves , even horse blankets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;19	Twenty years ago , foreign competition forced it to close two of its three mills and cut most of its 1,200 workers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;20	Those who are left now make twice as much cloth , and Cates says that efficiency will be the company 's key to survival .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;21	He hopes to expand by modernizing equipment and producing small orders that larger companies ignore .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;22	`` We 've tried to build in efficiency , quality and flexibility so we can jump around and fill different niches .
APW_ENG_19941201.0393;23	We think that maybe we 're in a better position to fight than some of the larger companies , '' Cates said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;0	Yasser Arafat 's government took control of tax collection and health care in the West Bank on Thursday , the latest step in transferring management of Palestinians ' day-to-day affairs to the PLO .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;1	In recent months , the Palestine Liberation Organization , which runs the 6-month-old autonomy arrangement in the Gaza Strip and Jericho , has taken charge of education , tourism and welfare in the West Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;2	Taxes and the health system complete the initial stage of self-rule , though Israeli troops still occupy all the West Bank except Jericho .

APW_ENG_19941201.0397;4	Thirty-two Israelis have been killed since early October .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;5	About 1,000 people gathered Thursday in the northern Israeli town of Afula for the funeral of the latest victim , Liat Gabai , a 19-year-old woman soldier who was axed to death on Wednesday .

APW_ENG_19941201.0397;13	Palestinian and Israeli leaders have blamed economic troubles in the Gaza Strip for the growing support for Islamic radicals .

APW_ENG_19941201.0397;15	Israel is worried that the PLO can not guarantee the safety of the 120,000 Jewish settlers once the army pulls out of Palestinian towns as stipulated in their peace accord .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;16	There are calls to renegotiate the agreement , including a proposal Wednesday by Deputy Foreign Minister Yossi Beilin to skip the interim phase altogether and begin talks now on the final status of the West Bank , Gaza Strip and Jerusalem .

APW_ENG_19941201.0397;19	During the six-year uprising against Israeli occupation , many Palestinians refused to pay taxes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;20	Israel retaliated by denying tax evaders documents such as drivers ' licenses and travel papers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0397;21	Alawneh said tax debts going back to the Israeli era would not be forgiven , and only fines and interest would be canceled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;0	A Bulgarian diplomat , a stockbroker , two rabbis and a Swiss couple were among 23 people accused of laundering more than dlrs 100 million in drug proceeds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;1	Carlo A. Boccia of the Drug Enforcement Administration said the defendants had a common motivation -- `` greed , a true example of how drug profits do corrupt at all levels of society . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;2	Boccia , special agent in charge of the New York office , said Wednesday that the defendants were part of a money laundering cell that enabled tens of millions of dollars to flow between major U.S. cities and Germany , Switzerland and Italy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;3	Boccia joined U.S. Attorney Mary Jo White , New York FBI head William A. Gavin and Police Commissioner William Bratton in condemning the alleged participation of otherwise respected professionals in the drug trade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;4	`` Money became the narcotic , '' Gavin said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;5	`` It shows the pervasive influence of drugs in our society . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;6	`` It is white-collar crime at its worst , '' White said , likening the defendants ' alleged deeds to those of street dealers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;7	`` The range of professions involved in this was surprising and somewhat depressing , '' said White , noting that a lawyer who was arrested practiced often at the federal courthouse in Manhattan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;8	A federal complaint charged 23 defendants with participating in a major international ring that laundered tens of millions of dollars in the last year alone .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;9	Among the group was an assistant manager at Citibank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;10	The organization operated in New York , Los Angeles , Houston , Chicago and Miami in the United States as well as in Germany , Switzerland , Italy , Puerto Rico and Colombia , authorities said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;11	During the probe , investigators seized dlrs 5 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;12	They arrested all but four of those named in a complaint , which was sealed until Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;13	According to court documents , the leaders of the organization in the United States were Richard Spence , a businessman who was formerly a New York City firefighter ; lawyer Harvey Weinig ; and Robert Hirsch , Weinig 's law partner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;14	Hirsch , 41 , has pleaded guilty to money laundering and other charges in a plea bargain with prosecutors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;15	White charged that the three arranged for the pickup of narcotics proceeds from street corners and hotel rooms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;16	Also arrested were Leon Weinmann and his wife , Rachel , of Switzerland , who were lured to the United States for a meeting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;17	The complaint charged that the Zurich couple received cash and wire transfers and remitted them to bank accounts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;18	Swiss authorities have blocked about a half dozen accounts at several banks in Zurich at the request of U.S. officials in connection with the case , Zurich prosecutor Marc Ziegler said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;19	He said the authorities asked the banks , which he declined to name , to provide information on the accounts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;20	Among those allegedly sent as couriers were police Officer Michael T. Kalanz , firefighter Charles Bruno , hospital administrator Gary Salerno , Los Angeles-based stockbroker Donald J. Hayden and rabbis Alexander Schwartz and Menashe Leifer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;21	Also arrested was Latchezar Christov , an honorary consul general for the Republic of Bulgaria .
APW_ENG_19941201.0398;22	Those arrested were charged with conspiracy and money laundering .
APW_ENG_19941201.0399;0	Russia on Thursday upset NATO 's plans for expanding its membership to former Warsaw Pact foes by claiming the move would create a new division in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0399;1	In an extraordinary session , Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev departed from a prepared speech to criticize the allies for ordering aides to draw up the terms and conditions for future membership .
APW_ENG_19941201.0399;2	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told a group of grim-faced foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0399;3	The Russian had been invited to the meeting to endorse a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts with Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0399;4	The special ties had been designed to ease Russia 's fears of an eastward drive by the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0399;5	But Kozyrev refused to agree to the documents .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;0	and when -- to open its doors to its former foes in Eastern Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;1	Poland , Hungary and others have repeatedly demanded coveted membership cards and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;2	In an effort to meet their demands -- but without upsetting Russia , the allies thought they had found a good formula .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;3	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , to bring former foes closer , but without membership .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;4	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .

APW_ENG_19941201.0400;6	`` We took significant , concrete steps toward ... expansion '' of the alliance , Christopher said afterward .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;7	The move was intended to be a cautious one .

APW_ENG_19941201.0400;9	But Kozyrev accused NATO of trying to make a fresh division on the European continent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;10	Some members of Partnership for Peace , he said , were destined to become members , while others would remain behind .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;11	`` Not all countries will be able to obtain membership at the same time , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0400;12	`` There needs to be some sort of clarification . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;0	Nordic navigation authorities agreed on stiffer rules Thursday that would require stronger hinges and better monitoring of cargo doors on ferries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;1	The rules , which still must be approved by maritime officials , were drafted in the wake of the Estonia ferry disaster , which sank Sept. 28 after its door locks failed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;2	More than 900 people died .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;3	Insurance companies and ferry lines at the time acted quicked to weld shut the doors and visors on ships .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;4	But only the Finnish government issued a blanket order for weldings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;5	The navigation authorities from Sweden , Finland , Norway and Denmark , meeting in Helsinki , agreed on rules that would require hinges on all ferries to be reinforced or replaced , the Swedish news agency TT reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;6	Inspectors had found the weak point to be locks and hinges , rather than the plates that hold them , said Joakim Heimdahl , an official from the Nordic Sea Navigation Board .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;7	`` In many cases , one can see certain sections need replacing or reinforcing , '' Heimdahl said , referring to ship inspections in the past two months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;8	Shipping lines would have the option of upgrading the doors , or welding them shut permanently , Heimdahl said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;9	The rules would apply to all doors , whether hinged at the side or on top -- as was the Estonia 's front visor .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;10	The rules also would require improved monitoring of the doors while the ship is underway , including closed-circuit cameras or other sensors , TT reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;11	Heimdahl conceded that the rules may mean `` sweeping , costly '' changes for older ships , apparently one reason why the decisions were not taken sooner .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;12	Agreement by the navigation board was the first hurdle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0401;13	The proposals were referred to the Nordic Marine Safety Inspection Board , which meets Dec. 13 , TT reported .

APW_ENG_19941201.0403;0	Governments must target bringing down rapidly increasing numbers of women with AIDS , discarding stereotypes that it 's mostly a gay men 's disease , according to politicians and activists at Thursday 's international AIDS summit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;1	Officials from 42 countries pledged to bolster the status of women and ensure their participation in drawing up and implementing AIDS policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;2	The deadly disease is spreading more rapidly among women , who suffer social , sexual and economic oppression , said Hiroshi Nakajima , director general of the World Health Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;3	WHO statistics show that three men for every two women become infected by the HIV virus that causes AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;4	But by the year 2000 , the rates will even out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;5	Although women are contracting HIV at a faster pace , most prevention methods still target men , U.S. Secretary of Health Donna Shalala said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;6	`` We must work together to reduce the vulnerability of women to HIV and AIDS by empowering them to protect themselves against infection -- both with and without reliance on their sexual partners , '' Shalala said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;7	The United States has doubled the amount of research money spent on microbe-killing vaginal creams or gels that are currently in the testing stage , Shalala said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;8	British physician Eileen Rubery said efforts have gained momentum over the last two years to develop a microbicide that women could apply before having sex .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;9	The cream has been tested in Thailand but caused itching and inflammation after frequent use , Rubery said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;10	It has been modified and is again being tested in hopes that a cheap , mass-market alternative to condoms will provide more women with protective choices against AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;11	Yolanda Simon , an AIDS sufferer from Trinidad , urged politicians around the world to increase care not just for women , but their families .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;12	American activists said the U.S. health program fails to take women 's family responsibilities into account , and that more women need to be involved in the administration of such programs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;13	But Phill Wilson , an AIDS victim from Los Angeles , said men should not be left out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;14	`` Women and AIDS is a co-gender issue .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;15	It 's a sexuality issue , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;16	`` It 's as much about homophobia and how gay men are forced to hide their sexuality from their -LRB- heterosexual -RRB- partners . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0403;17	Male education is needed because men are also responsible for having safe sex , Wilson said , especially in countries where women know little about protective measures or are unable to ask their partners to use them .

APW_ENG_19941201.0405;0	Germany was asked by NATO on Thursday to send fighter planes to patrol the skies over Bosnia , in a mission that could involve the German military in combat for the first time since World War II .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;1	Defense Minister Volker Ruehe said Germany must accept the mission , but Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel raised doubts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;2	It will be a thorny decision for Chancellor Helmut Kohl , who has shied from involvement in Bosnia-Herzegovina because of the history of Nazi atrocities in former Yugoslavia and anti-German sentiment among Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;3	It will be a difficult request for Germany to turn down , however , because of Kohl 's repeated assertions that his nation , seeking more international influence , must bear its share of peacekeeping responsibilities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;4	Support was n't clear in parliament , which would probably have to approve any such mission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;5	Lt. Col. Joe Cato , spokesman for NATO 's European military headquarters in Casteau , Belgium , said Germany has been asked to `` provide some combat aircraft to support NATO air operations over parts of former Yugoslavia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;6	NATO requested German Tornado planes equipped with electronic gear that can locate and identify radar sites and rockets designed to destroy such sites , a German defense official said , speaking on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;7	The Tornado planes could help prevent Serb attacks on NATO planes patrolling Bosnia to protect the U.N. humanitarian mission , and also could protect supply flights to Sarajevo , the official said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;8	The need for the specialized planes was highlighted last week , when supply flights to Sarajevo from Italy were called off after Serbs fired missiles at two British Tornados .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;9	German acceptance of the mission could mean a greater say for Germany in NATO policy toward Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;10	German officials have ceded key decisions to nations such as France and Britain , which have ground troops in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;11	If Germany turns down the mission , `` we lose the right to intelligently take part in the discussion on Bosnia-Herzegovina , '' Ruehe , the defense minister , said in comments distributed by the Defense Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;12	But ground troops are out of the question , Ruehe said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;13	German soldiers would be `` part of the problem , not the solution , '' because of the bitter memories over the hundreds of thousands of Serbs , Jews and others murdered by the German army and SS officers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;14	The opposition Social Democrats said any German combat mission in Bosnia was unacceptable .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;15	`` Every Serbian family mourns a victim of the Germans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;16	I have to ask whether it makes a difference if we 're on the ground or in the air , '' said Walter Kolbow , a defense expert for the party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;17	A July decision of the German constitutional court enabled the government to engage in peacekeeping missions outside of NATO countries for the first time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;18	German supply troops were involved in missions in Somalia and Rwanda .
APW_ENG_19941201.0405;19	`` Whether we , after the constitutional court ruling , should really choose former Yugoslavia as the place to step up our engagement , is something I believe we should consider very carefully , '' Kinkel , the foreign minister , said in Brussels , Belgium .

APW_ENG_19941201.0407;2	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told a group of grim-faced foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;3	The Russian had been invited to the meeting to endorse a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts with Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;4	The special ties had been designed to ease Russia 's fears of an eastward drive by the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;5	But Kozyrev refused to agree to the documents .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;6	He said he read the ministers ' statement on membership and immediately called Russian President Boris Yeltsin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;7	`` This communique raises more questions than it answers , '' he said impromptu remarks that were broadcast to reporters at the North Atlantic Treaty Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;8	`` We have to understand what are the intentions of the other partners . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;9	Willy Claes , the alliance 's new secretary-general , sought to respond to Kozyrev 's remarks .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;10	`` It is no change in strategy or policy of NATO .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;11	... There is nothing new , '' he told the Russian just before he left NATO headquarters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;12	`` We are not willing to organize new divisions in Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;13	Kozyrev 's outburst only added to the alliance 's woes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;14	There have been unprecedented strains in recent weeks between the United States and its European allies over the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;15	In an effort to heal the wounds , Christopher swung behind the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;16	It was a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the Europeans , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;17	In the past , Moscow has strongly opposed any move by NATO to draw in its one-time partners in the Warsaw Pact , the defunct Eastern military alliance led by the Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;18	The Europeans in particular have been uneasy about pushing expansion for fear of upsetting Russia , still a formidable military power at the edge of allied territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;19	In an effort to overcome Russian objections , the allies had agreed to develop a `` far-reaching relationship , corresponding with Russia 's size , importance and capabilities . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;20	They had insisted they had no intention of forming a hostile bloc threatening Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;21	`` Having just overcome the division of Europe , we have no desire to see the emergence of new lines of partition , '' the ministers said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;22	A senior U.S. official , speaking a few hours before Kozyrev 's outburst , said , `` The Russians are undoubtedly ambivalent about this . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;23	He spoke on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;24	NATO has been anguishing in recent years over whether -- and when -- to open its doors to its former foes in Eastern Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;25	Poland , Hungary and others have repeatedly demanded coveted membership cards and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;26	In an effort to meet their demands -- but without upsetting Russia , the allies thought they had found a good formula .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;27	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , to bring former foes closer , but without membership .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;28	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;29	On Thursday , the allies decided to go further by ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the terms and conditions for expanding the Western military alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;30	`` We took significant , concrete steps toward ... expansion '' of the alliance , Christopher said afterward .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;31	The move was intended to be a cautious one .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;32	No list of front-runners for membership will be made ; no date set for the first admissions will be set .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;33	But Kozyrev accused NATO of trying to make a fresh division on the European continent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;34	Some members of Partnership for Peace , he said , were destined to become members , while others would remain behind .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;35	`` Not all countries will be able to obtain membership at the same time , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0407;36	`` There needs to be some sort of clarification . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher confessed Thursday that the United States and its allies had mismanaged the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;1	He said they all had lessons to learn from the debacle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;2	As the NATO foreign ministers moved to expand NATO to countries in Central and Eastern Europe , Christopher found himself cast in the embarrassing role of explaining the Clinton administration 's decision to forgo force in favor of diplomacy to try to rein in the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;3	`` All of us ought to try to learn lessons from the experience in Bosnia , '' he told reporters , while trying to focus their attention on NATO 's future rather than the faltering attempt to quiet the conflict in the former Yugoslav republic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;4	Stoutly maintaining NATO had fulfilled the peacekeeping assignment given it by the United Nations , Christopher said the purpose in expanding the alliance and revamping the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe , a 53-nation East-West group , was to forestall other threats to peace on the continent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;5	A senior U.S. official put it more bluntly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;6	`` While Bosnia is burning we are trying to concentrate on the larger structural issues that may prevent other Bosnias , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;7	NATO 's projected expansion eastward would embrace the territory between Germany and Russia , where two world wars were fought in this century .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;8	On Friday , Christopher intends to get formal approval from France , Britain , Germany and Russia for a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;9	It calls for a cease-fire around Bihac , the northwestern Muslim enclave that Serbs are pummeling , a pledge to cease hostilities throughout the country for three to six months and then an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;10	The lure for the Serbs , who control about 70 percent of Bosnia , is an opportunity to press their demand for cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;11	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe and British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd made plans to fly to Belgrade next weekend to push the initiative .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;12	Christopher 's aides said he did not intend to accompany them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;13	At the same time , NATO is considering contingency plans to withdraw the 24,000 U.N. peacekeepers now in Bosnia , hundreds of whom have been detained by the onrushing Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;14	Christopher said an evacuation would require ground troops and the United States `` would have a role in that . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;15	However , he said President Clinton had not decided specifically what American troops might do to extricate the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;16	Looking backward , Christopher faulted the United Nations for deciding in 1991-92 to deal with the conflict in Bosnia as a humanitarian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;17	`` NATO has done very well in what it was asked to do , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;18	And looking ahead , Christopher said the United States would not shrink from any new conflicts in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;19	`` We believe the United States should be involved in the resolution of such crises in the future , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;20	NATO Secretary-General Willy Claes defended the alliance he has just taken over .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;21	`` Before accepting a new peacekeeping mission coming from the United Nations or coming from the CSCE we will look very carefully to the conditions , to the roles of the game , before saying once again yes , '' the Belgian diplomat said at a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0408;22	At this juncture , `` on Bosnia we certainly are of one mind today , '' Claes insisted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;0	Evicted by police from government offices , hunger-striking leaders of East Germany 's reformed communists expanded protests on Thursday against a whopping tax levy they say would ruin them financially .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;1	Some 3,000 sympathizers held rallies and sit-ins in Berlin , Schwerin and Dresden on Thursday in support of the fast begun on Wednesday by Party of Democratic Socialism -LRB- PDS -RRB- lawmakers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;2	The party claims the government is trying to exact its political death with the 67 million mark -LRB- dlrs 43 million -RRB- bill , which was assessed by Berlin tax authorities based on real estate sales in the first half of 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;3	At the time , just months before German unification , the PDS as successor to the communists held vast assets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;4	A large portion of those assets are now controlled by an independent federal commission that is supposed to determine how much of the property they can keep and how much belongs to the people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;5	The PDS asked the commission to pay the tax bill , but it refused , saying it would be violating its legal mandate in doing so .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;6	A court ruled Thursday that the PDS would only have to pay 3 million marks -LRB- dlrs 1.8 million -RRB- security for the moment , pending further attempts to settle the dispute .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;7	But party leaders said they would not pay .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;8	Leaders of other political parties accused the PDS , which was formed in 1990 out of the remnants of the collapsed East German Communist party , of trying to stir up public sympathy by falsely painting itself a victim .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;9	In Berlin , protesters gathered outside federal Interior Ministry offices to protest the police expulsion of PDS leaders from government offices on Wednesday night .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;10	They were also angered by Interior Minister Manfred Kanther 's threat to charge the politicians with trespassing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;11	The PDS lawmakers moved to their party offices at the Berlin city legislature and said the hunger strike would continue indefinitely under the motto `` We wo n't be taxed out of existence -- No expropriation of the PDS . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;12	The party won 20 percent of the vote in eastern Germany in Oct. 16 national elections , thanks mainly to resentment among eastern Germans who feel they have been demoted to second-class status in united Germany .
APW_ENG_19941201.0409;13	Chancellor Helmut Kohl has attacked the PDS as a group of `` red-painted fascists , '' and the party has been battered by accusations that its parliamentary leader , Gregor Gysi , was an informant for the East German secret police when he acted as defense lawyer for dissidents .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;0	Speakers and activists at a 42-nation summit on AIDS pleaded Thursday for compassion for homosexuals , drug users and prostitutes often shunned by politicians and the public .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;1	Governments should redouble their efforts to end discrimination against these groups , at high risk of becoming infected with the HIV virus that causes AIDS , participants said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;2	`` All laws which deny the freedom of people to cross borders because of HIV must be abolished , '' said Richard Burzynski , an HIV sufferer with a Canada-based AIDS rights group , ICASO .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;3	`` This means all laws which criminalize or discriminate against homosexuals , drug users , migrants and refugees , and sex workers must be abolished . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;4	Governments tend to ignore or isolate homosexuals , worsening rather than addressing the AIDS epidemic , the International Gay and Lesbian Association said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;5	Homosexuals must be accepted , educated and protected by legislation , the group said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;6	Officials of the 42 participating nations endorsed a declaration pledging to strengthen cooperation between developed and Third World countries and to fight discrimination against those suffering from AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;7	`` We are not meeting here simply to issue a further warning , but to declare a planetary emergency , '' said U.N. Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;8	`` Every day , AIDS kills children , destroys families , drains economies , threatens communities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;9	We must act without delays . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;10	The non-binding declaration says signatories will act to `` ensure that all persons living with HIV\/AIDS are able to realize the full and equal enjoyment of their fundamental rights and freedoms . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;11	The declaration promised efforts to provide health care , jobs , education and housing to people with HIV or AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;12	It also supported `` empowerment of women '' by raising their economic and social status and including them in decision-making .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;13	The summit was a focal point of World AIDS Day , observed around the world with education programs and fund-raising events .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;14	Australians attended special church services commemorating 3,500 compatriots killed by AIDS .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;15	In the Ivory Coast , where AIDS is the leading killer of young men , 2,000 people marched through Abidjan with banners declaring , `` Condoms for life ; AIDS for death . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;16	In South Africa , where the disease is spreading rapidly , health officials and politicians wrapped a huge red ribbon around St. George 's Cathedral in Cape Town as part of efforts to increase AIDS awareness .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;17	In Paris , hundreds of teen-agers visited a `` village '' set up across the Seine river from the Eiffel Tower , with scores of stands offering brochures , condoms and other educational material .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;18	A peaceful march led by the AIDS group Act Up through the Left Bank drew an estimated 4,500 people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;19	Earlier , about 50 Act Up activists lay on the Champs Elysees and blocked traffic for several minutes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;20	At the summit , there were numerous calls for more AIDS spending , starting with Federico Mayor , head of the U.N. Educational , Scientific and Cultural Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;21	`` In our budgets we have funds to pay the price of war , but we have made no provision for the cost of the fight against AIDS , '' Mayor said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;22	Funding `` must be accompanied by ethical surveillance to prevent or check any measures ... that would tend to exclude or discriminate against people who are ill from the disease , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;23	The World Bank , the biggest donor in the campaign against AIDS , pledged dlrs 150 million annually to combat the disease in developing countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;24	Britain announced an allocation of 230 million pounds -LRB- dlrs 358 million -RRB- on AIDS services for 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;25	Currently , however , more than 90 percent of the money pledged to fight AIDS goes toward helping only the 8 percent of those afflicted in developed countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;26	Some 17 million people are known to have been infected with the HIV virus , about two-thirds in Africa , the World Health Organization says .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;27	Up to 40 million will have been infected by 2000 , and 10 million will have died , according to WHO , co-sponsor of the summit with the French government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;28	Some French media pronounced the summit a failure even before it began .
APW_ENG_19941201.0410;29	The daily Liberation criticized the final declaration as `` banal , '' predicted that little new funding would materialize , and noted that senior U.S. , British or German leaders rebuffed summit invitations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;0	Ernesto Zedillo , a mild-mannered economist whose rise to power capped a tragic and tumultous year of rebellion and political assassination , was sworn in Thursday as the 63rd president of Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;1	Taking the red , green and white sash of office , the 42-year-old economist promised to expand democracy and prosperity for this nation of 90 million .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;2	`` Our most important challenge is to provide dignified living conditions for every Mexican family , '' Zedillo said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;3	The new president also vowed to use the North American Free Trade Agreement `` to help generate the jobs we need and raise living standards . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;4	He spoke in the ornate Chamber of Deputies before 1,500 Mexican officials and foreign leaders , including Vice President Al Gore and Cuba 's President Fidel Castro .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;5	Zedillo promised to start a war on poverty and maintain a cease-fire with Indian rebels in southern Chiapas state .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;6	He said Mexico must unite to eradicate the poverty that led to the rebellion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;7	Former President Carlos Salinas de Gortari , who negotiated NAFTA with the United States and Canada , was loudly applauded as Zedillo paid him tribute .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;8	Outside the hall , military bands struck up waltzes and mariachi musicians warmed up a huge street fiesta on the parade route to the National Palace , festive in red and green bunting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;9	But not everyone wanted to celebrate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;10	`` Out with Zedillo ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;11	and `` Zedillo No ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;12	shouted more than 4,000 anti-government demonstrators , some brandishing sticks and machetes , at a protest in downtown Mexico City .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;13	The protesters , mostly farmers in straw sombreros , raised banners of the leftist Democratic Revolution Party , the biggest opponent to 65 years of rule by the Institutional Revolutionary Party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;14	Zedillo , a former Mexicali shoeshine boy , received a doctorate in economics from Yale .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;15	Bypassed once for his party 's presidential nomination , he was thrust into the campaign by the March assassination of Luis Donaldo Colosio , first choice of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party , or PRI .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;16	He won the presidency Aug. 21 in the most credible elections ever held in Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;17	Zedillo has pledged to use the near-absolute powers of Mexico 's presidency to weaken his own office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;18	He says he will give greater independence to the congress , the courts and local governments as well as the PRI itself .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;19	He says he will end the practice of having the president handpick all top PRI candidates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;20	Zedillo , former budget and planning minister under Salinas , is sure to continue his predecessor 's free-market economic policies -- a commitment underlined by the Cabinet choices announced Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;21	Leading negotiators of NAFTA -- the trade pact with the United States and Canada -- were named heads of treasury , trade and foreign policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;22	Seven other free-market economists also were named to the 25-person cabinet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;23	Gore said 1994 was a year of `` unprecedented progress in the bilateral relationship between the United States and Mexico ... and we look forward to even greater improvement in the year ahead . '
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;24	Zedillo also showed signs of a political opening with the appointment of a conservative opposition party member , Antonio Lozano , as attorney general .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;25	The post is crucial for Zedillo , who made fighting government corruption a major part of his campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;26	Last week , a deputy attorney general investigating the Sept. 28 assassination of his own brother , a top PRI official , resigned angrily , charging that top government and party officials were involved in a cover-up .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;27	Lozano 's appointment marks the first time a Cabinet post has been given to an opposition party member , and it `` opens the possibility of an important change , '' said Carlos Castillo Pedraza , the president of the National Action Party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;28	On Tuesday , Zedillo reached out to the left as well , meeting with leaders of the Democratic Revolution Party and promising reforms to help make Mexico more democratic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;29	Salinas never met publicly with leaders of that main leftist opposition during his administration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;30	The party apparently responded by pulling some 4,000 protesters out of the capital 's main plaza Wednesday , indicating an effort to avoid the confrontations that marred Salinas ' inauguration in 1988 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;31	The demonstrators were protesting alleged vote fraud in recent state elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;32	Despite Zedillo 's moves , other discontent remains .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;33	A protest was planned Thursday by leftist supporters of the Zapatista National Liberation Army rebels of southern Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0411;34	That rebellion , stalled since January by a cease-fire , is one of the toughest problems facing the new president .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;0	Sunburned and scattered on an improvised armada of U.S. Navy ships and cargo boats in the Indian Ocean , the nearly 1,000 survivors of a blaze that swept through the Achille Lauro began the first leg Thursday of their return home .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;1	The fire broke out Wednesday morning in the engine room on the bad luck cruise ship .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;2	The Achille Lauro was hijacked in 1985 and an American passenger killed by Palestinian terrorists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;3	Passengers and crew who escaped the blaze by scrambling into lifeboats were transferred Thursday to 10 ships that would take them to Kenya or Djibouti .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;4	Many of the survivors , some dressed in evening or bed clothes , had spent hours aboard the deck of the oil tanker Hawaiian King and other merchant ships that had plucked them to safety immediately after the evacuation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;5	Two elderly passengers died -- an Englishman during the evacuation and a German man of a heart attack .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;6	Eight people were injured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;7	Starlauro , the Achille Lauro 's owners , said in Naples they were trying to determine if the German died because of the fire or if he had the attack before the early-morning blaze .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;8	`` The fire was so big you had to fight through smoke which poured down toward the cabins , '' one survivor , Tony Webb , was quoted as telling the London Daily Telegraph .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;9	Webb , a 44-year-old Briton who now lives in Cape Town , South Africa , had taken his wife and 2-year-old son on the cruise after winning a contest .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;10	He said he was still wearing his dinner jacket after a ship dance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;11	`` People were in their evening suits and dressing gowns , '' the paper quoted Webb as saying .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;12	Children screamed and people clung to each other as the Achille Lauro listed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;13	With his son Michael holding on to him in terror Webb looked back and saw flames `` leaping up and there was smoke all around . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;14	'' The crew was wonderful , '' Webb said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;15	`` They tried to keep us all calm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;16	At about 8 a.m. , the captain said the fire was too strong and we would have to abandon the ship . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;17	Starlauro , the cruise ship 's owners , said an SOS was sent at just before 7 a.m. local time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;18	A ship officer told Italian television that the fire broke out around 2 a.m. and took several hours to reach passenger areas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;19	`` Quite a few people were injured in the transfer -LRB- Wednesday -RRB- -- there 's a few broken bones and some pretty tortured souls , '' John Briand , captain of the oil tanker Lima , told the BBC .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;20	The Achille Lauro 's captain , Giuseppe Orsi , talking by phone Thursday aboard the Hawaiian King , told Italy 's transport minister in Rome that survivors ' morale was high but that clothing was needed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;21	He later said the fire began in the engine room and crews struggled to contain the blaze .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;22	`` But then a piston exploded and the flames spread all over the place , '' said Orsi .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;23	`` From what I saw -LRB- the ship -RRB- is gone , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;24	Two Navy ships , the USS Gettysburg and the Halyburton , took on a total of 208 survivors Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;25	`` Many had tears of relief '' as they came aboard the Gettysburg , that ship 's commander , Capt. Pete Smith said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;26	They were offered '' a hot shower , the crew were feeding them ... -LRB- and -RRB- donating clothes for them to wear , as a lot abandoned ship in nightclothes . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;27	Many had bad sunburn after being exposed for hours on the deck of the Hawaiian King , Navy officials reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;28	By Thursday evening , survivors were spread aboard a total of 10 ships .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;29	Five vessels were headed for Djibouti , on the Horn of Africa ; and five for Mombasa , Kenya , with the first due , the Liberian-registered Bar Du , in Djibouti , at 2 p.m. local time -LRB- 1100 gmt -RRB- , the Italian Coast Guard reported Thursday evening .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;30	Others were due in later Friday or Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;31	The ship had carried 581 passengers and 404 crew .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;32	Most of the crew was Italian , and the passengers mainly South African , German , Dutch or British .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;33	RAI state TV said the Italian state airline , Alitalia , would dispatch jumbos to fly out the survivors , except for South Africans , to Italy once they reached port and had a chance to rest .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;34	The Achille Lauro set sail Nov. 19 from Genoa , Italy ; stopped in Haifa , Israel , and then plied on to Africa 's east coast .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;35	The ship had been bound for South Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;36	The Italian liner itself Thursday still hung on , although listing badly to port .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;37	White steam and gray smoke poured out of port side and smaller plumes of smoke drifted out of the lower starboard deck .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;38	Tug boats arrived at the ship Thursday to possibly tow it to port , Italian media reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;39	The pilot of a plane carrying Associated Press cameramen and a reporter put the ship 's position at 160 miles east of the small Somali fishing village of Eil .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;40	Heat and soot blackened the Achille Lauro 's two smokestacks , and its blue-and-white paint was scorched and mottled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;41	The ship 's captain reportedly has put the fire 's origin in the engine room , apparently contradicting the company 's initial assertion that the blaze began in the passenger area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;42	Starlauro 's director-general , Franco Zuccherino , told RAI TV Thursday that the fire 's dynamics were yet to be determined .
APW_ENG_19941201.0412;43	`` We have to talk extensively with the captain '' first , Zuccherino said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;0	England 's Del Harris reached his first semifinal of a major squash tournament Thursday , defeating countryman Simon Parke at the dlrs 96,000 Qatar International .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;1	Harris , once the world No. 7 but now ranked No. 20 , will play Jansher Khan , the world 's No. 1 , in the semifinals on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;2	Harris beat Parke , who had downed No. 2 Peter Marshall in the first round , 15-14 , 15-9 , 15-13 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;3	Khan , the defending champion , beat veteran New Zealander Ross Norman 15-6 , 15-10 , 15-13 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;4	The last two quarterfinals of the day were marathon affairs from which Australia 's Rodney Eyles and England 's Chris Walker emerged victorious .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;5	Eyles , ranked four in the world , defeated No. 5 ranked Scotsman Peter Nicol 15-5 , 13-15 , 15-6 , 12-15 , 15-7 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0413;6	Walker , ranked No. 6 , beat world No. 3 Brett Martin of Australia 17-16 , 9-15 , 17-15 , 9-15 , 15-12 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;0	Bread prices increased 11 times Thursday as the government started implementing a market-reform plan aimed at freeing prices and slashing the deficit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;1	The government ordered bread prices increased from 6 drams -LRB- 1.3 cents -RRB- to 66 drams -LRB- 15 cents -RRB- per kilogram -LRB- 2.2 pounds -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;2	But bread rationing remained in force , with a daily norm of 350 grams -LRB- 12 ounces -RRB- per person in the capital and 250 grams -LRB- 9 ounces -RRB- in the countryside .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;3	Armenia is one of the poorest of the former Soviet republics , with an average monthly salary of about dlrs 7 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;4	Its economy has been severely hit by an economic blockade imposed by Azerbaijan as part of a six-year war over the enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;5	Armenia 's only source of energy is a natural-gas pipeline from Georgia that has been repeatedly bombed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;6	The government has vowed to gradually deregulate prices to meet requirements for international loans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;7	Armenia hopes to get dlrs 250 million to dlrs 300 million in credits from the International Monetary Fund , World Bank and some Western governments over the next year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;8	Authorities have said all prices would be freed until the fall of 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;9	On Thursday , the government also ordered a six-fold increase in electricity rates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;10	Prices for transport , rent and other prices were expected to rise soon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;11	Officials have promised to ease the impact of price hikes by doubling wages and increasing aid to the poor .
APW_ENG_19941201.0414;12	The government has said its economic plan will result in cutting inflation from the current 8 percent to 9 percent a month to just 1 percent by the end of next year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0415;0	Bread prices increased 11 times Thursday as the government started implementing a market-reform plan aimed at freeing prices and slashing the deficit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0415;1	The government ordered bread prices increased from 6 drams -LRB- 1.3 cents -RRB- to 66 drams -LRB- 15 cents -RRB- per kilogram -LRB- 2.2 pounds -RRB- .

APW_ENG_19941201.0416;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher confessed Thursday that the United States and its allies had mismanaged the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;1	He said they all have lessons to learn from the debacle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;2	As the NATO foreign ministers moved to expand NATO to countries in Central and Eastern Europe , Christopher found himself cast in the embarrassing role of explaining the Clinton administration 's decision to forgo force in favor of diplomacy to try to rein in the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;3	`` All of us ought to try to learn lessons from the experience in Bosnia , '' he told reporters , while trying to focus attention on NATO 's future rather than the faltering attempt to quiet the conflict in the former Yugoslav republic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;4	Stoutly maintaining NATO had fulfilled the peacekeeping assignment given it by the United Nations , Christopher said the purpose in expanding the alliance and revamping the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe , a 53-nation East-West group , was to forestall other threats to peace on the continent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;5	A senior U.S. official put it more bluntly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;6	`` While Bosnia is burning we are trying to concentrate on the larger structural issues that may prevent other Bosnias , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;7	NATO 's projected expansion eastward would embrace the territory between Germany and Russia , where two world wars were fought in this century .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;8	On Friday , Christopher intends to get formal approval from France , Britain , Germany and Russia for a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;9	It calls for a cease-fire around Bihac , the northwestern Muslim enclave that Serbs are pummeling , a pledge to cease hostilities throughout the country for three to six months and then an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;10	The lure for the Serbs , who control about 70 percent of Bosnia , is an opportunity to press their demand for cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;11	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe and British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd made plans to fly to Belgrade next weekend to push the initiative .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;12	Christopher 's aides said he did not intend to accompany them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;13	At the same time , NATO is considering contingency plans to withdraw the 24,000 U.N. peacekeepers now in Bosnia , hundreds of whom have been detained by the onrushing Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;14	Christopher said an evacuation would require ground troops and the United States `` would have a role in that . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;15	However , he said President Clinton had not decided specifically what American troops might do to extricate the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;16	Looking backward , Christopher faulted the United Nations for deciding in 1991-92 to deal with the conflict in Bosnia as a humanitarian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;17	`` NATO has done very well in what it was asked to do , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;18	And looking ahead , Christopher said the United States would not shrink from any new conflicts in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0416;19	`` We believe the United States should be involved in the resolution of such crises in the future , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;0	Holding 55 Canadian peacekeepers hostage in Bosnia is unacceptable and little progress is being made to win their release , Prime Minister Jean Chretien said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;1	Still , it was not a mistake for Canada to renew its six-month commitment to UN peacekeeping in the war-torn former Yugoslav republic , the prime minister said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;2	The current mandate runs out at the end of March .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;3	`` I do n't think that it 's a mistake when our country is doing something for peace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;4	It might be difficult , it might be complicated , it might be dangerous .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;5	`` But I have to tell you that the Canadians have a great reputation not to be afraid to do something for peace . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;6	Earlier in a speech to the French Senate , Chretien said NATO allies will try to solve the crisis in talks in Budapest next week with former Soviet bloc countries at the Conference on Security and Co-operation in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;7	The talks will look for a way `` to master this destructive spirit rooted in intolerance , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;8	Chretien is only the second foreign leader ever invited to speak to the French Senate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;9	He took advantage of the opportunity to send a discreet message to the French that Canada is a bilingual country that works .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;10	`` The French language continues to flourish in Canada and a multitude of Canadians are adopting it as their second language , '' Chretien said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;11	But the prime minister 's remarks -- which did not refer once to the forthcoming Quebec referendum on separation -- were overshadowed by concerns about UN peacekeeping in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;12	After his speech , Chretien said it was not acceptable that Bosnian Serbs , who are detaining some 400 peacekeepers , refused to meet UN Secretary General Butros Butros-Ghali when he visited the Bosnian capital of Sarajevo Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;13	The prime minister also did n't quarrel with calling the detained troops hostages .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;14	`` They are detained , you can call it hostages ... But I would not fight on the meaning of words here . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;15	The prime minister hopes the peacekeepers will be released soon , but `` we 're not making progress at this time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;16	Speaking in the ornate Senate chamber , Chretien downplayed national unity in favor of expanding world trade and stressing the importance of Canada-France relations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;17	He suggested it 's time to consider a free trade agreement between the North American trading bloc -- Canada , the United States and Mexico -- and the European Union .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;18	Chretien also promised a more modest summit when the Group of Seven leading industrial democracies meet next June in Halifax .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;19	Such meetings are sometimes criticized as expensive photo opportunities which accomplish little .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;20	La Francophonie , a group of the world 's French-speaking countries , could also get more involved in politics , Chretien said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;21	He noted the organization did little to avert a bloodbath in Rwanda and a military coup in Haiti , both member countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;22	While avoiding any direct references to Canadian unity , the prime minister still sent a subtle but powerful message to Quebec separatists .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;23	Quebec politicians have also been wooing the French in the pre-referendum period -- Premier Jacques Parizeau visits in January , International Affairs Minister Bernard Landry was there last month .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;24	But Chretien said three times in his speech that Canada and France share a common cause , referring to peacekeeping , world organizations and trade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;25	Asked later why he did n't mention the referendum that Parizeau has promised to hold next year , Chretien said : `` I do n't think it was appropriate for me to come and , you know , wash our linen here . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;26	German Chancellor Helmut Kohl was the first foreign leader to speak to the French Senate and Russian President Boris Yeltsin is expected to be the next .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;27	Rene Monory , president of the Senate , sidestepped a question about whether Parizeau will get a similar invitation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;28	`` It 's the office that has decided the invitation of Mr. Chretien , because I know he is the prime minister of the country , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;29	Earlier Thursday , Chretien told a conference on AIDS that `` as AIDS continues to ravage every corner of the world , there can be no doubt that we must all work even harder and more urgently . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;30	But he announced little new action , saying Canada would maintain and possibly increase its efforts in Africa against the disease .
APW_ENG_19941201.0417;31	Most of Canada 's $ 11 million international financial assistance concerning AIDS is already directed towards Africa .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;0	Moscow backed off from a threat to send troops Thursday into the breakaway republic of Chechnya , where leaders defied a Russian ultimatum and called on armed volunteers to defend their capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;1	Air attacks continued on the outskirts of Grozny , the Chechen capital , and a Russian delegation arrived from Moscow and began talks with Chechen officials .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;2	Residents continued to flee the mainly Muslim city of 300,000 people in the Caucasus Mountains of southern Russia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;3	The city has become a war zone between forces loyal to Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev , who declared independence from Moscow in 1991 , and Chechen rebels trying to topple him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;4	Dudayev accuses Moscow of arming and leading the rebels , who launched an offensive last week that began with helicopters and escalated in recent days to jet fighters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;5	Russia says it has given the rebels only political support .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;6	It refuses to recognize independence for Chechnya , which was incorporated into the Russian Empire in the 19th century after a series of long and bloody wars .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;7	President Boris Yeltsin threatened Tuesday to impose a state of emergency in Chechnya if both sides did not surrender prisoners and stop fighting by Thursday morning .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;8	On Thursday evening , Yeltsin 's office issued an altered text of the ultimatum , saying `` there was some disagreement in the media in interpreting certain clauses . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;9	The reissued document made no reference to a state of emergency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;10	Trying a different tack , Yeltsin offered limited amnesty Thursday to Chechens who `` voluntarily lay down arms by Dec. 15 . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;11	In another sign of Russia 's desire to avoid direct confrontation , Defense Minister Pavel Grachev told reporters in Moscow that some Russian soldiers who `` carried out certain military tasks for material compensation '' from anti-Dudayev forces had been brought back to central Russia , and more would be evacuated .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;12	Grachev insisted the soldiers were volunteers and were not in Chechnya on army orders .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;13	Dudayev 's government captured up to 70 Russians in fighting last weekend and alleged that some were army officers and soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;14	Chechen officials initially threatened to execute them , but Dudayev said Thursday they would be tried in court .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;15	Despite Moscow 's softened tone , it still appeared to be beefing up troops on the borders of Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;16	A tired-looking Dudayev held a defiant news conference in the basement of his presidential palace as jets roared overhead , calling Yeltsin 's government a `` satanic power . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;17	Dudayev said his house had been bombed Thursday morning .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;18	A small military air base near Grozny also was hit in an air raid Thursday and a woman 's corpse was seen .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;19	The ITAR-Tass news agency said two women were killed and fuel depots were burning .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;20	In Freedom Square outside Dudayev 's offices , several hundred volunteer fighters cradling Kalashnikov rifles and grenade launchers gathered to hear speeches .
APW_ENG_19941201.0418;21	Chechen elders in tall fur hats , tunics and high leather boots danced in a circle , chanting , `` Freedom or death ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;0	A United Nations protest to Bosnian Serbs for detaining peacekeepers and attacking a Canadian camp sparked a response from the Serb 's top general , a Canadian military spokesperson said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;1	Maj. Rita LePage , Canadian military spokesperson in Zagreb , Croatia , said Lt.-Gen .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;2	Bertrand Guillaume de Lapresle , UN commander in former Yugoslavia , and his deputy commander , Canadian Maj.-Gen .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;3	Raymond Crabbe , received two letters from the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;4	The letters came from Gen. Ratko Mladic , Serb army commander , and one of his assistants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;5	Earlier this week , Lapresle and Crabbe had themselves sent letters to the Serbs protesting the holding of UN troops and a Serb rocket attack on the Canadian peacekeeping camp in Visoko on Sunday , which damaged a building .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;6	Canadian officials declined to comment on the letters ' contents saying the Serb letters came at a `` sensitive '' time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;7	But military sources said the response was too general to satisfy UN leaders as they try to restart serious talks on releasing 400 UN troops , including 55 Canadians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;8	Prime Minister Jean Chretien , in Paris Thursday for a world conference on AIDS , said the hostage situation is unacceptable but little progress is being made to win their release .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;9	`` They are detained , you can call it hostages ... But I would not fight on the meaning of words here . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;10	Earlier , in a speech to the French Senate , Chretien said NATO allies will try to solve the crisis in talks in Budapest next week with former Soviet bloc countries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;11	Meanwhile , UN officials Thursday were trying to schedule high-level talks near Sarajevo on releasing UN soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;12	Lapresle and Yasushi Akashi , the top UN civilian in Bosnia , hope to meet today with Mladic and Radovan Karadzic , political leader of Bosnia 's Serbs , at the Bosnian Serb capital of Pale .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;13	Hopes for the soldiers ' release were dampened Thursday when Bosnian Serb forces crossed into Croatia , kidnapped seven Ukrainian peacekeepers and took them to Serb-held territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;14	The UN mission was put under further pressure as Serbs blocked food convoys , fired missiles at Sarajevo and traded fire with government troops around Bihac , a Muslim area in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;15	The 55 Canadians have been held for a week at observation points and other locations near their camp in Visoko .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;16	A camp supply vehicle reached the Canadians on Wednesday night with books , mail and personal items .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;17	Life at the Canadian peacekeepers ' camp gradually returned to normal Thursday , a day after a Serb threat to shell the camp again passed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;18	But the camp stayed at the high alert level of orange Thursday , which requires personnel to wear flak jackets and helmets when outside .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;19	In Brussels , NATO foreign ministers gathered Thursday to seek terms for a new Bosnian ceasefire , as western allies argued over the how NATO and the UN should handle the bloody Balkan war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;20	Officials in Bonn confirmed that NATO had asked Germany to contribute fighter planes to patrol the skies over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;21	The controversial move would put Germany 's military in its first combat role in 49 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0419;22	Chancellor Helmut Kohl was likely to intervene personally in any decision .
