APW_ENG_19941201.0489;0	A congressman is accusing U.S. gun manufacturers of decieving the public in ads aimed at getting women to arm themselves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;1	Rep. Charles Schumer , a New York Democrat , said ads that have appeared in several magazines seek to frighten women into believing they can increase their safety by buying a handgun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;2	`` The tragedy is ... that nothing could be further from the truth , '' Schumer said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;3	`` Study after study has proven that a gun in the home simply increases the chance that an innocent person will be killed by that gun . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;4	The National Rifle Association denounced Schumer 's comments Thursday , urging women to `` ignore scare tactics . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;5	Schumer said he would file a complaint against the advertising tactics with the Federal Trade Commission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;6	`` In its battle for the hearts of American women , the gun ban lobby has forgotten that American women have minds too , '' NRA lobbyist Tanya K. Metaksa said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;7	`` As women , we not only have the right and the obligation to make our own decisions about safety and security -- we have the intelligence to do so . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;8	Schumer said he remains confident that most Americans support gun control , including two measures passed last year -- the Brady Law , which requires a waiting period for firearms purchases or the ban on some assault-style weapons included in the dlrs 30 billion anti-crime legislation passed this year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;9	`` Yes , a new Congress will convene in January .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;10	Yes , Republican leadership is hostile to gun legislation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;11	And , yes , the Brady law and the assault weapons ban are in jeopardy , '' Schumer said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;12	`` Those of you who like a good political fight , welcome to Round Two .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;13	The fight over rational gun laws is not over . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;14	Gun manufacturers began advertising directed at women in the 1980s after the male market became saturated and gun sales declined , according to `` Female Persuasion , '' a report released during Schumer 's news conference by the Violence Policy Center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;15	The group used a full-age Colt 's Manufacturing Co. ad that features a woman tucking a girl into bed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;16	`` Self-protection is more than your right , '' the ad said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;17	`` It 's your responsibility . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;18	Colt 's officials were not immediately available for comment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;19	Democratic Rep. Nita Lowey said gun manufacturers are simply looking for new ways to sell guns .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;20	`` It 's clear that the National Rifle Association and the gun manufacturers have a new target , which is American women .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;21	This is a cynical marketing strategy designed to promote gun ownership by preying on women 's legitimate fears of violence , '' said Lowey , who led a protest of 25 female representatives last year against the National Rifle Association 's `` Refuse to be a Victim '' campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0489;22	The NRA launched the campaign in 1993 to advertise a three-hour self-defense seminar for women .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;0	Draped in rubber armor , bristling with guns , the `` Krajina Express '' must be one of the Serbs ' oddest weapons in the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;1	All aboard -- if you dare .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;2	The train , similar to those employed in both world wars , has three combat cars and three freight cars hooked to the front to protect it from mine blasts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;3	It chugs to the front line , aims and fires and then quickly retreats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;4	But on Tuesday , the train took a direct hit from a missile fired by Bosnian government defenders of Bihac , the U.N.-designated `` safe area '' in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;5	The 20-man crew survived and the damage was minor , since a thick rubber curtain absorbed most of the blast .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;6	The car was loaded with ammunition and the train could have exploded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;7	`` We were lucky , '' said Djuro , whose shrapnel wound to the leg was the only injury .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;8	A hundred yards long , roofless and loaded with guns , the `` Krajina Express '' -- named for the Krajina region of neighboring Croatia -- is an example of the firepower Serbs are throwing at defenders of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;9	The United Nations says Croatian Serbs have joined the fighting in the Bihac area , helping anti-government forces corner the Bosnian army 's powerful 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;10	Serb troops say they are determined to punish the 5th Corps for an October offensive that routed them out of the Bihac region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;11	The Serbs counter-attacked in early November and now control 30 percent to 40 percent of the area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;12	`` The 5th corps is in a desperate position and they will fight to the end , '' said Savo Bursac , who operates a 40 mm anti-aircraft gun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;13	`` I do n't expect them to surrender , and they have nowhere to go . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;14	He said the train crew never would have gotten involved had the 5th Corps not attacked Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;15	`` This is to teach them a lesson and to end the war . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;16	Capt. Blagoje Guska , commander of the train , said it had been fired upon but never hit before the missile attack Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;17	The train usually draws no fire and crew members blamed overconfidence for getting hit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;18	It rolled back quickly from the dangerous position south of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;19	`` That was our fault , '' said Djuro , who declined to give his last name .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;20	`` We went too close and stayed there exposed for too long . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;21	The motor on a triple-barrel , anti-aircraft machine gun was destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;22	A small fire was quickly extinguished and Djuro got a lift to a nearby hospital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;23	Earlier , on its first of three runs that day , the train followed its standard procedure of appearing suddenly , firing its deadly barrage and quickly retreating .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;24	Approaching from the south , it halted about two miles from Bihac and its guns joined the tank and howitzer fire on the region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;25	The first shells were fired by a self-propelled cannon , aimed at what was said to be Bosnian army trenches on a remote hill .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;26	Then , missiles that had been taken off of jet fighters and refitted to the train were unleashed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;27	On its third raid , another anti-tank missile fired at the train hit a house about 200 yards away , setting it ablaze .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;28	The house was empty and there were no casualties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;29	Runs toward the government line are interspersed with breaks back at the train 's base about three miles from Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;30	On one run back to the base , small trucks followed with hot soup and fresh bread for lunch .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;31	Morale was boosted by a short visit from Bosnian Serb army deputy commander Gen. Manojlo Milovanovic , who is directing the Bihac campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;32	Later , they sat around an open fire , playing accordion and singing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0491;33	` We are like family and we will be together till the end of this war , '' said Guska .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;0	About 50 Dominican prisoners ordered released by the courts but still behind bars rioted Thursday , burning mattresses and clothes in a call to be let out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;1	`` We want justice , we want liberty , '' shouted the inmates at the La Victoria prison 14 kilometers -LRB- 9 miles -RRB- north of the capital city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;2	The eight-hour uprising was quelled only after police sprayed some 20,000 gallons of water into the cells and the country 's Human Rights Commission president , Virgilio Almanzar , asked the inmates to stop .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;3	No injuries were reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;4	Santo Domingo prosecutor Alexis Joaquin Castillo was scheduled to meet with the inmates Friday to evaluate their legal status .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;5	An estimated 130 of La Victoria 's 4,000 prisoners were declared innocent or ordered released by the courts , including this country 's supreme court , months ago but remain in jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;6	Some were jailed only on the orders of police , without charges against them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;7	Human rights groups and the inmates ' families have demanded the release of the prisoners , known locally as `` the disrespected . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;8	President Joaquin Balaguer has said the prisoners should remain behind bars , arguing that the decisions to release them were tainted by corruption .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;9	He created a committee to review the cases .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;10	The committee , headed by Attorney General Efrain Reyes Duluc , recommended in June that 30 of the prisoners be freed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;11	But they remain jailed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;12	Balaguer in August pardoned Jose Guillermo Chiari , a Panamanian pilot who was serving a five-year sentence on a conviction of trafficking 163 kilograms -LRB- 359 pounds -RRB- of cocaine .
APW_ENG_19941201.0492;13	His appeal was scheduled to go to court here Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;0	Reports from Bosnian and Serb sources as well as the United Nations indicate Yugoslavia assisted in a crucial attack on northwest Bosnia , despite its public ban on war aid to Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;1	Together with the involvement of Serbs from across the border in Croatia , Yugoslav assistance in men and material provided to the fuel-short and outnumbered Bosnian Serbs appears to have been a key factor in their favor .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;2	The attack on Bihac this month called NATO 's bluff to use large-scale force against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;3	It has led to a rapid deterioration in the United Nations ' authority , and on Wednesday , U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali said the 24,000 peacekeepers might have to be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;4	Slobodan Milosevic , the powerful president of Serbia , announced in August that the border with Bosnia was being sealed to all but humanitarian aid to pressure Bosnian Serbs into accepting a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;5	Although there have been regular claims by Milosevic 's foes that he was cheating on the ban , several hundreds international monitors sent to patrol the 300-mile border reported seeing no violations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;6	The international community generally took Milosevic at his word , and allowed an easing of economic sanctions in October .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;7	The ban hurt Bosnian Serbs , supplied through the 2 -LCB- - year-old war by Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;8	In October , the Bosnian army 's 5th Corps broke out of the Bihac area where government forces are completely surrounded by Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;9	They pushed the Serbs back in a surprise attack to the east and south .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;10	But the Serbs counter-attacked furiously in early November and now control 30 percent to 40 percent of the U.N.-declared Bihac `` safe area , '' which encompasses the town of Bihac and its environs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;11	U.N. reports , and sources in Yugoslavia lend support to Bosnian army claims that Yugoslav aid helped turn the tide at Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;12	Bosnian government officials said intelligence reports indicated fuel and ammunition trucks had crossed the border into Bosnia from Serbia , the main republic in Yugoslavia , and that armor , helicopters and rockets all had been provided .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;13	`` It is so obvious that ... Serbs received new weapons , fresh troops ... and fuel to move ` dry ' tanks , '' charged Gen. Jovan Divjak , a Serb who serves as deputy commander of the Bosnian army .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;14	`` Otherwise , they would n't have been able to put Bihac under such strong pressure . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;15	Reports from Yugoslavia and from U.N. observers indicate that Milosevic may have used the involvement of Serbs from Croatia to get assistance to the Bihac combatants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;16	While Milosevic said he was cutting off help to the Bosnian Serbs , he did not make a similar pledge regarding the Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;17	Classified U.N. reports shown to The Associated Press in Sarajevo say that U.N. observers had seen armed men crossing the border between Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia in vehicles with Belgrade licenses .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;18	The presence of fighters from Yugoslavia in Bosnia also was reported in Milosevic 's Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;19	The Svet weekly , based in the northern Serbian town of Novi Sad , said a special Serbian police unit of up to 1,000 men headed by a top police officer had joined the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;20	The weekly said the policemen crossed into Bosnia as civilians , and traveled through Bosnia to Croatia , where they received weapons and uniforms .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;21	A senior Serbian police official denied the Svet report .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;22	But reliable sources in Belgrade confirmed that Yugoslav army and police detachments actively took part in the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0494;23	Svet also reported that the only other republic in Yugoslavia , Montenegro , had shipped a large supply of fuel to Bosnian Serbs .

APW_ENG_19941201.0496;0	The American dollar advanced broadly on Thursday , hitting a seven-week high vs. the Japanese yen , as a set of strong economic numbers helped fuel expectations that the Federal Reserve will again raise U.S. interest rates .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;1	In a reversal of the trend for much of the year , currency traders are no longer dumping the dollar on signs of an accelerating economy because they 're confident the Fed will take steps to control inflation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;2	Attitudes have shifted since the central bank 's 0.75-percentage point hike on Nov. 15 , analysts say .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;3	`` Strong data has helped the dollar because people feel the Fed is willing to mount a response to any inflation threat , '' said Amy Smith , senior currency strategist for the IDEA market analysis firm .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;4	`` It may be a bit optimistic , but it 's driving trading at the moment . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;5	Previously , such numbers prompted Treasury bond market sell-offs that dampened demand for the U.S. currency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;6	Data released Thursday by the National Association of Purchasing Management indicated U.S. manufacturing rose last month to the strongest level in 10 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;7	U.S. retailers reported robust sales for late November .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;8	The Commerce Department said , meanwhile , that Americans ' incomes rose by a stronger-than-expected 1.4 percent and spending climbed 0.7 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;9	Bond prices dipped on the reports , but the decline appeared to have little impact on the currency market , in large part because of the newfound confidence in the Fed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;10	`` The linkage with the bond market is cut , '' said Dave Glowacki , senior trader at NBD Bank in Detroit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;11	`` Bond investors who wanted to sell have sold .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;12	We 're back to the normal way of doing things .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;13	When the numbers point to a stronger economy , you buy the currency . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;14	Market participants said large U.S. investment funds and institutions were heavy buyers of dollars on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;15	Against the yen , that helped offset selling by Japanese companies that have accrued big stockpiles of dollars from exports to the United States .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;16	Belal Khan , senior dealer for the Bank of Tokyo in New York , said U.S. investors increasingly are pulling out of Japan 's stagnant stock market and repatriating funds , while Japanese investors have shown a greater appetite for U.S. assets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;17	`` U.S. interest rates are looking very attractive and the U.S. markets are attracting capital , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;18	`` The dollar has found a bottom and is moving higher . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;19	In late New York trading , the dollar was quoted at 99.34 yen , the highest level since Oct. 13 , up from 98.93 late Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;20	In London , the dollar rose to 99.35 yen from 98.89 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;21	The dollar also was changing hands late in New York at 1.5733 German marks , up from 1.5693 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;22	In London , the dollar traded at 1.5743 marks , up from 1.5686 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;23	David Durst , a vice president at Bear , Stearns and Co. , said a good deal of the dollar buying was spurred by upward revisions of estimates for November U.S. employment data , which the Labor Department reports on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;24	Economists are expecting the report to show creation of 260,000 to 290,000 jobs last month , up from earlier projections of 230,000 to 250,000 , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;25	Other late dollar rates in New York , compared with late Wednesday : 1.3295 Swiss francs , up from 1.3265 ; 5.3915 French francs , up from 5.3820 ; 1,614 Italian lire , down from 1,617 ; and 1.3776 Canadian dollars , up from 1.3763 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;26	The British pound traded at dlrs 1.5669 , up from dlrs 1.5650 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0496;27	In London , the pound fell to dlrs 1.5655 from dlrs 1.5673 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;0	Days after an Arizona State University student acknowledged fabricating a column depicting the stoning of a paralyzed man in Israel , parts of her resume also appear to be fictitious .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;1	Mary Leigh Summerton , 27 , could face expulsion for a gut-wrenching account of a European Jewish quadriplegic who was supposedly stoned to death at the Wailing Wall in Israel for using a mechanical device -- his wheelchair -- on the Sabbath .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;2	The story , which appeared in the Nov. 15 issue of the campus newspaper as a guest column , apparently was an embellished version of a tale a feminist member of the Jerusalem City Council told students on the summer trip .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;3	She said she published the article in The State Press in order to enter the Hearst competition , a college journalism contest that recognizes superior published articles .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;4	Now , Summerton faces a hearing for violating ASU 's code of conduct .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;5	Criminal behavior , plagiarism and cheating are included in code-of-conduct standards and can be punished by measures from probation to expulsion .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;6	Summerton , a former reporter and editor for The State Press , has been at Arizona State since the summer of 1993 working on a bachelor 's degree in journalism .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;7	On her resume , however , she claims to already have bachelor 's and master 's degrees in chemistry from the University of Miami in Florida .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;8	But Summerton never enrolled at the University of Miami , let alone received any degrees , said Sandra Bouie , who works in the registrar 's office there .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;9	She also attended ASU for one semester in the fall of 1990 -- the same time her resume places her at the University of Miami , working on her master 's degree .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;10	Maricopa County Community College District personnel records show Summerton never had a job there although she often told other students he worked as a lab instructor at Mesa Community College .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;11	And while she did work at Good Samaritan Regional Medical Center in Phoenix from Feb. 25 , 1991 , to March 10 , 1994 , it was not as a chemist as she claims on her resume but as an assistant to the pharmacist .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;12	The senior journalism student also claims on her resume to be a contributing writer to the Journal of Chemical Education , a well-known academic journal for chemists , teachers and students .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;13	`` Not only did she not write for us , the job she names is fictitious , '' said Debora Bittaker , assistant editor of the journal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;14	Summerton also claims she is from Florida , but school records show she graduated from Arizona 's Tolleson High School in 1985 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;15	`` Obviously , fidelity to the truth is not one of her strong points , '' said Jeffrey Ross of the Anti-Defamation League of B'nai B'rith , who led an expedition of 18 college journalists to Poland and Israel this past summer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;16	`` At least there 's a pattern .
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;17	Otherwise , the whole thing is inexplicable . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0497;18	Summerton did not return telephone calls from The Associated Press on Thursday seeking comment on her resume discrepancies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;0	Ernesto Zedillo was sworn in as president Thursday , vowing to broker peace with Indian rebels , work for his country 's impoverished millions and phase out Mexico 's one-party rule .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;1	As the 42-year-old economist was taking his oath of office , more than 10,000 people shouted slogans against him at a rally protesting his Institutional Revolutionary Party 's 65-year rule .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;2	Rock-throwing protesters clashed with riot police , who responded by firing tear gas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;3	At least 50 people were injured .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;4	Zedillo , who was honored with a parade by thousands of rifle-carrying soldiers backed by armored carriers , smartly saluted the army and navy marching bands as new commander-in-chief and 63rd president of Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;5	`` We want a homeland of peace , '' he declared in an inaugural address promising greater prosperity for all Mexicans .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;6	He took the oath of office at a simple midday ceremony .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;7	Departing President Carlos Salinas de Gortari transferred over the green , red and white sash of the office before 1,500 dignitaries including U.S. Vice President Al Gore and Cuba 's Fidel Castro .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;8	The dignitaries were then taken in a caravan of gleaming black limousines to the National Palace , trailing Zedillo 's luxury car , guarded by jogging security agents and showered by confetti thrown from balconies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;9	`` We think he will be a good president ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;10	said Carmen Valencia , a 60-year-old housewife and exuberant ruling party supporter out for the national holiday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;11	`` He came from below and understands poverty . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;12	Protesters had a different message .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;13	`` Out with Zedillo ! ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;14	they shouted as they jammed the plaza surrounding the Monument of the Revolution commemorating Mexico 's bloody 1910-20 revolution .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;15	They raised banners calling for a civil insurgency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;16	Later , hundreds marched toward the National Palace where Zedillo was greeting his new Cabinet and other supporters and were blocked by a barricade guarded by helmeted riot police .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;17	A Red Cross spokesman said about 50 people were injured when protesters threw rocks , bottles and other debris at police , who responded with tear gas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;18	Thick black smoke billowed in from of the National Lottery building as protesters set at least two vehicles ablaze -- a police jeep and an old truck owned by the ruling party , or PRI .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;19	Protesters threw rocks at firefighters trying to put out the flames .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;20	Many of the protesters were civil supporters of the Zapatista National Liberation Army , a guerrilla force that rebelled on Jan. 1 in the impoverished southern state of Chiapas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;21	Others were backers of Mexico 's leftist Democratic Revolution Party , the biggest opponent to PRI rule and the free-market reforms Salinas undertook during his six years in office .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;22	Some residents were wary of the new administration .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;23	The past year was marked by an unresolved Indian rebellion in Chiapas , the March 23 slaying of the first PRI presidential candidate , Luis Donaldo Colosio , kidnappings and drug feuds .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;24	`` We are all a little bit skeptical , '' said taxi driver Juan Angel Mendoza .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;25	`` They all say the same thing and nothing happens .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;26	But who knows , maybe Zedillo will be different . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;27	The new president , who will guide Mexico until the year 2000 , promised to expand democracy and prosperity while stripping away many of the powers that have made presidential power nearly absolute .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;28	`` The time has come to do away with centralism , '' vowed Zedillo in the ceremony at the ornate Chamber of Deputies , the lower house of Congress .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;29	Zedillo pledged to balance the power of the presidency with greater independence for the courts , the congress and state governments , as well as for his own party .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;30	Zedillo promised to launch a war on poverty and maintain a cease-fire with the Chiapas rebels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;31	`` Our most important challenge is to provide dignified living conditions for every Mexican family , '' he said , and vowed to use the free trade agreement with Canada and the United States `` to help generate the jobs we need and raise living standards . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;32	Bypassed once for his party 's presidential nomination , Zedillo was thrust into the campaign by Colosio 's assassination , the first major political killing in decades .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;33	He went on to win the presidency Aug. 21 in the most credible elections ever held in Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;34	Zedillo , former budget and planning minister under Salinas , is sure to continue his predecessor 's free-market economic policies -- a commitment underlined by the Cabinet choices announced Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;35	Leading negotiators of NAFTA -- the North American Free Trade Agreement -- were named heads of treasury , trade and foreign policy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;36	Seven other free-market economists also were named to the 25-person cabinet .
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;37	Gore said 1994 was a year of `` unprecedented progress in the bilateral relationship between the United States and Mexico ... and we look forward to even greater improvement in the year ahead . '
APW_ENG_19941201.0498;38	Zedillo also showed signs of a political opening with the appointment of a conservative opposition party member , Antonio Lozano , as attorney general .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;0	Draped in rubber armor , bristling with guns , the `` Krajina Express '' must be one of the Serbs ' oddest weapons in the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;1	All aboard -- if you dare .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;2	The train , similar to those employed in both world wars , has three combat cars and three freight cars hooked to the front to protect it from mine blasts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;3	It chugs to the front line , aims and fires and then quickly retreats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;4	But on Tuesday , the train took a direct hit from a missile fired by Bosnian government defenders of Bihac , the U.N.-designated `` safe area '' in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;5	The 20-man crew survived and the damage was minor , since a thick rubber curtain absorbed most of the blast .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;6	The car was loaded with ammunition and the train could have exploded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;7	`` We were lucky , '' said Djuro , whose shrapnel wound to the leg was the only injury .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;8	A hundred yards -LRB- meters -RRB- long , roofless and loaded with guns , the `` Krajina Express '' -- named for the Krajina region of neighboring Croatia -- is an example of the firepower Serbs are throwing at defenders of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;9	The United Nations says Croatian Serbs have joined the fighting in the Bihac area , helping anti-government forces corner the Bosnian army 's powerful 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;10	Serb troops say they are determined to punish the 5th Corps for an October offensive that routed them out of the Bihac region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;11	The Serbs counter-attacked in early November and now control 30 percent to 40 percent of the area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;12	`` The 5th Corps is in a desperate position and they will fight to the end , '' said Savo Bursac , who operates a 40mm anti-aircraft gun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;13	`` I do n't expect them to surrender , and they have nowhere to go . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;14	He said the train crew never would have gotten involved had the 5th Corps not attacked Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;15	`` This is to teach them a lesson and to end the war . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;16	Capt. Blagoje Guska , commander of the train , said it had been fired upon but never hit before the missile attack Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;17	The train usually draws no fire and crew members blamed overconfidence for getting hit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;18	It rolled back quickly from the dangerous position south of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;19	`` That was our fault , '' said Djuro , who declined to give his last name .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;20	`` We went too close and stayed there exposed for too long . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;21	The motor on a triple-barrel , anti-aircraft machine gun was destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;22	A small fire was quickly extinguished and Djuro got a lift to a nearby hospital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;23	Earlier , on its first of three runs that day , the train followed its standard procedure of appearing suddenly , firing its deadly barrage and quickly retreating .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;24	Approaching from the south , it halted about two miles -LRB- three kilometers -RRB- from Bihac and its guns joined the tank and howitzer fire on the region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;25	The first shells were fired by a self-propelled cannon , aimed at what was said to be Bosnian army trenches on a remote hill .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;26	Then , missiles that had been taken off of jet fighters and refitted to the train were unleashed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;27	On its third raid , another anti-tank missile fired at the train hit a house about 200 yards -LRB- meters -RRB- away , setting it ablaze .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;28	The house was empty and there were no casualties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;29	Runs toward the government line are interspersed with breaks back at the train 's base about three miles -LRB- five kilometers -RRB- from Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;30	On one run back to the base , small trucks followed with hot soup and fresh bread for lunch .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;31	Morale was boosted by a short visit from Bosnian Serb army deputy commander Gen. Manojlo Milovanovic , who is directing the Bihac campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;32	Later , they sat around an open fire , playing accordion and singing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0499;33	` We are like family and we will be together till the end of this war , '' said Guska .

APW_ENG_19941201.0502;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher confessed Thursday that the United States and its allies had mismanaged the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;1	He said they all had lessons to learn from the debacle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;2	As the NATO foreign ministers moved to expand NATO to countries in Central and Eastern Europe , Christopher found himself cast in the embarrassing role of explaining the Clinton administration 's decision to forgo force in favor of diplomacy to try to rein in the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;3	`` All of us ought to try to learn lessons from the experience in Bosnia , '' he told reporters , while trying to focus their attention on NATO 's future rather than the faltering attempt to quiet the conflict in the former Yugoslav republic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;4	Stoutly maintaining NATO had fulfilled the peacekeeping assignment given it by the United Nations , Christopher said the purpose in expanding the alliance and revamping the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe , a 53-nation East-West group , was to forestall other threats to peace on the continent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;5	A senior U.S. official put it more bluntly .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;6	`` While Bosnia is burning we are trying to concentrate on the larger structural issues that may prevent other Bosnias , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;7	NATO 's projected expansion eastward would embrace the territory between Germany and Russia , where two world wars were fought in this century .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;8	In Washington , Sen. George Mitchell , the outgoing Senate majority leader , indirectly chided his successor for second-guessing European allies over the Bosnia war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;9	`` It 's very easy for Americans to lecture our European allies on what should occur or should not occur on Bosnia , '' Mitchell told reporters on his last working day as majority leader .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;10	The remarks by the Maine Democrat came days after Senate Minority Leader Bob Dole , R-Kan. , the incoming majority leader , held tense meetings with officials in London and at NATO headquarters in Brussels over the Balkan war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;11	Dole declared the current U.N. peacekeeping effort a failure and said the peacekeeping force should withdraw .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;12	Dole stuck to his sharply critical stand in comments to reporters Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;13	`` There 's more and more feeling , I can tell you , for the -LRB- U.N. -RRB- protection forces to leave and to lift the arms embargo , '' Dole said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;14	`` It seems to me there is n't any U.S. policy in Bosnia right now . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;15	On Friday , Christopher intends to get formal approval from France , Britain , Germany and Russia for a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;16	It calls for a cease-fire around Bihac , the northwestern Muslim enclave that Serbs are pummeling , a pledge to cease hostilities throughout the country for three to six months and then an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;17	The lure for the Serbs , who control about 70 percent of Bosnia , is an opportunity to press their demand for cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;18	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe and British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd made plans to fly to Belgrade next weekend to push the initiative .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;19	Christopher 's aides said he did not intend to accompany them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;20	At the same time , NATO is considering contingency plans to withdraw the 24,000 U.N. peacekeepers now in Bosnia , hundreds of whom have been detained by the onrushing Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;21	Christopher said an evacuation would require ground troops and the United States `` would have a role in that . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;22	However , he said President Clinton had not decided specifically what American troops might do to extricate the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;23	Looking backward , Christopher faulted the United Nations for deciding in 1991-92 to deal with the conflict in Bosnia as a humanitarian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;24	`` NATO has done very well in what it was asked to do , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;25	And looking ahead , Christopher said the United States would not shrink from any new conflicts in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;26	`` We believe the United States should be involved in the resolution of such crises in the future , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;27	NATO Secretary-General Willy Claes defended the alliance he has just taken over .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;28	`` Before accepting a new peacekeeping mission coming from the United Nations or coming from the CSCE we will look very carefully to the conditions , to the roles of the game , before saying once again yes , '' the Belgian diplomat said at a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0502;29	At this juncture , `` on Bosnia we certainly are of one mind today , '' Claes insisted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;0	David Paul , convicted chairman of the failed CenTrust Bank , was sentenced Thursday to 11 years in prison for his part in the dlrs 1.7 billion collapse of the savings and loan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;1	Paul , 55 , was earlier convicted of 97 counts of racketeering and fraud in connection with the 1990 failure of CenTrust , the fourth-biggest banking collapse in U.S. history .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;2	The prosecution had recommended that Paul serve 17 to 22 years in jail , and the defense proposed a three-year sentence .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;3	Earlier in the day , U.S. District Judge Donald Graham warned that he was concerned about Paul 's willingness to accept his guilt .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;4	Graham had the power to impose additional prison time if he believed Paul was balking at accepting guilt .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;5	`` There 's a danger there , '' said Graham .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;6	`` I have to decide acceptance of responsibility because I 'm concerned about that , so be forewarned . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;7	Graham tentatively set a dollar loss of dlrs 62 million from the crimes committed while Paul was running the biggest savings and loan in the Southeast and hobnobbing with celebrities and politicians in the fast-paced 1980s .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;8	The amount is the starting point for determining the length of a prison term in fraud cases .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;9	The defense believes the bank had dlrs 938 million in revenues when it was seized in 1990 , while the prosecution has calculated a dlrs 371 million loss on junk bonds that were sold by regulators after the bank failed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0503;10	Regulators attacked CenTrust 's extravagant spending on artwork , and other luxuries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;0	Showing more contempt for U.N. authority , Bosnian Serb fighters have kidnapped more U.N. peacekeepers and tightened their stranglehold Thursday on the `` safe area '' of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;1	Alexander Ivanko , a U.N. spokesman , said Bosnian Serb units crossed the border into Croatia and seized seven Ukrainian peacekeepers from an observation post Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;2	They took the soldiers and a U.N. armored carrier into Bosnian Serb-held territory , and the United Nations has n't heard from its soldiers since .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;3	The observation post is now occupied by the Serbs , which allows them unimpeded movement of equipment and personnel from Serb-held parts of Croatia into Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;4	Serb rebels from the two countries have joined in an offensive to drive Muslim-led Bosnian government forces out of the Bihac region of northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;5	The fall of Bihac would effectively unite Serb-held territory in Bosnia and Croatia , and the strategic importance of the enclave prompted a warning Thursday from Croatian Defense Minister Gojko Susak .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;6	`` Croatia will not wait for the fall of Bihac , '' Susak told reporters in the capital Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;7	`` We are monitoring the situation , and if Croatia 's judgment is that Bihac is about to fall , Croatia will intervene . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;8	Croatian forces could not get to Bihac without going through territory that Serbs seized in the 1991 Croatian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;9	Bosnian Serbs did agree to meet Friday with top U.N. envoy Yasushi Akashi in Pale , their stronghold east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;10	On Wednesday , they refused to meet U.N. chief Boutros Boutros-Ghali because he insisted talks be held in Sarajevo , capital of Bosnia-Herzegovina 's internationally recognized government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;11	The Serbs agreed to Friday 's meeting after Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , the U.N. commander in Bosnia , traveled to Pale for talks with Radovan Karadzic and other Bosnian Serb leaders .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;12	In addition to trying to calm fighting in the Bihac area , where Serbs forces have overrun Muslim villages , Rose is concerned about the fate of more than 400 of his soldiers being held by the Serbs as insurance against further NATO air strikes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;13	But after Rose 's talks in Pale , no narrowing of differences was evident to raise hopes of an end to the 31-month-long war , which has left 200,000 people dead or missing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;14	Momcilo Krajisnik , leader of the Bosnian Serbs ' self-proclaimed legislature , again rejected a three-month cease-fire , which the Bosnian government wants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;15	He said Serbs would only accept a permanent cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;16	The Sarajevo government fears a permanent cease-fire would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;17	An international peace plan the Serbs have rejected would give Serbs 49 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;18	Senior Western officials now talk of altering that plan to allow the Bosnian Serbs links with Serb-dominated Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;19	Opponents say that would be a step toward creation of Serb nationalists ' goal of a `` Greater Serbia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;20	Continuing the squeeze on the Bosnian government , Serbs again denied U.N. requests to supply the Bihac enclave and other vulnerable U.N.-patrolled sites with food and supplies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;21	Monique Tuffelli , the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees staffer in Bihac , said food stocks would last only another week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;22	`` We have run out almost of everything , '' she said in a telephone interview with The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;23	The last UNHCR food convoy reached Bihac on Oct. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;24	Between May and October , Serbs allowed only a dozen to pass through their territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;25	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said food and fuel supplies for peacekeepers were running short in the government-held eastern Bosnian enclaves , as well as Bihac , 90 miles northwest of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;26	Bosnian radio said Serbs intensified their attacks Thursday afternoon on government-held towns in the Bihac enclave .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;27	Hamdija Kabiljagic , the regional mayor , reported increased fighting along the perimeters of Bihac and shelling of the town itself .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;28	He accused the United Nations of deliberately downplaying the situation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;29	Elsewhere , Serbs hit two government buildings in downtown Sarajevo with anti-tank missiles , wounding four people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;30	Sarajevo 's airport remained closed and the humanitarian airlift suspended , because Serbs had not given security guarantees for incoming planes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;31	In Brussels , Secretary of State Warren Christopher told NATO foreign ministers that the United States and its allies had mishandled the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;32	`` All of us ought to try to learn lessons from the experience in Bosnia , '' he told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;33	Christopher hopes to get formal approval Friday from France , Britain , Germany and Russia for a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0504;34	It calls for a cease-fire around Bihac , a pledge to cease hostilities throughout the country for three to six months , and an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;0	Researchers have isolated a genetic switch that separates the boys from the girls .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;1	It turns off the female in the human embryo and starts biological changes that eventually put hair on the chest .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;2	Dr. Michael Weiss of the University of Chicago said the new study advances the understanding of the complex cascade that determines whether people are male or female and sheds new light on how this process can sometimes go awry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;3	In research to be published Friday in the journal Science , Weiss and his team use sophisticated imaging techniques to explore on an atomic level the biological pathway to manhood .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;4	Their research report traces the development of maleness , from the turning on of the SRY gene , which is on the Y chromosome , to the work of another gene , called MIS , that removes the female parts of the original embryo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;5	Weiss said that science has long known that everybody at conception is female , but the precise biological mechanism that changes an embryo to male is still incompletely understood .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;6	Solving the puzzle on molecular level may answer questions about other basic cellular changes , such as the development of cancer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;7	`` If we can understand the general switches involved in sex determination , then we could possibly relate that to other basic processes , such as how organs differentiate or how cancer arises , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;8	For the first weeks after conception , all mammal embryos start forming the basic female structures -- uterus , fallopian tubes and vagina .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;9	`` The embryo destined to become a boy begins as a female , '' Weiss said in an interview .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;10	`` It lays down first female structures and not male structures at a phase when the embryo looks like a recognizable mammal , with toes , fingers and eyes and a heart .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;11	This is 35 to 40 days into human gestation . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;12	After that , he said , a gene called SRY switches on to start the embryo on its way toward manhood .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;13	The new study shows that SRY also triggers the work of another gene , called MIS , that dissolves the female parts of the original embryo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;14	`` SRY is the master switch , '' said Weiss .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;15	`` For the first time we have shown that SRY can activate a male specific pattern of gene expression leading to activation of MIS , which is the key signaling molecule for half of the male pathway . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;16	Sex determination in mammals originates with the chromosome of the sperm that fertilizes the egg .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;17	Male sperm can carry one of two chromosomes , X or Y. The Y chromosome is the male element that carries the SRY gene .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;18	The female egg has an X chromosome .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;19	If the egg is fertilized with the father 's X chromosome , then the embryo continues its development as a female .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;20	But if the egg is fertilized with Y , then the SRY gene sets off a series of changes that eventually creates a male .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;21	In experiments on embryonic mice , Weiss and his team used nuclear magnetic resonance images to show that the SRY gene sends chemical signals to the MIS gene .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;22	The MIS gene then causes the nascent female organs in the embryo to disappear .
APW_ENG_19941201.0505;23	SRY also starts the growth of testicles , which , in turn , start making testosterone , the hormone that causes development of male characteristics -- the penis , masculine-like muscles and , eventually , facial hair .
APW_ENG_19941201.0506;0	A shareholder has filed a lawsuit against Mellon Bank Corp. , alleging the bank 's losses from risky lending investments are being passed on to investors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0506;1	Matthew Grimes of Las Vegas filed the suit Wednesday in U.S. District Court , two days after Mellon announced it will take a dlrs 130 million charge in the fourth quarter to prevent further losses from investments that went sour .
APW_ENG_19941201.0506;2	The suit seeks compensation and damages for the company from Mellon 's directors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0506;3	Mellon spokeswoman Margaret Cohen said the Pittsburgh-based bank could n't comment on the suit because it had n't seen it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0506;4	The dlrs 130 million charge is being taken to protect clients at its Boston Co. subsidiary from losses on long-term fixed-rate securities that fell in value as interest rates rose .
APW_ENG_19941201.0506;5	The charge will reduce Mellon 's 1994 earnings by 88 cents per share , but the bank will still report a profit for the year and the fourth quarter ending Dec. 31 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;0	Despite an intense lobbying campaign by the Cali cocaine cartel , Colombian lawmakers rejected a bill Thursday that would have made it easier for drug traffickers to keep their fortunes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;1	President Ernesto Samper opposed the bill , already passed by the Senate and a House committee .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;2	In office only four months , Samper has been tainted by reports his election campaign received money from the Cali cocaine cartel .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;3	Passage of the so-called `` narcobill '' would have further damaged Samper 's credibility and made Colombia a pariah state to the United States and other nations fighting drug trafficking .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;4	The Cali cartel reportedly offered bribes to lawmakers to support the bill .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;5	It would have shielded them from prosecution for getting rich illegally , a technique prosecutors use when they ca n't catch drug kingpins actually making deals .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;6	The bill also would have forced authorities to shelve 800 pending cases of illicit enrichment against suspected traffickers , Prosecutor-General Alfonso Valdivieso told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;7	`` We would have had to prove the crime of drug trafficking to later establish the illicit enrichment , which seems absurd because organized crime does not leave fingerprints , '' Valdivieso said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0509;8	Colombian drug kingpins , who supply 80 percent of the world 's cocaine , have largely eluded convictions for drug trafficking but have problems accounting for their fortunes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;0	A rebel Serb assembly met Thursday to endorse an economic agreement with Croatia , a move toward normalization despite artillery duels between the two sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;1	Croatia 's army and Serbs lobbed artillery shells at each other most of the past two days , said U.N. spokesman Paul Risley in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;2	The two sides have had thousands of skirmishes and larger confronations since ending their six-month war with an uneasy , U.N.-patrolled truce in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;3	On Wednesday , the Croatian army fired 33 shells at Serb-held territory over a six-hour period , U.N. spokesman Alexander Ivanko said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;4	Risley said artillery duels continued Thursday in the same area near Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , the self-proclaimed capital of Serb-held Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;5	But Croatian Serbs denied there was any serious trouble Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;6	Reporters in the Croatian port of Split , just west of Knin , saw unusual activity by Croatian army helicopters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;7	Bosnian Serb media claimed that regular Croatian army troops , backed by Bosnian Croats , had attacked Serb positions in Bosnia , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 31 miles -RRB- northeast of Lake Peruca , across the border .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;8	But the United Nations could not confirm that .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;9	Croatia 's Defense Minister Gojko Susak denied his troops were involved in any fighting Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;10	But he suggested to reporters in Zagreb that the time was nearing to take up arms against rebel Serbs , who hold one-third of Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;11	`` Croatia today wants and can regain the territories , '' Susak said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;12	`` We have restrained so far . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;13	But he warned that `` in the next few months Croatia will have to do what every sovereign country would do to regain its territories . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;14	Susak did not find such rhetoric incongruous with the economic agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;15	`` We are viewing this agreement as a step forward towards normalization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;16	But we are not going to wait endlessly for this to happen , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;17	Negotiations between the two sides on the economic agreement had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;18	But the Serbs ' self-styled government late Wednesday recommended that the assembly meeting in Knin approve the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;19	Formal approval had not come by midnight but was expected .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;20	Croatian authorities had already endorsed the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;21	The United Nations , in a statement , announced the agreement would be signed on Friday : by the Croats at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb in the morning , and by the Serbs at U.N. headquarters in Knin in the afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;22	It would be the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their six-month war in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;23	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;24	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;25	The deal , supported by powerful Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and drafted with the help of international negotiators , was viewed as a possible step toward the gradual reintegration of the Serb areas , called the Krajina , into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;26	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since a tenuous cease-fire was reached in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0510;27	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;0	A jury convicted a Lebanese immigrant Thursday of murdering a Jewish teen-ager in an ambush on the Brooklyn Bridge , rejecting his claim that he was suffering a flashback from his childhood in war-torn Beirut .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;1	Rashid Baz , a livery cab driver , admitted he strafed a student van with bullets on March 1 as it drove onto the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;2	Sixteen year-old Aaron Halberstam was killed and three others were wounded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;3	Baz 's lawyer , Eric Sears , blamed his client 's `` catastrophic '' childhood in Beirut , where he became a soldier at age 9 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;4	He said Baz suffers post-traumatic stress syndrome , which climaxed in the bridge shooting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;5	Baz , 28 , said he fired at the van after people in it mouthed insults and leveled a gun at him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;6	Nachum Sosonkin , 18 , a van passenger who was shot in the head and the most badly injured of three wounded survivors , testified at the trial that he never heard anyone inside the van say anything to Baz or display a gun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;7	The jury deliberated one day before convicting Baz of second-degree murder and 14 counts of attempted murder .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;8	Baz , who immigrated from Lebanon at age 18 , faces 25 years to life at his Jan. 18 sentencing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;9	The shooting occurred as the 15 male students , dressed in the distinctive black garb worn by ultra-Orthodox Lubavitcher Jews , returned from a visit to the Manhattan hospital where the Lubavitchers ' leader , Rebbe Menachem Schneerson , was being treated .
APW_ENG_19941201.0511;10	The prosecution cited testimony by Baz 's uncle , Jamal Akel , that Baz 's problems predated the start of Lebanon 's civil war in 1975 and much of his behavior was shocking -- even in Beirut .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;0	Maj. Gen. Jean-Claude Duperval , who replaced former dictator Raoul Cedras as army commander , has been reassigned abroad as a military attache , a local radio station reported Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;1	Duperval , formerly Cedras ' second-in-command , was himself replaced Nov. 17 by an obscure firefighter , Brig. Gen. Bernardin Poisson , who was chosen as army chief by President Jean-Bertrand Aristide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;2	Poisson signed the order to transfer Duperval to Haiti 's diplomatic mission in Brazil , private Radio Quisqueya reported , citing an army source .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;3	The report also said Brig. Gen. Max Mayard was reassigned as military attache in Ecuador .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;4	While no officials at army heaquarters late Thursday would independently confirm the report , Aristide officials have expressed a desire to transfer overseas several senior officers in the 1991-4 military coup government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;5	Several other former members of the military high command have already been reassigned to military attache posts in Europe and South America .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;6	Mayard and Duperval were among four generals in the coup leadership .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;7	The other two , Lt. Gen. Cedras and Brig. Gen. Philippe Biamby , resigned and fled into self-imposed exile in Panama two days before Aristide 's U.S.-backed homecoming on Oct. 15 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;8	Aristide told supporters on Wednesday that he hoped to reform Haiti 's traditionally restive military , which he characterized as a `` cancer . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0512;9	He has pledged to slice the size of the army from 7,500 to 1,500 and to put policing duties under a new civilian police force .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;0	Draped in rubber armor , bristling with guns , the `` Krajina Express '' must be one of the Serbs ' oddest weapons in the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;1	All aboard -- if you dare .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;2	The train , similar to those employed in both world wars , has three combat cars and three freight cars hooked to the front to protect it from mine blasts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;3	It chugs to the front line , aims and fires and then quickly retreats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;4	But on Tuesday , the train took a direct hit from a missile fired by Bosnian government defenders of Bihac , the U.N.-designated `` safe area '' in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;5	The 20-man crew survived and the damage was minor , since a thick rubber curtain absorbed most of the blast .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;6	The car was loaded with ammunition and the train could have exploded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;7	`` We were lucky , '' said Djuro , whose shrapnel wound to the leg was the only injury .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;8	A hundred yards long , roofless and loaded with guns , the `` Krajina Express '' -- named for the Krajina region of neighboring Croatia -- is an example of the firepower Serbs are throwing at defenders of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;9	The United Nations says Croatian Serbs have joined the fighting in the Bihac area , helping anti-government forces corner the Bosnian army 's powerful 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;10	Serb troops say they are determined to punish the 5th Corps for an October offensive that routed them out of the Bihac region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;11	The Serbs counter-attacked in early November and now control 30 percent to 40 percent of the area .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;12	`` The 5th corps is in a desperate position and they will fight to the end , '' said Savo Bursac , who operates a 40 mm anti-aircraft gun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;13	`` I do n't expect them to surrender , and they have nowhere to go . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;14	He said the train crew never would have gotten involved had the 5th Corps not attacked the Serbs in Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;15	`` This is to teach them a lesson and to end the war . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;16	Capt. Blagoje Guska , commander of the train , said it had been fired upon but never hit before the missile attack Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;17	The train usually draws no fire and crew members blamed overconfidence for getting hit .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;18	It rolled back quickly from the dangerous position south of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;19	`` That was our fault , '' said Djuro , who declined to give his last name .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;20	`` We went too close and stayed there exposed for too long . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;21	The motor on a triple-barrel , anti-aircraft machine gun was destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;22	A small fire was quickly extinguished and Djuro got a lift to a nearby hospital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;23	Earlier , on its first of three runs that day , the train followed its standard procedure of appearing suddenly , firing its deadly barrage and quickly retreating .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;24	Approaching from the south , it halted about two miles from Bihac and its guns joined the tank and howitzer fire on the region .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;25	The first shells were fired by a self-propelled cannon , aimed at what was said to be Bosnian army trenches on a remote hill .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;26	Then , missiles that had been taken off of jet fighters and refitted to the train were unleashed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;27	On its third raid , another anti-tank missile fired at the train hit a house about 200 yards away , setting it ablaze .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;28	The house was empty and there were no casualties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;29	Runs toward the government line are interspersed with breaks back at the train 's base about three miles from Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;30	On one run back to the base , small trucks followed with hot soup and fresh bread for lunch .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;31	Morale was boosted by a short visit from Bosnian Serb army deputy commander Gen. Manojlo Milovanovic , who is directing the Bihac campaign .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;32	Later , they sat around an open fire , playing accordion and singing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0513;33	` We are like family and we will be together till the end of this war , '' said Guska .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;0	Canada will wait patiently for the release of 55 Canadian peacekeepers detained by the Bosnian Serbs in the hope the international community will succeed in its latest bid to negotiate a settlement in Bosnia , Foreign Minister Andre Ouellet said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;1	`` What is taking place is certainly not the ideal situation , '' said Ouellet after the first day of a two-day meeting of NATO foreign ministers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;2	`` Fortunately , our soldiers are not in danger more than they were before , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;3	`` They are well treated , they are able to move .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;4	We 've always thought the solution to the conflict -LRB- will not be found through -RRB- military force but through negotiations . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;5	Canada is backing renewed diplomatic efforts by the international contact group on former Yugoslavia made up of Russia , France , Britain , the United States and Germany .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;6	The contact group will meet in Brussels tonight to discuss a new diplomatic initiative that is expected to include the possibility of offering the Bosnian Serbs some form of confederation with Serbia itself in a bid to get the Serbs to the negotiating table .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;7	`` The -LRB- old peace -RRB- plan that has been proposed to the parties has not been totally accepted and has not allowed a peace process to materialize and be implemented , '' said Ouellet , defending the need to look at new approaches .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;8	`` If we 're to be successful , a new round of consultation and contacts and efforts on the diplomatic front have to take place .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;9	We will be supporting these initiatives announced by the contact group in order to be more successful at this time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;10	Critics of the proposed confederation argue that it will reward the Bosnian Serbs by creating a greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;11	U.S. sources insist that any talk of a confederation will not deviate from the current proposed peace map for Bosnia that would give 51 per cent of Bosnia to the Muslim-Croat federation and 49 per cent to the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;12	Ouellet also echoed his fellow NATO ministers claims that the allied divisions over policy in Bosnia did not signal the inevitable breakdown of the alliance
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;13	The NATO ministers made a concerted attempt Thursday to present a united front and dispel the distrust that has plagued NATO ever since Washington last month unilaterally decided to stop enforcing the arms embargo against the Bosnian Muslims .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;14	Britain and France in particular fear that Washington will further destablize NATO by succumbing to domestic pressure and calling for stronger military action to resolve the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;15	Ouellet said all members of the alliance have now agreed that more military action from NATO will not resolve the situation in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0514;16	Canada , Britain and France , the largest contributors of troops to the UN Protection Force in former Yugoslavia , fear their troops could become targets of the warring factions in Bosnia if more force is used or an international arms embargo is lifted .

APW_ENG_19941201.0520;17	Negotiations between the two sides on the economic agreement had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0520;18	But the Serbs ' self-styled government late Wednesday recommended that the assembly meeting in Knin approve the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0520;19	Croatian authorities had already endorsed the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0520;20	The deal , supported by powerful Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and drafted with the help of international negotiators , was viewed as a possible step toward the gradual reintegration of the Serb areas , called the Krajina , into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0520;21	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since a tenuous cease-fire was reached in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0520;22	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;0	Egyptian and U.S. students clashed Thursday on the campus of the American University in Cairo , and officials later said four Americans involved in the incident were leaving the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;1	Students and witnesses said the fight started after U.S. embassy officials arrived at the downtown campus to investigate an incident a day earlier near the campus in which four American students allegedly roughed up the Egyptian president of the Student Union , Mustafa Najam .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;2	They said some 250 students gathered to demand that the diplomats leave the campus , shouting that they had no right to interfere in student affairs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;3	The diplomats were unable to leave until Egyptian police were summoned to break up the protesters , who also were shoving each other , they said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;4	They insisted on anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;5	At least two students , both believed to be Egyptians , were taken to a nearby hospital for treatment of injuries , they said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;6	There were no reports of arrests .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;7	The university , chartered in Washington , D.C. , was founded 75 years ago to foster Western-style education in the Middle East .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;8	The university has an enrollment of more than 3,500 in graduate and undergraduate programs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;9	More than half are Egyptians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;10	Among the foreigners are many American and British students who come to study Arabic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0522;11	The reason for the confrontation between Najam and the American students was not immediately known , but the resulting tensions apparently contributed to Thursday 's problems .

APW_ENG_19941201.0524;0	Nordic navigation authorities agreed on stiffer rules Thursday that would require stronger hinges and better monitoring of cargo doors on ferries .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;1	The rules , which still must be approved by maritime officials , were drafted in the wake of the Estonia ferry disaster , which sank Sept. 28 after its door locks failed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;2	More than 900 people died .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;3	Insurance companies and ferry lines at the time acted quickly to weld shut the doors and visors on ships .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;4	But only the Finnish government issued a blanket order for weldings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;5	The navigation authorities from Sweden , Finland , Norway and Denmark , meeting in Helsinki , agreed on rules that would require hinges on all ferries to be reinforced or replaced , the Swedish news agency TT reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;6	Inspectors had found the weak point to be locks and hinges , rather than the plates that hold them , said Joakim Heimdahl , an official from the Nordic Sea Navigation Board .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;7	`` In many cases , one can see certain sections need replacing or reinforcing , '' Heimdahl said , referring to ship inspections in the past two months .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;8	Agreement by the navigation board was the first hurdle .
APW_ENG_19941201.0524;9	The proposals were referred to the Nordic Marine Safety Inspection Board , which meets Dec. 13 , TT reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;0	Michael Jackson is trying to end his 5-month-old marriage to Lisa Marie Presley , news reports in New York and London said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;1	But the official word from one half of the celebrity couple is that the reports are simply false .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;2	`` Once again , the media is being very irresponsible and spreading false rumors , '' Mrs. Jackson-Presley said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;3	`` Michael and I are very happily married .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;4	... These rumors , in spite of their wishful and destructive thinking , are totally unfounded and false . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;5	The separation speculation comes just after the couple 's six-month anniversary .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;6	Jackson biographer Christopher Andersen said he first heard rumors of a split on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;7	`` I had heard their lawyers were actually talking annulment , '' said the author of `` Michael Jackson Unauthorized . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;8	Lisa Marie and Michael were married in a secret ceremony in the Dominican Republic in May , but rumors about the marriage were n't confirmed until August .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;9	Speculation that the marriage is at best a union of convenience and at worst a publicity ploy started immediately .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;10	`` Are Michael and Lisa Marie friends ?
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;11	Sure -- they 've been friends for a long time .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;12	But that 's not a marriage , '' Andersen said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;13	The current rumors come in several versions .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;14	Andersen says the marriage was `` a scam '' from Day 1 , and now Lisa Marie wants out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;15	Gossip columnist Liz Smith intimates Michael viewed the nuptials as a `` public relations coup , '' but Lisa Marie fell in love and now Michael wants out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;16	Another Jacksonphile , author J. Randy Taraborrelli , blames the split on Lisa 's refusal to move to the East Coast and live with Michael in his Trump Tower apartment in New York .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;17	Whatever the reason , it seems only a few people expect the Jacksons to be exchanging the traditional silverware on their 25th anniversary .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;18	Or , for that matter , paper on anniversary No. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;19	`` I did say the marriage would be over by the end of the year , '' Andersen said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0525;20	`` Not that I want to say I told you so . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;0	Rebel Serbs moved closer toward normalizing ties with Croatia late Thursday , approving an economic agreement despite reported artillery duels between the two sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;1	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly , meeting behind closed doors for nearly eight hours , approved the accord shortly before midnight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;2	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;3	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220-mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;4	It is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their six-month war in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;5	The United Nations , in a statement , announced the agreement would be signed on Friday by the Croats at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb in the morning , and by the Serbs at U.N. headquarters in Knin in the afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;6	The diplomatic moves coincided with battlefield action .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;7	On Wednesday , the Croatian army fired 33 shells at Serb-held territory over a six-hour period , U.N. spokesman Alexander Ivanko said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;8	The artillery duels continued Thursday in the same area near Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.5 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , the self-proclaimed capital of Serb-held Croatia , said Paul Risley , another U.N. spokesman in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;9	But Croatian Serbs denied there was any serious trouble Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;10	Reporters in the Croatian port of Split , just west of Knin , saw unusual activity by Croatian army helicopters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;11	Bosnian Serb media claimed that regular Croatian army troops , backed by Bosnian Croats , had attacked Serb positions in Bosnia , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 30 miles -RRB- northeast of Lake Peruca , across the border .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;12	But the United Nations could not confirm that .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;13	The two sides have had thousands of skirmishes and larger confronations since ending their six-month war with an uneasy , U.N.-patrolled truce in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;14	Croatia 's Defense Minister Gojko Susak denied his troops were involved in any fighting Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;15	But he suggested to reporters in Zagreb that the time was nearing to take up arms against rebel Serbs , who hold a third of Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;16	`` Croatia today wants and can regain the territories , '' Susak said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;17	`` We have restrained so far . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;18	But he warned that `` in the next few months Croatia will have to do what every sovereign country would do to regain its territories . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;19	Susak did not find such rhetoric incongruous with the economic agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;20	`` We are viewing this agreement as a step forward towards normalization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;21	But we are not going to wait endlessly for this to happen , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;22	Negotiations between the two sides on the economic agreement had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;23	But the Serbs ' self-styled government late Wednesday recommended that the assembly meeting in Knin approve the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;24	Croatian authorities had already endorsed the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;25	The deal , supported by powerful Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and drafted with the help of international negotiators , was viewed as a possible step toward the gradual reintegration of the Serb areas , called the Krajina , into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;26	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since a tenuous cease-fire was reached in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0526;27	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
