APW_ENG_19941201.0528;0	Rebel Serbs moved closer toward normalizing ties with Croatia late Thursday , approving an economic agreement despite reported artillery duels between the two sides .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;1	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly , after a nearly eight-hour , closed-door session , approved the accord as expected shortly before midnight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;2	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;3	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;4	It is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their six-month war in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;5	The United Nations , in a statement , announced the agreement would be signed on Friday : by the Croats at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb in the morning , and by the Serbs at U.N. headquarters in Knin in the afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;6	The diplomatic moves coincided with battlefield action .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;7	On Wednesday , the Croatian army fired 33 shells at Serb-held territory over a six-hour period , U.N. spokesman Alexander Ivanko said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;8	The artillery duels continued Thursday in the same area near Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , the self-proclaimed capital of Serb-held Croatia , said Paul Risley , another U.N. spokesman in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;9	Reporters in the Croatian port of Split , just west of Knin , also reported unusual activity by Croatian army helicopters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;10	But Croatian Serbs denied there was any serious trouble Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;11	Bosnian Serb media claimed that regular Croatian army troops , backed by Bosnian Croats , had attacked Serb positions in Bosnia , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 31 miles -RRB- northeast of Lake Peruca , across the border .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;12	The United Nations could not confirm that .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;13	There have been thousands of skirmishes and larger confronations between the Croats and their Serb minority since their six-month war ended with an uneasy , U.N.-patrolled truce in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;14	Croatia 's Defense Minister Gojko Susak denied his troops were involved in any fighting Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;15	But he suggested to reporters in Zagreb that the time was nearing to take up arms against rebel Serbs , who hold one-third of Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;16	`` Croatia today wants and can regain the territories , '' Susak said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;17	`` We have restrained so far . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;18	But he warned that `` in the next few months Croatia will have to do what every sovereign country would do to regain its territories . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;19	Susak did not find such rhetoric incongruous with the economic agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;20	`` We are viewing this agreement as a step forward towards normalization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;21	But we are not going to wait endlessly for this to happen , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;22	Negotiations between the two sides on the economic agreement had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;23	But the Serbs ' self-styled government late Wednesday recommended that the assembly meeting in Knin approve the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;24	Croatian authorities had already endorsed the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0528;25	Supported by powerful Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic and drafted with the help of international negotiators , the accord was viewed as a possible step toward the gradual reintegration of the Serb areas , called the Krajina , into Croatia .

APW_ENG_19941201.0532;0	Lucien Bouchard , a central and charismatic leader of Quebec 's separatist movement , had his left leg amputated Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;1	His emergency hospitalization throws into doubt the role the Bloc Quebecois leader will play in next year 's critical referendum on separation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;2	French-speaking Quebec has long sought some form of sovereignty or separation from the rest of Canada , which is largely English-speaking .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;3	Bouchard , 55 , was in serious but stable condition Thursday at Montreal 's Saint-Luc Hospital , where he was hospitalized Tuesday for a blood clot in his leg .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;4	Bouchard 's doctor , Patrick D'Amico , said in a statement that Bouchard developed an infection on his leg after being hospitalized .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;5	`` This situation necessitated two operations to drain and amputate the leg and control the infection , '' said D'Amico .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;6	Widely considered the most compelling Quebec separatist leader , the charismatic Bouchard 's absence from the upcoming referendum battle would be a blow to forces seeking Quebec 's secession .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;7	Quebec Premier Jacques Parizeau prevailed on Bouchard to show the same courage he has regularly displayed in the political arena .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;8	`` Our prayers are with you , '' said a shaken Parizeau .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;9	`` I hope this will soon be just a bad dream .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;10	Hold on old friend . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;11	A Bloc Quebecois spokesman refused to provide more details on Bouchard 's condition .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;12	Bouchard is with him now , '' Marthe Lawrence , Bouchard 's spokesperson , said from the hospital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;13	`` The family wishes no further statement for the moment . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0532;14	Bouchard became leader of the Opposition after his fledgling party swept Quebec in the 1993 federal election , winning 54 out of 75 seats in the province .
APW_ENG_19941201.0533;0	A ferry carrying more than 400 people collided with a freighter and sank before dawn Friday , the Philippine coast guard reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0533;1	The ship sank near the town of Maragondon , about 35 miles southwest of Manila in Cavite province near the mouth of Manila Bay .
APW_ENG_19941201.0533;2	There was no immediate word whether anyone was rescued .
APW_ENG_19941201.0533;3	The ship was coming from Tagbilaran , capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941201.0533;4	News reports said the Singapore-registered freighter , with a crew of 26 , did not sink .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;0	Russia 's prisons are overcrowded and inhumane , with underfed inmates crammed into stinking , standing-room-only cells , a U.N. report said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;1	Conditions in pre-trial detention centers -- where first-time offenders accused of petty crimes can wait up to five years for a court appearance -- are even worse than labor camps for hardened convicts , the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;2	`` The oppressive heat , lack of oxygen , and the odors of sweat , excrement and disease created by gross overcrowding are overpowering , '' said Nigel Rodley , the U.N. 's special investigator on torture , who wrote the report .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;3	At the invitation of the Russian government , Rodley spent two weeks visiting prisons near Moscow and St. Petersburg , including four pre-trial centers , two police headquarters , one labor camp , one juvenile center and one hospital for seriously ill prisoners .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;4	The Russian government estimates there are 500,000 prisoners in about 528 prisons and penal colonies throughout the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;5	Russia has the highest rate of detentions in the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;6	Rodley said the skyrocketing crime rate following the end of communist control has worsened already serious overcrowding in prisons .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;7	He criticized Russian authorities for responding to public concern about crime by throwing petty offenders into jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;8	He called on President Boris Yeltsin to issue a presidential decree releasing 71,000 non-violent , first-time offenders to ease the overcrowding .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;9	`` It 's a radical proposal because it 's a radical problem which needs to be addressed urgently , '' Rodley said at a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;10	He said beatings and maltreatment were widespread .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;11	`` The conditions are cruel , inhuman and degrading ; they are torturous , '' he wrote about cells in Moscow 's Butyrskaya prison .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;12	`` There is virtually no daylight .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;13	There is insufficient room for everyone to lie down , sit down or even stand up at the same time . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;14	Butyrskaya prison was constructed in 1771 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;15	Built for 3,500 prisoners , it now holds 6,300 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;16	`` The food , not always available because of the indebtedness of the institutions -- is primitive , of a fat-saturated soupy nature .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;17	It is consumed in the cell and is excreted in the cell , '' the report said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;18	In another Moscow detention center , Matrosskaya Tishina No. 1 , conditions in quarantine cells for sick prisoners were atrocious .
APW_ENG_19941201.0534;19	`` Despite the fact that several of the inmates had open , festering sores , severe fungal infections with decaying flesh , and extensive rashes , they reported that they had not seen a doctor in over a week , '' Rodley wrote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0535;0	A ferry carrying more than 400 people collided with a freighter and sank before dawn Friday in Manila Bay , the Philippine coast guard reported .

APW_ENG_19941201.0547;1	`` We are in this country because we fled from Cuba , a place without hope where the words `` war '' and `` hate '' are constantly in schools , books and television , '' one of the children said in a speech delivered in front of the main government building .

APW_ENG_19941201.0547;3	Hundreds of Cubans have fled to this tiny British territory just 70 miles -LRB- 110 kilometers -RRB- south of Cuba since early August , when riots in Havana prompted Cuban President Fidel Castro to say he would not prevent people from leaving .
APW_ENG_19941201.0547;4	The approximately 1,175 Cubans who remain represent about 4 percent of the 30,000 residents of this tourist resort and offshore banking center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0547;5	The local government is housing them in a tented camp and trying to persuade the United States to accept them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0547;6	The United States is already hosting thousands of Cubans in refugee camps .

APW_ENG_19941201.0547;9	The government has said it would screen all refugees and provide shelter to those who fled political persecution .
APW_ENG_19941201.0547;10	It said if the United States did n't accept the others , it would repatriate them as long as the Cuban government would guarantee their safety .

APW_ENG_19941201.0551;0	Tons of food and donated goods from around the world are resupplying and fattening Rwanda 's exiled , genocidal Hutu regime as it plots a bloody return to power .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;1	The new government , meanwhile , is bankrupt , powerless and at the mercy of a world seemingly indifferent to its struggle to heal a shattered society and rebuild a nation .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;2	`` I 'm stumped .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;3	And I think it 's just scandalous , '' said Chris Hennemeyer of Catholic Relief Services .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;4	`` Either there is a massive conspiracy to keep Rwanda down ... or the world community is incredibly incompetent . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;5	Whatever the intent , international actions since the holocaust began in this tiny Central African nation have consistently helped the killers : -- When Rwanda 's president , a Hutu , was killed in a suspicious plane crash April 6 and order collapsed , the United Nations withdrew most of its troops .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;6	That freed the Hutu army and its affiliated militias to butcher an estimated 500,000 people , mostly ethnic Tutsis and moderate Hutus .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;7	-- In July , the Tutsi-led rebels of the Rwandan Patriotic Front toppled the remnants of the Hutu-dominated government , which promptly urged more than a million countrymen to flee with it into neighboring Zaire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;8	In the ensuing four months , relief groups have spent hundreds of millions of dollars to feed , shelter and care for the survivors and perpetrators of the bloodletting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;9	-- Of the dlrs 1.5 billion spent so far on the Rwanda crisis , dlrs 850 million has gone to help refugees outside the borders .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;10	The millions earmarked for rebuilding in Rwanda are controlled by the aid organizations for chosen programs ; Rwanda 's bankrupt government is powerless to help itself .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;11	`` It 's so unfair .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;12	It 's so perverted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;13	It 's so disgusting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;14	You keep searching for an explanation , '' said Rakiya Omaar of African Rights , a London-based humanitarian group .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;15	Cruel explanations exist , of course .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;16	The World Bank ca n't make a loan until the new government pays the old government 's outstanding debts .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;17	Aid organizations are flush with donations from around the globe but are n't allowed to give humanitarian assistance to a partisan government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;18	Similarly , the U.N. World Food Program may not help feed the national army , which is unpaid and in danger of disintegrating into a thieving mob .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;19	But it does feed former soldiers and militiamen who control the refugee camps by stealing relief supplies and holding hostage many people who want to return to Rwanda .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;20	`` The international community finds it easier to give largess , money , bounty to a humanitarian crisis because no one questions it , '' said Shaharyar Khan , the United Nations ' special envoy to Rwanda .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;21	`` But due consideration needs to be given to getting the ship of state afloat again , too . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;22	Relief organizations `` respond better to a refugee situation -- it 's manageable , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;23	`` You do n't have to go into detailed explanations of who is responsible .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;24	You just get pictures of poor refugees dying of cholera and it 's very good for fund-raising . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;25	In the squalid camps around Goma , Zaire , cholera is largely conquered .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;26	Malnutrition is a greater worry now as hard-eyed young men at ramshackle wooden stands sell sacks and cans of food clearly labeled as humanitarian donations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;27	Most of these merchants of purloined goods are believed to be members of the Hutu militias responsible for much of the ethnic carnage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;28	This relief travesty occurs because U.N. and private agencies merely deliver food to the camps .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;29	Its distribution is handled by the Hutu bosses , who use it to reward loyalists and punish those they label traitors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;30	Brenda Barton , spokeswoman for the World Food Program , estimates 25 percent of food sent to the camps is being pilfered and sold in the camps ' markets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;31	The camp leaders use other means of intimidation , too .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;32	Stabbed and beaten bodies are found in the camps almost daily ; aid workers blame Hutu leaders for the murders of dozens , perhaps hundreds , of people who have tried to go home .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;33	Major aid agencies have threatened to pull out of the camps unless the United Nations provides protection for their workers , some of whom have been briefly kidnapped by Hutu thugs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;34	This week , the Security Council voted to keep 5,500 U.N. peacekeepers in Rwanda until June 9 , 1995 , but delayed action on committing up to 5,000 troops for camp security until member nations could be consulted .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;35	Referring to the thousands of defeated Hutu soldiers and militiamen living in camps near Goma , the council said it was `` alarmed at the indications that these groups and individuals may be preparing for an armed invasion of Rwanda . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;36	A few aid groups have bent the rules a little to get food to the Rwandan army and badly needed items to some ministries , Khan said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;37	`` It 's a drop in the ocean , '' said Christine Umutoni , Rwanda 's deputy rehabilitation minister .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;38	`` The international community should not just sit and watch .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;39	It 's like sitting and watching an invalid . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;40	In Kigali , the capital , where aid organizations file reports on computers and contact the outside world by satellite and radio telephones , Rwandan agencies scrounge for pencils and stationery .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;41	A small fleet of government vehicles disappeared with the retreating Hutu officials , who also looted the Central Bank .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;42	Rwanda 's new justice minister , who hopes to bring 30,000 Hutus to trial on genocide charges , works in a bullet-scarred office that is often without electricity .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;43	The office has a single typewriter , no copying machine and a telephone that works so randomly it 's often impossible to call across town .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;44	After lobbying by Khan , several European nations recently pledged money to help the government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;45	To date , none has arrived .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;46	Last Friday , the European Union freed 45 percent of the dlrs 183 million it had set aside for Rwanda through 1995 -- but only dlrs 10 million went directly to the government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;47	Umutoni said some nations are making grants conditional on unrealistic demands , such as making the country safe for returnees and halting all reprisal killings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;48	But without money , she says , the government ca n't make improvements to lure people home , or train enough police to stop the killings or open the courts to try the killers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;49	An international war crimes tribunal is also months away , probably longer .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;50	`` Sometimes I think people ask too much , '' Umutoni said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;51	Rwandans have been so traumatized , she said , that it would not be startling if there were still `` 1,000 people being killed everyday and their bodies floating in the river . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;52	`` If you do n't have a justice system , Rwandans will be tempted , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;53	`` Right now they hold themselves because they know the tribunal was promised .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;54	And , Umutoni added , she might have expected too much from the world .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;55	`` After what Rwanda went through , we expected help to be automatic , that people would just switch on .
APW_ENG_19941201.0551;56	I think they should know that Rwanda has gone through hell and needs immediate help . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;0	The Senate gave final congressional approval to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade on a vote of 76-24 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;1	The House of Representatives had approved the accord on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;2	The Senate had voted 68-32 just minutes earlier to waive its own budget rules and remove a key procedural hurdle to passage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;3	Sixty votes were needed in the earlier vote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;4	Clinton , badly in need of a congressional victory to lift his battered fortunes following the November elections that gave opposition Republicans control of Congress , had worked throughout the day to convince wavering lawmakers to support the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;5	Retiring Democratic Leader George Mitchell noted that the vote was the last one to be taken by the 103rd Congress and the last he would ever take in the Senate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0552;6	He said he was proud that his last vote as a senator was `` on a matter that will have significance for generations to come . ''

APW_ENG_19941201.0553;2	There was no immediate word whether a coast guard rescue effort was at all successful .

APW_ENG_19941201.0554;0	Smokers are 50 percent more likely to suffer from impotence than nonsmokers , the U.S. government said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;1	Researchers at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said the rate may be even slightly higher , because some men in the study may have been unwilling to acknowledge the sexual disorder .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;2	`` It 's more bad news for smokers , '' said Dr. David Mannino of the CDC 's National Center for Environmental Health .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;3	Researchers estimate that up to 10 million U.S. men are impotent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;4	Smoking had long been suspected as a factor , along with diet , diabetes , aging , alcohol and medication .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;5	The study was based on a survey of 4,462 U.S. Army Vietnam veterans between the ages of 31 and 49 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;6	Of that number , 1,162 said they never smoked ; 1,292 said they were former smokers ; and 2,008 said they currently smoked .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;7	Among nonsmokers , 2.2 percent said they suffered persistent impotence , compared to 2 percent of former smokers and 3.7 percent of current smokers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;8	Researchers said the difference in the rate of impotence reported by nonsmokers and former smokers was statistically insignificant .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;9	There would be a 68 percent difference in the rate of impotence reported by smokers and nonsmokers except that Mannino said the risk dropped to 50 percent when other factors such as drug abuse , race , age and vascular disease were taken into account .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;10	The report , published in the December issue of the American Journal of Epidemiology , is the first to show that smoking alone is a risk factor for impotence , said Dr. Robert J. Krane , head of Boston University Medical Center 's urology department .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;11	Krane was among a group of researchers trying to examine a possible link between smoking and impotence in men over age 50 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;12	Most cases of impotence occur among older men .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;13	He said it was particularly striking that the survey participants were younger men .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;14	`` It 's quite impressive that we see a difference in this younger age group , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;15	Mannino said the study did not examine why smoking could lead to impotence , but earlier research has shown that smokers are more likely to develop vascular disease , which plays a role in sexual dysfunction .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;16	`` You need good blood vessels to maintain an erection , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;17	Other evidence points to the numerous compounds in cigarette smoke , such as carbon monoxide , which can relax the blood vessels or affect the nervous system and thus prevent an erection .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;18	Neither years spent smoking nor the number of cigarettes smoked daily appeared to predict whether a smoker would be impotent , but Mannino said that could change as the men age .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;19	`` This is in relatively young men , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0554;20	`` They may develop more of a problem '' as they continue to smoke .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;0	About 50 Dominican prisoners ordered released by the courts but still behind bars rioted Thursday , burning mattresses and clothes in a call to be let out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;1	No injuries were reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;2	`` We want justice , we want liberty , '' shouted the inmates at the La Victoria prison 14 kilometers -LRB- 9 miles -RRB- north of the capital city .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;3	The eight-hour uprising was quelled only when police sprayed about 20,000 gallons -LRB- 76,000 liters -RRB- of water into the cells and the country 's Human Rights Commission president , Virgilio Almanzar , asked the inmates to stop .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;4	Santo Domingo prosecutor Alexis Joaquin Castillo was scheduled to meet with the inmates Friday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;5	An estimated 130 of La Victoria 's 4,000 prisoners were declared innocent or ordered released by the courts months ago , but they remain in jail .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;6	Some were jailed only on the orders of police , with no charges against them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;7	Human rights groups and the inmates ' families have demanded the release of the prisoners , known locally as `` the disrespected . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;8	President Joaquin Balaguer has said the prisoners should remain behind bars , arguing that the decisions to release them were tainted by corruption .
APW_ENG_19941201.0555;9	He created a committee to review the cases .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;0	U.S. Olympic silver medalist Picabo Street had the fastest time Thursday in the final tuneup for the opening women 's World Cup downhill ski race of the season .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;1	Street beat Canadian Kate Pace by 31-hundredths of a second on the third day of training .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;2	Street , who coasted through the finish and nonchalantly missed the final gate , was timed in 1 minute , 45.66 seconds as the 26th starter .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;3	For the first time , downhillers in the top seed of 15 can select their starting numbers from 1 through 30 , and most of the favorites chose numbers in the 20s for the training runs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;4	Pace , who won the 1993 world championship downhill , had a time of 1:45.97 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;5	Anja Haas of Austria was third at 1:46.02 , followed by Olympic champion and defending World Cup downhill titlist Katja Seizinger of Germany at 1:46.03 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;6	Switzerland 's Chantal Bournissen , who led the first training run Tuesday , was fifth at 1:46.46 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;7	Melanie Suchet of France was sixth at 1:46.55 , and Swiss veteran Heidi Zeller-Baehler , winner of the giant slalom in the season-opening races last weekend , was seventh at 1:46.56 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;8	Street said she `` went way wide '' on a turn in the top part of the course .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;9	`` But I carried my speed OK through there .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;10	I took a pretty tight line after that and things were coming at me faster , but I was ready for it . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;11	`` The course probably wo n't be a whole lot faster tomorrow , '' Street said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;12	`` It will be a matter of who can clean up their mistakes and find a couple more tenths . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;13	Pace was pleased with her result , after placing ninth and 13th in the two previous training runs .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;14	`` Finally , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;15	`` I have n't been able to follow my game plan because of the loose snow on the course , but there was no loose snow or fresh snow overnight , and the course was perfect today . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;16	Hilary Lindh of Juneau , Alaska , the 1992 Olympic silver medalist in downhill who posted her first World Cup win last February , was 17th in 1:47.02 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;17	`` I think I can do better , '' Lindh said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;18	`` I 've never done well here .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;19	Certain people have courses they do well on , and this does n't happen to be one of mine .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;20	I 've always had a hard time on the turns at the bottom . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;21	Canada 's Melanie Turgeon , leader on the second day of training , finished a distant 42nd at 1:48.35 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0556;22	Friday 's downhill race will be followed by a super-G Saturday and a giant slalom Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;0	On the crucial budget waiver vote , the accord was supported by 31 Republicans and 37 Democrats and was opposed by 15 Republicans and 17 Democrats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;1	Senate Republican Leader Robert Dole said his office was still getting up to 2,000 calls a day protesting the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;2	Dole said he had decided to support agreement , even with its flaws , because the alternative of defeat would be far worse .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;3	`` The bottom line is we just ca n't isolate ourselves from the rest of the world , '' Dole said before the Senate began voting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;4	The 124-nation trade agreement cuts tariffs by an average of 38 percent worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;5	For the first time , it extends GATT rules to such new areas as reduction of trade-distorting agriculture subsidies , lowering trade barriers in service industries such as banking , and clamping down on copyright piracy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;6	It also creates a more powerful World Trade Organization to referee trade disputes and eliminates the one-country veto that a losing nation could use to block an adverse ruling .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;7	Supporters said the agreement , by cutting the border taxes Americans have to pay while at the same time lowering barriers U.S. businesses and farmers face overseas , would provide a tremendous boost to the U.S. economy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;8	The Clinton administration estimated this would create a half-million new jobs and mean an annual increase of dlrs 150 billion in U.S. economic growth a decade from now , when the deal is fully implemented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;9	That extra growth would put dlrs 1,700 more a year in the pockets of the average American family , the administration said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;10	However , opponents charged that the WTO represented a dangerous encroachment on U.S. sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;11	They said that seven previous GATT negotiating rounds to lower trade barriers have not cured America 's chronic trade deficit nor stopped the hemorrhage of manufacturing jobs overseas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;12	They warned that in textiles alone , one of America 's most protected industries , 1 million jobs could be lost .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;13	`` We are not leading in world trade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;14	We are losing , '' Sen. Ernest Hollings , a Democrat from South Carolina , a leading textile state , said during floor debate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;15	`` The reality is that we are in decline .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;16	Everybody knows that . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;17	The administration was anxious for a healthy bipartisan victory margin as a way to show that a Democratic White House will be able to work next year with the first Republican-controlled Congress in four decades .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;18	The Senate vote followed a surprisingly large 142-vote margin of victory in the House on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;19	Before the congressional action , only 36 other nations had approved GATT .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;20	But many other nations were simply waiting to see what the United States did .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;21	The agreement is scheduled to go into effect on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;22	The debate over the WTO came during the first outgoing session of Congress in 12 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;23	It was forced by Hollings , who used his power as a chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee to block a vote before the November elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0557;24	A diverse group of opponents worked down to the wire to defeat the deal , taking out newspaper ads and mobilizing opponents to telephone lawmakers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;0	Rebel Serbs approved an economic agreement with Croatia 's government Thursday , but they still hurled artilery shells at each other .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;1	The agreement calls for resuming water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway connecting Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;2	Two sections of the 220 mile highway are controlled by Croatian Serb rebels .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;3	It is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;4	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;5	Croatian authorities had already approved the deal , which was crafted with the help of international negotiators .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;6	The two sides will not meet face to face to sign the deal Friday , the United Nations said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;7	The Croats will sign it at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb in the morning while the Serbs will sign at U.N. headquarters in Knin , their capital , in the afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;8	The diplomatic moves coincided with battlefield action .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;9	Artillery duels continued Thursday near Lake Peruca , about 19 miles southeast of Knin , said Paul Risley , a U.N. spokesman in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;10	Croatian Serbs denied there was any serious military action Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;11	Reporters in the Croatian port of Split , just west of Knin , saw unusual activity by Croatian army helicopters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;12	The two sides have had thousands of skirmishes and larger confronations since ending their six-month war with an uneasy , U.N.-patrolled truce in January 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0559;13	Croatia 's Defense Minister Gojko Susak said his troops may soon attempt to regain territory from rebel Serbs who control one-third of Croatia .

APW_ENG_19941201.0561;1	`` We are in this country because we fled from Cuba , a place without hope where the words ` war ' and ` hate ' are constantly in schools , books and television , '' one of the children said in a speech in front of the main government building .
APW_ENG_19941201.0561;2	`` We want to know this world which promises a future full of hope , '' the child said .

APW_ENG_19941201.0561;4	About 1,175 Cubans are living in this tourist resort and offshore banking center .
APW_ENG_19941201.0561;5	The local government is housing them in a tented camp and trying to persuade the United States to accept them .
APW_ENG_19941201.0561;6	The Cubans here organized the march to ask for U.S. visas for the elderly and families with young children .

APW_ENG_19941201.0563;0	Bosnian Serb fighters tightened their stranglehold on the `` safe area '' of Bihac , but agreed to meet Friday with the top United Nations envoy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;1	Bosnian Serbs were to meet with chief U.N. representative Yasushi Akashi in Pale , their stronghold east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;2	On Wednesday , they refused to meet U.N. chief Boutros Boutros-Ghali because he insisted talks be held in Sarajevo , capital of Bosnia-Herzegovina 's internationally recognized government .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;3	The Serbs agreed to Friday 's meeting after Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , the U.N. commander in Bosnia , traveled to Pale for talks with Radovan Karadzic and other Bosnian Serb leaders .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;4	Alexander Ivanko , a U.N. spokesman , said Thursday that Bosnian Serb units crossed the border into Croatia and seized seven Ukrainian peacekeepers from an observation post Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;5	They took the soldiers and a U.N. armored carrier into Bosnian Serb-held territory , and the United Nations has n't heard from its soldiers since .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;6	The observation post is now occupied by the Serbs , which allows them unimpeded movement of equipment and personnel from Serb-held parts of Croatia into Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;7	Serb rebels from the two countries have joined in an offensive to drive Muslim-led Bosnian government forces out of the Bihac region of northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;8	The fall of Bihac would effectively unite Serb-held territory in Bosnia and Croatia , and the strategic importance of the enclave prompted a warning Thursday from Croatian Defense Minister Gojko Susak .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;9	`` Croatia will not wait for the fall of Bihac , '' Susak told reporters in the capital Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;10	`` We are monitoring the situation , and if Croatia 's judgment is that Bihac is about to fall , Croatia will intervene . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;11	Croatian forces could not get to Bihac without going through territory that Serbs seized in the 1991 Croatian war .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;12	In addition to trying to calm fighting in the Bihac area , where Serbs forces have overrun Muslim villages , Rose is concerned about the fate of more than 400 of his soldiers being held by the Serbs as insurance against further NATO air strikes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;13	But after Rose 's talks in Pale , no narrowing of differences was evident to raise hopes of an end to the 31-month-long war , which has left 200,000 people dead or missing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;14	Momcilo Krajisnik , leader of the Bosnian Serbs ' self-proclaimed legislature , again rejected a three-month cease-fire , which the Bosnian government wants .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;15	He said Serbs would only accept a permanent cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;16	The Sarajevo government fears a permanent cease-fire would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;17	An international peace plan the Serbs have rejected would give Serbs 49 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;18	Senior Western officials now talk of altering that plan to allow the Bosnian Serbs links with Serb-dominated Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;19	Opponents say that would be a step toward creation of Serb nationalists ' goal of a `` Greater Serbia . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;20	Continuing the squeeze on the Bosnian government , Serbs again denied U.N. requests to supply the Bihac enclave and other vulnerable U.N.-patrolled sites with food and supplies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;21	Monique Tuffelli , the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees staffer in Bihac , said food stocks would last only another week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;22	`` We have run out almost of everything , '' she said in a telephone interview with The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;23	The last UNHCR food convoy reached Bihac on Oct. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;24	Between May and October , Serbs allowed only a dozen to pass through their territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;25	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said food and fuel supplies for peacekeepers were running short in the government-held eastern Bosnian enclaves , as well as Bihac , 145 kilometers -LRB- 90 miles -RRB- northwest of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0563;26	Bosnian radio said Serbs intensified their attacks Thursday afternoon on government-held towns in the Bihac enclave .

APW_ENG_19941201.0565;0	The U.S. Senate overwhelmingly approved and sent to President Clinton the historic 124-nation GATT trade agreement that will slash tariffs worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;1	The Senate gave final congressional approval Thursday night to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade on a vote of 76-24 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;2	The House of Representatives had approved the accord on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;3	The Senate had voted 68-32 just minutes earlier to waive its own budget rules and remove a key procedural hurdle to passage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;4	Sixty votes were needed in the earlier vote .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;5	Clinton , badly in need of a congressional victory to lift his battered fortunes following the November elections that gave opposition Republicans control of Congress , had worked throughout the day to convince wavering lawmakers to support the deal .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;6	Retiring Democratic Leader George Mitchell noted that the vote was the last one to be taken by the 103rd Congress and the last he would ever take in the Senate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;7	He said he was proud that his last vote as a senator was `` on a matter that will have significance for generations to come . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;8	On the crucial budget waiver vote , the accord was supported by 31 Republicans and 37 Democrats and was opposed by 15 Republicans and 17 Democrats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;9	Senate Republican Leader Robert Dole said his office was still getting up to 2,000 calls a day protesting the agreement .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;10	Dole said he had decided to support agreement , even with its flaws , because the alternative of defeat would be far worse .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;11	`` The bottom line is we just ca n't isolate ourselves from the rest of the world , '' Dole said before the Senate began voting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;12	The trade agreement cuts tariffs by an average of 38 percent worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;13	For the first time , it extends GATT rules to such new areas as reduction of trade-distorting agriculture subsidies , lowering trade barriers in service industries such as banking , and clamping down on copyright piracy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;14	It also creates a more powerful World Trade Organization to referee trade disputes and eliminates the one-country veto that a losing nation could use to block an adverse ruling .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;15	Supporters said the agreement , by cutting the border taxes Americans have to pay while at the same time lowering barriers U.S. businesses and farmers face overseas , would provide a tremendous boost to the U.S. economy .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;16	The Clinton administration estimated this would create a half-million new jobs and mean an annual increase of dlrs 150 billion in U.S. economic growth a decade from now , when the deal is fully implemented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;17	That extra growth would put dlrs 1,700 more a year in the pockets of the average American family , the administration said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;18	However , opponents charged that the WTO represented a dangerous encroachment on U.S. sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;19	They said that seven previous GATT negotiating rounds to lower trade barriers have not cured America 's chronic trade deficit nor stopped the hemorrhage of manufacturing jobs overseas .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;20	They warned that in textiles alone , one of America 's most protected industries , 1 million jobs could be lost .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;21	`` We are not leading in world trade .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;22	We are losing , '' Sen. Ernest Hollings , a Democrat from South Carolina , a leading textile state , said during floor debate .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;23	`` The reality is that we are in decline .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;24	Everybody knows that . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;25	The administration was anxious for a healthy bipartisan victory margin as a way to show that a Democratic White House will be able to work next year with the first Republican-controlled Congress in four decades .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;26	The Senate vote followed a surprisingly large 142-vote margin of victory in the House on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;27	Before the congressional action , only 36 other nations had approved GATT .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;28	But many other nations were simply waiting to see what the United States did .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;29	The agreement is scheduled to go into effect on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;30	The debate over the WTO came during the first outgoing session of Congress in 12 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;31	It was forced by Hollings , who used his power as a chairman of the Senate Commerce Committee to block a vote before the November elections .
APW_ENG_19941201.0565;32	A diverse group of opponents worked down to the wire to defeat the deal , taking out newspaper ads and mobilizing opponents to telephone lawmakers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0566;0	The crash was the seventh in 70 launches since the commercial European Space Agency rocket program lifted off 15 years ago and became the world 's most successful launcher of lucrative private satellites .
APW_ENG_19941201.0566;1	Technicians at the Arianespace launching pad on the edge of the South American jungle said that the third-stage engine inexplicably lost pressure 218 kilometers -LRB- 135 miles -RRB- above Earth .
APW_ENG_19941201.0566;2	An investigation was opened immediately and a news conference scheduled for Friday to explain the initial findings .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;0	Chechnya has been a thorn in Russia 's side since the early 19th century , when the Russian Empire rapidly expanded through the Caucasus Mountains , gobbling up small countries and ethnic enclaves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;1	Many of the small nations gave in , thankful for Russian protection against hostile neighbors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;2	In the Russian mind , Chechnya still evokes images of warriors , savages and criminals -- and also victims of Russian and Soviet persecution .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;3	There is a religious divide as well ; Chechens are Muslims , Russians Christians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;4	For 50 years , the Chechens held out against Russian domination , capitulating in 1859 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;5	The dark-haired mountaineers often existed by raiding their neighbors for food , and Russian military camps quickly became targets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;6	In one well-known poem that is required reading in many Russian schools , poet Mikhail Lermontov referred to `` the evil Chechen -LRB- who -RRB- crawls up the bank '' of the Terek River .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;7	After the Chechen surrender , Russian Cossacks were encouraged to settle nearby to work the fertile lands and keep the peace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;8	But the fragile balance between Russian and Chechen was shattered under dictator Josef Stalin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;9	He first dispersed the Cossacks in an early purge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;10	Then , during World War II , he accused Chechens of supporting the Nazis and deported the entire nation , sending almost 400,000 people to Central Asia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;11	When they were allowed to return after Stalin 's death , Chechens found their homes destroyed and their land seized by former neighbors , mostly Russians or Ossetians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;12	Only Soviet repression kept the ethnic conflict from boiling over .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;13	With the Soviet breakup , age-old hostilities have flared again .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;14	The capital , Grozny , has become a war zone between forces loyal to Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev , who declared independence from Moscow in 1991 , and Chechen rebels trying to topple him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;15	Russian troops are stationed in neighboring Ossetia and Ingushetia , but Chechnya has told Moscow to stay away .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;16	Russia on Thursday backed off from a threat to send troops after Chechnya defied a Russian ultimatum and called on armed volunteers to defend the capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;17	Air attacks continued on the outskirts of Grozny on Thursday , claiming at least a few civilian lives .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;18	And a Russian delegation arrived from Moscow and began talks with Chechen officials .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;19	Meanwhile , residents continued to flee the mainly Muslim city of 300,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;20	As Chechen clans fight each other ; the region 's industries have come to a standstill , and living standards have plunged .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;21	Crime is up , and Russians say it is spilling out of Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;22	They accuse Chechens of stealing cattle and cars from nearby Cossack villages .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;23	In Moscow , police say Chechen mafia clans are among the strongest , and avoid arrest by hiding in Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;24	Then this summer , there was a string of hostage-takings in southern Russia , some carried out by Chechen gunmen who tried to escape into Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;25	In July , when several terrorists hijacked a busload of people near the border , Dudayev said Russian police would not be allowed to follow if they tried to escape to Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;26	Russian police then tried to seize the terrorists before they could escape , and four hostages were killed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;27	`` Chechens ... are fiercely independent and aggressive , like ancient Vikings , '' said Vasily Varenik , a historian in Rostov-on-Don .
APW_ENG_19941201.0567;28	`` It wo n't be easy to find a solution . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;0	While the United Nations deliberates whether to continue operations in Bosnia , the Bosnian Serbs basically have decided the issue .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;1	They 've virtually closed the mission down .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;2	Consider : -- Delivery of humanitarian aid to civilians is basic to the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;3	But Bosnian Serbs have refused to approve convoys through their territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;4	-- Sarajevo depends on the U.N. airbridge for 80 percent of its supplies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;5	For more than a week , the up-again , down-again airlift has not flown because the Serbs refuse to approve flights .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;6	To reinforce the message , the Serbs deployed surface-to-air missiles in the air corridor approaching Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;7	-- More than 400 peacekeepers , including French , British , Dutch , Canadians and Ukrainians , have been taken hostage against future NATO strikes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;8	Apart from delivering humanitarian aid , the U.N. mission is supposed to enforce agreements , such as those on removal of heavy weapons from the Sarajevo area and on protection of U.N. `` safe areas . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;9	Those military functions have been severely curtailed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;10	The United Nations is unable even to get permission from the Bosnian Serbs to resupply its own units in isolated Muslim enclaves such as Bihac and Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;11	Most of the detained peacekeepers were guarding collection points in the Sarajevo area , where Bosnian Serbs stored heavy guns after last February 's NATO ultimatum to remove such weapons from within 20 kilometers -LRB- 12.5 miles -RRB- of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;12	Both the Bosnian Serb and government forces routinely have put banned weapons in the zone .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;13	Apart from bluff and bluster , the U.N. has found no tools to force compliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;14	Last week , Bosnian Serb soldiers simply drove up to the nine collection points and surrounded them , trapping the peacekeepers inside .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;15	The presence of U.N. hostages virtually guarantees no NATO air strikes to follow three last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;16	U.N. relations with both sides have been touchy , and are getting worse .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;17	The Serbs are in a position to punish the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;18	Sources who attended a U.N. staff meeting Thursday quoted the commander for Bosnia , Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , as saying that the Bosnian Serbs `` have declared war '' on the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;19	On Wednesday , Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic refused to meet U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali at the Sarajevo airport .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;20	Boutros-Ghali had come to Sarajevo to warn the two sides that the United Nations might pull out of Bosnia-Herzegovina entirely if they did not cooperate with the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;21	U.N. officials , speaking on condition of anonymity , say they fear the Bosnian Serbs have decided to step up harassment in hopes the U.N. packs up and leaves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;22	During the past 21\/2 years , the United Nations has faced similar periods of harassment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;23	But spokesman Thant Myint-U described the current level of hostility as unprecedented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;24	`` While we will certainly continue operations throughout the country in fulfillment of our various mandates as best we can , this unprecedenteian Serb party is certainly not making our jobs any easier , '' Thant said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0568;25	Thant said the level of harassment is so intense andust have been approved at the highest level , presumably by Karadzic and his military chief , Gen. Ratko Mladic .

APW_ENG_19941201.0569;0	Chechnya has been a thorn in Russia 's side since the early 19th century , when the Russian Empire rapidly expanded through the Caucasus Mountains , gobbling up small countries and ethnic enclaves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;1	Many of the small nations gave in , thankful for Russian protection against hostile neighbors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;2	In the Russian mind , Chechnya still evokes images of warriors , savages and criminals -- and also victims of Russian and Soviet persecution .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;3	There is a religious divide as well ; Chechens are Muslims , Russians Christians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;4	For 50 years , the Chechens held out against Russian domination , capitulating in 1859 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;5	The dark-haired mountaineers often existed by raiding their neighbors for food , and Russian military camps quickly became targets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;6	In one well-known poem that is required reading in many Russian schools , poet Mikhail Lermontov referred to `` the evil Chechen -LRB- who -RRB- crawls up the bank '' of the Terek River .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;7	After the Chechen surrender , Russian Cossacks were encouraged to settle nearby to work the fertile lands and keep the peace .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;8	But the fragile balance between Russian and Chechen was shattered under dictator Josef Stalin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;9	He first dispersed the Cossacks in an early purge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;10	Then , during World War II , he accused Chechens of supporting the Nazis and deported the entire nation , sending almost 400,000 people to Central Asia .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;11	When they were allowed to return after Stalin 's death , Chechens found their homes destroyed and their land seized by former neighbors , mostly Russians or Ossetians .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;12	Only Soviet repression kept the ethnic conflict from boiling over .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;13	With the Soviet breakup , age-old hostilities have flared again .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;14	The capital , Grozny , has become a war zone between forces loyal to Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev , who declared independence from Moscow in 1991 , and Chechen rebels trying to topple him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;15	Russian troops are stationed in neighboring Ossetia and Ingushetia , but Chechnya has told Moscow to stay away .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;16	Russia on Thursday backed off from a threat to send troops after Chechnya defied a Russian ultimatum and called on armed volunteers to defend the capital .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;17	Air attacks continued on the outskirts of Grozny on Thursday , claiming at least a few civilian lives .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;18	And a Russian delegation arrived from Moscow and began talks with Chechen officials .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;19	Meanwhile , residents continued to flee the mainly Muslim city of 300,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;20	As Chechen clans fight each other ; the region 's industries have come to a standstill , and living standards have plunged .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;21	Crime is up , and Russians say it is spilling out of Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;22	They accuse Chechens of stealing cattle and cars from nearby Cossack villages .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;23	In Moscow , police say Chechen mafia clans are among the strongest , and avoid arrest by hiding in Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;24	Then this summer , there was a string of hostage-takings in southern Russia , some carried out by Chechen gunmen who tried to escape into Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;25	In July , when several terrorists hijacked a busload of people near the border , Dudayev said Russian police would not be allowed to follow if they tried to escape to Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;26	Russian police then tried to seize the terrorists before they could escape , and four hostages were killed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;27	`` Chechens ... are fiercely independent and aggressive , like ancient Vikings , '' said Vasily Varenik , a historian in Rostov-on-Don .
APW_ENG_19941201.0569;28	`` It wo n't be easy to find a solution . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;0	The U.S. dollar opened higher against the Japanese yen Friday , while prices on the Tokyo Stock Exchange slipped in early trading .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;1	The dollar started trading at 99.40 yen , up 0.39 yen from Thursday 's close and also above its overnight New York finish at 99.4 yen .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;2	The dollar 's strength followed its advance on Thursday in New York , where the currency gained to a seven-week high as a spate of strong economic figures provided expectations of a further rise in key U.S. interest rats .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;3	Among data released Thursday , the National Association of Purchasing Management indicated U.S. manufacturing rose in November to the strongest level in 10 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;4	A higher interest rate tends to strengthen a nation 's currency .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;5	On the stock market , the 225-issue Nikkei Stock Average fell 4.10 points , or 0.02 percent , to 19,009.50 in the first 30 minutes of trading .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;6	On Thursday , the average shed 62.02 points , or 0.33 percent , closing at 19,013.60 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;7	The Tokyo Stock Price Index of all issues listed on the first section was down 0.20 points , or negligible in percentage term , to 1,519.40 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;8	The TOPIX closed at 1,519.20 points on Thursday , down 1.21 points , or 0.08 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;9	Share prices moved in a narrow range amid a mixture of good and bad factors .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;10	The yen 's weakness against the dollar was a supportive factor to the stock market , while an overnight fall on Wall Street remained a negative factor , dealers said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;11	As of 9 a.m. -LRB- 0000 GMT -RRB- , the price of the benchmark No. 164 10-year Japanese government bonds stood at 96.41 yen , down 0.06 yen from Thursday 's close .
APW_ENG_19941201.0570;12	Their yield rose to 4.665 percent from 4.655 percent .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;0	While the United Nations deliberates whether to continue operations in Bosnia , the Bosnian Serbs basically have decided the issue .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;1	They 've virtually closed the mission down .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;2	Consider : -- Delivery of humanitarian aid to civilians is basic to the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;3	But Bosnian Serbs have refused to approve convoys through their territory .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;4	-- Sarajevo depends on the U.N. airbridge for 80 percent of its supplies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;5	For more than a week , the up-again , down-again airlift has not flown because the Serbs refuse to approve flights .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;6	To reinforce the message , the Serbs deployed surface-to-air missiles in the air corridor approaching Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;7	-- More than 400 peacekeepers , including French , British , Dutch , Canadians and Ukrainians , have been taken hostage against future NATO strikes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;8	Apart from delivering humanitarian aid , the U.N. mission is supposed to enforce agreements , such as those on removal of heavy weapons from the Sarajevo area and on protection of U.N. `` safe areas . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;9	Those military functions have been severely curtailed .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;10	The United Nations is unable even to get permission from the Bosnian Serbs to resupply its own units in isolated Muslim enclaves such as Bihac and Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;11	Most of the detained peacekeepers were guarding collection points in the Sarajevo area , where Bosnian Serbs stored heavy guns after last February 's NATO ultimatum to remove such weapons from within 20 kilometers -LRB- 12.5 miles -RRB- of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;12	Both the Bosnian Serb and government forces routinely have put banned weapons in the zone .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;13	Apart from bluff and bluster , the U.N. has found no tools to force compliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;14	Last week , Bosnian Serb soldiers simply drove up to the nine collection points and surrounded them , trapping the peacekeepers inside .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;15	The presence of U.N. hostages virtually guarantees no NATO air strikes to follow three last week .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;16	U.N. relations with both sides have been touchy , and are getting worse .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;17	The Serbs are in a position to punish the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;18	Sources who attended a U.N. staff meeting Thursday quoted the commander for Bosnia , Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , as saying that the Bosnian Serbs `` have declared war '' on the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;19	On Wednesday , Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic refused to meet U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali at the Sarajevo airport .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;20	Boutros-Ghali had come to Sarajevo to warn the two sides that the United Nations might pull out of Bosnia-Herzegovina entirely if they did not cooperate with the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;21	U.N. officials , speaking on condition of anonymity , say they fear the Bosnian Serbs have decided to step up harassment in hopes the U.N. packs up and leaves .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;22	During the past 21\/2 years , the United Nations has faced similar periods of harassment .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;23	But spokesman Thant Myint-U described the current level of hostility as unprecedented .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;24	`` While we will certainly continue operations throughout the country in fulfillment of our various mandates as best we can , this unprecedented level of non-cooperation by the Bosnian Serb party is certainly not making our jobs any easier , '' Thant said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;25	Thant said the level of harassment is so intense and widespread that the United Nations believes it must have been approved at the highest level , presumably by Karadzic and his military chief , Gen. Ratko Mladic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0571;26	Since all UN operations here can only be carried out with the approval of the warring sides , absence of cooperation means the mission grinds to a halt .

APW_ENG_19941201.0573;0	The first two stages fired perfectly and the rocket lifted off at 7:38 p.m. -LRB- 2238 GMT -RRB- on schedule .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;1	Technicians confidently expected another of what have become almost routine shots .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;2	The third stage also lit properly , but mysteriously sputtered and went out .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;3	Ariane officials said that the third stage was a new type using a new oxygen-hydrogen mixture to maximize performance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;4	The failure indicated continuing trouble in the third stage .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;5	During the 63rd Ariane launch on Jan. 24 , a turbo-pump failure in the third-stage froze the rocket motor .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;6	Ground controllers destroyed the launch in mid-flight , breaking a string of 26 faultless launches .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;7	Six subsequent flights this year have gone off without mishap .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;8	Thursday 's rocket took down with it a 2,985-kilogram -LRB- 3.3-ton -RRB- PanAmSat-3 telecommunications satellite built by Hughes Space and Communications in El Segundo , California .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;9	Belonging to PanAmSat of Greenwich , Conn. , the satellite would have channeled telephone , fax and television communications for most of North and South America , Europe and Africa over 15 years .
APW_ENG_19941201.0573;10	It would have traveled in geostationary orbit over the mid-Atlantic .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;0	An inter-island ferry carrying more than 500 people collided with a freighter and sank before dawn Friday in Manila Bay , the Philippine Navy reported .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;1	Reports said some of the passengers were rescued , but the numbers ranged widely .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;2	ZZRH , a private radio station , said the coast guard had rescued 18 people while station ZZMM said more than 200 were saved .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;3	`` We were sleeping .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;4	Suddenly we heard a crash .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;5	I grabbed my two children , but when the ferry sank we were sucked under the water with it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;6	A piece of metal hit my arm , and I lost hold of my two kids , '' said survivor Erwin Maravilla .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;7	`` I was lucky to be able to swim to the surface .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;8	Otherwise I would be dead , '' he said , adding that his wife was also missing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;9	He was one of the first group of survivors plucked from the sea by a navy patrol and brought to Manila .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;10	The Singapore-registered freighter , the Cota Soria , with a crew of 26 , was engaged in the rescue effort , reports said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;11	Cargo containers and rubber rafts were floating at the scene , but it was unclear whether there were people aboard , said radio station DZRH , reporting from an airplane overhead .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;12	`` We can not say if there are any casualties .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;13	We do not want to assume there are casualties , '' said navy spokesman Lt. Cmdr. Anselmo Cabingan .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;14	At least eight patrol boats and a search and rescue ship have were trying to rescue the 495 passengers and 14 crew who were aboard the ferry , the Cebu City , he said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;15	There was no immediate cause reported for the accident , which occurred in calm seas under clear night skies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;16	The ferry sank 30 minutes after the collision .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;17	The Cebu City sank near the mouth of Manila Bay near the town of Maragondon , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 35 miles -RRB- southwest of Manila in Cavite province .
APW_ENG_19941201.0574;18	It was coming from Tagbilaran , capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;0	Russia stunned a NATO meeting by protesting plans to give membership to East European nations and backed out of a program to improve cooperation between Moscow and the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;1	Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev was expected Thursday to endorse the plan approved just hours earlier by NATO foreign ministers .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;2	Instead , he criticized it , saying the decision to draw up conditions for future NATO membership would create a new division in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;3	His comments cast a pall over the meeting and over NATO 's attempt to draw its former Warsaw Pact enemies into its alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;4	However , some diplomats said they believed that he was playing to an audience back in Russia , where the government is contending with a strong nationalist opposition .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;5	In an effort to overcome Russian objections to its eastward expansion , the NATO allies had agreed to a special relationship with Moscow and insisted they had no intention of forming a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;6	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told a group of grim-faced foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;7	Afterward , Portuguese Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Durao Barroso said Kozyrev `` threw a bucket of cold water on the meeting . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;8	Kozyrev refused to endorse a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts with Moscow intended to ease Russia 's fears of an eastward drive by the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;9	He said he read the ministers ' statement on membership and immediately called Russian President Boris Yeltsin .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;10	`` This communique raises more questions than it answers , '' Kozyrev said in impromptu remarks that were broadcast to reporters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;11	`` We have to understand what are the intentions of the other partners . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;12	U.S. State Department spokesman Mike McCurry said Kozyrev gave no advance warning that he wanted clarification of the schedule for considering new NATO members next year .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;13	`` I would be tempted to say it has to do with domestic politics in Russia , '' McCurry said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;14	Willy Claes , the alliance 's new secretary-general , tried to reasssure Kozyrev that NATO was n't shifting direction .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;15	`` It is no change in strategy or policy of NATO .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;16	... There is nothing new , '' he told the Russian minister just before he left NATO headquarters .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;17	`` We are not willing to organize new divisions in Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;18	Kozyrev 's outburst only added to the alliance 's woes .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;19	There have been unprecedented strains in recent weeks between the United States and its European allies over Bosnia-Herzegovina .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;20	In an effort to heal the wounds , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher swung behind the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;21	It was a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the Europeans , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;22	NATO has been anguishing in recent years over whether -- and when -- to open its doors to its former foes in central and eastern Europe .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;23	Poland , Hungary and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;24	In an effort to meet their demands , but without upsetting Russia , the allies thought they had found a good formula .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;25	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , to bring former foes closer , but without membership .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;26	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941201.0575;27	On Thursday , the allies decided to go further by ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the terms and conditions for expanding the Western military alliance .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;0	A jury convicted a Lebanese immigrant Thursday of murdering a Jewish teen-ager in an ambush on the Brooklyn Bridge , rejecting his claim that he was suffering a flashback from his childhood in war-torn Beirut .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;1	Rashid Baz , a livery cab driver , admitted he strafed the van with bullets on March 1 as it drove onto the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;2	Sixteen year-old Aaron Halberstam was killed and three others were wounded .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;3	Baz 's lawyer , Eric Sears , blamed his client 's `` catastrophic '' childhood in Beirut , where he became a soldier at age 9 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;4	He said Baz suffers post-traumatic stress syndrome , which climaxed in the bridge shooting .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;5	Baz , 28 , said he fired at the van after its passengers mouthed insults and leveled a gun at him .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;6	`` Let him rot in hell , '' Devorah Halberstam , the dead boy 's mother , said after the verdict .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;7	Nachum Sosonkin , 18 , a passenger who was shot in the head , testified during the trial that he never heard anyone inside the van say anything to Baz or display a gun .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;8	The jury deliberated one day before convicting Baz of second-degree murder and 14 counts of attempted murder .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;9	Baz , who immigrated from Lebanon at age 18 , faces 25 years to life in prison at his Jan. 18 sentencing .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;10	`` Nobody believed he was insane .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;11	The evidence was overwhelming that he was not .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;12	... I honestly believe his only remorse is that he did n't kill every single boy in that van , '' Mrs. Halberstam said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;13	The shooting occurred as 15 male students , dressed in the distinctive black garb worn by ultra-Orthodox Lubavitcher Jews , returned from a visit to a Manhattan hospital where the Lubavitchers ' leader , Rebbe Menachem Schneerson , was being treated .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;14	The rebbe died in June .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;15	The dead boy 's father , Rabbi David Halberstam , said he believes Baz acted to revenge the Feb. 25 massacre on Israel 's West Bank in which a Jewish settler killed 29 Arabs as they prayed in a mosque .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;16	Baz 's attorney had argued that the shooting was not revenge , but that the massacre might have triggered a deadly flashback .
APW_ENG_19941201.0576;17	The prosecution cited testimony by Baz 's uncle , Jamal Akel , that Baz 's problems predated the start of Lebanon 's civil war in 1975 and much of his behavior was shocking -- even in Beirut .

APW_ENG_19941201.0578;0	A year after drug kingpin Pablo Escobar died in a shootout with police , his 10-year-old daughter says she still weeps for him and asks `` Why did you leave me all alone ? ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;1	Escobar , the Medellin cocaine cartel leader who ordered hundreds of the deaths , was nonetheless a devout family man .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;2	Police tracked him down by tracing calls he made to his family as he tried to help them flee a death squad .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;3	As he was making one of the calls on Dec. 2 , 1993 , police stormed into his Medellin hideout .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;4	Escobar , a pistol in each hand , fled onto the red-tile roof and was cut down by a fusillade of police bullets .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;5	To mark the anniversary of Escobar 's death , his wife , son and daughter sent a card and a bouquet of fragrant dried flowers by courier Thursday to The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;6	In the card was a photograph of Escobar being kissed by his wife and daughter as his son looked on .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;7	`` On that December 2 you left me alone in a pitiless winter where sadness abounds , '' wrote his wife , Victoria Henao de Escobar .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;8	`` You left when I most needed your strength , which your gaze gave me .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;9	To bear living without you , your strength will become my strength . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;10	Escobar had doted on his daughter , Manuela Escobar , a black-haired girl whose hearing was permanently damaged in a bomb attack against Escobar .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;11	In the card , Manuela told her dead father she had learned to ride horses and was deeply pained he could not be there .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;12	`` Why , poppy ?
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;13	Why did it happen ?
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;14	Why did I lose you ?
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;15	Why did you leave me all alone ?
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;16	As I say goodbye I am crying for you . ''
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;17	Juan Pablo Escobar , 17 , wrote that he hoped to be united with his fathers ' spirit after he dies .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;18	Unlike the family , most Colombians remembered Escobar 's death with relief .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;19	In his attempt to dictate policy to the government , Escobar allegedly ordered the assassinations of presidential candidates , justice ministers , judges and police .
APW_ENG_19941201.0578;20	The drug lord , among the world 's richest men and most wanted criminals , also waged a terrorist war against ordinary citizens , planting car bombs in shopping centers and residential neighborhoods that killed and maimed hundreds of people .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;0	A record 45 nations have submitted entries for best foreign-language film Oscar , the highest honor bestowed by the American motion picture industry .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;1	The previous record was set in 1990 when 37 countries submitted films .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;2	Last year , 35 countries entered .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;3	`` The number of entries directly reflects the changing face of the world map , '' Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences President Arthur Hiller said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;4	`` Both halves of the former Czechoslovakia have submitted pictures , and we have four entries this year from what was once the single nation of Yugoslavia , '' Hiller said .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;5	Nations entering films for the first time include Bosnia and Herzegovina , Belarus , the Czech Republic , Cambodia and Guatemala .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;6	Nominations will be announced at the academy on Feb. 14 .
APW_ENG_19941201.0579;7	The 67th annual presentation of the awards will take place at the Los Angeles Shrine Auditorium March 27 .
