APW_ENG_19941202.0011;1	Retail prices increased by 1.7 percent for the period ending Nov. 30 due in part to heavy floods in the Mekong River region , Vietnam 's biggest rice-growing area , the Saigon Newsreader reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0011;2	The floods caused temporary shortages and speculation that led to higher rice prices .
APW_ENG_19941202.0011;3	Vietnam had hoped to keep inflation at less than 10 percent this year , but prices exceeded the target in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0011;4	Government officials have set a new goal of keeping inflation below 14 percent in 1994 , the paper reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0011;5	Official newspapers have tried to justify the higher than expected price increases .

APW_ENG_19941202.0012;1	Above-ground atomic test blasts were detonated on the vast Maralinga lands under British scientists ' direction in the 1950s and 1960s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;2	Aborigines were evicted from the land and have since fought to have the area cleaned up so they could return .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;3	Under the settlement , however , Australian primary industries minister Bob Collins said some of the 30,890-square-mile -LRB- 80,000 square kilometer -RRB- area in northern South Australia would remain closed indefinitely due to dangerous levels of plutonium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;4	The settlement will fund new outstations in Maralinga as well as health services , roads , water supplies and employment programs , Collins said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;5	An outstation is a cabin or settlement in the outback with a water pump as the main amenity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;6	Collins said `` it 's been a very sad chapter in our history and I 'm pleased to say that in human terms , at least one important bit of it has been brought to a close . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;7	The compensation is separate from the massive five-year task of cleaning up the land , expected to start early next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;8	Its cost is estimated at dlrs 104 million -LRB- U.S. dlrs 79 million -RRB- .

APW_ENG_19941202.0012;11	Negotiations began after they became public .
APW_ENG_19941202.0012;12	An earlier British government settlement of 20 million pounds -LRB- U.S. dlrs 12.7 million -RRB- for the rehabilitation of the Maralinga lands signaled the end of its involvement in the compensation battle .

APW_ENG_19941202.0015;3	So you may not have a choice .
APW_ENG_19941202.0015;4	And I think the young ones may not even know . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0015;5	Eleven Chinese athletes , seven of them swimmers , tested positive for drugs at the Asian Games at Hiroshima , Japan , in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0015;6	Chinese officials denied their swimming federation encouraged or knew about drug use .
APW_ENG_19941202.0015;7	`` This is an act by individuals , '' a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman said Thursday from Beijing , adding his country 's sports authorities practice `` strict prohibition , strict testing and strict punishment '' of drug use .

APW_ENG_19941202.0015;9	`` I think the coaches know , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0015;10	`` I think the administrators know .
APW_ENG_19941202.0015;11	I think it would be impossible not to know that . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0015;13	Allegations of drug use escalated in September when the Chinese women won 12 of 16 gold medals at the world championships in Rome .

APW_ENG_19941202.0015;15	Eggert said 17 countries , including the United States , signed a petition at the world championships asking the International Swimming Federation to develop a more rigorous drug-testing program .

APW_ENG_19941202.0015;17	Then , seven of them tested positive .

APW_ENG_19941202.0015;27	But the evidence shows it was a systematic problem . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0017;3	Bosnian Serb units entered Croatia and took the Ukrainian soldiers and a U.N. armored carrier back into Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0017;4	The United Nations has n't heard from the peacekeepers since , Ivanko said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0017;8	Croatian Defense Minister Gojko Susak warned Thursday that his country would not let that happen .

APW_ENG_19941202.0017;12	The Serbs agreed to today 's meeting after Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , the U.N. commander in Bosnia , traveled to Pale for talks with Radovan Karadzic and other Bosnian Serb leaders .

APW_ENG_19941202.0017;16	The last U.N. food convoy reached Bihac on Oct. 1 .

APW_ENG_19941202.0017;19	He said Serbs would only accept a permanent cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0017;20	But the Sarajevo government fears a permanent cease-fire would cement Serb dominion over the 70 percent of Bosnia they now control .
APW_ENG_19941202.0017;21	An international peace plan the Serbs have rejected would give Serbs 49 percent of the country .

APW_ENG_19941202.0018;0	Prime Minister Rafik Hariri has tendered his resignation following a stormy Cabinet meeting in which he accused his opponents of trying to paralyze the government , aides said early Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;1	Speaking on condition of anonymity , the aides said the 51-year-old self-made Sunni Muslim billionaire , whose premiership was backed by Syria and Saudi Arabia , offered his resignation in a telephone call late Thursday night to President Elias Hrawi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;2	Hrawi , a Maronoite Catholic , had not yet accepted or rejected the resignation because it must first be made in writing , presumably later Friday , the aides said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;3	The resignation was triggered by a heated exchange between Hariri and Housing Minister Mahmoud Abu Hamdan , a SHiite Muslim , the aides said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;4	They reported that Hariri accused Hamdan and other opponents of seeking to sabotage all government-proposed legislation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;5	At one point , Hariri fumed that `` the country can not be ruled through militias , '' the aides quoted him as saying .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;6	Hamdan is one of a group of ministers in the 30-member Cabinet who are aligned with Nabih Berri , the Shiite speaker of Parliament and head of the Amal movement , once a powerful militia in Lebanon 's 1975-1990 civil war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;7	Hariri 's critics accuse him of trying to enrich himself further by grabbing a large share of the multibillion-dollar postwar reconstruction projects for his own companies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;8	They also claim the tycoon , who has substantial real estate and engineering holdings , is trying to monopolize decision-making by ramming his decisions through the Cabinet , disregarding substantial internal opposition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;9	Earlier this year , Hariri staged a protest lasting several days during which he refused to attend government meetings as a way of demonstrating his frustration at the slowness of government action on reconstruction .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;10	Hariri was appointed prime minister Oct. 22 , 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;11	At the time , he was hailed as Lebanon 's savior who would rescue the onetime `` Switzerland of the Middle East '' from economic oblivion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;12	The Lebanese hoped his image , untarnished by scandal as many of the country 's politicians were , as well as his wealth and his powerful Syrian and Saudi connections would help him achieve what previous governments had not : an economic turnaround to erase the war 's devastation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;13	His record has been mixed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;14	Much of war-ravaged central Beirut is being bulldozed as part of a massive reconstruction of the downtown area , designed to make the Lebanese capital once more a financial and trading hub for the region .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;15	But the reconstruction has been slower than expected and Hariri 's critics have constantly accused him of seeking to use his position to line his own pockets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;16	Hariri built much of his dlrs 3 billion fortune in Saudi Arabia and enjoys a close friendship with the Saudi royal family .
APW_ENG_19941202.0018;17	According to a national covenant dating to independence from France in 1943 , Lebanon 's president is traditionally a Maronite Catholic , the Parliament speaker a Shiite and the prime minister a Sunni .

APW_ENG_19941202.0020;0	The North American Free Trade Agreement has failed so far to deliver on its promise of more U.S. jobs and instead has resulted in a net loss of 10,000 jobs , according to a congressional analysis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;1	A Joint Economic Committee study requested by Democratic Sen. Byron Dorgan of North Dakota estimates that while NAFTA created roughly 127,000 jobs in its first nine months , increased imports from Mexico have cost 137,000 U.S. jobs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;2	NAFTA , which went into effect this year , brought the United States , Mexico and Canada into a single trading bloc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;3	Dorgan issued the study as the Senate ratified the 124-nation accord negotiated under the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;4	President Clinton , meanwhile , is expected to announce his intention next week to broaden NAFTA to include Chile and call for a hemispheric trade agreement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;5	`` NAFTA and GATT are trade agreements that make it easier for American jobs to go where labor is cheap , '' Dorgan said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;6	`` It 's a bankrupt trade strategy that weakens our country but strengthens corporations who want to employ cheap labor elsewhere and ship their goods here . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;7	Commerce Department officials questioned the findings , saying their own analyses show job gains as a result of increased trade with Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;8	`` We are quite confident that NAFTA has been a net plus for jobs in 1994 , '' said Commerce 's chief economist , Lewis Alexander .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;9	Commerce officials questioned the study 's premise and the assumption that increased imports necessarily translate into job loss .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;10	The officials were reluctant to assign specific job gain numbers from NAFTA , saying it 's very difficult to separate the trade agreement 's effect on jobs from overall trade patterns with Mexico .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;11	Nine-month NAFTA figures released by Commerce last month showed U.S. exports to Mexico hit record levels , rising almost 22 percent over a year earlier .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;12	Imports from Mexico were up almost 23 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;13	But opponents contend that NAFTA backers are ignoring the fact that the United States ' trade surplus with Mexico is shrinking .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;14	After hitting a high of dlrs 5.3 billion in 1992 , the trade surplus is expected to reach dlrs 2.8 billion this year if current trends hold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;15	The congressional study 's authors themselves expressed some discomfort with pinning job loss numbers at this early stage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0020;16	`` It will take at least five to 10 years for the full effects of the agreement to manifest themselves , '' they wrote .

APW_ENG_19941202.0024;11	His record has been mixed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0024;12	Much of war-ravaged central Beirut is being bulldozed as part of a massive reconstruction to make the Lebanese capital once more a financial and trade magnet for the region .
APW_ENG_19941202.0024;13	But the reconstruction has been slower than expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0024;14	Earlier this year , Hariri refused to attend government meetings for several days to protest the slowness of government action on reconstruction .
APW_ENG_19941202.0024;15	Hariri built much of his dlrs 3 billion fortune in Saudi Arabia and enjoys a close friendship with the Saudi royal family .
APW_ENG_19941202.0024;16	According to a national covenant dating to independence from France in 1943 , Lebanon 's president is a Maronite Catholic , the Parliament speaker is a Shiite and the prime minister is a Sunni .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;0	Author Robin Moore says he was surprised at how he easily obtained information in the former Soviet Union for his book about the Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;1	Moore , 69 , the author of the `` French Connection '' and `` The Green Berets '' spoke Thursday at the Litchfield-Morris Rotary about his latest novel `` The Moscow Connection '' that grew out of a 1991 visit to Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;2	`` I was fascinated to find a new era of free speech , '' Moore told the group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;3	`` It seemed everything could be bought and sold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;4	You could even buy the KGB -- I did . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;5	The latest book is a thinly disguised work of fiction chronicling the rise and fall of the Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;6	It was set in the wake of the failed coup that ended the reign of former Soviet President Mikhail S. Gorbachev in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;7	The book grew out of an invitation by the Moscow police to do a positive story about the department .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;8	When he got there , Moore said , he found the department so riddled with corruption that a positive story was impossible .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;9	Instead , he made friends with some honest officers who steered him to his latest work with tales of the existence of a Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0025;10	Moore hopes his book will blow the lid off the burgeoning Russian mafia and what he says is its vigorous trade in the nuclear weaponry of the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;0	Australia will pay Aborigines dlrs 13.5 million -LRB- U.S. dlrs 10 million -RRB- for damage British nuclear testing did to their land , the government said Friday after a decade of negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;1	Above-ground atomic test blasts were detonated on the vast Maralinga lands under British scientists ' direction in the 1950s and 1960s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;2	Aborigines were evicted from the land and have since fought to have the area cleaned up so they could return .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;3	Under the settlement , however , Australian primary industries minister Bob Collins said some of the 30,890-square-mile -LRB- 80,000 square kilometer -RRB- area in northern South Australia would remain closed indefinitely due to dangerous levels of plutonium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;4	The settlement will fund new outstations in Maralinga as well as health services , roads , water supplies and employment programs , Collins said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;5	An outstation is a cabin or settlement in the outback with a water pump as the main amenity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;6	Collins said `` it 's been a very sad chapter in our history and I 'm pleased to say that in human terms , at least one important bit of it has been brought to a close . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;7	The compensation is separate from the massive five-year task of cleaning up the land , expected to start early next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;8	Its cost is estimated at dlrs 104 million -LRB- U.S. dlrs 79 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;9	Archie Barton , administrator of the Maralinga Tjarutja lands , said Friday 's announcement ended `` 10 years of frustration , mental and physical strain on our older people . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;10	The bomb tests were kept secret until the early 1980s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;11	Negotiations began after they became public .
APW_ENG_19941202.0026;12	An earlier British government settlement of 20 million pounds -LRB- U.S. dlrs 31.2 million -RRB- for the rehabilitation of the Maralinga lands signaled the end of its involvement in the compensation battle .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;0	At Los Angeles , Reggie Miller scored 9 of his 24 points in the fourth quarter and Dale Davis added 16 points and 14 rebounds as the Indiana Pacers beat the hapless Los Angeles Clippers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;1	Falling to 0-14 , the Clippers were within three games of matching the worst start in NBA history .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;2	The Miami Heat lost the first 17 games of their inaugural season in 1988 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;3	Pooh Richardson had 17 points for the Clippers , who have yet to shoot 50 percent from the field this season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;4	Los Angeles trimmed Indiana 's lead to 79-73 with 7:47 to play .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;5	But Los Angeles never got closer as Miller hit a layup and his fourth 3-pointer of the game to restore Indiana 's double-digit lead with 2:27 left .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;6	In Oakland , Calif. , Hakeem Olajuwon had 37 points , 13 rebounds and a career-high 12 assists as the Houston Rockets defeated the Golden State Warriors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;7	Robert Horry added 16 points and eight assists for the Rockets , the first NBA team to win 11 games this season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;8	Latrell Sprewell had 30 points and Tim Hardaway had 27 for the Warriors , who have lost five of six .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;9	The Rockets , who have an NBA-best 7-1 road mark this season , have won seven straight against the Warriors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;10	Olajuwon left the game with 1:45 left when he hurt his right hand falling into a row of cameramen behind the court .
APW_ENG_19941202.0027;11	His hand was cut and bloodied , but the extent of the injury was unclear .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;0	A rocket scientist involved in India 's space program has been arrested on suspicion of passing on secrets , newspapers reported Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;1	Nambi Narayanan was the second space expert to be accused in the spy case that was exposed after the Oct. 20 arrest of a woman who allegedly seduced scientists and blackmailed them to give her designs of rocket engines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;2	Narayanan , who helped develop engines for India 's satellite launch vehicles and defense missiles , was arrested Wednesday in Trivandrum on India 's southern coast , the reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;3	He was the head of the liquid propulsion laboratory of the Indian Space Research Organization .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;4	Police in the southern state of Kerala , where many of the space laboratories are located , began probing the spy ring after arresting Mariam Rasheda , a citizen of the archipelago nation of the Maldives , the reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;5	Her interrogation led to the arrests of rocket expert D. Sasikumaran , Fousiya Hassan , who is a Maldivian , and K. Chandrashekaran , a businessman who claimed to represent the Russian space company Glavkosmos , the Indian Express said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;6	At least 30 other scientists , businessmen and even a top police officer are involved in the affair , the reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;7	Newspapers quoted unidentified police sources as saying that the ring was working for Pakistan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;8	Both India and Pakistan , who have fought three wars since 1947 , are believed capable of producing nuclear weapons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;9	India is developing its own weapons delivery system , while Pakistan buys M-11 missiles from China .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;10	Indian scientists have been developing rockets to launch communications satellites since 1979 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;11	But the space laboratories also are involved in developing missile technology and have come under pressure from western countries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0029;12	In 1992 , Russia 's Glavkosmos was forced to cancel a deal to supply rocket engines to India under pressure from Washington .

APW_ENG_19941202.0031;0	The once grand idea of U.N. peacekeeping as a global emergency police force appears to be fading as the United Nations closes shop in Somalia and faces humiliation in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;1	With the United Nations in apparent retreat , observers are saying that future peacekeeping is likely to shy away from where it is needed most : the front lines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;2	Bosnia is a `` bucket of cold water on ambitious plans for peacekeeping , '' said Richard Betts , professor of political science at Columbia University in New York .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;3	`` I think there is a great future for peacekeeping that does not matter very much , and a very shaky future for messier operations . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;4	That seemed apparent this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;5	As Serb militiamen held hundreds of peacekeepers hostage and pounded a U.N.-declared safe haven in Bosnia , the Security Council met in New York , but high on its agenda was the Golan Heights , not Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;6	The quick meeting extending the mandate for the Israeli-Syrian border mission highlighted a U.N. success -- a mission where both sides want peace and the border is quiet .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;7	The council talks later dragged on about Bosnia , but without direct action .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;8	`` Peacekeeping is the role of referee , '' said Dan Plesch , director of the British-American Security Information Council in London .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;9	`` You can separate warring parties who want to be separated . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;10	But in instances like Bosnia and Somalia , where the sides are n't willing to stop fighting , the United Nations is refusing to order its peacekeepers to separate the sides .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;11	Such a direct role would be war , not peacekeeping , council members say .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;12	Many observers say missions like those in Golan and Cyprus -- with clear and limited objectives such as monitoring borders or delivering aid to war zones -- are likely to expand in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;13	`` But we will also see peacekeeping used by the United States and other powers as a way of repackaging war , '' Plesch said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;14	He cited Haiti and Georgia as examples .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;15	The United States pushed the council to authorize military intervention in Haiti , offering its own soldiers to lead the mission that will give way to a U.N. peacekeeping force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;16	Russia would like to do much the same in Georgia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;17	It has already sent its own troops to the former Soviet republic , but is pressing the United Nations to take over the mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;18	While Bosnia -- with 24,000 soldiers or almost a third of all U.N. peacekeepers -- would prove the greatest U.N. peacekeeping failure if it collapses , the United Nations has lost face on other missions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;19	It was unable to foster peace in Somalia , and decided this fall to wind down its two-year mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;20	In Liberia , observers have been abused and humiliated by the warring factions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;21	U.N. officials bristle at criticisms that peacekeeping has been ineffective and say the problem is that world leaders are not willing to commit the troops or money to ambitious peacekeeping operations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;22	The world body is being made a scapegoat for the lack of global will to act , said Kofi Annan , the head of U.N. peacekeeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;23	`` It is absolutely unfair when member states do not want to take the risks , when they do not want to commit the resources , but blame the U.N. for failure to act , '' Annan said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;24	U.N. peacekeeping costs have ballooned to dlrs 3.8 billion for the year ending April 1994 , but by October , members still owed the world body dlrs 1.6 billion for peacekeeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;25	There are some 80,000 U.N. peacekeepers worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;26	U.N. missions involved only about 10,000 soldiers in 1987 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;27	With a more isolationist Congress coming into power in Washington , it is unlikely the United States -- which pays about a third of the peacekeeping budget -- would be willing to pay for additional operations that are not directly in the U.S. interest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;28	`` There may be other Bosnias , but I do n't think there will be another UNPROFOR , '' William Durch , a senior associate at the Henry L. Stimson Center in Washington , said , referring to the peacekeeping mission in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;29	`` If the West is not willing to act on its own doorstep why would it do it elsewhere ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;30	Lewis MacKenzie , a veteran of nine peacekeeping operations and the former head of the Sarajevo operation , points out that despite its shortcomings , the U.N. mission in Bosnia still ensures that millions of people receive food every day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;31	And the retired major-general says that despite the problems , there is still a need for peacekeeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0031;32	`` People who talks about the loss of credibility will be on bended knees before the U.N. at the next crisis , '' MacKenzie said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0033;0	NATO is ready to start building its program to admit former Cold War foes into the alliance , but the foundation received a strong new jolt from Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;1	Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev stunned the North Atlantic Treaty Organization foreign ministers on Thursday by backing out of a program tailored to ease Russia 's fears of an eastward drive by the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;2	Instead of endorsing a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts between NATO and Moscow , as he had been invited to Brussels to do , Kozyrev recited Russia 's worries about the Partnership for Peace program , a U.S. initiative proudly unveiled at a NATO summit last January .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;3	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told his dumbfounded audience , which had just agreed to a cautious , year-long project to draw up conditions for new members from the former Soviet bloc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;4	The foreign ministers were to meet today with their counterparts from Eastern Europe and former Soviet republics to discuss the plan -- and Russia 's opposition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;5	Some diplomats thought Kozyrev 's message was really intended for the strong nationalist opposition back home in Russia , which fears the West is encroaching on Russia 's sphere of influence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;6	Portuguese Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Durao Barroso said Kozyrev `` threw a bucket of cold water on the meeting . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;7	Since the collapse of the Soviet Bloc , NATO has anguished over whether -- and when -- to open its doors to its former foes in central and eastern Europe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;8	Poland , Hungary and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;9	The allies thought in the Partnership for Peace , they had found a formula pleasing both to East European supplicants and the wary Russians -- a sort of halfway house where former Soviet Bloc nations can take part in NATO military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;10	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;11	But Kozyrev warned that the Partnership threatened to create new divisions in Europe , with some participants destined to become NATO members , while others would remain on the outs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;12	`` Not all countries will be able to obtain membership at the same time , '' he protested .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;13	Willy Claes , the alliance 's new secretary-general , tried to respond to Kozyrev 's remarks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;14	`` It is no change in strategy or policy of NATO , '' he told the Russian minister just before he left NATO headquarters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;15	`` There is nothing new .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;16	We are not willing to organize new divisions in Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;17	Kozyrev 's outburst was only the latest blow to the alliance , which has suffered unprecedented strains in recent weeks over a split between the United States and Europe over how NATO should deal with the war in Bosnia-Herzegovina .
APW_ENG_19941202.0033;18	Attempting to heal the rift , Secretary of State Warren Christopher this week made a major policy switch , adopting the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;0	Test reject John Crawley scored a fiery unbeaten 91 Friday to spearhead England to a four-wicket win over a Sir Donald Bradman XI in a limited-overs cricket match at Bowral , southwest of Sydney .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;1	Crawley , who was left out of the team for the first Test against Australia , clubbed eight fours and a six as England scored a morale-boosting win against the team of young Australians led by former Test captain Allan Border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;2	The Bradman XI scored 205 for four in its allocated 50 overs and England reached the required total with just seven balls to spare .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;3	Crawley revived England 's hopes after tourists had slumped to 136 for six .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;4	He and Darren Gough added 72 runs off just 57 balls in an unbeaten seventh wicket stand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;5	Gough finished not out 24 , with one six and two fours .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;6	Earlier , Mike Atherton , Alec Stewart and Mike Gatting all made starts before throwing their wickets away .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;7	For the Bradman XI , Neil Maxwell had the best bowling figures of two for 2-26 from 9.5 overs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;8	Opener Jason Arnberger had ensured England would face a difficult chase when he top-scored for the home side with 79 against an ineffective attack .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;9	All the batsmen got starts , with Arnberger 's opening partner Jamie Cox scoring 42 , Jimmy Maher 26 and Shane Lee 27 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;10	Arnberger and Cox shared a century opening stand , the highlight of which was a big six from Cox off the bowling of spinner Shaun Udal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;11	England next faces the Australian Capital Territory in Canberra on Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;12	Scores : Sir Donald Bradman XI 205-4 -LRB- Jason Arnberger 79 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;13	England 208-6 -LRB- John Crawley 91 not out -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0034;14	England won by four wickets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;0	The worst floods in Vietnam 's rice growing area in three decades have killed 407 people , mostly children , according to figures reported in a newspaper Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;1	The floods in Vietnam 's Mekong River region also destroyed dlrs 208 million worth of crops and property , Tuoi Tre -LRB- Youth -RRB- reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;2	Officials at the government 's disaster management unit could not immediately confirm the newspaper 's figures .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;3	The flood waters are receding from the eight stricken provinces but will probably not fully subside until next month , said Ingomar Anderson , an official of the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;4	The floods , which began in June , were caused by heavy seasonal rains .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;5	`` If you talk about water levels , the worst is over , '' Anderson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;6	`` But that does n't mean the worst is over for the people because they lost their crops . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;7	Members of the federation have donated dlrs 2 million of emergency aid , and half of the money has already been distributed to local authorities to buy boats , fishing nets and clothing , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;8	About 22,000 Vietnamese who fled their flooded homes will probably have to live for at least another month at temporary sites , Anderson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;9	Sicknesses such as diarrhea are widespread at the sites , he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;10	Among those most badly affected by the floods are recent ethnic Vietnamese immigrants from neighboring Cambodia who fled communal violence there last year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0035;11	The Vietnamese government has paid the equivalent of dlrs 5.8 million in cash and supplies to the flood victims , Tuoi Tre reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0036;0	Japan has agreed with Russia to postpone payments of 100 million dollars , a part of the debts owed by the former Soviet Union to the Export-Import Bank of Japan that falls due on Dec. 31 , the government said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0036;1	A new deadline for repayment has been set for Sept. 30 , 1997 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0036;2	Japan has signed another deferment agreement for 180 million dollars worth of debts with trade insurance , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0036;3	With this agreement , the total debts that Japan has postponed for Russia in 1994 comes to about 280 million dollars .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;0	Vietnamese retail prices rose 13.2 percent during the first 11 months of the year , a report said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;1	Prices increased by 1.7 percent in November due partly to heavy floods in the Mekong River region , Vietnam 's biggest rice-growing area , the Saigon Newsreader reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;2	The floods caused temporary shortages and speculation that led to higher rice prices .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;3	Vietnam had hoped to keep inflation at less than 10 percent this year , but prices exceeded the target in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;4	Government officials have set a new goal of keeping inflation below 14 percent in 1994 , the newspaper reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;5	Official newspapers have tried to justify the higher-than-expected price increases .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;6	They report , for example , that higher prices for rice mean better incomes for the four-fifths of the nation 's people who live by farming .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;7	International lenders such as the World Bank have praised Vietnam 's success in reigning in inflation , which reached 775 percent in 1986 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;8	Free-market reforms since then have encouraged farmers and businessmen to produce more food and consumer goods to meet domestic demand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;9	Inflation stood at 5.2 percent in 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0037;10	Vietnam 's National Assembly has targeted a maximum inflation rate of 10 percent next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;0	The Asian Development Bank announced Friday it has begun offering a new category of loans at prevailing market rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;1	The Manila-based bank said the new fund source , its third lending `` window , '' was opened in response to growing demand for market-based loans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;2	The bank 's two other loan categories are a pool-based , multi-currency loan window which is predominantly in Japanese yen and a pool-based single-currency window in U.S. dollars .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;3	Lending rates of the windows are based on the cost of pools of borrowing undertaken separately for each window plus a variable lending spread .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;4	The new loan window is linked to the London Inter-Bank Offered Rate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;5	Borrowers from this window will have the option of having their loans priced at either fixed or floating rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;6	The floating rate will be linked to the six-month LIBOR in each loan currency while the fixed lending rate will be set at the time of disbursement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0039;7	Loan maturities will range from eight to 15 years , the bank added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;0	The United States is about to resume an anti-drug intelligence operation with Colombia that the administration suspended seven months ago because of questions about its legality .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;1	An administration official said resumption of the program is imminent , adding that agreement with Peru is close as well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;2	A congressional study carried out during the summer said that suspension of the program had benefited drug traffickers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;3	Until last May , ground-based U.S. radar was able to keep tabs on drug flights out of the two Andean countries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;4	Very few flights were intercepted but authorities in Bogota and Lima were able to use the data to stage raids on cocaine laboratories and storage facilities , officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;5	The United States discontinued the program in May on grounds that U.S. officials could be held liable under international law if Colombia or Peru used the U.S.-supplied data to shoot down civilian aircraft suspected of being used in drug trafficking .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;6	American sensitivities about the downing of innocent aircraft were heightened in April when U.S. F-15 fighters , in a case of mistaken identity , shot down two American helicopters in northern Iraq .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;7	Twenty-six people were killed : 15 Americans , five Kurds , three Turks , two Britons and a Frenchman .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;8	Just two weeks later , nervous administration officials called a halt to the radar operations in Peru and Colombia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;9	Civilian aircraft is the most common means to send cocaine base from Peru to Colombia for final processing and for ultimate distribution in the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;10	The May decision prompted expressions of outrage from officials in Colombia and Peru , who felt it demonstrated a lack of U.S. resolve .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;11	It also produced a deep rift between the counter-narcotics offices in the Pentagon and the State Department , which vigorously opposed the suspension .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;12	Legislation approved by Congress at the administration 's request this past summer requires the administration to certify that the country receiving the intelligence data has taken measures to protect against innocent loss of life .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;13	An administration official , asking not to be identified , said details of the new arrangement have been completed with Colombia and `` we 're almost there with Peru . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;14	The study carried out during the summer by the General Accounting Office , a congressional agency , said the May decision made life easier for the drug traffickers in several ways .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;15	It said they were able to use multiple flights with smaller drug loads than before .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;16	They also began flying during daylight hours instead of the early evening .
APW_ENG_19941202.0040;17	In addition , they were able to spend more time on the ground and used more direct air routes instead of the more circuitous ones used previously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;0	A regional pro-democracy forum adopted a resolution Friday demanding the release of Aung San Suu Kyi and other political prisoners held by Burma 's military junta .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;1	Mrs. Suu Kyi , leader of the pro-democracy opposition to Burma 's military government , has been under house arrest since July 1989 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;2	She won the 1991 Nobel Peace Prise for her struggle .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;3	The resolution -- adopted by about 200 former heads of state , politicians and scholars from around the world -- called on the Burmese ruling council to unconditionally release Mrs. Suu Kyi and other political prisoners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;4	The participants in the Forum of Democratic Leaders in the Asia Pacific also pledged to join international efforts to implement United Nations resolutions aimed at restoring democracy in Burma .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;5	The forum says one of its main goals is to fight authoritarian rulers in the Asia-Pacific region who say democracy is a luxury with less priority than economic development .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;6	`` The true development of human beings involves much more than mere economic growth , '' Mrs. Suu Kyi said in a message read by former Philippine President Corazon Aquino to the forum .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;7	`` Mere material assistance is not enough ; the poor must have the sense that they themselves can shape their own future ... in a world where political leadership is often synonymous with tyranny and the rule of a narrow elite . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;8	Although the National League for Democracy , led by Mrs. Suu Kyi , won a landslide victory in 1990 elections , the military junta has so far refused to yield power .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;9	In March , the U.N. Human Rights Commission adopted a resolution urging the government in Rangoon to improve human rights conditions and immediately release Mrs. Suu Kyi , who is in her sixth year under house arrest without trial .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;10	`` She is healthy , high-spirited and well-informed , '' said Sein Win , prime minister of Burma 's exile government , the National Coalition Government of the Union of Burma .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;11	He was attending the forum .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;12	`` On the whole , there has been no real change in Burma .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;13	The human rights situation remains the same , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;14	The forum drew many human rights advocates , such as former President Oscar Sanchez Arias of Costa Rica and Ed Broadbent , head of the Montreal-based International Center for Human Rights and Democratic Development .
APW_ENG_19941202.0042;15	The forum -- co-hosted by Mrs. Aquino and Kim Dae-jung , an eight-time Nobel Peace Prize nominee for his struggle against South Korea 's past authoritarian governments -- ends Saturday after a three-day inaugural conference in Seoul .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;0	A rocket scientist in India 's space program has been arrested on suspicion of passing on secrets , newspapers reported Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;1	Nambi Narayanan was the second space expert to be accused in a spy ring case after the Oct. 20 arrest of a woman who allegedly seduced scientists and blackmailed them to give her designs of rocket engines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;2	Indian newspapers quoted unidentifed police sources as saying the ring was working for Pakistan , India 's neighbor and arch-enemy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;3	Narayanan , who helped develop engines for India 's satellite launch vehicles and defense missiles , was arrested Wednesday in Trivandrum on India 's southern coast , reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;4	He was the head of the liquid propulsion laboratory of the Indian Space Research Organization .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;5	Reports said Indian police began an espionage probe after arresting Mariam Rasheda , a citizen of an Indian Ocean archipelago , the Maldives .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;6	Rasehda 's interrogation led to the arrests of a rocket expert and K. Chandrashekaran , a businessman who claimed to represent the Russian space company Glavkosmos , the Indian Express newspaper said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;7	At least 30 other scientists , businessmen and a top police officer are involved in the affair , reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;8	India and Pakistan have fought three wars since 1947 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;9	Both are believed capable of producing nuclear weapons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;10	India is developing its own weapons delivery system , while Pakistan buys M-11 missiles from China .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;11	Indian scientists have worked on rockets to launch communications satellites since 1979 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;12	But the space laboratories also are involved in developing missile technology .
APW_ENG_19941202.0043;13	Under U.S. pressure , Glavkosmos was forced to cancel a deal to supply rocket engines to India in 1992 .

APW_ENG_19941202.0045;0	Now that Japan has issued an apology , of sorts , about its attack on Pearl Harbor , some historians say the United States should be declaring its own regrets about its conduct after that fateful day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;1	They say the two U.S. military leaders blamed for having their guard down when Japanese planes destroyed much of the Pacific Fleet were scapegoats whose names should be cleared .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;2	Rear Adm. Husband E. Kimmel and Lt. Gen. Walter C. Short have been regarded for more than 50 years as sleeping sentries , said British author John Costello .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;3	`` But the record shows that they were really more like two guards who have been blindfolded by the lack of intelligence , told to face the wrong direction , and inadequately armed to fend off an enemy air attack . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;4	Costello and two other like-minded historians spoke at the National Archives on Thursday , trying to attract a measure of the public interest aroused by Japan 's debates over its wartime behavior .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;5	Japan apologized Nov. 21 , not for attacking Pearl Harbor , but for failing to warn that it was at war with the United States before attacking .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;6	The surprise attack on Dec. 7 , 1941 , killed 2,403 people , sank or damaged 18 warships , destroyed 188 planes and drew the United States into World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;7	U.S. officials refused as recently as last year to reopen the case of Kimmel and Short , both cited during the war for dereliction of duty and both now dead .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;8	The Kimmel family , 32 retired admirals and two former chairmen of the Joint Chiefs of Staff are among those who have pressed for the commanders ' vindication .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;9	Kimmel , who was commander of the Pacific Fleet , and Short , commander of the Army 's Hawaii department , were blamed in official inquiries for playing down intelligence reports warning of Japan 's intentions and for mounting inadequate reconnaissance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;10	Costello said his new book , `` Days of Infamy , '' builds on previously reported evidence that the Hawaiian commanders were not given the full benefit of American intelligence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;11	The commanders indeed shrugged off some 11th-hour signals of trouble , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;12	But they did so because a steady drumbeat of intelligence from Washington had pointed to the Philippines as the likely target for Japan 's move against U.S. forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;13	Nine hours after Pearl Harbor , Japan bombed Clark Field in the Philippines , destroying 18 bombers , 55 fighters and 33 other planes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0045;14	In the Philippines , Costello said , Gen. Douglas MacArthur had received `` the full diplomatic picture of Japan 's march toward belligerence '' but did nothing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;0	An independent counsel concluded his investigation of the search of President Clinton 's passport files during the 1992 presidential campaign , saying no criminal charges will be filed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;1	Joseph diGenova , who has been investigating the matter for nearly two years , said his report will exonerate the former Bush administration officials who had been the subject of his probe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;2	`` No question about it , '' he said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;3	A three-judge federal panel appointed diGenova nearly two years ago , after President Bush 's attorney general , William Barr , found possible evidence of criminal intent in the search of the Democratic presidential candidate 's passport files .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;4	Late in the campaign , rumors had surfaced that while Clinton was a student in England , he had sought information on how to renounce his U.S. citizenship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;5	The unfounded rumors triggered requests for government documents from the news media and an inquiry from a Republican House member , Rep. Gerald Solomon of New York .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;6	Political appointees at the State Department expedited the search , and State Department Inspector General Sherman Funk concluded after his own investigation that they had sought to use their official access to government records to damage Clinton 's chances against Bush .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;7	Among those criticized in Funk 's report was Elizabeth Tamposi , the assistant secretary of state for consular affairs , who was subsequently fired .
APW_ENG_19941202.0047;8	Funk referred the matter to the Justice Department for prosecution , and Barr then sought appointment of an independent counsel .

APW_ENG_19941202.0048;1	`` I do n't think the Japanese people will have good feelings toward the design of the stamp , '' Foreign Minister Yohei Kono said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;2	`` We may convey our feelings to the U.S. side in some form , '' he told a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;3	The U.S. Postal Service plans to begin selling the stamp next September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;4	The stamp depicts the explosion of the atomic bomb dropped by U.S. forces on the city of Hiroshima in the closing days of World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;5	Under the mushroom cloud , it says , `` Atomic bombs hasten war 's end , August 1945 . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;6	Within five months after the bombing of Hiroshima , about 140,000 of the city 's 340,000 residents died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;7	Another atomic bombing of Nagasaki three days later killed 70,000 of that city 's 270,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;8	Several days later , on Aug. 15 , 1945 , Japan surrendered to the Allied Forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0048;9	Survivors of the atomic bombing and anti-nuclear activists expressed anger over the stamp on Thursday .

APW_ENG_19941202.0049;0	A 13-year-old Japanese boy hanged himself in his back yard after being bullied by classmates into giving them more than 1 million yen -LRB- dlrs 10,000 -RRB- over three years , reports said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;1	In a four-page suicide note , Kiyoteru Okouchi said a group of four classmates at Tobu Junior High School had been abusing him and extorting money from him for three years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;2	His body was found Sunday night hanging from a tree at his home in Nishio , about 270 kilometers -LRB- 170 miles -RRB- west of Tokyo , local police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;3	Police would not say how much money Okouchi handed over after the other students repeatedly hit him and dunked his head in a river , but news reports said the total came to 1.1 million yen -LRB- dlrs 11,000 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;4	He took the money from his parents ' house without permission and left a note addressed to his mother acknowledging the debt , Kyodo News Service said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;5	Bullying remains frequent at Japan 's regimented schools .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;6	Typical targets are children with outstanding grades , physical handicaps , foreign upbringing , or who otherwise do n't conform .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;7	Some students choose suicide rather than continue to face bullying .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;8	Last year , 113 students between the ages of 10 and 19 committed suicide for school-related problems such as bullying and severe punishments from teachers , according to a National Police Agency report .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;9	About the same amount was reported in 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;10	A total of 23,258 cases of bullying were reported in public schools in 1992 , up from 22,062 cases reported in 1991 , according to the most recent figures available from the Education Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;11	`` For him , suicide was no doubt the most severe form of retaliation possible , '' said Susumu Abe , a noted critic on educational issues .
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;12	`` Japanese children are not given enough instruction about the constraints they should put on their actions toward others . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0049;13	In Japan , children under age of 16 do not face criminal prosecution and are tried only in family courts .

APW_ENG_19941202.0051;0	The worst floods in Vietnam 's main rice growing area in three decades have killed 407 people , mostly children , according to figures reported in a newspaper Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;1	The floods in Vietnam 's Mekong River region also destroyed dlrs 208 million worth of crops and property , Tuoi Tre -LRB- Youth -RRB- reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;2	Officials at the government 's disaster management unit could not immediately confirm the newspaper 's figures .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;3	The flood waters are receding from the eight stricken provinces but will probably not fully subside until next month , said Ingomar Anderson , an official of the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;4	The floods , which began in June , were caused by heavy seasonal rains .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;5	`` If you talk about water levels , the worst is over , '' Anderson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;6	`` But that does n't mean the worst is over for the people because they lost their crops . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;7	Members of the federation have donated dlrs 2 million of emergency aid , and half of the money has already been distributed to local authorities to buy boats , fishing nets and clothing , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;8	About 22,000 Vietnamese who fled their flooded homes will probably have to live for at least another month at temporary sites , Anderson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;9	Sicknesses such as diarrhea are widespread at the sites , he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;10	Among those most badly affected by the floods are recent ethnic Vietnamese immigrants from neighboring Cambodia who fled communal violence there last year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0051;11	The Vietnamese government has paid the equivalent of dlrs 5.8 million in cash and supplies to the flood victims , Tuoi Tre reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;0	Eating cheese sandwiches and sleeping across from duty-free shops selling perfume , Khadija Abdul-Aziz has spent nine months in the Cairo airport transit lounge -- bound for nowhere .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;1	The tall , 34-year-old woman with close-cropped hair says she is a refugee from Angola , but has no passport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;2	Officials have doubts about her claim .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;3	The United Nations and five countries are trying to figure out just who she is .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;4	While she waits , this woman without a country spends her days sitting in the transit lounge , talking to Egyptian airport workers and watching other potential refugees come and go .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;5	`` I am devastated in every way and I am living in this whirlpool , '' she said during an interview in an airport hallway , its walls painted a sickly yellow .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;6	`` Every day is the same here . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;7	Abdul-Aziz says she fled to Portugal in 1985 , escaping a massacre in Angola that killed her parents , brother and husband .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;8	Her three children were with her , and she was pregnant with a fourth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;9	Her two girls and two boys are now in Italy with a sister .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;10	After working in Spain for seven years , she says , she was deported for having an expired visa .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;11	Sudan was her destination because -- she says -- she was keeping a Sudanese friend 's passport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;12	In Khartoum , the passport was confiscated and she was put on the first flight to Egypt , which sent her to Spain , which sent her back to Cairo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;13	She 's been at Cairo airport since March .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;14	`` My children do n't know I am in here .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;15	I tell them I am still working in Spain and that everything is fine , '' she told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;16	It 's a sad story -- if it 's true .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;17	Officials wonder about that .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;18	She is a Muslim -- a religion almost unknown among Angolans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;19	She speaks excellent Arabic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;20	She said she learned it from an airport guard , but her dialect is Sudanese .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;21	The U.N. High Commissioner of Refugees is trying to help her .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;22	The Egyptian government would like her to leave , but she has refused to see Angolan diplomats to help verify her identity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;23	`` The Egyptian immigration office said she does not speak any local Angolan dialects but is fluent in Arabic , '' said Cesar Felizardo , first secretary of Angola 's Embassy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;24	So Abdul-Aziz stays in the transit area .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;25	About a dozen other people sit in the area , sometimes for a few days , while their status is investigated .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;26	Abdul-Aziz has the only bed in a room reserved for women .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;27	One day earlier this week , bundles of clothing were heaped on the floor , and two figures slept on the stained brown carpet under an old gray blanket .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;28	`` I had to buy new blankets because it is too cold , '' Abdul-Aziz said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;29	The UNHCR has given her 900 Egyptian pounds , or about dlrs 270 , over the past nine months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;30	`` We first heard about Abdul-Aziz 's case in June ... and we gave her money on humanitarian grounds , '' said UNHCR spokesman Panos Moumtzis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;31	He said the UNHCR is also confused about her identity , noting she once said she was Sudanese .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;32	She has applied for help from a United States program for women , `` Women at Risk , '' but has had no answer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;33	Egypt also says it wants to help .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;34	`` It is not Egypt 's fault that she is staying at the airport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;35	... We want somebody to tell us who she is so that we can send her out , '' said Hazem Taher of the Foreign Ministry 's Refugee Department .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;36	But Abdul-Aziz stays on , complaining the airport supplies only one cheese sandwich a day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;37	`` If I lived on only that I would have been buried a long time ago , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;38	Asked of her hopes , Abdul-Aziz said she wants to leave -- but not to Angola -- and to see her children .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;39	`` I do n't mind going anywhere , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0052;40	`` I am very tired from inside . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0054;0	Authorities have arrested 51 people for killing 16 Asian elephants to obtain their ivory tusks , a blow to the preservation of the endangered animals , an official report said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;1	The elephants were killed in a 240,000-hectare -LRB- 592,800-acre -RRB- nature preserve in southwest China 's Yunnan province , the Guangming Daily reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;2	Asian elephants are native to the sub-tropical southern Yunnan region of Xishuangbanna , but only about 200 still exist nationwide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;3	Forestry officials said the case was the largest slaughter of protected animals in recent years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;4	The report said forestry police and reserve managers began receiving reports in March of hunters with military-style rifles going into the nature preserve .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;5	A three-month investigation revealed that the gang had killed 16 Asian elephants and injured four others since mid-1993 , it said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;6	Authorities confiscated 11 tusks , more than 60,000 yuan -LRB- dlrs 7,000 -RRB- , an automatic rifle and a tractor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;7	The newspaper said the people involved in the case included government officials , police officers , office workers , farmers , private traders and foreign businessmen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;8	The tusks were smuggled out of the country , the report said , without saying where .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;9	Ivory trade has been banned worldwide in an effort to protect the dwindling numbers of elephants around the world .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;10	The report said the suspects would be prosecuted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0054;11	The ringleaders are likely to face the death penalty .

APW_ENG_19941202.0056;0	The dollar climbed against the Japanese yen in Tokyo Friday on hopes for another rise in U.S. interest rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;1	Stock prices edged lower .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;2	The U.S. currency ended the week at 99.58 yen , up 0.57 yen from its Thursday close in Tokyo and above its overnight finish in New York at 99.34 yen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;3	After opening at 99.40 yen , trades ranged between 99.38 yen and 99.59 yen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;4	The dollar continued to rise in Tokyo after its advance Thursday in New York to a seven-week high as a spate of strong economic figures fueled expectations of a further rise in key U.S. interest rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;5	Currency dealers said the dollar moved somewhat narrowly as many players awaited the release later in the day of November U.S. employment data .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;6	If the data suggest persistent inflationary pressure in the U.S. economy , dealers believe that prospects for another rate hike may become stronger , thus increasing the return on some dollar-based investments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;7	The U.S. Federal Reserve raised its key lending rate by 0.75 percentage points Nov. 15 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;8	On the stock market , the 225-issue Nikkei Stock Average lost 15.30 points , or 0.08 percent , ending the week at 18,998.30 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;9	On Thursday , the average shed 62.02 points , or 0.33 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;10	Stock prices closed lower in quiet trading as many participants sat on the sidelines ahead of the release of U.S. employment figures .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;11	Equity players fear that if the data suggest another increase in U.S. interest rates , Wall Street may again respond negatively , bringing down Tokyo stocks as well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;12	The Tokyo Stock Price Index of all issues listed on the first section fell 3.35 points , or 0.22 percent , to 1,515.85 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;13	The TOPIX lost 1.21 points , or 0.08 percent , the day before .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;14	Volume on the first section was very thin at an estimated 210 million shares , down from 265.29 million shares Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;15	Retreating issues outnumbered winners 594 to 402 , while 201 issues were unchanged .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;16	Benchmark No. 164 10-year Japanese government bonds closed at 96.63 yen , up 0.16 yen from Thursday 's close .
APW_ENG_19941202.0056;17	Their yield fell by 0.025 percentage point to 4.630 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;0	NATO foreign ministers sought Friday to reassure Russia that their plans for admitting former Warsaw Pact foes would n't create a new division in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;1	The allies opened daylong talks with counterparts from nearly two-dozen nations in Eastern Europe in a session likely to be dominated by Russia 's unexpected opposition to a plan to expand the alliance in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;2	Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev stunned the ministers Thursday by protesting the plan for drawing up conditions for future NATO membership .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;3	He also backed out of a program to improve cooperation between Moscow and NATO .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;4	`` I think that we 'll all get -LRB- it -RRB- sorted out ... How soon I do n't know , '' said British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd as he entered alliance headquarters for the second day of discussions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;5	He said ties between Moscow and NATO were `` too important to be lost . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;6	Kozyrev 's comments cast a pall over the meeting and over NATO 's attempt to draw its former Warsaw Pact enemies into its alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;7	However , some diplomats suggested he was playing to an audience back in Russia , where the government is contending with a strong nationalist opposition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;8	Poland 's foreign minister , Andrzej Olechowski , said the foreign ministers would `` explain everything to the Russians -- that -LRB- membership plans -RRB- are n't against them . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;9	`` It 's our problem and the alliance 's problem -- not the Russians ' , '' said Czech Foreign Minister Josef Zieleniec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;10	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;11	In an effort to meet their demands , but without upsetting Russia , the allies thought they had found a good formula .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;12	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , to bring former foes closer , but without membership .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;13	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;14	On Thursday , the allies decided to go further by ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the terms and conditions for expanding the Western military alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;15	In an effort to overcome Russian objections to its eastward expansion , the NATO allies had agreed to a special relationship with Moscow and insisted they had no intention of forming a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;16	But Kozyrev was n't impressed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;17	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told a group of grim-faced NATO ministers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;18	Afterward , Portuguese Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Durao Barroso said Kozyrev `` threw a bucket of cold water on the meeting . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;19	Kozyrev refused to endorse a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts with Moscow intended to ease Russia 's fears of an eastward drive by the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;20	He said he read the ministers ' statement on membership and immediately called Russian President Boris Yeltsin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;21	`` This communique raises more questions than it answers , '' Kozyrev said in impromptu remarks that were broadcast to reporters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;22	`` We have to understand what are the intentions of the other partners . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;23	U.S. State Department spokesman Mike McCurry said Kozyrev gave no advance warning that he wanted clarification of the schedule for considering new NATO members next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;24	`` I would be tempted to say it has to do with domestic politics in Russia , '' McCurry said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;25	Willy Claes , the alliance 's new secretary-general , tried to reassure Kozyrev that NATO was n't shifting direction .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;26	`` It is no change in strategy or policy of NATO .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;27	... There is nothing new , '' he told the Russian minister just before he left NATO headquarters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;28	`` We are not willing to organize new divisions in Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;29	Kozyrev 's outburst only added to the alliance 's woes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;30	There have been unprecedented strains in recent weeks between the United States and its European allies over Bosnia-Herzegovina .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;31	In an effort to heal the wounds , U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher swung behind the European view that diplomacy , not force , is the best way to deal with the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941202.0058;32	It was a major policy switch by Washington under pressure from the Europeans , led by Britain and France .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;0	Ernesto Zedillo 's grade school teacher always told her students that one among them might just grow up to be president .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;1	With her former student 's inauguration as Mexico 's newest president on Thursday , Celia Ladron de Guevara no longer has to hedge with words like `` might . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;2	Ladron said she always encouraged her students to aspire to greatness -- telling them they could reach the county 's top office if they worked hard .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;3	`` Some of my students would laugh , thinking it was a joke , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;4	`` Today they 're no longer laughing . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;5	Ladron remembered Zedillo as a poor , skinny boy who always came to class clean and neatly dressed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;6	`` And he was always first in his class , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;7	Zedillo learned the value of hard work early , growing up in a poor family in this city near the U.S. border , she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;8	`` To make it , he had odd jobs outside of school , shining shoes , selling newspapers . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;9	Zedillo 's grades enabled him to study in some of Mexicali 's better schools , where many students come from much wealthier families .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;10	`` Fortunately , all of the students wore uniforms , so it was n't too obvious who came from rich and poor families , '' Ladron said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;11	Even Carlos Ling Altamirano , who heads the local chapter of the National Action Party , Mexico 's leading opposition party , is proud of the hometown boy 's achievements .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;12	`` Historically , many of Mexico 's presidents have come from the north , because life here is harder , '' Ling said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0059;13	`` There are deserts here and people have to work harder to survive . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;0	A ferry carrying more than 600 people collided with a Singapore-registered freighter and sank before dawn Friday in Manila Bay , killing at least 17 people , the Coast Guard reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;1	Coast Guard spokesman Amado Samante said 449 passengers had been rescued and the search was continuing for others .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;2	The 2,452-ton ferry , the Cebu City , sank 30 minutes after the collision .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;3	There was no immediate official report on the cause of the accident , but the company which owned the Cebu City said it had been rammed by the Singapore-registered freighter Kota Suria .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;4	Jacob Cabatuan , a crewman on the ferry , said the Kota Suria 's bow crashed into the Cebu City , destroying the bridge and ripping a one-meter -LRB- three-foot -RRB- hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;5	He said ship captain Wesceslao Lampong and several other officers were pinned on the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;6	Erwin Maravilla , one of the first group of survivors plucked from the sea by a navy patrol , said his family was sleeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;7	`` Suddenly we heard a crash .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;8	I grabbed my two children , but when the ferry sank we were sucked under the water with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;9	A piece of metal hit my arm , and I lost hold of my two kids , '' he said , adding that his wife was also missing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;10	`` I was lucky to be able to swim to the surface .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;11	Otherwise I would be dead , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;12	The 12,500-ton Kota Suria , with a crew of 26 , was damaged in its bow but joined the rescue effort , carrying 230 of those saved .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;13	President Fidel Ramos ordered an investigation into the cause of the accident , which occurred in calm seas under clear night skies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;14	Maximo Calamba , 38 , who survived with his wife Veneranda , 30 , and 1-year-old son Marcelo , complained that the ferry crew failed to inform them about the approaching freighter and did not help people evacuate the ship after the collision .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;15	`` There was no alarm .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;16	We were thrown off our cots and everybody was on their own , '' Calamba said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;17	`` When we were rescued by the Suria I could still hear crying out for help . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;18	Cargo containers and rubber rafts were floating at the scene , but it was unclear whether there were people aboard , said radio station DZRH , reporting from an airplane overhead .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;19	At least eight patrol boats , a search and rescue ship and several other inter-island ferries were trying to recover survivors , it said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;20	The Cebu City had a capacity of 800 passengers , but only 605 people were on board at the time of the accident , said a spokesman for the Williams Lines shipping company .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;21	The Cebu City sank near the mouth of Manila Bay near the town of Rosario , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 35 miles -RRB- southwest of Manila in Cavite province .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;22	It had left the port of Manila bound for Tagbilaran , the capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;23	Quirimon Tan , William Lines vice president , said each of the dead passengers was covered by 50,000 pesos -LRB- dlrs 2,173 -RRB- in insurance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;24	He said the company would also pay for medical and funeral expenses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0060;25	The Philippines ' worst peacetime ferry disaster was in December 1987 , when 3,537 people died in the collision of the ferry Dona Paz with the oil tanker Vector off Mindoro Island , about 130 kilometers -LRB- 80 miles -RRB- south of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;0	Air raids continued Friday in Chechnya amid reports that volunteers from throughout the Caucasus were coming to the aid of the restive republic 's embattled president .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;1	The Interfax news agency said there were rocket attacks early Friday on an airfield and two towns east of Grozny , the Chechen capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;2	It gave no details .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;3	On Thursday , a small airfield near Grozny was hit in an air raid and four people died in a missile attack at Katayama , about 20 kilometers -LRB- 12 miles -RRB- from Grozny .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;4	Russian newspapers were full of reports that volunteers from neighboring republics in the volatile Caucasus Mountains were arriving in Chechnya to fend off a Russian invasion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;5	Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev declared his tiny , mostly Muslim republic 's independence from Russia in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;6	Dudayev accuses Moscow of arming and leading the rebels who are now trying to topple him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;7	The rebels began an offensive last week backed by combat aircraft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;8	Thousands of people have fled the fighting in Grozny , a city of 300,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;9	President Boris Yeltsin threatened earlier this week to send in troops unless both Dudayev and his opponents stopped fighting and freed their prisoners of war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;10	Neither side complied and Yeltsin softened his stance to an offer of amnesty to those who `` voluntarily lay down arms by Dec. 15 . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;11	Russia says it offers the rebels only political support .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;12	It refuses to recognize independence for Chechnya , which was incorporated into the Russian Empire in the 19th century after a series of long and bloody wars .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;13	Media reports say there are substantial troop buildups in southern Russia near the Chechen border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;14	Meanwhile , a delegation from the Russian parliament was in Grozny trying to negotiate the release of 70 Russian captives Dudayev claims were fighting alongside the Chechen opposition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;15	`` The use of force in Chechnya is doomed to failure , '' Sergei Yushenkov , head of the delegation , said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;16	Dudayev says the prisoners are Russian soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;17	He first threatened to execute them , but now says they will be tried in military courts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;18	Russian Defense Minister Pavel Grachev has said the prisoners are mercenaries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;19	Although Chechens are at odds , they are united in their distrust of Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;20	In Freedom Square outside Dudayev 's offices , several hundred volunteer fighters cradling Kalashnikov rifles and grenade launchers gathered to hear speeches Thursday while a tank maneuvered into position .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;21	Elders in tall fur hats , tunics and high leather boots danced in a circle , chanting , `` Freedom or death ! ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;22	Russians are generally content to let the Chechens go their own way , according to a poll Thursday by the International Opinion Research Center .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;23	The poll of 3,250 people said 74.2 percent believe Russia should recognize Chechnya 's independence , while 5.5 percent said it should n't and 20.3 said they could n't answer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0062;24	The margin of error was 1 percent .

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;1	The allies opened daylong talks with their counterparts from Eastern Europe and former Soviet republics in a session likely to be dominated by Russia 's unexpected opposition to a plan to expand the alliance in coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;2	Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev stunned the ministers Thursday by protesting the plan for drawing up conditions for future NATO membership .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;3	He also announced Russia 's withdrawal from a program to improve military and political cooperation between Moscow and NATO .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;4	`` I think that we 'll all get -LRB- it -RRB- sorted out ... How soon I do n't know , '' said British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd as he entered alliance headquarters for the second day of discussions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;5	He said ties between Moscow and NATO were `` too important to be lost . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;10	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;11	In an effort to meet their demands , but without upsetting Russia , the allies thought they had found a good formula .

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;13	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;14	On Thursday , the allies decided to go further by ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the terms , costs and conditions for expanding the Western military alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;15	In an effort to ease Russian fears about its eastward expansion , the NATO allies had agreed to a special relationship with Moscow and insisted they had no intention of forming a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;16	But Kozyrev was n't impressed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;17	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told a group of grim-faced NATO ministers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;18	He said he read the ministers ' statement on membership and immediately called Russian President Boris Yeltsin .

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;20	`` We have to understand what are the intentions of the other partners . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;22	`` I would be tempted to say it has to do with domestic politics in Russia , '' McCurry said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;24	`` It is no change in strategy or policy of NATO .

APW_ENG_19941202.0067;26	`` We are not willing to organize new divisions in Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0067;27	Kozyrev 's outburst only added to the alliance 's woes .
