APW_ENG_19941202.0148;0	The government on Friday expelled two foreign journalists from Indonesia , accusing them of working in the disputed territory of East Timor without proper permits .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;1	Irene Slagt , 42 , of the Netherlands , and Jill da Rosemary Jolliffe , 49 , of Australia , entered Dili , the capital of East Timor , on Nov. 28 on tourist visas , a military spokesman said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;2	`` They were detained while interviewing some people , '' Maj. Laeden Simbolon , a spokesman of the East Timor Military Command , told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;3	East Timor , a former Portuguese colony annexed by Jakarta in 1976 , is normally closed to journalists , who have to obtain permits from the Information Ministry to report from there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;4	Such permits are rarely given , but an exception was made when Indonesia hosted the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation summit last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;5	Restrictions were reimposed once the 17 APEC leaders returned home .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;6	Indonesia , fighting a pro-independence campaign by guerrillas in East Timor , has often been condemned for reported human rights violations by its troops in the territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;7	Simbolon said the two journalists were detained in the regency of Baucau , 65 kilometers -LRB- 40 miles -RRB- east of Dili , on Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;8	The left Indonesia early Friday , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;9	It was not immediately clear which publications the two women worked for .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;10	Jolliffe is a Lisbon-based journalist who was to accompany a Portuguese parliamentary mission to East Timor in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;11	The trip was called off after Indonesia rejected Jolliffe 's inclusion in the team , accusing her of supporting the East Timor insurgency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;12	The cancellation of the trip sparked a violent demonstration in Dili on Nov. 12 , 1991 , that was quelled when troops opened fire , killing dozens of people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;13	To mark the anniversary of the massacre , thousands of East Timorese rampaged through the streets of Dili on Nov. 13 , looting shops , burning cars and smashing windows .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;14	The expulsion of the journalists coincided with the visit of two United Nations envoys to Dili on Friday in preparation for talks on East Timor between the foreign ministers of Indonesia and Portugal on Jan. 9 in Geneva .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;15	Also , a special envoy of Pope John Paul II reached Dili Thursday for a five-day visit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;16	The Rev. Thomas Michel met with Governor Abilio Jose Osorio Soares and discussed religious life on the island .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;17	East Timor is the only Roman Catholic region in overwhelmingly Muslim Indonesia , a country of 185 million people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;18	Indonesian troops moved into East Timor a year after Portugal abandoned the territory it had colonized for four centuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0148;19	However , the United Nations still recognizes Portugal as East Timor 's administering power .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;0	Serbs fired missiles at the Bosnian government headquarters Friday in a sign of contempt for senior U.N. officials on a new mission to end harassment of their peacekeeping troops .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;1	The anti-tank missiles were fired just before the arrival of the top U.N. official for former Yugoslavia , Yasushi Akashi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;2	Akashi , on a mission to end detention of hundreds of peacekeepers and win freedom of movement for U.N. convoys , hoped to have more success with the Serbs than his boss , Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;3	Boutros-Ghali was rebuffed trying to meet with the Bosnian Serbs on Wednesday , and afterwards said intransigence by the warring sides in Bosnia might lead to the end of the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;4	Akashi arrived Friday morning in Sarajevo for meetings with Bosnian government officials , and was to continue on to the Bosnian Serb headquarters at Pale later in the day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;5	He left the presidency briefly and the two missiles hit the building just before he returned for meetings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;6	A third missile hit a building nearby .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;7	There were no immediate reports of injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;8	On Thursday , Serbs fired two anti-tank missiles at the Interior Ministry , wounding four people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;9	Akashi 's talks with the Serbs would follow a meeting Thursday between Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic and the U.N. commander for Bosnia , Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;10	A U.N. source said Karadzic promised to try to help , but added that such promises often are empty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;11	Spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi wanted to discuss fighting around the government enclave of Bihac with Karadzic , as well as an end to restrictions on the movement of U.N. troops .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;12	Thant said Bihac , scene of heavy fighting for weeks , was quiet overnight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;13	But strong Serb forces , which have seized 30-40 percent of the U.N.-declared `` safe zone '' encompassing the town of Bihac and environs , remained in the area .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;14	The United Nations has said the Serbs , from both Croatia and Bosnia , appeared strong enough to capture Bihac if they wanted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;15	There were signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;16	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces against the Serbs , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;17	A Croat militia and the Bosnian army took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;18	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Croatian Serb forces also had shelled his forces across the border near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;19	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;20	Alexander Ivanko , a U.N. spokesman , said Thursday that Bosnian Serb units in the Bihac area crossed the border into Croatia and seized seven Ukrainian peacekeepers from an observation post Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;21	They took the soldiers and a U.N. armored carrier into Bosnian Serb-held territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;22	More than 400 of the 24,000 U.N. soldiers in Bosnia are being detained by the Serbs as insurance against further NATO airstrikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;23	NATO struck three times last week , but the attacks did nothing to stop the Serb assault on Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;24	The Serbs also have been ignoring U.N. requests to send supply convoys across territory they hold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;25	Monique Tuffelli , the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees staffer in Bihac , said Thursday that food stocks would last only another week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;26	`` We have run out almost of everything , '' she said in a telephone interview with The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;27	The Serbs repeatedly have rejected an international peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;28	With the threat of international force appearing to dissipate , their position is hardening .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;29	Momcilo Krajisnik , leader of the Bosnian Serbs ' self-proclaimed legislature , rejected a three-month cease-fire , which the Bosnian government wants .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;30	He said Serbs would only accept a permanent cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;31	The Sarajevo government fears a permanent cease-fire would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;32	The peace plan they rejected would give the Serbs 49 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;33	Senior Western officials now talk of altering that plan to allow the Bosnian Serbs links with Serb-dominated Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0150;34	Opponents say that would be a step toward creation of Serb nationalists ' goal of a `` Greater Serbia . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;0	A Utah woman and her late husband have been honored by Israel as `` Righteous Gentiles '' for hiding about a dozen Jews from the Nazis in Amsterdam during World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;1	Uri Oren , the Israeli consul general in Los Angeles , presented Alida Praag with a medal and certificate at the state Capitol on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;2	Mrs. Praag and her husband Tom 's names will be inscribed on the Righteous Honor Wall at Yad Vashem in Jerusalem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;3	`` My husband and I felt it should be done .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;4	It was our sense of what was right , '' Mrs. Praag said , recalling their hiding of between 12 and 14 Jews during the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;5	Attending the ceremony Thursday was Peter Epstein of Los Angeles , who was a child in wartime Amsterdam .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;6	He helped bring the Praags to the attention of the Israeli government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;7	Epstein said his father asked the Praags to take him and his 1-year-old brother , Frank , but they had room only for Frank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;8	The Epsteins decided to keep their family together and they eventually were sent to the Bergen Belsen concentration camp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;9	They survived and were liberated by the Russians in May 1945 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;10	`` Fifty-five years ago , a black cloud covered the world , '' Oren said during the ceremony .
APW_ENG_19941202.0151;11	`` But behind every black cloud is a source of light , the righteous among the nations . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0153;2	Three soldiers were also killed in the clashes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0153;3	The guerrillas have been fighting for autonomy since 1984 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0153;4	More than 13,000 people have died in the unrest .

APW_ENG_19941202.0154;1	Alberto Tomba ca n't wait .
APW_ENG_19941202.0154;2	The three-time Olympic champion has been training on a glacier in Cervinia , Italy , since cancellation earlier this week of a nighttime slalom race in Sestriere .
APW_ENG_19941202.0154;3	`` I feel good , in great form .

APW_ENG_19941202.0154;5	`` Thus I want to finish high in the giant slalom . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0154;6	A giant slalom is scheduled for Saturday , followed by a slalom Sunday on a glacier at Tignes more than 2,600 meters -LRB- 8,500 feet -RRB- above sea level .
APW_ENG_19941202.0154;7	After rains canceled the opening races in Saas Fee , Switzerland at the start of November , warm weather and lack of snow has plagued Europe since .
APW_ENG_19941202.0154;8	A pair of races in Sestriere were moved to Tignes this weekend , while the opening downhill and super-G set for Val D'Isere , France , on Dec. 3-4 were also wiped out .
APW_ENG_19941202.0154;9	The two speed races and another downhill scheduled for Val Gardena , Italy , are still looking for a location .

APW_ENG_19941202.0154;13	while races in Austria later in December are in jeopardy if snow does not come soon .

APW_ENG_19941202.0154;15	One of the favorites is Kjetil-Andre Aamodt of Norway , who won the overall World Cup last year by more than 300 points over five-time champion Marc Girardelli , the Austrian-born skier who competes for Luxembourg .

APW_ENG_19941202.0155;0	A group of Beijing Christians subjected to weeks of government harassment issued an appeal Friday to believers worldwide for prayer and support .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;1	`` We call on brothers and sisters in Christ to pray for us , members of the -LRB- church -RRB- body who have suffered abuse , and to be concerned about how the situation develops , '' said the written appeal given to The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;2	It was signed by six Christians who have been active in recent months in urging their church to defy government attempts to remove their senior pastor , Yang Yudong .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;3	Yang , the aging pastor of Gangwashi church , the most popular in Beijing , has long irritated the government with his pro-democracy views and his attempts to distance himself and his congregation from government supervision .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;4	For the second time in two years , the government has had to back down from sacking Yang in the face of opposition from church members , who last year threatened street protests and this year sought international media attention .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;5	The appeal said eight church members have been constantly tailed by plainclothes police since mid-November .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;6	On Nov. 23 , one of them , Liu Fenggang , was beaten and kicked in the face and knocked to the ground by plainclothes police .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;7	Photos showed his jacket ripped from waist to armpit and his face swollen and bruised .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;8	On the same day , Hua Huiqi , also was attacked by plainclothes police , who insulted his beliefs and said they were singling out Christians to beat up , the appeal said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;9	`` What is the crime in believing in the Lord ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;10	The Nov. 23 incidents were not the first clashes between church members and police and government religious officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;11	In recent months , there have been several scuffles at the church over government attempts to dismiss Yang and over a room in the church compound that the government took over for its own use .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;12	Official statistics say there are 7 million to 8 million Christians in China who worship in government-approved churches , but estimates of the number of members of underground churches run from 30 million to 50 million .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;13	Officially , freedom of religion of religion is protected by China 's constitution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;14	In reality religious believers are frequently subjected to official persecution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;15	Many Catholic clergy , Protestant lay leaders and Tibetan Buddhists have been imprisoned and in some cases have died in prison because of their religious beliefs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;16	The People 's Daily , the Communist Party newspaper , on Friday reminded readers that party members are not supposed to believe in religion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;17	It said that in recent years , growing numbers of party members are turning to religion , which it characterized as a form of superstition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0155;18	It said the phenomenon was the result of slack ideological education .

APW_ENG_19941202.0156;1	Lawyer Pam Baker said some of the Vietnamese have been living in camps in this British colony since the early 1980s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0156;2	The 34 boat people , who are ethnic Chinese , are not considered Vietnamese nationals by Vietnam .

APW_ENG_19941202.0156;9	Refugee Concern said there are about 700 Vietnamese in Hong Kong who are not able to return home because of objections by Vietnam .

APW_ENG_19941202.0157;1	`` This is a day for particular celebration , '' GATT Director-General Peter Sutherland told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;2	`` The successful culmination of this debate proved that common sense still works . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;3	The U.S. Senate approved the GATT treaty by 76-24 votes late Thursday -- a much bigger margin than expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;4	The House of Representatives cleared the deal earlier in the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;5	Congressional approval , uncertain for weeks , was deemed crucial to the entry into force of the World Trade Organization Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;6	The new body will implement the new accord and have tougher powers than GATT to settle trade disputes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;7	`` I warmly welcome the vote by the U.S. Senate , '' said European Union Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan , Europe 's chief negotiator in the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;8	He said the 12-nation bloc would complete the approval process by Dec. 20 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;9	In Japan , Trade Minister Rytaro Hashimoto said U.S. ratification of the deal would encourage other countries to follow suit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;10	Japan 's powerful lower house of parliament passed the accord early Friday and it will now move to the upper house .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;11	This view was echoed by Hong Kong 's Director-General of Trade , Tony Miller .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;12	`` The world looks to the United States for leadership in promoting free trade under the multilateral regime , '' Miller said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;13	In Canberra , Austrlian Trade Minister Bob McMullan said the U.S. result was `` great news for Australia and the world economy generally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;14	Sutherland said he expected about 100 of GATT 's 124 member nations to ratify the trade accord by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;15	The agreement is considered the most ambitious attempt ever to free world trade and is expected to boost global income by dlrs 510 billion by the year 2005 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;16	It reduces customs duties on hundreds of thousands of products , liberalizes trade in service industries , protects against copyright theft and patent abuse and cuts protection of farm goods and textiles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;17	`` We will have a rules-based system that allows for the development of the world economy and provides an assurance of security , prosperity and reduction of tensions , '' Sutherland said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;18	` I celebrated last night , '' said the Irish lawyer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0157;19	`` It 's a triumph for the organization and the fact that people can react rationally . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0160;1	The anti-armor missiles landed just before meetings began with the top U.N. official for former Yugoslavia , Yasushi Akashi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;2	Akashi , on a mission to free hundreds of peacekeepers and end restrictions on U.N. relief convoys , was to talk later with the Serbs , who refused to even meet with his boss , U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , on Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;3	After the rebuff , Boutros-Ghali warned that the intransigence of the warring sides in Bosnia threatened to force the United Nations to end its mission there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;4	The United Nations has pressing issues to discuss : attempts to calm fighting in northwest Bosnia , where Serbs forces have overrun Muslim villages in a U.N.-desigated `` safe area '' ; and the fate of more than 400 U.N. soldiers being held by the Serbs as insurance against NATO air strikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;5	Akashi arrived this morning in Sarajevo for meetings with officials of the Muslim-led Bosnian government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;6	He left the presidency building briefly before the meetings began and the two missiles hit the structure just before he returned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;7	A third wire-guided anti-armor missile hit a building nearby .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;8	There were no immediate reports of injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;9	After the meetings with the government , Akashi was to head for talks at Bosnian Serb headquarters in Pale , outside Sarajevo .

APW_ENG_19941202.0160;11	A U.N. source said Karadzic promised to try to help , but added that such promises often are empty .

APW_ENG_19941202.0160;13	Thant said Bihac , scene of heavy fighting for weeks , was quiet overnight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;14	But strong Serb forces , which have seized 30 percent to 40 percent of the U.N.-declared `` safe zone '' encompassing the town of Bihac and its environs , remained in the area .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;15	The United Nations has said that ethnic Serbs from Croatia and Bosnia appeared strong enough to capture Bihac if they wanted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;16	There were signs that frontlines south of Bihac were also heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;17	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces against the Serbs , claimed they captured three villages north of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;18	A Croat militia and the Bosnian army took the town from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;19	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Croatian Serb forces also had shelled his forces across the border near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;20	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;21	Seven more peacekeepers were seized Tuesday from an observation post in Croatia , across the border from Bihac , a U.N. spokesman said Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;22	Bosnian Serb units entered Croatia and took the Ukrainian soldiers and a U.N. armored carrier back into Bosnia , the spokesman , Alexander Ivanko , said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;23	More than 400 U.N. soldiers are being detained by the Serbs to deter NATO air raids .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;24	NATO struck three times last week , but the attacks did nothing to stop the Serb assault on Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;25	The Serbs also have been refusing to let U.N. relief convoys pass through Serb-held territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;26	Monique Tuffelli , a staffer with the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees in Bihac , said Thursday that food stocks would last only another week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;27	`` We have run out almost of everything , '' she said in a telephone interview with The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;28	The Serbs repeatedly have rejected an international peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;29	With the threat of international force appearing to dissipate , their position is hardening .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;30	Momcilo Krajisnik , leader of the Bosnian Serbs ' self-proclaimed legislature , rejected a three-month truce , which the Bosnian government wants .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;31	He said Serbs would only accept a permanent cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;32	The Sarajevo government fears a permanent cease-fire would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;33	The peace plan the Serbs rejected would give them 49 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;34	Senior Western officials now talk of altering that plan to allow the Bosnian Serbs links with Serb-dominated Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0160;35	Opponents say that would be a step toward creation of Serb nationalists ' goal of a `` Greater Serbia . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0161;3	They have maintained independent sales operations .

APW_ENG_19941202.0161;5	`` The two companies thought they could remain in business by taking a defensive position and sharing . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0161;6	That 's no longer necessary , and both want to return to being competitors , as they are in other nations around the world , he said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0162;0	Indonesia plans to introduce new labor laws providing stiffer penalties for violators and better protection for workers , a senior official said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;1	`` The government is fully aware that the current penalties for violation of labor laws are too lenient , '' said Suwarto , the director general of guidance and control in the Manpower Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;2	He told The Associated Press that a draft of the new laws has been submitted to President Suharto 's office .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;3	He did not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;4	Although the government has admitted its poor record in labor conditions in the past , little has been done to improve them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;5	Earlier this year the United States threatened to withdraw trade privileges to Indonesia if it did n't improve working conditions and wages for workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;6	The present legislation sets a maximum of three months ' imprisonment and a fine of 100,000 rupiahs -LRB- dlrs 45 -RRB- for employers who do not pay their workers the minimum wage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;7	The government raised the legal minimum wage to 3,800 rupiahs -LRB- dlrs 1.7 -RRB- a day in January this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;8	The new laws will provide more legal protection for workers and guarantee their safety `` so that they will be encouraged to increase productivity , '' Suwarto said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;9	The new laws are to cover the wage system , labor unions , manpower , social insurance , work leave as well as workers ' health , safety and education .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;10	He said 12 of the 95 companies that violated labor laws this year have been prosecuted , most of them either for violating minimum wage regulations or for failure to provide mandatory social insurance , overtime payment , work leave and safe working environments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;11	Their punishments ranged from fines of 75,000 rupiahs -LRB- dlrs 34 -RRB- to 750,000 rupiahs -LRB- dlrs 344 -RRB- or jail terms of three months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0162;12	The remaining 83 companies are expected to be tried soon , said Suwarto .

APW_ENG_19941202.0166;1	The divers , making the first human surveillance of the wreck , intend to scrutizine the condition of the ship , which is resting on its side in 56-84 meters -LRB- 180-280 feet -RRB- of water off Finland 's southwestern coast , the news agency TT reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;2	`` The weather conditions are good .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;3	The weather wo n't hinder the work , '' Swedish maritime administration spokesman Lars-Goeran Bronow told TT .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;4	The divers are to gather evidence to help authorities decide the feasibility of retreiving the bodies or taking some other action to preserve them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;5	More than 800 bodies are believed entombed in the wreck , although officials have said they may never know the exact number because of unreliable passenger lists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;6	According to the latest official count , 136 people survived and 913 died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;7	Only 94 bodies have bee recovered .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;8	Swedish authorities were focusing on three options , none of which included raising the entire wreck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;9	Divers could scour the wreck to retreive the bodies they find , or could do that plus flip it over using cables to find more bodies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;10	The last alternative would be leaving all the bodies and filling the wreck with sand to `` bury '' the victims and protect the wreck from scavengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;11	The divers are using a large , floating research platform called SEMI 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;12	The work was scheduled to begin Wednesday , but was delayed due to poor conditions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0166;13	The Swedish government , meanwhile , said Friday it has decided to give 3 million kronor -LRB- dlrs 417,000 -RRB- to organizations helping victims ' families , in many cases including orphans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;0	The passage of a world trade pact by the U.S. Congress is a `` triumph '' that will help make the world a more prosperous place , the head of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;1	`` This is a day for particular celebration , '' GATT Director-General Peter Sutherland told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;2	`` The successful culmination of this debate proved that common sense still works . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;3	The U.S. Senate approved the GATT treaty by 76-24 votes late Thursday -- a much bigger margin than expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;4	The House of Representatives cleared the deal earlier in the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;5	Congressional approval , uncertain for weeks , was deemed crucial for the the World Trade Organization to take effect on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;6	The WTO will implement the new accord and have more powers than GATT to settle trade disputes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;7	`` I warmly welcome the vote by the U.S. Senate , '' said European Union Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan , Europe 's chief negotiator in the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;8	He said the 12-nation bloc would complete the approval process by Dec. 20 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;9	In Japan , Trade Minister Rytaro Hashimoto said U.S. ratification of the deal would encourage other countries to follow suit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;10	Japan 's powerful lower house of parliament passed the accord early Friday and it will now move to the upper house .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;11	This view was echoed by Hong Kong 's Director-General of Trade , Tony Miller .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;12	`` The world looks to the United States for leadership in promoting free trade under the multilateral regime , '' Miller said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;13	In Canberra , Australian Trade Minister Bob McMullan said the U.S. result was `` great news for Australia and the world economy generally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;14	Sutherland said he expected about 100 of GATT 's 124 member nations to ratify the trade accord by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;15	The agreement is considered the most ambitious attempt ever to knock down barriers to free world trade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;16	The pact is expected to boost global income by dlrs 510 billion by the year 2005 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;17	It reduces customs duties on hundreds of thousands of products , liberalizes trade in service industries , protects against copyright theft and patent abuse and cuts protection of farm goods and textiles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0167;18	`` We will have a rules-based system that allows for the development of the world economy and provides an assurance of security , prosperity and reduction of tensions , '' Sutherland said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;0	Police arrested 11,000 people headed toward Bhopal Friday for a demonstration marking the 10th anniversary of the world 's worst industrial accident , organizers said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;1	The people were taken off trains at stations outside Bhopal in central India and charged with traveling without tickets -- a common practice in India usually punishable by a fine or a few hours in jail .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;2	`` Shame on you , government , '' said Abdul Jabbar Khan , of the Gas Victims Organization .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;3	On Dec. 2 , 1984 , a cloud of toxic chemicals leaked from a pesticide plant owned by the Indian subsidiary of the U.S.-based Union Carbide Corp.
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;4	About 4,000 people died that night , and 3,000 more deaths were later attributed to the effects of the gas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;5	A half-million people are still seeking compensation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;6	Chief Minister Digvijay Singh , chief executive of Madhya Pradesh state , acknowledged that many people were arrested on trains heading toward the city .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;7	But Singh could not confirm the number arrested and said he was not sure the arrests were related to the anniversary rally .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;8	Tens of thousands of people travel without tickets on Indian railroads every day , but few are caught and arrested .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;9	Khan led a march of 3,000 people from a city park to a square near the state legislature today .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;10	Police barricaded the roads and red police vans patrolled the area .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;11	The city administration banned the protesters from assembling around the legislature .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;12	Khan said his group planned a bigger demonstration Saturday and called for a one-day strike in the city .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;13	He said his main demand was clearing the logjam that has blocked compensation for the victims .
APW_ENG_19941202.0168;14	Bhopal is located 740 kilometers -LRB- 460 miles -RRB- south of New Delhi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;0	Melissa Selosia , one of the survivors of a ferry that sank Friday in Manila Bay , killing at least 34 people , escaped by remembering her seaman husband 's advice on what to do in an accident at sea .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;1	The ferry Cebu City sank quickly after colliding in Manila Bay with a large freighter , the Singapore-registered Kota Suria , barely two hours after setting out for the southern Philippines before dawn .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;2	At least 451 of the ferry 's approximately 600 passengers and crew members survived .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;3	`` I was jolted by the crash and I woke up , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;4	`` Immediately , I grabbed a life jacket and made for the upper deck and then I jumped into the water . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;5	`` I remembered what my husband told me -- to swim away from a sinking boat or else I would be sucked in by the water as it goes down . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;6	She wept in a tearful reunion with her husband , her sister and a brother at coast guard headquarters in Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;7	They had heard radio reports of the accident just hours after they sent her off at Manila harbor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;8	Mrs. Selosia was on her way to Ozamis City on Mindanao Island , 775 kilometers -LRB- 485 miles -RRB- south of Manila , to join her four children for Christmas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;9	Her husband , Presencio , was to leave for Japan on Dec. 10 for ship duty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;10	Erwin Maravilla , one of the first survivors plucked from the sea by a navy patrol , was less fortunate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;11	His wife and two children were missing after they were sucked underwater as the ship slipped into the dark sea .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;12	`` A piece of metal hit my arm and I lost hold of my children , '' Maravilla said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;13	Most of the survivors clambered onto the Kota Suria while it remained next to the ferry as it was listing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;14	The survivors said the Cebu City remained afloat for about 15 minutes before it rolled to the left and sank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;15	Many of the passengers from the lower decks were bathed in oil that gushed out of the engine room .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;16	`` It was every man for himself , '' said Danny Dalugdog , a 24-year-old driver and bodyguard for a job recruiter in Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;17	In the confusion , he said he was separated from his wife , Liza , and his 3-month-old baby , Dennis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;18	`` I thought they were gone , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;19	But he found his wife on the freighter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;20	Then , as they transferred to a coast guard ship to return to Manila , a passenger called out that he found a baby boy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0170;21	`` It turned out to be my son , '' Dalugdog said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;0	Congressional clearance of a new world trade accord is expected to encourage ratification by other countries , enabling the mammoth export-boosting pact to enter into force as planned Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;1	Around the world , big and small nations alike are trying to rush the 22,000 page GATT agreement through national parliaments , often in low-key processes that contrast with the rocky ride through the U.S. legislature .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;2	Nearly 40 countries , including the United States and most of southeast Asia , have ratified the 124-nation pact .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;3	About 40 more -- including trade giants Japan , the European Union and Canada -- have indicated they will do so by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;4	Four countries -- Switzerland , Liechtenstein , Cyprus and Poland -- have already told the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade that domestic politics will prevent them from ratifying the accord this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;5	But this wo n't stop the pact from taking effect as scheduled on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;6	All that is needed is for the all the big traders to come on board as founding members of the World Trade Organization -- GATT 's more powerful successor body that implement the accord .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;7	The agreement is considered the most ambitious attempt ever to liberalize world trade and is expected to boost global income by dlrs 510 billion by the year 2005 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;8	Most governments object to at least some provisions because previously protected industries -- such as agriculture in Europe and textiles in the United States -- will suffer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;9	But all participating countries agreed not to upset the carefully crafted compromises with amendments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;10	The ratification situation in some of the main trading nations is as follows : -- European Union : Britain , Ireland , Greece , Germany amd Luxembourg have approved it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;11	The seven other EU members are meant to do so before foreign ministers meet Dec. 19-20 to approve the deal on behalf of the entire trade bloc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;12	France and Portugal still have some qualms , but the EU Commission , the union 's executive body , said there are no real obstacles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;13	An internal dispute between the Commission and member states over negotiating powers , which slowed national ratification , has been settled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;14	-- Japan : Japan 's powerful lower house has approved the deal , and passage through the upper house is virtually certain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;15	The government placated rice farmers , upset at potential competition from imports , with a six-year , 7.2 trillion yen -LRB- dlrs 74 billion -RRB- compensation package .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;16	-- South Korea : The ruling Democratic Liberal party , which has a big majority , plans to push the accord through the national assembly next week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;17	Opposition politicians and farmers accuse the government of making too many concessions under U.S. pressure to open the rice market .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;18	There have been frequent violent demonstrations against the accord .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;19	-- India : There was strong opposition from both left - and right-wing parties , especially to provisions that give foreign multinationals stronger patent claims to Indian seeds and medicines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;20	The opposition , however , seems to have run out of steam and legislative passage appears more or less certain , though no date has been set .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;21	-- Canada : Hopes to ratify the accord by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;22	-- Mexico : Under former President Salinas de Gortari , who is one of three candidates for the directorship of the WTO , Mexico was one of the first countries to ratify the trade accord .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;23	-- South America : Chile has ratified the accord and Argentina hopes to do so before the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;24	In Brazil , parliamentary passage is likely to be in February , not because the accord is contested but because of delays caused by this year 's election .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;25	-- China : In order to join the WTO , Beijing first has to enter GATT .
APW_ENG_19941202.0172;26	Western concerns about China 's market reform programs and a possible flood of Chinese exports mean GATT membership talks are unlikely to finish by the end of the year .

APW_ENG_19941202.0173;1	Don Reid , speaking to reporters at London 's Heathrow Airport , said he was driving in a six-truck convoy run by two charities , ActionAid and Assist , when they were stopped at a checkpoint near the Rutshuru refugee camp in Zaire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;2	`` The next thing I knew was there were two Zairean soldiers on the inside of my truck , '' said Reid , 43 , a former soldier in the British army .
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;3	`` Immediately , in a second , they started firing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;4	All hell broke loose ... I got out of the truck and just ran like hell . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;5	He said the atmosphere in the camps before the shooting was particularly tense with rumors that a Zairean businessman had been robbed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;6	ActionAid said it would have to withdraw without better protection .
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;7	`` For weeks now we have been warning the British government and the Foreign Office that something like this was going to happen , '' said the charity 's international director , Nigel Twosee .
APW_ENG_19941202.0173;8	Reid said `` there should be some sort of protection for people on the ground . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0174;0	Japan 's economy grew at a healthy 3.7 percent annual rate in the July-September quarter , the government announced Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;1	It was the latest sign that the world 's second-largest economy may be getting back on track .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;2	The 0.9 percent quarter-to-quarter growth in Japan 's gross domestic product , a broad indicator of what a country produces within its own borders , prompted the government 's Economic Planning Agency to predict a `` full-scale recovery '' by the end of the current fiscal year next March .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;3	Private economists remained somewhat more cautious , however , saying the fast pace of expansion may not last and that structural drags on the economy , including mountains of bad debt , may hold Japan 's recovery to a slow pace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;4	Still , positive signs have been spreading .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;5	Despite the record-high yen , many export-related companies , including electronics giants , have been reporting higher earnings for the first half of the fiscal year through September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;6	Also , a survey of 200 top firms released Friday by Japan 's leading economic newspaper , the Nikkei , predicted a 4.3 percent uptick in pretax profits at those firms for the current fiscal year , followed by an 18.1 percent increase in the next fiscal year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;7	But in another sign that the recovery may remain modest , the survey also showed that even after those two years of higher profits , earnings will still be just 60 percent of their peak in 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;8	EPA Vice Minister Tsutomu Tanaka told reporters that consumer spending grew strongly during the latest quarter , thanks to a one-year income tax cut this June as well as a summer heat wave .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;9	The record heat triggered a surge in spending on everything from beer to beach wear .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;10	Tanaka said it 's still difficult to predict how strongly the Japanese economy will grow , noting that the yen 's strength and the pace of growth in spending by companies , known as capital outlays , must both be watched .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;11	The strong growth in the July-September quarter followed a relatively mild 0.2 percent expansion in the April-June quarter , which works out to 0.7 percent growth at an annual pace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;12	The surprising 0.5 percent upturn in capital outlays was seen as a particularly good sign .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;13	It was the first quarter-on-quarter growth in three years in corporate investment in plant and equipment , which accounts for roughly 20 percent of GDP .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;14	Such spending but has been depressed in recent years as companies retreated from the heavy investments made during the late 1980s , putting a drag on economic growth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;15	But private analysts say it 's doubtful that the strong gains in consumer and corporate spending can be sustained during the current quarter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;16	The report definitely points to recovery , but `` let 's not get carried away , '' said Mineko Sasaki-Smith , senior economist with Morgan Stanley Japan Ltd.
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;17	The scenario of a gradual upturn still remains most likely , she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;18	Another positive sign has been the steady improvement in business sentiment this year as measured in the closely watched `` tankan , '' a quarterly report issued by the central bank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;19	Many analysts are expecting another improvement in sentiment in the report due out Dec. 9 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0174;20	Pessimism continues to outweigh optimism , but the gap between them has been narrowing since March , when sentiment improved for the first time in 41\/2 years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;0	NATO foreign ministers sought Friday to reassure Russia that their plans for admitting former Warsaw Pact foes would n't create a new division in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;1	But Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev maintained for a second day his strong opposition to a NATO plan for drawing up conditions for adding new members in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;2	He told a joint meeting of NATO and East European foreign ministers that Moscow could not develop close ties with the alliance until it spelled out its expansion plans , alliances sources said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;3	Kozyrev , they said , questioned whether the Western military alliance had changed from its Cold War days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;4	On Thursday , the Russian stunned NATO ministers by his last-minute refusal to agree to a special cooperation program with the alliance to protest the decision to prepare for a future expansion to the East .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;5	NATO ministers sought to play down Kozyrev 's outburst .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;6	`` We should n't make too much of yesterday 's events , '' U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher told CBS ' `` This Morning '' program .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;7	`` -LRB- The -RRB- Russians will have a chance to analyze what we did ... I think they 'll find it to be responsible and deliberate . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;8	Christopher met separately with Kozyrev for more than an hour Friday to discuss the dispute as well as the situation in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;9	`` I think that will all get sorted out ... How soon I do n't know , '' said British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;10	He said ties between Moscow and NATO were `` too important to be lost . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;11	Willy Claes , secretary-general of the 16-nation North Atlantic Treaty Organization , opened the formal session by saying : `` The division of Europe has ended .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;12	We have worked ... to ensure that it never returns . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;13	Kozyrev 's comments cast a pall over the two-day meeting and over NATO 's attempt to draw its former Warsaw Pact enemies into its alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;14	However , some diplomats suggested he was playing to an audience back in Russia , where the government is contending with a strong nationalist opposition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;15	`` The Russians have their internal situation ... This is all a little bit more complicated , '' said German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;16	Other East European nations welcomed the NATO decision to start the process that could lead to them joining the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;17	`` This is an important milestone on the road to an undivided Europe , '' said Poland 's foreign minister , Andrzej Olechowski .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;18	He said NATO and former communist states should work to overcome Russian `` misinterpretation '' of NATO .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;19	`` We do n't see -LRB- NATO -RRB- as a war machine , so we do n't see how anyone could be concerned , '' Olechowski told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;20	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would go with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;21	The Russian outburst pushed , at least temporarily , the crisis in Bosnia off the ministers ' agenda .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;22	Christopher , Hurd , Kinkel and Kozyrev were meeting later in the day with French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe to try to revive the peace process in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;23	Christopher wants formal approval from the others for a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;24	It calls for a cease-fire around Bihac , the northwestern Muslim enclave that Serbs are pummeling , a pledge to cease hostilities throughout the country for three to six months and then an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;25	The lure for the Serbs , who control about 70 percent of Bosnia , is an opportunity to press their demand for cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;26	Juppe and Hurd may fly to Belgrade this weekend to push the initiative .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;27	The NATO allies , in trying to meet East Europeans demands for membership without upsetting a militarily powerful Russia , thought they had found a good formula .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;28	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , to bring former foes closer , but without membership .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;29	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;30	On Thursday , the allies decided to go further by ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the terms and conditions for expanding the Western military alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;31	To overcome Russian objections to its eastward expansion , NATO had agreed to a special relationship with Moscow and insisted they had no intention of forming a hostile bloc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;32	But Kozyrev was n't impressed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0176;33	`` If the strategy of NATO has changed , then that is something which requires further discussion , '' Kozyrev told grim-faced NATO ministers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;0	Activists called Friday for an end to violence against women in Asia , which they said ranges from harassment in the workplace to forced prostitution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;1	More than 100 people -- most of them Asian -- made the call at the end of a two-day Asian Women 's Tribunal aimed at promoting the human rights of a gender often discriminated against in this largely male-dominated region .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;2	`` It is very easy for a Thai soldier or a Thai policeman to rape a woman , '' said Nimalka Fernando of Sri Lanka , the human rights coordinator of the Asia-Pacific Forum on Women , Law and Development .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;3	`` So long as people have the attitude that women are seen as the property of men , violence will continue , '' added Salbiah Ahmad of Nepal , a member of the same group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;4	The meeting issued a declaration painting a grim picture of the treatment of women in Asia , with reports of migrant workers in a number of countries being sexually abused and Indonesian women being forced to undergo inspections to claim the menstrual leave provided them by law .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;5	Indian Clarence J. Dias , of the International Center for Law in Development , said violence results from the insecurity of men and the pervasiveness of violence on television shows .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;6	`` Everywhere , people are getting the message , ` You are weak if you do n't use violence , ' '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;7	The meeting called for the criminalization of all acts leading to the sexual slavery of women , holding governments accountable for their failure to protect the human rights of women , and the development of social safety nets to protect the human rights of women .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;8	`` Some violence will always be there , '' Dias added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0177;9	`` But hopefully it will change from the violence of the oppressor to the violence of the oppressed when women begin to fight back and begin to say that this must end . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;0	An SS concentration camp commander serving a life term for killing 650 Jewish slave laborers was indicted Friday on 144 new charges of murder and abetting murder .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;1	Josef Schwammberger , 82 , who sicked his dog on inmates and shot a rabbi for refusing to work on a Jewish holiday , was sentenced in May 1992 in the last major Nazi trial in Germany .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;2	Prosecutor Kurt Schrimm said the new indictment stemmed from evidence that had surfaced since Schwammberger 's earlier trial , and included mass executions and the the murder of individual prisoners by Schwammberger himself .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;3	During the earlier trial , Schwammberger admitted running the forced labor camps of Rozwadow , Mielec and Przemysl , all in Poland , between 1942 and 1944 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;4	But he denied killing anyone and said he could n't remember many of the events that were discussed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;5	Despite Schwammberger 's age , Schrimm said , the court has the duty to punish him for every crime it can prove .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;6	Austrian-born Schwammberger fled to Argentina in 1948 , and was extradited in 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0179;7	Earlier this year , Simon Wiesenthal , the Austrian Nazi-hunter , said that with the apparent death of SS commander Alois Brunner in Syria in 1992 , it was unlikely any other major Nazis would be captured or prosecuted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;0	A 13-year-old Japanese boy hanged himself in his back yard after being bullied by classmates into giving them more than 1 million yen -LRB- dlrs 10,000 -RRB- over three years , reports said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;1	In a four-page suicide note , Kiyoteru Okouchi said a group of four classmates at Tobu Junior High School had been abusing him and extorting money from him for three years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;2	His body was found Sunday night hanging from a tree at his home in Nishio , about 270 kilometers -LRB- 170 miles -RRB- west of Tokyo , local police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;3	Police would not say how much money Okouchi handed over after the other students repeatedly hit him and dunked his head in a river , but news reports said the total came to 1.1 million yen -LRB- dlrs 11,000 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;4	He took the money from his parents ' house without permission and left a note addressed to his mother acknowledging the debt , Kyodo News Service said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;5	In a section of the note read on an evening news program , Okouchi detailed the way his classmates beat him and forced him to give them money , and said his happiest times were at home .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;6	`` To my family , thank you so much , '' he wrote .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;7	`` I 'm going away now . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;8	Bullying remains frequent at Japan 's regimented schools .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;9	Typical targets are children with outstanding grades , physical handicaps , foreign upbringing , or who otherwise do n't conform .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;10	Some students choose suicide rather than continue to face bullying .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;11	Last year , 113 students between the ages of 10 and 19 committed suicide for school-related problems such as bullying and severe punishments from teachers , according to a National Police Agency report .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;12	About the same amount was reported in 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;13	A total of 23,258 cases of bullying were reported in public schools in 1992 , up from 22,062 cases reported in 1991 , according to the most recent figures available from the Education Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;14	`` For him , suicide was no doubt the most severe form of retaliation possible , '' said Susumu Abe , a noted critic on educational issues .
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;15	`` Japanese children are not given enough instruction about the constraints they should put on their actions toward others . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0180;16	In Japan , children under age of 16 do not face criminal prosecution and are tried only in family courts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;0	An SS concentration camp commander serving a life term for killing 650 Jewish slave laborers was indicted Friday on 144 new charges of murder and abetting murder .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;1	Josef Schwammberger , 82 , who sicked his dog on inmates and shot a rabbi for refusing to work on a Jewish holiday , was sentenced in May 1992 in the last major Nazi trial in Germany .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;2	Prosecutor Kurt Schrimm said the new indictment stemmed from evidence that had surfaced since Schwammberger 's earlier trial , and included mass executions and the the murder of individual prisoners by Schwammberger himself .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;3	During the earlier trial , Schwammberger admitted running the forced labor camps of Rozwadow , Mielec and Przemysl , all in Poland , between 1942 and 1944 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;4	But he denied killing anyone and said he could n't remember many of the events that were discussed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;5	Despite Schwammberger 's age , Schrimm said , the court has the duty to punish him for every crime it can prove .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;6	Austrian-born Schwammberger fled to Argentina in 1948 , and was extradited in 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0181;7	Earlier this year , Simon Wiesenthal , the Austrian Nazi-hunter , said that with the apparent death of SS commander Alois Brunner in Syria in 1992 , it was unlikely any other major Nazis would be captured or prosecuted .

APW_ENG_19941202.0183;0	Swedish divers on Friday planned to survey the wreck of the sunken ferry Estonia , a Baltic Sea tomb for an estimated 800 victims of the tragedy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;1	The divers , making the first human surveillance of the wreck , intend to scrutizine the condition of the ship , which is resting on its side in 56-84 meters -LRB- 180-280 feet -RRB- of water off Finland 's southwestern coast , the news agency TT reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;2	`` The weather conditions are good .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;3	The weather wo n't hinder the work , '' Swedish maritime administration spokesman Lars-Goran Bronow told TT .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;4	The divers were to gather evidence to help authorities decide the feasibility of retrieving the bodies or taking some other action to preserve them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;5	More than 800 bodies are believed entombed in the wreck , although officials have said they may never know the exact number because of unreliable passenger lists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;6	Of the estimated 1,049 on the ferry when it sank , 137 survived , according to official figures published Friday by the Finnish police .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;7	Only 94 bodies have been recovered .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;8	Swedish authorities were focusing on three options , none of which included raising the entire wreck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;9	Divers could scour the wreck to retrieve the bodies they find , or could do that plus flip it over using cables to find more bodies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;10	The last alternative would be leaving all the bodies and filling the wreck with sand to `` bury '' the victims and protect the wreck from scavengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;11	The divers are using a large , floating research platform called SEMI 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;12	The work was scheduled to begin Wednesday , but was delayed due to poor conditions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0183;13	The Swedish government , meanwhile , said Friday it has decided to give 3 million kronor -LRB- dlrs 417,000 -RRB- to organizations helping victims ' families , in many cases including orphans .

APW_ENG_19941202.0187;0	Searchers recovered 34 bodies from a ferry that sank before dawn Friday with more than 600 people on board after colliding with a Singapore-registered freighter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;1	Frogmen said more bodies were trapped inside the ship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;2	Lt. Comdr. Amado Samante , the coast guard spokesman , said at least 451 people on the 2,452-ton Cebu City survived the collision with the 12,500-ton Kota Suria , which is five times bigger , as the ferry was about to sail out of Manila Bay .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;3	The search for the remaining passengers was called off late in the day because of darkness and was to resume Saturday morning .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;4	`` There were more bodies inside the cabins , '' said Seaman Angel Espidido , one of 27 coast guard divers who joined navy frogmen in recovering bodies trapped inside the ferry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;5	Espidido said he could see the bodies through portholes but the divers were unable to open the doors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;6	`` Tomorrow we will go back to unlock them , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;7	Seaman Hermogenes Guilaran said he recovered the bodies of two elderly women and a boy who were trapped at a railing on the side of the ferry which was lying under 90 feet -LRB- 27 meters -RRB- of water .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;8	William Lines , the ferry operator , said the ship was carrying 608 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;9	There was no immediate official report on the cause of the accident , but the ferry 's owner claimed it had been rammed by the Kota Suria .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;10	Eugene Espedido , a vice president of the company , said it was preparing a request for the coast guard to detain the freighter and its crew .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;11	Jacob Cabatuan , a crewman on the ferry , said the Kota Suria 's bow crashed into the Cebu City , destroying the bridge and ripping a one-meter -LRB- three-foot -RRB- hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;12	He said ship captain Wesceslao Lampong and several other officers were pinned on the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;13	The Kota Suria , with a crew of 30 , had its bow badly dented but joined the rescue effort , plucking 230 of those saved .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;14	President Fidel Ramos ordered an investigation into the cause of the accident , which occurred in calm seas under clear night skies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;15	Samante said about 50 coast guard , navy and commercial sea vessels were involved in the search effort .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;16	William Lines said the Cebu City had a capacity of 800 passengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;17	It sank near the town of Rosario , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 35 miles -RRB- southwest of Manila in Cavite province .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;18	It had left the port of Manila bound for Tagbilaran , the capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;19	Quirimon Tan , William Lines vice president , said each of the dead passengers was covered by 50,000 pesos -LRB- dlrs 2,173 -RRB- in insurance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;20	He said the company would also pay for medical and funeral expenses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;21	In a quirk of timing , the Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday approved William Lines ' initial public stock offering .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;22	The company is selling 235 million shares for between 9.65 pesos -LRB- 41 U.S. cents -RRB- and 15.15 pesos -LRB- 65 cents -RRB- a share .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;23	An analyst who asked not to be named said the accident would probably not drag down the stock issue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0187;24	The Philippines ' worst peacetime ferry disaster was in December 1987 , when 4,341 people died in the collision of the ferry Dona Paz with the oil tanker Vector off Mindoro Island , about 130 kilometers -LRB- 80 miles -RRB- south of Manila .

APW_ENG_19941202.0192;0	In the harshest Dutch move yet to repulse a tidal wave of refugees , Parliament Friday authorized the government to automatically bar all asylum seekers arriving overland .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;1	The measure is aimed at stemming a flow of asylum seekers that has severely strained government resources and led to a rightist resurgence in May 's national elections .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;2	`` We do n't want to send people back to face danger , '' said spokesman Tom van der Maas for the right-wing Liberals , one of the three ruling coalition partners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;3	`` But we need to redirect this inflow of people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;4	It 's an effort to spread the burden throughout Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;5	`` This is an ugly law , '' countered Fronnie Biesma , spokesman for the Dutch Refugee Council .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;6	`` We are just transferring the responsibility to other countries . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;7	The legislation takes direct aim at the Netherlands ' international reputation as a safe haven for the persecuted , a label that this year will draw an estimated 55,000 asylum seekers to this nation of 15 million .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;8	The new law would bar any asylum seekers who had traveled through so-called `` safe third countries '' where they could have applied for asylum before reaching the Netherlands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;9	Virtually assured of becoming law , the legal stratagem is aimed primarily at the `` economic migrants '' who shuttle around Europe in search of the best residency and benefits deal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;10	In practice , the law will bar the vast majority of asylum seekers , who usually arrive overland by bus , car or train from neighboring Germany or Belgium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;11	Relatively few come by airplane or ship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;12	The new law would bar people like 26-year-old Babak Alighorian who left his family back in Iran and applied for political asylum here in April 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;13	`` This is not good , '' said Alighorian , who arrived in the Netherlands after traveling through Turkey , Bulgaria , Romania , Hungary , Austria , and Germany by car and by bus .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;14	Under the new measure , Alighorian would have been turned back to Germany .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;15	Instead he got a one-year residency permit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;16	While rejected asylum seekers will still have the right of appeal in civil courts , it is unclear how long that would take and whether the government would support them pending a ruling .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;17	Friday 's lower house passage virtually guarantees upper house approval by early next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;18	A list of safe countries will be drawn up by the Justice Ministry once the measure becomes law .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;19	The Dutch measure is a direct response to a similar law passed by the German government last year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;20	`` Since Germany approved the return of refugees to the safe third country , the number of asylum seekers there has decreased tremendously , while in the Netherlands the number has significantly increased , '' the Justice Ministry said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;21	Before the Dutch government began clamping down on asylum applicants in recent years , the country had one of Europe 's most liberal asylum policies and a generous benefit package to match .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;22	But with a new get-tough policy in place since last year , new `` flying squads '' of immigration officers are now policing the border and two asylum centers opened near the German and Belgian borders this fall to turn away bogus applicants .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;23	As of October , the Justice Ministry has received 44,492 asylum applications this year , a rise of more than 16,500 over the same period in 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0192;24	The cost to shelter and feed them will be about 1.6 billion guilders -LRB- dlrs 909 million -RRB- this year , according to the National Center for Asylum Seekers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0193;0	Yasser Arafat and an Islamic leader formed a committee Friday to work out differences and prevent violence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0193;1	Both hailed it as a start to ending two weeks of tension following bloody clashes in the Gaza Strip .
APW_ENG_19941202.0193;2	Israel has demanded that Arafat crack down on the Islamic Resistance Movement , or Hamas , which has claimed responsibility for attacks that have killed 32 Israelis since early October .

APW_ENG_19941202.0194;5	Both are based in Hong Kong .
APW_ENG_19941202.0194;6	Caterpillar has been selling its heavy equipment to China since 1975 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0194;7	It has entered 12 technology transfer agreements and has formed two manufacturing joint ventures in China .

APW_ENG_19941202.0197;0	Russian lawmakers who came to Chechnya to negotiate an end to a standoff with Moscow pointed fingers at their own government Friday , saying jets attacking the tiny republic are clearly Russian .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;1	President Boris Yeltsin 's government has denied providiny any military support to the Chechen rebels seeking to topple Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev , even as the rebel offensive has escalated from small arms fire to missiles and bombs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;2	Defense Minister Pavel Grachev says mercenaries are fighting on both sides .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;3	Dudayev , however , who declared independence for his Caucasus Mountain republic in 1991 , flatly accuses Moscow of leading and arming the opposition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;4	Meanwhile , air raids on the outskirts of Grozny , the Chechen capital , continued Friday for a fourth day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;5	`` It is clear that these planes are not English or French but Russian , '' said Ella Pamfilova , a member of parliament and Yeltsin 's former social welfare minister .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;6	`` This is against the law . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;7	Other members of the four-person parliamentary delegation , which has met briefly with Dudayev , also called for an end to the air strikes , warning the conflict could spiral out of control .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;8	The group is specifically trying to negotiate the release of about 70 Russians -- including , allegedly , some Army soldiers and officers -- who were captured in the fighting in Chechnya , a mostly Muslim republic in southern Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;9	Dudayev at first threatened to kill the prisoners , but later said they would be tried in court .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;10	Since the rebels ' air offensive began last week , thousands of people have fled Grozny , a city of 300,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;11	Chechen officials said there was another round of air raids early Friday east of Grozny , including one at Shali , home to a tank regiment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;12	On Thursday , a small airfield near Grozny was hit and four people died in a missile attack at Katayama , about 20 kilometers -LRB- 12 miles -RRB- from Grozny , where Dudayev lives .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;13	Dudayev said his home was bombed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;14	An old bus also was hit by shrapnel , and its floor was covered with sawdust Friday to soak up blood .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;15	`` We saw two planes fly over this morning , '' the commander of the airfield , Biali Chimayev , said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;16	`` We 're expecting another attack . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;17	The raids have destroyed a number of aircraft at civilian and military airports .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;18	Moscow does not recognize the independence of Chechnya , which became part of the Russian Empire in the 19th century after a series of long and bloody wars .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;19	Yeltsin threatened on Tuesday to send in troops unless the fighting had stopped by Thursday , but when the deadline expired he softened his stance , saying Chechen fighters would be given amnesty if they put down their weapons by Dec. 15 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;20	Still , there were media reports of Russian troop buildups near the border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;21	`` Chauvinist forces in Russian are pushing President Yeltsin to act , saying he can not control ` little ' Chechnya , '' warned Vladimir Lysenko , a member of the parliamentary delegation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;22	Although ultranationalists , like the flamboyant Vladimir Zhirinovsky , constantly lament the loss of Moscow 's empire , most Russians appear ready to let the Chechens go their own way .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;23	More than 74 percent of 3,250 people questioned in a new poll said Russia should recognize Chechnya 's independence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;24	Only 5.5 percent opposed it and 20.3 percent had no opinion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;25	The poll , released Thursday by the International Opinion Research Center , had a 1 percent margin of error .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;26	Although Chechens are at odds , they are united in their distrust of Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;27	Lysenko warned that the conflict is endangering the lives of as many as 150,000 ethnic Russians in Chechnya .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;28	In Copenhagen , a Russian journalist said Friday he received a fax from a group threatening Russians abroad if Moscow does not recognize Chechnya 's independence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;29	The threat was signed `` K.K.K.O. 130 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;30	year , '' which Danish police said might stand for the North Caucasian Liberation Army .
APW_ENG_19941202.0197;31	Police in Copenhagen said they heard the group has been active in other countries .

APW_ENG_19941202.0200;0	A former SS concentration camp commander serving a life term for killing 650 Jewish slave laborers was indicted Friday on 144 new charges of murder and abetting murder .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;1	Josef Schwammberger , 82 , who sicked his dog on inmates and shot a rabbi for refusing to work on a Jewish holiday , was sentenced in May 1992 in the last major Nazi trial in Germany .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;2	Prosecutor Kurt Schrimm said the new indictment stemmed from evidence that surfaced during Schwammberger 's earlier trial but could n't be introduced because it was n't included in the request for Schwammberger 's 1990 extradition from Argentina , where he fled in 1948 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;3	Schwammberger is accused of ordering mass executions and of murdering individual prisoners himself , Schrimm said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;4	During the earlier trial , Schwammberger admitted running the forced labor camps of Rozwadow , Mielec and Przemysl , all in Poland , between 1942 and 1944 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;5	But he denied killing anyone and said he could n't remember many of the events that were discussed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;6	Despite Schwammberger 's age , Schrimm said , the court has the duty to punish him for every crime it can prove .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;7	It could take six months for the judge to examine the charges and the defense 's likely objection to a new trial .
APW_ENG_19941202.0200;8	Earlier this year , Simon Wiesenthal , the Austrian Nazi-hunter , said that with the apparent death of SS commander Alois Brunner in Syria in 1992 , it was unlikely any other major Nazis would be captured or prosecuted .

APW_ENG_19941202.0201;1	The trial was adjourned until Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;2	There have been a string of adjournments since the men were arrested Sept. 13 for slaying Louise Jensen , a 23-year-old tour guide from Hirthshals , northern Denmark , after kidnapping her .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;3	Friday 's move followed a ruling by the three-judge court in this south coast resort city that it was competent to hear arguments on a defense motion for dismissal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;4	The defense claims the confiscation of confidential notes the men had written for their lawyers by a guard in Nicosia 's Central prison , the only one on the east Mediterranean island , was illegal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;5	State prosecutor Petros Clerides asked for time to consult the attorney general and stressed that such a legal point has never been raised in Cyprus before .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;6	That opened the possibility the case will be referred to the Supreme Court , the republic 's highest court .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;7	That could delay the trial for weeks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;8	The soldiers are privates Alan Ford , 26 , of Birmingham ; Justin Fowler , 26 , of Falmouth , Cornwall ; and Jeff Parnell , 23 , of Oldbury , West Midlands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;9	They have yet to enter their pleas on charges of manslaughter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;10	The original charge of premeditated murder was reduced last month because the prosecution decided it might not be able to prove the men had planned to kill Jensen before they abducted her .
APW_ENG_19941202.0201;11	Police said the Britons have admitted kidnapping and killing Jensen in the tourist resort of Ayia Napa Sept. 13 .

APW_ENG_19941202.0202;0	The wandering skull of a 14th century religious reformer has found its way home to St. Lebuinus Church , courtesy of an anonymous do-gooder .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;1	Geert Groote died of the Black Plague in 1384 , and his remains were interred in the church to be venerated by the faithful .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;2	After six centuries , a skull was all that was left of the penitential preacher known to church historians as Gerardus Magnus .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;3	And even that disappeared 14 years ago , stolen from the church 's reliquary .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;4	Thursday church caretaker Nico Geelen found a box pushed inside the church 's door marked `` Fragile , But Not Hazardous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;5	It contained the skull and a small piece of stone carved with the Latin words meaning `` Here is the head of a deacon and a very holy man . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;6	`` I always had the feeling it would come back one day , '' said Geelen , adding that the skull 's authenticity was verified through photos .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;7	Groote made a rebellious name for himself preaching against corruption in the medieval Roman Catholic Church .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;8	One of Deventer 's most famous sons , Groote was educated in Paris but rejected the priesthood by claiming he was not holy enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;9	He died at 44 when the Black Death came to Deventer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;10	Instead of being hidden away , Groote 's skull will now go to the city museum .
APW_ENG_19941202.0202;11	Geelen said he did n't think Groote would be too concerned where it ends up , `` so long as his ideas survive . ''
