APW_ENG_19941202.0204;0	Peter Karrie , one of the most anonymous celebrities in the world of stage , says his role as the masked phantom in the mega-musical `` The Phantom of the Opera '' fills every moment of his waking hours .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;1	`` Once you have rehearsed the role and adopted it , he is with you all the time , ' said Karrie , the 48-year-old tenor who has portrayed the popular Andrew Lloyd Webber character for the last three years in London and Toronto .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;2	He has appeared more than 1,000 times on stage as the phantom in the award-winning production , which has garnered dlrs 1 billion since it first opened in London 's West End in 1986 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;3	`` When you wake up in the morning , when you go out shopping , you are thinking about it all the time , '' Karrie , a native of Wales , told Singapore reporters Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;4	He spoke by video-telephone from Toronto where he is currently performing as the phantom .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;5	The 45-minute news conference via satellite was called to announce that Karrie would also be playing the love-stricken phantom when the dlrs 12 million musical opens in Singapore in February .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;6	Although he dominates the nearly three-hour show , Karrie appears in a white mask , wig and cape .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;7	That 's why most autograph seekers are unable to recognize him even when he walks into the dress circle , Karrie said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;8	`` It would be nice to be recognized sometimes , '' said Karrie .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;9	`` The Phantom of the Opera , '' which opened in Broadway in 1988 and in Toronto in September 1989 , is based on a French novel about a hideously deformed phantom who lurks beneath the stage of the Paris Opera House .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;10	He falls in love with a young soprano and devotes himself to creating a new star for the opera .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;11	The Singapore production will be directed by Harold Prince , winner of 19 Tony awards .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;12	Karrie , when asked what goes into his role , said : `` Some Welsh passion . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;13	Asked how he keeps fit for the physically demanding role , Karrie said he uses `` ginseng , '' a Chinese herbal tonic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;14	`` It is great .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;15	We 've got it over here .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;16	I take some ginseng every day , '' he said with a wink and thumbs-up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;17	`` I also do some workout in the gym .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;18	And drink lots of water . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;19	Karrie , who starred as the phantom for 18 months in the West End , has previously portrayed the heroic lead Jean Valijean in `` Les Miserables , '' Che in `` Evita , '' the American in `` Chess '' and Judas in `` Jesus Christ Superstar . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;20	Phantom 's staging in Singapore is also an attempt by local authorities to show the city-state as not just a moneymaking center of commerce but a growing cultural and performing arts hub in the region .
APW_ENG_19941202.0204;21	Earlier this year , the popular Broadway production `` Cats '' was performed here following a production of `` Les Miserables . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;0	Sol Kerzner , creator of the Sun City gambling complex , may face charges of bribery and corruption dating back eight years , according to news reports Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;1	Justice Ministry attorney Christo Nel said an investigation into a bribe Kerzner offered officials in the former Transkei black homeland in 1986 had been reopened and could result in formal charges .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;2	Kerzner has admitted offering the bribe of 2 million rand -LRB- dlrs 909,000 at the exchange rate at the time -RRB- in return for exclusive gambling rights in the Transkei , one of four homelands granted independence under the apartheid era plan to strip blacks of South African citizenship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;3	Although no other countries ever recognized the homelands ' sovereignty , their nominal independence allowed Kerzner to build a string of lavish casinos and resorts without violating South African laws against gambling .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;4	After admitting the bribe at a South African judicial inquest in 1989 , he avoided prosecution by staying out of the Transkei .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;5	Former Transkei prime minister George Matanzima was imprisoned in the Transkei for accepting the bribe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;6	The nation 's first all-race election in April ended apartheid and scrapped the homeland system , with the regions becoming part of South Africa again .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;7	Nel , who was attorney general in the Transkei , said it would take up to six months to complete the investigation and decide if enough of a case existed to press charges .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;8	Kerzner has built a multibillion rand -LRB- dollar -RRB- empire from his hotel and gambling resorts in South Africa and Europe , and plans to open similar complexes in the Bahamas and the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;9	One news report said Kerzner 's ties with top officials of the new African National Congress-led government would allow him to avoid prosecution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0205;10	President Nelson Mandela 's office issued a statement in response , denying any possibility of interference with the judicial process .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;0	U.S. congressional clearance of a new world trade accord is expected to encourage ratification by other countries , allowing the mammoth export-boosting pact to take effect as planned on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;1	Large and small nations alike are trying to rush the 22,000-page GATT agreement through national parliaments , often in low-key processes compared to the rocky ride through Congress .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;2	Nearly 40 countries , including the United States , have now ratified the 124-nation agreement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;3	About 40 more -- including Japan , the European Union and Canada -- have said they will do so by year 's end .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;4	The head of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade , Peter Sutherland , said Friday that U.S. passage was a `` triumph '' that will help make the world a more prosperous place .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;5	`` This is a day for particular celebration , '' GATT Director-General Peter Sutherland told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;6	`` The successful culmination of this debate proved that common sense still works . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;7	The U.S. Senate approved the GATT treaty by 76-24 votes late Thursday -- a much bigger margin than expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;8	The House of Representatives cleared the deal earlier in the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;9	Congressional approval , uncertain for weeks , was deemed crucial for the the World Trade Organization to take effect on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;10	The WTO will implement the new accord and have more powers than GATT to settle trade disputes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;11	`` I warmly welcome the vote by the U.S. Senate , '' said European Union Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan , Europe 's chief negotiator in the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;12	He said the 12-nation bloc would complete the approval process by Dec. 20 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;13	In Japan , Trade Minister Rytaro Hashimoto said U.S. ratification of the deal would encourage other countries to follow suit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;14	Japan 's powerful lower house of parliament passed the accord early Friday and it will now move to the upper house .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;15	This view was echoed by Hong Kong 's Director-General of Trade , Tony Miller .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;16	`` The world looks to the United States for leadership in promoting free trade under the multilateral regime , '' Miller said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;17	In Canberra , Australian Trade Minister Bob McMullan said the U.S. result was `` great news for Australia and the world economy generally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;18	Sutherland said he expected about 100 of GATT 's 124 member nations to ratify the trade accord by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;19	The agreement is considered the most ambitious attempt ever to knock down barriers to free world trade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;20	The pact is expected to boost global income by dlrs 510 billion by the year 2005 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;21	It reduces customs duties on hundreds of thousands of products , liberalizes trade in service industries , protects against copyright theft and patent abuse and cuts protection of farm goods and textiles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0206;22	`` We will have a rules-based system that allows for the development of the world economy and provides an assurance of security , prosperity and reduction of tensions , '' Sutherland said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0207;1	Nierenz Bernd Karl-Heinz , of Eberswacde , Germany , refused to open the door when police came to his apartment on a tip from neighbors , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0207;2	They used a key to open the door and said they found four boys -- age 12 and 13 -- hiding in their underpants in the bathroom .
APW_ENG_19941202.0207;3	Police reported that the boys said they had sex with Heinz .
APW_ENG_19941202.0207;4	Police seized four videos of young Thai boys having sex and a large stack of photographs of them posing nude , police Maj. Nawin Klamsang said in an interview .
APW_ENG_19941202.0207;5	Nawin said it was unclear how long Heinz had been living in Thailand but noted that he spoke fluent Thai .

APW_ENG_19941202.0207;7	If they came again , the boys were offered 100 baht -LRB- dlrs 4 -RRB- to pose nude for a still camera , they said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0207;8	And , on subsequent visits , they were paid 100 baht -LRB- dlrs 4 -RRB- to act in pornographic videos , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0207;9	Heinz is to appear in court within the month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;0	A substantially bigger-than-expected gain in construction employment helped force the U.S. unemployment rate down to the lowest level in four years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;1	The Labor Department said a seasonally adjusted 350,000 new workers were added to the nation 's nonfarm payrolls , pushing the unemployment rate to 5.6 percent from 5.8 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;2	That is the lowest level since August 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;3	The jobless rate has been declining all year , dropping 1.1 percent since January .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;4	The nation 's nonfarm payrolls have increased by 1.4 million people this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;5	The report suggests the economy is still growing at a robust pace and employment growth remains strong .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;6	However , the government 's chief forecasting gauge of future economic activity pointed in the other direction , falling in October for the first time in 15 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;7	The Index of Leading Economic Indicators slipped 0.1 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;8	In advance of the unemployment report , most economists were expecting the unemployment rate to remain at 5.8 percent and nonfarm payrolls to increase by about 250,000 workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;9	Even the most optimistic analysts were expecting an increase no bigger than 280,000 jobs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;10	Strong employment growth this year was one of the factors that prompted the central bank to raise short-term interest rates last month for a sixth time this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;11	Last month , the central bank raised key rates three-quarters of a percentage point , the largest increase in 13 years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;12	The large number of new hires was boosted by unexpectedly robust growth in construction employment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;13	The Labor Department said 71,000 jobs were added to construction industry payrolls in November .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;14	Manufacturing employment also was robust , jumping 51,000 after increases of just over 18,000 in the previous three months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;15	Gains were recorded in manufacture of durable goods , including lumber , fabricated metals , industrial machinery and electronic equipment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0208;16	As expected , most of the new hires were in service industries , including 25,000 in retail trade and a substantial 26,000 increase in the number of government workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;0	Some 76,000 Rwandans already in Zaire poured into internationally run refugee camps this week under orders from Zairean police forces after clashes with the local population , the U.N. refugee agency said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;1	Sylvana Foa , spokeswoman for the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees , said the agency was surprised by the numbers of Rwandans outside the camps , which she said were `` already badly overloaded . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;2	There are already an estimated 850,000 Rwandans in the camps on the border of Rwanda and Zaire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;3	The Rwandans , mostly Hutu , fled their country last summer following the takeover of the government by the Tutsi-led Rwandan Patriotic Front .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;4	Zairean forces ordered the Rwandans into the camps following a clash last week in a village near Goma , Zaire , that left 24 refugees and three Zaireans dead and 77 wounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;5	Foa said the violence appeared to have started because of stealing from tradesmen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;6	As a result of the Zairean order , 45,000 refugees streamed into Kitale camp , 18,000 into Kibumba camp , and 13,000 into Kahindo camp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0209;7	Foa said relief workers have begun looking for a site for a new camp to help ease the overcrowding .

APW_ENG_19941202.0210;1	Chasing 166-9 to win , Australia limped home after 47.2 overs , losing 4-8 in the closing overs with part-time Zimbabwean spinner Grant Flower picking up three wickets to ensure a tight finish .

APW_ENG_19941202.0210;4	But when the openers departed in the 15th and 16th overs , the runs dried up and Zimbabwe tightened the screws to prolong what always seemed like the inevitable .

APW_ENG_19941202.0210;8	At one stage I thought it looked like a 230-run wicket .
APW_ENG_19941202.0210;9	`` We lost our way with a lack or urgency and some silly shots . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0210;10	Zimbabwe captain Andy Flower said his side was inconsistent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0210;11	`` Our guys bowled well but our batting was not up to scratch and we lost too many wickets in the middle stages after setting up a good platform , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0210;13	`` I honestly believe we can get up around the 250 mark against any of the sides in the competition .

APW_ENG_19941202.0211;1	`` I do n't think the Japanese people will have good feelings toward the design of the stamp , '' Foreign Minister Yohei Kono said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;2	`` We may convey our feelings to the U.S. side in some form , '' he told a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;3	The U.S. Postal Service plans to begin selling the stamp next September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;4	The stamp depicts the explosion of the atomic bomb dropped by U.S. forces on the city of Hiroshima in the closing days of World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;5	Under the mushroom cloud , it says , `` Atomic bombs hasten war 's end , August 1945 . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;6	In Washington , Postal Service spokesman Robin Wright said the stamp is part of a series of stamps on World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;7	`` We would be remiss in omitting such a watershed and historically critical event as the use of the atomic bomb , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;8	`` Our purpose is to provide a comprehensive history of events of World War II and we are not making a value judgment on any of those events , '' Wright added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;9	Within five months after the bombing of Hiroshima , about 140,000 of the city 's 340,000 residents died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;10	Another atomic bombing of Nagasaki three days later killed 70,000 of that city 's 270,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;11	Several days later , on Aug. 15 , 1945 , Japan surrendered to the Allied Forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;12	Survivors of the atomic bombing and anti-nuclear activists expressed anger over the stamp on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;13	Sunao Tsuboi , a leader of the 30,000-member Hiroshima Prefectural Confederation of A-Bomb Survivors ' Organizations , called the stamp `` outrageous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0211;14	`` It makes our blood boil with anger , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0214;1	Listening to calypso music , the retired American military chief told students at the University of the West Indies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;2	Powell , 57 , the child of Jamaican immigrants to the United States , received an honorary degree from the institution late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;3	Earlier in the day , he accepted the Order of Jamaica , the nation 's equivalent to knighthood in the British system .
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;4	Powell told students he was pleased to be included among UWI 's earlier honorees , naming South African President Nelson Mandela , Anglican Archbishop Desmond Tutu and former Jamaican Prime Minister Michael Manley .
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;5	`` But there is one name that I have to single out as I look through all of those honorees of the past , '' Powell said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;6	`` This one person for all those 35 years for me has been an inspiration .
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;7	And even during those dark days of Desert Storm when I was alone in my office , pondering matters of war and peace , this person was in the office with me in spirit helping me . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0214;8	The crowd broke up in laughter when Powell named his inspiration -- The Mighty Sparrow , Trinidad 's venerable calypso king .

APW_ENG_19941202.0214;11	And I would have a smile on my face ... They never quite understood what was coming out of that music box . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0218;4	`` It 's everywhere .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;5	You ca n't go 10 steps without either seeing it or hearing it . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0218;7	`` I ca n't tell you how many times I 've heard ` Beat Army ' in my lifetime , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;8	`` So many times , I can hear it in my sleep . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;9	While other U.S. college football teams judge their season on whether or not they get to a post-season `` bowl '' game , Army and Navy determine their success on whether or not they beat each other .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;10	Since the 1960s , both Army and Navy , once U.S. college football powerhouses , have struggled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;11	They are unable to recruit top players because of a six-year committment each graduate must make to his branch of the U.S. military as payment for his education .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;12	Most pro teams are not willing to wait six years for a player to become eligible -- especially since they wo n't be playing in that time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;13	And college football is a stepping stone to the pros .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;14	But the lackluster records have not , and do not , dampen the spirit , intensity or enthusiasm of the Army-Navy rivalry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;15	It equals any bowl game .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;16	In 94 meetings , Army has won only once more than Navy , 44 victories to 43 , with seven draws .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;17	The Navy `` Midshipmen '' have outscored the Army `` Cadets '' 1,203-1 ,135 -- a difference of only seventh-tenths of a point per game .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;18	Army eked out a 16-14 victory last year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;19	The Cadets jumped out to a 16-0 lead in the third quarter before Kubiak engineered two touchdown drives and one final drive that ended at the Army 1-yard-line with six seconds to play .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;20	Ryan Bucchianeri then missed an 18-yard field goal attempt that would have given Navy the victory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;21	`` They might say , ` It 's over with ' and all that , but , you know what ?
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;22	That 's still in your mind , and you go to sleep with it every night , '' said Kubiak , who holds Navy career records for completions -LRB- 534 -RRB- and yards -LRB- 5,647 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;23	`` And everybody on our football team wants to change that . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;24	Navy has momentum on its side .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;25	After an 0-5 start , it has won three of its last five .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;26	Kubiak said an inexperienced offensive line has begun to play together : After being sacked 31 times in Navy 's first nine games , he was only sacked twice in their last game , a 29-17 victory over Rice .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;27	Army 's season has gone in the opposite direction .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;28	The Cadets opened with a victory over Holy Cross and got consecutive victories over Louisville and The Citadel , but they have also lost games they could have won against Temple , Rutgers , Wake Forest , Air Force and Boston University .

APW_ENG_19941202.0218;30	`` A big part of this game is tackling , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;31	`` They throw a lot of passes where receivers are definitely going to catch the ball .
APW_ENG_19941202.0218;32	You have to be able to keep the gains to a minimum . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0222;0	The head of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade on Friday hailed the overwhelming Senate majority for a new trade pact as a `` triumph '' which would help make the world a more prosperous place .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;1	`` This is a day for particular celebration , '' GATT Director-General Peter Sutherland told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;2	`` The successful culmination of this debate proved that common sense still works . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;3	The U.S. Senate approved the GATT treaty by 76-24 votes late Thursday -- a much bigger margin than expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;4	The House of Representatives cleared the deal earlier in the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;5	Congressional approval , uncertain for weeks , was deemed crucial to the entry into force of the World Trade Organization Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;6	The new body will implement the new accord and have tougher powers than GATT to settle trade disputes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;7	`` I warmly welcome the vote by the U.S. Senate , '' said European Union Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan , Europe 's chief negotiator in the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;8	He said the 12-nation bloc would complete the approval process by Dec. 20 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;9	France added a note of caution about a U.S. provision which would allow it to withdraw quickly from the WTO in the event of three adverse trade rulings deemed unfair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;10	France may now press the EU to take out a similar safeguard .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;11	`` We have noted with satisfaction that Congress ratified the agreement , '' said a French Foreign Ministry spokeswoman , speaking on the usual condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;12	`` We are nevertheless concerned with certain aspects of the American application . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;13	In Japan , Trade Minister Rytaro Hashimoto said U.S. ratification of the deal would encourage other countries to follow suit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;14	Japan 's powerful lower house of parliament passed the accord early Friday and it will now move to the upper house .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;15	This view was echoed by Hong Kong 's Director-General of Trade , Tony Miller .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;16	`` The world looks to the United States for leadership in promoting free trade under the multilateral regime , '' Miller said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;17	In Canberra , Austrlian Trade Minister Bob McMullan said the U.S. result was `` great news for Australia and the world economy generally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;18	Sutherland said he expected about 100 of GATT 's 124 member nations to ratify the trade accord by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;19	The agreement is considered the most ambitious attempt ever to free world trade and is expected to boost global income by dlrs 510 billion by the year 2005 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;20	It reduces customs duties on hundreds of thousands of products , liberalizes trade in service industries , protects against copyright theft and patent abuse and cuts protection of farm goods and textiles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;21	`` We will have a rules-based system that allows for the development of the world economy and provides an assurance of security , prosperity and reduction of tensions , '' Sutherland said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;22	` I celebrated last night , '' said the Irish lawyer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0222;23	`` It 's a triumph for the organization and the fact that people can react rationally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;0	Led by a sharp drop for cars and other transportation equipment , orders to U.S. factories fell in October for the first time in three months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;1	The Commerce Department said Friday that orders declined 0.4 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;2	But the government , which originally estimated orders to be down 0.2 percent in September , revised that figure to show a rise of less than 0.1 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;3	New orders , a key gauge of the nation 's manufacturing sector , have risen in 13 of the last 15 months including a 4.7 percent jump in August that was led by auto demand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;4	They last fell in July , when they were off 2 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;5	Analysts expected orders to fall in October , predicting a decline of 0.6 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;6	Still , other data indicates the economy continues to grow at a solid pace despite higher interest rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;7	Earlier Friday , the Labor Department reported a sharp drop in unemployment to 5.6 percent for November .

APW_ENG_19941202.0224;9	In the factory report , the Commerce Department said that -- excluding the volatile transportation component -- orders rose 0.9 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;10	That indicator was unchanged in September and has risen 16 times in the last 17 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;11	Orders for both durable and non-durable goods totaled a seasonally adjusted dlrs 286 billion , down from dlrs 287.2 billion in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;12	Shipments , a measure of current production , decreased 0.7 percent to dlrs 284.2 billion in October , the third decline in the last four months and the fifth decrease this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;13	Shipments fell 0.7 percent in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;14	The backlog of unfilled orders rose 0.4 percent in October to dlrs 450.6 billion , following a 0.2 percent increase the previous month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;15	The orders backlog is often seen as a measure of whether current facilities and manpower are able to keep up with demand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;16	Inventories in October rose 0.4 percent to dlrs 388 billion , after a 0.1 percent decrease in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;17	Orders for durable goods , items expected to last more than three years , were down 1 percent to dlrs 153.9 billion , after gaining 0.5 percent in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;18	Transportation equipment fell dlrs 3.4 billion or 8.8 percent , led by declining car demand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;19	Orders for non-durable goods were up 0.2 percent at dlrs 132.1 billion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;20	Increased orders for tobacco , textiles and paper products were partly offset by declines in printing and publishing and petroleum and coal products .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;21	Orders for non-defense capital goods excluding aircraft rose 0.1 percent in October after rising 3.5 percent in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0224;22	These orders often are a barometer of business plans to expand and modernize .

APW_ENG_19941202.0226;3	The U.N. mission here set up stringent security measures after rebel representatives canceled a meeting earlier in the week , saying they feared for their lives in the government-held capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0226;4	The two sides were scheduled to begin work Saturday on practical implementation of a treaty their leaders signed two weeks ago in Lusaka , Zambia , said the military official , speaking on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0226;5	At issue are security measures for rebel officials , withdrawal of troops from contested areas and transportation of government and rebel soldiers to demobilization centers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0226;6	Although both UNITA and the government have accused each other of violating a cease-fire called Nov. 22 , two days after the treaty was signed , there has been a general reduction in fighting across the war-ravaged nation .

APW_ENG_19941202.0226;8	If the cease-fire holds , a 7,000-strong U.N. peace keeping force has been promised to secure Angola 's transition to peace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0226;9	Angola 's war , which erupted on the eve of independence from Portugal in 1975 , has killed a half-million Angolans and left millions more threatened by starvation and disease .
APW_ENG_19941202.0226;10	Peace accords in 1991 brought a brief respite but UNITA lost multiparty elections a year later , cried foul and returned to war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0226;11	After initially capturing more than two-thirds of the country , UNITA has recently suffered crushing defeats and rebel leaders have been on the run since their main base in the central city of Huambo fell to the government early November .

APW_ENG_19941202.0228;1	It based the reports on sworn affidavits it said were given by three policemen who were living in a European country under a witness protection program .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;2	A judicial panel investigating political violence in South Africa has interviewed South African policemen in Denmark .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;3	The Sowetan report , citing confidentiality of the witness protection program , lacked the identities of the policemen , the country they were in and any information on how the newspaper obtained the affidavits .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;4	Allegations of police hit squads date back years , and several judicial inquests have found evidence that some police took part in hit squads but never linked such activities to top officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;5	In addition , some policemen have been convicted of what appeared to be politically motivated killings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;6	The Sowetan report contained details of alleged police activities against black opposition groups that included : -- The 1988 bombing of the South African Council of Churches office in downtown Johannesburg .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;7	A former Cabinet minister allegedly congratulated the police unit involved ; -- Bombing cinemas to prevent the screening of the film `` Cry Freedom , '' which portrayed the relationship between black activist Steve Biko , who died in police custody , and a journalist ; -- Sending former guerrilla fighters infected with the HIV virus that leads to AIDS into the Hillbrow entertainment district of Johannesburg to infect black prostitutes ; -- Supplying arms to the Zulu nationalist Inkatha Freedom Party , which fought a low-level civil war against the African National Congress that killed thousands of blacks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;8	-- Planning the killing of ANC and civil rights activist Bheki Mlangeni , who died when earphones he received in a mail package exploded as he used them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;9	There was no immediate comment from police or the Safety and Security Ministry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;10	Since the nation 's first all-race election in April ended apartheid and brought the ANC to power , President Nelson Mandela has called for reforms in the police department to bring blacks into the white-dominated hierarchy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;11	The ANC has for years accused police of aiding Inkatha in the political fighting that mostly stopped just before the election .
APW_ENG_19941202.0228;12	It also claimed police instigated violence to destabilize the black opposition movement .

APW_ENG_19941202.0228;14	Inkatha and the National Party , which implemented and dismantled apartheid during its 46 years in power until the April vote , oppose full public disclosure of details of the crimes .

APW_ENG_19941202.0229;1	Grand Ayatollah Ali Araki died Tuesday at the age of at least 100 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;2	After his death , the jockeying began to replace him as supreme head of the world 's 100 million Shiite Muslims , who comprise one of Islam 's two main branches .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;3	Traditionally the marja ala , or supreme spiritual leader , has been chosen from the grand ayatollahs -- who number about a dozen -- by theologians in the leading Shiite seminaries in Qom in Iran and the holy city of Najaf in Iraq .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;4	In the past , the marja ala has eschewed involvement in politics .

APW_ENG_19941202.0229;6	Such a leader , he said , would help resurgent Islam face `` an American-backed Islam . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;7	Jannati is a member of key official committees and a close associate of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei , the Iranian government 's choice for spiritual leader .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;8	His comments underlined fears among many Shiites that Iran 's government , by intervening in what has until now been a solely religious matter , is seeking to control religion in Iran and exert authority over Shiites around the world .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;9	Khamenei , 55 , has the qualifications of a middle-ranking cleric , but the radio referred to him as a grand ayatollah several times Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;10	There has been no official word that Khamenei had been promoted to grand ayatollah by Iran 's religious establishment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;11	Iran is promoting Khamenei because it fears that a non-Iranian , the Grand Ayatollah Ali Husseini Seestani , may become the next marja ala.
APW_ENG_19941202.0229;12	Seestani , 65 , who lives and teaches in Najaf in Iraq , has steered clear of politics .

APW_ENG_19941202.0233;0	Nearly half a century after its launch , the Achille Lauro was drifting silently in the Indian Ocean on Friday , its history of triumphs and tragedy nearing an end .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;1	The 979 surviving passengers and crew members of the Italian liner were heading for three African and Middle Eastern ports aboard 10 rescue vessels after abandoning the blazing ship two days ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;2	Still smoldering , listing badly and charred from stem to stern , the Achille Lauro was but a shell of the gleaming blue and white luxury liner that once sailed around the world in 80 days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;3	But it was for tragedy , not triumph , that the Achille Lauro was best known .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;4	The ship burst into the world 's headlines in 1985 when Palestinian terrorists hijacked it , killed an American Jew , Leon Klinghoffer , and dumped his body overboard in his wheelchair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;5	The terrorists escaped from the ship and boarded a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced it to land in Italy and the hijackers were arrested and later tried .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;6	The second fire in the ship 's history began in the engine room before dawn Wednesday and slowly spread to engulf the ship , despite efforts by the crew to contain it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;7	Two elderly passengers died , one apparently of a heart attack , and eight people were injured as lifeboats and rafts were launched and the ship was abandoned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;8	The first fire aboard the Achille Lauro came in 1981 off the Canary Islands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;9	Passengers leaped from the decks into the Atlantic and two died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;10	Wednesday 's `` fire was so big you had to fight through smoke which poured down toward the cabins , '' one survivor , Tony Webb , was quoted as telling the London Daily Telegraph .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;11	`` At about 8 a.m. , the captain said the fire was too strong and we would have to abandon ship , '' said Webb , 44 , a Briton living in Cape Town , South Africa .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;12	Webb praised the crew and the ship 's captain , Giuseppe Orsi , who was the last to abandon ship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;13	But two other passengers , interviewed by Britain 's Sky TV on Friday , were critical .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;14	One , Geoffrey Wall , said one of the two victims was killed when the crew dropped an inflated raft on top of a lifeboat carrying about 35 passengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;15	And Dennis Basset told Sky TV that the crew failed to alert all of the passengers to the emergency until only minutes before the abandon ship order was sounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;16	In a radio telephone call from a rescue ship Thursday , Captain Orsi said he thought the Achille Lauro was finished .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;17	But an official of the ship 's owner , Starlauro of Naples , said Friday that seagoing tugs had been hired to go to the scene and check the ship 's condition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;18	`` We intend to tow the ship -- to save it at all costs , '' said Sergio Santopaolo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;19	But Santopaolo acknowledged the final decision will be made only after the tugboat crews evaluate the damage , and that would take at least a couple of days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;20	`` From what I saw , -LRB- the ship -RRB- is gone , '' Orsi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;21	Eight cargo vessels and two American warships , the USS Gettysburg and Halyburton , were carrying the Achille Lauro 's surviving passengers and crew members to Djibouti , Mombasa in Kenya and Muskat in Oman .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;22	Most were heading for Mombasa .
APW_ENG_19941202.0233;23	The first ship was expected to dock in Djibouti on Saturday ; the rest were scheduled to make port on Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;0	Arianespace , the world leader in commercial satellite launching , apologized Friday after a dlrs 150 million U.S. communications satellite crashed into Atlantic , but said the client has signed on for another try .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;1	Charles Bigot , Arianespace 's chief executive , said a failure in the third-stage engine caused an unmanned Ariane rocket to crash 15 minutes after takeoff Thursday from the launch center in French Guiana .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;2	Aboard was a sophisticated communications satellite built by Hughes Space and Communications of El Segundo , Calif. , for PanAmSat , a Greenwich , Conn.-based firm .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;3	The PamAmSat-3 satellite would have channeled telephone , fax and television communications for most of North and South America , Europe and Africa over 15 years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;4	It would have traveled in geostationary orbit over the mid-Atlantic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;5	Bigot , answering French reporters ' questions in a live hook-up from the launch center in South America , said it was too early to decide when Ariane launches would resume .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;6	He said preliminary report on the crash was due by mid-December .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;7	He said the lost satellite had been insured , and PanAmSat was preparing a replacement satellite .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;8	Despite the accident , Bigot said PanAmSat 's vice president , Reverge Anselmo , had signed a contract for Arianespace to launch another PanAmSat satellite by the end of 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;9	Arianespace technicians said the third-stage engine inexplicably lost pressure 218 kilometers -LRB- 135 miles -RRB- above Earth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;10	In January , a third-stage breakdown forced engineers to explode a rocket in mid-flight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;11	A Turkish and a European telecommunications satellites were also destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;12	Six perfect launches followed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;13	Thursday 's crash was the seventh in 70 launches since the European Space Agency 's commercial Arianespace program lifted off 15 years ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;14	It should not shake Ariane 's dominance as the world 's most successful launcher of lucrative private satellites -- the company now holds about 70 percent of the market .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;15	`` We hope to get back into operation very quickly , '' said Bigot , who apologized to the satellite 's owners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;16	Liftoff was on schedule at 7:38 p.m.
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;17	The first two stages fired perfectly and controllers confidently expected another of what have become almost routine shots for the Ariane launchers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;18	The third stage also lit properly , but then mysteriously sputtered and went out .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;19	Officials said that the third stage was a new type using a new oxygen-hydrogen mixture to maximize performance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;20	January 's accident was blamed on a turbo-pump failure freezing the third-stage rocket motor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;21	That failure followed 26 straight successful launches in which the European rocket distanced itself from its competitors , the United States and China .
APW_ENG_19941202.0234;22	The Arianes have put 94 satellites in orbit and have a backlog of 38 , representing contracts worth more than 17 billion francs -LRB- dlrs 3.1 billion -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;0	In an attempt to repulse incoming refugees , Parliament on Friday authorized the government to automatically bar all asylum seekers arriving overland .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;1	The measure is aimed at stemming a flow of asylum seekers that has severely strained government resources and led to a rightist resurgence in May 's national elections .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;2	`` We do n't want to send people back to face danger , '' said spokesman Tom van der Maas for the right-wing Liberals , one of the three ruling coalition partners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;3	`` But we need to redirect this inflow of people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;4	It 's an effort to spread the burden throughout Europe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;5	`` This is an ugly law , '' countered Fronnie Biesma , spokesman for the Dutch Refugee Council .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;6	`` We are just transferring the responsibility to other countries . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;7	The legislation takes direct aim at the Netherlands ' international reputation as a safe haven for the persecuted , a label that this year will draw an estimated 55,000 asylum seekers to this nation of 15 million .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;8	Virtually assured of becoming law , the measure is aimed primarily at the `` economic migrants '' who move around Europe in search of the best residency and benefits deal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;9	In practice , the law will bar the vast majority of asylum seekers , who usually arrive overland by bus , car or train from neighboring Germany or Belgium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0235;10	The new law also would bar any asylum seekers who had traveled through so-called `` safe third countries '' where they could have applied for asylum before reaching the Netherlands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;0	Stocks were mostly higher in early trading Friday morning as bond prices staged a surprised rally on mixed economic reports .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;1	After 30 minutes of trading the Dow Jones average of 30 industrial stocks was up 11.10 but it then lost all the gain to register 3,700.87 at 10.30 a.m. EST -LRB- 1530 GMT -RRB- one hour into the session , unchanged from Thursday 's close .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;2	Advancing issues led decliners by 789 to 664 on the New York Stock Exchange , where volume totaled 34.26 million shares in the first half hour .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;3	Broad-market indexes were higher .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;4	The NYSE composite was up 0.61 at 246.65 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;5	The American Stock Exchange 's market value index was up 0.34 at 431.53 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;6	The Nasdaq composite index stood at 741.97 , up 0.78 from a revised Thursday close of 741.19 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;7	The Labor Department said a seasonally adjusted 350,000 new workers were added to the nation 's nonfarm payrolls , pushing the unemployment rate to 5.6 percent from 5.8 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;8	That is the lowest level since August 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;9	Analysts had expected an increase in nonfarm jobs of about 250,000 , and for the unemployment rate to remain at 5.8 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;10	The jobs data showed a stronger-than expected growth in the economy , but its impact was softened by a drop of 0.1 percent in October in the government 's index of leading indicators , the chief forecasting gauge of future economic activity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;11	Bonds initially dipped on the jobs report but then quickly rallied , pulling stocks higher with them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;12	The 30-year U.S. Treasury bond was up about dlrs 6 per dlrs 1,000 face value and yielding 7.95 percent , after the market got mixed reports on the economy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;13	`` I 'm surprised , '' said Ricky Harrington , technical analyst at Interstate-Johnson Lane in Charlotte , N.C. `` I thought the market would have been down 10-20 points '' on the jobs data .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;14	`` It could be we 've simply reached an oversold condition as far as bonds are concerned , and that might be the reason '' for the rally in both markets , Harrington said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;15	Harrington did note that average earnings and workweek fell , which could also have offered some comfort to bond traders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;16	Weak economic data is generally good for bonds because it lessens the likelihood that the Federal Reserve will have to raise interest rates to curb inflation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;17	Stocks were lower overseas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;18	Tokyo 's Nikkei index fell 0.1 percent , and Frankfurt 's DAX index was down 0.4 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0236;19	London 's FT-SE 100 was lower as well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;0	A prominent Russian historian said Friday that Kremlin archives from the 1950s show China and North Korea were sharply at odds over the number of American POWs they held during the Korean War .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;1	`` Even the countries that fought together and held POWs in their camps in North Korea and China did n't know their exact number , '' said Gen. Dmitry Volkogonov , a historian and adviser to President Boris Yeltsin , told a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;2	Volkogonov co-chairs the joint Russian-U.S. Commission , which is investigating the fate of American POWs and MIAs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;3	He said he would turn the document over to the American side at the commission 's session in Washington next week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;4	Volkogonov cited an account he had found in the archives of a secret meeting in Moscow in the fall of 1952 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;5	Dictator Josef Stalin had summoned Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai , North Korean leader Kim Il Sung and North Korean military commander Pan Do Huai to the Kremlin to discuss the Korean War .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;6	He asked how many Americans they had captured , Volkogonov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;7	`` Zhou Enlai replied that they held 8,000 foreigners , while Kim Il Sung immediately interrupted him , saying the actual number was slightly more than 4,000 , '' Volkogonov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;8	`` Stalin tried to clarify that , but none of the participants in these secret talks could tell the exact number of United Nations ' POWs , much less American POWs . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;9	He suggested that China and North Korea help clarify the matter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;10	The Russian-U.S. commission announced last year there was no hope of finding any American POWs alive in the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;11	It confined its search to finding the remains of U.S. servicemen and clarifying the circumstances of their deaths .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;12	The commission has also said it found no proof that any captured Americans were brought to the Soviet Union from Korea or Vietnam .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;13	It did confirm that American POWs were interrogated by Soviet troops in North Korea and China during the Korean War .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;14	The commission 's other co-chairman , Malcolm Toon , a former U.S. ambassador to the Soviet Union , has urged the Russians to continue searching archives .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;15	Among the commission 's earlier findings were that several dozen Americans were sent to the Soviet Gulag after the Red Army freed them from the Nazis at the end of World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;16	Soviet authorities arrested those with Slavic or Jewish surnames on assumption they were Russians who had collaborated with the Germans , Volkogonov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;17	`` The fates of some were so tragic they deserve to be told by Shakespeare , '' Volkogonov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;18	He cited the case of one American , whom he identified only by the last name Oggins , who spent eight years in Soviet camps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;19	The man was finally shot on Stalin 's personal order in 1952 , days before his term was to expire , for fear he would tell the world what he had been through , Volkogonov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;20	Volkogonov said the commission also continues to investigate the fate of American pilots downed in the 1950s while probing the Soviets ' radar defenses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0238;21	Earlier this year , the investigators found the remains of one , Capt. John P. Dunham , whose reconaissance plane was shot down by Soviet fighters over the Sea of Japan in 1952 , Volkogonov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;0	A jury convicted a Lebanese immigrant Thursday of murdering a Jewish teen-ager in an ambush on the Brooklyn Bridge , rejecting his claim that he was suffering a flashback from his childhood in war-torn Beirut .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;1	Rashid Baz , a livery cab driver , admitted he strafed the van with bullets on March 1 as it drove onto the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;2	Sixteen year-old Aaron Halberstam was killed and three others were wounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;3	Baz 's lawyer , Eric Sears , blamed his client 's `` catastrophic '' childhood in Beirut , where he became a soldier at age 9 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;4	He said Baz suffers post-traumatic stress syndrome , which climaxed in the bridge shooting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;5	Baz , 28 , said he fired at the van after its passengers mouthed insults and leveled a gun at him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;6	`` Let him rot in hell , '' Devorah Halberstam , the dead boy 's mother , said after the verdict .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;7	`` Nobody believed he was insane .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;8	The evidence was overwhelming that he was not .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;9	... I honestly believe his only remorse is that he did n't kill every single boy in that van , '' Mrs. Halberstam said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;10	Nachum Sosonkin , 18 , a passenger who was shot in the head , testified during the trial that he never heard anyone inside the van say anything to Baz or display a gun .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;11	The jury deliberated one day before convicting Baz of second-degree murder and 14 counts of attempted murder .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;12	Baz , who immigrated from Lebanon at age 18 , faces 25 years to life in prison at his Jan. 18 sentencing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;13	`` I do n't think my son got a fair trial , '' said Baz 's 52-year-old mother , Suheila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;14	`` The jury was very harsh . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;15	`` But I have high hopes in the American judge and I hope my son will get a fair sentence , considering his illness , '' she told The Associated Press in an interview at her apartment in Beirut .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;16	She did not say what a fair sentence would be .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;17	The shooting occurred as 15 male students , dressed in the distinctive black garb worn by ultra-Orthodox Lubavitcher Jews , returned from a visit to a Manhattan hospital where the Lubavitchers ' leader , Rebbe Menachem Schneerson , was being treated .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;18	The rebbe died in June .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;19	The dead boy 's father , Rabbi David Halberstam , said he believes Baz acted to revenge the Feb. 25 massacre on Israel 's West Bank in which a Jewish settler killed 29 Arabs as they prayed in a mosque .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;20	Baz 's attorney had argued that the shooting was not revenge , but that the massacre might have triggered a deadly flashback .
APW_ENG_19941202.0239;21	The prosecution cited testimony by Baz 's uncle , Jamal Akel , that Baz 's problems predated the start of Lebanon 's civil war in 1975 and much of his behavior was shocking -- even in Beirut .

APW_ENG_19941202.0240;1	A New York judge ordered one of Simpson 's DNA lawyers , Peter Neufeld , to appear in his court for a murder trial despite an order by the Simpson judge for Neufeld to be in Los Angeles .

APW_ENG_19941202.0240;13	Three other prospects who had heard of Ms. Brown 's comments were dismissed Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0240;14	The New York Daily News reported Friday that an inmate claims that he overheard Simpson make incriminating statements while talking to his friend Rosey Grier , a former football player who now is a minister .
APW_ENG_19941202.0240;15	According to the newspaper , which cited an unidentified source , the inmate reported to a deputy that he overheard the conversation in a visiting room , which has several glass-enclosed cubicles that are open on top .
APW_ENG_19941202.0240;16	The deputy then notified Ito .
APW_ENG_19941202.0240;17	The newspaper gave no detail on the alleged statements .
APW_ENG_19941202.0241;0	Later Friday , Russia 's Yevgeny Kafelnikov faced Magnus Larsson in the second singles with Swedes Jonas Bjorkman and Jan Apell , the ATP Tour 's top-ranked doubles team and recently crowned doubles champions , facing Kafelnikov and Andrei Olhovskiy on Saturday .

APW_ENG_19941202.0241;2	But buoyed by a partisan crowd of 12,000 , Volkov battled back in the third set , punctuated with a crowd-pleasing ace to take the tiebreaker .

APW_ENG_19941202.0244;0	Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin on Friday downplayed hints by Syria 's leader that Damascus was losing hope in peace talks with Israel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;1	`` Be neither alarmed nor unmoved , '' by Hafez Assad 's comments , Rabin told newspaper editors meeting in Tel Aviv .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;2	He added the deadlocked peace efforts with Syria must continue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;3	Rabin said both Israel and Arab regimes were endangered by an Iranian-backed `` ugly wave of extremist , fundamentalist , terroristic Islam that has swept the Arab and Muslim world . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;4	Noting what he termed an upsurge in mosque construction in the United States and Western Europe , Rabin said : `` Today extremist Islam has an international infrastructure . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;5	He said most of the Israelis killed by Arabs since the Sept. 1993 autonomy pact with the PLO were victims of Palestinian fundamentalists , sometimes financed by supporters in the United States , or the Iranian-backed Lebanese militia Hezbollah .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;6	Bloodshed in that time has claimed 94 Israelis and 187 Palestinians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;7	Rabin said Syria should follow the example of the PLO and Jordan , which both reached accords with Israel since Rabin took office in mid-1992 , in establishing a direct dialog with Jerusalem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;8	But the Syrians can not be forced into peace , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;9	Rabin was responding to Assad 's statement Thursday that the status quo was preferable to formal peace under Israel 's conditions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;10	Israel and Syria have not fought directly for 21 years except for an air battle during Israel 's 1982 Lebanon invasion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;11	Both back proxy forces fighting in south Lebanon .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;12	On Friday , Syria 's government-run Al-Thawra daily accused Israel of continuing to pursue `` war and aggression '' to intimidate the Arabs into peace on its terms .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;13	`` If Syria really prefers the present situation over peace , peace can not be forced , '' Rabin said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;14	`` We can not force it on the Syrians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;15	The Syrians can not force it on us , and the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;16	understands that coercion and peace contradict each other . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;17	Israeli-Syrian negotiations have been deadlocked almost since they started in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;18	Syria demands that Israel return the entire Golan Heights captured in 1967 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;19	Israel has offered only a phased , partial pullback and also demands Syria dismantle Iranian-backed militias in Lebanon .

APW_ENG_19941202.0244;21	Itamar Rabinovich , Israel 's U.S. ambassador and a leading negotiator with the Syrians , said it was up to Christopher to rescue the faltering peace process .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;22	`` It is very important that he be successful in saving the gloomy atmosphere that has formed around the negotiations , '' Rabinovich said on Army radio .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;23	Rabin faces strong opposition in Israel to any peace deal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;24	Benjamin Begin , a leading lawmaker from the right-wing Likud opposition , told Army radio that military intelligence believed Assad still sought Israel 's destruction .
APW_ENG_19941202.0244;25	`` Under such conditions , when this is the Syrian strategy , it is hard to understand why people with even minimal logic could even think about any withdrawal from the Golan , '' said Begin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;0	Author Robin Moore says he was surprised at how he easily obtained information in the former Soviet Union for his book about the Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;1	Moore , 69 , the author of the `` French Connection '' and `` The Green Berets , '' spoke Thursday at the Litchfield-Morris Rotary about his latest novel , `` The Moscow Connection , '' which grew out of a 1991 visit to Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;2	`` I was fascinated to find a new era of free speech , '' Moore told the group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;3	`` It seemed everything could be bought and sold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;4	You could even buy the KGB -- I did . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;5	The latest book is a thinly disguised work of fiction chronicling the rise of the Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;6	It was set in the wake of the failed coup that ended the reign of former Soviet President Mikhail S. Gorbachev in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;7	The book grew out of an invitation by the Moscow police to do a positive story about the department .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;8	When he got there , Moore said , he found the department so riddled with corruption that a positive story was impossible .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;9	Instead , he made friends with some honest officers who steered him to his latest work with tales of the existence of a Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;10	Moore hopes his book will expose the burgeoning Russian mafia and what he says is its vigorous trade in the nuclear weaponry of the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941202.0245;11	The Register Citizen newspaper in Torrington is serializing the novel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;0	The Croatian government and leaders of the rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday that , if implemented , could lead to normalized relations between the two enemies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;1	A six-month war in 1991 -- at the start of the violent breakup of Yugoslavia -- left Serbs in control of one-third of Croatian territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;2	There have been thousands of skirmishes and larger confrontations between the two since a January 1992 ceasefire halted the war , including artillery duels southeast of Knin which continued for the third day Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;3	The economic agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;4	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;5	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;6	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;7	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;8	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;9	`` For many people it has been senseless to be deprived of water , electricity , '' Owen said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;10	`` The basics of economic life can now be made available to all . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;11	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the agreement , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;12	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;13	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;14	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly , after a nearly eight-hour , closed-door session , approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;15	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;16	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent clandestine meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;17	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;18	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0246;19	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .

APW_ENG_19941202.0250;0	Arianespace , the world leader in commercial satellite launching , apologized Friday after a dlrs 150 million U.S. communications satellite crashed into Atlantic , but said the client has signed on for another try .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;1	Charles Bigot , Arianespace 's chief executive , said a failure in the third-stage engine caused an unmanned Ariane rocket to crash 15 minutes after takeoff Thursday from the launch center in French Guiana .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;2	Aboard was a sophisticated communications satellite built by Hughes Space and Communications of El Segundo , Calif. , for PanAmSat , a Greenwich , Conn.-based firm .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;3	The PamAmSat-3 satellite would have channeled telephone , fax and television communications for most of North and South America , Europe and Africa over 15 years , operating in geostationary orbit over the mid-Atlantic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;4	Bigot , answering reporters ' questions in a live hook-up from the launch center in South America , said it was too early to decide when Ariane launches would resume .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;5	He said a preliminary report on the crash was due by mid-December .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;6	He said the lost satellite had been insured , and PanAmSat was preparing a replacement satellite .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;7	Despite the accident , Bigot said PanAmSat had signed a contract for Arianespace to launch another satellite by the end of 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;8	`` While we are disappointed , PanAmSat has always recognized the risks inherent to this industry , '' said Fred Landman , PanAmSat 's president .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;9	`` PanAmSat 's aggressive recovery plan reflects our commitment to provide high-quality satellite international services to our customers as soon as possible . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;10	Arianespace technicians said the third-stage engine inexplicably lost pressure 218 kilometers -LRB- 135 miles -RRB- above Earth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;11	In January , a third-stage breakdown forced engineers to explode a rocket in mid-flight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;12	A Turkish and a European telecommunications satellites were also destroyed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;13	Six perfect launches followed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;14	Thursday 's crash was the seventh in 70 launches since the European Space Agency 's commercial Arianespace program lifted off 15 years ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;15	It should not shake Ariane 's dominance as the No. 1 launcher of lucrative private satellites -- the company now holds about 70 percent of the market .

APW_ENG_19941202.0250;17	Liftoff was on schedule , and the first two stages fired perfectly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;18	The third stage also lit properly , but then mysteriously sputtered and went out .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;19	Officials said that the third stage was a new type using a new oxygen-hydrogen mixture to maximize performance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;20	January 's accident was blamed on a turbo-pump failure freezing the third-stage rocket motor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0250;21	That failure followed 26 straight successful launches in which the European rocket distanced itself from its competitors , the United States and China .
