APW_ENG_19941202.0257;0	U.S. congressional clearance of a new world trade accord is expected to encourage ratification by other countries , allowing the mammoth export-boosting pact to take effect as planned on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;1	Large and small nations alike are trying to rush the 22,000-page GATT agreement through national parliaments , often in low-key processes compared to the rocky ride through Congress .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;2	Nearly 40 countries , including the United States , have now ratified the 124-nation agreement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;3	About 40 more -- including Japan , the European Union and Canada -- have said they will do so by year 's end .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;4	The head of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade , Peter Sutherland , said Friday that U.S. passage was a `` triumph '' that will help make the world a more prosperous place .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;5	`` This is a day for particular celebration , '' GATT Director-General Peter Sutherland told journalists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;6	`` The successful culmination of this debate proved that common sense still works . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;7	France added a note of caution about a U.S. provision which would allow it to withdraw quickly from the WTO in the event of three adverse trade rulings deemed unfair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;8	France may now press the EU to take out a similar safeguard .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;9	`` We have noted with satisfaction that Congress ratified the agreement , '' said a French Foreign Ministry spokeswoman , speaking on the usual condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;10	`` We are nevertheless concerned with certain aspects of the American application . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;11	The U.S. Senate approved the GATT treaty by 76-24 votes late Thursday -- a much bigger margin than expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;12	The House of Representatives cleared the deal earlier in the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;13	Congressional approval , uncertain for weeks , was deemed crucial for the the World Trade Organization to take effect on Jan. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;14	The WTO will implement the new accord and have more powers than GATT to settle trade disputes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;15	`` I warmly welcome the vote by the U.S. Senate , '' said European Union Trade Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan , Europe 's chief negotiator in the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;16	He said the 12-nation bloc would complete the approval process by Dec. 20 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;17	In Japan , Trade Minister Rytaro Hashimoto said U.S. ratification of the deal would encourage other countries to follow suit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;18	Japan 's powerful lower house of parliament passed the accord early Friday and it will now move to the upper house .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;19	This view was echoed by Hong Kong 's Director-General of Trade , Tony Miller .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;20	`` The world looks to the United States for leadership in promoting free trade under the multilateral regime , '' Miller said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;21	In Canberra , Australian Trade Minister Bob McMullan said the U.S. result was `` great news for Australia and the world economy generally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;22	Sutherland said he expected about 100 of GATT 's 124 member nations to ratify the trade accord by the end of the year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;23	The agreement is considered the most ambitious attempt ever to knock down barriers to free world trade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;24	The pact is expected to boost global income by dlrs 510 billion by the year 2005 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;25	It reduces customs duties on hundreds of thousands of products , liberalizes trade in service industries , protects against copyright theft and patent abuse and cuts protection of farm goods and textiles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0257;26	`` We will have a rules-based system that allows for the development of the world economy and provides an assurance of security , prosperity and reduction of tensions , '' Sutherland said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;0	A man threatening to detonate a bomb in a Ukrainian nuclear power plant unless unless he received dlrs 1 million has been arrested , a security service spokesman said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;1	The man , described only as `` Slav and young , '' was captured Thursday night after two days of telephone negotiations with `` high-level officials '' said Viktor Varenyk , Security Ministry press officer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;2	Varenyk said intelligence officers had so far failed to find any explosives in any of Ukraine 's five nuclear power plants , but had treated the threats as serious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;3	The incident was similar to a threat to blow up Lithuania 's main nuclear power plant earlier in November , unless a dlrs 8-million ransom was paid .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;4	The Ignalina plant was shut down , but no explosives were found .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;5	One man was arrested for that blackmail attempt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;6	The suspect captured in Kiev was taken into custody after police traced a telephone used by the caller , security officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;7	His capture came only hours before he was due to board a Lufthansa flight to Europe where a police trap had been laid for him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;8	Ukrainian state television showed pictures of a sealed box , said to contain over dlrs 650,000 , and cut diamonds valued at dlrs 350,000 being emptied from a Lufthansa bag .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;9	The blackmailer had demanded to be flown to western Europe together with the loot .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;10	Officials did not disclose where the explosives were alleged to have been planted , but the closest nuclear power station to Kiev is Chernobyl , site of the world 's worst nuclear power accident in 1986 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;11	Dozens of people died in the aftermath of an explosion in one of the plant 's four reactors and environmental groups say thousands have died since from fall-out of the radioactive cloud that swept across European nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;12	The director of Chernobyl , Sergei Parashyn , told The Associated Press that security had been increased and the search was continuing for suspicious devices .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;13	`` You know what happens in Chechnya with kidnaps and ransom demands , so anything is possible , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;14	Security at the station has been criticized as lax following the theft of ten nuclear fuel rods earlier this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0258;15	Varenyk , said , `` this incident must , after Chernobyl and what it means to Ukrainians , be treated as more than a normal crime . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;0	A man threatening to detonate a bomb in a Ukrainian nuclear power plant unless unless he received dlrs 1 million has been arrested , a security service spokesman said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;1	The man , described only as `` Slav and young , '' was captured Thursday night after two days of telephone negotiations with `` high-level officials '' said Viktor Varenyk , Security Ministry press officer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;2	Varenyk said intelligence officers had so far failed to find any explosives in any of Ukraine 's five nuclear power plants , but had treated the threats as serious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;3	The incident was similar to a threat to blow up Lithuania 's main nuclear power plant earlier in November , unless a dlrs 8-million ransom was paid .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;4	The Ignalina plant was shut down , but no explosives were found .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;5	One man was arrested for that blackmail attempt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;6	The suspect captured in Kiev was taken into custody after police traced a telephone used by the caller , security officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;7	His capture came only hours before he was due to board a Lufthansa flight to Europe where a police trap had been laid for him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;8	Ukrainian state television showed pictures of a sealed box , said to contain over dlrs 650,000 , and cut diamonds valued at dlrs 350,000 being emptied from a Lufthansa bag .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;9	The blackmailer had demanded to be flown to western Europe together with the loot .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;10	Officials did not disclose where the explosives were alleged to have been planted , but the closest nuclear power station to Kiev is Chernobyl , site of the world 's worst nuclear power accident in 1986 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;11	Dozens of people died in the aftermath of an explosion in one of the plant 's four reactors and environmental groups say thousands have died since from fall-out of the radioactive cloud that swept across European nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;12	The director of Chernobyl , Sergei Parashyn , told The Associated Press that security had been increased and the search was continuing for suspicious devices .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;13	`` You know what happens in Chechnya with kidnaps and ransom demands , so anything is possible , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;14	Security at the station has been criticized as lax following the theft of ten nuclear fuel rods earlier this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0260;15	Varenyk , said , `` this incident must , after Chernobyl and what it means to Ukrainians , be treated as more than a normal crime . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;0	A substantially bigger-than-expected gain in construction employment helped force the U.S. unemployment rate down two-tenths of a percent in November to the lowest level in four years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;1	The Labor Department said a seasonally adjusted 350,000 new workers were added to the nation 's nonfarm payrolls , pushing the unemployment rate to 5.6 percent from 5.8 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;2	That is the lowest level since August 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;3	Labor Secretary Robert Reich called the report `` great news '' and evidence of a continued strong economic recovery .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;4	`` I 've been calling it the Goldie Locks expansion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;5	It 's not too hot , it 's not too cold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;6	It 's not hot enough to ignite inflation , but it does n't seem to be cooling off at all , '' he said in an interview with The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;7	`` This is really very impressive , '' said Robert G. Dederick , an economic consultant with Northern Trust Co. in Chicago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;8	`` The economy continues to surprise us on the up side .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;9	The job market is still very vigorous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;10	Financial markets appeared to welcome the report .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;11	Bond prices advanced , with the yield on the U.S. Treasury 's benchmark 30-year issue falling to 7.95 percent from 8.01 percent late Thursday ; the dollar surged , rising above 100 yen for the first time in nearly two months ; stock prices were mixed in early trading .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;12	The jobless rate has been declining all year , dropping 1.1 percent since January .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;13	The nation 's nonfarm payrolls have increased by 2.6 million people this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;14	The report suggests the economy is still growing at a robust pace and employment growth remains strong .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;15	However , the government 's chief forecasting gauge of future economic activity pointed in the other direction , falling in October for the first time in 15 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;16	The Index of Leading Economic Indicators slipped 0.1 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;17	In another report , the government said orders to U.S. factories fell in October for the first time in three months , led by a sharp drop for cars and other transportation equipment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;18	In advance of the unemployment report , most economists were expecting the unemployment rate to remain at 5.8 percent and nonfarm payrolls to increase by about 250,000 workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;19	Even the most optimistic analysts were expecting an increase no bigger than 280,000 jobs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;20	Strong employment growth this year was one of the factors that prompted the Federal Reserve to raise short-term interest rates last month for a sixth time this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;21	Last month , the central bank raised key rates three-quarters of a percentage point , the largest increase in 13 years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;22	Higher interest rates are meant to curb inflation , which bothers investors because it lowers the value of their holdings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;23	Marilyn Schaja , an economist with Donaldson , Lufkin and Jenrette Securities in New York said the report could provide impetus for another round of interest rate increases .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;24	She said with the unemployment rate as low as it is `` we are going to see some inflationary pressures . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;25	The large number of new hires was boosted by unexpectedly robust growth in construction employment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;26	The Labor Department said 71,000 jobs were added to construction industry payrolls in November .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;27	Katharine G. Abraham , commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics , said construction employment benefited from the return of some construction employees in the Southeast who had been unable to work because of heavy rains in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;28	A modest 4,000 construction jobs were added in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;29	Manufacturing employment also was robust , jumping 51,000 after increases of just over 18,000 in the previous three months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0261;30	Abraham said gains were recorded in manufacturing of durable goods , including lumber , fabricated metals , industrial machinery and electronic equipment .

APW_ENG_19941202.0267;0	The U.S. Postal Service on Friday defended its stamp recalling the atomic bombing of Japan saying that it could not omit such a major event from its World War II history series .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;1	The stamp , showing a mushroom-shaped cloud rising from an atomic blast , is one of a set of 10 stamps marking major events of 1945 to be sold on a sheet titled `` 1945 : Victory at Last . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;2	Forty stamps have already been issued in similar sets for the 50th anniversary of the 1941-44 war years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;3	But the atomic bomb stamp is drawing sharp criticism in Japan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;4	Sunao Tsuboi , acting director of the 30,000-member Hiroshima Prefectural Confederation of A-bomb Survivors Organizations , termed it `` outrageous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;5	Japan surrendered Aug. 15 , 1945 , days after atomic bombs were dropped on the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;6	`` Atomic bombs hasten war 's end , August 1945 , '' says the caption on the mushroom cloud stamp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;7	Postal Service spokesman Robin Wright said the World War II series was developed in cooperation with the State and Defense departments to assure historical accuracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;8	As far as the atomic bomb stamp , he said , `` we would be remiss in omitting such a watershed and historically critical event as the use of the atomic bomb . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;9	`` Our purpose is to provide a comprehensive history of events of World War II , and we are not making a value judgment on any of those events , '' Wright added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;10	Other stamps in the 1945 set picture U.S. Marines raising the American flag on Iwo Jima , `` Okinawa , the last big battle , '' liberations of Manila and of Holocaust survivors in Europe , Germany 's surrender at Reims , refugees uprooted by war and U.S. celebrations of Japanese surrender .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;11	The 1941 set , titled `` A World at War '' included stamps showing Japanese bombing Pearl Harbor , Hawaii , and President Roosevelt and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill framing the Atlantic Charter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0267;12	The 1944 set , titled `` Road to Victory '' included the allied Normandy landings , the liberation of Rome and the battles of Leyte Gulf in the Pacific and the Bulge in Belgium .

APW_ENG_19941202.0273;6	Among the issues discussed were a rookie salary cap , salary arbitration and free agency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;7	But the major obstacle , the luxury tax , was apparently set aside for the moment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;8	NHL commissioner Gary Bettman did not speak to reporters following the meetings Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;9	`` He 's feeling a little bit exhausted right now because they worked very hard .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;10	Both sides worked hard , '' league spokesman Arthur Pincus said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;11	`` Talking is the only way to make a deal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;12	So talks continuing has to be taken as that all by itself .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;13	I do n't want to characterize it any more than that . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;14	Since the owners locked out the players Oct. 1 , the season has been pared to 60 games , with 24 games stripped from each team .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;15	CP reported the union has dropped its desired salary ceiling to dlrs 1.25 million from dlrs 1.5 million for first-round players , while the NHL remained at dlrs 700,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;16	On salary arbitration , the NHL wants to retain its right to have an arbitrator 's decision to be non-binding on the team .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;17	Rather than paying the awarded salary , a team could allow the player to become an unrestricted free agent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;18	The league also proposed that only two players per team per year be eligible for salary arbitration .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;19	The NHLPA wants arbitration to be binding .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;20	The two sides agreed that , in an arbitration case , an unrestricted free agent 's contract can not be used to provide comparisons and arrive at a decision , a source told CP .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;21	On free agency , both sides agreed that players shall become unrestricted free agents upon reaching age 28 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;22	Each team would be allowed to designate one player as a franchise player .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;23	The NHL Players Association agreed to this proposal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;24	The franchise player could be kept three years beyond his 28th birthday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0273;25	The owners want the franchise player to be the highest-paid player on the team , while the NHLPA 's position is that the franchise player would be any player earning the average of the top 26 salaries in the league -- about dlrs 3 million a season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;0	The Croatian government and leaders of the rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday that could lead to normalized relations between the two enemies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;1	The pact calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;2	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;3	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;4	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;5	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;6	`` For many people it has been senseless to be deprived of water , electricity , '' Owen added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;7	`` The basics of economic life can now be made available to all . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;8	A six-month war in 1991 -- at the start of the violent breakup of Yugoslavia -- left Serbs in control of one-third of Croatian territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;9	There have been thousands of skirmishes and larger confrontations between the two since a January 1992 ceasefire halted the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;10	The two sides traded artillery fire southeast of Knin for the third day Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;11	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the agreement , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;12	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;13	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;14	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly , after a nearly eight-hour , closed-door session , approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;15	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;16	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent clandestine meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;17	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;18	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0274;19	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .

APW_ENG_19941202.0290;6	Bouchard 's emergency hospitalization throws into doubt the role the Bloc Quebecois leader will play in next year 's critical referendum on separation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0290;7	French-speaking Quebec has long sought some form of sovereignty or separation from the rest of Canada , which is largely English-speaking .

APW_ENG_19941202.0290;11	The rapidly-spreading flesh-eating disease is caused by a virulent form of streptococcus bacteria that enters the body through a cut or a wound and produces an infection .

APW_ENG_19941202.0293;0	After a slow start , Haiti is moving swiftly to solidify its democratic institutions , appointing a new 11-member Supreme Court and formally placing the army-controlled police under civilian command .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;1	In another supportive step , 250 former Haitian boat people were heading home Friday to become members of the internationally supervised interim police force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;2	The separation of the police and military , stipulated in the 1987 Constitution , was approved by the Senate on Wednesday night but only announced on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;3	It will become law when it appears in the official government gazette , Le Moniteur .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;4	`` The armed forces reform law is a historic break with our repressive political past , '' Sen. Jean-Robert Martinez told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;5	The appointment of new Supreme Court is another building block to establishing civil justice in a land that has been ruled by the gun for most of its history .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;6	The new chief justice , Clauzel Debrosse , had been an existing member of the Supreme Court but an opponent of the military overthrow in 1991 of elected President Jean-Bertrand Aristide , who returned to power in October after U.S. military intervention .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;7	`` We wanted to reward Debrosse for his opposition to de facto rule , '' said Martinez , an Aristide supporter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;8	Aristide , in conformity with the constitution , chose the judges from a Senate list of three for each seat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;9	The array of judicial moves reflects the desire by Aristide to strengthen civilian authority as rapidly as possible .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;10	Thousands of American and other foreign troops are guaranteeing the peace now , but U.S. Republican leaders are urging the Clinton administration to hasten the pullout of GIs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;11	The widely popular Aristide , wary of those who overthrew him three years ago , is quickly reassigning senior military officers to overseas posts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;12	U.S. Embassy spokesman Stanley Schrager confirmed Friday that former Haitian military chief Jean-Claude Duperval was being transferred to a diplomatic post in Brazil and Brig. Gen. Max Mayard was heading to a similar military attache position in Ecuador .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;13	The other two generals during the 1991-4 military rule , Lt. Gen. Raoul Cedras and Brig. Gen. Philippe Biamby , quit and fled to self-imposed exile in Panama two days before Aristide 's return .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;14	Aristide has pledged to slice the size of the army from 7,500 to 1,500 and to create a 4,000-member civilian police force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;15	The 250 Haitians joining the interim police force Friday were recruited and trained in the refugee tent camp at the U.S. base in Guantanamo Bay , Cuba .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;16	They were among tens of thousands of Haitians who fled their nation under military rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;17	Another 750 refugees-turned-police will arrive in Haiti in the next three weeks , Schrager , the U.S. spokesman , told the AP .
APW_ENG_19941202.0293;18	`` In coming weeks , they will be used in police support positions by both the Haitian government and the I.P.M. , '' said Paul Browne , spokesman for the 800-member 20-nation International Police Monitor corps that is supervising police work .

APW_ENG_19941202.0294;6	`` It 's an IAAF Marshall Plan , '' Winner said , referring to the massive U.S. aid project for Europe after World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0294;7	Although many of the world 's top track and field stars are Americans , the sport has suffered from a lack of exposure and popularity in the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0294;8	On another issue , Nebiolo said the timetable for track and field events in Atlanta was still under study and no fixed date had been set to annouce the schedule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0294;9	The timetable has been held up by debate over the timing of the men 's marathon .
APW_ENG_19941202.0294;10	The IAAF wants to start the race in late afternoon to culminate with the Games ' closing ceremony , but several runners and medical experts have said it would be hazardous to compete at that hour in Atlanta 's notorious heat and humidity .

APW_ENG_19941202.0295;1	The ferry sank a half hour later , a one-meter -LRB- three-foot -RRB- hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;2	At least 34 people drowned .

APW_ENG_19941202.0295;12	The radio room may have been severely damaged because the distress signals came from other ships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;13	Maximo Calamba , who was rescued with his wife and 1-year-old son , said he heard many cries for help .

APW_ENG_19941202.0295;15	We were thrown off our cots and everybody was on their own . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0295;17	The freighter , five times the ferry 's size , destroyed the bridge and tore a gaping hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;18	The captain and his mates were in the bridge , the control section of the ferry , said one crewman , Jacob Cabatuan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;19	They were among the missing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;20	The cause of the accident , which occurred in calm seas under clear night skies , is under investigation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;21	The company that owns the ferry said it was rammed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;22	Danny Dalugdog , a driver and bodyguard , was separated from his wife and 3-month-old son in the confusion .

APW_ENG_19941202.0295;30	`` Tomorrow we will go back to unlock them . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;31	Cargo containers and rubber rafts floated in the sea , but many survivors apparently never got a chance to use them .

APW_ENG_19941202.0295;35	The ferry 's owner , the William Lines shipping company , said 608 people were on board .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;36	The accident coincided with the company 's initial public stock offering Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0295;37	The ferry , which can carry 800 people , was en route to Tagbilaran , capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .

APW_ENG_19941202.0297;0	Swedish divers prowled inside the sunken ferry Estonia for the first time Friday , finding decks `` demolished '' after the ship 's 60-meter plunge to the Baltic Sea floor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;1	Maritime authorities declined to say whether the divers found any bodies in the wreck , where an estimated 800 people were entombed when the ferry sank on Sept. 28 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;2	`` It 's extremely demolished , '' Swedish maritime administration spokesman Lars-Goran Bronow told the news agency TT .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;3	`` It happened when the ship turned upside down . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;4	The ferry sank in about 30 minutes after a storm ripped off its front cargo door .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;5	Investigators say it capsized and probably rolled over completely before hitting bottom .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;6	It now lies on its side 56-84 meters -LRB- 180-280 feet -RRB- under water off Finland 's southwestern coast .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;7	Divers had examined two of the ship 's six decks as of Friday afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;8	Weather permitting , teams of six divers plan to work in shifts around the clock for four days surveying the ship 's interior , authorities said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;9	They will work their way into the bridge , where authorities hope to retreive navigational computers and other records that might provide clues about what happened , Bronow said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;10	`` The weather conditions are good .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;11	The weather wo n't hinder the work , '' Bronow told TT earlier .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;12	Working in near-freezing water , the divers ' mission is to gather evidence to help authorities decide whether to raise the ship , retreive the bodies or take some other action .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;13	Of the estimated 1,049 people on the ferry , 137 survived , according to the latest figures published Friday by the Finnish police .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;14	Only 94 bodies have been recovered .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;15	The rest are believed in the ship , although officials have said they may never know the exact number because of unreliable passenger lists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;16	Authorities said they will not disclose any divers ' information about bodies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;17	Each diver was required to sign a contract barring him from describing the scene to anybody but investigators and officials , Swedish media reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;18	`` -LRB- This -RRB- mission does not include bringing anybody to the surface , '' Swedish Communications Minister Ines Uusmann told the newspaper Aftonbladet .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;19	Swedish authorities hope to decide on a course of action by mid-December , and were focusing on several options .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;20	In one , salvagers could scour the wreck to retrieve all the bodies they find , or could do that plus flip it over using cables to find more bodies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;21	They also could leave all the bodies and fill the wreck with sand to `` bury '' the victims and protect the wreck from scavengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;22	The divers are working from a large , floating research platform called SEMI 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;23	The work was scheduled to begin Wednesday , but was delayed because the ships apparently had been given the wrong coordinates for the wreck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0297;24	The Swedish government , meanwhile , said Friday it has decided to give 3 million kronor -LRB- dlrs 417,000 -RRB- to organizations helping victims ' families , in many cases including orphans .

APW_ENG_19941202.0300;1	In a report to Congress on PLO compliance with the peace agreement with Israel , the State Department said that the Palestinian Liberation Organization `` both in its words and deeds is negotiating in good faith and is demonstrating that it recognizes Israel 's right to exist . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;2	A copy of the report to be made public later Friday was obtained by The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;3	The report criticized Palestinian police as not being `` as effective as they could have been in halting acts of violence . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;4	It also expressed disappointment that the PLO has not yet amended its covenant to delete language calling for the destruction of Israel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;5	The report said Arafat has assured Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of his commitment to amend the covenant `` but did not present a definitive timetable . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;6	Congress required the administration to report every six months on the progress of PLO compliance with its commitments to renounce terrorism , amend its covenant , and end the economic boycott of Israel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;7	The report said that during the past six months groups opposed to the peace process -- Hamas and the Palestine Islamic Jihad -- `` have launched a concerted effort to undermine negotiations by killing Israelis and discrediting the authority and effectiveness of the Palestinian Authority . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;8	During that period 39 Israelis have been killed , six of them in areas controlled by the Palestinian Authority .
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;9	`` These terrorist groups do not belong to or operate under the control of the PLO and have openly opposed Arafat because of his commitment to make peace with Israel , '' the department said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;10	It said the PLO has `` moved to condemn terrorist attacks in a more timely , direct and authoritative manner . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;11	But it also said the Palestinian police `` have not been as effective as they could be , in particular in terms of following up detentions with effective investigations , actual prosecution and incarceration of those responsible . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;12	It also said that `` the Palestinian police have not been effective in locating terrorist operatives who are organized in small compartmented cells . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;13	As for the economic boycott , the report said that the PLO has `` signed a detailed economic protocol with Israel which represents a de facto reversal of the PLO 's traditional support for the boycott . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0300;14	At the same , the State Department noted that the PLO `` has not explicitly called for an end to any aspect of the boycott . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0306;25	Each team would be allowed to designate one player as a franchise player .

APW_ENG_19941202.0309;0	The U.S. dollar rose against most major currencies Friday and breached the 100-yen mark for the first time in seven weeks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0309;1	The surge followed release of better-than-expected employment data , which heightened expectations of another rise in short-term interest rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0309;2	The U.S. Labor Department announced the unemployment rate down two-tenths of a percent in November to the lowest level in four years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0309;3	A total of 350,000 new workers were added to the nation 's nonfarm payroll .
APW_ENG_19941202.0309;4	`` The implication is that U.S. rates will go up again in January or February , '' said Stewart Frost , an analyst at Natwest Markets in London .
APW_ENG_19941202.0309;5	`` The market was expecting the figure to be about 200,000 , '' Frost added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0309;6	`` Also , the price of U.S. Treasury Bonds is holding up , suggesting they are undervalued . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0310;0	Serbian police have arrested 156 ethnic Albanians , all former police officers , in the restive Kosovo province , the public prosecutor announced Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;1	In the first official confirmation of the crackdown over the past ten days , Serbian prosecutor Miodrag Brkljac said the ethnic Albanians were members of an illegal group which planned `` armed rebellion against '' Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;2	It was the biggest police raid in Kosovo since 1989 when Serbia revoked the autonomy of its southern province , where ethnic Albanians comprise 90 percent of the 1.9 million population .
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;3	Serbian police now keep a firm grip on any ethnic Albanian dissent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;4	Ethnic Albanian officials , who have formed a parallel structures in Kosovo , staunchly deny that they plan any armed rebellion against Serbia , saying that would be against their peaceful resistance policy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;5	However , the prosecutor told reporters that the detained ethnic Albanians had formed `` a parallel army , collected information about -LRB- Serbian -RRB- police and the military and planned liquidation of prominent Serbs in Kosovo . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;6	Azem Vlasi , representing the arrested , claimed that the detained `` are being physically harassed in order to confess . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;7	An independent Serbian human rights organization protested the arrests , saying they show that `` the regime is suppressing the alternative government in Kosovo by violating human rights and intimidating citizens . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0310;8	Serbia regards Kosovo the cradle of its history and culture and has vowed never to give it up to the ethnic Albanians who seek independence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;0	Human rights groups sharply criticized Russian authorities Friday for carrying out a Turkmen request to detain a leading dissident .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;1	The Federal Counterintelligence Service last week detained Murad Esenov , a correspondent for Radio Liberty and prominent Turkmen activist living in Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;2	Human rights groups linked Esenov 's detention to a recent crackdown on opposition activity by Turkmen President Saparmurat Niyazov .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;3	According to the group Human Rights Watch-Helsinki , Niyazov called for the arrest and repatriation of several leading critics , including Esenov , in order `` to neutralize the activities of the traitors of the homeland . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;4	Human Rights Watch also said Esenov was badly beaten in a street attack in Moscow in October in an attack that may have been politically motivated .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;5	It said he was awaiting extradition in a Moscow jail .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;6	Acting Russian Prosecutor General Alexei Ilyushenko confirmed that Esenov was detained after a delegation from Turkmenistan came to Moscow with a request for his arrest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;7	But , Ilyushekno told a news conference , the request was not properly documented , and Esenov was only being detained while an investigation is carried out .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;8	Ilyushenko said there were no immediate plans to send Esenov and several other detained Turkmen dissidents back home .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;9	`` Nobody is talking about extraditing them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;10	They have not been arrested , they have been detained , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;11	The Nezavisimaya Gazeta newspaper said Esenov had received phone threats saying that if he did not stop his dissident activity he would be deported to Turkmenistan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;12	Russia 's constitution forbids extraditing anyone for political activity , but if Turkmen authorities can provide evidence of criminal offenses , Esenov and the other dissidents may be sent back .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;13	Once back in Turkmenistan , the dissidents could face the death penalty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;14	Niyazov was Turkmenistan 's former Communist Party boss and has been its president since Soviet times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;15	After a referendum last January , he will be allowed to remain in office until June 21 , 2002 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0311;16	Both Azerbaijan and Armenia have also appealed to Russia to extradite opposition leaders in recent months .

APW_ENG_19941202.0314;0	Nick Faldo of England shot eight birdies Friday for a record-tying 64 and a seven-stroke lead after two rounds of the Million Dollar Challenge golf tournament .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;1	Faldo 's 130 total -- 14 under par -- at the halfway point set a tournament record , and the 64 score tied Lee Trevino for lowest round on the par 72 Gary Player Country Club course .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;2	A second-place finisher three times in the tournament with golf 's richest first prize -- dlrs 1 million -- Faldo finished seven shots ahead of British Open champion Nick Price of Zimbabwe and Bernhard Langer of Germany , with U.S. Open champion Ernie Els of South Africa another shot back .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;3	Like in the first round , Faldo 's precision kept him out of trouble and set up repeated birdie putts with the cross-hand grip adopted in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;4	He made eight birdies for the second straight day , and shot par the rest of the way to improve over the first-day 66 that included two bogies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;5	`` That was the best nine holes I have ever played , '' Faldo said of back nine , when he birdied five straight holes and two others for a 29 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;6	`` I 'm going off now to find some starch and spray myself to see if I can stay in this mode , '' he joked , adding : `` This is as good as I have ever played .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;7	Perhaps my swing had a little more zip in 1989 , but technically I am a better player now . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;8	Price , the world 's top rated player this year and defending champion , came back from a poor-putting first round 71 to fire a six-under 66 , while Langer followed his first day 68 with a three-under 69 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;9	Both were at 137 , one shot ahead of Els , who shot a two-under 70 Friday after a four-under 68 in the first round .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;10	David Frost of South Africa and Tom Lehman of the United States tied at four-under-par 140 , 10 strokes off the pace , followed by Mark McNulty of Zimbabwe and Corey Pavin of the United States at 141 , American Hale Irwin at 142 and Colin Montgomerie of Scotland at 143 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;11	Seve Ballesteros of Spain at 147 and Vijay Singh of Fiji at 153 brought up the rear .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;12	Faldo said he intended to keep playing aggressively despite his large lead in the 12-player tournament that includes 11 of the 20 top rated golfers in the world .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;13	`` I ca n't afford to get too defensive or some of these guys can shoot a great round and get within a couple of shots tomorrow , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;14	But Price , who was back using his favorite putter that was repaired after breaking in transit , gave himself only an `` outside chance '' of closing the gap .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;15	`` Faldo is going to have to make some mistakes before anyone can catch him , '' Price said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0314;16	`` It 's really up to him now . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;0	Quebec separatist leader Lucien Bouchard had his left leg amputated after being attacked by a strain of flesh-eating bacteria , but is out of danger , doctors said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;1	Bouchard , who heads the Bloc Quebecois , the main opposition party in Canada 's parliament , was reported in serious condition by officials at Montreal 's Saint-Luc hospital following surgery Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;2	Hospital deputy director Robert Raciot said Friday that reports that the 55-year-old Bouchard was on the verge of death were untrue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;3	His doctor , Patrick d'Amico , said Bouchard underwent three operations Tuesday to combat the rapid spread of necrotizing fasciitis , a virulent form of streptococcus bacteria .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;4	The bacteria enter the body through a cut or a wound .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;5	He now faces three or four months rehabilitation , doctors said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;6	Bouchard vowed in a letter to his supporters that he will continue his political career .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;7	News of Bouchard 's illness shook Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;8	Small groups of people , some bearing Quebec flags , kept an all-night vigil outside the hospital under a light snowfall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;9	The fledgling Bloc Quebecois became the official opposition in Ottawa after last year 's federal election .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;10	The party , devoted to independence for French-speaking Quebec , won 54 out of 75 seats in the province .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;11	Since then , Bouchard has played a powerful role as the separatist standard-bearer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;12	The separatist government in Quebec , which came to power this fall , has promised to hold a referendum on independence next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;13	But the leadership Bouchard was expected to provide in the campaign is now in doubt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;14	Prime Minister Jean Chretien , in Paris for a summit on AIDS , said it was a time to put political differences aside and express `` our personal solidarity with the suffering of a fellow human being . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;15	Dr. Michel Poisson , head of microbiology at Montreal 's Hotel-Dieu hospital , said doctors would have to wait 24 to 48 hours after the surgery to make sure they had removed all infected flesh .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;16	The flesh-destroying bacteria have been linked to about a dozen recent deaths in Britain and elsewhere .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;17	The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta estimates there are 500 to 1,500 cases of deadly strains of the bacteria in the United States each year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0315;18	The fatality rate is about 30 percent .

APW_ENG_19941202.0318;0	A beautiful Russian Orthodox cross an Idaho man secreted out of the communist country 27 years ago is returning to the faithful in Boise .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;1	`` It really needs to go home , '' Quinten Crockett said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;2	`` It means a lot to me .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;3	But it means more to them . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;4	On Sunday , Crockett will give the cross to the St. Seraphim of Sarov Russian Orthodox Church in Boise during a special service .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;5	`` The cross in our church is a very powerful symbol of our victory over sin , '' said the Rev. David Moser , St. Seraphim 's minister .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;6	`` We tend to look at things that have survived the ravages of times and persecutions as kind of special .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;7	They are a symbol of our ability to overcome trial . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;8	Crockett bought the cross on the Russian black market 27 years ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;9	A man approached him with an offer to sell religious icons , but only for American money .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;10	They agreed on a purchase price : $ 10 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;11	The cross 's history is uncertain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;12	But many similar icons were taken from Russian Orthodox churches and hidden during the Russian Revolution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;13	Tiny figures in relief depict the crucifixion of Christ .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;14	On the back are words scratched in old Slavic , a language all but gone in Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;15	Crockett knew all religious materials were considered property of the state and would be confiscated when he left the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;16	But he outsmarted border guards by stuffing the 18-inch icon down his pants and covering the top with his untucked shirt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;17	Crockett kept the cross as a memento of his trip and of the people he met in the Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;18	`` The same spirit I feel in the Mormon Temple , I felt in the Orthodox churches , '' said Crockett , who is LDS .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;19	The cross is believed to have come from a small country church .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;20	`` And it 's going to go to a little church , '' Crockett said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;21	`` It 's time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0318;22	It 's like if someone had an old , original Book of Mormon and was n't sharing it with anyone . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0320;1	The new communist government is required under the constitution to win the vote because it did not have the required majority in the 205-member House of Representatives .
APW_ENG_19941202.0320;2	`` I have talked to all the leaders of other political parties , '' Prime Minister Man Mohan Adhikari said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0321;0	The United States , France , Britain , Germany and Russia were meeting Friday to discuss new ideas for peace in Bosnia , including a suggestion of a confederation between Bosnian Serbs and Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations gathered after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;2	Thus , Christopher sought to heal a rift with NATO allies France and Britain over the alliance 's use of force in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;3	On a visit to the NATO headquarters Thursday , Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev said he endorsed a confederation of Bosnian Serbs with neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;4	`` We do support the suggestion -LRB- of -RRB- an unambiguous recognition '' of Bosnian Serbs ' right to forge political links with the government in Belgrade , Kozyrev told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;5	He met here with Christopher in the margin of a NATO meeting before going over to the EU headquarters for the Contact Group talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;6	A U.S. official said Christopher 's `` understanding of Foreign Minister Kozyrev 's position is very clear , '' but that a Bosnian Serbs-Serbia political alliance was `` not a proposal we support at this time . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;7	Also attending the meeting were Douglas Hurd and Alain Juppe , the British and French foreign ministers who will go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , on Sunday for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;8	The Contact Group , officials said , hoped to launch a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;9	It was expected to call for a cease-fire around Bihac , the northwestern Muslim enclave that Serbs are pummeling , a pledge to cease hostilities across Bosnia for up to six months , followed by an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;10	On offer for the Bosnian Serbs , who control about 70 percent of Bosnia , would be an opportunity to press their demand for cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;11	Hurd said this week that would not amount to giving in to Serb aspirations of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;12	The current peace plan , that Bosnian Serbs have rejected , envisions a confederation between Croatia and the Muslim-led government in Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;13	The core of the peace plan Bosnian Serbs have rejected is a division of Bosnia that would required them to return much territory they have seized in battle .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;14	The Contact Group meeting caps an eventful week in which U.N. Secretary General Boutros-Boutros Ghali failed in his bid to meet with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Kardazic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;15	More than 400 of the 24,000 U.N. soldiers in Bosnia are being detained by the Serbs as insurance against NATO airstrikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0321;16	NATO struck three times last week , but the attacks did nothing to stop the Serb assault on Bihac .

APW_ENG_19941202.0323;1	Khan , seeking to win the Qatar title for the third straight year , routed Harris , the world 's No. 20 , 15-4 , 15-3 , 15-10 in just 36 minutes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0323;2	In Saturday 's final , Khan will play Australia 's Rodney Eyles , world ranked No. 54 , who downed England 's Chris Walker in the other semifinal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0323;3	`` I 'm playing better and better every day , '' said Khan , who has won the World and British Opens this year as well as tournaments in Hong Kong , Japan , Portugal and Austria .
APW_ENG_19941202.0323;4	During 1994 , Khan has only lost once and that was at the start of the year against Scotland 's Peter Nicol at the Welsh Classic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0323;5	Eyles took 54 minutes to beat the sixth-ranked Walker 15-13 , 10-15 , 15-12 , 15-9 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0323;6	Eyles can also take comfort from being one of the few to have beaten Khan , having done so at the 1993 Portuguese Open by coming from two games behind and two match balls down to win .

APW_ENG_19941202.0324;1	Rauf Denktash told reporters after the 50-minute meeting that he understood Boutros-Ghali would instruct his representative on the divided Mediterranean island to organize fresh talks between the opposing Turkish Cypriot and Greek Cypriot sides .
APW_ENG_19941202.0324;2	`` We are ready to continue the talks ... with political equality and Swiss-like sovereignty , '' said Denktash .
APW_ENG_19941202.0324;3	Denktash met informally with President Glafcos Clerides , leader of the majority Christian Greeks , five times this fall as part of a confidence-building exercise to gain each other 's trust .
APW_ENG_19941202.0324;4	They were the first meetings between the two leaders in a year .

APW_ENG_19941202.0324;6	Turkish Cypriots declared a breakaway republic in the north in 1983 , but only Turkey recognizes it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0324;7	The main sticking points are the Turkish Cypriot demand for recognition of their breakaway state , and their rejection of the U.N. Security Council resolutions demanding the withdrawal of some 35,00 Turkish troops and 50,000 mainland settlers .

APW_ENG_19941202.0326;0	An anti-abortion activist who killed a doctor and his escort in a shotgun attack was sentenced by a federal judge on Friday to life in prison .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;1	The judge sentenced Paul Hill to two life terms for violating the new federal clinic protection law .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;2	Hill faces the death penalty when he is sentenced Tuesday in state court for the same shootings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;3	Hill , 40 , showed no emotion as U.S. District Judge Roger Vinson handed down the life sentences and a 10-year sentence for wounding a third victim .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;4	The sentences are to run concurrently .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;5	Dr. John Bayard Britton , 69 , and retired Air Force Lt. Col. James Barrett , 74 , died in the shotgun attack July 29 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;6	Barrett 's wife , June , 69 , was wounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;7	Hill was the first person convicted of violating the new federal abortion clinic protection law .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;8	Vinson also ordered Hill to serve an additional five years in prison for firearm violations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;9	Hill represented himself at both his state and federal trials , offering no evidence and declining to question witnesses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;10	He was not allowed to argue that the murders were justifiable homicide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;11	Hill told the judge Friday that he shot the doctor because `` I was trying to prevent Dr. Britton from killing the 30 people he was going to kill that day . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;12	He has argued that killing of abortion providers is justified to prevent abortions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;13	Vinson said he did not doubt Hill 's sincerity about believing he had a higher motive , but disagreed with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;14	`` God does not look with favor on the taking of any human life , '' Vinson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;15	`` The killing of a person is not intrinsically wrong -- if that person deserves death , '' Hill said in an interview broadcast Thursday on CBS .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;16	`` My actions were to defend the innocent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;17	Therefore , I am certainly guilty of no crimes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0326;18	As a matter of fact , my actions are honorable . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;0	Swedish divers looked inside the sunken ferry Estonia for the first time on Friday , finding decks `` demolished '' after the ship 's 200-foot -LRB- 60-meter -RRB- plunge to the Baltic Sea floor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;1	Maritime authorities declined to say whether the divers found any bodies in the wreck , where an estimated 800 people were entombed when the ferry sank on Sept. 28 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;2	`` It 's extremely demolished , '' Swedish maritime administration spokesman Lars-Goran Bronow told the news agency TT .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;3	`` It happened when the ship turned upside down . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;4	The ferry sank in about 30 minutes after a storm ripped off its front cargo door .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;5	Investigators say it capsized and probably rolled over completely before hitting bottom .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;6	It now lies on its side 180-280 feet -LRB- 56-84 -RRB- meters under water off Finland 's southwestern coast .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;7	Divers had examined two of the ship 's six decks as of Friday afternoon .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;8	Weather permitting , teams of six divers plan to work in shifts around the clock for four days surveying the ship 's interior , authorities said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;9	They will work their way into the bridge , where authorities hope to retreive navigational computers and other records that might provide clues about what happened , Bronow said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;10	`` The weather conditions are good .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;11	The weather wo n't hinder the work , '' Bronow told TT earlier .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;12	Working in near-freezing water , the divers ' mission is to gather evidence to help authorities decide whether to raise the ship , retreive the bodies or take some other action .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;13	Of the estimated 1,049 people on the ferry , 137 survived , according to the latest figures published Friday by the Finnish police .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;14	Only 94 bodies have been recovered .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;15	The rest are believed in the ship , although officials have said they may never know the exact number because of unreliable passenger lists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;16	Authorities said they will not disclose any divers ' information about bodies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;17	Each diver was required to sign a contract barring him from describing the scene to anybody but investigators and officials , Swedish media reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;18	`` -LRB- This -RRB- mission does not include bringing anybody to the surface , '' Swedish Communications Minister Ines Uusmann told the newspaper Aftonbladet .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;19	Swedish authorities hope to decide on a course of action by mid-December , and were focusing on several options .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;20	In one , salvagers could scour the wreck to retrieve all the bodies they find , or could do that plus flip it over using cables to find more bodies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;21	They also could leave all the bodies and fill the wreck with sand to `` bury '' the victims and protect the wreck from scavengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;22	The divers are working from a large , floating research platform called SEMI 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;23	The work was scheduled to begin Wednesday , but was delayed because the ships apparently had been given the wrong coordinates for the wreck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0327;24	The Swedish government , meanwhile , said Friday it has decided to give 3 million kronor -LRB- dlrs 417,000 -RRB- to organizations helping victims ' families , in many cases including orphans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;0	The Danish capital , already filled with bicyclists on city streets , hopes it found a way to get even more people on two wheels -- for free .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;1	Sponsors on Friday showed bikes that people will be allowed to ride at no cost , starting next spring .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;2	Though a previous free-bike program failed before , Danish officials think they 've solved the problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;3	Under the new private initiative backed by government officials , bicyclists will have to deposit a 20-kroner coin -LRB- dlrs 3.30 -RRB- at a special rack to pick up one of the 1,000 city-provided bikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;4	The money will be returned when the bike is taken back to any one of 200 racks located throughout the city .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;5	`` In a city where everyone is bicycling there 's a need for free bikes , '' said Bente Frost , Copenhagen 's transportation mayor , after her maiden ride on a Bycykel , which means City Bike in Danish .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;6	Thirty percent of Copenhagen residents ride bikes to work during the summer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;7	Frost said up to 5,000 bicycles would be ready when Copenhagen becomes the European cultural capital in 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;8	Each year about 27,000 bicycles are stolen in Copenhagen , costing insurance companies 41 million kroner -LRB- dlrs 6.7 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;9	The city hopes the program will help the environment and curb bicycle thefts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;10	Would-be thieves are discouraged from stealing the bike for refitting because none of the Bycykel 's parts fit to standard bicycles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;11	Morten Sadolin , a businessman who helped design the project , said they also planned poster campaigns to tell people that if a Bycykel is seen `` miles outside Copenhagen , it must be stolen . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;12	The easily recognizable Bycykel has advertisements from sponsors on the clumsy-looking frame .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;13	It has no speeds and will only be suitable for short distances .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;14	The Copenhagen city council -- interested in reducing air pollution and traffic congestion - is backing the private initiative .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;15	Sadolin said several cities , among them Aspen , Colorado , and Adelaide in Australia , had shown interest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0328;16	`` One city at the time , '' he added .

APW_ENG_19941202.0330;0	The once grand idea of U.N. peacekeeping as a global 911 appears to be fading as the United Nations closes shop in Somalia and faces humiliation in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;1	With the United Nations in apparent retreat , observers are saying that future peacekeeping is likely to shy away from where it is needed most : the front lines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;2	Bosnia is a `` bucket of cold water on ambitious plans for peacekeeping , '' said Richard Betts , professor of political science at Columbia University .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;3	`` I think there is a great future for peacekeeping that does not matter very much , and a very shaky future for messier operations . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;4	That seemed apparent this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;5	As Serb militiamen held hundreds of peacekeepers hostage and pounded a U.N.-declared safe haven in Bosnia , the Security Council met in New York , but high on its agenda was the Golan Heights , not Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;6	The quick meeting extending the mandate for the Israeli-Syrian border mission highlighted a U.N. success -- a mission where both sides want peace and the border is quiet .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;7	The council talks later dragged on about Bosnia , but without direct action .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;8	`` Peacekeeping is the role of referee , '' said Dan Plesch , director of the British-American Security Information Council in London .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;9	`` You can separate warring parties who want to be separated . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;10	But in instances like Bosnia and Somalia , where the sides are n't willing to stop fighting , the United Nations is refusing to order its peacekeepers to separate the sides .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;11	Such a direct role would be war , not peacekeeping , council members say .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;12	Many observers say missions like those in Golan and Cyprus -- with clear and limited objectives such as monitoring borders or delivering aid to war zones -- are likely to expand in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;13	`` But we will also see peacekeeping used by the United States and other powers as a way of repackaging war , '' Plesch said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;14	He cited Haiti and Georgia as examples .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;15	The United States pushed the Council to authorize military intervention in Haiti , offering its own soldiers to lead the mission that will give way to a U.N. peacekeeping force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;16	Russia would like to do much the same in Georgia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;17	It has already sent its own troops to the former Soviet republic , but is pressing the United Nations to take over the mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;18	While Bosnia -- with 24,000 soldiers or almost a third of all U.N. peacekeepers -- would prove the greatest U.N. peacekeeping failure if it collapses , the United Nations has lost face on other missions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;19	It was unable to foster peace in Somalia , and decided this fall to wind down its two-year mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;20	In Liberia , observers have been abused and humiliated by the warring factions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;21	U.N. officials bristle at criticisms that peacekeeping has been ineffective and say the problem is that world leaders are not willing to commit the troops or money to ambitious peacekeeping operations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;22	The world body is being made a scapegoat for the lack of global will to act , said Kofi Annan , the head of U.N. peacekeeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;23	`` It is absolutely unfair when member states do not want to take the risks , when they do not want to commit the resources , but blame the U.N. for failure to act , '' Annan said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;24	U.N. peacekeeping costs have ballooned to $ 3.8 billion for the year ending April 1994 , but by October , members still owed the world body $ 1.6 billion for peacekeeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;25	There are some 80,000 U.N. peacekeepers worldwide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;26	U.N. missions involved only about 10,000 soldiers in 1987 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;27	With a more isolationist Congress coming into power in Washington , it is unlikely the United States -- which pays about a third of the peacekeeping budget -- would be willing to pay for additional operations that are not directly in the U.S. interest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;28	`` There may be other Bosnias , but I do n't think there will be another UNPROFOR , '' said William Durch , a senior associate at the Henry L. Stimson Center in Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;29	`` If the West is not willing to act on its own doorstep why would it do it elsewhere ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;30	UNPROFOR is the peacekeeping mission in former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;31	Lewis MacKenzie , a veteran of nine peacekeeping operations and the former head of the Sarajevo operation , points out that despite its shortcomings , the U.N. mission in Bosnia still ensures that millions of people receive food every day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;32	And the retired major-general says that despite the problems , there is still a need for peacekeeping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0330;33	`` People who talks about the loss of credibility will be on bended knees before the U.N. at the next crisis , '' MacKenzie said .
