APW_ENG_19941202.0334;0	The city health department on Friday opened a room where heroin addicts can take their drugs in clean surroundings with fresh needles , the first such experiment in Germany .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;1	Backers of the project , which aims to convince 150 long-term addicts to try methadone or withdrawal treatment and stop the spread of AIDS , had to override objections from national officials who said it could encourage use of illegal drugs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;2	Similar `` junkie rooms '' have been set up in several European cities to entice addicts out of squalid conditions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;3	The Swiss cities Basel and Zurich have such places , and in the Netherlands , Rotterdam has a designated place by the central train station where junkies can do whatever they please .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;4	The Frankfurt hard-drugs scene , also centered on the main train station , has been cleaned up in recent years as police forced several hundred foreigners to leave and clamped down on an open drugs market .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;5	But 150 long-term local addicts remain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;6	The city drugs commissioner , Margarethe Nimsch , opened the so-called Gesundheitraum -- Health Room -- in Frankfurt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;7	It is in an old factory building far from the train station , and a shuttle bus will carry addicts to the facility , which is next to a counseling office and a hostel for addicts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;8	`` It is a command of humanity to help addicts out of their misery and not to fence them out , '' Ms. Nimsch said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;9	Police and prosecutors have agreed to tolerate the project as long as those using it show they are over 18 and addicted but not in a withdrawal or methadone program .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;10	They have to bring their own drugs -- sales on the premises are not permitted -- but fresh syringes are supplied .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;11	The remote location of the `` junkie room '' was an obvious drawback , and it remained to be seen whether addicts would be willing to make the trip .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;12	Police Inspector Roland Ullmann said the project would have to observed for a while to see if it is a success .
APW_ENG_19941202.0334;13	`` But one has to have the courage to close such a facility after a year or two if it does n't work , '' Ullmann said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;0	While the United Nations deliberates whether to continue operations in Bosnia , the Bosnian Serbs basically are deciding the issue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;1	They 've virtually closed the mission down .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;2	Consider : -- Delivery of humanitarian aid to civilians is basic to the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;3	But Bosnian Serbs have refused to approve convoys through their territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;4	-- Sarajevo depends on the U.N. airlift for 80 percent of its supplies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;5	For more than a week , the up-again , down-again airlift has not flown because the Serbs refuse to approve flights .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;6	To reinforce the message , the Serbs deployed surface-to-air missiles in the air corridor approaching Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;7	-- More than 400 peacekeepers , including French , British , Dutch , Canadians and Ukrainians , have been taken hostage against future NATO strikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;8	Apart from delivering humanitarian aid , the U.N. mission is supposed to enforce agreements , such as those on removal of heavy weapons from the Sarajevo area and on protection of U.N. `` safe areas . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;9	Those military functions have been severely curtailed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;10	The United Nations is unable even to get permission from the Bosnian Serbs to resupply its own units in isolated Muslim enclaves such as Bihac and Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;11	Most of the detained peacekeepers were guarding collection points in the Sarajevo area , where Bosnian Serbs stored heavy guns after last February 's NATO ultimatum to remove such weapons from within 12.5 miles of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;12	Both the Bosnian Serb and government forces routinely have put banned weapons in the zone .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;13	Apart from bluff and bluster , the U.N. has found no tools to force compliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;14	Last week , Bosnian Serb soldiers simply drove up to the nine collection points and surrounded them , trapping the peacekeepers inside .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;15	The presence of U.N. hostages virtually guarantees no NATO air strikes to follow three last week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;16	U.N. relations with both sides have been touchy , and are getting worse .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;17	The Serbs are in a position to punish the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;18	Sources who attended a U.N. staff meeting Thursday quoted the commander for Bosnia , Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , as saying that the Bosnian Serbs `` have declared war '' on the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;19	On Wednesday , Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic refused to meet U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali at the Sarajevo airport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;20	Boutros-Ghali had come to Sarajevo to warn the two sides that the United Nations might pull out of Bosnia-Herzegovina entirely if they did not cooperate with the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;21	U.N. officials , speaking on condition of anonymity , say they fear the Bosnian Serbs have decided to step up harassment in hopes the U.N. packs up and leaves .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;22	During the past 2 -LCB- years , the United Nations has faced similar periods of harassment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;23	But U.N. spokesman in Sarajevo , Thant Myint-U , described the current level of hostility as unprecedented .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;24	`` While we will certainly continue operations throughout the country in fulfillment of our various mandates as best we can , this unprecedented level of non-cooperation by the Bosnian Serb party is certainly not making our jobs any easier , '' Thant said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;25	Thant said the level of harassment is so intense and widespread that the United Nations believes it must have been approved at the highest level , presumably by Karadzic and his military chief , Gen. Ratko Mladic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0335;26	Since all U.N. operations here can only be carried out with the approval of the warring sides , absence of cooperation means the mission grinds to a halt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;0	U.S. Senate Democrats on Friday selected Sen. Thomas Daschle as their minority leader for the next Congress , opting for a young , amiable lawmaker with scant experience in the national limelight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;1	Republicans chose unopposed Kansas Sen. Bob Dole as majority leader for the second time in his career .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;2	But they moved to the right in dumping Sen. Alan Simpson as whip in favor of younger and more conservative Sen. Trent Lott of Mississippi , an ally of Dole 's potential rival for their party 's 1996 presidential nomination .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;3	The Republicans wrested majority control of both Houses of Congress from the Democrats , President Clinton 's party , in the Nov. 8 national election .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;4	The leaders elected Friday will begin official business in January and could affect the tone and politics of the Senate for years to come .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;5	Daschle , a two-term South Dakota Democrat , defeated the more feisty , combative Sen. Christopher Dodd of Connecticut to succeed Majority Leader George Mitchell , who is retiring .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;6	The vote was 24-23 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;7	`` We will offer constructive alternatives , not gridlock , '' said Daschle .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;8	`` We stand to offer vigorous opposition to extreme proposals .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;9	... We will fight against proposals that are mean spirited . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;10	Lott , who also won by a single vote , 27-26 , said he was `` honored that I will be able to serve with our majority leader -LRB- Dole -RRB- ... he 's been such a fantastic leader . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;11	He added that `` I also am committed '' to working with the Democratic leadership .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;12	Simpson said Lott `` is what the party has asked for at this time , a change in leadership and change perhaps in style . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;13	Simpson had been Dole 's No. 2 man since 1985 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;14	Now 63 , his relaxed manner is spiced with a sharp , folksy wit that has sometimes gotten him into clashes -- frequently with the press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;15	His credentials are mostly conservative , although he has favored abortion rights .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;16	Lott , 53 , is an energetic former House of Representatives whip with close ties to the incoming Republican House Speaker , Newt Gingrich .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;17	He is also an ally of Sen. Phil Gramm of Texas who is likely to challenge Dole for the Republican presidential nomination in 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;18	Lott 's combative style is in tune with the Senate 's growing cadre of younger , more conservative Republicans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;19	Since March , Daschle , 46 , has been campaigning for the Democratic leadership job methodically and behind the scenes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;20	His work for agriculture and veterans programs has gained little public attention for the boyish-looking lawmaker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;21	Dodd has been in the Senate six years longer than Daschle , and has a higher profile .
APW_ENG_19941202.0336;22	A former Peace Corps worker , he is best known for his vocal opposition to the Reagan administration 's policies in Central America and for his support of programs for children .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;0	Negotiations to end the National Hockey League lockout broke off abruptly on Friday when neither side showed any willingness to budge .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;1	`` We did n't have anything more to provide to each other , '' union head Bob Goodenow said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;2	`` They presented their positions and stated them to us Friday and , likewise , we stated our positions on various issues .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;3	One could say we agreed to disagree on the issues as they were , give it more thought and more work , and see if some ideas could develop before we met again . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;4	There had been hope that an eight-hour meeting Thursday would pave the way for the end of the 63-day labor dispute .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;5	But after meeting for only about an hour Friday , collective bargaining talks were tabled until Monday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;6	`` We 'll be back here in Chicago , '' said commissioner Gary Bettman , the front man in negotiations for the owners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;7	`` There just was n't anything further that we could productively discuss Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;8	As a result , we agreed to meet on Monday . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;9	Management and union representatives had resumed negotiations in Chicago , mindful that a labor agreement probably would have to be in place within two weeks to salvage a 50-game North American ice hockey season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;10	`` I 'm hoping at some point we get into position to make a deal , '' Bettman said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;11	`` If you 're asking me ... what makes me think the rhetoric will change , it may not .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;12	`` Time is a factor and the longer this goes on , the more of a factor time becomes . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;13	Boston Bruins general manager Harry Sinden , a management hard-liner , said negotiations ended Friday because `` we tapped out on conversation . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;14	`` Everybody 's position remained where it was and it did n't go any further , so we called it off , '' Sinden said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;15	`` We sat on it overnight and there were no new ideas . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;16	Since the owners locked out the players Oct. 1 , the season has been pared to 60 games , with 24 games stripped from each team .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;17	Among the issues discussed Thursday were a rookie salary cap , salary arbitration and free agency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;18	But the major obstacle , the luxury tax , remained in the background .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;19	The Canadian Press reported Thursday that the union dropped its desired salary ceiling for first-round draft picks to dlrs 1.25 million from dlrs 1.5 million for first-round players , while the NHL remained at dlrs 700,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;20	On salary arbitration , the NHL wants to retain its right to have an arbitrator 's decision to be non-binding on the team .
APW_ENG_19941202.0337;21	Rather than paying the awarded salary , a team could allow the player to become an unrestricted free agent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0338;0	Share prices fell Friday on the London Stock Exchange .
APW_ENG_19941202.0338;1	The benchmark Financial Times-Stock Exchange 100-share index finished down 22.3 points , or 0.73 percent , at 3,017.3 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0338;2	The Financial Times 30-share index closed at 2,323.8 , down 16.4 points , or 0.70 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0338;3	Volume was 447.7 million shares compared with 722.3 million on Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;0	The International Committee of the Red Cross will continue its humanitarian mission in Bosnia even if UN peacekeepers pull out of the war-torn republic , the organization 's president said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;1	`` I would regret UNPROFOR leaving because the presence of so many blue helmets has certainly had a deterrent effect to the conduct of war , '' Cornelio Sommaruga said , referring to the United Nations military force in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;2	Faced with an escalation of the fighting and increased harassment of the peacekeepers by Bosnian Serbs , UN Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali warned this week that the world body 's 23,000 soldiers may be withdrawn unless the warring sides agree to cooperate with the mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;3	There has been no indication , however , that a U.N. pullout , which would require a Security Council decision , is imminent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;4	Countries contributing the bulk of the UN troops , including Britain and France , also have said they would pull their men out if the fighting persists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;5	`` The ICRC has a mission to protect and assist victims wherever there is a conflict , and this mission is completely independent from the UN , '' Sommaruga said in an interview .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;6	`` We would certainly continue to be there . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;7	In the past , there have been serious doubts whether scores of international humanitarian organizations , which have provided massive relief aid to needy Bosnians in the past 21\/2 years , could continue to operate if the peacekeepers withdrew .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;8	But the decision by a major relief supplier such as the ICRC to remain in Bosnia may sway other groups to continue providing assistance in such an event .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;9	Sommaruga said the Geneva-based body already had prepared contingency plans for a possible UN withdrawal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;10	`` There is no humanitarian operation without problems .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;11	When you are operating in the middle of the war , you will always have problems reaching the victims , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;12	`` But in Bosnia we have had more problems than we have normally . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;13	In addition to providing food and medical aid , the 130-year-old organization is engaged in tracing , visiting and freeing prisoners of war held by the various warring factions , and in reuniting families dispersed by the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;14	But Sommaruga indicated that if the fighting worsened considerably , even the ICRC may be forced to reconsider its stand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0339;15	`` What would affect our operations would be the way in which the conflict is conducted , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0340;0	The ex-wife of fugitive British businessman Asil Nadir was released Friday after being detained on charges of trying illegally to sell an antique marble fountain , a private television station reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0340;1	Atv said a judge ordered the release of Aysegul Tecimer pending trial .
APW_ENG_19941202.0340;2	She was detained on Tuesday when she offeredt o sell the historic piece to undercover police for 2 billion Turkish lire -LRB- dlrs 55,500 -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0340;3	Tecimer , well known in Turkey for her extensive antique and jewelry collection , was also detained earlier this year linked to the alleged sale of a stolen antique Koran .
APW_ENG_19941202.0340;4	Nadir , the chairman of the food conglomerate Polly Peck International , escaped to Turkish-occupied northern Cyprus last year after he jumped bail in Britain on charges of stealing dlrs 47 million from the company .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;0	Still angry about NATO 's plans to admit former Warsaw Pact foes , Russia on Friday brushed aside attempts to get it to follow through on plans for close military links with the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;1	Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev refused to soften his opposition to a NATO blueprint setting out conditions for the entry of East European countries in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;2	He told a closed-door meeting of NATO and East European foreign ministers that Moscow could not move closer to the alliance until it provided more details about its intentions , sources said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;3	Kozyrev , they said , questioned whether there had been any change in NATO since it was a military machine arrayed against the Soviet Union during the Cold War era .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;4	On Thursday , he stunned U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and other foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization by blasting the plan and backing out of a program for close military and political ties .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;5	He complained NATO 's proposals would create a new division on the European continent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;6	A day later , Christopher sought to play down the embarrassing incident , which ruined the alliance 's efforts to present a united front on the sensitive issue of expanding NATO territory farther east .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;7	`` We should n't make too much of yesterday 's events , '' Christopher told CBS ' `` This Morning '' program .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;8	He and others expressed confidence Moscow would eventually agree to a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts , which were designed to ease Russia 's fears of being isolated .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;9	`` I think that will all get sorted out ... How soon I do n't know , '' said British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;10	Ties between NATO and Russia , he said , are `` too important to be lost . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;11	Despite Russia 's objections , NATO Secretary-General Willy Claes insisted , `` We are not ready to change any words in our decision '' ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the conditions for expansion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;12	If Russia was miffed about the membership plans , other East European nations were delighted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;13	`` We think this is an important milestone on the road to an undivided Europe , '' said Poland 's foreign minister , Andrzej Olechowski .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;14	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would be attached .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;15	The allies , though , have been hesitant about moving too quickly to admit their one-time foes for fear of upsetting and isolating Russia , still a formidable military power .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;16	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , which was seen as a waiting room for East Europeans eager to join .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;17	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;18	On Thursday , the allies decided to push ahead and ordered a blueprint of terms , costs and conditions for expanding the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;19	But , mindful of Russia 's worries , they promised not to identify any front-runners for membership nor set any entry dates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0341;20	`` The Russians will have a chance to analyze what we did yesterday , and I think they 'll find it to be responsible and deliberate , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;0	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and NATO 's top civilian official on Friday denied reports the alliance had agreed to a U.N. request to stop enforcing the no-fly zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;1	`` NATO is continuing to enforce the no-fly zone , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;2	NATO Secretary General Willy Claes said he knew of no request from the U.N. to halt or scale-down enforcement of the military flight ban which is designed to protect the civilians from bombardment in the 31-month war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;3	`` We have never received any request , can I be any clearer than that ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;4	Claes told reporters after a meeting here of foreign ministers from NATO and former East bloc nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;5	Christopher told reporters Serb anti-missile batteries posed a problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;6	But , he said , NATO was capable of dealing with them `` and we continue to police the no-fly zone in the effective way we have in the past . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;7	U.N. spokesman Fred Eckhard in New York also denied reports that the United Nations had formally requested a suspension of the no-fly zone
APW_ENG_19941202.0342;8	`` There is no intention of requesting such a suspension , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;0	The Croatian government and leaders of the rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday that , if implemented , could lead to normalized relations between the two enemies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;1	A six-month war in 1991 -- at the start of the violent breakup of Yugoslavia -- left Serbs in control of one-third of Croatian territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;2	There have been thousands of skirmishes and larger confrontations between the two since a January 1992 ceasefire halted the war
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;3	The economic agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;4	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are ontrolled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;5	The signing of the agreement coincided with the fiercest battlefield clashes since the U.N. brokered another cease-fire last March , Alun Roberts , a U.N. spokesman in Knin , said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;6	Artillery duels continued for the third day Friday in the area of Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , the capital of Serb-held territory in Croatia , Alexander Ivanko , another U.N. spokesman , said in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;7	He said six Serb soldiers were reported wounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;8	Meanwhile , the Belgrade-based Tanjug news agency quoted Bosnian Serb sources as saying that `` regular Croatian troops supported by HVO -LRB- Bosnian Croat militia -RRB- continued their offensive Friday against Bosnian Serb territories '' in the region between Grahovo and Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;9	It claimed that seven Serb civilians and soldiers had been killed while 3,000 people fled their homes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;10	There was no U.N. confirmation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;11	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the economic accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;12	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;13	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;14	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;15	`` For many people it has been senseless to be deprived of water , electricity , '' Owen said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;16	`` The basics of economic life can now be made available to all . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;17	But he warned : `` This agreement can easily be blown up literally and metaphorically .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;18	The fighting is continued challenge to it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;19	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the agreement , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;20	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;21	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;22	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;23	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;24	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent clandestine meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;25	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;26	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0343;27	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .

APW_ENG_19941202.0347;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher met Friday with key European foreign ministers , setting the stage for new overtures to the Bosnian Serbs in an effort to end the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;1	The meeting with ministers of France , Britain , Russia and Germany came as the Bosnian Serbs tightened their grip on the mostly Muslim Bihac enclave and as the conflict threatened to spread into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;2	Two of the ministers , Alain Juppe of France and Douglas Hurd of Britain , plan to carry a peace plan to Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic in Belgrade Sunday in the hope he would recommend it to his allies in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;3	Before the ministers meeting , Christopher told reporters : `` I think it 's important we come out of it unified but also that we come out of it with effective steps . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;4	Juppe , as he left for the meeting of the five-nation `` contact group , '' acknowledged : `` It wo n't be easy ; that wo n't surprise you . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;5	Christopher wants Milosevic to threaten to seal Serbia 's border to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;6	Despite a promise to halt weapons deliveries , Clinton administration officials said , arms were still getting through to fuel the Bosnian Serbs ' drive to gain more territory and to terrorize Muslim civilians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;7	The war has taken an estimated 200,000 lives and left many times that number homeless .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;8	Some 500 U.N. peacekeepers have been detained by the Bosnian Serbs , contributing to the decision by the U.N. commander , Sir Michael Rose , not to conduct heavy bombing raids against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;9	Christopher 's plan , which was adopted by President Clinton 's senior foreign policy advisers Monday at a White House meeting , calls for a cease-fire in the Bihac area , a cessation of hostilities for three to six months throughout Bosnia and a peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;10	There , the Bosnian Serbs would be able to promote their aspirations for a Greater Serbia , initially with political links to Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;11	They hope also to establish cross-border ties to ethnic Serbs in Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;12	Elements of the plan are similar to one rejected repeatedly by the Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;13	It called for them to accept Bosnia as a legitimate country and to shrink the territory under their control to 49 percent from about 70 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;14	A federation of Muslims and Croats would be in charge of 51 percent of the war-torn country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;15	Even that division is negotiable once peace talks are resumed , U.S. officials said , hoping to induce the Serbs to halt their attacks and to negotiate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;16	Ironically , it was here at a NATO summit meeting in January that Clinton and allied leaders decided that NATO warplanes should be used to protect Bosnian Muslim civilians from attacks by rebel Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;17	Clinton had campaigned against former President Bush 's policy as not being tough enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;18	He also proposed excluding the Bosnian government from a U.N. arms embargo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;19	But France and Britain prevailed in their resistance to a military approach .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;20	The Clinton administration has capitulated with some grumbling over its shoulder that the United Nations should have authorized sustained bombing and that the Bush administration should have done more than provide humanitarian assistance to trapped civilians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;21	In weighing diplomatic approaches , the five-nation group also considered a plan to urge Serbia to recognize the borders of Croatia and Bosnia make peace with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;22	The incentive would be an easing of economic sanctions against Milosevic 's government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;23	While the ministers are trying to enlist Milosevic , Christopher said , it would not be proper to have a further easing of sanctions against Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;24	When Milosevic promised to cut off arms supplies to Bosnian Serbs , some of the sanctions were lifted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;25	This included opening of the Belgrade airport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;26	Again signaling a willingness to compromise with the Serbs , Christopher did not rule out political union between the Serbs in Bosnia with Serbia itself `` if it would mean reaching a peaceful resolution '' of the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0347;27	He said that was a constitutional issue the parties -- Serbs , Muslims and Croats -- should decide among themselves .
APW_ENG_19941202.0348;0	Secretary of State Warren Christopher dismissed as incorrect Friday reports that NATO had decided to stop enforcing a U.N. no-fly zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0348;1	The ban on military flights is designed to protect the civilians from bombardment in the 31-month war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0348;2	`` NATO is continuing to enforce the no-fly zone , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0348;3	He told reporters Serb anti-missile batteries posed a problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0348;4	But , he said , NATO was capable of dealing with them `` and we continue to police the no-fly zone in the effective way we have in the past . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;0	President Nelson Mandela 's government started fulfilling campaign promises Friday , allocating more than 1 billion rand -LRB- dlrs 285 million -RRB- for health care and development projects .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;1	Most of the money for the Reconstruction and Development Program went for health projects , including 500 million rand -LRB- dlrs 142.5 million -RRB- to provide free health care for children and pregnant women .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;2	Another 472 million rand -LRB- dlrs 133 million -RRB- went for feeding schemes at schools in rural areas and black townships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;3	The government designated 2 billion rand -LRB- dlrs 570 million -RRB- for the development program in the 1994-1995 budget year , and Friday 's announcement was the first direct allocation of some of that money .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;4	Mandela and his African National Congress promised the multibillion rand reconstruction program during campaigning for the nation 's first all-race election in April .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;5	The ANC won the vote and heads the first black-led government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;6	The Reconstruction and Development Program is an ambitious five-year plan that calls for building 1 million houses , providing power and running water to millions of poor blacks and creating jobs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;7	Critics question if the government can afford the plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0351;8	Along with the free health care and school feeding projects , money was allocated for building health clinics , running the government 's land reform program and providing grants to help people buy land .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;0	Lebanon 's prime minister , once hailed as the savior of a country ravaged by 15 years of civil war , promised to resign Friday , but hinted he might return to office if quarrelsome ministers are ousted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;1	Prime Minister Rafik Hariri told the president during a stormy Cabinet meeting Thursday night that he was quitting after more than two years in office .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;2	He planned to sumbit a letter of resignation next week , aides said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;3	Hariri , a 51-year-old billionaire , has long been frustrated by opposition to his economic and reconstruction policies by several Cabinet ministers allied with neighboring Syria , the undisputed power in Lebanon .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;4	His resignation would be a severe setback to efforts to rebuild Lebanon from the destruction of the 1975-90 civil war , which killed 150,000 people , maimed tens of thousands and caused an estimated dlrs 25 billion in damage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;5	But in his first public appearance since the Cabinet meeting , Hariri hinted he could accept reappointment as prime minister if ministers blocking his programs were excluded from the new government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;6	`` We will not retreat from our latest move , '' Hariri said at the inauguration of a book fair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;7	`` We will not backtrack from rebuilding the country ... whether we are still in power or not , '' he said in a 15-minute speech punctuated by applause .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;8	`` God willing , Lebanon will move forward and a bunch of gamblers , arrogant people and adventurers will not be able to halt the course of development and reconstruction , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;9	`` It 's imperative that a government of institutions evolve in Lebanon rather than a government of outlaws who join the system . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;10	It was by far the sharpest attack by the soft-spoken Hariri against opponents , some of whom are former militia warlords appointed to government posts as part of Muslim-Christian reconciliation pact .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;11	Syrian and Lebanese officials tried to talk Hariri out of resigning .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;12	But his aides said he plans to submit a letter of resignation to President Elias Hrawi next week after a trip to Damascus Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;13	Hariri canceled a weekend trip to China and another to Morocco next week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;14	The crisis erupted after the government on Thursday night decreed a 20 percent pay raise for workers , which was promptly rejected by the General Federation of Labor Unions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;15	The federation , which represents 350,000 workers , insists on an 80 percent hike to keep pace with rampant inflation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;16	The unions staged a one-day warning strike Tuesday to press their demands and threatened to escalate their protests Dec. 5 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;17	The government has also been beset by corruption allegations , which prompted a heated exchange during Thursday night 's Cabinet session .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;18	Housing Minister Mahmoud Abu Hamdan claimed Hariri , who has a fortune estimated at dlrs 3 billion , would benefit from a real estate deal in Beirut .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;19	Hariri stormed out of the Cabinet room .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;20	He later telephoned Hrawi and told him that he was determined to step down .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;21	Hariri was appointed prime minister Oct. 22 , 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;22	Many welcomed his ascent to power as a harbinger of Lebanon 's return to regional prominence as a financial and trading hub .
APW_ENG_19941202.0352;23	But corruption charges have dogged his two-year tenure and his high-handed style has angered opponents .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;0	Western allies and Russia on Friday discussed new ideas for peace in Bosnia , including a suggestion of a confederation between Bosnian Serbs and Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations gathered after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;2	Thus , Christopher sought to heal a rift with NATO allies France and Britain over the alliance 's use of force in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;3	On a visit to the NATO headquarters Thursday , Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev said he endorsed a confederation of Bosnian Serbs with neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;4	`` We do support the suggestion -LRB- of -RRB- an unambiguous recognition '' of Bosnian Serbs ' right to forge political links with the government in Belgrade , Kozyrev told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;5	Russia , France , Germany , Britain , France , and the U.S. comprise the contact group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;6	Kozyrev met here with Christopher in the margin of a NATO meeting before going over to the EU headquarters for the Contact Group talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;7	A U.S. official said Christopher 's `` understanding of Foreign Minister Kozyrev 's position is very clear , '' but that a Bosnian Serbs-Serbia political alliance was `` not a proposal we support at this time . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;8	Also attending the meeting were Douglas Hurd and Alain Juppe , the British and French foreign ministers who will go to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , on Sunday for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;9	The Contact Group , officials said , hoped to launch a new diplomatic initiative to try to draw the Bosnian Serbs into negotiations with the Muslims and Croats .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;10	It was expected to call for a cease-fire around Bihac , the northwestern Muslim enclave that Serbs are pummeling , a pledge to cease hostilities across Bosnia for up to six months , followed by an international peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;11	On offer for the Bosnian Serbs , who control about 70 percent of Bosnia , would be an opportunity to press their demand for cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;12	Hurd said this week that would not amount to giving in to Serb aspirations of a Greater Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;13	The current peace plan , that Bosnian Serbs have rejected , envisions a confederation between Croatia and the Muslim-led government in Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;14	The core of the peace plan Bosnian Serbs have rejected is a division of Bosnia that would required them to return much territory they have seized in battle .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;15	The Contact Group meeting caps an eventful week in which U.N. Secretary General Boutros-Boutros Ghali failed in his bid to meet with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Kardazic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;16	More than 400 of the 24,000 U.N. soldiers in Bosnia are being detained by the Serbs as insurance against NATO airstrikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0353;17	NATO struck three times last week , but the attacks did nothing to stop the Serb assault on Bihac .

APW_ENG_19941202.0355;0	Stefan Edberg had to rally from match point in the final set and Magnus Larsson likewise prevailed in five sets Friday , giving Sweden a sweep of opening singles and a 2-0 lead over Russia in the Davis Cup final .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;1	Edberg faced match point trailing 5-4 in the fifth set , but rallied to beat Alexander Volkov 6-4 , 6-2 , 6-7 -LRB- 2-7 -RRB- , 0-6 , 8-6 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;2	Larsson , ranked 19th by the ATP Tour , followed by overcoming a whistling , foot-stomping home crowd of 12,000 , to beat No. 11 ranked Yevgeny Kafelnikov 6-0 , 6-2 , 3-6 , 2-6 , 6-3 victory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;3	The opening-day setbacks severely hurt Russia 's chances of becoming the first unseeded team to win the Davis Cup .

APW_ENG_19941202.0355;9	`` It did n't really hurt but I felt very insecure .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;10	I could n't hit slices , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0355;15	I took a few chances and it paid off . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0355;18	The 27-year-old Volkov then dominated Edberg in the fourth set with devastating passing shots and seemed set to take the match , serving for the victory in the final set .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;19	`` I needed to kick myself , especially in the fifth set , '' Edberg said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;20	`` I was a little bit depressed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;21	I had the match in my hand and became defensive ... I felt I was getting closer and closer in every game in the fifth set . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0355;32	Edberg was troubled by inconsistent serves .
APW_ENG_19941202.0355;33	`` I 've been in the same situation .

APW_ENG_19941202.0355;38	It is only the seventh to reach the final .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;0	Many countries continue to resist according foreign banks the same operating rights as domestic ones , the U.S. Treasury Department reported to Congress Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;1	`` Intensive multilateral and bilateral negotiations have led to significant improvements in the terms on which U.S. firms compete in offering financial services abroad , '' the Treasury Department said in its 1994 study on national treatment for banks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;2	The study cited the North American Free Trade Agreement , which opened the Mexican market to U.S. financial institutions for the first time in over 50 years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;3	And it noted progress in a number of key areas in negotiations with Japan , China , Korea and Taiwan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;4	It also noted that the new global trade agreement has established a multilateral framework that could be applied to trade in financial services .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;5	But Treasury Secretary Lloyd Bentsen said in a statement accompanying the report `` while many countries have begun to recognize the economic benefits that come from liberalization of the financial sector , national treatment is still the exception rather than the rule in too many important markets . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;6	The Treasury is required to provide Congress with updates on national treatment issues every four years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;7	National treatment is the equal application of rules and regulations among domestic and foreign companies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;8	Bentsen said President Clinton 's administration continues to seek open markets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;9	`` But unless other commercially important countries are prepared to commit to open their markets to U.S. financial institutions , the United States will not be prepared to accept -LRB- a most-favored nation -RRB- obligation in financial services in the WTO , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;10	The Senate gave final congressional approval Thursday night to legislation implementing U.S. participation in a vastly expanded world free trade agreement to be enforced by the WTO , or World Trade Organization .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;11	Bentsen said that , in addition to the multilateral global trade talks , bilateral negotiations continue in several key markets , including `` a satisfactory outcome in the Japan Framework Talks on financial services . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;12	U.S. policy provides that the results achieved in the U.S.-Japan negotiations be extended to all countries on a most-favored nation basis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;13	The report notes a `` large and diverse presence '' of foreign financial institutions in the United States , including 288 foreign banks from 60 countries that operate 580 agencies and branches , and 91 banking subsidiaries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;14	`` We want to continue to keep our markets open to foreign financial institutions , '' Bentsen said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;15	`` They play an important role in financing investment in the United States and they help keep our financial markets the most competitive and innovative in the world .
APW_ENG_19941202.0356;16	`` But we also need to ensure that foreign countries provide the same degree of access to our firms in their markets , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;0	Iberia airline pilots Friday said they were prepared to take pay cuts to rescue the near-bankrupt company but insisted the reductions must be part of a genuine viability plan that would guarantee Iberia 's future .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;1	Following an all-day meeting , the pilots ' union SEPLA said a meeting was scheduled Monday with Iberia management .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;2	The union said it was prepared to consider demands for salary reductions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;3	But the pilots ' insistence that any wage cut must be part of an `` authentic viability plan '' appeared to suggest that they still did not fully accept Iberia 's latest restructuring plan as it stands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;4	`` You ca n't center everything on a salary reduction in exchange for a ` now we 'll see what we can do ' attitude , '' said SEPLA chief Armando Guajardo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;5	`` We 're not prepared to hand over the money with our eyes closed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;6	Hopes of implementing the viability plan appeared dashed Thursday when talks between management and SEPLA broke down over the issue of a sliding scale wage reduction of 15 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;7	The plan , accepted in principle by the company 's other main unions , also entails a wage freeze and a reduction of some 3,500 jobs through early retirements and pay-offs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;8	A restructuring plan agreed on by all unions is crucial if the European Commission is to consider allowing the Spanish government to grant Iberia a 130 billion peseta -LRB- dlrs 1 billion -RRB- capital injection .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;9	Iberia has posted losses since 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;10	It ended last year 67 billion pesetas -LRB- dlrs 530 million -RRB- in the red while losses for this year are expected to top 40 billion pesetas -LRB- dlrs 300 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;11	Chairman Javier Salas has warned that the company would be technically bankrupt by March 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;12	If finally accepted by SEPLA , the plan would be put to a vote among the company 's 24,000 employees .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;13	The viability proposals were thrashed out between management and the principal unions except SEPLA after the company threatened to enforce emergency measures , including the axing of 5,200 jobs and the sale of company assets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;14	That threat sparked a one-day walk-out on Monday that paralyzed the country 's airports .
APW_ENG_19941202.0357;15	Pilots represent some 5 percent of the 24,000-strong staff .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;0	As the scorched Achillo Lauro sank Friday into the Indian Ocean , a surviving passenger said one of the victims who died was injured when the crew dropped inflatable rafts on top of a crowded lifeboat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;1	The 979 passengers and crew who survived the fire on the Italian luxury liner were headed for three African and Middle Eastern ports aboard 10 rescue vessels , including freighters and U.S. warships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;2	They abandoned the blazing ship two days ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;3	The Achille Lauro was once a gleaming blue-and-white luxury liner that sailed around the world in 80 days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;4	But it was best known for the 1985 hijacking by Palestinian terrorists , who killed an elderly Jewish American passenger , Leon Klinghoffer , and dumped his body overboard in his wheelchair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;5	The terrorists escaped aboard a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced the plane down in Italy and the hijackers were arrested and later tried .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;6	Wednesday 's fire began in the engine room before dawn .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;7	Two elderly passengers died , one apparently of a heart attack .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;8	Eight people were injured as lifeboats and rafts were launched and the ship was abandoned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;9	According to passenger Geoffrey Wall , interviewed Friday by Britain 's Sky TV , one man was injured when crew members released inflatable rafts onto the lifeboat , which held about 35 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;10	`` It was tilting at an angle , '' said Wall , a Briton , describing attempts to lower a lifeboat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;11	`` They got it near the water .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;12	They could n't lower it properly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;13	Then somebody hit the wrong -- I do n't know what it is that they release them with -- but they dropped two of these inflatable life boats on top of us , resulting in injury to one man . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;14	He said people gave the ailing man mouth-to-mouth resuscitation before a rescue ship arrived about four hours later .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;15	`` We were in 100 yards -LRB- meters -RRB- or so of the rescue ship when he started to go ... unfortunately he died , '' Wall said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;16	It was not immediately clear if the man died of his injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;17	The ship 's owner , Naples , Italy-based Starlauro , had no immediate comment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;18	Passenger Dennis Bassett , also told Sky TV that crew members did not alert all the passengers until only minutes before the order sounded to abandon ship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;19	`` Some passengers at 7 o'clock in the morning were still in bed , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;20	The ship 's captain , Giuseppe Orsi , was the last to abandon the ship , which sank Friday evening off the coast of Somalia shortly after Italian tugboats reached the ailing vessel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;21	`` She was hooked up to the -LRB- tug -RRB- Solano and in 10 minutes , she collapsed -- pfft , she disappeared , '' said Antonio de Rosa , marketing director for Starlauro .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;22	He put the loss at dlrs 25 million .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;23	Starlauro had hired seagoing tugs to bring the vessel home to try to save her .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;24	Italian coast guard Lt. Francesco D'Amico said the ship was unrecoverable .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;25	Orsi , aboard the oil tanker Hawaiian King , told the Italian news agency ANSA by radio phone he was `` very sorry '' about the news .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;26	`` I knew that by now she was unseaworthy , but what happened has greatly displeased me , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;27	`` The fire had destroyed her almost completely . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;28	Eight cargo vessels and two American warships , the USS Gettysburg and Halyburton , were carrying the surviving passengers and crew members to Djibouti , Mombasa in Kenya and Muskat in Oman .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;29	Most were heading for Mombasa .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;30	The first ship was expected to dock in Djibouti on Saturday ; the rest were scheduled to make port on Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;31	The first fire aboard the Achille Lauro came in 1981 off the Canary Islands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0358;32	Passengers leaped from the decks into the Atlantic and two died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;0	Bosnian Serb gunners ringing Sarajevo fired five anti-tank missiles at the capital Friday , including two which hit government headquarters minutes before the chief U.N. envoy arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;1	It was yet another sign of the contempt with which Serbs hold the United Nations mission to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;2	More than 300 U.N. peacekeepers remained hostages of the Serbs , as insurance against further NATO airstrikes , but 70 were released Friday after being detained for seven days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;3	Two Sagger wire-guided missiles hit the Bosnian presidency building , which houses the offices of the top government officials , minutes before U.N. envoy Yasushi Akashi arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;4	One destroyed the office of Miro Lazovic moments after he left for the Akashi meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;5	Lazovic is an ethnic Serb member of Bosnia 's collective presidency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;6	Later , three missiles hit nearby buildings as Akashi met in the presidency with top government and military officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;7	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;8	`` Until we achieve something tangible , this shuttle diplomacy must continue , '' Akashi told reporters in Sarajevo before leaving for Pale , the Bosnian Serb headquarters east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;9	But the Bosnian government blasted the United Nations for failing to use the necessary force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , even as fighting continued in that northwest region Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;10	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;11	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic , referring to European capitulation to Adolf Hitler before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;12	Charles Redman , the former U.S. member of the Contact Group , was also back in Sarajevo , leading bilateral talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic that presumably focused on a proposed new peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;13	Redman , now ambassador to Germany , helped draft the first Contact Group peace plan , which the Serbs have repeatedly rejected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;14	Although that proposal was presented to the Serbs as a take-it-or-leave-it plan , the lack of Western will to use force has allowed the Serbs to demand , apparently successfully , the right of future confederal links with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;15	The original plan denied Serbs that as punishment for starting the war , though it granted the Bosnian Croat-Muslim federation similar rights to link with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;16	Akashi , on a mission to end the peacekeepers ' detention and win freedom of movement for U.N. convoys , hoped to have more success with the Serbs than his boss , Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;17	Boutros-Ghali was rebuffed in even trying to meet the Bosnian Serbs on Wednesday , and afterwards said intransigence by the warring sides might force the end of the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;18	Seventy Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia , Friday after being released from a seven-day detention by the Serbs in eastern Bosnia , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;19	But Serbs continued to hold about 20 other Dutch peacekeepers , along with hundreds of British , Ukrainians and Canadians , at various points throughout Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;20	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi also wanted to discuss with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic fighting around the government enclave of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;21	The United Nations is trying to broker a cease-fire there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;22	A number of detonations were reported on the outskirts of Bihac Friday , along with machine-gun and small arms fire , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;23	But the heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;24	The Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave , part of which is a U.N. `` safe area , '' in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;25	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;26	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces against the Serbs , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;27	A Croat militia and the Bosnian army took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;28	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia also had shelled his forces across the border , near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0359;29	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;0	The Croatian government and leaders of the rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday that , if implemented , could lead to normalized relations between the two enemies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;1	A six-month war in 1991 -- at the start of the violent breakup of Yugoslavia -- left Serbs in control of one-third of Croatian territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;2	There have been thousands of skirmishes and larger confrontations between the two since a January 1992 ceasefire halted the war
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;3	The economic agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;4	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220 mile -RRB- highway are ontrolled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;5	The signing of the agreement came amid the fiercest battlefield clashes since the U.N. brokered another cease-fire last March , Michael Williams , a U.N. spokesman in Zagreb , said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;6	Artillery duels continued for the third day Friday in the area of Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , the capital of Serb-held territory in Croatia , Alexander Ivanko , another U.N. spokesman in Zagreb , said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;7	He said six Serb soldiers were reported wounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;8	Meanwhile , the Belgrade-based Tanjug news agency quoted Bosnian Serb sources as saying that `` regular Croatian troops supported by HVO -LRB- Bosnian Croat militia -RRB- continued their offensive Friday against Bosnian Serb territories '' in the region between Grahovo and Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;9	It claimed that seven Serb civilians and soldiers had been killed while 3,000 people fled their homes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;10	There was no U.N. confirmation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;11	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the economic accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;12	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;13	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;14	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;15	`` For many people it has been senseless to be deprived of water , electricity , '' Owen said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;16	`` The basics of economic life can now be made available to all . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;17	But he warned : `` This agreement can easily be blown up literally and metaphorically .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;18	The fighting is continued challenge to it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;19	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the agreement , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;20	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;21	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;22	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;23	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;24	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent clandestine meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;25	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;26	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0360;27	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;0	Russian lawmakers negotiating the release of prisoners in Chechnya accused their own government Friday of sending the jets that have attacked the breakaway republic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;1	The four-person delegation of Russian parliament members is trying to get Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev to release about 70 Russians , including Army soldiers and officers , who were captured in fighting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;2	Dudayev , who declared independence for his Caucasus Mountain republic in 1991 , says Moscow is arming and leading the rebels against him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;3	President Boris Yeltsin 's government has denied providing anything but political support , even as the rebel offensive has escalated from small-arms fire to jet attacks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;4	Defense Minister Pavel Grachev has called the captives mercenaries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;5	Jets roared over the Chechen capital , Grozny , for a fourth day Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;6	Raids this week have killed at least four civilians and an airport guard , and destroyed planes at civilian and military airports .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;7	`` It is clear that these planes are not English or French but Russian , '' said Ella Pamfilova , a parliament member and Yeltsin 's former social welfare minister , who is part of the delegation in Grozny .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;8	`` This is against the law . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;9	`` You can rest assured that President Yeltsin has recognized the prisoners as members of the Russian Army , '' delegation leader Sergei Yushenkov said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;10	A dozen of the prisoners , interviewed by The Associated Press while Chechen guards watched , said they were hired by Russia 's Federal Counterintelligence Service for secret operations with the Chechen rebels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;11	The men said they were promised money when the operation was over .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;12	But they said it went off badly , and that some of their Chechen allies did not know how to use guns and fled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;13	`` There are n't the words , '' imprisoned Capt. Alexander Tryukov said when asked how he felt about Grachev .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;14	Counterintelligence spokesman Alexander Mikhailov , asked about such reports at a news conference Friday , said only that Chechnya is part of Russia and that the servicemen should therefore be called volunteers , not mercenaries , ITAR-Tass and Interfax said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;15	Dudayev first threatened to kill the prisoners if Russia did not claim them , but later said they would be tried in court .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;16	Yeltsin threatened to send troops if they were not released .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;17	Moscow has since toned down the threat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;18	But it continued to beef up troops on Chechnya 's borders , news reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;19	Lawmaker Anatoly Shabad , a delegation member , said he believes the Russians will be released , but he criticized the rebels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;20	`` We are against the way in which the opposition has used people with guns -- first locals and then Russian soldiers , '' Shabad said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;21	Since the air offensive began last week , thousands of people have fled Grozny , a city of 300,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;22	Chechen officials said a raid Friday targeted a tank regiment east of Grozny .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;23	Four people were killed in a missile attack Thursday at Katayama , about 20 kilometers -LRB- 12 miles -RRB- from Grozny .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;24	A bus was hit and Dudayev said his home was bombed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;25	The opposition accuses Dudayev of running Chechnya 's economy into the ground .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;26	The main industry , oil refining , is operating at about 10 percent of capacity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;27	But Chechen pride and age-old enmity with Russia have rallied many people to Dudayev 's side , including some volunteers from other Caucasus regions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;28	Russia conquered the mainly Muslim Chechens in its imperial drive towards the Black Sea last century .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;29	Ethnic tensions suppressed in Soviet times have boiled over since the 1991 Soviet collapse .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;30	Many Russian nationalists vow never to let Chechnya go .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;31	But at a pro-Dudayev camp outside Grozny , 24-year-old Sergei Chicherov , a blue-eyed Cossack , had cast his lot with the Chechens .
APW_ENG_19941202.0361;32	`` If someone comes and attacks your home , are you supposed to just sit and watch ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;0	Still angry about NATO 's plans to admit former Warsaw Pact members , Russia on Friday brushed aside attempts to get it to follow through on plans for close military links with the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;1	Russian Foreign Minister Andrei Kozyrev refused to soften his opposition to a NATO blueprint setting out conditions for the entry of East European countries in the coming years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;2	He told a closed-door meeting of NATO and East European foreign ministers that Moscow could not move closer to the alliance until it provided more details about its intentions , sources said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;3	Kozyrev , they said , questioned whether there had been any change in NATO since it was a military machine arrayed against the Soviet Union during the Cold War era .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;4	On Thursday , he stunned U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and other foreign ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization by blasting the plan and backing out of a program for close military and political ties .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;5	He complained NATO 's proposals would create a new division on the European continent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;6	A day later , Christopher sought to play down the embarrassing incident , which ruined the alliance 's efforts to present a united front on the sensitive issue of expanding NATO territory farther east .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;7	He and others expressed confidence Moscow would eventually agree to a wide-ranging program of military and political contacts , which were designed to ease Russia 's fears of being isolated .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;8	`` I think that will all get sorted out ... How soon I do n't know , '' said British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;9	Ties between NATO and Russia , he said , are `` too important to be lost . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;10	Despite Russia 's objections , NATO Secretary-General Willy Claes insisted , `` We are not ready to change any words in our decision '' ordering aides to conduct a 12-month study of the conditions for expansion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;11	Poland , Hungary , the Czech Republic and others have repeatedly demanded NATO membership and the security guarantees that would be attached .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;12	The allies , though , have been hesitant about moving too quickly to admit their one-time foes for fear of upsetting and isolating Russia , still a formidable military power .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;13	At a summit last January , President Clinton and other allied leaders approved a U.S. initiative , Partnership for Peace , which was seen as a waiting room for East Europeans eager to join .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;14	Twenty-three nations , including Russia , have enrolled in the project , which allows them to take part for the first time in military exercises and other alliance activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;15	On Thursday , the allies decided to push ahead and ordered a blueprint of terms , costs and conditions for expanding the alliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;16	But , mindful of Russia 's worries , they promised not to identify any front-runners for membership nor set any entry dates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0362;17	`` The Russians will have a chance to analyze what we did yesterday , and I think they 'll find it to be responsible and deliberate , '' Christopher said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;0	The city health department on Friday opened a room where heroin addicts can take drugs in clean surroundings with fresh needles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;1	Backers of the project , which aims to convince 150 long-term addicts to try methadone or withdrawal treatment and stop the spread of AIDS , had to override objections from national officials who said it could encourage use of illegal drugs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;2	Similar `` junkie rooms '' have been set up in several European cities to entice addicts out of squalid conditions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;3	The Swiss cities Basel and Zurich have such places , and in the Netherlands , Rotterdam has a designated place by the central train station where junkies can do whatever they please .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;4	The Frankfurt drugs commissioner , Margarethe Nimsch , opened the so-called Gesundheitraum -- Health Room -- in an factory building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;5	A shuttle bus will carry addicts to the facility from the train station , which is next to a counseling office and a hostel for addicts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;6	`` It is a command of humanity to help addicts out of their misery and not to fence them out , '' Ms. Nimsch said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;7	Police and prosecutors have agreed to tolerate the project as long as those using it show they are over 18 and addicted but not in a withdrawal or methadone program .
APW_ENG_19941202.0363;8	They have to bring their own drugs -- sales on the premises are not permitted -- but fresh syringes are supplied .
