APW_ENG_19941202.0366;0	Joe Montana angrily denied a published report that he is retiring at the end of the American National Football League season on Friday and said that although he is injured , he is not yet finished with football .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;1	`` It 's ridiculous , '' the Kansas City quarterback said Friday at Arrowhead Stadium during his weekly news conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;2	`` I had n't heard about it until I got here today .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;3	I think , first of all , you guys are going to start having to stand up for what you write .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;4	It hurts the credibility of your field . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;5	In an exclusive story by NFL writer Gary Myers , the New York Daily News on Friday cited unidentified league sources as saying that Montana would retire when this season ended .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;6	`` All I can tell you is that I stand by story , '' Myers said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;7	Myers ' report was also broadcast Thursday night on the cable television program `` Inside the NFL . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;8	Montana sprained a foot in Sunday 's loss to Seattle and rumors started that he would be out for a lengthy period and would not be back next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;9	`` I 've got a sprained ankle and some guy writes that I 'm retiring , '' Montana said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;10	`` I had a hangnail last week and he did n't write about that . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;11	`` It 's irritating .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;12	It 's irritating that you have to put people through this .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;13	It 's irritating that I should have to stand up here and go through this , '' Montana said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;14	He said chances are `` pretty slim '' that he will be able to play against Denver Sunday in Kansas City .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;15	He said the ankle feels better but is still sore .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;16	Asked earlier about the New York Daily News report , Chiefs spokesman Bob Moore said that Montana has always said he would make no decision until after the end of the season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;17	Moore said `` it is just natural that from now until the end of the season there will be all kinds of speculation about Montana 's future plans . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;18	Montana , 38 , spent 14 seasons with the San Francisco 49ers and helped them win four Super Bowls .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;19	After playing just one game in 1991 and 1992 , he was traded to Kansas City in April , 1993 , along with safety David Whitmore and a third-round draft pick in exchange for a first-round draft choice that the 49ers later traded away .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;20	Montana was reported to have considered retirement last season after sustaining a concussion in Kansas City 's AFC championship game loss in Buffalo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0366;21	Until last Sunday , this season was relatively injury-free for Montana .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;0	Retired Gen. Colin Powell , former chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff , said he was proud to help broker the controversial last-minute accord that averted a U.S. invasion of Haiti .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;1	Powell , a child of Jamaican immigrants , spoke at the University of the West Indies late Thursday after accepting the university 's honorary Doctor of Laws degree .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;2	`` I was pleased to be a member of the delegation that President Clinton sent to Haiti to persuade the generals and the colonels to step down , to tell them that their time had passsed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;3	To tell them that democracy had to return to Haiti , '' Powell said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;4	`` We succeeded without the need for an invasion which would have killed innocent young Haitians and innocent young Americans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;5	Instead we have the democratically elected president back in Port-au-Prince and American troops arrived as friends and not as enemies . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;6	Powell participated in a U.S. delegation led by former President Jimmy Carter that secured a Sept. 18 pledge by the Haitian military leaders to step down and allow the peaceful arrival of U.S. troops to prepare for the Oct. 15 return of elected Haitian President Jean-Bertrand Aristide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;7	Some analysts criticized the accord as giving away too much to the Haitian coup leaders , who had ousted Aristide in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;8	Also , the Pentagon was relunctant to get involved in Haiti .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;9	However , since U.S. forces entered Haiti without major problems , U.S. military chiefs have said they should stay until they accomplish their U.N.-sanctioned mission , which is to create a safe environment that can be turned over to a U.N. peacekeeping force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;10	Powell , 57 , frequently mentioned as a possible contender for the U.S. presidency in 1996 , said , `` Haiti now begins the hard journey to real democracy and economic reform .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;11	It is a journey many other nations are taking ... in a spirit of reconciliation and moving away from all patterns of ideological confrontation . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;12	The former military chief said Jamaica and other Caribbean nations played vital roles in creating the conditions which allowed the U.S.-led forces to go into Haiti and restore democracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;13	Earlier in the day , Powell accepted the Order of Jamaica , the nation 's equivalent to knighthood in the British system .
APW_ENG_19941202.0367;14	Others who have received the University of the West Indies ' honorary degree include American civil rights leader Dr. Martin Luther King and South African President Nelson Mandela .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;0	The International Committee of the Red Cross will continue its humanitarian mission in Bosnia even if U.N. peacekeepers pull out , the organization 's president said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;1	The U.N. departure would be regretted `` because the presence of so many blue helmets has certainly had a deterrent effect to the conduct of war , '' Cornelio Sommaruga said , referring to the United Nations military force in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;2	Faced with an escalation of the fighting and increased harassment of the peacekeepers by Bosnian Serbs , U.N. Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali said this week that the world body 's 23,000 soldiers may be withdrawn unless the warring sides agree to cooperate with the mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;3	There has been no indication , however , that a U.N. pullout , which would require a Security Council decision , is imminent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;4	Countries contributing the bulk of the U.N. troops , including Britain and France , also have said they would pull their men out if the fighting persists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;5	The Red Cross `` has a mission to protect and assist victims wherever there is a conflict , and this mission is completely independent from the U.N. , '' Sommaruga said in an interview .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;6	`` We would certainly continue to be there . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;7	In the past , there have been serious doubts whether scores of international humanitarian organizations , which have provided massive relief aid to needy Bosnians in the past 2 -LCB- years , could continue to operate if the peacekeepers withdrew .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;8	But the decision by a major relief supplier such as the International Committee of the Red Cross to remain in Bosnia may sway other groups to continue providing assistance in such an event .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;9	Sommaruga said the Geneva-based body already had prepared contingency plans for a possible U.N. withdrawal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0368;10	In addition to providing food and medical aid , the 130-year-old organization is engaged in tracing , visiting and freeing prisoners of war held by the various warring factions , and in reuniting families dispersed by the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;0	While the United Nations deliberates whether to continue operations in Bosnia , the Bosnian Serbs basically are deciding the issue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;1	They 've virtually closed the mission down .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;2	Consider : -- Delivery of humanitarian aid to civilians is basic to the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;3	But Bosnian Serbs have refused to approve convoys through their territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;4	-- Sarajevo depends on the U.N. airlift for 80 percent of its supplies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;5	For more than a week , the up-again , down-again airlift has not flown because the Serbs refuse to approve flights .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;6	To reinforce the message , the Serbs deployed surface-to-air missiles in the air corridor approaching Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;7	-- More than 400 peacekeepers , including French , British , Dutch , Canadians and Ukrainians , have been taken hostage against future NATO strikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;8	Apart from delivering humanitarian aid , the U.N. mission is supposed to enforce agreements , such as those on removal of heavy weapons from the Sarajevo area and on protection of U.N. `` safe areas . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;9	Those military functions have been severely curtailed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;10	The United Nations is unable even to get permission from the Bosnian Serbs to resupply its own units in isolated Muslim enclaves such as Bihac and Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;11	Most of the detained peacekeepers were guarding collection points in the Sarajevo area , where Bosnian Serbs stored heavy guns after last February 's NATO ultimatum to remove such weapons from within 12.5 miles of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;12	Both the Bosnian Serb and government forces routinely have put banned weapons in the zone .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;13	Apart from bluff and bluster , the U.N. has found no tools to force compliance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;14	Last week , Bosnian Serb soldiers simply drove up to the nine collection points and surrounded them , trapping the peacekeepers inside .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;15	The presence of U.N. hostages virtually guarantees no NATO air strikes to follow three last week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;16	U.N. relations with both sides have been touchy , and are getting worse .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;17	The Serbs are in a position to punish the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;18	Sources who attended a U.N. staff meeting Thursday quoted the commander for Bosnia , Lt. Gen. Sir Michael Rose , as saying that the Bosnian Serbs `` have declared war '' on the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;19	On Wednesday , Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic refused to meet U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali at the Sarajevo airport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;20	Boutros-Ghali had come to Sarajevo to warn the two sides that the United Nations might pull out of Bosnia-Herzegovina entirely if they did not cooperate with the peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;21	U.N. officials , speaking on condition of anonymity , say they fear the Bosnian Serbs have decided to step up harassment in hopes the U.N. packs up and leaves .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;22	During the past 2 -LCB- years , the United Nations has faced similar periods of harassment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;23	But U.N. spokesman in Sarajevo , Thant Myint-U , described the current level of hostility as unprecedented .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;24	`` While we will certainly continue operations throughout the country in fulfillment of our various mandates as best we can , this unprecedented level of non-cooperation by the Bosnian Serb party is certainly not making our jobs any easier , '' Thant said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;25	Thant said the level of harassment is so intense and widespread that the United Nations believes it must have been approved at the highest level , presumably by Karadzic and his military chief , Gen. Ratko Mladic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0369;26	Since all U.N. operations here can only be carried out with the approval of the warring sides , absence of cooperation means the mission grinds to a halt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;0	Seattle Seahawks running back Chris Warren was arrested after a car he was driving crashed into a utility pole , injuring him and two teammates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;1	One player , defensive tackle Michael Frier , suffered a serious neck injury .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;2	Warren , 27 , the fourth-leading rusher in the U.S. National Football League this season ; rookie running back Lamar Smith , 24 ; and a third player who was not unidentified pending notification of his parents , were taken to Overlake Medical Center in Bellevue after the Thursday night crash .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;3	Frier 's condition was improved from critical to serious on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;4	Team orthopedic surgeon Pierce Scranton refused to say whether Frier was paralyzed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;5	Warren , who suffered two cracked ribs , was treated and released .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;6	Smith had chip fractures in his spine and ankle and was hospitalized overnight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;7	Warren , driving a Chevy Blazer -- a small truck-like vehicle , was arrested at the scene for investigation of vehicular assault , Sgt. Mark Smith said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;8	Smith said it appeared Warren was driving too fast for the rain-slicked road .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;9	The crash set the utility pole on fire and the players had to be pulled from the vehicle by passersby and firefighters , Smith said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;10	Police would not comment on whether drugs or alcohol were involved .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;11	Warren was released on his own recognizance , police dispatcher Jill Roberts said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;12	The accident happened about 8:40 p.m. near the team 's training center .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;13	`` You read about it , you hear about it , but when it happens to somebody very close it really is a shock , '' Seahawks coach Tom Flores told KIRO radio early today .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;14	`` It 's something that we all have to keep praying for that they all recover . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;15	The power line suspended on the pole was severed in the collision , causing a large electrical flash and disabling three substations , said Kristen Wappler , a spokeswoman for Puget Sound Power and Light Co.
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;16	The accident knocked out electricity to some 4,500 Puget Power customers for about an hour .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;17	Warren , a fifth-year , Pro Bowl running back , is the first Seahawks player to rush for 1,000 yards in three consecutive seasons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;18	He started this week as the second-leading rusher in the American conference with 1,096 yards , just 5 yards behind San Diego 's Natrone Means .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;19	He also is second in the AFC in total yards .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;20	The Seahawks play Indianapolis Sunday in the Kingdome .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;21	The accident was the latest in a number of auto accidents involving NFL players this season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;22	Dallas offensive lineman Erik Williams was lost for the season when he tore knee ligaments in an Oct. 24 crash .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;23	Williams pleaded no contest to drunken driving .
APW_ENG_19941202.0370;24	Teammate Shante Carver , a defensive end , also was involved in an accident in October when his speeding truck crashed into a concrete retaining wall .

APW_ENG_19941202.0372;0	Part of an express train headed from eastern Hungary to Budapest derailed Friday , causing an undetermined number of deaths and injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0372;1	The state news agency MTI cited the National Ambulance Service as saying `` several people have died and the number of injured is high . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0372;2	Precise figures were not immediately available .
APW_ENG_19941202.0372;3	But doctors at one hospital near Szolnok , close to the site of the accident , said 26 injured , including two critical cases , were admitted to their hospital alone , with several others also taking in injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0372;4	The accident occurred at Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 40 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0372;5	The second car of the express train derailed , dragging three other cars with it and the overturned carriages smashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0372;6	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;0	The Danish capital , already filled with bicyclists on city streets , is trying to get even more people on two wheels -- for free .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;1	Under a private project backed by the government , cyclists will deposit a 20-kroner coin -LRB- dlrs 3.30 -RRB- at a special rack to pick up one of the 1,000 city-provided bikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;2	The money will be returned when the bike is taken back to any one of 200 racks throughout the city .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;3	`` In a city where everyone is bicycling there 's a need for free bikes , '' said Bente Frost , Copenhagen 's transportation chief , after her first ride on a city bike .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;4	Thirty percent of Copenhagen residents bike to work during the summer , and the city hopes the program will help the environment and curb bicycle thefts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;5	Each year about 27,000 bicycles are stolen in Copenhagen , costing insurance companies 41 million kroner -LRB- dlrs 6.7 million -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0373;6	Frost said up to 5,000 bicycles would be ready when Copenhagen becomes the European cultural capital in 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;0	Nadia Comaneci completed a 10-day visit to her homeland by promising to return in 1996 to marry American fiance Bart Conner .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;1	The 33-year-old gymnast , who scored the first-ever perfect 10 in the 1976 Montreal Olympic Games , said she was `` very moved '' by the warm welcome given her five years after she defected in what turned out to be the waning days of Communist rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;2	During her stay , she returned to her hometown , met the president and performed in front of the prime minister .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;3	`` People are more open , they are freer and say what they think .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;4	I know how it was before , '' she said in Romanian , translating for Conner .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;5	Conner , a two-time Olympic gymnastics champion , spoke of the `` warm and exciting reception '' the couple received , saying the most memorable moment was when he asked Gheorghe Comeneci for his daughter 's hand in marriage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0375;6	Nadia Comaneci left Romania five years ago , a month before the collapse of the regime of dictator Nicolae Ceausescu .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;0	Croatia and its rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday touted as a framework for normalized relations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;1	But the worst Serb-Croat clashes in months cast doubt on the pact 's chances for success .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;2	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;3	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220-mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;4	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;5	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;6	Croatia was effectively partitioned after a six-month war in 1991 at the start of the breakup of Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;7	A cease-fire in January 1992 halted the war , but left Serbs in control of a third of Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;8	Since then , thousands of skirmishes and larger clashes have threatened the truce .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;9	On Friday , U.N. spokesman Michael Williams reported the fiercest battlefield clashes since the United Nations brokered another cease-fire last March .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;10	It was the third day of artillery duels around Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , Alexander Ivanko , another U.N. spokesman , said in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;11	Six Serb soldiers were reported wounded , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;12	Nevertheless , an international mediator said the agreement could be made to work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;13	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;14	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;15	But he warned : `` This agreement can easily be blown up literally and metaphorically .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;16	The fighting is continued challenge to it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;17	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the agreement , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;18	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;19	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;20	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;21	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;22	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;23	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;24	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0376;25	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;0	Croatia and its rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday touted as a framework for normalized relations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;1	But the worst Serb-Croat clashes in months cast doubt on the pact 's chances for success .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;2	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;3	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220-mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;4	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;5	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;6	Croatia was effectively partitioned after a six-month war in 1991 at the start of the breakup of Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;7	A cease-fire in January 1992 halted the war , but left Serbs in control of a third of Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;8	Since then , thousands of skirmishes and larger clashes have threatened the truce .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;9	On Friday , U.N. spokesman Michael Williams reported the fiercest battlefield clashes since the United Nations brokered another cease-fire last March .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;10	It was the third day of artillery duels around Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , Alexander Ivanko , another U.N. spokesman , said in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;11	Six Serb soldiers were reported wounded , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;12	Nevertheless , an international mediator said the agreement could be made to work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;13	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;14	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;15	But he warned : `` This agreement can easily be blown up literally and metaphorically .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;16	The fighting is continued challenge to it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;17	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the agreement , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;18	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;19	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;20	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;21	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;22	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;23	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;24	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0377;25	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;0	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and key European foreign ministers met Friday , setting the stage for new overtures to the Bosnian Serbs for ending the war in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;1	The meeting with ministers of France , Britain , Russia and Germany came as the Bosnian Serbs tightened their grip on the mostly Muslim Bihac enclave and as the conflict threatened to spread into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;2	Two of the foreign ministers , Alain Juppe of France and Douglas Hurd of Britain , plan to carry a peace plan to Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic in Belgrade Sunday in the hope he would recommend it to his allies in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;3	Before the ministers meeting , Christopher told reporters : `` I think it 's important we come out of it unified but also that we come out of it with effective steps . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;4	Juppe , as he left for the meeting of the five-nation `` contact group , '' acknowledged : `` It wo n't be easy ; that wo n't surprise you . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;5	Christopher wants Milosevic to threaten to seal Serbia 's border to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;6	Despite a promise to halt weapons deliveries , Clinton administration officials said , arms were still getting through to fuel the Bosnian Serbs ' drive to gain more territory and to terrorize civilians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;7	The war has taken an estimated 200,000 lives and left many times that number homeless .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;8	Some 500 U.N. peacekeepers have been detained by the Bosnian Serbs , contributing to the decision by the U.N. commander , Sir Michael Rose , not to conduct heavy bombing raids against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;9	Christopher 's plan , which was adopted by President Clinton 's senior foreign policy advisers last Monday , calls for a cease-fire in the Bihac area , a cessation of hostilities for three to six months throughout Bosnia and a peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;10	There , the Bosnian Serbs would be able to promote their aspirations for a Greater Serbia , initially with political links to Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;11	They hope also to establish cross-border ties to ethnic Serbs in Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;12	Elements of the plan are similar to one rejected repeatedly by the Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;13	It called for them to recognize Bosnia and to shrink the territory under their control to 49 percent from about 70 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;14	A federation of Muslims and Croats would be in charge of 51 percent of the war-torn country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;15	Even that division is negotiable once peace talks are resumed , U.S. officials said , hoping to induce the Serbs to halt their attacks and to negotiate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;16	Ironically , it was here at a NATO summit meeting in January that Clinton and allied leaders decided that NATO warplanes should be used to protect Bosnian Muslim civilians from attacks by rebel Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;17	But France and Britain prevailed in their resistance to a military approach .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;18	The Clinton administration has capitulated with some grumbling that the United Nations should have authorized sustained bombing and that the Bush administration that preceded Clinton 's should have done more than provide humanitarian assistance to trapped civilians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;19	In weighing diplomatic approaches , the five-nation group also considered a plan to urge Serbia to recognize the borders of Croatia and Bosnia make peace with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;20	The incentive would be an easing of economic sanctions against Milosevic 's government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;21	While the ministers are trying to enlist Milosevic , Christopher said , it would not be proper to have a further easing of sanctions against Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;22	When Milosevic promised to cut off arms supplies to Bosnian Serbs , some of the sanctions were lifted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;23	This included opening of the Belgrade airport .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;24	Again signaling a willingness to compromise with the Serbs , Christopher did not rule out political union between the Serbs in Bosnia with Serbia itself `` if it would mean reaching a peaceful resolution '' of the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0378;25	He said that was a constitutional issue the parties -- Serbs , Muslims and Croats -- should decide among themselves .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;0	Nadia Comaneci completed a 10-day visit to her homeland by promising to return in 1996 to marry American fiance Bart Conner .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;1	The 33-year-old gymnast , who scored the first-ever perfect 10 in the 1976 Montreal Olympic Games , said she was `` very moved '' by the warm welcome given her five years after she defected in what turned out to be the waning days of Communist rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;2	During her stay , she returned to her hometown , met the president and performed in front of the prime minister .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;3	`` People are more open , they are freer and say what they think .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;4	I know how it was before , '' she said in Romanian , translating for Conner .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;5	Conner , a two-time Olympic gymnastics champion , spoke of the `` warm and exciting reception '' the couple received , saying the most memorable moment was when he asked Gheorghe Comeneci for his daughter 's hand in marriage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0379;6	Nadia Comaneci left Romania five years ago , a month before the collapse of the regime of dictator Nicolae Ceausescu .

APW_ENG_19941202.0381;0	For a while , it looked like Union Carbide itself would not survive the worst industrial accident in history .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;1	But in the 10 years since a cyanide gas leak left nearly 4,000 people dead in Bhopal , India , Carbide has engineered a dramatic turnaround .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;2	Today , Carbide is a smaller , more focused company built around core chemicals businesses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;3	The company has sold or spun off most of its non-core divisions , shaved dlrs 575 million from its annual operating costs and radically cut its work force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;4	`` There 's no comparison to the Carbide that was and the Carbide that is , '' Carbide chairman and Chief Executive Officer Robert D. Kennedy said in a recent interview .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;5	But no matter how well it fares financially , Union Carbide remains in the shadow of Bhopal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;6	It was early on Dec. 3 , 1984 that the company 's downward spiral began .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;7	Methyl isocyanate gas , an ingredient in pesticides , leaked out of Carbide 's plant in Bhopal killing 3,800 people living nearby in crowded , dilapidated houses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;8	A legal battle over compensation for the victims of Bhopal went on for years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;9	Carbide , which concluded the gas leak was the result of employee sabotage , tried to defend itself from accusations by the Indian government and environmental groups who claimed the company did n't care enough about the indigent residents of Bhopal to take necessary safety precautions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;10	A Bhopal court issued a warrant for the arrest of former Carbide chairman Warren Anderson and unsuccessfully sought his extradition to face homicide charges .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;11	The legal problems caused by Bhopal were resolved in 1989 , when Carbide paid dlrs 470 million to settle the claims , as directed by the Supreme Court of India .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;12	There were other problems .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;13	Soon after the disaster , the company became the target of a takeover bid by GAF Corp. , a specialty chemicals maker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;14	As a defense , Carbide sold its profitable consumer products group -- including Glad garbage bags , Eveready batteries and Prestone antifreeze -- and bought back 56 percent of its own stock .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;15	In the process , the company saddled itself with dlrs 3.3 billion in new debt and made it difficult to diversify into other businesses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;16	Sales dropped from approximately dlrs 9.99 billion in 1980 to dlrs 6.39 billion in 1985 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;17	Over the next few years , Carbide spun off non-core businesses including pesticides , silicones and , in 1992 , Linde , its industrial gases unit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;18	Union Carbide is almost unrecognizable from its pre-Bhopal days as a conglomerate with about 20 different businesses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;19	Its worldwide work force has been slashed dramatically -- from 98,400 in 1984 to about 12,000 today .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;20	The company is even looking to lease out space at its sprawling Danbury headquarters , built before the Bhopal accident and now too large for the new , leaner Carbide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;21	Wall Street seems to approve of the redesigned Carbide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;22	`` Bhopal almost destroyed the company .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;23	It was the beginning of a series of problems ... but today I 'd call it a big Wall Street success story , '' said James Hickman , a chemicals industry analyst at CS First Boston in New York .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;24	`` -LRB- The turnaround -RRB- involved some divestiture , some head count reductions and efficiency improvements , and the market -- skeptical at first -- ultimately rewarded the company , and the stock price improved dramatically , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;25	The company 's shares appreciated almost 35 percent in 1993 to close at dlrs 22.375 , the fifth-best performance for the year among the 30 companies on the Dow Jones industrial list .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;26	Today it is trading in the high dlrs 20 range .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;27	Analysts credit the company 's cost-cutting program for the company 's revival .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;28	In late 1990 , Carbide announced a plan to cut dlrs 200 million from its operating budget by the end of 1994 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;29	Within a year , the company increased that target to dlrs 400 million , and in 1993 , to dlrs 575 million , a goal the company said it will reach by the end of this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;30	`` That transformed them from a high-cost producer to one of the lower cost producers , '' said Paul Raman , an analyst with S.G. Warburg , a New York investment bank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;31	But critics are still mindful of Bhopal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0381;32	Environmental groups are familiar fixtures at the company 's annual stockholders ' meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;0	A former Christian warlord standing trial on charges of bombing a church and killing a rival politician said Friday he did not commit murder and complained of mistreatment in prison .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;1	Samir Geagea , 43 , was the leader of the Lebanese Forces , the Christians ' main militia until it was disarmed in 1990 at the end of Lebanon 's 15-year civil war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;2	Friday 's session was devoted to the murder of Dany Chamoun , 56 , his half-German wife Ingrid Abdel-Noor , and their two sons , Tarek , 7 , and Julien , 5 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;3	They were killed by unidentified gunmen who broke into their house in suburban Baabda east of Beirut at dawn on Oct. 21 , 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;4	Chamoun headed the right-wing National Liberal Party , long at odds with Geagea 's Lebanese Forces , which ruled most of the Christian hinterland north and northeast of Beirut during the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;5	Geagea faces the death penalty if convicted of either charge .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;6	He told the judges he did not kill Chamoun .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;7	`` You should realize that we are innocent and that we have been framed , '' Geagea said in his first comments in court .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;8	`` I have been held for 250 days in a cell without light ... sometimes blindfolded , '' Geagea told the five-judge tribunal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;9	`` In our cell I can sometimes hear screams '' coming from elsewhere in the Defense Ministry detention center .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;10	In the other case , Geagea is accused of masterminding an explosion at a church in the Christian port city of Jounieh on Feb. 27 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;11	Eleven worshipers were killed and 60 were wounded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;12	Also on trial for the two crimes are four Geagea aides , including his chief of staff , Fuad Malek .
APW_ENG_19941202.0382;13	Fourteen others , including his top security chief , Ghassan Touma , are being tried on the same charges in absentia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;0	A U.N. commission of experts reiterated charges Friday that Hutu leaders were guilty of genocide against the minority Tutsi group in Rwanda , adding to legal evidence that may be brought before a war crimes tribunal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;1	In its final report to the U.N. Security Council , the three-man panel said it had been unable to find evidence that the new Tutsi-led Royal Patriotic Front government had instigated systematic killings after it assumed power last July .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;2	However , it added that it was `` disturbed by ongoing violence committed by some RPF soldiers , '' and recommended that investigations should continue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;3	It said it had not had enough time itself to complete the inquiry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;4	U.N. Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali ordered the commission to check into alleged massacres by RPF soldiers after the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees said they had carried out reprisal killings of up to 30,000 people late August and early September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;5	The government arrested some of its own soldiers after the allegations but maintains it is powerless to clamp down on all abuses because of lack of international help to restore the shattered law and order system .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;6	The commission 's final report added added little to its interim conclusions issued in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;7	`` After careful deliberation , the Commission of Experts has concluded that there exists overwhelming evidence to prove that acts of genocide against the Tutsi group were perpetrated by Hutu elements in a concerted , planned , systematic and methodical way , '' the 58-page document said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;8	Atsu-Koffi Amega , a former judge from Togo , heads the commission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;9	The other members are Salifou Fomba , a law professor from Mali , and Haby Dieng , a prosecutor from Guinea .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;10	Their work is in addition to inquiries carried out by the U.N. Human Rights Center .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;11	The Security Council voted last month to set up an international tribunal for genocide in Rwanda , with a maximum sentence of life imprisonment for those found guilty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;12	However , it may be months before a tribunal starts work , and the Rwandan government objects to the U.N. plans because they exclude the death penalty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;13	An estimated 500,000 people , mostly ethnic Tutsis and moderate Hutus , were massacred by the Hutu army and militias after the death of the Hutu president in a mysterious plane crash April 6 released an orgy of violence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0383;14	Many of those accused of the worst atrocities are now sheltering in refugee camps in neighboring Zaire and there are fears that -- with the help of international aid -- they are preparing a violent invasion of Rwanda .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;0	John , Paul , George and Ringo have a new record in British and Irish shops this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;1	So does Pope John Paul II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;2	The pope is featured on half of a double album , reciting the rosary in Latin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;3	The other half is a recording of an Irish priest , the Rev. Colm Kilcoyne , reciting the rosary in English .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;4	The recording of the pope , made from a Vatican Radio broadcast , was first sold in Spain , said Colin Elms , national account executive for Telstar Records PLC of London .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;5	The recording came out two days before EMI released double album `` Live At the BBC , '' a collection of Beatles ' recordings from the 1960s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;6	The pope 's disc was a best seller in Spain , and a platinum record was presented to the pope at the Vatican three weeks ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0384;7	In Britain , the recording entered the chart at No. 52 at midweek , indicating sales of about 4,000 in three days , Elms said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;0	Bosnian Serb gunners ringing Sarajevo fired five anti-tank missiles at the capital Friday , including two which hit government headquarters minutes before the chief U.N. envoy arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;1	It was yet another sign of the contempt with which Serbs hold the United Nations mission to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;2	More than 300 U.N. peacekeepers remained hostages of the Serbs , as insurance against further NATO airstrikes , but 70 were released Friday after being detained for seven days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;3	Two missiles hit the Bosnian presidency building , which houses the offices of the top government officials , minutes before U.N. envoy Yasushi Akashi arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;4	One destroyed the office of Miro Lazovic moments after he left for the Akashi meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;5	Lazovic is an ethnic Serb member of Bosnia 's collective presidency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;6	Later , three missiles hit nearby buildings as Akashi met in the presidency with top government and military officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;7	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;8	`` Until we achieve something tangible , this shuttle diplomacy must continue , '' Akashi told reporters in Sarajevo before leaving for Pale , the Bosnian Serb headquarters east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;9	But the Bosnian government blasted the United Nations for failing to use the necessary force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , even as fighting continued in that northwest region Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;10	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;11	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic , referring to European capitulation to Adolf Hitler before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;12	Charles Redman , the former U.S. member of the Contact Group , was also back in Sarajevo , leading bilateral talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic that presumably focused on a proposed new peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;13	Redman , now ambassador to Germany , helped draft the first Contact Group peace plan , which the Serbs have repeatedly rejected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;14	Although that proposal was presented to the Serbs as a take-it-or-leave-it plan , the lack of Western will to use force has allowed the Serbs to demand , apparently successfully , the right of future confederal links with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;15	The original plan denied Serbs that as punishment for starting the war , though it granted the Bosnian Croat-Muslim federation similar rights to link with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;16	Akashi , on a mission to end the peacekeepers ' detention and win freedom of movement for U.N. convoys , hoped to have more success with the Serbs than his boss , Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;17	Boutros-Ghali was rebuffed in even trying to meet the Bosnian Serbs on Wednesday , and afterwards said intransigence by the warring sides might force the end of the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;18	Seventy Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia , Friday after being released from a seven-day detention by the Serbs in eastern Bosnia , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;19	But Serbs continued to hold about 20 other Dutch peacekeepers , along with hundreds of British , Ukrainians and Canadians , at various points throughout Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;20	In New York , Russia and Ukraine issued a statement Friday calling on U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali and the UNPROFOR command to take `` all appropriate measures ... to facilitate the release of all captured or detained UNPROFOR personnel . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;21	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi also wanted to discuss with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic fighting around the government enclave of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;22	The United Nations is trying to broker a cease-fire there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;23	A number of detonations were reported on the outskirts of Bihac Friday , along with machine-gun and small arms fire , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;24	But the heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;25	The Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave , part of which is a U.N. `` safe area , '' in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;26	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;27	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces against the Serbs , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;28	A Croat militia and the Bosnian army took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;29	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia also had shelled his forces across the border , near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0385;30	He said his troops returned fire .

APW_ENG_19941202.0386;1	Gagner and Pittsburgh Penguin star Jaromir Jagr are taking part courtesy of the labor dispute that has stilled the NHL season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;2	`` I did not play a great game today , and the team did not either , '' Gagner said . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;3	Villach is a very good defensive team .
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;4	They play just like the North American style -- they clutch and grab -- and it was very hard to find open ice . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;5	Villach scored first at 19:29 of the first period with a goal by Gerald Ressmann .
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;6	Bob Reynolds tied it for CourmAosta at 10:41 of the second period .
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;7	Courmaosta scored two more in the third , with a goal at 11:08 by Sim Camazzola and at 11:43 by Alberto Scapinello .
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;8	Teams from Austria , Italy , Slovenia , France , Holland and Denmark were invited to the tournament .
APW_ENG_19941202.0386;9	Gagner signed to play part of the Italian season for CourmAosta after the NHL season was put on hold , and Jagr has contracted to play in the tournament for Wurth Bolzano .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;0	Bosnian Serb gunners ringing Sarajevo fired five anti-tank missiles at the capital Friday , including two which hit government headquarters minutes before the chief U.N. envoy arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;1	It was yet another sign of the contempt with which Serbs hold the United Nations mission to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;2	More than 300 U.N. peacekeepers remained hostages of the Serbs , as insurance against further NATO airstrikes , but 70 were released Friday after being detained for seven days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;3	Two missiles hit the Bosnian presidency building , which houses the offices of the top government officials , minutes before U.N. envoy Yasushi Akashi arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;4	One destroyed the office of Miro Lazovic moments after he left for the Akashi meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;5	Lazovic is an ethnic Serb member of Bosnia 's collective presidency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;6	Later , three missiles hit nearby buildings as Akashi met in the presidency with top government and military officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;7	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;8	`` Until we achieve something tangible , this shuttle diplomacy must continue , '' Akashi told reporters in Sarajevo before leaving for Pale , the Bosnian Serb headquarters east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;9	But the Bosnian government blasted the United Nations for failing to use the necessary force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , even as fighting continued in that northwest region Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;10	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;11	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic , referring to European capitulation to Adolf Hitler before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;12	Charles Redman , the former U.S. member of the Contact Group , was also back in Sarajevo , leading bilateral talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic that presumably focused on a proposed new peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;13	Redman , now ambassador to Germany , helped draft the first Contact Group peace plan , which the Serbs have repeatedly rejected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;14	Although that proposal was presented to the Serbs as a take-it-or-leave-it plan , the lack of Western will to use force has allowed the Serbs to demand , apparently successfully , the right of future confederal links with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;15	The original plan denied Serbs that as punishment for starting the war , though it granted the Bosnian Croat-Muslim federation similar rights to link with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;16	Akashi , on a mission to end the peacekeepers ' detention and win freedom of movement for U.N. convoys , hoped to have more success with the Serbs than his boss , Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;17	Boutros-Ghali was rebuffed in even trying to meet the Bosnian Serbs on Wednesday , and afterwards said intransigence by the warring sides might force the end of the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;18	Seventy Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia , Friday after being released from a seven-day detention by the Serbs in eastern Bosnia , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;19	But Serbs continued to hold about 20 other Dutch peacekeepers , along with hundreds of British , Ukrainians and Canadians , at various points throughout Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;20	In New York , Russia and Ukraine issued a statement Friday calling on U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali and the UNPROFOR command to take `` all appropriate measures ... to facilitate the release of all captured or detained UNPROFOR personnel . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;21	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi also wanted to discuss with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic fighting around the government enclave of Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;22	The United Nations is trying to broker a cease-fire there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;23	A number of detonations were reported on the outskirts of Bihac Friday , along with machine-gun and small arms fire , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;24	But the heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;25	The Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave , part of which is a U.N. `` safe area , '' in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;26	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;27	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces against the Serbs , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;28	A Croat militia and the Bosnian army took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;29	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia also had shelled his forces across the border , near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0387;30	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;0	Accusing Iran 's Islamic regime of giving the orders , prosecutors Friday demanded a life sentence for an Iranian accused of leading a commando team that murdered former Iranian Prime Minister Shahpour Bakhtiar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;1	Prosecutor Jacques Mouton , saying the assassination was carried out `` with perfect mastery in perfect cold blood , '' demanded terms of 13-15 years for two other defendants , accused of helping the killers enter France and escape .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;2	Bakhtiar , an exiled opposition leader , and his secretary , Soroush Katibeh , were strangled and slashed to death Aug. 6 , 1991 , at his home in suburban Paris .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;3	Police guards failed to detect the murders for two days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;4	Presenting five hours of final arguments to the special anti-terrorist court , Mouton said that the killers walked away from the `` butchery '' with a calm that amounted to disdain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;5	Mouton asked for a life sentence with a minimum of 18 years behind bars for the alleged leader of the hit team , Ali Vakili Rad , 35 , who was arrested in Switzerland 15 days after the killing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;6	The other two accused assassins got away .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;7	Vakili Rad claims he actually belonged to Bakhtiar 's opposition group but was duped by his cohorts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;8	Mouton called him a liar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;9	Vakili Rad and the other defendants -- Massoud Hendi , 47 , once Paris bureau chief of the Islamic Republic Broadcasting Network , and Zeynalabedine Sarhadi , 28 , an archivist at Iran 's embassy in Bern , Switzerland -- mount their final defense in the month-long trial Monday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;10	The seven-judge panel will render its verdict Monday or Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;11	Reviewing tomes of evidence , Mouton spared no words for Iran , suggesting the Islamic state was implicated through a vast , complicated network with its hub in Tehran officialdom .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;12	The Iranian Ministry of Telecommunications `` was at the heart of this assassination , '' Mouton said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;13	Many of the dozens of telephone calls at critical moments before and after the murder were traced by the French secret service to the ministry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;14	Among the suspects France wants to try but remain at large is Hossein Sheikhattar , who headed the ministry 's satellite division .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;15	Hendi said in testimony that Sheikhattar asked him to procure visas for two of the suspected killers , including Vakili Rad .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;16	The Iranian Embassy in Paris has denied any role by the government in the slayings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;17	At least 63 Iranians have been killed in exile since the Islamic Republic was founded in 1979 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0388;18	But , if the defendants are found guilty , this would be the first trial directly implicating the regime .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;0	American Hilary Lindh earned her second career World Cup victory , capturing the opening women 's downhill race of the season on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;1	Lindh , 25 , prevailed by 29-hundredths of a second over Isolde Kostner of Italy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;2	Defending World Cup downhill champion Katja Seizinger of Germany finished third .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;3	Austria 's Stefanie Schuster overcame a late start number to finish a career-best fourth , Switzerland 's Heidi Zurbriggen was fifth , and Sweden 's Pernilla Wiberg took sixth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;4	Lindh , winning on a course that she admitted did n't fit her style because of tight turns at the bottom , was timed in 1 minute , 45.00 seconds .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;5	Her best previous finish on this course was sixth place two years ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;6	Kostner , the last of the top-seeded skiers to complete the run , could n't overcome Lindh 's solid effort , coming across in 1:45.29 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;7	Seizinger was timed in 1:45.44 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;8	Three other favorites -- Anja Haas of Austria , Melanie Suchet of France and American Picabo Street -- fell and did not finish .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;9	Street made a minor mistake early in her run and , in an effort to make up time , got out of control near the finish , did the splits and crashed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;10	Haas had the fastest intermediate time one-third of the way down the course when she fell .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;11	Lindh , the 1992 Olympic downhill silver medalist , posted her first victory on the World Cup circuit last February in Sierra Nevada , Spain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;12	For the first time , downhillers in the top seed of 15 were allowed to select starting numbers from 1 through 30 , and most of the favorites chose numbers in the 20s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0391;13	The course appeared to speed up slightly during the race as a bright sun glazed the snow , making it slicker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;0	Part of an express train headed from eastern Hungary to Budapest derailed Friday , its cars sliding into a station building and burying passengers underneath the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;1	Police said at least 20 people died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;2	The accident occurred at Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 40 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;3	The second car of the express train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages smashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;4	`` There was a tremedous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;5	He said in a telephone interview that people remained buried in the wreckage more than four hours after the crash , which occured at 4:45 p.m. local time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;6	National Police Maj. Imre Olah said 20 deaths had been confirmed `` but that 's not the final count by any means . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;7	Ambulance crews taking victims to the hospital said between 20 and 40 people were believed injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;8	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok , close to the site of the accident , said 26 injured , including two critical cases , were admitted to their hospital alone , with several others also taking in injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0392;9	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0393;0	Serbian police have arrested 156 ethnic Albanians , all former police officers , who they claim were plotting rebellion in Kosovo province , the public prosecutor announced Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0393;1	In the first official confirmation of the crackdown over the past ten days , Serbian prosecutor Miodrag Brkljac said the ethnic Albanians were members of an illegal group which planned `` armed rebellion against '' Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0393;2	It was the biggest police raid in Kosovo since 1989 when Serbia revoked the autonomy of its southern province , where ethnic Albanians comprise 90 percent of the 1.9 million population .
APW_ENG_19941202.0393;3	Serbian police now keep a firm grip on any ethnic Albanian dissent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0393;4	Ethnic Albanian officials deny planning any armed rebellion against Serbia , saying that would be against their peaceful resistance policy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0393;5	Serbia regards Kosovo as the cradle of its history and culture and has vowed never to give it up to the ethnic Albanians who seek independence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;0	Expectations of continued robust strength for the economy were tempered Friday by reports suggesting the pace could slacken next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;1	The government 's main forecasting gauge of future economic activity fell in October for the first time in 15 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;2	Also , new orders to U.S. factories slipped for the first time in three months as demand for cars and other transportation equipment plummeted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;3	`` The slowdown is still an expectation rather than a reality , '' said economist Norman Robertson of Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;4	The data `` tend to suggest that sometime in 1995 we will see a slower-paced expansion . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;5	The Commerce Department said its Index of Leading Economic Indicators declined 0.1 percent in October after edging up 0.1 percent in September and climbing 0.5 percent in August .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;6	When the index moves in the same direction for three straight months , it is considered a sign of an economic trend six months down the road .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;7	Analysts had expected the index to rise moderately in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;8	But seven of its 11 components fell , led by a slower rate of increase for raw material prices due largely to declines for some paper products .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;9	Other negative factors in the index were a slowing in business orders for plant and equipment , higher weekly initial claims for unemployment insurance , lower money supply , fewer building permits , lower stock prices and declining unfilled orders for durable goods .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;10	The four components that made positive contributions to the index were slower business delivery times that usually are a sign of rising orders , increased average workweek , rising consumer expectations and more new orders for consumer goods .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;11	The Commerce Department also said that factory orders fell 0.4 percent in October after a rise of less than 0.1 percent the previous month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;12	The decrease , caused by an 8.8 percent drop in transportation equipment led by declining car demand , was expected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;13	The reports softened somewhat the impact of other data that pointed to a still-surging economy and possible rising inflation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;14	The Labor Department said unemployment fell to 5.6 percent in November , its lowest rate in four years , as a seasonally adjusted 350,000 new workers were added to the nation 's nonfarm payrolls ,
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;15	Reports earlier in the week signaled brisk growth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;16	Analysts said they doubt the Federal Reserve will move this month to raise short-term interest rates a seventh time this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;17	`` I suppose they do n't want to be Scrooge-like and do it before Christmas , '' said Robertson .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;18	`` And there are ambiguities in the numbers . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;19	The Federal Open Market Committee , which sets policy for the Federal Reserve , next meets on Dec. 20 and then has a two-day meeting concluding Feb. 1 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;20	New factory orders , a key gauge of the nation 's manufacturing sector , have risen in 13 of the last 15 months including a 4.7 percent jump in August that was led by auto demand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;21	They last fell in July , when they were off 2 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0394;22	Excluding the volatile transportation component , orders rose 0.9 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;0	Croatia and its rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement Friday touted as a framework for normalized relations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;1	But the worst Serb-Croat clashes in months cast doubt on the pact 's chance for success .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;2	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;3	Two sections of the 360-kilometer -LRB- 220-mile -RRB- highway are controlled by Croatian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;4	Representatives of the Croatian government signed the accord Friday morning at U.N. headquarters in Zagreb , with international mediators Lord David Owen and Thorvald Stoltenberg as co-signers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;5	The document was then brought to Knin , rebel Serb headquarters , where their leaders signed it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;6	Croatia was effectively partitioned after a six-month war in 1991 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;7	A cease-fire in January 1992 halted the war , but left Serbs in control of a third of Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;8	Since then , thousands of skirmishes and bigger clashes have threatened the truce .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;9	On Friday , U.N. spokesman Michael Williams reported the fiercest clashes since the United Nations brokered another cease-fire last March .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;10	It was the third day of artillery duels around Lake Peruca , about 30 kilometers -LRB- 18.6 miles -RRB- southeast of Knin , Alexander Ivanko , another U.N. spokesman , said in Zagreb .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;11	Six Serb soldiers were reported wounded , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;12	Nevertheless , an international mediator said the agreement could be made to work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;13	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;14	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;15	But he warned : `` This agreement can easily be blown up literally and metaphorically .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;16	The fighting is continued challenge to it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;17	Croatian President Franjo Tudjman , on a three-day visit to Argentina , called the agreement `` an important step toward the total return of our occupied territories . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;18	He said , however , if Serbs refuse to relinquish the territory , `` Croatia will resort to other means , backed by the international community . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;19	He did not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;20	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the accord , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;21	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;22	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;23	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;24	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;25	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans ' power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;26	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;27	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0396;28	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;0	Sweden 's new government is trying to retake a central role alongside Norway in the Middle East peace process after a three-year hiatus .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;1	The government 's initiative features an unusual trip to Israel this weekend by an ex-foreign minister to hammer out an economic assistance plan for Palestinian territories .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;2	Sweden 's `` concrete plan '' will detail immediate improvements in conditions for Gaza and the West Bank , the Swedish newspaper Dagens Nyheter reported this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;3	Sweden hopes the effort , undertaken at the request of Israel and the PLO , will include `` political '' issues , said the official , Sten Andersson , who was involved in talks leading to the 1991 Madrid peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;4	`` This is social and economic and political , '' Andersson told The Associated Press before leaving Sweden Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;5	`` It 's high time for Sweden to do something .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;6	The peace process is in a very critical stage right now .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;7	There must be some signs for the -LRB- Palestinian -RRB- population that something will happen . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;8	Administration and economic development in Gaza are priorities for Arafat , who is facing pressure from Islamic radicals because of dismal conditions in the territories .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;9	Israeli officials have hinted they want to speed up the process .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;10	In Brussels this week , foreign donors released dlrs 125 million pledged earlier for the Palestinians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;11	Among the plans already under consideration are job-creation programs and the establishment of an industrial zone along Gaza 's borders to attract investment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;12	Andersson , 71 , declined to detail his initiative , other than saying he had `` new '' ideas which could be included in the plan to be discussed in Stockholm Dec. 12 by PLO leader Yasser Arafat and Israeli Foreign Minister Shimon Peres .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;13	Sweden 's neighbor , Norway , already has been deeply involved in the peace process since the country established its acclaimed `` Oslo Channel '' two years ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;14	That channel led to last year 's peace treaty signed in Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;15	In what may be mainly a footnote to history , Sweden 's new initiative arises from a domestic political feud and a friendly rivalry with Norway for the mantle of peacemaker in the Middle East .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;16	Swedish officials , led by Andersson , had been intimately involved in Israeli-Palestinian contacts until 1991 , when the Social Democrats lost elections to a center-conservative coalition led by former Prime Minister Carl Bildt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;17	According to Andersson and other officials , the Social Democrats at the time had close contacts with the Palestine Liberation Organization , whose leader Arafat was looking for a third country to foster contacts with Israel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;18	`` The -LRB- conservative -RRB- Bildt government was very passive , that was a pity , '' said Andersson , a career Social Democrat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;19	`` So then I recommended to the PLO that they go to the Norwegians . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;20	Norway 's government was led by Social Democrats also .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;21	Palestinians then turned to Norwegian diplomats to set up talks which eventually led to the `` Oslo Channel , '' a Scandinavian diplomat involved with the talks said on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;22	The diplomat , however , said the relationship had been established well before the change of power in Sweden .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;23	`` It 's probably true that Sten Andersson suggested Norway , and suggested to Norway that we help , '' the diplomat said by telephone from Israel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;24	`` The fact that we -LRB- already -RRB- had good relations was the reason . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;25	Andersson , now retired , insisted the new Social Democratic government , which returned to power last September , was not trying to take over Norway 's role in the peace process .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;26	`` The Norwegians have done a magnificent job and I 'm not here to compete with them , '' Andersson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0398;27	Bildt 's spokeswoman referred all questions about the period to Bildt or his former aides , none of whom could be reached for comment Friday .

APW_ENG_19941202.0399;12	Nevertheless , an international mediator said the agreement could be made to work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;13	`` The significance of the agreement is going to depend on the parties to the agreement , '' Owen told The Associated Press in Knin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;14	The two sides `` have it in their power to implement the agreement if they want to , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;15	But he warned : `` This agreement can easily be blown up literally and metaphorically .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;16	The fighting is continued challenge to it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;17	Croatian President Franjo Tudjman , on a three-day visit to Argentina , called the agreement `` an important step toward the total return of our occupied territories . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;18	He said , however , if Serbs refuse to relinquish the territory , `` Croatia will resort to other means , backed by the international community . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;19	He did not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;20	Croatian Serb representative Borislav Mikelic , though signing the accord , remained firm in the Serbs ' refusal to accept any reintegration with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;21	`` By signing this agreement we once more proved that we are in favor of a peaceful solution to the crisis here and we also showed that we 're interested in the economic progress and economic opening to Europe and the world , '' Mikelic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;22	But he refused to discuss the crucial overall political solution , saying , `` This is not the time to talk about it . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;23	The self-styled Croatian Serb assembly approved the economic accord late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;24	Negotiations between the two sides had been stalled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;25	But the Croatian Serbs relented after a recent meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic , the Balkans ' power broker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;26	Thousands of peacekeepers have been deployed between the warring sides in the disputed territories since the 1992 cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;27	But international efforts toward lasting peace have failed over what seemed to be irreconcilable differences .
APW_ENG_19941202.0399;28	This is the first accord between the foes since they agreed March 29 on a formal cease-fire to end their 1991 war .

APW_ENG_19941202.0401;0	Serbian police have arrested 156 ethnic Albanians , all former police officers , who they claim were plotting rebellion in Kosovo province , the public prosecutor announced Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0401;1	In the first official confirmation of the crackdown over the past ten days , Serbian prosecutor Miodrag Brkljac said the ethnic Albanians were members of an illegal group which planned `` armed rebellion against '' Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0401;2	It was the biggest police raid in Kosovo since 1989 when Serbia revoked the autonomy of its southern province , where ethnic Albanians comprise 90 percent of the 1.9 million population .
APW_ENG_19941202.0401;3	Serbian police now keep a firm grip on any ethnic Albanian dissent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0401;4	Ethnic Albanian officials deny planning any armed rebellion against Serbia , saying that would be against their peaceful resistance policy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0401;5	Serbia regards Kosovo as the cradle of its history and culture and has vowed never to give it up to the ethnic Albanians who seek independence .
