APW_ENG_19941202.0416;0	Quebec separatist leader Lucien Bouchard had his left leg amputated after being attacked by a strain of flesh-eating bacteria , but is out of danger , doctors said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;1	Bouchard , 55 , the most popular leader in Canada 's largest French-speaking province , vowed to continue his political career , dedicated to making Quebec an independent country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;2	`` Mr. Bouchard has greatly improved over the past 12 hours , '' Dr. Patrick d'Amico told a news conference at Montreal 's St. Luc Hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;3	D'Amico said Bouchard had undergone three operations since being admitted to the hospital earlier this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;4	The left leg was amputated at mid-thigh in an operation during which he was conscious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;5	If no further complications occur , Bouchard should recover fully in about three or four months , said D'Amico .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;6	Earlier Friday , rumors circulated that Bouchard was on the verge of death , but hospital officials dismissed them as untrue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;7	News of Bouchard 's illness shook Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;8	Small groups of people , some bearing Quebec flags , kept an all-night vigil outside the hospital under a light snowfall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;9	Bouchard was struck by a rare disease known as necrotizing fasciitis , more commonly known as the `` flesh-eating disease . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;10	Doctors say the disease is caused by the streptococcus A bacteria and is fatal in 80 percent of the cases .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;11	The bacteria is common and usually results in sore throats or tonsilitis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;12	But in about one in a million cases , it turns deadly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;13	Bouchard , a former Conservative Cabinet minister , bolted former Prime Minister Brian Mulroney 's government in 1990 and formed his own party .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;14	The new party became , effectively , the national arm of the Parti Quebecois , the provincial party dedicated to the secession of Quebec and its 7 million inhabitants from Canada .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;15	In the 1993 federal elections , the Bloc Quebecois won 54 seats to become the official opposition to the ruling Liberals in the House of Commons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;16	Few wanted to speculate on what the absence of Bouchard would have on the political scene or the referendum on independence expected next year in Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;17	Politicians of all political stripes expressed their concern for Bouchard 's health and wished him well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;18	Prime Minister Jean Chretien , on a trip to France , said : `` I speak not only for the government of Canada , but also for the people of Canada when I express to Mr. Bouchard and his family our deep regrets and our sincere wish for a rapid return of his health . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;19	The disease struck Bouchard suddenly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;20	Last weekend he had attended a party congress , though he complained of having the flu .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;21	On Tuesday , he was diagnose with phlebitis , an inflammation of a vein in his leg , and was admitted to St. Luc Hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;22	Dr. Pierre Ghosn , head of cardiovascular surgery , said he operated to relieve pressure in the leg and discovered the disease .
APW_ENG_19941202.0416;23	A third operation was necessary to remove infection found in the abdomen and
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;0	In its final report to the Security Council , a U.N. commission again charged Rwanda 's Hutu leaders with genocide and said Friday it could find no evidence the new government engaged in systematic killings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;1	The findings , particularly of genocide , add to the legal evidence that may be used against any Hutu leaders brought before a war crimes tribunal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;2	But the commission 's final report added little to its initial conclusions in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;3	The 58-page document explicitly blamed Hutus for mass killings carried out `` in a concerted , planned , systematic and methodical way . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;4	An estimated 500,000 people , mostly ethnic Tutsis and moderate Hutus , were massacred by the Hutu army and militias after the death of the Hutu president in a mysterious plane crash on April 6 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;5	Many of those accused of the worst atrocities are now sheltering in refugee camps in neighboring Zaire and there are fears that -- with the help of international aid -- they are preparing a violent invasion of Rwanda .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;6	The three-man panel said it had been unable to find evidence that the new Tutsi-led Royal Patriotic Front government had instigated systematic killings after it assumed power last July .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;7	But it added that it was `` disturbed by ongoing violence committed by some RPF soldiers , '' and recommended that investigations should continue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;8	It said it had not had enough time itself to complete the inquiry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;9	Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali ordered the commission to check into alleged massacres by RPF soldiers after some U.N. officials said they had carried out reprisal killings of up to 30,000 people in August and September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0417;10	The government arrested some of its own soldiers after the allegations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;0	An express train derailed Friday sending cars smashing into a railroad station southeast of Budapest and burying people under the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;1	At least 20 people were killed , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;2	The accident occurred at 4:45 p.m. in Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 43 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;3	The second car of the train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages crashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;4	`` There was a tremedous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;5	He said in a telephone interview that people remained buried in the wreckage more than four hours after the crash .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;6	National Police Maj. Imre Olah said 20 deaths had been confirmed , `` but that 's not the final count by any means . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;7	Ambulance crews said between 20 and 40 people were believed injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;8	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok said 26 injured people , including two critical cases , had been admitted to their hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;9	Several other hospitals were also taking in the injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0418;10	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest , to the capital .

APW_ENG_19941202.0420;0	Marking a milestone in Taiwan 's shift to democracy , Taiwanese voters go to the polls Saturday in the toughest electoral test for the island 's Nationalist rulers in 45 years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;1	The elections are part of the reforms initiated by the Nationalists , who ruled by martial law until unleashing a bloodless democratic revolution in 1987 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;2	Voters will elect a Taiwan governor , mayors for Taipei and Kaohsiung -- the island 's two largest cities -- local councilors and provincial assemblymen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;3	Polling stations open at 8 a.m. -LRB- 0000 GMT -RRB- , and results are expected about eight hours after polls close at 4 p.m. -LRB- 0800GMT -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;4	Newspapers predicted up to 70 percent of Taiwan 's 13.8 million eligible voters would turn out .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;5	The polls also are a prelude to Taiwan 's first direct presidential election in 1996 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;6	President Lee Teng-hui 's prospects for another term will be measured by his Nationalists ' performance Saturday against the main opposition , the Democratic Progressive Party .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;7	The Nationalists fled to Taiwan to escape the 1949 Communist takeover of mainland China .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;8	They still say they hope one day to reunite Taiwan with the Chinese motherland .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;9	But the DPP advocates Taiwanese independence , something China has vowed to resist by force , and DPP successes Saturday could bring warnings from Beijing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;10	The campaigning has focused largely on `` Tong-Du '' -- reunification vs. independence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;11	To the annoyance of the DPP , business leaders placed newspaper ads days before the poll warning that Taiwan 's dollar and the island 's standing with investors could plummet if pro-independence forces gain power .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;12	But the DPP may profit from a split in the Nationalist vote caused by the recently formed New Party , which quit the Nationalists last year after accusing them of abandoning the commitment to reunification .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;13	The DPP 's Chen Shui-bian is thought to be a frontrunner in the race fo Taipei mayor , while Nationalist James Soong has a 50-40 lead over the DPP 's Chen Ting-nan in the gubernatorial race , according to latest surveys .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;14	Candidates held final rallies Friday night , including tens of thousands of cheering New Party supporters who packed Taipei 's municipal stadium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;15	The feverish election campaign , which sometimes resembled a carnival , is a sign of Taiwanese enthusiasm for democracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;16	Taipei 's streets and many of its taxis were covered with flags .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;17	In the last few days , campaigners lulled the capital to sleep at night with drums and roused it each morning with firecrackers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;18	Interior Minister Wu Poh-hsiung even complained that precious resources were wasted and that the campaign flags `` could have clothed 1 million refugees . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;19	But there also were occasions when enthusiasm and heated debate spilled over into violence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;20	Riot police were often at campaign rallies and 50,000 officers were to be deployed to keep order Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;21	In a statement Friday , President Lee appealed for calm on polling day so Taiwan can `` welcome a new era of democracy for all . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;22	Other officials appealed to voters not to take bribes , a problem in past elections as well as this one .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;23	The DPP filed a lawsuit Wednesday accusing the Nationalists of earmarking about 150 million Taiwan dollars -LRB- U.S. dlrs 5.6 million -RRB- to buy votes for Huang Ta-chou , Taipei 's incumbent Nationalist mayor , who is lagging in opinion polls .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;24	The Nationalists denied the allegations and appealed against vote-buying .
APW_ENG_19941202.0420;25	Government-controlled TV ran advertisements showing vote-buyers in handcuffs .

APW_ENG_19941202.0421;1	Shortly before he arrived at the presidency , where the federal government has its offices , Bosnian Serb gunners ringing the capital fired two anti-tank missiles at the building .

APW_ENG_19941202.0421;5	There were no injuries .

APW_ENG_19941202.0421;7	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .

APW_ENG_19941202.0421;11	Although that proposal was presented to the Serbs as a take-it-or-leave-it plan , the lack of Western will to use force has allowed the Serbs to demand , apparently successfully , the right of future confederal links with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0421;12	The original plan denied Serbs that as punishment for starting the war , though it granted the Bosnian Croat-Muslim federation similar rights to link with Croatia .

APW_ENG_19941202.0421;16	But the heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0421;17	The Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave , part of which is a U.N. `` safe area , '' in late October .

APW_ENG_19941202.0424;0	Sweden 's new government wants to retake a central role alongside Norway in the Mideast peace process after a three-year hiatus .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;1	The government 's initiative features an unusual trip to Israel this weekend by a former foreign minister to devise an economic assistance plan for Palestinian territories .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;2	The plan will detail immediate improvements in conditions for Gaza and the West Bank , the Swedish newspaper Dagens Nyheter reported this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;3	Sweden hopes the effort , undertaken at the request of Israel and the PLO , will include `` political '' issues , said the official , Sten Andersson , who was involved in talks leading to the 1991 Madrid peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;4	`` It 's high time for Sweden to do something , '' Andersson told The Associated Press before leaving Sweden Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;5	`` The peace process is in a very critical stage right now .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;6	There must be some signs for the -LRB- Palestinian -RRB- population that something will happen . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;7	Administration and economic development in Gaza are priorities for PLO leader Yasser Arafat , who is facing pressure from Islamic radicals .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;8	Israeli officials have hinted they want to speed up the process .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;9	In Brussels this week , foreign donors released dlrs 125 million pledged earlier for the Palestinians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;10	Among the plans under consideration are job-creation programs and the establishment of an industrial zone along Gaza 's borders to attract investment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;11	Andersson , 71 , declined to detail his initiative , other than saying he had new ideas which could be included in the plan to be discussed in Stockholm Dec. 12 by Arafat and Israeli Foreign Minister Shimon Peres .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;12	Sweden 's neighbor , Norway , already has been deeply involved in the peace process since the country established its acclaimed `` Oslo Channel '' two years ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;13	That channel led to last year 's peace treaty signed in Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;14	In what may be mainly a footnote to history , Sweden 's new initiative arises from a domestic political feud and a friendly rivalry with Norway for the mantle of peacemaker in the Middle East .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;15	Swedish officials , led by Andersson , had been intimately involved in Israeli-Palestinian contacts until 1991 , when the Social Democrats lost elections to a center-conservative coalition led by former Prime Minister Carl Bildt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;16	According to Andersson and other officials , the Social Democrats at the time had close contacts with the Palestine Liberation Organization , and Arafat was looking for a third country to foster contacts with Israel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;17	`` The -LRB- conservative -RRB- Bildt government was very passive , that was a pity , '' said Andersson , a career Social Democrat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;18	`` So then I recommended to the PLO that they go to the Norwegians . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;19	Norway 's government was led by Social Democrats also .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;20	Palestinians then turned to Norwegian diplomats to set up talks which eventually led to the `` Oslo Channel , '' a Scandinavian diplomat involved with the talks said on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;21	The diplomat , however , said the relationship had been established well before the change of power in Sweden .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;22	Andersson , now retired , insisted the new Social Democratic government , which returned to power last September , was not trying to take over Norway 's role in the peace process .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;23	`` The Norwegians have done a magnificent job and I 'm not here to compete with them , '' Andersson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0424;24	Bildt 's spokeswoman referred all questions about the period to Bildt or his former aides , none of whom could be reached for comment Friday .

APW_ENG_19941202.0425;2	The minister , identified only as Preacher Wagner , reportedly said her plane would crash and Mrs. Nascimento would `` sink in sin in hell '' if she tried to receive the prize of 50,000 reals , worth about dlrs 60,000 .

APW_ENG_19941202.0427;3	The Security Council has not yet acted on the proposal and Twagiramungu 's warning is likely to make the council more cautious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0427;4	Militiamen and soldiers who fled Rwanda with an estimated 1.2 million refugees are in effect controlling camps and there is evidence that they are planning an invasion of Rwanda .

APW_ENG_19941202.0427;6	`` They can not win the war they want to win . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0427;10	But he said there were fears that the militiamen could carry out a protracted guerrilla war .

APW_ENG_19941202.0427;15	Between April and June , an estimated 500,000 people were killed .

APW_ENG_19941202.0429;0	The U.S. Postal Service on Friday defended its stamp recalling the atomic bombing of Japan saying that it could not omit such a major event from its World War II history series .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;1	The stamp , showing a mushroom-shaped cloud rising from an atomic blast , is one of a set of 10 stamps marking major events of 1945 to be sold on a sheet titled `` 1945 : Victory at Last . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;2	Forty stamps have already been issued in similar sets for the 50th anniversary of the 1941-44 war years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;3	But the atomic bomb stamp is drawing sharp criticism in Japan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;4	Sunao Tsuboi , acting director of the 30,000-member Hiroshima Prefectural Confederation of A-bomb Survivors Organizations , termed it `` outrageous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;5	Japan surrendered Aug. 15 , 1945 , days after atomic bombs were dropped on the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;6	`` Atomic bombs hasten war 's end , August 1945 , '' says the caption on the mushroom cloud stamp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;7	Postal Service spokesman Robin Wright said the World War II series was developed in cooperation with the State and Defense departments to assure historical accuracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;8	As far as the atomic bomb stamp , he said , `` we would be remiss in omitting such a watershed and historically critical event as the use of the atomic bomb . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;9	`` Our purpose is to provide a comprehensive history of events of World War II , and we are not making a value judgment on any of those events , '' Wright added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;10	Other stamps in the 1945 set picture U.S. Marines raising the American flag on Iwo Jima , `` Okinawa , the last big battle , '' liberations of Manila and of Holocaust survivors in Europe , Germany 's surrender at Reims , refugees uprooted by war and U.S. celebrations of Japanese surrender .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;11	The 1941 set , titled `` A World at War '' included stamps showing Japanese bombing Pearl Harbor , Hawaii , and President Roosevelt and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill framing the Atlantic Charter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0429;12	The 1944 set , titled `` Road to Victory '' included the allied Normandy landings , the liberation of Rome and the battles of Leyte Gulf in the Pacific and the Bulge in Belgium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;0	Growers , sellers and users of marijuana gathered here Friday at an event that was part drug festival , part trade fair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;1	The second annual Netherweed Festival drew about 2,000 enthusiastic visitors with a mixture of events ranging from a contest to decide the nation 's best Dutch-grown weed to a fashion show and pop music .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;2	But for many it was a chance to meet business contacts and do deals in the growers ' room , although selling the product was not allowed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;3	Giving it away , maybe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;4	Netherweed has become the generic term for high-power marijuana developed and grown in the Netherlands , a nation known for its high-tech agricultural techniques .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;5	`` There are about 20 paying stalls here and a couple of non-commercial stands , '' said Henk van Velthooven , spokesman for the organizer , the Dutch marijuana magazine `` High Life . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;6	He spoke proudly of how the commercial stalls were helping out by sponsoring the event at the Marcanti Plaza , while non-commercials like the Dutch Cannabis Consumers ' Union was there for free , trying to recruit new members .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;7	If anyone could see the stall through the dense smoke .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;8	`` Before we took over , there were a lot of local harvest festivals , but we 've taken this to a national level , '' said Van Velthooven .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;9	One man at the festival for business rather than pleasure was John Campion , 34 , of Hartlepool in northeast England .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;10	`` I 've been running a shop selling growing kits for five months and in that time I 've had a turnover of about 150,000 pounds -LRB- dlrs 230,000 -RRB- , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;11	`` I do like a smoke , but this is business .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;12	I regard it solely as business . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;13	Campion said he exploits a loophole in British law that allows him to sell equipment for growing marijuana , but does not allow people to use the equipment after they 've bought it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;14	`` We do n't ask people what they are going to do with it , '' said Campion with a wink .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;15	In the Netherlands , the sale and possession of both hard and soft drugs in small quantities are non-prosecutable offenses , although technically still illegal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;16	Police prefer to concentrate on arresting large-scale traffickers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;17	Ed Rosenthal , a self-proclaimed `` marijuana expert '' from Oakland , Calif. , was invited to the festival to give a speech on growing techniques .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;18	When he arrived , there was no microphone and no projector for his slides , but he did n't seem to mind .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;19	`` Get me a chair to stand on and a joint , pure marijuana with hashish and we 'll be alright , '' he told the organizers .

APW_ENG_19941202.0430;21	Another aspect of the festival was a competition for the best marijuana grown in the Netherlands .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;22	A jury of experts was hoping to give its verdict after weeks of testing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0430;23	`` If there 's anyone still standing , '' said Van Velthooven .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;0	Russian lawmakers negotiating the release of prisoners in Chechnya accused their own government Friday of sending the jets that have attacked the breakaway republic .

APW_ENG_19941202.0431;16	But it continued to beef up troops on Chechnya 's borders , news reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;17	Since the air offensive began last week , thousands of people have fled Grozny , a city of 300,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;18	Russia conquered the mainly Muslim Chechens in its imperial drive toward the Black Sea last century .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;19	Suppressed ethnic tensions have boiled over since the 1991 Soviet collapse .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;20	Many Russian nationalists vow never to let Chechnya go .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;21	The opposition accuses Dudayev of running Chechnya 's economy into the ground .
APW_ENG_19941202.0431;22	The main industry , oil refining , is operating at 10 percent of capacity .

APW_ENG_19941202.0431;25	`` If someone comes and attacks your home , are you supposed to just sit and watch ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;0	It was as if someone had turned the already wretched slum into a gas chamber , unleashing a toxic brew that doomed thousands of people in a matter of hours by making them gulp the air that killed them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;1	Tens of thousands of people crawled or ran , panic-stricken , from their homes that miserable night in Bhopal 10 years ago , victims of a lethal gas leak from a subsidiary of U.S.-based Union Carbide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;2	Hazara Bee was one of the survivors of the world 's worst industrial disaster .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;3	`` Everyone was fleeing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;4	I ran and ran and fainted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;5	When I regained consciousness , I remember someone asking me if my husband 's name was Abdul Latif , '' Mrs. Bee , 50 , said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;6	A hospital staffer was trying to identify her .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;7	Her husband , Abdul Latif , was already dead -- one of 4,000 who died that night .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;8	By official count , about 3,000 others died later from illnesses caused by the disaster at the pesticide plant .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;9	That night , hundreds of corpses lay where they fell , their mouths and eyes covered with a white froth formed by the reaction of the poison gas with the oxygen the victims had tried so desperately to breathe in their last minutes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;10	Most had their mouths open in a last gasp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;11	Street dogs gnawed at the corpses that lay all over the slum , which adjoined the Union Carbide factory that had employed thousands in Bhopal , then killed them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;12	On Friday , police arrested 11,000 people on their way to Bhopal to mark the anniversary with a rally demanding compensation , organizers said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;13	Officials could not confirm the number of arrests .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;14	Police arrested the demonstrators on trains at stations outside Bhopal and charged them with traveling without tickets -- a common violation that is rarely enforced .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;15	A decade after the tragedy , the visible scars have all but faded from Bhopal , an 11th-century city built around two lakes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;16	A parking lot was built on land outside Hamidia Hospital where , 10 years ago , hundreds of bodies were laid out , cardboard name cards placed at each head .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;17	The potholed roads leading to the Union Carbide pesticide factory , where victims lay struggling for breath or blinded , have been repaved .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;18	Once , the plant 's tall smokestacks symbolized opportunity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;19	Today , the smokestacks are rusty and the metal tank that leaked the deadly methyl isocyanate just before midnight on Dec. 2 , 1984 , is smothered with weeds .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;20	Union Carbide , whose parent company is based in Danbury , Conn. , sold off the last of its Indian holdings this summer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;21	But though the physical reminders have been erased , pain and poverty still stalk many of the half million survivors in Bhopal , a city of 500,000 in central India .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;22	Many do n't like to talk any more about the tragedy that ruined their lives .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;23	For the past 10 years , they have discussed their agony with so many doctors , lawyers , officials and reporters that the exercise of recollection has become an exercise in futility .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;24	The last hope for any redress -- monetary compensation -- is snarled in a tangle of red tape .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;25	As dawn breaks on any given day , men , women and children line up outside the claims court to complete paperwork for receiving compensation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;26	The effects of gas poisoning are still claiming victims , like Savitri Singh .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;27	`` She had been sick off and on since 1984 , often complaining of chest pain and breathlessness , '' said her husband , Daulat Singh , as he prepared the funeral pyre Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;28	`` The doctors said she was sick because of the gas , but she died before getting any compensation and proper medical care . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;29	`` These poor and uneducated people ca n't prove that the death occurred due to long-term aftereffects of the gas , '' said Abdul Jabbar Khan , head of the Bhopal Gas Victims Organization .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;30	`` Our estimate is that 25,000 people have died until now directly or indirectly due to the gas leak . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;31	In 1989 , Union Carbide paid dlrs 470 million -- one-twelfth of India 's original claim -- in an out-of-court settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0434;32	About 94,000 compensation claims have been settled and dlrs 20 million paid to victims .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;0	Quebec separatist leader Lucien Bouchard had his left leg amputated after being attacked by a strain of flesh-eating bacteria , but is out of danger , doctors said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;1	Bouchard , 55 , the most popular leader in Canada 's largest French-speaking province , vowed to continue his political career , dedicated to making Quebec an independent country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;2	`` Mr. Bouchard has greatly improved over the past 12 hours , '' Dr. Patrick d'Amico told a news conference at Montreal 's St. Luc Hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;3	D'Amico said Bouchard had undergone three operations since being admitted to the hospital earlier this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;4	The left leg was amputated at mid-thigh in an operation during which he was conscious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;5	If no further complications occur , Bouchard should recover fully in about three or four months , said D'Amico .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;6	Earlier Friday , rumors circulated that Bouchard was on the verge of death , but hospital officials dismissed them as untrue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;7	News of Bouchard 's illness shook Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;8	Small groups of people , some bearing Quebec flags , kept an all-night vigil outside the hospital under a light snowfall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;9	Bouchard was struck by a rare disease known as necrotizing fasciitis , more commonly known as the `` flesh-eating disease . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;10	Doctors say the disease is caused by the streptococcus A bacteria and is fatal in 80 percent of the cases .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;11	The bacteria is common and usually results in sore throats or tonsilitis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;12	But in about one in a million cases , it turns deadly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;13	Bouchard , a former Conservative Cabinet minister , bolted former Prime Minister Brian Mulroney 's government in 1990 and formed his own party .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;14	The new party became , effectively , the national arm of the Parti Quebecois , the provincial party dedicated to the secession of Quebec and its 7 million inhabitants from Canada .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;15	In the 1993 federal elections , the Bloc Quebecois won 54 seats to become the official opposition to the ruling Liberals in the House of Commons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;16	Few wanted to speculate on what the absence of Bouchard would have on the political scene or the referendum on independence expected next year in Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;17	Politicians of all political stripes expressed their concern for Bouchard 's health and wished him well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0435;18	Prime Minister Jean Chretien , on a trip to France , said : `` I speak not only for the government of Canada , but also for the people of Canada when I express to Mr. Bouchard and his family our deep regrets and our sincere wish for a rapid return of his health . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0435;20	Last weekend he had attended a party congress , though he complained of having the flu .

APW_ENG_19941202.0435;22	Dr. Pierre Ghosn , head of cardiovascular surgery , said he operated to relieve pressure in the leg and discovered the disease .

APW_ENG_19941202.0438;0	Most of the 608 passengers aboard the Cebu City were sleeping when a freighter slammed into the ferry Friday in Manila Bay .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;1	The ferry sank a half hour later , a one-meter -LRB- three-foot -RRB- hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;2	At least 34 people drowned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;3	Divers discovered more bodies in the ship , lying under 30 meters -LRB- 100 feet -RRB- of water , but could not get to them before the search for the more than 100 people still missing was called off for the night .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;4	`` Suddenly we heard a crash , '' Erwin Maravilla said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;5	`` I grabbed my two children , but when the ferry sank we were sucked under the water with it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;6	A piece of metal hit my arm , and I lost hold of my two kids . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;7	His wife also was among the missing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;8	Ships in the area plucked 451 people from the sea , many coated with the diesel oil disgorged as the ferry sank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;9	The freighter , the Singapore-registered Kota Suria , joined in the rescue effort , its bow badly bent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;10	Survivors complained the crew did little to save people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;11	The radio room may have been severely damaged because the distress signals came from other ships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;12	Maximo Calamba , who was rescued with his wife and 1-year-old son , said he heard many cries for help .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;13	`` There was no alarm .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;14	We were thrown off our cots and everybody was on their own . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;15	The collision occurred before dawn near the town of Rosario , about 55 kilometers -LRB- 35 miles -RRB- southwest of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;16	The freighter , five times the ferry 's size , destroyed the bridge and tore a gaping hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;17	The captain and his mates were in the bridge , the control section of the ferry , said one crewman , Jacob Cabatuan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;18	They were among the missing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;19	The cause of the accident , which occurred in calm seas under clear night skies , is under investigation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;20	The company that owns the ferry said it was rammed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;21	Danny Dalugdog , a driver and bodyguard , was separated from his wife and 3-month-old son in the confusion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;22	`` I thought they were gone . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;23	But he found his wife on the freighter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;24	Then , as they transferred to a coast guard ship to return to Manila , a passenger called out that he found a baby boy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;25	`` It turned out to be my son , '' Dalugdog said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;26	A coast guard spokesman , Lt. Cmdr. Amado Samante , said 451 passengers had been rescued and 34 bodies recovered , many children and women .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;27	`` There were more bodies inside the cabins , '' said Angel Espidido , a coast guard diver .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;28	Divers could see the dead through the portholes but were unable to open the doors late Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;29	`` Tomorrow we will go back to unlock them . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;30	Cargo containers and rubber rafts floated in the sea , but many survivors apparently never got a chance to use them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;31	`` I was jolted by the crash and I woke up , '' said Melissa Selosia , who was on her way to going to Mindanao Island , 780 kilometers -LRB- 485 miles -RRB- south of Manila for Christmas with her four children .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;32	`` I grabbed a life jacket and made for the upper deck and then I jumped into the water . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;33	She said she swam as quickly as possible from the sinking ferry , recalling her seaman husband 's words that a sinking boat will suck down everything around it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;34	The ferry 's owner , the William Lines shipping company , said 608 people were on board .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;35	The accident coincided with the company 's initial public stock offering Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0438;36	The ferry , which can carry 800 people , was en route to Tagbilaran , capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- southeast of Manila .

APW_ENG_19941202.0440;0	In a bizarre raid lasting several hours Friday night , heavily armed police in ski masks blocked off a downtown building that houses city government and the offices of one of Russia 's top bankers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0440;1	It was not clear who conducted the raid or whether it actually had anything to do with banker Vladimir Gusinsky or his prominent Most Group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0440;2	But six of the bank 's employees were detained , and company cars and employees were searched as they tried to leave .
APW_ENG_19941202.0440;3	Gusinsky called it the latest case of harassment against Russia 's entrepreneurs , and drafted a letter to President Boris Yeltsin demanding an investigation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0440;4	The banker said the armed men blocked off his offices without explanation at about 5 p.m.
APW_ENG_19941202.0440;5	They left about five hours later .
APW_ENG_19941202.0440;6	The Interior Ministry eventually told him the gunmen were part of a task force against organized crime , Gusinsky said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0451;1	For its part , GM would spend up to dlrs 60 million on safety and research programs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;2	Transportation Secretary Federico Pena scheduled a news conference for 3:30 p.m. in Washington concerning the trucks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;3	The sources , who spoke on condition they not be identified , said the idea behind the deal would be that the safety and research program GM would fund has the potential to save more lives than a recall of GM 's 1973-87 C-K pickups .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;4	Pena announced Oct. 17 that he had determined the trucks present an unreasonable risk of fire in side-impact collisions because their fuel tanks are mounted outside the vehicle frame .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;5	He scheduled a public meeting , set for Tuesday in Washington , to gather additional information on whether he should order a recall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;6	The deal described by the sources would cancel the meeting , and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and the Transportation Department would not proceed with further steps toward a recall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;7	GM has never wavered in its argument that the trucks are among the safest vehicles on the road .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;8	NHTSA began investigating them two years ago after consumer groups petitioned for a recall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;9	The agency asked GM to voluntarily recall the trucks in 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;10	Pena acknowledged in October that the trucks meet federal crash safety standards , but he said the law requires that they be safe in real-world conditions as well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;11	GM filed suit last month seeking to block any further action by him in the case .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;12	About 9 million of the trucks were built between model years 1973 and 1987 and sold under Chevrolet and GMC nameplates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0451;13	GM estimates about 5 million still are in use .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;0	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and NATO 's top civilian official denied Friday that the alliance had abandoned its enforcement of the U.N. `` no-fly '' zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;1	`` NATO is continuing to enforce the no-fly zone , '' Christopher said , amid continued confusion between the United Nations and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization over how to deal with the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;2	Earlier Friday , Wing Commander Timothy Hewlet , U.N. director for air operations in Bosnia , told reporters in Sarajevo that Bosnian Serbs had activated several surface-to-air missile sites throughout the country , threatening humanitarian flights and NATO jets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;3	Hewlet said NATO had agreed to a `` cooling off '' period to calm tensions , but was able to `` control '' the situation with AWACs planes flying outside Bosnian air space .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;4	`` There are no flights over Bosnia at the moment that I am aware of , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;5	At NATO headquarters , Secretary-General Willy Claes said he was unaware of any request from the United Nations to halt or scale-down Allied patrols enforcing of the military flight ban , designed to protect Bosnian civilians from bombardment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;6	`` We have never received any request , can I be any clearer than that ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;7	However , Yasushi Akashi , the chief U.N. envoy in former Yugoslavia , acknowledged talks on the issue were underway .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;8	`` I can not comment on internal discussions which we are conducting with NATO , '' Akashi told reporters after meeting with Bosnian Serb leaders in Pale , their stronghold east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;9	`` But I am glad that NATO is adopting an attitude that they are essentially at the service of UNPROFOR in the peacekeeping mission . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;10	NATO and the United Nations have repeatedly talked of the need to `` show presence '' in the skies over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;11	But NATO sources in Brussels said Allied planes had been fired on nine times in recent days by Serb missiles and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;12	Under current rules of engagement , NATO planes can strike back if targeted without prior approval from the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;13	Thant Myint-U , a U.N. spokesman in Sarajevo , cautioned that such retaliation could lead to an increase in fighting at a time when international negotiators were trying to revive flagging peace efforts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;14	`` There would be massive escalation in the situation on the ground that could spin out of control , '' Thant said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;15	Christopher told reporters Serb anti-missile batteries posed a problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;16	But , he said , NATO was capable of dealing with them , `` and we continue to police the ` no-fly ' zone in the effective way we have in the past . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;17	In Washington however , a senior U.S. military officer acknowledged that pilots and other NATO forces were taking steps to lessen the threat to aircraft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;18	He would not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;19	On Tuesday , officials said the United Nations requested and NATO agreed that planes would not fly over Bosnia for a 48-hour period while U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali and other peace negotiators visited Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;20	Western military sources said it appeared that request was extended slightly , and it was not clear if NATO planes were back in Bosnian airspace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;21	Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic , speaking in Pale after his meeting with Akashi , said , `` We would like to see skies clear of ... NATO aircraft . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0453;22	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents , '' Karadzic added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;0	CHICAGO -LRB- AP -RRB- - Grain and soybean futures prices rose strongly Friday on the Chicago Board of Trade on signs of brisk export demand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;1	Soybeans reversed a three-day slide after the Agriculture Department reported U.S. soybean exports totaled 60,000 metric tons last week , a robust figure according to Victor Lespinasse , assistant vice president in the grain trading division of Dean Witter , Discover and Co.
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;2	Soybeans also were bolstered by a sharp increase in Malaysian palm oil futures overseas and higher bids for soybean oil in Rotterdam , the main port of entry for U.S. farm goods into Europe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;3	Wheat futures rose for the third straight day on expectations for new export sales to Egypt or China .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;4	Egypt denied rumors it was planning to bid this weekend for up to 500,000 metric tons of U.S. wheat at subsidized prices , but prices refused to fall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;5	`` To me , that suggests some business is right around the corner , '' Lespinasse said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;6	Corn futures gained on news that China has temporarily halted corn exports to preserve grain for domestic use .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;7	`` If China stays out of the market , their customers will have to come to us , '' Lespinasse said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0454;8	Wheat for December delivery rose 4 1-2 cents to dlrs 3.79 1-4 a bushel ; December corn rose 1 1-2 cents to dlrs 2.15 1-2 a bushel ; December oats rose 2 1-4 cents to dlrs 1.10 1-4 a bushel ; January soybeans rose 6 cents to dlrs 5.62 3-4 a bushel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;0	President Clinton on Friday served notice on the next Republican-controlled Congress that he would fight tax cuts that inflate the budget and any attempt to repeal a new ban on assault weapons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;1	`` I hope and believe we can cooperate with the new Congress , '' Clinton said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;2	`` But cooperation for me can not mean abandoning principle , abandoning the hard work we have already accomplished together in our fight to restore the economy , our fight against crime . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;3	Addressing a national meeting of mayors and city officiais , he drew the line against relaxing gun controls enacted by the just-ended Congress over opposition from the National Rifle Association .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;4	`` The assault weapons ban that you helped to win stands between the citizens you and I must protect and the gangs and thugs that would terrorize them , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;5	`` I will do all in my power to keep the next Congress from doing anything that will jeopardize the safety of our people . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;6	Clinton spoke before a White House meeting with Congress ' new Republican leaders , incoming House Speaker Newt Gingrich , and the next Senate majority leader , Bob Dole .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;7	Separately , Clinton also met in the Cabinet Room with newly named Democratic leaders , who will be in the minority .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;8	`` It 's no secret that the landscape in Washington shifted dramatically last month , '' Clinton said ruefully , referring to the November elections that gave Republicans control of both houses of Congress for the first time in 40 years and a majority of U.S. state governorships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;9	The election results gave momentum to calls for middle-class tax cuts , an idea embraced by Republicans and Democrats alike .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;10	Clinton 's administration fears the rival parties might try to outdo each other on tax cuts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;11	He said he would fight any proposal that would `` explode the deficit ... my standard will be : Will it help increase incomes for the middle class , will it promote jobs and growth and can we pay for it ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;12	In his speech broadcast from Washington to the National League of Cities conference in Minneapolis , Clinton said , `` We need to give hard working middle-class people a dividend from the end of the Cold War and the dramatic downsizing of the federal government . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;13	The Republican campaign 's Contract with America called for an array of tax credits .
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;14	Clinton urged city officials who have been complaining about inadequate funds for essential services `` to make sure that the Congress understands what the consequences are of all these budgetary decisions . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0455;15	In the afterglow of bipartisan support for the new world trade agreement , Clinton said he hoped to work with Republicans on welfare and health-care reform , cost-controls on medical care and easing the financial demands imposed on cities and states by Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;0	Azerbaijan 's parliament passed an unusual law Friday guaranteeing a multibillion-dollar Caspian Sea oil development contract with a consortium of Western companies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;1	The law said simply that Azerbaijan 's parliament and president `` guarantee the implementation '' of the 30-year deal , which involves dlrs 7.4 billion in investments into three of the country 's oilfields .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;2	A consortium of eight Western oil companies and one Russian one signed the contract in September , and parliament ratified it Nov. 15 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;3	But the Western partners wrote parliament last week saying ratification alone was not enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;4	In the absence of legislation regulating oil production , they asked for special guarantees .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;5	Western partners have been made nervous partly because Azerbaijan has indicated it will turn to Iran for financing help .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;6	The consortium envisions the start of production about four years after development begins , increasing to a rate of about 86,000 metric tons -LRB- 600,000 barrels -RRB- a day by the end of the decade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0456;7	They expect to extract a total of 511 million metric tons -LRB- 3.5 billion barrels -RRB- of crude oil .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;0	Middle East champion Mohammed bin Sulayem swept to his eighth Dubai International Rally victory in 10 years Friday after his two main challengers found frustration on the second leg .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;1	Michel Saleh , leader for much of the first day and lying third overnight , went out within yards of the morning 's restart after a vain attempt to replace a broken drive shaft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;2	The Victory Rally Team 's Khalifa al-Mataywi , attempting to hold onto a diminishing advantage over Sulayem , lost the lead after being held up by Nasser Khalifa al-Attiya 's ailing Toyota .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;3	Mataywi lost two-and-a-half minutes to Sulayem 's Ford Escort and the Arab world 's No. 1 driver went on to the finish with a winning margin of almost four minutes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;4	Sulayem 's triumph gave Ford the Middle East manufacturers ' championship for the first time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;5	The consolation for Mataywi was that his second place gave him his first United Arab Emirates championship and the runner-up spot in the regional series at the first attempt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;6	Finishing third in his Toyota , Saudi Arabia 's Middle East Group N champion , Abdullah Bakhashab , completed a hat-trick of production-class wins in Dubai .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;7	Hindered by a misfiring engine for most of the day , Sharjah 's Sheik Abdullah al-Qassimi took his Mitsubishi Galant to fourth place ahead of Kenya 's Khalid Aslam and the Mitsubishi Galant of Britain 's Peter Cherry who secured second place in the Middle East Group N championship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;8	Despite being edged out of the top 10 after her Group N Volkswagen Golf got stuck in soft sand , British ladies champion Stephanie Simmonite underlined her obvious talent by finishing 11th and also winning the ladies prize .
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;9	Mohammed bin Sulayem - Ford Cosworth 2:17:47
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;10	Khalifa al-Mataywi - Toyota Celica 2:21:41
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;11	Abdullah Bakhashab - Toyota Celica 2:32:22
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;12	Abdullah al-Qassimi - Mitsubishi Galant 2:42:41
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;13	Khalid Aslam - Volkswagen 2:47:36
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;14	Peter Mark Cherry - Mitsubishi Galant 2:52:11
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;15	-LRB- numbers are the starting of the cars -RRB-
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;16	Middle East Championship results :
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;17	Mohammed bin Sulayem 87 points
APW_ENG_19941202.0457;18	Sheik Soheil bin Khalifa al-Maktoum 35 points
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;0	Azerbaijan 's parliament passed an unusual law Friday guaranteeing a multibillion-dollar Caspian Sea oil development contract with a consortium of Western companies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;1	The law said simply that Azerbaijan 's parliament and president `` guarantee the implementation '' of the 30-year deal , which involves dlrs 7.4 billion in investments into three of the country 's oilfields .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;2	A consortium of eight Western oil companies and one Russian one signed the contract in September , and parliament ratified it Nov. 15 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;3	But the Western partners wrote parliament last week saying ratification alone was not enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;4	In the absence of legislation regulating oil production , they asked for special guarantees .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;5	Western partners have been made nervous partly because Azerbaijan has indicated it will turn to Iran for financing help .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;6	The consortium envisions the start of production about four years after development begins , increasing to a rate of about 86,000 metric tons -LRB- 600,000 barrels -RRB- a day by the end of the decade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0458;7	They expect to extract a total of 511 million metric tons -LRB- 3.5 billion barrels -RRB- of crude oil .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;0	Bosnian Serb leaders promised Friday to release hundreds of detained U.N. peacekeepers and allow free movement of aid convoys , the chief U.N. envoy said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;1	Yasushi Akashi , speaking at Bosnian Serb headquarters in Pale , east of Sarajevo , told reporters he had won assurances that Ukrainian peacekeepers held in northern Bosnia , as well as Dutch and British convoys detained since Saturday , would be freed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;2	`` In addition , we have agreed that normal activities be restored to the Canadians -- 55 Canadians near Visoko -- and all other soldiers from other countries that were doing their work at weapons collection sites , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;3	Serbs had detained more than 400 U.N. personnel throughout Bosnia for more than a week as insurance against further NATO airstrikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;4	Earlier Friday , they released 70 Dutch peacekeepers who arrived in Zagreb , Croatia , after being held for seven days in eastern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;5	The U.N. envoy to former Yugoslavia also said the Serbs had promised to allow Bangladeshi peacekeepers stranded in the besieged Bihac enclave in northwestern Bosnia to be resupplied .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;6	Akashi said he was pleased with the `` willingness of the Bosnian Serb leadership to respond to our urgent appeal . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;7	Whether the promises would be kept remained to be seen , as Serbs have repeatedly broken their word to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;8	Earlier Friday , they once again made clear their contempt for the U.N. mission , firing anti-armor missiles at the Bosnian presidency building minutes before Akashi arrived there for talks with government leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;9	Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic promised his side would normalize relations with the United Nations , but also called for another meeting first .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;10	`` We certainly need some meeting of the military people of the U.N. and the Serb army , '' Karadzic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;11	`` Some issues do not have to wait for the meeting , but some of them require that kind of meeting because of the technical issues . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;12	It was not immediately clear whether Karadzic 's comments hinted at potential stumbling blocks to carrying out the promises announced by Akashi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;13	`` More or less , we can say we are moving fast to normalization of our relations , '' Karadzic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;14	Akashi went to Pale for talks with the Bosnian Serb leadership after meetings with Bosnia 's Muslim-led government in Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;15	Shortly before he arrived at the presidency , where the Bosnian government has its offices , Bosnian Serb gunners ringing the capital fired two anti-tank missiles at the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;16	One destroyed the office of Miro Lazovic moments after he left for the Akashi meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;17	Lazovic is an ethnic Serb member of Bosnia 's collective presidency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;18	A short while later , three more missiles hit nearby buildings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;19	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;20	The Bosnian government complained about Akashi 's `` shuttle diplomacy '' and blasted the United Nations for failing to use force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , as fighting continued in that northwest region Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;21	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;22	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;23	He was referring to European appeasement of Adolf Hitler at a 1938 meeting in Munich before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;24	Charles Redman , a U.S. diplomat , was also back in Sarajevo , leading talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic that presumably focused on a proposed new peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;25	Redman , now U.S. ambassador to Germany , helped draft the first international peace plan drawn up by the five-nation Contact Group , which the Serbs have repeatedly rejected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;26	Although that proposal was presented to the Serbs as a take-it-or-leave-it plan , the lack of Western will to use force has allowed the Serbs to demand , apparently successfully , the right of future confederal links with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;27	The original plan denied Serbs that as punishment for starting the war , though it granted the Bosnian Croat-Muslim federation similar rights to link with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;28	Akashi hoped to have more success with the Serbs than his boss , Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;29	Boutros-Ghali was rebuffed in even trying to meet the Bosnian Serbs on Wednesday , and afterwards said intransigence by the warring sides might force the end of the U.N. mission .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;30	Earlier , U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi also wanted to discuss with Karadzic the continued fighting around Bihac , where the United Nations is trying to broker a cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;31	There was no immediate indication of any progress .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;32	A number of detonations were reported on the edge of the Bihac `` safe area '' Friday , along with machine-gun and small arms fire , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;33	But the heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;34	The Bosnian Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave , part of which is a U.N.-designated `` safe area , '' in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;35	There were also signs that the frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;36	Bosnian Croats , who are allied with the Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;37	A Croat militia and the Bosnian army took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;38	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia also had shelled his forces across the border , near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0460;39	He said his troops returned fire .

APW_ENG_19941202.0461;39	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;0	Bosnian Serbs , seeing U.S. policy swinging in their favor , said Friday the new U.S. approach to the war in former Yugoslavia is `` a step in the right direction . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;1	But an emissary , Danielle Sremac , rejected some key elements of a peace proposal U.S. officials are now pushing in Europe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;2	`` A U.S. policy change that recognizes the rights of Serbs in Bosnia is a step in the right direction , '' Ms. Sremac said , adding that U.S. policy is key to resolution of the 21\/2 - year war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;3	`` The U.S. policy of siding with the Muslims has been one of the main obstacles to peace , '' she said at a forum sponsored by the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;4	A Belgrade-born U.S. citizen who is not recognized as an official emissary by the U.S. government , Ms. Sremac has served as a U.S.-based spokeswoman for Bosnian Serb leaders since May .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;5	She recently returned from consultations in Pale , the unofficial Bosnian Serb capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;6	The Clinton administration , rebuffed by Britain and France in its efforts to use more NATO military force to quell Serb aggression , is now working for a diplomatic solution in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;7	The latest U.S. stance provides `` a good sign for peace in Bosnia , '' Ms. Sremac said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;8	But she said Bosnian Serbs still demand a contiguous country of their own , links to other Serbian areas of the former Yugoslavia and control over parts of the Bosnian capital of Sarajevo and other Bosnian cities with large Serbian populations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;9	Secretary of State Warren Christopher , at NATO meetings in Brussels , has been promoting a new U.S. plan that calls for an international conference to resolve the crisis and a three - to six-month cease-fire around besieged Bihac , which Serbs are poised to overrun .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;10	Ms. Sremac said Bosnian Serbs reject the cease-fire because it would give Bosnia 's outgunned government forces the winter months to regroup and plan new attacks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;11	Bosnian Serbs want permanent ceasefire negotiations , she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;12	They also continue to reject the plan drawn up by the United States , Britain , France , Germany and Russia that would allow them to control about half of the country but still maintain Bosnia 's borders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;13	U.S. officials , however , have expressed a new willingness to discuss a political link between Serbia and Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;14	Christopher said this week that political union between the Serbs in Bosnia with Serbia itself might be possible `` if it would mean reaching a peaceful resolution '' of the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;15	A link among Serbs in former Yugoslav states has been a principle demand of Bosnian Serbs throughout the war that has killed 200,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;16	A Serb union would likely mean the end of Bosnia as a multiethnic state .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;17	Bosnian Serbs , who hold about 70 percent of Bosnia , would be willing to accept some reduction in the territory they now control , Ms. Sremac said , if they could form a `` fully functioning state '' and establish ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0462;18	Their leaders have in the past indicated they would be willing to settle for about two-thirds of the republic .

APW_ENG_19941202.0467;0	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and NATO 's top civilian official denied Friday that the alliance had abandoned its enforcement of the U.N. `` no-fly '' zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;1	`` NATO is continuing to enforce the no-fly zone , '' Christopher said , amid continued confusion between the United Nations and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization over how to deal with the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;2	Earlier Friday , Wing Commander Timothy Hewlet , U.N. director for air operations in Bosnia , told reporters in Sarajevo that Bosnian Serbs had activated several surface-to-air missile sites throughout the country , threatening humanitarian flights and NATO jets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;3	Hewlet said NATO had agreed to a `` cooling off '' period to calm tensions , but was able to `` control '' the situation with AWACs radar planes flying outside Bosnian air space .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;4	`` There are no flights over Bosnia at the moment that I am aware of , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;5	At NATO headquarters , Secretary-General Willy Claes said he was unaware of any request from the United Nations to halt or scale-down allied patrols enforcing the military flight ban , designed to protect Bosnian civilians from bombardment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;6	`` We have never received any request , can I be any clearer than that ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;7	However , Yasushi Akashi , the chief U.N. envoy in former Yugoslavia , acknowledged talks on the issue were under way .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;8	`` I can not comment on internal discussions which we are conducting with NATO , '' Akashi told reporters after meeting with Bosnian Serb leaders in Pale , their stronghold east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;9	`` But I am glad that NATO is adopting an attitude that they are essentially at the service of UNPROFOR -LRB- the U.N. protection force -RRB- in the peacekeeping mission . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;10	NATO and the United Nations have repeatedly talked of the need to `` show presence '' in the skies over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;11	But NATO sources in Brussels said allied planes had been fired on nine times in recent days by Serb missiles and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;12	Under current rules of engagement , NATO planes can strike back if targeted without seeking prior approval from the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;13	Thant Myint-U , a U.N. spokesman in Sarajevo , cautioned that such retaliation could lead to an increase in fighting at a time when international negotiators were trying to revive flagging peace efforts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;14	`` There would be massive escalation in the situation on the ground that could spin out of control , '' Thant said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;15	Christopher told reporters that Serb anti-missile batteries posed a problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;16	But , he said , NATO was capable of dealing with them , `` and we continue to police the ` no-fly ' zone in the effective way we have in the past . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;17	In Washington however , a senior U.S. military officer , speaking on condition of anonymity , acknowledged that pilots and other NATO forces were taking steps to lessen the threat to aircraft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;18	He would not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;19	On Tuesday , officials said the United Nations requested and NATO agreed that planes would not fly over Bosnia for a 48-hour period while U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali and other peace negotiators visited Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;20	Western military sources said it appeared that request was extended slightly , and it was not clear if NATO planes were back in Bosnian airspace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;21	Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic , speaking in Pale after his meeting with Akashi , said , `` We would like to see skies clear of ... NATO aircraft . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0467;22	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents , '' Karadzic added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;0	All of the recognizable names have dropped out of a conference pitched by the Clinton administration as a `` first-ever '' hemispheric gathering on trade and finance at the Summit of the Americas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;1	The accumulated cancellations by top U.S. officials are an embarrassment for the White House , which has been criticized for slighting trade -- the top priority of Latin American and Caribbean leaders -- on the 34-nation summit agenda .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;2	`` The -LRB- public relations staff -RRB- may have a little problem fixing that one , '' said Steve Albee , publisher of Inside Latin America , a Miami newsletter produced for the accounting firm of Coopers & Lybrand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;3	`` The summit may end up being a great big barbecue , but with little accomplished . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;4	Calls to the White House for comment were not immediately returned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;5	Asked whether the disrupted schedule validated criticism about the U.S. commitment to improved trade in the hemisphere , a U.S. government source speaking on condition of anonymity said Friday , `` sort of makes you wonder , does n't it ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;6	This week 's GATT votes and schedule conflicts were given as explanations for the cancellations , but passage of the world trade agreement would have given U.S. officials bragging rights at the meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;7	Vice President Al Gore ca n't make it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;8	Treasury Secretary Lloyd Bentsen and U.S. Trade Representative Mickey Kantor will send three-minute video greetings instead of giving keynote speeches .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;9	Commerce Secretary Ron Brown , Transportation Secretary Federico Pena and Florida Gov. Lawton Chiles canceled Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;10	In their place will be an assortment of undersecretaries , deputies and assistants , but no big wheels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;11	Customs Commissioner George Weise is still committed to the conference sponsored by his agency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;12	Lame-duck Florida Comptroller Gerald Lewis will offer luncheon introductions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;13	`` We are still of the opinion that we have an exceedingly high-caliber group of speakers and panelists , '' Customs spokesman Michael Sheehan said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;14	Versions of the much-altered schedule note the times they were written so organizers know they 're dealing with the latest draft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;15	About 1,000 people , including 300 foreigners , signed up for the Customs Service conference on customs , trade and finance by Wednesday 's deadline , said Sheehan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;16	They wo n't get word of the new lineup until they register .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;17	One of the conference attractions promoted in a four-color brochure was `` direct access '' to U.S. and foreign customs , banking and finance officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;18	`` The thrust of our conference from the beginning has been to allow people , ordinary business people involved in international trade , an opportunity to have access to and resolve problems with the actual government officials and private sector experts that they need to deal with , '' Sheehan said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;19	The conference was formulated in November in place of a business roundtable announced by Brown with great fanfare on a special trip to Miami on Oct. 28 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;20	It was the same day an op-ed piece in the Wall Street Journal complained of a lack of trade emphasis in summit planning .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;21	Brown 's roundtable never materialized .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;22	`` I know that the Customs summit was put together in an effort to make the business community feel that the summit had some value , and it 's unfortunate that the big guns have decided not to be there , '' Albee said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0469;23	`` The whole thing was added to try to bring the business community into the event . ''
