APW_ENG_19941202.0471;0	American Hilary Lindh overcame a course that does n't suit her to win the opening women 's World Cup downhill ski race of the season on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;1	Just one day after dismissing herself as a favorite , Lindh flashed to a winning margin of 29-hundredths of a second over Isolde Kostner of Italy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;2	Defending World Cup downhill champion Katja Seizinger of Germany finished third .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;3	Austria 's Stefanie Schuster overcame a late start number to finish a career-best fourth , Switzerland 's Heidi Zurbriggen was fifth , and Sweden 's Pernilla Wiberg took sixth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;4	Lindh , the 1992 Olympic downhill silver medalist , won for only the second time on the World Cup circuit .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;5	Her first career victory came last February in a downhill in Sierra Nevada , Spain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;6	The 25-year-old Alaskan , whose best previous finish on this course was sixth place two years ago , was timed in 1 minute , 45.00 seconds .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;7	A day earlier , Lindh said , `` Certain people have courses they do well on , and this does n't happen to be one of mine .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;8	I 've always had a hard time on the turns at the bottom .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;9	The last 20 seconds is where I lose it all . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;10	`` I do n't know if I nailed it -LRB- the bottom -RRB- , but it was very much improved from training , '' Lindh said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;11	`` It felt solid and pretty quick . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;12	Kostner , the last of the top-seeded skiers to complete the run , could n't overtake Lindh , coming across in 1:45.29 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;13	Seizinger was timed in 1:45.44 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;14	Kostner , 19 , who has had six top-three finishes in the last two seasons including two Olympic bronze medals , said , `` This was n't surprising because in training I was skiing well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;15	I always like to go fast . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;16	`` When I saw Hilary 's time , I knew she had had a great run , '' Seizinger said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;17	`` The first two-thirds of this course is very flat , a little problem for me .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;18	But third place is n't bad . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;19	Three other favorites -- Anja Haas of Austria , Melanie Suchet of France and American Picabo Street -- fell and did not finish .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;20	Street made a minor mistake early in her run and , in an effort to make up time , got out of control near the finish , did the splits and crashed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;21	Haas had the fastest intermediate time one-third of the way down the course when she fell .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;22	American Megan Gerety came in eighth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;23	The top Canadian was Kate Pace , who had trouble at the bottom and placed 11th .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;24	Vreni Schneider of Switzerland , the overall standings leader , was 23rd .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;25	For the first time , downhillers in the top seed of 15 were allowed to select starting numbers from 1 through 30 , and most of the favorites chose numbers in the 20s .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;26	The course appeared to speed up slightly during the race as a bright sun glazed the snow , making it slicker .
APW_ENG_19941202.0471;27	A super-G is scheduled here Saturday with a giant slalom on Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;0	The United States has elevated Greece to a `` priority watch list '' because of alleged piracy of American motion pictures and recordings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;1	U.S. Trade Representative Mickey Kantor said Friday a `` large number '' of unlicensed Greek television stations are broadcasting American movies without paying the U.S. motion picture industry for their use .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;2	`` We note that the Greek government has very recently moved against one such station , '' Kantor said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;3	`` We hope this is the start of a sustained campaign against these unauthorized broadcasts . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;4	If it were , the United States could re-examine Greece 's status , Kantor said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;5	But continued unauthorized broadcast of copyrighted material could result in a formal investigation leading to retaliation against imports from Greece , he added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;6	Two other nations -- Egypt and the United Arab Emirates -- were kept on a U.S. non-priority watch list .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;7	Kantor urged Egypt to enact a strong patent law that would protect foreign pharmaceuticals and agricultural chemicals from piracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0472;8	He also said the U.S. government remains concerned about alleged piracy of computer software and other copyrighted material in the UAE .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;0	The estranged wife of President Alberto Fujimori has announced she will run for Congress and head a new political alliance in next year 's elections .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;1	Susana Higuchi , who previously was disqualified from seeking the presidency , announced her congressional candidacy Thursday night .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;2	She said she would lead a coalition between her Harmony 21st Century party and the Civilian , Military and Police Front , known by its acronym FREMPOL .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;3	FREMPOL is small party made up mostly of retired police and career military officers whose main interest is increasing their pensions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;4	The alliance gives Higuchi the chance to stand for Congress because FREMPOL is already qualified to take part in the April 9 elections .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;5	Higuchi 's party was disqualified in October along with her presidential bid for lack of sufficient signatures on its election petition .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;6	But the National Elections Board said it would still have to rule on whether Higuchi is eligible to hold national office .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;7	Congress in July passed a law , known locally as the `` Susana Law , '' prohibiting the president 's immediate family members from running for president , vice president or Congress .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;8	The elections board on Friday published a ruling that banned the state-run news media from promoting political candidates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;9	It was aimed at ending the pro-Fujimori publicity in the state-owned newspaper , television channel and radio station .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;10	The board 's ruling came in response to on-going criticism by the opposition that Fujimori is taking advantage of his office to campaign at state expense .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;11	The board said the state media , government officials , the police and the military were prohibited from engaging in political campaigning .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;12	But it said the public stations and newspaper could accept paid political advertising .
APW_ENG_19941202.0473;13	It also said the state television and radio stations should , as a traditional public service , run free half-hour spots for candidates once a day during the month before the elections .
APW_ENG_19941202.0474;0	The United States , France , Britain , Germany and Russia on Friday sought to revive the peace initiative for Bosnia by unveiling new proposals including the suggestion of a confederation between Bosnian Serbs and Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0474;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations launched a new drive to end the fighting , after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0474;2	After the meeting French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe told reporters that at the meeting it was agreed `` to devise a constitutional arrangement '' enabling Bosnian Serbs to link up politically with Belgrade without somehow undermining the integrity as a sovereign nation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0474;3	Juppe and his British counterpart Douglas Hurd will travel to Belgrade on Sunday to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , on Sunday for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;0	When the Rolling Stones began their current concer tour , there were worries that time was no longer on their side .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;1	But despite some heavy competition , the Stones are likely to end 1994 as the year 's top concert draw in North America , according to two concert industry trade publications .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;2	When their U.S. tiour ends on Dec. 18 , the Stones will have earned an estimated dlrs 119.4 million , Performance magazine said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;3	That total does n't count four shows where the band did n't report its earnings because of slow ticket sales .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;4	More than 2 million people have seen the Stones this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;5	`` They 're still incredible performers , '' said Jane Cohen , senior editor of Performance , on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;6	`` They 're still the premiere rock 'n' roll band .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;7	But I do n't think you 're going to see them tour at this level again . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;8	Ticket sales for the Stones ' tour were initially slow , but that was largely because there was so much competition on the road , said Gary Bongiovanni , editor of Pollstar , which will also report the Stones as top earners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;9	Pink Floyd , which lumbers along despite internal strife and poorly-received albums , drew more than 3 million fans and earned dlrs 104.6 million , Performance said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;10	Billy Joel performed before nearly 2 million people and earned dlrs 75.8 million to finish third , followed by the Eagles .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;11	Barbra Streisand , criticized for steep ticket prices , took in dlrs 58.9 million while performing before nearly 300,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;12	More than four times as many people saw Elton John , but his concert gross was only dlrs 56.8 million .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;13	The Grateful Dead , the Lollapalooza tour , Phil Collins and Michael Bolton rounded out Performance 's list of top earners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;14	`` It 's been a very good year for concerts , '' Bongiovanni said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;15	R.E.M. , Tom Petty and Van Halen are expected to be among the big concert draws next year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;16	Former Led Zeppelin partners Robert Plant and Jimmy Page are heading on tour , Bongiovanni said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0477;17	The Eagles , who had to reschedule concerts because of Glenn Frey 's illness , will also be back on the road .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;0	Part of an express train headed from eastern out 70 kilometers -LRB- 40 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;1	The second car of the express train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages smashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;2	`` There was a tremedous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;3	He said in a telephone interview that people remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night , although the crash occured at 4:45 p.m. local time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;4	State television showed horrific pictures of battered and broken railway cars covered in brick torn loose from the building and rescue crews frantically dragging bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;5	Laszlo Garamvoelgyi , a National Police spokesman , said the death toll had risen to 21 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;6	With temperatures below freezing and others left in the wreckage the death toll was expected to rise - Garamvoelgyi said the latest count `` was not the final one by any means . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;7	The severity of the accident eclipsed the previous most serious train tragedy of recent years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;8	Ten children died last February , in a bus-train collision .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;9	Transport ministry officials said the accident occured at a rail switch and suggested that it was possibly caused by the switch not being thrown .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;10	They had no information about the speed of the train when the cars derailed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;11	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok , close to the site of the accident , said 26 injured , including two critical cases , were admitted to their hospital alone , with several others also taking in injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;12	Among senior officials at the scene by late Friday evening was Interior Minister Laszlo Kuncze .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;13	`` We are witnesses to a terrible tragedy , '' Kuncze said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0478;14	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;0	Bosnian Serb leaders promised Friday to release hundreds of detained peacekeepers and allow free movement of certain U.N. convoys , the chief U.N. envoy announced .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;1	Yasushi Akashi , speaking after talks with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic at his headquarters east of Sarajevo , told reporters he had been assured that Ukrainian peacekeepers kidnapped in northern Bosnia , as well as Dutch and British resupply convoys detained since Saturday , would be freed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;2	`` In addition , we have agreed that normal activities be restored to the Canadians ... and all other soldiers from other countries that were doing their work at weapons collection sites , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;3	Serbs detained more than 400 U.N. personnel throughout Bosnia as insurance against further NATO airstrikes after alliance planes struck Serb targets three times last week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;4	Earlier Friday , they released 70 Dutch peacekeepers , detained with a convoy bound for the eastern enclave of Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;5	Akashi also said the Serbs promised to allow Bangladeshi peacekeepers stranded in the besieged Bihac enclave to be resupplied .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;6	`` I am very pleased to find willingness of the Bosnian Serb leadership to respond to our urgent appeal , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;7	Whether the promises would be fulfilled remained to be seen , as Serbs have repeatedly broken their word to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;8	Karadzic promised normalized relations , but also called for another meeting first .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;9	`` We certainly need some meeting of the military people of the U.N. and the Serb army , '' Karadzic said , without elaborating .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;10	`` Some issues do not have to wait for the meeting , but some of them require that kind of meeting because of the technical issues . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;11	Karadzic also issued a veiled warning against NATO warplanes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;12	`` We would like to see skies clear of our aircrafts and of NATO aircrafts , '' Karadzic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;13	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;14	NATO sources said allied planes had been fired on by Serb missiles nine times in recent days and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;15	Akashi , addressing conflicting reports over whether NATO warplanes were over Bosnia enforcing the U.N. `` no fly '' zone , said :
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;16	`` I can not comment on internal discussions which we are conducting with NATO , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;17	`` But , I am glad that NATO is adopting an attitude that they are essentially at the service of UNPROFOR in the peacekeeping mission . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;18	Under rules of engagement , NATO planes can defend themselves against attack without prior U.N. approval .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;19	U.N. officials fear that could escalate tensions as they try to salvage stalled peace talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;20	`` What may seem as an innocent step ... can be fraught with difficulties , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0479;21	`` For example , this NATO air activity : the NATO flying over the skies may also bring about enhanced air defense system against which then NATO has to bring in more planes to defend itself , so we have to ... break this vicious circle . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0481;0	Stocks posted substantial gains Friday as bond prices rallied on economic data that showed steady but non-inflationary growth in the economy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;1	Traders said the market was also staging a technical rebound from losses earlier this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;2	Bond prices moved sharply higher , with the 30-year U.S. Treasury bond up more than dlrs 10 per dlrs 1,000 face value and yielding 7.91 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;3	Bonds got a lift from part of a Labor Department November jobs report that showed declines in the average hourly wage and work week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;4	The overall report showed a gain of 350,000 jobs in nonfarm payrolls in November , pushing the unemployment rate to 5.6 percent from 5.8 percent in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;5	Analysts had expected an increase in nonfarm jobs of about 250,000 , and for the unemployment rate to remain at 5.8 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;6	The overall jobs data showed a stronger-than expected growth in the economy , which analysts said might encourage the Federal Reserve to further tighten interest rates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;7	But fears of higher interest rates were softened by the wage and work-week components of the Labor Department report , as well as a drop of 0.1 percent in October in the government 's index of leading indicators , and a 0.4-percentage point drop in factory orders in October , analysts said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;8	Bonds initially dipped on the jobs report but then quickly rallied , pulling stocks higher with them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;9	`` The conclusion , at least for today -- and it 's only tentative -- is that the economy is going to slow to a no-boom , no-bust sustainable , non-inflationary pace , '' said Hugh Johnson , chief market strategist at First Albany Corp.
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;10	But Johnson and others said the market had been technically poised to rally after losing substantial ground earlier in the week , and that technical factors , like program trading , were responsible for some of the market 's gains .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;11	`` Stock investors are very very tentative , '' Johnson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;12	`` The level of confidence is not high . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;13	The Dow Jones average of 30 industrial stock rose 44.75 to 3,745.62 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0481;14	Advancing issues outnumbered decliners by about 3 to 2 on the New York Stock Exchange , with 1,397 up , 899 down and 623 unchanged .

APW_ENG_19941202.0481;19	At the American Stock Exchange , the market value index rose 1.27 to 452.46 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;0	Speaking to reporters after the meeting , Christopher made clear that the current peace initiative , and its territorial division giving Bosnian Serbs 49 percent of the territory , remains intact .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;1	`` The contact group plan with its 51-49 division of territory , must be the basis of a settlement of the conflict . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;2	Allowing a link up between the Bosnian Serbs and Serbia has been one of the main war aims of the Serbs and will be seen as a step towards the `` Greater Serbia '' which has so far been resisted by the West .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;3	Hurd said the alternative to a negotiated settlement that provides for some form of Serb confederation is `` more dangerous , even disastrous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;4	Earlier , Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic suggested that the possible offer of confederal links with Serbia would not be enough to get his side to accept a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;5	He asked for international recognition of the Bosnian Serb sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;6	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;7	Then we can stay in association with Muslims , Croats , Serbia etc , '' Karadzic said at his headquarters in Pale , Bosnia .

APW_ENG_19941202.0482;9	The idea of a political alliance of Bosnian Serbs with Belgrade is akin to the confederation that the current peace plan -- rejected by the Bosnian Serbs -- allows between Bosnian Croats and the Muslim-led government with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0482;10	The contact group nations also called for an immediate end to all hostilities across Bosnia , especially in the embattled enclave of Bihac , and demanded free passage for U.N. peacekeeping forces .

APW_ENG_19941202.0484;0	Bosnian Serbs promised Friday to release hundreds of peacekeepers and allow aid deliveries as the chief U.N. envoy tried to salvage what was left of the ailing U.N. mission in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;1	Earlier , Serb gunners surrounding Sarajevo hit the presidency building with anti-tank missiles just minutes before U.N. envoy Yasushi Akashi arrived for talks with the Muslim-led Bosnian government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;2	It was yet another sign of Serb contempt for the peacekeeping effort , which has virtually ground to a halt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;3	The Serb rebels have stopped U.N. aid convoys , attacked a U.N.-declared `` safe area , '' and taken peacekeepers hostage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;4	In Brussels , Belgium , Secretary of State Warren Christopher met with European foreign ministers to discuss a U.S. plan for a cease-fire that would lead to peace talks in the 2 -LCB- - year-old war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;5	The plan would grant the Serbs their main aim in the conflict : the right to ties with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;6	The Serbs on Friday released 70 peacekeepers who had been held a week , but more than 300 peacekeepers remained hostage as insurance against NATO airstrikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;7	Two wire-guided missiles hit the presidency building minutes before Akashi arrived for talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;8	One destroyed the office of Miro Lazovic , an ethnic Serb member of Bosnia 's collective presidency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;9	Three missiles hit nearby buildings while Akashi was meeting top government and military officials .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;10	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;11	`` Until we achieve something tangible , this shuttle diplomacy must continue , '' Akashi told reporters before leaving for Pale , the Bosnian Serb headquarters east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;12	Akashi later said Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic had promised to release hundreds of detained peacekeepers and allow free movement of aid convoys .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;13	`` More or less , we can say we are moving fast to normalization of our relations , '' Karadzic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;14	But he also called for more talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;15	The Bosnian government blasted the United Nations for not using force to halt fighting at Bihac , the embattled government-held enclave in the northwest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;16	Serb forces have seized 30 percent to 40 percent of the `` safe area , '' and fighting continued there Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;17	U.S. Ambassador to Germany Charles Redman held talks in Sarajevo with Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic on the U.S. peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;18	Redman helped draft an earlier plan that the Serbs rejected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;19	The war began when Serbs rebelled against a vote for independence from Yugoslavia by Bosnia-Herzegovina 's Muslims and Croats .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;20	More than 200,000 people are dead or missing in the war , and the Serbs have seized 70 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;21	Following the secession during the past three years of Slovenia , Croatia , Bosnia and Macedonia , Yugoslavia now is comprised only of Serbia and tiny Montenegro .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;22	Serb nationalists in Yugoslavia , Croatia and Bosnia have pressed for a unified `` Greater Serbia . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;23	The rejected peace plan denied Serbs the right to links with Yugoslavia as punishment for starting the war and granted them 49 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;24	It allowed Bosnia 's Croats and Muslims the right to ties with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;25	Akashi hopes to have more success than U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , who was rebuffed Wednesday when he tried to meet with Bosnian Serb leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;26	Boutros-Ghali said afterwards that intransigence by the warring sides might force the U.N. mission to withdraw .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;27	Seventy Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia , after being released from a seven-day detention by the Serbs in eastern Bosnia , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;28	But Serbs continued to hold about 20 other Dutch peacekeepers , plus hundreds of British , Ukrainians and Canadians , at various points throughout Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;29	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi also wanted to discuss the fighting around Bihac with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;30	The United Nations is trying to broker a cease-fire there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;31	Machine-gun and small arms fire was reported on the outskirts of Bihac , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;32	The heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;33	The Bosnian Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;34	There were also signs that fronts south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;35	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;36	Croat militia and Bosnian army soldiers took Kupres from the Serbs last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;37	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia had shelled his forces across the border , near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;38	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;39	In Knin , Croatia , the Croatian government and leaders of the rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement that , if implemented , could lead to normalized relations between the two enemies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0484;40	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital of Belgrade .

APW_ENG_19941202.0488;1	Four Russian legislators , representing parliament 's military committee , are trying to get Chechen President Dzhokhar Dudayev to release about 70 Russians , including army soldiers , who were captured in fighting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;2	Dudayev , who declared independence for his Caucasus Mountain republic in 1991 , says Moscow is arming and leading the rebels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;3	President Boris Yeltsin 's government has denied providing anything but political support , even as jets have attacked and Russian soldiers have been captured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;4	Jets roared over Grozny , the Chechen capital , for a fourth day Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;5	Raids this week have killed at least four civilians and an airport guard , and destroyed planes at civilian and military airports .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;6	`` It is clear that these planes are not English or French , but Russian , '' said Ella Pamfilova , a member of the parliament delegation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;7	`` This is against the law . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0488;9	Defense Minister Pavel Grachev has called the captives mercenaries .

APW_ENG_19941202.0488;11	But they said the operations went badly , and that some of their Chechen allies did not know how to use guns and fled .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;12	Counterintelligence spokesman Alexander Mikhailov , asked about such reports at a news conference Friday , said only that Chechnya is part of Russia and that the servicemen should be called volunteers , not mercenaries , ITAR-Tass and Interfax said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;13	Dudayev first threatened to kill the prisoners if Russia did not claim them , but later said they would be tried in court .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;14	Yeltsin had threatened to send troops if they were not released .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;15	Moscow has toned down the threat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;16	But it continued to beef up troops on Chechnya 's borders , news reports said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;17	Since the air offensive began last week , thousands of people have fled Grozny , a city of 300,000 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;18	Russia conquered the mainly Muslim Chechens in its imperial drive toward the Black Sea last century .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;19	Suppressed ethnic tensions have boiled over since the 1991 Soviet collapse .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;20	Many Russian nationalists vow never to let Chechnya go .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;21	The opposition accuses Dudayev of running Chechnya 's economy into the ground .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;22	The main industry , oil refining , is operating at 10 percent of capacity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;23	But Chechen pride and age-old enmity with Russia have rallied many people to Dudayev 's side , including volunteers from other Caucasus regions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;24	At a pro-Dudayev camp outside Grozny , 24-year-old Sergei Chicherov , a blue-eyed Cossack , had cast his lot with the Chechens .
APW_ENG_19941202.0488;25	`` If someone comes and attacks your home , are you supposed to just sit and watch ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0489;0	In a statement , the contact group nations said the 49 percent of land offered to the Serbs and the 51 percent to the Muslim-Croat alliance under the group 's plan , `` can be adjusted by mutual agreement between the parties . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0489;1	The statement said both the Bosnian Serbs and the Croat-Muslim group should be allowed `` equitable and balanced arrangements . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0489;2	The Bosnian Serbs currently control some 70 percent of the territory .

APW_ENG_19941202.0490;1	At least 21 people were killed , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0490;2	The accident occurred at 4:45 p.m. in Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 43 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0490;3	The second car of the train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages crashed into the station building , railway officials said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0490;5	He said in a telephone interview that some people remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night .

APW_ENG_19941202.0490;7	State television showed pictures of battered and broken railway cars covered in bricks torn loose from the building with rescue crews frantically dragging bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0490;8	National police spokesman Laszlo Garamvoelgyi said the death toll had risen to 21 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0490;9	With temperatures below freezing and others still trapped in the wreckage , the death toll was expected to rise , Garamvoelgyi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0490;10	Transport ministry officials said the accident occurred at a rail switch and suggested it was possibly caused by the switch not being thrown .
APW_ENG_19941202.0490;11	They had no information about the speed of the train when the cars derailed .

APW_ENG_19941202.0495;1	Thirteen months after losing his heavyweight titles to Evander Holyfield , there are more questions than answers about a fighter many predicted would dominate the heavyweight ranks for a long time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;2	Injury and weight problems have dogged Bowe , who has been mostly inactive since losing a close decision to Holyfield .

APW_ENG_19941202.0495;4	`` I 'm still the best heavyweight in the world , '' Bowe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;5	`` As long as I 'm in shape I beat all of them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;6	They can only hope I 'm fat and come in out of condition . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;7	That hope may have been put to rest Thursday when Bowe weighed in at 241 pounds -LRB- 109 kilos -RRB- for the scheduled 12-round fight at Caesars Palace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;8	It was the lightest Bowe has weighed since winning the titles from Holyfield in November 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;9	`` This is the best I 've felt since the first Holyfield fight , '' Bowe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;10	Bowe , who has seen the WBA and IBF titles he once held change hands twice more since his loss , is taking a chance fighting Donald , an up-and-coming 1992 Olympian who is undefeated in 16 professional fights .

APW_ENG_19941202.0495;12	`` Foreman will never fight Riddick Bowe and it 's just as well , '' Bowe 's manager , Rock Newman , said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;13	`` He would get massacred .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;14	McCall will never fight Riddick either , but who cares about him . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;15	Bowe instead hopes to tiptoe around the three major boxing organizations by beating Donald to set up a fight against Herbie Hide , who holds the lightly regarded WBO version of the crown .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;16	Newman said negotiations were close to being finalized for a fight against Hide in the spring .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;17	`` I believe I can legitimize the WBO the same way Larry Holmes legitimized the IBF , '' Bowe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;18	`` I do n't care what title I have as long as it indicates I 'm heavyweight champion of the world . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;19	First , though , there 's the matter of Donald , who is a slick boxer and has shown flashes of power in scoring 12 knockouts in 16 wins as a pro .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;20	Boxers who can move have given Bowe -LRB- 34-1 -RRB- trouble in the past , but he is a 4-1 pick to beat Donald .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;21	`` It 's going to be a great fight if Larry comes to fight , '' Bowe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;22	`` He 's perhaps a little better than Mathis because he 's more my size and he possesses a good left jab .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;23	If he has a chin , he 'll take a beating for 12 rounds . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;24	Donald , who weighed in at 228 pounds -LRB- 103 kilos -RRB- , is 27 , the same age as Bowe .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;25	But he did n't take up boxing until he was 19 and developed late as an amateur .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;26	Donald 's biggest fights have been a decision win over Jeremy Williams and a knockout of former heavyweight contender Bert Cooper .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;27	`` I 'm on my way up , '' Donald said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;28	`` I 'm loaded with confidence for this fight . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;29	By taking the fight , Donald , whose first pro fight was in January 1993 , violated the boxing maxim that a young contender should never be put in a tough fight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;30	But his trainer , Janks Morton , said the fight was one Donald actively sought .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;31	`` Bowe is the best heavyweight out there , that 's why we asked for him , '' Morton said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;32	`` Larry Donald is a better heavyweight than Bowe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0495;33	Bowe will earn dlrs 1 million for the fight , while Donald will get dlrs 490,000 , his biggest payday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;0	The United States , France , Britain , Germany and Russia on Friday sought to revive the peace initiative for Bosnia by unveiling new proposals , including a confederation between Bosnian Serbs and Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations launched a new drive to end the fighting , after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;2	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe told reporters that at the meeting it was agreed `` to devise a constitutional arrangement '' enabling Bosnian Serbs to link up politically with Belgrade without undermining the integrity as a sovereign nation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;3	Juppe and his British counterpart Douglas Hurd will travel on Sunday to Belgrade , the Serbian capital , for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;4	Speaking to reporters after the meeting , Christopher made clear that the current peace initiative -- and its territorial division giving Bosnian Serbs 49 percent of the territory -- remains intact .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;5	`` The contact group plan with its 51-49 division of territory , must be the basis of a settlement of the conflict . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;6	Allowing a link up between the Bosnian Serbs and Serbia has been one of the main war aims of the Serbs and will be seen as a step toward the `` Greater Serbia '' which has so far been resisted by the West .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;7	Hurd said the alternative to a negotiated settlement that provides for some form of Serb confederation is `` more dangerous , even disastrous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;8	Earlier , Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic suggested that the possible offer of confederal links with Serbia would not be enough to get his side to accept a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;9	He asked for international recognition of the Bosnian Serb sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;10	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;11	Then we can stay in association with Muslims , Croats , Serbia etc , '' Karadzic said at his headquarters in Pale , Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;12	`` We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;13	The idea of a political alliance of Bosnian Serbs with Belgrade is akin to the confederation that the current peace plan , rejected by the Bosnian Serbs , allows between Bosnian Croats and the Muslim-led government with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;14	The contact group nations also called for an immediate end to all hostilities across Bosnia , especially in the embattled enclave of Bihac , and demanded free passage for U.N. peacekeeping forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;15	In a statement , the contact group nations said the 49 percent of land offered to the Serbs and the 51 percent to the Muslim-Croat alliance under the group 's plan , `` can be adjusted by mutual agreement between the parties . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0496;16	The Bosnian Serbs currently control about 70 percent of the territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;0	Bosnian Serb promised Friday to release hundreds of detained UN peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;1	Canadian officials confirmed the report but said the Canadians were not yet free to move .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;2	UN special envoy Yasushi Akashi said Bosnian Serb leaders had agreed to release Ukrainian peacekeepers held in northern Bosnia , as well as Dutch and British convoys detained since Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;3	`` In addition , we have agreed that normal activities be restored to the Canadians -- 55 Canadians near Visoko -- and all other soldiers from other countries that were doing their work at weapons collection sites , '' Akashi said after talks with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic in Pale , near Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;4	Canadian officials confirmed the UN has negotiated the release of the Canadian peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;5	`` But the release has not been effected , '' John Williston , press secretary to Defense Minister David Collenette , said in Ottawa .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;6	`` That may happen in the next 24 to 48 hours . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;7	Whether the promises would be kept remained to be seen , as Serbs have repeatedly broken their word to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;8	In Paris , Peter Donolo , a spokesman for Prime Minister Jean Chretien , said : `` Obviously we 're encouraged by the developments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;9	We 're keeping our fingers crossed , but we 're not going to rest until our troops have full freedom of movement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;10	We 've been let down before . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;11	The Serbs have been holding about 400 UN soldiers as insurance against NATO airstrikes on their siege of the Muslim pocket of Bihac , a UN-declared safe haven in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;12	The Serbs released 70 Dutch peacekeepers taken hostage Saturday near Zvornik in eastern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;13	The soldiers were in good condition , Dutch officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;14	The Canadians have been held for the past 10 days at various sites in Serb-held territory near their peacekeeping camp in Visoko , near Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;15	About 20 are at a police complex in the village of Illijas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;16	The rest are at checkpoints and observation posts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;17	The soldiers are in radio contact with their camp and those at observation posts carry on their work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;18	Maj. Dean Milner , the senior officer among the detainees , is able to drive around in his vehicle and visit his soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;19	The Serbs are allowing supply vehicles from camp to reach the soldiers with mail , food and other items .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;20	Akashi , the top UN civilian leader in Bosnia set out Friday to hold talks with the Bosnian government in Sarajevo and with Serb leader Karadzic in Pale .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;21	His mission started badly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0497;22	Three missiles hit the Bosnian government building shortly before he arrived .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;0	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and NATO 's top civilian official denied Friday that the alliance had abandoned its enforcement of the U.N. `` no-fly '' zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;1	`` NATO is continuing to enforce the no-fly zone , '' Christopher said , amid continued confusion between the United Nations and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization over how to deal with the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;2	Earlier Friday , Wing Commander Timothy Hewlet , U.N. director for air operations in Bosnia , told reporters in Sarajevo that Bosnian Serbs had activated several surface-to-air missile sites throughout the country , threatening humanitarian flights and NATO jets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;3	Hewlet said NATO had agreed to a `` cooling off '' period to calm tensions , but was able to `` control '' the situation with AWACs planes flying outside Bosnian air space .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;4	`` There are no flights over Bosnia at the moment that I am aware of , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;5	At NATO headquarters , Secretary-General Willy Claes said he was unaware of any request from the United Nations to halt or scale-down Allied patrols enforcing of the military flight ban , designed to protect Bosnian civilians from bombardment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;6	`` We have never received any request , can I be any clearer than that ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;7	However , Yasushi Akashi , the chief U.N. envoy in former Yugoslavia , acknowledged talks on the issue were underway .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;8	`` I can not comment on internal discussions which we are conducting with NATO , '' Akashi told reporters after meeting with Bosnian Serb leaders in Pale , their stronghold east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;9	`` But I am glad that NATO is adopting an attitude that they are essentially at the service of UNPROFOR in the peacekeeping mission . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;10	NATO and the United Nations have repeatedly talked of the need to `` show presence '' in the skies over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;11	But NATO sources in Brussels said Allied planes had been fired on nine times in recent days by Serb missiles and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;12	Under current rules of engagement , NATO planes can strike back if targeted without prior approval from the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;13	Akashi cautioned that NATO air action could threaten delicate negotiations to revive flagging peace efforts and lead to an escalation of fighting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;14	`` One miscalculation , one misunderstanding and it might become beyond our control , '' he told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;15	Christopher told reporters Serb anti-missile batteries posed a problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;16	But , he said , NATO was capable of dealing with them , `` and we continue to police the ` no-fly ' zone in the effective way we have in the past . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;17	In Washington however , a senior U.S. military officer acknowledged that pilots and other NATO forces were taking steps to lessen the threat to aircraft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;18	He would not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;19	On Tuesday , officials said the United Nations requested and NATO agreed that planes would not fly over Bosnia for a 48-hour period while U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali and other peace negotiators visited Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;20	Western military sources said it appeared that request was extended slightly , and it was not clear if NATO planes were back in Bosnian airspace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0498;21	Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic , speaking in Pale after his meeting with Akashi , said , `` We would like to see skies clear of ... NATO aircraft . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0503;0	Liquidators of the Bank of Credit and Commerce International have taken a new settlement plan for the failed bank to a Luxembourg court , court officials said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;1	Judge Maryse Welter is to rule Jan. 12 on the plan to repay 250,000 creditors and depositors around the world some dlrs 10 billion , said court registrar Maryse Schumacher .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;2	A creditors ' committee approved the plan in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;3	It would provide dlrs 1.8 billion from the bank 's majority shareholders , the government and ruling family of Abu Dhabi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;4	Liquidators say the plan could repay creditors 30 to 40 cents on the dollar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;5	But many depositors worry their savings have disappeared in legal costs during the four years it has taken to wind up the bank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;6	An earlier settlement plan for BCCI depositors was shot down by a Luxembourg judge last year as too favorable to Abu Dhabi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;7	Abu Dhabi was to have paid dlrs 1.7 billion into a fund for creditors in the earlier deal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;8	The new deal increases the amount of money and changes the wording to accommodate what technical objections raised by the judges last year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;9	Schumacher said no creditors opposed the plan during two days of court hearings Wednesday and Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;10	But a lawyer for Luxembourg 's banking supervisors , the Luxembourg Monetary Institute , argued against what it considers is still too easy a deal for Abu Dhabi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;11	Banking regulators closed BCCI branches around the world in July 1991 , leaving claims of about dlrs 10 billion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0503;12	Officials alleged BCCI was used to launder money for drug dealers and dictators around the globe , but some of the depositors who lost their money blame the troubles on lax regulation by the authorities , including the Bank of England .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;0	The standoff between the U.S. PGA Tour and the new World Golf Tour has turned into a contest of credibility with both sides claiming a victory of sorts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;1	The World Golf Tour on Friday issued a statement saying it was `` continuing to move ahead as planned '' with its venture to stage six to eight tournaments in 1995 , some of which would conflict with PGA Tour events .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;2	The statement also said that Greg Norman 's commitment to the World Golf Tour `` is as firm as ever . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;3	This all came one day after PGA Tour commissioner Tim Finchem released a statement in which he said Norman told him he had had a `` re-evaluation of this situation '' and had told Finchem `` he would not support any venture that would damage the PGA Tour . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;4	Norman , who joined World Golf Tour executive director John Montgomery Jr. and Fox Television in announcing the new tour two weeks ago , has wavered in his support of the venture since Finchem announced that he would suspend any PGA Tour member who played in events that conflict with the tour .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;5	No American professionals have committed to the world tour , and no dates , sites or sponsors have been announced for the tournaments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;6	`` They are very keen to keep communications open , '' Norman , who is in Australia , said about the PGA Tour .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;7	`` He -LRB- Finchem -RRB- asked me to see him when I get home , and I will do that .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;8	Right now , the World Tour and the PGA Tour have a chance of working this thing out . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;9	Norman is scheduled to meet with Finchem and Montgomery separately when he returns to the United States next week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;10	Fox Sports spokesman Vince Wladika said the network was still interested in broadcasting the tournaments if the world tour went forward as planned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;11	As proposed , the new tour would have a 40-man field , based on the world rankings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0504;12	The prize money would provide dlrs 1 million for player of the year ; dlrs 600,000 to each tournament winner , and dlrs 30,000 to the last-place finisher , as well as dlrs 50,000 to each golfer for expenses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;0	Earlier Friday , Akashi met with Bosnian government officials in Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;1	Minutes before he arrived for those talks , two anti-tank missiles slammed into the presidency building where the meeting was to occur .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;2	Three more missiles hit nearby buildings during the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;3	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;4	U.N. officials said it appeared to be Serb fire ; the Serbs later accused the Bosnians of attacking themselves to cause trouble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;5	The Bosnian government complained about Akashi 's `` shuttle diplomacy '' while the United Nations failed to use force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , a U.N. `` safe area . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;6	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;7	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic , referring to European capitulation to Adolf Hitler before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;8	Charles Redman , the former U.S. member of the Contact Group and now ambassador to Germany , was also back in Sarajevo , leading bilateral talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic on new efforts to reach a peace settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;9	Those new efforts , unveiled Friday night in Brussels by the five-nation Contact Group , include allowing Bosnian Serbs to have some form of political ties to Serb-led Yugoslavia , which they had long sought .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;10	Critics of that new plan said it amounted to appeasement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;11	But Karadzic suggested even that might not now be enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;12	He said the Bosnians Serbs must first be guaranteed sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;13	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;14	... We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;15	In a letter to Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , carried by his news service SRNA , Karadzic warned the United Nations to drop its `` illusion that Bosnia exists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;16	... This illusion has cost us hundreds of thousands of human lives . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;17	Akashi also discussed a possible cease-fire for Bihac and beyond .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;18	But the Serbs maintained their rejection of a temporary cease-fire , saying they would accept only an end to the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;19	The Bosnian government fears that would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;20	U.N. officials said fighting continued Friday around Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;21	But the heaviest action was around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;22	The Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;23	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;24	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;25	Those allied forces took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;26	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia had shelled his forces across the border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;27	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0505;28	Karadzic claimed regular Croatian army troops were fighting alongside the Bosnian Croats and warned Akashi to get them out , saying , `` otherwise we will be forced to declare we are in war with Croatia . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0506;1	`` Even without winter it 's grim .

APW_ENG_19941202.0507;0	The United States , France , Britain , Germany and Russia Friday sought to restart the drive for a peace deal in Bosnia by endorsing , for the first time , a confederation of Bosnian Serbs and neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations met after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;2	`` The road will be very difficult , '' Christopher told reporters after the meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;3	`` But we do not see any other responsible road to take other than to redouble our efforts '' to find a political settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;4	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe said it was agreed `` to devise a constitutional arrangement '' enabling Bosnian Serbs to link up politically with Belgrade without somehow undermining Bosnia 's sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;5	Such an alliance has been a key aim of Serbs throughout the Bosnian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;6	The endorsement of it is bound to be seen as acquiescing in a `` Greater Serbia '' which has so far been resisted by the Contact Group members .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;7	The immediate reaction to the latest peace plan version from Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic was not encouranging .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;8	He asked for international recognition of the Bosnian Serb sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;9	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;10	Then we can stay in association with Muslims , Croats , Serbia etc , '' Karadzic said at his headquarters in Pale , Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;11	`` We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;12	Juppe and his British counterpart Douglas Hurd are to visit the Serbian capital of Belgrade Sunday for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;13	`` We shall keep trying '' to find a negotiated settlement , Juppe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;14	Christopher said the core of a Bosnian peace plan remained a strict territorial division giving Bosnian Serbs 49 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;15	`` The Contact Group plan with its 51-49 division of territory , must be the basis of a settlement of the conflict , '' Christopher said
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;16	Hurd said the alternative to a negotiated settlement that provides for some form of Serb confederation is `` more dangerous , even disastrous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;17	The idea of a political alliance of Bosnian Serbs with Belgrade is akin to the confederation that the current peace plan -- rejected by the Bosnian Serbs -- allows between Bosnian Croats and the Muslim-led government with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;18	The contact group nations also called for an immediate end to all hostilities across Bosnia , especially in the embattled enclave of Bihac , and demanded free passage for U.N. peacekeeping forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;19	In a statement , the contact group nations said the 49 percent of land offered to the Serbs and the 51 percent to the Muslim-Croat alliance under the group 's plan , `` can be adjusted by mutual agreement between the parties . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;20	The statement said both the Bosnian Serbs and the Croat-Muslim group should be allowed `` equitable and balanced arrangements . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0507;21	The Bosnian Serbs currently control some 70 percent of the territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;0	An anti-abortion activist who killed a doctor and his escort in a shotgun attack was sentenced by a federal judge on Friday to life in prison .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;1	The judge sentenced Paul Hill to two life terms for violating the new federal clinic protection law .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;2	Next week , a judge will decide whether Hill should get the electric chair on state murder charges in the slayings .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;3	Hill , 40 , of Pensacola was the first person in the nation prosecuted under the federal law against using violence or otherwise interfering with those entering abortion clinics .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;4	The life-without-parole sentences will run concurrently .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;5	Hill , a former Presbyterian minister , killed Dr. John Bayard Britton , 69 , and his volunteer bodyguard , retired Air Force Lt. Col. James Barrett , 74 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;6	Barrett 's wife , 69-year-old June Barrett , was wounded in the attack July 29 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;7	`` The rationale , your honor , is simply I was trying to prevent Dr. Britton from killing the 30 people he was going to kill that day , '' Hill told U.S. District Judge Roger Vinson .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;8	Vinson said he did not doubt Hill 's sincerity about believing he had a higher motive , but added : `` God does not look with favor on the taking of any human life . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;9	The sentence `` shows that extreme anti-abortion zealots are not above the law and will be punished to the full measure of the law , '' Eleanor Smeal , president of the Feminist Majority Foundation , said in a statement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;10	Hill also received 10 years under the new law for shooting Mrs. Barrett and five years for a weapons violation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;11	He was ordered to pay Mrs. Barrett $ 480 for medical expenses and counseling and $ 1,815 for her husband 's funeral expenses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;12	Hill acted as his own lawyer at both trials but offered no defense after the two judges refused to let him argue that the slayings were a justifiable attempt to save lives .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;13	The state jury that convicted Hill a month ago recommended the death penalty , but Circuit Judge Frank Bell is not bound by the recommendation at sentencing on Tuesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;14	Assistant U.S. Attorney David McGee said a key purpose of the dual prosecution in state and federal court was to let people know federal resources will be brought to bear against those who commit anti-abortion violence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;15	`` History teaches few lessons as clearly as the dangers inherent in those who kill in the name of God , '' McGee said after Hill 's sentencing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;16	`` Paul Hill is one of those men .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;17	He commits coldblooded murder and invokes the name of God to defend his acts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;18	It 's sacrilege . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;19	Barrett 's son , Bruce Barrett of Pensacola , attended the hearing and praised the sentence .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;20	`` That 's the way the law goes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0508;21	That 's what my father died for -- the law , the Constitution , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0510;1	`` You 're saying we have two more weeks , but I 'm not quite sure .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;2	And even if we did , it goes by awfully quickly , '' said Cliff Fletcher , the Toronto Maple Leafs ' general manager .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;3	`` It 's like driving a car 100 miles -LRB- 160 kilometers -RRB- an hour , racing toward a cliff .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;4	You 'd better make sure you know how to put the brakes on in time . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;5	So far , the sides only know how to put the brakes on negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;6	The latest delay guarantees that the owners ' lockout will carry into a 10th week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;7	An eight-hour meeting Thursday had produced hope that an accord could be reached in time to salvage a 50-game season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;8	But the sides met for only an hour Friday before agreeing to postpone talks until Monday in Chicago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;9	`` What you hope will happen after a break like this is that people come back to the table with new ideas or new concepts or new proposals and the thing moves forward quickly , '' NHL senior vice president Brian Burke said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;10	`` But the calendar is coming toward us like a freight train .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;11	At some point , it 's not going to be possible to have a season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;12	Hopefully , that 's going to add some pressure to the talks from both sides . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;13	The players , however , insist they 've been operating with a sense of urgency and say they 've been making all the concessions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;14	`` It is getting a little tiresome in the sense that this has been characterized so far as a negotiation of concession , '' NHL Players Association president Mike Gartner said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;15	`` That 's what happens , I guess , in a lockout .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;16	I guess if we would have given enough , there would be hockey right now . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;17	The latest union concessions came Thursday , when the NHLPA agreed to allow each team to designate a `` franchise player '' who could be kept from becoming a free agent if he is paid a certain salary .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;18	Gartner and union head Bob Goodenow contacted several potential franchise players , including some who are skating for the all-star team Wayne Gretzky has assembled to play in Europe during the lockout .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;19	`` Their reaction was that they were n't too happy about it , '' Gartner said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;20	`` But they did say , ` If this is going to get a deal , we understand . ' ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;21	The union on Thursday also agreed to drop its desired salary ceiling for first-round draft picks from dlrs 1.5 million to dlrs 1.25 million , but the owners refused to budge from their dlrs 700,000 figure .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;22	The main sticking points in negotiations continued to be salary arbitration , free agency and other ways the owners can fix costs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;23	`` We have a situation where revenues have been greatly outstripped by the increase in salaries , '' said NHL commissioner Gary Bettman , the front man in negotiations for the owners .

APW_ENG_19941202.0510;25	Players consider it a form of salary cap and say they wo n't agree to it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;26	Each team already has had 24 games canceled from its 84-game schedule because of the lockout .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;27	More cuts are likely .
