APW_ENG_19941202.0510;29	`` And the longer this goes on , the more of a factor time becomes , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;30	`` I hope both sides are cognizant of what the downside of this is .
APW_ENG_19941202.0510;31	I told the owners early on when they decided to go down this road that one of the possibilities they had to prepare for was the possibility of no season . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;0	The American dollar surged against the Japanese yen Friday , closing above the key 100-yen level for the first time in seven weeks , in a move that many analysts said signaled the U.S. currency 's long-awaited recovery .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;1	Data released in Tokyo and Washington pointed to changes in economic fundamentals that according to currency market participants should shift the global flow of capital back toward U.S. assets and drive up demand for the dollar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;2	`` We 're seeing a fundamental reappraisal of the dollar , '' said Robert Brusca , chief financial economist at Nikko Securities Co.
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;3	International Inc. `` It 's turned a pretty important corner . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;4	In late New York trading , the dollar was quoted at 100.61 yen , up from 99.34 late Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;5	It was the currency 's first close above 100 yen since Oct. 11 and the highest since Oct. 7 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;6	In London , the dollar rose to 100.36 yen from 99.35 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;7	In Tokyo , where the trading day begins , the U.S. currency finished the week at 99.58 yen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;8	The dollar also surged to a three-month high against the German mark and advanced vs. most other major currencies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;9	But dealers said trading centered on the yen , which weakened broadly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;10	The dollar rose in Asian dealings after the Japanese government reported the country 's trade surplus fell sharply in October , the third-consecutive monthly decline , while the economy grew at a 3.7 percent annual rate in the third quarter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;11	Those numbers suggested a reduction of the huge stockpiles of dollars Japan earns by exporting goods to the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;12	Constant selling of dollars for yen by Japanese companies had helped to push the U.S. currency to record lows this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;13	In addition , a strong Japanese economy should absorb more imports , which must be paid for in foreign currencies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;14	`` Some of the reasons for the stronger yen may no longer be as valid , '' said Ezra Zask , president of Norfolk , Conn.-based money-management firm Ezra Zask Associates Inc.
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;15	The dollar was further bolstered in European and American trading by a stronger-than-expected report on U.S. employment in November .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;16	The Labor Department said the economy created 350,000 jobs last month , pushing the unemployment rate to a four-year low of 5.6 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;17	That combined with other recent evidence of economic strength increases the liklihood that the Federal Reserve will raise short-term interest rates again , perhaps as soon as this month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;18	The central bank has boosted rates six times this year in an effort to head off inflation , which reduces the value of many investments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;19	Receding inflation fears and the higher returns offered on shorter-term U.S. investments vs. those in Europe and Japan are providing a powerful draw , particularly at a time when Tokyo stock prices seem to have peaked .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;20	`` There is a realization in the foreign exchange market of a shifting out of yen-denominated assets and into dollar assets , '' said Bob Near , a vice president at the Bank of New York .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;21	Brusca added that the Japanese had been hesitant this year to buy into American financial markets for fear that their investments would decline in value as the dollar dropped .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;22	That 's likely to change now that the dollar has breached 100 yen .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;23	`` A dollar below 100 yen reflected a currency that was too weak and deterred people from bringing money into the country , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;24	The stronger dollar `` inspires more confidence from investors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;25	The United States now stands a better chance of attracting Japanese capital . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;26	The dollar was changing hands late in New York at 1.5802 marks -- the best finish against that currency since Aug. 31 -- up from 1.5733 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;27	In London , the dollar advanced to 1.5763 marks from 1.5743 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;28	Other late dollar rates in New York , compared with late Thursday : 1.3338 Swiss francs , up from 1.3295 ; 5.4190 French francs , up from 5.3915 ; 1,618 Italian lire , up from 1,614 ; and 1.3712 Canadian dollars , down from 1.3776 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;29	The British pound was quoted at dlrs 1.5603 , down from dlrs 1.5669 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0511;30	In London , the pound dropped to dlrs 1.5605 from dlrs 1.5655 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;0	Lacking a witness to testify billions of dollars in Japanese bonds are really fakes , federal prosecutors dropped charges against two St. Petersburg men and a South Korean .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;1	The three were accused of trying to parlay dlrs 4.1 billion worth of purportedly counterfeit Japanese government bonds into multimillion-dollar lines of credit at four Tampa Bay-area financial institutions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;2	Charges of bank and wire fraud , conspiracy and counterfeiting were dropped Thursday after a federal judge denied the government 's request to delay the trial until a witness could be brought from Japan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;3	U.S. District Judge H. Dale Cook said he would decide early next year whether the government can refile the charges .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;4	Prosecutors had hoped Cook would allow the witness , a Japanese government official , to testify via a videocassette tape made when he was in town to testify in another case in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;5	But the tape ran out after two hours of testimony and defense attorneys never got a chance to cross-examine the witness .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;6	The witness , Hideo Inoue of the Japanese Ministry of Finance , then announced he would be leaving for Japan the next day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;7	`` It was a hoot , '' defense attorney John Swisher said Thursday of the abortive taping session .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;8	Swisher said prosecutors searched for a fresh tape and came up empty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;9	Assistant U.S. Attorney Edward Page said Inoue apparently did not enjoy testifying in court -- and then coming under hours of cross-examination -- during a similar bond case earlier the day of the taping .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;10	Inoue testified in the trial of former Assistant U.S. Attorney General Norbert Schlei and three others .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;11	The group was charged with attempting to sell up to dlrs 16 billion in forged Japanese bonds .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;12	Inoue 's testimony is key to both cases because without him prosecutors have no Japanese government witness to say the bonds are fake .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;13	The bonds in the two cases are nearly identical , but the cases share no other connection .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;14	Page said the government hopes to refile charges against William Woo Am Choi , 59 , of St. Petersburg ; his son Samuel Choi , 25 ; and Joung Joon An , 56 , of South Korea .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;15	Joung and William Choi were to be released after the charges were dropped .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;16	Samuel Choi already was free on bail .
APW_ENG_19941202.0513;17	The trial of Schlei and the three others continues next week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;0	The United States , France , Britain , Germany and Russia on Friday sought to restart the drive for a peace deal in Bosnia by endorsing a confederation of Bosnian Serbs and neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations met after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;2	`` The road will be very difficult , '' Christopher told reporters after the meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;3	`` But we do not see any other responsible road to take other than to redouble our efforts '' to find a political settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;4	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe said it was agreed `` to devise a constitutional arrangement '' enabling Bosnian Serbs to link up politically with Belgrade without undermining Bosnia 's sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;5	Such an alliance has been a key aim of Serbs throughout the Bosnian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;6	The endorsement of it is bound to be seen as acquiescing in a `` Greater Serbia '' which has so far been resisted by the Contact Group members .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;7	The immediate reaction to the latest peace plan version from Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic was not encouraging .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;8	He asked for international recognition of the Bosnian Serb sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;9	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;10	Then we can stay in association with Muslims , Croats , Serbia etc , '' Karadzic said at his headquarters in Pale , Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;11	`` We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;12	Juppe and his British counterpart Douglas Hurd are to visit the Serbian capital of Belgrade Sunday for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;13	`` We shall keep trying '' to find a negotiated settlement , Juppe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;14	Christopher said the core of a Bosnian peace plan remained a strict territorial division giving Bosnian Serbs 49 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;15	`` The Contact Group plan with its 51-49 division of territory , must be the basis of a settlement of the conflict , '' Christopher said
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;16	Hurd said the alternative to a negotiated settlement that provides for some form of Serb confederation is `` more dangerous , even disastrous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;17	The idea of a political alliance of Bosnian Serbs with Belgrade is akin to the confederation that the current peace plan , rejected by the Bosnian Serbs , allows between Bosnian Croats and the Muslim-led government with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;18	The contact group nations also called for an immediate end to all hostilities across Bosnia , especially in the embattled enclave of Bihac , and demanded free passage for U.N. peacekeeping forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;19	In a statement , the contact group nations said the 49 percent of land offered to the Serbs and the 51 percent to the Muslim-Croat alliance under the group 's plan , `` can be adjusted by mutual agreement between the parties . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0515;20	The Bosnian Serbs currently control about 70 percent of the territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0516;0	World Boxing Association cruiserweight champion Anaclet Wamba of France will defend his crown Saturday against Marcelo Dominguez of Argentina .
APW_ENG_19941202.0516;1	The bout , Wamba 's seventh defense , was scheduled for 6:10 p.m. -LRB- 2110 GMT -RRB- in Salta , a provincial capital 1,010 miles -LRB- 1,625 kilometers -RRB- northwest of Buenos Aires .
APW_ENG_19941202.0516;2	Wamba , 32 , has a record of 44-1-2 with 22 knockouts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0516;3	Dominguez 's record stands at 14-0-1 with seven knockouts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0516;4	The referee is Vinnie Delgado of the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0516;5	Judges are Roberto Barrovecchio of Italy , Micky Hanny of Britain and Harry Croes of Aruba .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;0	No one is quite sure how long the man sat in the patio chair in his darkened basement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;1	When a gas meter reader finally found him Thursday , he was still comfortably dressed in a woolly blue and white sweater , sweatpants and slippers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;2	Except that his head was missing .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;3	The seated , skeletal remains were so decomposed that the skull had apparently toppled away , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;4	Authorities tentatively identified the body Friday as Long Lu Lee , 69 , a mechanical engineer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;5	When Lee died -- and how -- remained a mystery .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;6	A woman who investigators believe was Lee 's wife , Thuc Khoanh Lu , 62 , was providing few answers , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;7	Lu told police she had not seen her husband for several months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;8	But police could not find a missing-person report , said Sgt. Edward Caro , a police spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;9	The results of an autopsy Friday were inconclusive and doctors will conduct more tests .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;10	Brooklyn Union Gas Co. had been trying , unsuccessfully , to read the meter at the home in the New York borough of Queens for more than a year , said spokesman Ed Yutkowitz .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;11	Armed with a court order , a meter reader went to the home along with a city marshal and a locksmith .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;12	Lu tried to discourage them from going into the basement , Caro said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;13	They pushed their way through a huge , sticky cobweb and found the headless skeleton sitting in the white plastic chair near a boiler , Caro said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0517;14	Lee 's wallet was found in a pants pocket , his head under the chair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;0	The government agreed Friday to drop its case against General Motors pickup trucks , accepting a deal in which GM will spend more than dlrs 51 million on safety and research programs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;1	Transportation Secretary Federico Pena announced the agreement at a news conference in Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;2	He said the idea behind the deal is that the safety and research programs GM will finance will begin saving lives immediately .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;3	`` Proceeding with the recall process would have taken years in court , '' Pena said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;4	`` During all that time , the trucks subject to this investigation would have remained on our highways . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;5	He described the agreement as `` a common sense outcome and a victory for safety and saving lives . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;6	GM released a statement describing the company 's agreement to collaborate with the government on safety programs as `` clearly in the public interest . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;7	Pena announced Oct. 17 that he had determined the trucks present an unreasonable risk of fire in side-impact collisions because their fuel tanks are mounted outside the vehicle frame .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;8	He scheduled a public meeting , set for Tuesday in Washington , to gather more information on whether he should order a recall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;9	The deal cancels the meeting , and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and the Transportation Department will not proceed with further steps toward a recall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;10	About 9 million of the trucks were built between model years 1973 and 1987 and sold under Chevrolet and GMC nameplates .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;11	GM estimates about 5 million still are in use .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;12	The agreement also calls for the Department of Transportation to add dlrs 27 million to the dlrs 51 million GM is putting into the program .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;13	`` Our position has never wavered that these trucks are not unsafe and do not pose an unreasonable risk to owners who continue to operate them , '' the GM statement said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;14	NHTSA began investigating the trucks two years ago after consumer groups petitioned for a recall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;15	The agency asked GM to voluntarily recall the trucks in 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;16	Pena acknowledged in October that the trucks meet federal crash safety standards , but he said the law requires that they be safe in real-world conditions as well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;17	GM filed suit last month seeking to block any further action by him in the case .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;18	Pena said that case would be dismissed as part of the settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;19	In February 1993 , a jury in Atlanta found General Motors negligent in the death of a teen-ager in a fiery crash involving a GM pickup .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;20	The jury awarded the parents of 17-year-old Shannon Mosley , who died in a crash in 1989 , dlrs 105 million in damages .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;21	The verdict and the damage award were later thrown out by a state appeals court and a retrial is pending .
APW_ENG_19941202.0518;22	The appeals court said the jury should not have been told about other suits pending against GM .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;0	Bosnian Serb leaders promised Friday to release hundreds of detained U.N. peacekeepers and allow free movement of certain U.N. convoys , the chief U.N. envoy said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;1	Earlier Friday , the Serbs once again made clear their contempt for the U.N. mission , firing anti-armor missiles at the Bosnian presidency building minutes before Yasushi Akashi , the chief U.N. envoy for the former Yugoslavia , arrived there for talks with government leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;2	Akashi later met with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic at his headquarters in Pale , east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;3	After the meeting , Akashi told reporters he had been assured that Ukrainian peacekeepers held in northern Bosnia , as well as Dutch and British resupply convoys detained since Saturday , would be freed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;4	`` In addition , we have agreed that normal activities be restored to the Canadians ... and all other soldiers from other countries that were doing their work at weapons collection sites , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;5	Serbs detained more than 400 U.N. personnel throughout Bosnia as insurance against further NATO airstrikes after alliance planes struck Serb targets three times last week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;6	Earlier Friday , they released 70 Dutch peacekeepers , detained a week ago with a convoy bound for the eastern enclave of Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;7	The Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;8	Akashi also said the Serbs promised to allow Bangladeshi peacekeepers stranded in the besieged Bihac enclave to be resupplied .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;9	`` I am very pleased to find willingness of the Bosnian Serb leadership to respond to our urgent appeal , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;10	Whether the promises would be kept remained to be seen , as Serbs have repeatedly broken their word to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;11	Karadzic promised normalized relations , but also called for another meeting first .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;12	`` We certainly need some meeting of the military people of the U.N. and the Serb army , '' Karadzic said , without elaborating .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;13	`` Some issues do not have to wait for the meeting , but some of them require that kind of meeting because of the technical issues . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;14	Karadzic also issued a veiled warning against NATO warplanes enforcing a U.N. `` no-fly '' zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;15	`` We would like to see skies clear of our aircrafts and of NATO aircrafts , '' Karadzic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;16	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;17	NATO sources said allied planes had been fired on by Serb missiles nine times in recent days and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;18	Earlier Friday , Akashi met with Bosnian government officials in Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;19	Minutes before he arrived for those talks , two anti-tank missiles slammed into the presidency building where the meeting was to occur .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;20	Three more missiles hit nearby buildings during the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;21	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;22	U.N. officials said it appeared to be Serb fire ; the Serbs later accused the Bosnians of attacking themselves to cause trouble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;23	The Bosnian government complained about Akashi 's `` shuttle diplomacy '' and criticized the United Nations for failing to use force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , a U.N.-designated `` safe area . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;24	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;25	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;26	He was referring to the European appeasement of Adolf Hitler at the 1938 Munich meeting before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;27	Charles Redman , the former U.S. member of the Contact Group and now ambassador to Germany , was also back in Sarajevo , leading bilateral talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic on new efforts to reach a peace settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;28	Those new efforts , unveiled Friday night in Brussels by the five-nation Contact Group , include allowing Bosnian Serbs to have some form of political ties to Serb-led Yugoslavia , which they had long sought .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;29	Critics of that new plan said it amounted to appeasement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;30	But Karadzic suggested even that might not now be enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;31	He said the Bosnians Serbs must first be guaranteed sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;32	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;33	... We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;34	In a letter to Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , carried by his news service SRNA , Karadzic warned the United Nations to drop its `` illusion that Bosnia exists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;35	... This illusion has cost us hundreds of thousands of human lives . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;36	Akashi also discussed a possible cease-fire for Bihac and beyond .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;37	But the Serbs maintained their rejection of a temporary cease-fire , saying they would accept only an end to the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;38	The Bosnian government fears that would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;39	U.N. officials said fighting continued Friday around Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;40	But the heaviest action was around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;41	The Bosnian Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;42	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;43	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;44	Those allied forces took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;45	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia had shelled his forces across the border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;46	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0519;47	Karadzic claimed regular Croatian army troops were fighting alongside the Bosnian Croats and warned Akashi to get them out , saying , `` otherwise we will be forced to declare we are in war with Croatia . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;0	The United States , France , Britain , Germany and Russia Friday sought to restart the drive for a peace deal in Bosnia by endorsing , for the first time , a confederation of Bosnian Serbs and neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;1	The foreign ministers of the Bosnia ` Contact Group ' nations met after U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher endorsed the European view that diplomacy is the best way to deal with the conflict that has dragged on for 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;2	They insisted on a 51-49 percent division of territory -- long the core of the group 's so far unsuccessful peace proposals -- but allowed for adjustments only `` by mutual agreement . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;3	`` The road will be very difficult , '' Christopher told reporters after the meeting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;4	`` But we do not see any other responsible road to take other than to redouble our efforts '' to find a political settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;5	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe said it was agreed `` to devise a constitutional arrangement '' enabling Bosnian Serbs to link up politically with Belgrade without somehow undermining Bosnia 's sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;6	Such an alliance has been a key aim of Serbs throughout the Bosnian crisis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;7	The endorsement of it is bound to be seen as acquiescing in a `` Greater Serbia '' which has so far been resisted by the Contact Group members .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;8	The immediate rteaction to the latest peace plan version from Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic was not encouranging .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;9	He asked for international recognition of the Bosnian Serb sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;10	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;11	Then we can stay in association with Muslims , Croats , Serbia etc , '' Karadzic said at his headquarters in Pale , Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;12	`` We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;13	Juppe and his British counterpart Douglas Hurd are to visit the Serbian capital of Belgrade Sunday for talks with President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;14	`` We shall keep trying '' to find a negotiated settlement , Juppe said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;15	Christopher said the core of a Bosnian peace plan remained a strict territorial division giving Bosnian Serbs 49 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;16	`` The Contact Group plan with its 51-49 division of territory , must be the basis of a settlement of the conflict , '' Christopher said
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;17	Hurd said the alternative to a negotiated settlement that provides for some form of Serb confederation is `` more dangerous , even disastrous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;18	The idea of a political alliance of Bosnian Serbs with Belgrade is akin to the confederation that the current peace plan -- rejected by the Bosnian Serbs -- allows between Bosnian Croats and the Muslim-led government with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;19	The contact group nations also called for an immediate end to all hostilities across Bosnia , especially in the embattled enclave of Bihac , and demanded free passage for U.N. peacekeeping forces .
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;20	In a statement , the contact group nations said the 49 percent of land offered to the Serbs and the 51 percent to the Muslim-Croat alliance under the group 's plan , `` can be adjusted by mutual agreement between the parties . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;21	The statement said both the Bosnian Serbs and the Croat-Muslim group should be allowed `` equitable and balanced arrangements . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0520;22	The Bosnian Serbs currently control some 70 percent of the territory .

APW_ENG_19941202.0524;40	But the heaviest action was around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;41	The Bosnian Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;42	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;43	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;44	Those allied forces took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;45	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia had shelled his forces across the border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;46	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0524;47	Karadzic claimed regular Croatian army troops were fighting alongside the Bosnian Croats and warned Akashi to get them out , saying , `` otherwise we will be forced to declare we are in war with Croatia . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;0	National Hockey League labor talks ended abruptly Friday , even though a collective bargaining agreement probably needs to be in place by mid-December to save the season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;1	`` You 're saying we have two more weeks , but I 'm not quite sure .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;2	And even if we did , it goes by awfully quickly , '' said Cliff Fletcher , the Toronto Maple Leafs ' general manager .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;3	`` It 's like driving a car 100 miles -LRB- 160 kilometers -RRB- an hour , racing toward a cliff .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;4	You 'd better make sure you know how to put the brakes on in time . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;5	So far , the sides only know how to put the brakes on negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;6	The latest delay guarantees that the owners ' lockout will carry into a 10th week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;7	An eight-hour meeting Thursday had produced hope that an accord could be reached in time to salvage a 50-game season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;8	But the sides met for only an hour Friday before agreeing to postpone talks until Monday in Chicago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;9	`` What you hope will happen after a break like this is that people come back to the table with new ideas or new concepts or new proposals and the thing moves forward quickly , '' NHL senior vice president Brian Burke said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;10	`` But the calendar is coming toward us like a freight train .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;11	At some point , it 's not going to be possible to have a season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;12	Hopefully , that 's going to add some pressure to the talks from both sides . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;13	The players , however , insist they 've been operating with a sense of urgency and say they 've been making all the concessions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;14	`` It is getting a little tiresome in the sense that this has been characterized so far as a negotiation of concession , '' NHL Players Association president Mike Gartner said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;15	`` That 's what happens , I guess , in a lockout .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;16	I guess if we would have given enough , there would be hockey right now . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;17	The latest union concessions came Thursday , when the NHLPA agreed to allow each team to designate a `` franchise player '' who could be kept from becoming a free agent if he is paid a certain salary .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;18	Gartner and union head Bob Goodenow contacted several potential franchise players , including some who are skating for the all-star team Wayne Gretzky has assembled to play in Europe during the lockout .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;19	`` Their reaction was that they were n't too happy about it , '' Gartner said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;20	`` But they did say , ` If this is going to get a deal , we understand . ' ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;21	The union on Thursday also agreed to drop its desired salary ceiling for first-round draft picks from dlrs 1.5 million to dlrs 1.25 million , but the owners refused to budge from their dlrs 700,000 figure .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;22	The main sticking points in negotiations continued to be salary arbitration , free agency and other ways the owners can fix costs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;23	`` We have a situation where revenues have been greatly outstripped by the increase in salaries , '' said NHL commissioner Gary Bettman , the front man in negotiations for the owners .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;24	For now , the sides are n't discussing the owners ' contentious salary tax proposal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;25	Players consider it a form of salary cap and say they wo n't agree to it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;26	Each team already has had 24 games canceled from its 84-game schedule because of the lockout .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;27	More cuts are likely .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;28	Bettman , who said he was `` getting a little frustrated , '' agreed that time has become a major factor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;29	`` And the longer this goes on , the more of a factor time becomes , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;30	`` I hope both sides are cognizant of what the downside of this is .
APW_ENG_19941202.0526;31	I told the owners early on when they decided to go down this road that one of the possibilities they had to prepare for was the possibility of no season . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;0	An express train headed from eastern Hungary to Budapest derailed Friday and slammed into a station building , killing at least 21 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;1	At least 60 people were injured , said National Police spokesman Laszlo Garamvoelgyi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;2	The accident occurred at Szajol , about 40 miles southeast of the Hungarian capital , when the second car of an express train derailed and dragged three other cars off the tracks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;3	The overturned carriages smashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;4	`` There was a tremendous explosion , like the end of the world , '' a railway employee who witnessed the accident said in a telephone interview .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;5	People were still buried in the wreckage more than four hours after the crash , said the employee , who spoke on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;6	State television showed pictures of battered and broken railway cars covered in bricks and rescue crews dragging bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;7	The death toll reached 21 by late Friday and was expected to go higher , with temperatures below freezing and some people still trapped in the wreckage , said Garamvoelgyi , the police spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;8	Doctors at a hospital near Szolnok , close to the site of the accident , said they admitted 26 injured people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;9	Other hospitals also took in injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0527;10	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 100 miles east of Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;0	Quebec separatist leader Lucien Bouchard had his left leg amputated after being attacked by a strain of flesh-eating bacteria , but is out of danger , doctors said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;1	Bouchard , 55 , the most popular leader in Canada 's largest French-speaking province , vowed to continue his political career , dedicated to making Quebec an independent country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;2	`` Mr. Bouchard has greatly improved over the past 12 hours , '' Dr. Patrick d'Amico told a news conference at Montreal 's St. Luc Hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;3	D'Amico said Bouchard had undergone three operations since being admitted to the hospital earlier this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;4	The left leg was amputated at mid-thigh in an operation during which he was conscious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;5	If no further complications occur , Bouchard should recover fully in about three or four months , said D'Amico .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;6	Earlier Friday , rumors circulated that Bouchard was on the verge of death , but hospital officials dismissed them as untrue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;7	News of Bouchard 's illness shook Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;8	Small groups of people , some bearing Quebec flags , kept an all-night vigil outside the hospital under a light snowfall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;9	Bouchard was struck by a rare disease known as necrotizing myositis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;10	It is similar to necrotizing fasciitis , the `` flesh-eating disease '' that caused alarm in Britain this year , but attacks muscle rather than connective tissue .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;11	Dr. Francois Lamothe , a specialist in microbiology who also appeared at the news conference , said the disease is caused by the streptococcus A bacterium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;12	It is fatal in 80 percent of the cases .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;13	The bacteria is common and usually results in sore throats or tonsilitis .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;14	But in about one in a million cases , it turns deadly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;15	Bouchard , a former Conservative Cabinet minister , bolted former Prime Minister Brian Mulroney 's government in 1990 and formed his own party .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;16	The new party became , effectively , the national arm of the Parti Quebecois , the provincial party dedicated to the secession of Quebec and its 7 million inhabitants from Canada .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;17	In the 1993 federal elections , the Bloc Quebecois won 54 seats to become the official opposition to the ruling Liberals in the House of Commons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;18	Few wanted to speculate on what the absence of Bouchard would have on the political scene or the referendum on independence expected next year in Quebec .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;19	Politicians of all political stripes expressed their concern for Bouchard 's health and wished him well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;20	Prime Minister Jean Chretien , on a trip to France , said : `` I speak not only for the government of Canada , but also for the people of Canada when I express to Mr. Bouchard and his family our deep regrets and our sincere wish for a rapid return of his health . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;21	The disease struck Bouchard suddenly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;22	Last weekend he had attended a party congress , though he complained of having the flu .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;23	On Tuesday , he was diagnose with phlebitis , an inflammation of a vein in his leg , and was admitted to St. Luc Hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0528;24	Dr. Pierre Ghosn , head of cardiovascular surgery , said he operated to relieve pressure in the leg and discovered the disease .

APW_ENG_19941202.0529;1	Wilson Pastor , the ministry 's coordinator for the project , said the 10 fields need dlrs 151 million of additional investment to raise the extractable oil reserves from 47.96 million barrels to 154.26 million barrels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0529;2	`` We expect to finish the bidding on these fields between June and July 1995 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0529;3	The winning companies will have concessions for 20 years , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0529;4	Sixty national companies and consortiums and 80 international companies have qualified to bid , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0529;5	The lots produce less than 1 percent of the national production of 385,000 barrels of crude a day , and measure between 20,000 and 149,000 acres -LRB- 8,000 to 60,000 hectares -RRB- each , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0529;6	Pastor said that in the first stage of the project the winning companies will have to invest between dlrs 30 million and dlrs 45 million for environmental protection and recovery in the Amazon jungle region where the well are located .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;0	Liquidators of the Bank of Credit and Commerce International have taken a new settlement plan for the failed bank to a Luxembourg court , court officials said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;1	Judge Maryse Welter is to rule Jan. 12 on the plan to repay 250,000 creditors and depositors around the world some dlrs 10 billion , said court registrar Maryse Schumacher .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;2	A creditors ' committee approved the plan in September .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;3	It would provide dlrs 1.8 billion from the bank 's majority shareholders , the government and ruling family of Abu Dhabi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;4	Liquidators say the plan could repay creditors 30 to 40 cents on the dollar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;5	But many depositors worry their savings have disappeared in legal costs during the four years it has taken to wind up the bank .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;6	An earlier settlement plan for BCCI depositors was shot down by a Luxembourg judge last year as too favorable to Abu Dhabi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;7	Abu Dhabi was to have paid dlrs 1.7 billion into a fund for creditors in the earlier deal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;8	The new deal increases the amount of money and changes the wording to accommodate what technical objections raised by the judges last year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;9	Schumacher said no creditors opposed the plan during two days of court hearings Wednesday and Thursday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;10	But a lawyer for Luxembourg 's banking supervisors , the Luxembourg Monetary Institute , argued against what it considers is still too easy a deal for Abu Dhabi .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;11	Banking regulators closed BCCI branches around the world in July 1991 , leaving claims of about dlrs 10 billion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0530;12	Officials alleged BCCI was used to launder money for drug dealers and dictators around the globe , but some of the depositors who lost their money blame the troubles on lax regulation by the authorities , including the Bank of England .
APW_ENG_19941202.0531;0	Here are excerpts of a statement issued by the Contact Group foreign ministers after their meeting here Friday :
APW_ENG_19941202.0531;1	`` Ministers expressed very deep concern about the recent intensification of hostilities in Bosnia and Herzegovina , particularly around Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0531;2	They were unanimous that the solution to the conflict in the former Yugoslavia can only be reached at the negotiating table , not on the battlefield .

APW_ENG_19941202.0531;4	`` Ministers supported UNPROFOR efforts to pursue demilitarization , particular of the Bihac safe area and Sarajevo .

APW_ENG_19941202.0531;12	Constitutional arrangements agreeable to the parties will need to be drawn up which preserve the integrity of Bosnia Herzegovina and allow equitable and balanced arrangements for the Bosnia-Croat and Bosnian Serb entities . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;0	Part of an express train headed from eastern Hungary to Budapest derailed Friday , its cars sliding into a station building and burying passengers , rail workers and their family members underneath the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;1	Police said at least 24 people died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;2	The accident occurred at Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 40 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;3	The second car of the express train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and some of the overturned carriages smashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;4	`` There was a tremedous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;5	People remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night , although the crash occured at 4:45 p.m. local time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;6	Battered and broken railway cars were covered in brick torn loose from the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;7	Rescue crews frantically dragged bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;8	One car , partially twisted beyond recognition , remained skewering the building as a huge crane was positioned shortly before midnight to pluck it from the crumbling brick and mortar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;9	About 200 soldiers and 100 police officers worked into the night looking for survivors and keeping away the curious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;10	Rescue workers said the destroyed building was sleeping quarters for railway personnel and their families , including small children who were likely victims .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;11	and that they continued to hear voices from within the wreck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;12	Laszlo Garamvoelgyi , a National Police spokesman , said the death toll had risen to 24 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;13	With temperatures below freezing and others left in the wreckage the death toll was expected to rise - Garamvoelgyi said the latest count `` was not the final one by any means . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;14	The severity of the accident eclipsed the previous most serious train tragedy of recent years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;15	Ten children died last February , in a bus-train collision .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;16	Transport ministry officials said the accident occured at a rail switch and suggested that it was possibly caused by the switch not being completely thrown - the car that skewered the building jumped four tracks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;17	Local Police Chief Gyoergy Lengyel said the train was traveling at about 110 kilometers -LRB- 66 miles -RRB- and hour , normal speed past a station that was not a stop .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;18	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok said 26 injured , including two critical cases , were admitted to their hospital alone , with three others also taking in injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;19	Among senior officials at the scene by late Friday evening was Interior Minister Laszlo Kuncze .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;20	`` We are witnesses to a terrible tragedy , '' Kuncze said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0532;21	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;0	Aamir Sohail scored a century and captain Salim Malik made an unbeaten 65 Friday to lead Pakistan to a comfortable victory over Sri Lanka in the first match of the Benson and Hedges quadrangular cricket series .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;1	Needing to top Sri Lanka 's 238 for five in its 50 overs , Pakistan reached the target of 239 with 13 balls to spare for the loss of four wickets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;2	Sri Lankan captain Arjuna Ranatunga scored 101 , his first century in 152 one-day internationals , and was named man of the match .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;3	But Pakistan appeared in control and only faced danger when Sri Lankan outfielders Aravinda de Silva and Roshan Mahanama each made brilliant catches to dismiss Sohail and Ejaz Ahmad .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;4	Malik then steadied the batting , with the benefit of a ruling in his favor by third umpire Barry Lambson after it appeared he had been stumped by offspinner Ruhan Kalpage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;5	The two sides play again Sunday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;6	South Africa and New Zealand are the other two nations in the round-robin tournament for the Mandela Cup , named for new South African President Nelson Mandela .
APW_ENG_19941202.0533;7	All three visiting sides are making their first trips since South Africa returned to international cricket in 1991 after being banned two decades because of apartheid .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;0	Bosnian Serb leaders promised Friday to release hundreds of detained U.N. peacekeepers and allow free movement of certain U.N. convoys , the chief U.N. envoy said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;1	Earlier Friday , two anti-tank missiles slammed into the Bosnian presidency building in Sarajevo minutes before Yasushi Akashi , the chief U.N. envoy for the former Yugoslavia , was to meet with the Muslim-led government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;2	Three more missiles hit nearby buildings during the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;3	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;4	U.N. officials said it appeared to be Serb fire ; the Serbs later accused the Bosnians of attacking themselves to cause trouble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;5	Akashi later met with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic at his headquarters in Pale , east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;6	After the meeting , Akashi told reporters he had been assured that Ukrainian peacekeepers held in northern Bosnia , as well as Dutch and British resupply convoys detained since Saturday , would be freed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;7	`` In addition , we have agreed that normal activities be restored to the Canadians ... and all other soldiers from other countries that were doing their work at weapons collection sites , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;8	Serbs detained more than 400 U.N. personnel throughout Bosnia as insurance against further NATO airstrikes after alliance planes struck Serb targets three times last week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;9	Earlier Friday , they released 70 Dutch peacekeepers , detained a week ago with a convoy bound for the eastern enclave of Srebrenica .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;10	The Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;11	Akashi also said the Serbs promised to allow Bangladeshi peacekeepers stranded in the besieged Bihac enclave to be resupplied .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;12	`` I am very pleased to find willingness of the Bosnian Serb leadership to respond to our urgent appeal , '' Akashi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;13	Whether the promises would be kept remained to be seen , as Serbs have repeatedly broken their word to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;14	Karadzic promised normalized relations , but also called for another meeting first .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;15	`` We certainly need some meeting of the military people of the U.N. and the Serb army , '' Karadzic said , without elaborating .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;16	`` Some issues do not have to wait for the meeting , but some of them require that kind of meeting because of the technical issues . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;17	Karadzic also issued a veiled warning against NATO warplanes enforcing a U.N. `` no-fly '' zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;18	`` We would like to see skies clear of our aircrafts and of NATO aircrafts , '' Karadzic said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;19	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;20	NATO sources said allied planes had been fired on by Serb missiles nine times in recent days and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;21	Earlier Friday , Akashi met with Bosnian government officials in Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;22	The Bosnian government complained about Akashi 's `` shuttle diplomacy '' and criticized the United Nations for failing to use force to halt the Serb attack on Bihac , a U.N.-designated `` safe area . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;23	`` Instead of doing what they have to do , the U.N. is driving back and forth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;24	... This Munich policy is a humiliation of the international community , '' said Kemal Muftic , chief adviser to Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;25	He was referring to the European appeasement of Adolf Hitler at the 1938 Munich meeting before World War II .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;26	Charles Redman , the former U.S. member of the Contact Group and now ambassador to Germany , was also back in Sarajevo , leading bilateral talks with Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic on new efforts to reach a peace settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;27	Those new efforts , unveiled Friday night in Brussels by the five-nation Contact Group , include allowing Bosnian Serbs to have some form of political ties to Serb-led Yugoslavia , which they had long sought .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;28	Critics of that new plan said it amounted to appeasement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;29	But Karadzic suggested even that might not now be enough .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;30	He said the Bosnians Serbs must first be guaranteed sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;31	`` Everything can be solved by recognition of our sovereignty .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;32	... We have to be either recognized or destroyed . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;33	In a letter to Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , carried by his news service SRNA , Karadzic warned the United Nations to drop its `` illusion that Bosnia exists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;34	... This illusion has cost us hundreds of thousands of human lives . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;35	Akashi also discussed a possible cease-fire for Bihac and beyond .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;36	But the Serbs maintained their rejection of a temporary cease-fire , saying they would accept only an end to the war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;37	The Bosnian government fears that would cement Serb territorial gains of 70 percent of the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;38	U.N. officials said fighting continued Friday around Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;39	But the heaviest action was around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;40	The Bosnian Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;41	There were also signs that frontlines south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;42	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;43	Those allied forces took Kupres from the Serbs in a joint attack last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;44	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia had shelled his forces across the border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;45	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0534;46	Karadzic claimed regular Croatian army troops were fighting alongside the Bosnian Croats and warned Akashi to get them out , saying , `` otherwise we will be forced to declare we are in war with Croatia . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0535;1	New battle cry -LRB- Business Times , Kuala Lumpur -RRB- :
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;2	The latest battle cry around the world is '' free trade . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;3	If things go according to plan , there will be a free trade area from Yukon to Tierra del Fuego covering the United States , Canada , Latin America and Caribbean nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;4	The European Union -LRB- EU -RRB- and MERCOSUR -LRB- Southern Common Market -RRB- -- the South American trade grouping of Argentina , Brazil , Paraguay and Uruguay -- have also announced plans to negotiate a free trade zone between them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;5	But other countries in Asia and the Eastern Hemisphere are not as united , nor do they have a plan to develop a trade area in the region .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;6	With the rest of the world 's regions joining hands , countries in the Far East may find themselves isolated and too weak to fend for themselves .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;7	They may even be locked out of their major trading partners and regions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;8	In the light of the latest developments , even a major economic power like Japan may not be able to remain unaffected and be able to fend for itself alone .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;9	The answer to developments in the rest of the world must be the establishment of the proposed East Asia Economic Caucus -LRB- EAEC -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;10	The need is even greater for it now than ever before .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;11	As a caucus , it will enable like-minded people to make a united stand on common issues and concerns and prepare themselves to face the new challenges and battles that may be fought in the world economic arena with the setting up of free trade zones .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;12	Russia 's move on nuclear reactors -LRB- Korea Times , Seoul -RRB- :
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;13	It is dismaying to note that Russia is still seeking to provide its own type of nuclear reactors to North Korea , despite the fact that South Korea , the United States and Japan have already agreed to provide South Korean-type reactors through the international consortium tentatively called the Korea Energy Development Organization -LRB- KEDO -RRB- .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;14	According to reports , Moscow plans to send a government delegation to Pyongyang within this month to convince the North to accept the Russian-type nuclear reactors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;15	The Russians reportedly reasoned that Russian reactors are the best choice for the North because the nuclear facilities in North Korea had been constructed with the former Soviet Union 's technological aid .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;16	Undeniably , there are some points in Moscow 's assertion , and to resolve the problems , advice and some assistance from Russia may be necessary .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;17	However , the Russian interference in what type of reactor to provide is quite unreasonable and therefore unacceptable .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;18	In the first place , the reported Russian overture runs counter to the Geneva nuclear agreement between Washington and Pyongyang , which virtually calls for the South Korean-type reactor to be used with the acquiescence of North Korea .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;19	We worry in this context that the ongoing U.S.-North Korea talks on the reactor issue in Beijing would be hampered or complicated by Moscow 's inappropriate and untimely interference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;20	Unless Moscow is ready to take Seoul 's role in this regard , it is in no position to push for changes in the accord for its own interests .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;21	Rather , Russia should remember that it was Soviet nuclear technology and manpower that gave birth to Pyongyang 's nuclear weapons program in the first place .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;22	Cosmetic changes in Burma do not justify coddling SLORC -LRB- Nation , Bangkok -RRB- :
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;23	Are we denying reality by duping ourselves that things are getting better in Burma ?
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;24	Clearly , the two meetings between the military junta , which calls itself the State Law and Order Restoration Council -LRB- SLORC -RRB- , and prodemocracy leader Aung San Suu Kyi , currently in her sixth year of house arrest , have been nothing more than stage-managed events .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;25	Certainly , United Nations special rapporteur Yozo Yokota 's report to the Third Committee of the U.N. General Assembly was cause for alarm .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;26	It states that '' many restrictions on fundamental freedoms and various violations of human rights continue in Myanmar . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;27	As claimed , the SLORC has implemented a number of '' development '' projects in the border areas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;28	It has been argued that economic engagement can make repressive regimes less monstrous , as open markets create a burgeoning meddle class aware of their political rights and freedoms .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;29	This middle class , it is argued further , are in turn able to press for liberal reforms .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;30	In the case of Burma , however , the economy is held captive by key military establishments , with people being used as forced labor in the name of capitalism .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;31	If one interprets Yokota 's report , there is a strong indication that Burma is on the path to becoming a feudalistic state .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;32	The SLORC must take clear and specific steps to ease repression in Burma , and unless this can be verified by the United Nations , there is no business being conciliatory towards the junta .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;33	Diplomatic engagement with a repressive regime will only work if demands are forced down the throats of the tyrants ruling the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0535;34	The West would be practicing double standards if their tough talk is soon dissipated by cosmetic changes made by the SLORC .
APW_ENG_19941202.0536;0	Prince Charles switched on the Christmas lights in the small town near his estate Friday night , as hundreds of his rural neighbors followed him on a stroll around the shops .
APW_ENG_19941202.0536;1	The 45-year-old heir to the throne , wrapped against the December damp in a tweed overcoat , pulled the switch that lit up the center of Tetbury , in the Cotswold region , near his Highbury country estate , 85 miles -LRB- 135 km -RRB- west of London .
APW_ENG_19941202.0536;2	Staff in the Tetbury Catering Company -- selling takeout food -- had a surprise when the prince wandered into their premises unannounced .
APW_ENG_19941202.0536;3	`` He said he could n't resist the smell and just followed his nose into the shop , '' said co-owner Karen Pegler .
APW_ENG_19941202.0536;4	`` He said all the food looked really nice and we were quite a find . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;0	After a slow start , Haiti is moving swiftly to solidify its democratic institutions , appointing a new 11-member Supreme Court and formally placing the army-controlled police under civilian command .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;1	In another supportive step , 250 former Haitian boat people returned home Friday to become members of the internationally supervised interim police force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;2	`` Democracy has returned ; it 's natural for me to return and help my country progress , '' said Jean-Louis Valiere , 31 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;3	He spoke after stepping off a U.S. Coast Guard cutter from the U.S. Navy base in Guantanamo Bay , Cuba , where 1,000 Haitian refugees have been recruited and trained to serve as interim police .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;4	The separation of the police and military , stipulated in the 1987 Constitution , was approved by the Senate on Wednesday night but only announced on Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;5	It will become law when it appears in the official government gazette , Le Moniteur .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;6	`` The armed forces reform law is a historic break with our repressive political past , '' Sen. Jean-Robert Martinez told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;7	The appointment of new Supreme Court is another building block to establishing civil justice in a land that has been ruled by the gun for most of its history .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;8	The new chief justice , Clauzel Debrosse , had been an existing member of the Supreme Court but an opponent of the military overthrow in 1991 of elected President Jean-Bertrand Aristide , who returned to power in October after U.S. military intervention .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;9	`` We wanted to reward Debrosse for his opposition to de facto rule , '' said Martinez , an Aristide supporter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;10	Aristide , in conformity with the constitution , chose the judges from a Senate list of three for each seat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;11	The array of judicial moves reflects the desire by Aristide to strengthen civilian authority as rapidly as possible .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;12	Thousands of American and other foreign troops are guaranteeing the peace now , but U.S. Republican leaders are urging the Clinton administration to hasten the pullout of GIs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;13	The widely popular Aristide , wary of those who overthrew him three years ago , is quickly reassigning senior military officers to overseas posts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;14	U.S. Embassy spokesman Stanley Schrager confirmed Friday that former Haitian military chief Jean-Claude Duperval was being transferred to a diplomatic post in Brazil and Brig. Gen. Max Mayard was heading to a similar military attache position in Ecuador .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;15	The other two generals during the 1991-4 military rule , Lt. Gen. Raoul Cedras and Brig. Gen. Philippe Biamby , quit and fled to self-imposed exile in Panama two days before Aristide 's return .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;16	Aristide has pledged to slice the size of the army from 7,500 to 1,500 and to create a 4,000-member civilian police force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;17	The 250 Haitians joining the interim police force Friday were recruited and trained in the refugee tent camp at the U.S. base in Guantanamo Bay , Cuba .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;18	They were among tens of thousands of Haitians who fled their nation under military rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;19	Another 750 refugees-turned-police will arrive in Haiti in the next three weeks , Schrager , the U.S. spokesman , told the AP .
APW_ENG_19941202.0537;20	`` In coming weeks , they will be used in police support positions by both the Haitian government and the I.P.M. , '' said Paul Browne , spokesman for the 800-member 20-nation International Police Monitor corps that is supervising police work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;0	The U.S. government said Friday it will continue to impound some 36 million pounds -LRB- 16.2 million kilograms -RRB- of frozen Australian beef until tests confirm the meat is free of a pesticide not used in the United States .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;1	Australian tests have already shown the dlrs 65 million worth of beef free of chlorfluazuron , the U.S. Agriculture Department said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;2	But the department 's Food Safety and Inspection Service wants to confirm those results .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;3	Because the pesticide is n't used in the United States , U.S. laboratories do n't have an established way to test the meat , meaning a process will have to be devised .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;4	The meat has been held in warehouses since Nov. 18 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;5	The U.S. Agriculture department says the pesticide poses little human health threat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0539;6	Australian officials said the pesticide showed up in some meat after producers fed cattle with roughage from cotton crops that had been treated .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;0	Chiapas residents under the gun of a smoldering Indian rebellion want to believe President Ernesto Zedillo is serious about his inaugural pledge to resume peace talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;1	But people of the southern state , the heart of an uprising rooted in poverty and injustice , said they are skeptical that the daunting hardships can be solved as Zedillo promised .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;2	Zedillo , in an inaugural address Thursday , said his most important challenge would be to provide dignified living conditions for every Mexican .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;3	`` Economic progress only makes sense if it reaches every household , '' said Zedillo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;4	`` Many millions of Mexicans lack the bare essentials . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;5	Nowhere is that more apparent than in Chiapas , Mexico 's poorest state , where poverty among Mayan Indians bereft of jobs , housing and basic health care has led to a rebellion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;6	Half of the state 's homes have dirt floors and no running water .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;7	Ragamuffin children begging in tattered clothes and gaunt Indian women peddling trinkets are a common sight .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;8	`` We must see deeds , not words , '' said Emilio Morales Lievano , a 21-year-old shoeshine boy in the plaza of San Cristobal de Las Casas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;9	`` The problems stay the same , '' scoffed Jose Francisco Aranda Tinajera , a leader of farmworkers in the southern Chiapas city of Tapachula .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;10	Zedillo promised to seek renewed peace talks with the Zapatista rebels , whose shooting war with the army cost more than 145 lives in January .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;11	A tenuous cease-fire has held since Jan. 12 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;12	`` I am convinced that it is possible to achieve a new negotiation in Chiapas that will lead us to a just , honorable and definitive peace , '' Zedillo said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;13	But the rebels severed all contacts with the government in October and have threatened to resume fighting if demands for full democracy and help for poor Indians are not met .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;14	`` If the earlier president could n't achieve peace , it will be even harder for Zedillo , '' said Morales Lievano , referring to failed peace efforts by former president Carlos Salinas de Gortari .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;15	Now a potentially explosive election dispute in Chiapas is heading for a showdown next week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;16	Eduardo Robledo Rinco , candidate of Mexico 's ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party , is vowing to take office as Chiapas governor on Thursday , despite charges he won through fraud .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;17	Amado Avendano Figueroa , a journalist-lawyer of the leftist opposition Democratic Revolutionary Party , suggested Friday that could provoke the rebels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;18	`` We are committed to civil resistance , '' Avendano told supporters Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;19	`` If this civil resistance does n't work , and if the government tries to impose the imposter , no option remains . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;20	Supporters of Avendano launched a series of marches and highway blockades Friday and vowed to storm the government palace in the state capital of Tuxtla Gutierrez to block Robledo 's swearing-in .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;21	Rebellion , political disputes , land clashes and feuding by local bosses all overshadow the problem of poverty in a state where about a fourth of the 3.2 million residents speak an Indian language .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;22	`` We have seen promises made many times before , but what they promise they never fulfill , '' said Pedro Giron Gomez , a 38-year-old Tzeltal Indian .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;23	`` These are all pure lies of the government . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;24	Elia Medina Urbe , a Chiapas sociologist , said Zedillo must break a government pattern of neglect of the state .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;25	`` It 's as if the indigenous people did n't exist in the political realm , '' she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;26	But she called Zedillo 's words `` promising , even encouraging . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;27	Zedillo said the Mexican army would continue to abide by the government cease-fire that cut short a shooting war with the rebels .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;28	He said he would also strengthen the legislative and judiciary arms of government while waging his war on poverty and battling corruption .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;29	Laura Clemente , 23 , a schoolteacher in a community of rebel sympathizers near the town of Ocosingo , said the government would first have to change a decades-old style of heavy-handed rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0540;30	`` If the government changes and they give us the help we need , yes there can be peace , '' Clemente concluded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;0	U.S. Secretary of State Warren Christopher and NATO 's top civilian official denied Friday that the alliance had abandoned its enforcement of the U.N. `` no-fly '' zone over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;1	`` NATO is continuing to enforce the no-fly zone , '' Christopher said , amid continued confusion between the United Nations and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization over how to deal with the crisis in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;2	Earlier Friday , Wing Commander Timothy Hewlet , U.N. director for air operations in Bosnia , told reporters in Sarajevo that Bosnian Serbs had activated several surface-to-air missile sites throughout the country , threatening humanitarian flights and NATO jets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;3	Hewlet said NATO had agreed to a `` cooling off '' period to calm tensions , but was able to `` control '' the situation with AWACs radar planes flying outside Bosnian air space .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;4	`` There are no flights over Bosnia at the moment that I am aware of , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;5	At NATO headquarters , Secretary-General Willy Claes said he was unaware of any request from the United Nations to halt or scale-down allied patrols enforcing the military flight ban , designed to protect Bosnian civilians from bombardment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;6	`` We have never received any request , can I be any clearer than that ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;7	However , Yasushi Akashi , the chief U.N. envoy in former Yugoslavia , acknowledged talks on the issue were under way .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;8	`` I can not comment on internal discussions which we are conducting with NATO , '' Akashi told reporters after meeting with Bosnian Serb leaders in Pale , their stronghold east of Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;9	`` But I am glad that NATO is adopting an attitude that they are essentially at the service of UNPROFOR -LRB- the U.N. protection force -RRB- in the peacekeeping mission . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;10	NATO and the United Nations have repeatedly talked of the need to `` show presence '' in the skies over Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;11	But NATO sources in Brussels said allied planes had been fired on nine times in recent days by Serb missiles and fixed by targeting radar some 15 times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;12	Under current rules of engagement , NATO planes can strike back if targeted without seeking prior approval from the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;13	Akashi cautioned that NATO air action could threaten delicate negotiations to revive flagging peace efforts and lead to an escalation of fighting .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;14	`` One miscalculation , one misunderstanding and it might become beyond our control , '' he told reporters .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;15	Christopher told reporters that Serb anti-missile batteries posed a problem .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;16	But , he said , NATO was capable of dealing with them , `` and we continue to police the ` no-fly ' zone in the effective way we have in the past . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;17	In Washington however , a senior U.S. military officer , speaking on condition of anonymity , acknowledged that pilots and other NATO forces were taking steps to lessen the threat to aircraft .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;18	He would not elaborate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;19	On Tuesday , officials said the United Nations requested and NATO agreed that planes would not fly over Bosnia for a 48-hour period while U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali and other peace negotiators visited Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;20	Western military sources said it appeared that request was extended slightly , and it was not clear if NATO planes were back in Bosnian airspace .
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;21	Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic , speaking in Pale after his meeting with Akashi , said , `` We would like to see skies clear of ... NATO aircraft . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0541;22	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents , '' Karadzic added .
