APW_ENG_19941202.0543;0	Part of an express train headed west for Budapest derailed Friday , its cars sliding into a station building and burying passengers , rail workers and their family members underneath the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;1	Police said at least 24 people died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;2	The accident occurred at Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 40 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;3	The second car of the express train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and some of the overturned carriages smashed into the station building , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;4	`` There was a tremedous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;5	People remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night , although the crash occured at 4:45 p.m. local time .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;6	Battered and broken railway cars were covered in brick torn loose from the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;7	Rescue crews frantically dragged bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;8	One car , partially twisted beyond recognition , remained skewering the collapsed building as a huge crane was positioned shortly before midnight to pluck it from the crumbling brick and mortar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;9	About 100 soldiers and 100 police officers worked into the night looking for survivors and keeping away the curious , as the ministers of defense , interior and transport converged on the accident site .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;10	Rescue workers said part of the the destroyed building was sleeping quarters for railway personnel and their families , including small children who were likely victims and that they continued to hear voices from within the wreck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;11	Defense Minister Gyoergy Keleti said dogs normally used to locate victims of mining disasters had found three children who were dug from the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;12	Laszlo Garamvoelgyi , a National Police spokesman , said the death toll had risen to 24 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;13	With temperatures below freezing and others left in the wreckage , the death toll was expected to rise - Garamvoelgyi said the latest count `` was not the final one by any means . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;14	The severity of the accident eclipsed the previous most serious train tragedy of recent years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;15	Te car that skewered the building jumped four tracks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;16	Transport Minister Mihaly Lotz said human error seemed to have caused the accident but investigations continued .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;17	Local Police Chief Gyoergy Lengyel said the train was traveling at about 110 kilometers -LRB- 66 miles -RRB- and hour , normal speed past a station that was not a stop .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;18	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok said 26 injured , including two critical cases , were admitted to their hospital alone , with three others also taking in injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;19	`` We are witnesses to a terrible tragedy , '' said Interior Minister Gabor Kuncze .
APW_ENG_19941202.0543;20	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;0	An express train derailed southeast of Budapest Friday sending cars smashing into a railroad station building and burying passengers , railroad workers and their family under rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;1	At least 24 people were killed , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;2	The accident occurred at 4:45 p.m. in Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 43 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;3	The second car of the train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages crashed into a station building used as sleeping quarters by railway personnel and their families , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;4	`` There was a tremendous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;5	He said in a telephone interview that some people remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;6	`` We are witnesses to a terrible tragedy , '' said Interior Minister Laszlo Kuncze , who was among the senior officials at the scene late Friday evening .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;7	Battered and broken railway cars were covered by bricks torn loose from the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;8	Rescue crews frantically dragged bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;9	One car , partially twisted beyond recognition , remained skewering the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;10	A huge crane was positioned shortly before midnight to pluck it from the crumbling brick and mortar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;11	About 200 soldiers and 100 police officers worked into the night looking for survivors and keeping away onlookers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;12	Rescue workers said they continued to hear voices from within the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;13	National police spokesman Laszlo Garamvoelgyi said the death toll had risen to 24 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;14	With temperatures below freezing and others still trapped in the wreckage , the death toll was expected to rise , Garamvoelgyi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;15	There were fears that the victims could include the children of the railway workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;16	Transport ministry officials said the accident occurred at a rail switch and suggested it was possibly caused by the switch not being completely thrown .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;17	The car that skewered the building jumped four tracks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;18	Local police Chief Gyoergy Lengyel said the train was traveling at about 110 kilometers -LRB- 66 miles -RRB- an hour , the normal speed for passing a station that was not a stop .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;19	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok said 26 injured people , including two critical cases , had been admitted to their hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;20	Several other hospitals were also taking in the injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0544;21	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest , to the capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;0	Author Robin Moore says he was surprised at how he easily obtained information in the former Soviet Union for his book about the Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;1	Moore , 69 , the author of the `` French Connection '' and `` The Green Berets , '' spoke Thursday at the Litchfield-Morris Rotary about his latest novel , `` The Moscow Connection , '' which grew out of a 1991 visit to Moscow .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;2	`` I was fascinated to find a new era of free speech , '' Moore told the group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;3	`` It seemed everything could be bought and sold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;4	You could even buy the KGB -- I did . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;5	The latest book is a thinly disguised work of fiction chronicling the rise of the Russian mafia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;6	Moore hopes his book will expose the burgeoning Russian mafia and what he says is its vigorous trade in the nuclear weaponry of the former Soviet Union .
APW_ENG_19941202.0545;7	The Register Citizen newspaper in Torrington is serializing the novel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;0	An express train derailed southeast of Budapest Friday sending cars smashing into a railroad station building and burying passengers , railroad workers and their family under rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;1	At least 24 people were killed , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;2	The accident occurred at 4:45 p.m. in Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 43 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;3	The second car of the train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages crashed into a station building used as sleeping quarters by railway personnel and their families , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;4	`` There was a tremendous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;5	He said in a telephone interview that some people remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;6	`` We are witnesses to a terrible tragedy , '' said Interior Minister Laszlo Kuncze , who was among the senior officials at the scene late Friday evening .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;7	Battered and broken railway cars were covered by bricks torn loose from the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;8	Rescue crews frantically dragged bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;9	One car , partially twisted beyond recognition , remained skewering the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;10	A huge crane was positioned shortly before midnight to pluck it from the crumbling brick and mortar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;11	About 200 soldiers and 100 police officers worked into the night looking for survivors and keeping away onlookers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;12	Rescue workers said they continued to hear voices from within the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;13	National police spokesman Laszlo Garamvoelgyi said the death toll had risen to 24 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0546;14	With temperatures below freezing and others still trapped in the wreckage , the death toll was expected to rise , Garamvoelgyi said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0547;0	Bosnian Serbs promised Friday to release hundreds of peacekeepers and allow aid deliveries as the chief U.N. envoy tried to salvage what was left of the ailing U.N. mission in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;1	Earlier , two anti-tank missiles slammed into the presidency building just minutes before U.N. envoy Yasushi Akashi arrived for talks with the Muslim-led Bosnian government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;2	U.N. officials said the missiles appeared to come from Serb positions , but the Serbs said the government attacked itself to cause trouble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;3	It was yet another sign of Serb contempt for the peacekeeping effort , which has virtually ground to a halt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;4	The Serb rebels have stopped U.N. aid convoys , attacked a U.N.-declared `` safe area , '' and taken peacekeepers hostage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;5	In Brussels , Belgium , Secretary of State Warren Christopher and European foreign ministers endorsed a U.S. plan for a cease-fire that would lead to peace talks in the 2 -LCB- - year-old war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;6	The plan would also grant the Serbs their main aim in the conflict : the right to ties with Serb-led Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;7	The Serbs on Friday released 70 peacekeepers who had been held a week , but more than 300 peacekeepers remained hostage as insurance against NATO airstrikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;8	Akashi , who met with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic at Serb headquarters in Pale , east of Sarajevo , said he was assured that Ukrainian peacekeepers held in northern Bosnia would be released , Dutch and British supply convoys detained since Saturday would be freed , and Bangladeshi peacekeepers stranded in Bihac would be allowed to receive supplies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;9	Karadzic said the Serbs and the U.N. `` are moving fast to normalization of our relations , '' but he issued a veiled warning against NATO .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;10	`` We would like to see skies clear of our aircraft and of NATO aircraft , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;11	`` If NATO is flying around there is more risk of misunderstandings and incidents . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;12	Under current rules of engagement , the U.N. must request the NATO airstrikes , although NATO planes can defend themselves against attack without U.N. approval .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;13	U.N. officials fear that could escalate tensions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;14	Akashi had met earlier with Bosnian government and military leaders in Sarevejo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;15	Two wire-guided missiles hit the presidency building minutes before he arrived for the talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;16	One destroyed the office of Miro Lazovic , an ethnic Serb member of Bosnia 's collective presidency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;17	Three missiles hit nearby buildings while the meeting went on .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;18	There were no injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;19	The Bosnian government blasted the United Nations for not using force to halt fighting at Bihac , the embattled government-held enclave in the northwest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;20	Serb forces have seized 30 percent to 40 percent of the `` safe area , '' and fighting continued there Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;21	U.S. Ambassador to Germany Charles Redman held talks in Sarajevo with Bosnian President Alija Izetbegovic and Prime Minister Haris Silajdzic on the U.S. peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;22	Redman helped draft an earlier plan that the Serbs rejected .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;23	The war began when Serbs rebelled against a vote for independence from Yugoslavia by Bosnia-Herzegovina 's Muslims and Croats .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;24	More than 200,000 people are dead or missing in the war , and the Serbs have seized 70 percent of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;25	Following the secession since 1991 of Slovenia , Croatia , Bosnia and Macedonia , Yugoslavia now comprises Serbia and Montenegro .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;26	Serb nationalists in Yugoslavia , Croatia and Bosnia have pressed for a unified `` Greater Serbia . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;27	The rejected peace plan denied Serbs the right to links with Yugoslavia as punishment for starting the war , but allowed Bosnia 's Croats and Muslims the right to ties with Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;28	The old plan also granted the Serbs 49 percent of Bosnia -- a condition the new plan also contains .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;29	Akashi had more success than U.N. Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali , who was rebuffed Wednesday when he tried to meet with Bosnian Serb leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;30	Boutros-Ghali said afterwards that intransigence by the warring sides might force the U.N. mission to withdraw .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;31	Seventy Dutch peacekeepers arrived in Zagreb , Croatia , after being released from a seven-day detention by the Serbs in eastern Bosnia , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;32	But Serbs continued to hold about 20 other Dutch peacekeepers , plus hundreds of British , Ukrainians and Canadians , at various points throughout Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;33	U.N. spokesman Thant Myint-U said Akashi also wanted to discuss the fighting around Bihac with Karadzic .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;34	The United Nations is trying to broker a cease-fire there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;35	Machine-gun and small arms fire was reported on the outskirts of Bihac , U.N. officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;36	The heaviest fighting appeared concentrated around Velika Kladusa , north of Bihac , where Serbs were apparently closing in on the government army 's 5th Corps .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;37	The Bosnian Serbs , backed by Serbs from neighboring Croatia , want to wipe out the 5th Corps , which launched a briefly successful offensive from the Bihac enclave in late October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;38	There were also signs that fronts south of Bihac were heating up .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;39	Bosnian Croats , allied with Muslim-led government forces , claimed they captured three villages north of the town of Kupres in central Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;40	Croat militia and Bosnian army soldiers took Kupres from the Serbs last month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;41	Gen. Ante Roso , the Bosnian Croat military commander , charged that Serbs in neighboring Croatia had shelled his forces across the border , near the town of Livno .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;42	He said his troops returned fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;43	Karadzic claimed regular Croatian army troops were fighting alongside the Bosnian Croats and warned Akashi to get them out or `` we will be forced to declare we are in war with Croatia . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;44	In Knin , Croatia , the Croatian government and leaders of the rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement that , if implemented , could lead to normalized relations between the two enemies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0547;45	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity supplies and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , and the Yugoslav capital of Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;0	Hundreds of angry people descended on a neighborhood gunmen when multinational soldiers freed him Friday , prompting the foreign soldiers to return to save him two hours later .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;1	Samuel Chery , who had terrorized a neighborhood in this Port-au-Prince suburb during military coup rule from 1991 to October , had been held for nearly two months after U.S. soldiers arrested him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;2	Chery , known as `` Ti Samuel , '' was an `` attache , '' one of thousands of thugs who had Haitian military support to beat or kill supporters of democracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;3	He was freed by foreign troops at 2 p.m. , prompting uncomprehending screams by neighbors , many of whom feared their lives if the attaches returned to the streets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;4	Hundreds of people gathered , grabbing sticks or carrying machetes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;5	They surrounded Chery 's home .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;6	He had thrown rocks out at them and locked his door .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;7	Another Humvee carrying foreign soldiers arrived two hours later and took away Chery .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;8	Telephones were not functioning at the U.S. military 's Joint Information Bureau late Friday , and it was not clear why Chery was freed or where he was being held .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;9	Former U.S. Attorney General Ramsay Clark accused the United States Friday of protecting members of the right-wing terror group FRAPH even after intervening to return exiled President Jean-Bertrand Aristide .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;10	The Front for the Advancement and Progress of Haiti says its converting into a political organization , and a leader , Emmanuel Constant , renounced violence at a U.S.-arranged news conference two months ago .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;11	`` The same forces that planned the coup '' are maintaining the level of violence , Clark told reporters after a five-day fact-finding mission of his Haiti Commission human rights group .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;12	`` The longer the criminals go unpunished , the more likely it is that the people will take justice into their own hands , '' said lawyer Michael Ratner , another commission member and director of the New York-based Center for Constititonal Rights .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;13	The U.N. civilian mission in a Nov. 22 communique said `` a certain degree of violence prevailed until the end of October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;14	Since then , without having entirely disappeared , violent incidents are much rarer . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0548;15	The mission reported , however , that many people believe `` that the disarmament and dismantlement of groups which were part of the former repressive apparatus have been insufficient . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;0	The United States and four other governments on Friday tried to restart the drive for peace in Bosnia with a plea for support of a plan designed to lure advancing Serbs with a prospect of political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;1	Secretary of State Warren Christopher said the group rejected the options of `` carpet bombing '' or surrender , agreeing to resubmit a plan whose basic terms the Serbs rejected in the past .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;2	`` The road will be very difficult , '' Christopher said , referring to the new attempt to draw the Serbs into peace talks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;3	The hint of a step toward a Greater Serbia was contained in a one-page text of the agreement distributed after Christopher met with the foreign ministers of Britain , France , Germany and Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;4	It said the idea was to `` allow equitable and balanced arrangements for the Bosniac-Croat and Bosnian Serb entities . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;5	This proclaims that since the Muslim-led Bosnian government and Bosnian Croats have formed a federation linked to Croatia , the Bosnian Serbs have the same right to seek cross-border political ties to Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;6	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe , who led a successful European campaign to move the Clinton administration from its support for NATO bombing raids on Serb positions , called this assurance a matter of giving all parties `` an equal opportunity . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;7	He and the other ministers stressed , however , that the Serbs must recognize the legitimacy of Bosnia-Herzegovina .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;8	The ministers emphasized they had reached unity after lengthy wrangling on how to deal with the war over the last 31 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;9	German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel , who chaired the meeting of the five-nation `` contact group , '' said the fighting in the Bihac region of northwest Bosnia had reached an awful state .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;10	He said the war can not be solved with external military force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;11	Juppe and British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd will go to Belgrade on Sunday in pursuit of a diplomatic solution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;12	Both stressed that while they would carry the joint decision with them , they would be meeting with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic as representatives of their governments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;13	Michael McCurry , the State Department spokesman , said U.S. envoy Charles E. Redman went to Sarajevo on Thursday for meetings with Bosnian Muslim leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;14	He also told reporters the proposal Christopher had prepared for an international peace conference was being held `` in abeyance '' until the various consultations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;15	The meeting of the U.S.-allied contact group came as the Bosnian Serbs tightened their grip on the mostly Muslim Bihac enclave and as the conflict threatened to spread into Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;16	Christopher wants Milosevic to threaten to seal Serbia 's border to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;17	Despite a promise to halt weapons deliveries , Clinton administration officials said , arms were still getting through to fuel the Bosnian Serbs ' drive to gain more territory and to terrorize Muslim civilians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;18	The war has taken an estimated 200,000 lives and left many times that number homeless .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;19	Some 500 U.N. peacekeepers have been detained by the Bosnian Serbs , contributing to the decision by the U.N. commander , Sir Michael Rose , not to conduct heavy bombing raids against the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;20	Meanwhile , a senior U.S. military officer , briefing reporters at the Pentagon , reported that NATO has begun planning to prepare for its role in the possible evacuation of U.N. peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;21	`` We are doing planning at the NATO level for a withdrawal -- when and if that ever comes about , '' said the officer , who spoke on condition his name not be used .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;22	The officer emphasized that no request to help in such a move had come from the United Nations , but that it was `` prudent '' to prepare for such a move , even though a U.N. withdrawal did not appear imminent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;23	Christopher 's plan , which was adopted by President Clinton 's senior foreign policy advisers Monday at a White House meeting , calls for a cease-fire in the Bihac area , a cessation of hostilities for three to six months throughout Bosnia and a peace conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;24	There , the Bosnian Serbs would be able to promote their aspirations for a Greater Serbia , initially with political links to Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;25	They hope also to establish cross-border ties to ethnic Serbs in Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;26	Elements of the plan are similar to one rejected repeatedly by the Bosnian Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;27	It called for them to accept Bosnia as a legitimate country and to shrink the territory under their control to 49 percent from about 70 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;28	A federation of Muslims and Croats would be in charge of 51 percent of the war-torn country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0549;29	Even that division is negotiable once peace talks are resumed , U.S. officials said , hoping to induce the Serbs to halt their attacks and to negotiate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;0	Zachariah Toungate has spent a third of his life fighting for the right to wear a ponytail to school .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;1	About the only thing that 's changed in those four years is the length of his hair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;2	State District Judge Norman Lanford ruled this week that the Bastrop school district 's above-the-bottom-of-the-collar hair rule for boys violates the Texas Constitution 's Equal Rights Amendment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;3	But he said the courts have given administrators broad authority in running schools , and refused to revoke the rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;4	Though Zach wo n't be returning to school -- and may appeal -- the 12-year-old said he feels good about the ruling .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;5	`` The judge said it was unconstitutional , and he said that he thought that was wrong , '' said the boy , whose ponytail is now about 15 inches -LRB- 38 centimeters -RRB- long .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;6	Ray Long , president of the School Board , said there is no sentiment on the board to change the rule .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;7	`` I think that hair , dress and grooming standards are good , '' Long said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;8	The fight started in 1990 when Zach refused to cut his hair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;9	He was separated from other third-graders and taught alone .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;10	He was prohibited from participating in extracurricular activities .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;11	In 1991 , Zach 's parents withdrew him from school and taught him at home .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;12	They sued to abolish the rule so he could return to class .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;13	The case finally went to trial in October in Bastrop , a town of 4,000 people about 35 miles -LRB- 56 kilometers -RRB- east of Austin .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;14	The jury ruled in the school district 's favor , but the judge indicated jurors may have been confused , and he issued his own ruling .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;15	School officials had argued that if the hair-length rule were repealed , it would lead to gangs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;16	But Lanford , in his ruling Tuesday , said that argument was `` solely designed to frighten the jury . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;17	He said the district had failed to prove that students ' schooling would be disrupted .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;18	Zach continues to receive schooling at home , studying reading , math and history through correspondence courses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;19	The seventh-grader said it 's difficult to make new friends since he does n't go to school .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;20	Zach 's mother , September , and father , Stanley , are backing their son .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;21	`` It has been worth it .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;22	Discrimination is wrong , '' said his mother , a 33-year-old nurse at an adolescent psychological center .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;23	The boy 's father , a 44-year-old auto mechanic and electrician , had long hair when Zach decided to grow his long , too , said the boy 's lawyer , Charles Beall .
APW_ENG_19941202.0550;24	Later , the elder Toungate cut his hair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;0	Skirting differences over tax cuts , welfare and health insurance , President Clinton and leaders of the incoming Republican Congress agreed at a White House summit Friday to work together on a batch of less-divisive issues .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;1	Emerging from their first talks with Clinton since November elections gave the Republicans control of Congress , incoming Senate Majority Leader Bob Dole said , `` certainly it 's in our interest , where possible , to be together . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;2	Rep. Newt Gingrich , the incoming House of Representatives speaker , said , `` We agreed as a principle that there would be areas in which we would disagree but I do n't think we actually spent much time on them . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;3	The Republicans said the meeting was positive ; Gingrich called it `` superb . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;4	But it was clear they avoided areas of likely disagreement such as taxes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;5	`` We did n't cover everything , we did n't get down to the T 's , '' Dole said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;6	Hours before the meeting , Clinton served notice in a speech that he would fight tax cuts that inflate the budget deficit and any attempt to repeal the new ban on assault weapons .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;7	Gingrich said Clinton agreed to work with Republicans on easing costly requirements imposed on the states by Washington and enacting a line-item veto allowing the president to delete some projects from legislation without killing it altogether .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;8	Dole said he suggested that Clinton consult with Republicans more on foreign policy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;9	As for further talks with Clinton , Dole said , `` I assume anytime we want to meet , the president 's going to be accessible . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;10	`` I hope and believe we can cooperate with the new Congress , '' Clinton said earlier .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;11	`` But cooperation for me can not mean abandoning principle , abandoning the hard work we have already accomplished together in our fight to restore the economy , our fight against crime . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;12	Addressing a national meeting of mayors and city officiais , he drew the line against relaxing gun controls enacted by the just-ended Congress over opposition from the National Rifle Association .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;13	`` The assault weapons ban that you helped to win stands between the citizens you and I must protect and the gangs and thugs that would terrorize them , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;14	`` I will do all in my power to keep the next Congress from doing anything that will jeopardize the safety of our people . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;15	Separately , Clinton also met in the Cabinet Room with newly named Congressional leaders of his Democratic Party , now in the minority .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;16	Afterwards , Sen. Tom Daschle , the new Democratic leader , said Democrats will work with the White House but that , `` Clearly , we have our own agenda as well . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;17	`` It 's no secret that the landscape in Washington shifted dramatically last month , '' Clinton said ruefully , referring to the November elections that gave Republicans control of both houses of Congress for the first time in 40 years and a majority of U.S. state governorships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;18	Clinton 's administration fears the rival parties might try to outdo each other on tax cuts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;19	He said he would fight any proposal that would `` explode the deficit ... my standard will be : Will it help increase incomes for the middle class , will it promote jobs and growth and can we pay for it ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;20	In his speech broadcast from Washington to the National League of Cities conference in Minneapolis , Clinton said , `` We need to give hard working middle-class people a dividend from the end of the Cold War and the dramatic downsizing of the federal government . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;21	The Republican campaign 's Contract with America called for an array of tax credits .
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;22	Clinton urged city officials who have been complaining about inadequate funds for essential services `` to make sure that the Congress understands what the consequences are of all these budgetary decisions . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0551;23	In the afterglow of bipartisan support for the new world trade agreement , Clinton said he hoped to work with Republicans on welfare and health-care reform , cost-controls on medical care and easing the financial demands imposed on cities and states by Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;0	An express train derailed southeast of Budapest Friday sending cars smashing into a railroad station building and burying passengers , railroad workers and their family under the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;1	At least 24 people were killed , police said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;2	The accident occurred at 4:45 p.m. in Szajol , a station near Szolnok about 70 kilometers -LRB- 43 miles -RRB- southeast of the Hungarian capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;3	The second car of the train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages crashed into a station building used as sleeping quarters by railway personnel and their families , railway officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;4	`` There was a tremendous explosion , like the end of the world , '' said a railway employee who witnessed the accident and asked not to be identified .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;5	He said in a telephone interview that some people remained buried in the wreckage into Friday night .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;6	`` We are witnesses to a terrible tragedy , '' said Interior Minister Laszlo Kuncze , who joined other senior officials at the scene late Friday evening .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;7	Battered and broken railway cars were covered by bricks torn loose from the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;8	Rescue crews frantically dragged bloody bodies from the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;9	One car , partially twisted beyond recognition , remained skewering the building .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;10	A huge crane was positioned shortly before midnight to pluck it from the crumbling brick and mortar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;11	About 100 soldiers and 100 police officers worked into the night looking for survivors and keeping away onlookers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;12	Rescue workers said they continued to hear voices from within the wreckage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;13	Defense Minister Gyoergy Keleti said dogs normally used to locate victims of mining disasters had found three children who were dug out from the rubble .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;14	National police spokesman Laszlo Garamvoelgyi said the death toll had risen to 24 by late Friday with 60 others injured , some seriously .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;15	With temperatures below freezing and others still trapped in the wreckage , the death toll was expected to rise , Garamvoelgyi said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;16	There were fears the victims could include the children of the railway workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;17	Transport ministry officials said the accident occurred at a rail switch and suggested it was possibly caused by the switch not being completely thrown .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;18	The car that skewered the building jumped four tracks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;19	Transport Minister Mihaly Lotz said human error appeared to have caused the accident but the investigation continued .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;20	Local police Chief Gyoergy Lengyel said the train was traveling at about 110 kilometers -LRB- 66 miles -RRB- an hour , the normal speed for passing a station that was not a stop .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;21	Doctors at one hospital near Szolnok said 26 injured people , including two critical cases , had been admitted to their hospital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;22	Several other hospitals were also taking in the injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0553;23	The train was en route from Nyiregyhaza , about 160 kilometers -LRB- 100 miles -RRB- east of Budapest , to the capital .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;0	The chief drug enforcement official of the U.S. government Friday congratulated Thailand for arresting 10 people believed to be top lieutenants of one of the world 's biggest heroin traffickers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;1	The arrests came after two years of internatioanl cooperation and a months-long pursuit of the 10 suspects , said DEA Administrator Thomas A. Constantine .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;2	Police of Thailand 's Narcotics Suppression Bureau carried out the arrests this past week in Bangkok and northern Thailand .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;3	Those arrested are said to be close aides of the notorious drug warlord Khun Sa , who is based in the Burmese jungle in the `` Golden Triangle '' region where the borders of Thailand , Burma and Laos meet .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;4	`` That 's like going into Sicily and grabbing the 10 biggest Mafia figures
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;5	and taking them away , '' said Constantine , who is on a tour of the region .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;6	Most of the heroin that comes to the United States originates in the Golden Triangle , and U.S. authorities say Khun Sa is the trade 's kingpin there .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;7	He has an estimated 10,000 men in his Shan United Army , whose main purpose Khun Sa claims is to press Burma 's central government for autonomy for the Shan ethnic minority .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;8	Speaking at a news conference , Constantine described heroin trafficking and addiction as a growing social problem for the United States and much of the world .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;9	He said that heroin sold in major cities in the United States is now 100 times as pure as it was in the early 1970s -- jumping from 7 percent to 70 percent -- while its price has been cut by half .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;10	Violent crime , as well as the spread of AIDS through the sharing of needles by addicts , are only two of its consequences , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;11	`` The individual primarily responsible for this worldwide devastation of drug addiction is Khun Sa and his Shan United Army , '' said Constantine .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;12	`` He has delivered as much evil to this world as any Mafia don has ever done in our history . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;13	Constantine revealed details behind the recent arrests , which were carried out by police of Thailand 's Narcotics Suppression Bureau , with little fanfare .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;14	He said that for the past two years a combined group of Thai police and military , narcotics units , and border police , along with American DEA , State Department , immigration and customs officials have targeted Khun Sa as `` the kingpin Mafia druglord most important in the entire globe . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;15	As a result of their investigations , a U.S. federal court in New York City had issued indictments against major figures in Khun Sa 's drug trafficking ring , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;16	The same task force that conducted the investigations has been tracking `` for months '' the people arrested this week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;17	`` When these druglords are brought to the justice that I think they so richly deserve , and the appropriate punishment is given to them for the evil they have produced , then the whole world can properly thank Thailand and these dedicated public servants for their contributions to making this a better world , '' Constantine said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;18	Constantine came to Thailand from Hong Kong , and will next visit Malaysia and Singapore .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;19	The purpose of his tour , a DEA spokeswoman said , is `` to see firsthand the extent of heroin production and trafficking and to ask the governments with which we deal about how we can help cooperate for greater progress in this area . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;20	Constantine said he hopes some way could be found to more effectively tackle drug production in Burma , where the United States maintains a minimal drug enforcement presence because of concerns over human rights abuses by that country 's ruling military junta .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;21	`` My position is that this is a country which produces between 60 and 70 percent of the world 's heroin ; they are inflicting , that group of people on the border area , ... great damage on the world .
APW_ENG_19941202.0554;22	And I think we have to find some resolution to the problem so we can address it . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0555;3	The second car of the train derailed , dragging three other cars with it , and the overturned carriages crashed into a station building used as sleeping quarters by railway personnel and their families , railway officials said .

APW_ENG_19941202.0556;0	A U.S. lawyer who is in Guatemala searching for her guerrilla husband was banned Friday from leaving the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;1	Jennifer Harbury had said she intended to file charges against the government in the disappearance of her husband , Efrain Bamaca .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;2	She was barred from leaving under a complex law that requires a person to file charges against the state after saying that they intend to do so .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;3	`` Any person who has stated their intention to press charges against the state ... can in turn be legally forced by the state to pursue the accusation , '' said her lawyer , Antonio Argueta .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;4	`` In Jennifer 's case we do not see it as a purely legal measure but as a ... way to debilitate the search for her husband , '' Argueta added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;5	Harbury , based in Washington , D.C. , contends the government illegally detained and tortured Bamaca , who has not been seen since 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;6	`` I was always going to press charges against those military officials ... who saw my husband being tortured inside a military base but now the Guatemalan government is forcing me to do it sooner , '' Harbury told The Associated Press .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;7	Guatemala gives a person 15 days to file charges after announcing an intent to do so .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;8	Harbury returned to Guatemala to cooperate with investigations by the Supreme Court of Justice and a government human rights office into her husband 's whereabouts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;9	Both the military and the government deny Bamaca was ever captured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;10	President Ramiro de Leon Carpio repeatedly claims Bamaca died in combat and says clandestine jails do not exist in Guatemala .
APW_ENG_19941202.0556;11	However , evidence made public by the U.S. State Department in November indicates that Bamaca was captured alive by the Guatemalan army with slight injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;0	The U.S. Postal Service on Friday defended its stamp recalling the atomic bombing of Japan saying that it could not omit such a major event from its World War II history series .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;1	The stamp , showing a mushroom-shaped cloud rising from an atomic blast , is one of a set of 10 stamps marking major events of 1945 to be sold on a sheet titled `` 1945 : Victory at Last . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;2	Forty stamps have already been issued in similar sets for the 50th anniversary of the 1941-44 war years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;3	But the atomic bomb stamp is drawing sharp criticism in Japan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;4	Sunao Tsuboi , acting director of the 30,000-member Hiroshima Prefectural Confederation of A-bomb Survivors Organizations , termed it `` outrageous . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;5	Japan surrendered Aug. 15 , 1945 , days after atomic bombs were dropped on the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;6	`` Atomic bombs hasten war 's end , August 1945 , '' says the caption on the mushroom cloud stamp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;7	Postal Service spokesman Robin Wright said the World War II series was developed in cooperation with the State and Defense departments to assure historical accuracy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;8	As far as the atomic bomb stamp , he said , `` we would be remiss in omitting such a watershed and historically critical event as the use of the atomic bomb . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;9	`` Our purpose is to provide a comprehensive history of events of World War II , and we are not making a value judgment on any of those events , '' Wright added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;10	Asked for comment on the issue , the State Department said in a statement late Friday it has been in contact with the Postal Service , and understands that `` the stamps are not intended for the general public but rather for philatelists . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;11	`` We understand the matter is still under consideration , '' the statement added .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;12	It did not reply to a question whether there had been discussions with the Japanese government explaining the matter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;13	Other stamps in the 1945 set picture U.S. Marines raising the American flag on Iwo Jima , `` Okinawa , the last big battle , '' liberations of Manila and of Holocaust survivors in Europe , Germany 's surrender at Reims , refugees uprooted by war and U.S. celebrations of Japanese surrender .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;14	The 1941 set , titled `` A World at War '' included stamps showing Japanese bombing Pearl Harbor , Hawaii , and President Roosevelt and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill framing the Atlantic Charter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0557;15	The 1944 set , titled `` Road to Victory '' included the allied Normandy landings , the liberation of Rome and the battles of Leyte Gulf in the Pacific and the Bulge in Belgium .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;0	The United States has offered shelter in its refugee camps to up to 900 of the Cubans who have fled to this tiny British territory , Cayman officials said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;1	If the Cubans accept the offer , they would go to camps at the U.S. Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay , Cuba , and in Panama , Gerry Maguire , the territory 's chief immigration officer , told the refugees in a meeting at their tented camp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;2	The U.S. camps already hold thousands of refugees .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;3	The Cayman refugees probably would n't be transferred until early next year , government spokeswoman Pat Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;4	`` It will be a significant weight off our shoulders , '' Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;5	The announcement came after months of talks with U.S. officials and the day after more than 300 Cuban women and children marched peacefully through George Town calling on the United States to let them in .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;6	Also Friday , the United States announced new immigration rules that will allow more Cuban families now sheltered in refugee camps to enter .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;7	Hundreds of Cubans fled here after riots in Havana in early August prompted Cuban President Fidel Castro to say he would not prevent people from leaving .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;8	The approximately 1,150 Cubans now sheltered here represent about 4 percent of the 30,000 residents of this tourist resort and offshore banking center just 70 miles -LRB- 110 kilometers -RRB- south of Cuba .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;9	But the Caymans ' Cuban problem is far from resolved , Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;10	Many Cubans have said they do n't want to go to Guantanamo because it 's too close to the home they want to escape and because a larger camp does n't appeal to them , Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;11	Even if all 900 accept , that still leaves 250 refugees .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;12	The Cayman government has decided to grant asylum to a small , as-yet-undetermined number of Cubans who fled political persecution , Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;13	Twenty-four refugees have asked to return to their homeland and will be flown back , probably within two weeks , Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;14	As a last resort , the Cayman government could repatriate those who remain , she said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;15	`` We 're really not heaving a sigh of relief .
APW_ENG_19941202.0560;16	Not for ourselves and not for the Cubans , '' Ebanks said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;0	President Clinton on Friday ordered that no U.S. government funds be spent on human embryo research , rejecting a recommendation made just hours earlier by a federal advisory committee .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;1	`` I do not believe that federal funds should be used to support the creation of human embryos for research purposes , '' Clinton said , continuing the ban imposed by Presidents Reagan and Bush before him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;2	`` I have directed that the National Institutes of Health not allocate any resources for such research , '' Clinton said in a statement issued by the White House .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;3	He said research on fertilized human eggs `` raises profound ethical and moral questions as well as issues concerning the appropriate allocation of federal funds . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;4	The report of the NIH 's human embryo committee said the research had the potential of finding new ways to correct infertility , prevent or correct birth defects , and learn fundamental cell biology that might help combat cancer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;5	After studying the issue for nine months , the committee delivered its recommendations this week to another panel that advises NIH Director Harold Varmus .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;6	That panel endorsed the recommendations , leaving the final decision up to Varmus on if , when and how the NIH would proceed with research grants -- until Clinton took it out of Varmus ' hands later in the day .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;7	Clinton praised the work of the committees and said he understood how the research could make advances in in vitro fertilization , the so-called test tube baby technique .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;8	He also said he planned to establish a bioethics advisory commission to further deliberate such issues .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;9	The advisory committee acknowledged that many people had ethical and moral reservations about its recommendation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;10	Under the recommendation , embryo research would have been subject to strict controls , including limiting it to the first 14 days after fertilization .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;11	At that point , a fertilized human egg has grown to hundreds of cells but has not yet developed a nervous system , specific tissues or a human form .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;12	The White House announcement came as opponents of human embryo research , mostly groups that also oppose abortion , were gathering forces for a showdown in Congress .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;13	A coalition of the opponents planned a news conference on Monday and one congressman already had pledged to support their efforts with legislation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;14	`` Regardless of any potential medical advancements , human dignity must not be degraded by having life created in a laboratory dish just to have it thrown out with the trash when scientists are finished with their Frankenstein-type experiments , '' said Rep. Robert Dornan , R-Calif. , who promised to carry the fight to Congress .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;15	Richard Doerfinger of the U.S. Catholic Conference said his organization would support efforts to block any federal funding for the embryo research .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;16	Guidelines for embryo research were first recommended by an NIH committee in 1979 , but Presidents Reagan and Bush opposed it and the process withered .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;17	Varmus , who was appointed by President Clinton , revived the effort by naming the embryo research committee earlier this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;18	Despite the lack of federal funds , clinics and universities that provide in vitro fertilization services -- the so-called test-tube-baby technique of assisting reproduction for infertile couples -- have privately financed extensive research for more than a decade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;19	Dr. Steven Muller , president emeritus of Johns Hopkins University and chairman of the embryo advisory panel that studied the issue for months , said members of that committee received more than 50,000 pieces of mail , most of it protesting government support for the research .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;20	`` The public has no idea what human embryo research means , but to most people it does seem terrible , '' Muller said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0563;21	`` The extreme high level of public ignorance invites exploitation '' by opponents to the research .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;0	This year 's drop in the stock market may accomplish what six interest-rate tightenings by the Federal Reserve have apparently failed to do : Slow the economy down .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;1	So argues inveterate market bear Michael Metz , chief investment strategist at Oppenheimer and Co. , in a recent research report .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;2	Despite the fact that blue-chip stocks have held up well , many investors have experienced a 5 to 10 percent drop in the value of their stock portfolios this year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;3	Stock investors `` feel poorer and they are poorer '' than they were last Jan. 1 , Metz said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;4	They will assess their losses for the year and , alarmed about the erosion of their net worth , put a tight lid on discretionary spending .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;5	That in turn will finally put the brakes on a seemingly unstoppable economy , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;6	`` The decline in stock values -- and the drop already seen in the bond market this year -- is expected to have a tangible wealth effect on householders who now have their highest exposure in decades to stocks and bonds as a percentage of their assets , '' Metz writes in a Nov. 23 report entitled , `` Will the Stock Market do the Fed 's Work ? ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;7	`` The result ... '' Metz writes , `` is a slowdown in personal consumption spending generally in 1995 , and a growth recession by the second quarter of 1995 . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;8	Metz turns on its head the conventional wisdom that Federal Reserve credit tightenings should , by themselves , slow the economy down .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;9	He got some support from economic reports this past week that show the economy continues to chug along , despite a better than 2 percentage point increase in short-term interest rates since last February .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;10	The most recent of these was a report Friday that the nation 's nonfarm payrolls added an impressive 350,000 jobs in November , pushing the unemployment rate down by 0.2 percentage points to 5.6 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;11	Stocks initially stalled on the news but then posted some respectable gains as bond prices surged , pushing inerest rates lower .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;12	The Dow Jones industrial average finished Friday 's session at 3,745.62 , up 44.75 for the day and up 37.35 for the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;13	Analysts said Friday 's rally occurred for largely technical reasons , however , and they remained cautious .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;14	`` We have gotten through a week of news and the market has , for whatever it 's worth , held together , '' said Hugh Johnson , market strategist at First Albany Corp.
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;15	Metz argues that , whether interest rates move higher or not , the drop in the stock market itself will arrest economic growth .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;16	But Johnson said , `` I think it 's not that easy . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;17	This year 's Fed tightenings , as aggressive as they have been , have not had enough time to work , Johnson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;18	Interest rate changes typically do not affect the economy for 12 to 18 months .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;19	And exports , government spending and business investments , all of which have a big impact on the economy , are likely to ebb and flow independently of the stock market , Johnson said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;20	Still , Metz pointed out that when the stock market crashed in 1987 , many investors watched from the sidelines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;21	A large portion of their investments were in bonds , because interest rates were relatively high at the time , Metz said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;22	Now , households have more than a third of their financial assets in stocks , according to industry studies .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;23	That compares with an average of about 26 percent since 1945 and means that individual investors -- and the economy -- are especially vulnerable to market downturns , Metz said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;24	On Friday , the New York Stock Exchange 's composite index rose 1.97 to 248.01 , up 0.41 for the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;25	The Standard and Poor 's 500-stock index rose 4.38 to 453.30 , up 1.01 for the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;26	The Nasdaq composite index rose 3.83 to 745.02 , up 2.50 for the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;27	The American Stock Exchange 's market value index rose 1.27 to 432.46 , up 2.23 for the week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0565;28	The Wilshire Associates Equity Index , which is the market value of NYSE , American , and over-the-counter issues , ended the week at dlrs 4.476 trillion , up dlrs 4.644 billion from the previous week .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;0	Bosnian Serb leaders promised Friday to release hundreds of detained United Nations peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;1	But there was no confirmation that 55 detained Canadians peacekeepers were free to move .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;2	Here are some key dates surrounding their detention :
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;3	Nov. 19 -- UN Security Council extends NATO air authority to Croatia after Serb warplanes flying from an air base in Udbina , in Serb-controlled Croatia , launch air strikes on the UN-declared safe haven of Bihac in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;4	Nov. 21 -- NATO planes bomb the Udbina airport and two Serb missile sites in Bosnia near Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;5	Nov. 22 -- Serbs fire surface-to-air missiles at two NATO jets flying over Serb-held Banja Luka , in northwest Bosnia , and set villages ablaze and send civilians fleeing in the Bihac pocket in retaliation for NATO air strikes .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;6	Nov. 23 -- Serbs detain some 250 UN peacekeepers , including 55 Canadian troops near their base in Visoko , Bosnia , hours after renewed NATO air strikes against Serb positions near Bihac in Bosnia and Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;7	Nov. 24 -- UN officials attempt to negotiate the release of the Canadians and the other UN peacekeepers in talks with Serb leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;8	Bosnian Muslim-led government troops block attempt to transfer 150 non-essential personnel from the Canadian base at Visoko to Kiseljak , some 15 kilometres away .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;9	Nov. 25 -- NATO jets fly over Serb positions near Bihac but due to darkness drop no bombs as Serb forces advance into the enclave , controlled by the Muslim-led government army .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;10	Serbs allow some of the detained Canadians to carry out work at their observation posts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;11	Muslims lift blockade of Canadian camp .
APW_ENG_19941202.0567;12	Nov. 26 -- Canadian troops come under fire three times .

APW_ENG_19941202.0571;2	The seven-man , five-woman jury deadlocked on the two other counts , and acquitted her of supplying cocaine to an undercover police officer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0571;3	Fleiss was visibly unhappy with the outcome .
APW_ENG_19941202.0571;4	She slammed her hands on the defense table and laid down her head as the guilty verdicts were read .

APW_ENG_19941202.0573;0	As the scorched Achille Lauro has sunk into the Indian Ocean , a surviving passenger blamed the crew for dropping inflatable rafts on top of a crowded lifeboat , injuring one man who later died .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;1	The victim was one of two elderly passengers who died as a result of the fire on the Italian luxury liner .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;2	The 979 passengers and crew who survived were headed for three African and Middle Eastern ports aboard 10 rescue vessels , including freighters and U.S. warships .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;3	They abandoned the blazing ship Wednesday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;4	The Achille Lauro was once a gleaming blue-and-white luxury liner that sailed around the world in 80 days .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;5	But it was best known for the 1985 hijacking by Palestinian terrorists , who killed an elderly Jewish American passenger , Leon Klinghoffer , and dumped his body overboard in his wheelchair .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;6	The terrorists escaped aboard a jet , but U.S. fighter planes forced the plane down in Italy and the hijackers were arrested and later tried .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;7	Eight people were injured in the fire , which began in the engine room before dawn .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;8	Lifeboats and rafts were launched and the ship was abandoned .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;9	According to passenger Geoffrey Wall , interviewed Friday by Britain 's Sky TV , one man was injured when crew members released inflatable rafts onto the lifeboat , which held about 35 people .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;10	`` It was tilting at an angle , '' said Wall , a Briton , describing attempts to lower a lifeboat .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;11	`` They got it near the water .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;12	They could n't lower it properly .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;13	Then somebody hit the wrong -- I do n't know what it is that they release them with -- but they dropped two of these inflatable life boats on top of us , resulting in injury to one man . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;14	He said people gave the ailing man mouth-to-mouth resuscitation before a rescue ship arrived about four hours later .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;15	`` We were in 100 yards -LRB- meters -RRB- or so of the rescue ship when he started to go ... Unfortunately , he died , '' Wall said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;16	It was not immediately clear if the man died of his injuries .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;17	The ship 's owner , Naples , Italy-based Starlauro , had no immediate comment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;18	Passenger Dennis Bassett , also told Sky TV that crew members did not alert all the passengers until only minutes before the order sounded to abandon ship .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;19	`` Some passengers at 7 o'clock in the morning were still in bed , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;20	The ship 's captain , Giuseppe Orsi , was the last to abandon the ship , which sank Friday evening about 125 miles -LRB- 200 kms -RRB- off the coast of Somalia in about 14,700 feet -LRB- 4,450 meters -RRB- of water .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;21	The liner fell to its left side and sank as an Italian tug began to pull it , StarLauro President Nicola Coccia told the Italian news agency ANSA .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;22	`` There probably was a movement of a mass of water inside , '' causing it to sink , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;23	`` She was hooked up to the -LRB- tug -RRB- Solano and in 10 minutes , she collapsed -- pfft , she disappeared , '' said Antonio de Rosa , marketing director for Starlauro .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;24	He put the loss at dlrs 25 million .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;25	Starlauro had hired the seagoing tugs to bring the vessel home to try to save her .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;26	Italian coast guard Lt. Francesco D'Amico said the ship was unrecoverable .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;27	Eight cargo vessels and two American warships , the USS Gettysburg and USS Halyburton , were carrying the surviving passengers and crew members to Djibouti , Mombasa in Kenya and Muskat in Oman .
APW_ENG_19941202.0573;28	Most were heading for Mombasa .

APW_ENG_19941202.0573;31	The planes leave Sunday and return Monday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;0	The United States and four European governments dusted off a rejected , five-month old Bosnia peace plan Friday , hoping the prospect of political ties to Serbia might lure advancing Bosnian Serbs into negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;1	Secretary of State Warren Christopher said it would have been useless to approve `` carpet bombing '' by NATO aircraft on Serb positions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;2	That , he said , would have meant a `` reign of terror '' and required hundreds of thousands of allied troops to force a settlement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;3	And to `` walk away '' from the 31-month war that has taken some 200,000 lives is unacceptable , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;4	`` The road will be very difficult , '' Christopher said of the renewed effort to stop the bloodshed through a diplomatic attempt to effectively divide Bosnia-Herzegovina into areas dominated by the Serbs and by a Muslim-Croat federation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;5	The hint that the Serbs might take a step toward a Greater Serbia was in the text of a one-page agreement adopted in a four-hour meeting with the foreign ministers of Britain , France , Germany and Russia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;6	It said that while preserving the `` integrity '' of Bosnia as a legitimate country , the Bosnian Serbs were entitled to seek the kind of `` balanced and equitable arrangements '' worked out by the Muslims and Croats when they formed a federation in March linked to Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;7	French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe , who led a successful European campaign to persuade the Clinton administration to forgo heavy bombing as a strategy to stop the Serbs , called this assurance a matter of giving parties `` an equal opportunity . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;8	The text does not specifically call for a confederation between Serbs in Bosnia and Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;9	A senior U.S. official said Russian Foreign Minister Andrei V. Kozyrev had argued for endorsing confederation but Christopher `` beat that back . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;10	The agreement also carried a hint that the 24,000 U.N. peacekeepers now in Bosnia , some 500 of whom were being held by the Serbs , might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;11	Their mission should continue `` provided that the risks do not become unacceptable , '' the agreement said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;12	The plan rejected repeatedly by the Serbs would give them control of 49 percent of the country , about two-thirds of the 70 percent they now occupy .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;13	The Muslim-Croat area covered the other 51 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;14	This division `` can be adjusted by mutual arrangement , '' the ministers said , again suggesting the Serbs might do better at the bargaining table .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;15	However , Juppe and the other ministers stressed in a joint news conference that the Serbs must recognize the legitimacy of Bosnia-Herzegovina .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;16	They emphasized they were now united in promoting diplomacy as the only possible key to a ceasefire and a peace accord .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;17	German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel , who chaired the meeting of the five-nation `` contact group , '' said the fighting in the Bihac region of northwest Bosnia had reached an awful state .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;18	He said the war could not be terminated through external military force .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;19	Juppe and British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd will go to Belgrade on Sunday in pursuit of a diplomatic solution .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;20	Both stressed that while they would carry the joint decision with them , they would meet with Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic as representatives of their governments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;21	Michael McCurry , the State Department spokesman , said U.S. envoy Charles E. Redman went to Sarajevo on Thursday for meetings with President Alija Izetbegovic and other Bosnian government leaders .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;22	He also told reporters the proposal Christopher had prepared for an international peace conference was being held `` in abeyance '' until the various consultations were concluded .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;23	The meeting was held against the backdrop of a Bosnian Serb hammerlock on the mostly Muslim Bihac enclave and its 60,000 terrified civilians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;24	The prospect of the war spreading into Croatia also exists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;25	Christopher wants Milosevic to persuade Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic to accept a ceasefire and negotiations with the Muslims and Croats by threatening to seal Serbia 's border to Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;26	Despite a promise by Milosevic to halt weapons deliveries , Clinton administration officials said arms were still getting through to fuel the Bosnian Serbs ' drive to gain more territory .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;27	Meanwhile , a senior U.S. military officer , briefing reporters at the Pentagon in Washington , reported that NATO has begun planning for the possible evacuation of U.N. peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0574;28	`` We are doing planning at the NATO level for a withdrawal -- when and if that ever comes about , '' said the officer , who spoke on condition his name not be used .
