APW_ENG_19941202.0616;0	Jose Montepeque scored on a header in the 87th minute Friday to give Aurora of Guatemala a 2-1 win over Real Maya of Honduras in a semifinal game of the CONCACAF Cup Winner 's Cup .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;1	Montepeque 's goal from eight yards in came on a cross from Juan Davila and beat defenseless Real Maya goalkeeper Juan Palacios .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;2	Aurora advances to the Sunday 's final in the Orange Bowl .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;3	The Guatemalan Cup champion will play the winner of Friday 's late game between Necaxa of Mexico and Lambada of Barbados .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;4	The CONCACAF Cup Winners Cup matches winners of domestic cup competitions in North and Central America and the Caribbean .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;5	Aurora took a 1-0 lead in the game 's 24th minute when Roderico Mendez scored from 10 meters on a rebound into an open net .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;6	Palacios was forced off his line to make a kick save on a 20-meter shot by Aurora forward Edwin Westphal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;7	The deflection went directly to Mendez , who calmly finished the scoring play .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;8	Westphal missed a chance for a second goal when he volleyed a cross from Julio Giron just wide of the left post in the 60th minute .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;9	That miss almost proved costly for the Guatemalans as Real Maya tied it two minutes later on a goal by Nelson Rosales .
APW_ENG_19941202.0616;10	Rosales played a give-and-go with Victor Zuniga and finished his chance from 12 yards past fallen Aurora keeper Edgar Estrada .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;0	Russia vetoed a Security Council resolution late Friday aimed at stopping Yugoslavia from sending fuel supplies that reportedly are powering a Serb offensive in northern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;1	It was the first council veto in a year and a half , and the first on the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;2	The resolution was sponsored by Islamic and non-aligned states to show sympathy for the Muslim-led Bosnian government .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;3	Russia , a traditional Serb ally , said it vetoed the resolution because it would tighten sanctions against Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;4	`` We had no other choice than to vote against this draft , '' said Russian Ambassador Sergey Lavrov .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;5	Lavrov said that Serb-dominated Yugoslavia had stopped supplying the rebel Serbs in Bosnia and was cooperating with peace negotiators .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;6	Another Russian diplomat , speaking on condition of anonymity , stressed that the veto did n't mean there was a split within the five-nation contact group pushing for a peace agreement in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;7	Hours before the veto , diplomats from Russia , the United States , France , Britain and Germany demonstrated their unity by endorsing a confederation of Bosnia 's Serbs with neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;8	The last Security Council veto was in May 1993 , when Russia killed a proposal to make all U.N. members pay for the small peacekeeping force in Cyprus .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;9	Lavrov has repeatedly accused the United Nations of using a double standard , saying that the council imposed sanctions against Serbia for arming Bosnia 's Serbs but ignored Muslim acts of aggression against Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;10	Between 100 and 150 fuel tankers were leaving Yugoslavia for Serb forces in Croatia , said one diplomat , speaking on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;11	Croatian and Bosnian diplomats say the fuel is far in excess of humanitarian needs and is being used to support the Serbs ' offensive in the Muslim enclave of Bihac in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;12	The resolution would have required U.N. border monitors to severely limit shipments of fuel and other supplies from Serbia , the dominant member of Yugoslavia , to Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;13	The aim of the resolution is `` to totally shackle the Serb war-making capability , '' said Djibouti 's ambassador , Roble Olhaye .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;14	U.N. resolutions already ban all but humanitarian supplies from crossing the Yugoslav-Bosnian border .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;15	Monitors have allowed shipments to cross Bosnia if they are destined for Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;16	The resolution also called for the freedom of more than 300 U.N. peacekeepers being held hostage by Serb forces and freedom of movement for U.N. refugee workers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;17	Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic announced in August that Yugoslavia 's border with Bosnia was being sealed to all but humanitarian aid to pressure the Bosnian Serbs into accepting an internationally-brokered peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;18	In response , the United Nations eased its sanctions against Yugoslavia in October .
APW_ENG_19941202.0617;19	Serbia had supplied the Bosnian Serbs since they rebelled 2 -LCB- years ago against a decision by Bosnia 's Muslims and Croats to secede from Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;0	Bosnian Serbs promised Friday to release hundreds of detained UN peacekeepers , but there was no confirmation that Canadians were free to move .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;1	Defense Minister David Collenette said in Ottawa that Canadian officers in the former Yugoslavia could n't confirm the reports of agreement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;2	UN special envoy Yasushi Akashi said Bosnian Serb leaders had agreed to release Ukrainian peacekeepers held in northern Bosnia , as well as Dutch and British convoys detained since Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;3	`` In addition , we have agreed that normal activities be restored to the Canadians -- 55 Canadians near Visoko -- and all other soldiers from other countries that were doing their work at weapons collection sites , '' Akashi said after talks with Bosnian Serb leader Radovan Karadzic in Pale , near Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;4	`` We have no confirmed reports concerning Canadian detainess , '' Collenette said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;5	`` You ca n't be definitive until you know what is happening . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;6	He said Canadian military officers are monitoring the negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;7	`` We had understood that negotiations were becoming more hopeful and fruitful , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;8	`` You 're dealing with a conflict where there are a lot of turns . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;9	Whether the promises would be kept remained to be seen , as Serbs have repeatedly broken their word to the United Nations .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;10	Maj. Rita LePage , UN military spokeswoman in Zagreb , Croatia , said that while promises have been made , no timetable has been given for the possible release of the Canadian peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;11	Bosnian Serbs said details would be provided as soon as possible , said LePage .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;12	In Paris , Peter Donolo , a spokesman for Prime Minister Jean Chretien , said : `` Obviously we 're encouraged by the developments .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;13	We 're keeping our fingers crossed , but we 're not going to rest until our troops have full freedom of movement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;14	We 've been let down before . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;15	The Serbs have been holding about 400 UN soldiers as insurance against NATO airstrikes on their siege of the Muslim pocket of Bihac , a UN-declared safe haven in northwest Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;16	The Serbs released 70 Dutch peacekeepers taken hostage Saturday near Zvornik in eastern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;17	The soldiers were in good condition , Dutch officials said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;18	The Canadians have been held for the past 10 days at various sites in Serb-held territory near their peacekeeping camp in Visoko , near Sarajevo .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;19	About 20 are at a police complex in the village of Illijas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;20	The rest are at checkpoints and observation posts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;21	The soldiers are in radio contact with their camp and those at observation posts carry on their work .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;22	Maj. Dean Milner , the senior officer among the detainees , is able to drive around in his vehicle and visit his soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0618;23	The Serbs are allowing supply vehicles from camp to reach the soldiers with mail , food and other items .

APW_ENG_19941202.0618;26	Three missiles hit the Bosnian government building shortly before he arrived .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;0	A coast guard spokesman Saturday expressed hope survivors would be found among the more than 100 people still missing from the ferry that sank after colliding with a cargo ship , killing at least 34 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;1	Rescue efforts resumed at daybreak , and the coast guard detained the freighter , the Singapore-registered Kota Suria , and its 30-man crew , which , though damaged , had helped the rescue effort Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;2	Thirty-four bodies were found and at least 451 people saved .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;3	The Cebu City had been carrying 608 people , said William Lines , the ferry operator .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;4	The cargo ship crew was unhurt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;5	The cause of the accident was not yet known , but the ferry 's owner claimed it had been rammed by the Kota Suria , which suffered damage to its port-side bow .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;6	The freighter will be held during the investigation , which will last for several weeks , said coast guard spokesman Lt. Comdr. Amado Samante .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;7	Jacob Cabatuan , a crewman on the ferry , said the Kota Suria 's bow crashed into the Cebu City , destroying the bridge and ripping a one-meter -LRB- three-foot -RRB- hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;8	He said ship captain Wenceslao Lampong and several other officers were pinned on the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;9	Passengers , many of whom were asleep two hours after the ferry had left port in Manila , said they had no warning .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;10	`` I was jolted by the crash and I woke up , '' said Melissa Selosia , who was on her way to Mindanao Island , 780 kilometers -LRB- 485 miles -RRB- south of Manila for Christmas .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;11	`` I grabbed a life jacket and made for the upper deck and then I jumped into the water . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;12	The ferry was embedded in mud in about 14 fathoms -LRB- 84 feet -RRB- of water .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;13	Four teams of coast guard and navy men were searching the ship for bodies believed trapped in the cabins , Samante said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;14	About 50 coast guard , navy and commercial sea vessels were involved in the search effort Saturday , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;15	`` Considering that all -LRB- passengers of the Cebu -RRB- were wearing life jackets , we are hopeful to find survivors , '' said Samante .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;16	`` In fact , two of the survivors yesterday were found by fishermen near a coastal town . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;17	Seaman Angel Espidido , one of 27 coast guard divers who joined navy frogmen Friday in the dive , said there were bodies inside the cabins he could see through portholes but that the divers were unable to open the doors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;18	Seaman Hermogenes Guilaran said he recovered the bodies of two elderly women and a boy who were trapped at a railing on the side of the ferry .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;19	The 2,452-ton Cebu City had left Manila bound for the resort area of Tagbilaran , the capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- to the southeast , a 28-hour boat trip .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;20	The ferry , usually used by families and small business owners , sank 30 minutes after it and the 12,500-ton freighter collided .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;21	William Lines said the Cebu City had a capacity of 800 passengers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;22	It sank near the town of Rosario , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 35 miles -RRB- southwest of Manila in Cavite province .
APW_ENG_19941202.0619;23	The Philippines ' worst peacetime ferry disaster was in December 1987 , when 4,341 people died in the collision of the ferry Dona Paz with the oil tanker Vector off Mindoro Island , about 130 kilometers -LRB- 80 miles -RRB- south of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;0	From opening doors to logging physical fitness tests and taking in a bit of shopping in between .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;1	Singapore 's 275,000 regular and part-time soldiers will soon be able to do all this and more just by using a credit-card sized card that will replace their military identity cards within three years .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;2	Releasing the first such Singapore Armed Forces Card on Friday , Defense Minister Lee Boon Yang said it was part of his ministry 's move towards creating a truly `` intelligent organization '' by the year 2001 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;3	The Defense Ministry is the first organization in Singapore , a prosperous city-state riding a high-technology boom , to use the smart-card technology for such wide ranging uses .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;4	The plastic card has built in processing and data storage capabilities that will capture vital statistics about a serviceman besides other useful information such as drug allergies or vacation times .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;5	The card would be used like any other credit card by sliding its magnetic strip through a reader or slotting it into computer-linked machines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;6	In army units , the card will allow the booking of conference rooms and auditoriums , access to parking lots , unlocking doors , logging onto computers and buying drinks from vending machines .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;7	In the future , it would also act as a bank charge card in supermarkets .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;8	The card is also a portable electronic score card for physical fitness tests .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;9	For example , soldiers would slot the card into a computer and start doing chin-ups on a bar .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;10	The results will be recorded electronically and stored in a training and manpower database computer .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;11	Singapore , with 3 million people , has 50,000 regular troops in the army , navy and air force , plus 250,000 reservists .
APW_ENG_19941202.0622;12	Military services is compulsory for all males .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;0	Seattle Seahawks tackle Mike Frier probably will never walk again after breaking his neck in a car crash that also injured two teammates , a doctor said Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;1	The issue of who was driving the car Thursday night remained uncertain after agents for the two other players -- Chris Warren and Lamar Smith -- contradicted police reports that Warren was at the wheel .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;2	Smith 's agent , Eugene Parker , said Smith was driving .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;3	Rick Schaeffer , a Baltimore lawyer and Warren 's agent , said his client was not driving and was not the owner of the car .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;4	Asked why police would say Warren was the driver , Schaeffer replied , `` The best I can tell you is that it was a misunderstanding . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;5	Police detective Ed Malkowski told The Journal-American the preliminary investigation points to Warren as the driver , but they are looking into the possibility it was Smith .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;6	Malkowski confirmed the car was registered to Smith .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;7	Warren , reached at home , refused to comment .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;8	Kirkland police said after the accident that Warren , a running back , was driving , had been arrested for investigation of vehicular assault and was released on his own recognizance .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;9	Detective Jim O'Toole said Friday there is `` reason to believe alcohol was involved . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;10	He said blood samples were taken only from Warren .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;11	Warren , 27 , was treated for two fractured ribs and released early Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;12	He was listed as questionable for Sunday 's game against Indianapolis in the Kingdome .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;13	Smith , 24 , a rookie running back , sustained a chip fracture in his spine and an ankle sprain .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;14	He was released from the hospital Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;15	Frier , 25 , `` almost certainly will be wheelchair dependent , '' Dr. Michael Schlitt told a news conference .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;16	Frier has no use of his legs or hands and only minimal muscle function in his upper arms .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;17	He has a broken and dislocated neck between the fifth and sixth vertebrae and his spinal cord was severely injured .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;18	`` The likelihood that he will play football again is zero , '' Schlitt said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;19	`` The likelihood of walking is very poor .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;20	He 'll regain a little bit more use in the arms .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;21	That 's almost guaranteeable .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;22	But it 's doubtful that he 'll have completely normal function of the hands . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;23	`` He knows about his diagnosis , '' Schlitt said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;24	`` I 've discussed it with him .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;25	He 's depressed as most people will be after such an injury . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;26	Frier was Seattle 's seventh-round draft choice in 1992 and was picked up on waivers by Cincinnati that year .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;27	He played in 32 games with the Bengals before being released Oct. 13 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;28	He played in two games as a reserve with the Seahawks this season .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;29	`` There is a tremendous shock in the locker room right now , '' said Seahawks coach Tom Flores .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;30	Police Sgt. Mark Smith said the initial indication was the car carrying the Seahawks pulled out to pass in the left lane .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;31	`` Then , as they were entering the northbound lane , they continued on across -LRB- the lane -RRB- and hit the pole , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;32	He said there were no skid marks and it appeared the car was going too fast for the rain-slicked road .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;33	He declined to estimate the speed .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;34	The crash set the utility pole on fire and the players had to be pulled from the car by passersby and firefighters , he said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;35	Vehicular assault is punishable by up to five years in prison , although the standard sentencing range under state guidelines is three to nine months in jail , the King County prosecutor 's office said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0623;36	The charge alleges a defendant caused serious harm to another person as a result of driving a vehicle in a reckless manner or while under the influence of drugs or alcohol .

APW_ENG_19941202.0626;0	Amid reports that detained Canadian UN soldiers may be freed by Bosnian Serbs , Prime Minister Jean Chretien said peacekeeping rules are changing faster than ceasefire agreements are broken in war-torn former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;1	`` We went there to maintain the peace , but the war is still going on , '' he said Friday after meeting with French President Francois Mitterrand and Prime Minister Edouard Balladur .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;2	`` We 're playing it the best we can . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;3	Chretien said it 's time to intensify diplomatic efforts to end the war , adding that the Conference on Security and Co-operation in Europe next week in Budapest will be crucial .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;4	`` If some initiatives are decided , it will be decided Monday and Tuesday . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;5	In Pale , Bosnia , UN special envoy Yasushi Akashi said the Serbs agreed to release more than 400 detained peacekeepers , including 55 Canadians .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;6	By the end of the day , 70 Dutch troops had been freed but there was no schedule for the others ' release and in Ottawa , Defense Minister David Collenette said : `` We have no confirmed reports concerning Canadian detainees . ''

APW_ENG_19941202.0626;8	He told about 400 business people that improving trade links across the Atlantic is the best way to prevent trading blocs from withdrawing `` timidly into their own shells . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;9	`` This is the best way to energize relations between Canada and France , and Canada and Europe , and to fight the temptation of isolationism . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;10	The prime minister first suggested the idea Thursday while speaking to the French Senate .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;11	Federal officials said Canada has n't yet broached the subject with the U.S. or Mexico , its partners in the North America Free Trade Agreement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;12	Chretien said his new trade initiative did n't come up Friday in separate talks with Mitterrand and Balladur , which dealt mostly with the situation in Bosnia , in preparation for the meetings in Budapest .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;13	Canada has extensive trade and investment links with France .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;14	Two-way trade amounted to more than $ 4 billion in 1993 and French companies have invested $ 4.2 billion in Canada , including more than $ 2.5 billion in Ontario .
APW_ENG_19941202.0626;15	French business executives expressed curiosity about Chretien 's proposal during a private lunch but did n't endorse or reject the idea , said Canadian officials .

APW_ENG_19941202.0627;0	The Security Council late Friday night called on the former Soviet republic of Georgia and a breakaway province to press forward with peace talks and cautioned against a separate Abkhaz state .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;1	Russia has repeatedly urged the council to address the conflict .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;2	The council statement came moments after Moscow vetoed a resolution that would have limited fuel shipments to Serbia , a traditional Russian ally .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;3	The council statement said that last week 's declaration by Abkhazia 's parliament `` purporting to establish a sovereign Abkhaz identity would violate the commitments ... to seek a comprehensive political settlement . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;4	Georgia and Abkhazia signed a U.N.-brokered agreement in September that allowed for the return of refugees .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;5	But Abkhazian authorities have refused to accept many refugees , citing Georgian violations of a cease-fire .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;6	At issue is the plight of some 250,000 Georgians who fled Abkhazia and want to return home .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;7	The war in Abkhazia began in the summer of 1992 when Georgian soldiers marched into the Black Sea province to crush the secessionist movement .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;8	The fighting , which claimed 3,000 lives , ended last fall when Abkhazian forces drove out the Georgian soldiers .
APW_ENG_19941202.0627;9	A truce , monitored by Russian peacekeepers and U.N. observers , is now in place .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;0	The United States and North Korea have wrapped up the latest round of nuclear talks on providing the communist state with modern nuclear reactors .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;1	`` The talks addressed complex matters and were serious and useful , '' said a joint statement after the three-day talks in Beijing ended Friday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;2	It was carried Saturday by the North 's official Korean Central News Agency .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;3	Under an agreement signed in October , the North is to receive two reactors in exchange for freezing and eventually dismantling its nuclear facilities , suspected of being used to develop atomic bombs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;4	It is also to gain diplomatic relations with Washington .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;5	The statement said the two sides reaffirmed their intention to meet the terms of the Geneva accord on the provision of the new reactors , worth about dlrs 4 billion .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;6	Under the agreement , Washington is to organize an international consortium to finance and build the plants by 2003 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;7	The new lightwater reactors would produce much less weapons-grade plutonium than the North 's present graphite-moderated reactors are capable of , experts say .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;8	The statement gave no further details on the negotiations , except to say the two sides agreed to meet again in January .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;9	South Korean officials say the talks focused on deciding the type of reactors to be given to the North and discussed such details as where they will be built .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;10	South Korea is willing to bear much of the cost on condition that it makes them .
APW_ENG_19941202.0629;11	North Korea reportedly prefers Russian or German models , apparently to avoid losing face to its capitalist rival .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;0	After spending hours in poorly heated classrooms sharing tattered , Soviet-era textbooks , students at public school No. 728 come to the `` computer closet '' to work on their on-line newspaper .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;1	Or to send e-mail to students in Minnesota .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;2	Or to practice their French in an electronic conference with European teens .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;3	Like most of Russia 's roads , its information superhighway is ridden with potholes and Soviet-style dead-ends .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;4	Nevertheless , the younger generation is building its own on-ramps and starting to cruise .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;5	`` The kids may not understand yet what this access , this communication , means for them , '' said Volodya Pilipchuk , the school 's computer adviser and a former 728 student .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;6	`` But 10 years from now , they will . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;7	Pilipchuk 's students have joined the millions of people -- from New York CEOs to human rights activists in East Timor -- who communicate via a worldwide web of computer networks .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;8	It does n't seem to matter to these students that they were born in a society famous for restricting information .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;9	Or that some of their parents built careers on imposing those restrictions .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;10	What matters is the computer itself .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;11	Dozens of students huddle around the school 's lone unit during breaks , as Pilipchuk struggles to ration out computer time to eager users .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;12	Most of the students here , unlike many of their U.S. counterparts , had never seen a computer before this project began .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;13	Olga Galkina , the founder of the school 's on-line newspaper , says the project is aimed at `` helping kids understand their global importance . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;14	And ultimately , she hopes , these children may be the ones to guide the rest of the former Soviet Union into the information age .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;15	Much of Russia 's wealth of computer expertise has been lured to the West , leaving a relatively small cadre of dedicated but underfunded programmers to bring new technologies to this vast nation .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;16	In the meantime , the kids are having fun .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;17	`` Look , I can type in English , '' boasted Sasha , a 12-year-old wearing an L.A. Raiders sweatshirt .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;18	`` Even my older brother ca n't do that . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;19	The latest issue of `` Southern Zone , '' the on-line school paper , included articles on the music of David Lee Roth and a nature reserve in Russia 's Far North .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;20	The issue was posted on the local network Glasnet , which is connected to the worldwide Internet , allowing computers around the world access to the newspaper .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;21	The publication has evoked responses from users as far away as Minnesota .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;22	`` The messages from the American kids are funny , '' said Alyosha , tugging on his long blond bangs .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;23	`` Someone asked if Russia was bigger than California . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;24	These kids are also proving that the information superhighway is not restricted to an elite few .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;25	The school 's computer , a standard IBM-compatible 386 with an internal modem , belongs to John Whitely , a sociology professor at the University of California at Irvine .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;26	Whitely loaned the machine to Galkina for the newspaper project in 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;27	And Glasnet , a non-profit Russian computer network , donated an e-mail account to the school .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;28	The project costs just a few dollars per year -- less than the paper version of the school newspaper .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;29	The computer project is a bargain in a cash-strapped public education system struggling to support its 65,000 schools .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;30	Teachers in Russia earn about $ 40 a month .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;31	School 728 is just one of several seeds of hope .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;32	At least 300 Russian schools -- most outside Moscow -- have access to e-mail accounts .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;33	`` The numbers are still not high , for a country this size , '' said Galkina , who is now working on a project to connect disabled children in Russia to on-line services .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;34	`` But Russia , like the U.S. , wo n't become computer literate overnight . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;35	Computer literacy is not a top priority for School 728 's administrators , who pay little attention to the cramped , windowless computer room .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;36	`` Yes , I know there 's something going on over there , '' said Nina Mikhailova , head of the student relations department , in the opposite wing of the school .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;37	`` But it does n't concern us .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;38	We do n't use computers over here . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;39	The administration may be wary , but its pupils are already making plans .
APW_ENG_19941202.0630;40	`` I want to be a programmer , '' 14-year-old Anton said , `` because the world ca n't survive without computers . ''
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;0	Vietnam 's Ministry of Finance has raised interest rates on treasury bonds from 15 percent to 21 percent , to attract more capital needed for economic development , an official report said Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;1	The three-year treasury bonds , which first went on sale in June , are available to foreign residents and companies with foreign investors as well as to Vietnamese buyers , the state-run Vietnam News reported .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;2	The ministry planned earlier this year to issue the securities only if they carried an interest rate of less than 20 percent .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;3	But a tepid public response to bond offerings so far has motivated the ministry to boost the rate to increase their appeal .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;4	Vietnam hopes to attract as much as dlrs 55 billion in investment , loans and foreign aid to double its national per capita income to around dlrs 450 by the end of the decade .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;5	The treasury bonds are aimed at attracting what foreign bankers estimate is some dlrs 1 billion circulating outside Vietnam 's banking system .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;6	Many Vietnamese are wary of socialist-era banks that catered historically to state-run companies rather than retail customers , and they keep their savings at home or buy U.S. dollars or gold .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;7	Separately , the International Nederlanden Group -LRB- ING -RRB- has received approval in principle to open a commercial bank branch in Hanoi , a bank officer said .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;8	The ING bank becomes the first from the Netherlands to receive such approval and brings to at least 12 the number of foreign banks with branches , or permission to open branches , in the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;9	ING , which opened offices here in 1992 , has no plans yet to apply for a second branch in Ho Chi Minh City , Vietnam 's business hub , said its representative in Hanoi , Nguyen Duc Phuc .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;10	Vietnamese authorities see foreign bank branches as one way to attract investment to the capital Hanoi and speed development in the north of the country .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;11	Citibank and the Bank of America , the last two foreign banks to receive approval in principle for branches , will open their branches in Hanoi as well .
APW_ENG_19941202.0631;12	The ING branch , once it opens , will cater to wholesale customers rather than individuals , Phuc said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;0	Russia believes it 's time to lift some United Nations sanctions on Serbia , its ambassador said Friday
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;1	Ambassador Sergey Lavrov spoke to reporters after blocking a resolution that would have severely limited all Serbian fuel and supplies from entering Bosnia and Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;2	`` Russia does not think it 's appropriate '' to pass such a resolution on the same day Croatia and its rebel Serb minority signed an economic agreement touted as a framework for normalized relations , Lavrov said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;3	The agreement calls for restoring water and electricity and reopening oil pipelines and the highway linking Zagreb , the Croatian capital , with the Yugoslav capital , Belgrade .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;4	Lavrov also noted Serbia has begun to cooperate with the international community by supporting the international peace process and cooperating with U.N. observers monitoring the the Bosnian-Serb border .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;5	`` So , we believe it is high time not to reiterate sanctions against the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia , but to consider further ways of lifting some of the sanctions , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;6	`` We had no other choice than to vote against this draft , '' Lavrov said during the council meeting .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;7	One Western diplomat said the veto was important to Russians but will probably not get much reaction from Security Council members .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;8	However , New Zealand Ambassador Colin Keating was unhappy with Russia 's decision to veto the resolution sponsored by Muslim and non-aligned nations .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;9	`` We have no doubt that the consequences of today 's vote will be felt for a long time to come , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0001;10	Russia has been going along with the Western powers on most of the U.N. resolutions during the Bosnian crisis , despite its traditionally close relationship with the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;0	As their tiny island country is invaded by Sonoran troops , the Ginger Islands call on the United States for help .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;1	The situation deteriorates , crisis becomes conflict .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;2	Americans on the Gingers are evacuated .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;3	Air Force planes begin bombing runs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;4	Marines are ready to land .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;5	`` It 's a good , messy scenario , '' Rear Adm. Dennis C. Blair , commander of the Kitty Hawk carrier battle group said as the biennial Tandem Thrust maneuvers moved towards Saturday toward their climax off the real Pacific islands of Guam and Tinian .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;6	Blair said a major feature of this year 's exercises , which involve 14,500 troops , is a more integrated approach -- Navy , Air Force , Army , Marines , and Coast Guard are all participating -- made necessary by tighter budgets and continued cuts in the size of the military .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;7	`` We 've had a 40 percent budget cut , so we 've learned to look to other services for some of the things we used to do ourselves , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;8	`` Before , it was really a zone defense , '' he said , making a sports metaphor in which each player is responsible for only his own part of a court or field .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;9	Nowhere is the new attitude of cooperation reflected better than in a cramped set of operations rooms in the Kitty Hawk , whose crew and air wing add up to 5,550 people .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;10	Shoulder to shoulder , specialists from the different branches of the military coordinate their air missions against the imaginary Sonorans .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;11	From that command center , crammed to overflowing with maps , message boards and state-of-the-art computers , roughly 210 sorties are planned each day , some dropping live ordnance on a small island firing range on the maneuver 's parameters .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;12	`` So far , it 's been working magnificently well , '' said Read Adm. Herb Brown , head of the exercise 's joint air command .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;13	Navy spokesmen stressed that the exercises , which began Nov. 26 and end Dec. 8 , are not planned as a preparation for hostilities with any particular nation but are instead a composite of potential threats and responses .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;14	They have also been designed to emphasize the kind of hot-spot tensions that have become more common since the end of the Cold War .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;15	As the maneuvers progress , simulated political and diplomatic activities are also underway , giving an additional dimension of uncertainty to the mission .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;16	`` Right now , we are just trying to demonstrate to the opposition our presence , '' said Air Force Col. Ed Allen , deputy chief of the maneuver 's joint air command .
APW_ENG_19941203.0002;17	`` We are hoping the government of Sonora will back down . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;0	Government troops killed four Tamil Tiger rebels in two separate clashes in eastern Sri Lanka , a military spokesman said Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;1	Troops killed three rebels Friday in Panichchankerni , 200 kilometers -LRB- 130 miles -RRB- east of Colombo , said Brig. Gemunu Kulatunga , the military 's spokesman .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;2	In another incident , guerrillas attacked policemen and one rebel was killed in the cross-fire in Namalpokuna and killed one rebel , Kulatunga said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;3	No casualties were reported on the government side .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;4	Clashes have continued despite President Chandrika Kumaratunga 's offer of a cease-fire and restarting the peace talks .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;5	Rebel leader Velupillai Prabhakaran has agreed to peace talks to end the 11-year-old war , but no date has been fixed for resuming negotiations suspended after a suspected rebel suicide bomber killed opposition presidential candidate Gamini Dissanayake and 56 others on Oct. 24 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;6	The rebels want a homeland in the north and east for Sri Lanka 's 3-million-strong Tamil minority .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;7	They accuse the majority Buddhist Sinhalese of discrimination .
APW_ENG_19941203.0003;8	More than 34,000 people have been killed in the fighting .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;0	Russia vetoed a Security Council resolution late Friday aimed at stopping Yugoslav fuel supplies reportedly powering a Serb offensive in northern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;1	It was the first council veto in a year and a half -- and the first on the Bosnian war .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;2	The resolution was sponsored by Islamic and non-aligned states to show sympathy for the Bosnian Muslims .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;3	Russia , a traditional Serb ally , said it vetoed the resolution because it would tighten sanctions against Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;4	`` We had no other choice than to vote against this draft , '' said Russian Ambassador Sergey Lavrov .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;5	`` We hope that ultimately there will be a sound and balanced approach '' toward a political process .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;6	Lavrov said `` a more untimely moment of this -LRB- resolution -RRB- is impossible , '' adding that Yugoslavia had closed its border with Bosnia and was cooperating with peace negotiators .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;7	Another Russian diplomat , speaking on condition of anonymity , stressed that the veto did not represent a split within the five-nation contact group pushing for a peace agreement in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;8	Hours before the veto , diplomats from Russia , the United States , France , Britain and Germany demonstrated their unity by endorsing a confederation of Bosnian Serbs and neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;9	The last veto was in May 1993 , when Russia blocked its first resolution in nine years , killing a proposal to make all U.N. members pay for the small U.N. peacekeeping force in Cyprus .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;10	Friday night 's veto was also an opportunity for Russia to show its muscle in the council .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;11	Lavrov has repeatedly accused the United Nations of a `` double standard , '' saying that the council has imposed sanctions against Serbia , but has ignored Muslim acts against Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;12	The resolution would require U.N. border monitors to severely limit shipments of fuel and other supplies crossing the border between Serbia , the dominant member of Yugoslavia , and Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;13	The aim of the resolution is `` to totally shackle the Serb war-making capability , '' said Djibouti 's ambassador Roble Olhaye .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;14	U.N. resolutions already ban all but humanitarian supplies from crossing the border between Yugoslavia and Bosnia , but monitors have been permitting shipments to cross Bosnia if they are destined for Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;15	The resolution also called for the freedom of the 450 U.N. peacekeepers being held by Serb forces .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;16	Bosnian Serbs have promised to free the peacekeepers and allow aid deliveries , but Security Council President Manzi Bakuramutsa said late Friday there was no evidence the soldiers had been released .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;17	`` There is no confirmation yet that the restrictions have actually been lifted , '' said Bakuramutsa , the Rwandan ambassador .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;18	`` The council members insist that all detainees ... be released immediately and that UNPROFOR 's ... freedom of movement be respected in the future . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;19	UNPROFOR is the U.N. peacekeeping mission in the former Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;20	Some 100 to 150 tankers filled with fuel are being allowed to cross the Yugoslav border and reach Serb forces in Croatia , said one diplomat , speaking on condition of anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;21	Croatian and Bosnian diplomats say the fuel is far in excess of humanitarian needs and is being used in the war effort in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;22	The ambassador of Pakistan , a co-sponsor of the resolution called the Bosnians `` victims of international indifference . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;23	Jamsheed Marker said his country had demanded a vote on the resolution because `` the U.N. can not stand by and permit this genocide ... -LRB- which -RRB- makes a mockery of what the U.N. stands for . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;24	Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic announced in August that the border with Bosnia was being sealed to all but humanitarian aid to pressure Bosnian Serbs into accepting a peace plan .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;25	The United Nations eased its sanctions against Yugoslavia in October .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;26	Belgrade had supplied the Bosnian Serbs throughout the 21\/2 - year war with Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;27	Classified U.N. reports shown to The Associated Press in Sarajevo say that U.N. observers had seen armed men crossing the border between Serb-held territory in Croatia and Bosnia in vehicles with Belgrade licenses .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;28	With Friday 's vote , the veto has been used 281 times in the Security Council since the founding of the United Nations in 1945 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0004;29	The last veto cast by the United States was in May 1990 and blocked a resolution criticizing Israel for its activities in the occupied territories .

APW_ENG_19941203.0007;0	A new drive to win approval of an old peace plan for Bosnia is under way with the united support of the Clinton administration and four European governments .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;1	`` The road will be very difficult , '' Secretary of State Warren Christopher said Friday of the effort to lure the Serbs to the negotiating table while they are on the march in Bosnia and after they repeatedly rejected the plan after its adoption in July .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;2	But the United States and its allies are counting on war weariness and a threat of tougher sanctions to convince the Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;3	Meanwhile , British Foreign Secretary Douglas Hurd and French Foreign Minister Alain Juppe will go to Belgrade on Sunday to seek the help of Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;4	American diplomat Charles E. Redman already is in Sarajevo , trying to line up the Muslim-led government of Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;5	It had accepted the plan , but the proposal now is being embellished with hints to the Serbs of securing political links to Serbia or control of more than the 49 percent of the country provided by the plan .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;6	Christopher said it would have been useless to approve `` carpet bombing '' by NATO aircraft on Serb positions .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;7	That , he said , would have meant a `` reign of terror '' and required hundreds of thousands of allied troops to force a settlement .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;8	And , he said , it would have been unacceptable to `` walk away '' from the 31-month war that has taken some 200,000 lives and drawn the United States and its European allies into a sustained effort to end the bloodshed through diplomacy .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;9	The plan was approved Friday at a four-hour meeting of Christopher , Hurd , Juppe and Foreign Ministers Klaus Kinkel of Germany and Andrei V. Kozyrev of Russia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;10	Unanimity among the allies was broken at the United Nations later Friday , however , as Russia vetoed a Security Council resolution aimed at blocking shipment of fuel supplies said to be powering a Serb offensive in northern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;11	Islamic and nonaligned states sponsored the measure to show sympathy for the Muslim-led Bosnian government .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;12	But Russia , a traditional Serb ally , said it vetoed the resolution because it would tighten sanctions against Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;13	While preserving the `` integrity '' of Bosnia as a legitimate country , said the allied plan adopted in Brussels , the Bosnian Serbs were entitled to seek the kind of `` balanced and equitable arrangements '' worked out by the Muslims and Croats when they formed a federation in March linked to Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;14	France 's Juppe , who led a successful European campaign to persuade the Clinton administration to forgo heavy bombing as a strategy to stop the Serbs , called this assurance a matter of giving all parties `` an equal opportunity . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;15	The text did not specifically call for confederation between Serbs in Bosnia and in Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;16	A senior U.S. official , speaking on condition of anonymity , said Kozyrev had argued for endorsing confederation but that Christopher `` beat that back . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;17	The agreement also carried a hint that the 24,000 U.N. peacekeeping troops now in Bosnia , some 500 of whom were being held by the Serbs , might be withdrawn .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;18	Their mission should continue `` provided that the risks do not become unacceptable , '' the agreement said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;19	The plan rejected repeatedly by the Serbs would give them control of 49 percent of the country , about two-thirds of the 70 percent they now occupy .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;20	The Muslim-Croat area covered the other 51 percent .
APW_ENG_19941203.0007;21	This division `` can be adjusted by mutual arrangement , '' the foreign ministers said , again suggesting the Serbs might do better at the bargaining table .

APW_ENG_19941203.0009;0	A pre-trial hearing for a man accused of murdering seven backpackers has so far turned up circumstantial evidence but no direct proof placing him at the scene of the crimes .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;1	Friends and family members of the victims gave tearful testimony in Campbelltown Local Court this past week , describing the last time they saw or heard from their loved ones .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;2	They also identified camping equipment police found in the home of one of Milat 's brothers .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;3	A coworker and the ex-wife of the defendant , Ivan Milat , also testified about hunting , his love for guns and the state forest where the bodies were found .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;4	Milat is accused of shooting and stabbing the Australian , British and German backpackers and burying their bodies in shallow graves in Belanglo State Forest , southwest of Sydney .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;5	Their bodies were found between September 1992 and November 1993 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;6	Charged with murder , attempted murder , armed robbery and firearms offenses , Milat faces up to life imprisonment .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;7	Milat secured the services of a new barrister , two weeks after sacking his previous chief counsel .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;8	The New South Wales Supreme Court gave permission for Terry Martin , a Queensland barrister , to practice in the state and represent Milat .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;9	On Monday , before the ruling , Milat sat alone .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;10	`` I ca n't defend myself .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;11	... I 'm a roadworker , not a lawyer , '' Milat told Magistrate Michael Price .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;12	`` I 'm being framed here for seven murders . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;13	During testimony later in the week , Stephen Wright of England , identified with `` no doubt '' a tent found at one of Milat 's brothers as the one he gave British travelers Caroline Clarke and Joanne Walters .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;14	The tent still had a hole Wright said he made accidentally with a knife while touring Australia in 1992 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;15	The parents and friends of Walters and Clarke broke down in tears during testimony by Milat 's ex-wife .
APW_ENG_19941203.0009;16	She recalled her seven-year relationship with Milat and said he kept firearms and other weapons and often carried a revolver in his sock .

APW_ENG_19941203.0010;2	Americans on the Gingers are evacuated .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;3	Air Force planes begin bombing runs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;4	Marines are ready to land .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;5	`` It 's a good , messy scenario , '' Rear Adm. Dennis C. Blair , commander of the Kitty Hawk carrier battle group said as the biennial Tandem Thrust maneuvers moved Saturday toward their climax off the real Pacific islands of Guam and Tinian .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;6	Blair said a major feature of this year 's exercises , which involve 14,500 troops , is a more integrated approach -- Navy , Air Force , Army , Marines , and Coast Guard are all participating -- made necessary by tighter budgets and continued cuts in the size of the military .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;7	`` We 've had a 40 percent budget cut , so we 've learned to look to other services for some of the things we used to do ourselves , '' he said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;8	`` Before , it was really a zone defense , '' he said , making a sports metaphor in which each player is responsible for only his own part of a court or field .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;9	Nowhere is the new attitude of cooperation reflected better than in a cramped set of operations rooms in the Kitty Hawk , whose crew and air wing add up to 5,550 people .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;10	Shoulder to shoulder , specialists from the different branches of the military coordinate their air missions against the imaginary Sonorans .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;11	From that command center , crammed to overflowing with maps , message boards and state-of-the-art computers , roughly 210 sorties are planned each day , some dropping live ordnance on a small island firing range on the maneuver 's parameters .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;12	`` So far , it 's been working magnificently well , '' said Read Adm. Herb Brown , head of the exercise 's joint air command .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;13	Navy spokesmen stressed that the exercises , which began Nov. 26 and end Dec. 8 , are not planned as a preparation for hostilities with any particular nation but are instead a composite of potential threats and responses .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;14	They have also been designed to emphasize the kind of hot-spot tensions that have become more common since the end of the Cold War .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;15	As the maneuvers progress , simulated political and diplomatic activities are also underway , giving an additional dimension of uncertainty to the mission .
APW_ENG_19941203.0010;16	`` Right now , we are just trying to demonstrate to the opposition our presence , '' said Air Force Col. Ed Allen , deputy chief of the maneuver 's joint air command .

APW_ENG_19941203.0011;1	Sudhir Kumar Sharma , based in the southern city of Bangalore , where the Indian Space Research Organization is located , was arrested Thursday , The Times of India said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;2	Sharma 's arrest came a day after police picked up Nambi Narayanan , a rocket scientist who helped develop engines for launching satellites and missiles .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;3	Narayanan was the second space expert to be accused in the spy case exposed after the Oct. 20 arrest of a woman who allegedly seduced scientists and blackmailed them to give her designs of rocket engines .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;4	Both arrests were made in Trivandrum on India 's southern coast , close to a small town where the liquid propulsion laboratory that Narayanan headed is located .

APW_ENG_19941203.0011;6	Pakistan has denied it was involved .

APW_ENG_19941203.0011;8	Her interrogation led to the arrests of rocket expert D. Sasikumaran ; another Maldivian woman , Fousiya Hassan ; and K. Chandrashekaran , who claimed to represent the Russian space company Glavkosmos .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;9	Both India and Pakistan , who have fought three wars since 1947 , are believed capable of producing nuclear weapons .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;10	India is developing its own weapons delivery system , while Pakistan buys M-11 missiles from China .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;11	Indian scientists have been developing rockets to launch communications satellites since 1979 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0011;12	But the space laboratories also are involved in developing missile technology and have come under pressure from Western countries .

APW_ENG_19941203.0014;1	Pakistan needs to penetrate the Dutch defense with its own free-flowing attacks and to avoid conceding any penalty corners .
APW_ENG_19941203.0014;2	Easier said than done .
APW_ENG_19941203.0014;3	The Dutch have been ruthless from short corners throughout the two-week tournament .
APW_ENG_19941203.0014;4	Twelve of their 24 goals have come from set piece plays -- at which Floris Jan Bovelander and Taco van den Honert are devastating .

APW_ENG_19941203.0014;6	`` But if we play our normal game I believe we can beat them . ''

APW_ENG_19941203.0014;10	`` We have the best short corner specialist in the world in Bovelander , but we have scored 12 goals from the field here , '' Oltmans said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0014;11	`` We certainly do n't play only for short corners . ''

APW_ENG_19941203.0017;0	In another display of U.N. divisions over how to handle the war in Bosnia , Russia vetoed a Security Council resolution aimed at cutting Yugoslav fuel supplies reportedly powering a recent rebel Serb offensive .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;1	The resolution brought to a vote Friday night was sponsored by Islamic and non-aligned states .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;2	It would have required U.N. border monitors to severely limit shipments of fuel and other supplies crossing the border between Serb-dominated Yugoslavia and Croatia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;3	U.N. resolutions already ban shipments of all but humanitarian supplies between Yugoslavia and Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;4	Some 100 to 150 tankers filled with fuel are being allowed to cross the Yugoslav border and reach rebel Serb forces in Croatia , said a diplomat who requested anonymity .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;5	Croatian and Bosnian diplomats say the fuel is well beyond humanitarian needs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;6	Croatian Serbs in recent weeks have crossed the border into northwest Bosnia and joined Bosnian Serbs in fighting the Bosnian government army around Bihac .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;7	Russia said it vetoed the resolution because it would tighten sanctions against Serbia , the main remaining state in Yugoslavia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;8	`` We hope that ultimately there will be a sound and balanced approach '' toward making peace in Bosnia , said Russian Ambassador Sergey Lavrov .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;9	He has repeatedly accused the United Nations of using a double standard -- imposing sanctions against Serbia but ignoring acts by Bosnia 's Muslim-led army against Serbs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;10	He said the resolution was `` untimely , '' since Yugoslavia had closed its border with Bosnia and was cooperating with peace negotiations .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;11	Serbian President Slobodan Milosevic announced in August that the border was being sealed to all but humanitarian aid to pressure Bosnian Serbs into accepting a peace plan , and the United Nations eased sanctions against Yugoslavia in October .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;12	The resolution Friday also called for the release of U.N. peacekeepers being held by Serb forces .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;13	Hours before the Security Council veto Friday -- the first in a year and a half -- diplomats from Russia , the United States , France , Britain and Germany endorsed a confederation of Bosnian Serbs and neighboring Serbia in hopes of drawing Serbs into peace negotiations to end the 2 -LCB- - year war .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;14	Western diplomats differed over the impact of the Russian veto on the prospects for peace in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;15	One said that the veto was an important sign to Russians , the Serbs ' traditional allies , but would probably get little reaction from Security Council members .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;16	But Ambassador Paul Keating of New Zealand disagreed .
APW_ENG_19941203.0017;17	`` We have no doubt that the consequences of today 's vote will be felt for a long time to come , '' he said .

APW_ENG_19941203.0022;2	Bowe returns to the ring for only the second time since losing his World Boxing Association and International Boxing Federation titles to Evander Holyfield 13 months ago .

APW_ENG_19941203.0022;11	`` I 'm a master boxer and I 'm on my way up . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0022;12	Bowe , whose only fight since losing to Holyfield was an aborted no contest against Buster Mathis Jr. in August , is taking a calculated risk in meeting an up-and-coming fighter whose style could give him problems .

APW_ENG_19941203.0026;1	Johnson , 27 , was honored with the Jesse Owens Award Friday night as track and field 's top performer .
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;2	His victories , the three best times in the world for the year , extended his winning streak in the 400 to 26 in a row .
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;3	`` If you run 10 or 15 races a year , you can slack off on a few , '' Johnson said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;4	`` If you only run three races , you 've got to make sure they 're all fast . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;5	Johnson , of Rockwall , Texas , has n't lost in the 400 since 1989 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;6	This year he ran times of 44.32 and 44.04 seconds in August , and had a world-best 43.90 in Madrid , Spain , in September .
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;7	He also had the fastest time run by an American in 1994 at 200 meters , a 19.94 clocking at a meet in Monaco .
APW_ENG_19941203.0026;8	Johnson said he 'd run both events next year at the World Championships in Goteborg , Sweden , and also would double in the 1996 Atlanta Olympics .

APW_ENG_19941203.0026;10	The award was handed out at the annual USA Track & Field convention .

APW_ENG_19941203.0035;0	Investigators probing a spy ring that stole secrets from India 's space program have arrested a businessman , the sixth person to be detained in the case , newspapers reported Saturday .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;1	Sudhir Kumar Sharma was arrested Thursday , The Times of India said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;2	He was based in the southern city of Bangalore , where the Indian Space Research Organization is located .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;3	A day earlier , police arrested Nambi Narayanan , a rocket scientist who helped develop engines for launching satellites and missiles .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;4	Another rocket expert , D. Sasikumaran , was arrested earlier .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;5	Investigators cracked the ring with the Oct. 20 arrest of a woman who supposedly seduced scientists and then blackmailed them for rocket engine designs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;6	Newspapers , quoting unidentified police sources , reported that India 's arch-rival , Pakistan , was behind the ring .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;7	Pakistan has denied any involvement .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;8	India and Pakistan have fought three wars since 1947 and are believed capable of producing nuclear weapons .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;9	While Pakistan has been buying M-11 missiles from China , India has been developing its own missile technology , a program its space laborotories have taken part in .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;10	Narayanan and his alleged seducer , Mariam Rasheda , a citizen of the Maldives , were arrested in Trivandrum on India 's southern coast , near to the liquid propulsion laboratory that Narayanan headed .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;11	Following Rasheda 's arrest , police also picked up Fousiya Hassan , also of the Maldives , and K. Chandrashekaran , who claimed to represent the Russian space company Glavkosmos .
APW_ENG_19941203.0035;12	In 1992 , Glavkosmos was forced to cancel a deal to supply rocket engines to India under pressure from Washington , which fears an arms race and nuclear proliferation in the region .

APW_ENG_19941203.0041;0	Thousands of gaunt men and women -- the survivors of the world 's worst industrial disaster -- marched on the streets of Bhopal Saturday to mark the 10th anniversary of the calamity that killed , by official count , 7,000 people .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;1	The central Indian city , where deadly methyl isocyanate gas leaked from a factory owned by the Indian subsidiary of the U.S.-based Union Carbide , observed a partial strike Saturday in memory of those killed in the Dec. 2-3 , 1984 disaster .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;2	Survivors and orphaned children gathered in front of the closed factory to burn straw-and-bamboo effigies of Warren Anderson , the then chief of the Danbury , Conn.-based corporation .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;3	Children beat the burning effigies with sticks as elders , many of them with tears in their eyes , shouted `` death to Anderson . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;4	As more protestors gathered to burn effigies , some 10-feet - -LRB- 3 meter - -RRB- high , local leaders made speeches demanding that Anderson be brought to India and tried for mass murder .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;5	Others spoke of the plight of the half-a-million survivors who are yet to get full compensation .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;6	At other places in the city , prayer meetings were held for the dead .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;7	`` I know all this may produce nothing , but I decided to come , '' said Kamal Pancham , who lost his daughter and father in the disaster .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;8	`` Even after 10 years we look like beggars asking for alms , '' Rehena Begum , a voluntary worker , told a group of 500 women survivors .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;9	India 's slow-moving courts are overwhelmed with claims .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;10	Bureaucratic corruption and red tape add to the woes of survivors .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;11	Every passing day brings to hospitals fresh cases of lung diseases , cancer , cataracts , gynecological disorders , and psychiatric disorders arising out of gas poisoning .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;12	In 1989 , Union Carbide paid dlrs 470 million -- one-twelfth of India 's original claim -- in an out-of-court settlement that guaranteed immunity from prosecution for Carbide executives .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;13	The government has paid out only dlrs 20 million so far and the balance has grown to dlrs 516 million .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;14	Two years after the agreement , India 's Supreme Court struck down the immunity clause , while allowing the financial settlement to stand .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;15	But the money has been locked in banks while bureaucrats and judges sort out the claims .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;16	Eight officials of Union Carbide 's Indian subsidiary were charged with manslaughter for alleged negligence , but none has been brought to trial .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;17	Studies have found that the gassing victims have three times more respiratory problems than the national average , get cataracts 15 years earlier and have more gynecological complications .
APW_ENG_19941203.0041;18	Nearly all the victims have low immunity , and growth of affected children is slower than normal .

APW_ENG_19941203.0042;41	Mitch Richmond led all scorers with 30 points , but he had eight turnovers for the Kings .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;0	Russia 's first veto of a Security Council resolution in 18 months was a show of strength that followed repeated warnings the council was ignoring Moscow 's interests .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;1	Under strong domestic pressure to reassert its influence at the United Nations , Russia also pushed the council Friday to call for peace talks in the former Soviet republic of Georgia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;2	Russia 's veto blocked a resolution aimed at stopping Yugoslav fuel supplies reportedly powering a Serb offensive in northern Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;3	Russian Ambassador Sergey Lavrov said the resolution would have tightened sanctions against Serbia , the main remaining state in Yugoslavia , which has been cooperating with international peace efforts .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;4	`` We had no other choice than to vote against this draft , '' Lavrov said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;5	The move seemed to surprise many diplomats , but it cost Russia little .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;6	The United States did not press for the resolution and in brief remarks after the vote , deputy U.S. Ambassador Edward Gnehm made no direct mention of the veto .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;7	Lavrov has repeatedly accused the United Nations of a double standard , saying the council has imposed sanctions against Serbia but has ignored Muslim acts against Serbs -- Russia 's traditional allies .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;8	The veto came amid increasing signs of Russian assertiveness on the council .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;9	On Tuesday , Russia abstained on a resolution that increased the U.N. team in Haiti tenfold to 500 members .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;10	At the time , Lavrov accused Security Council members of focusing a `` disproportionate '' amount of attention on Haiti and of dragging its feet on `` situations that actually threaten international peace . ''
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;11	Russia has repeatedly called on the council to take a more active role in Georgia and Tajikistan , where Russia has deployed peacekeepers .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;12	On Friday , the council acted , calling on Georgia and its breakaway province of Abkhazia to press forward with peace talks .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;13	Russia last used its veto in May 1993 to block a proposal on financing the U.N. peacekeeping force in Cyprus .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;14	Vetos have been used 281 times in the Security Council since the United Nations was founded in 1945 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;15	Lavrov said Friday 's veto did not mean the death of the five-nation contact group pushing for peace in Bosnia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;16	He stressed that hours before the veto , diplomats from Russia , the United States , France , Britain and Germany demonstrated their unity by endorsing a confederation of Bosnian Serbs and neighboring Serbia .
APW_ENG_19941203.0043;17	EDITOR 'S NOTE - Louis Meixler covers the United Nations for The Associated Press .

APW_ENG_19941203.0045;0	President Kim Young-sam on Saturday ordered one of South Korea 's biggest government reshuffles , saying it will streamline key economic functions to help the country compete in the world market .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;1	The shakeup will eliminate two Cabinet ministers , three vice ministers and dozens of other high-ranking posts .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;2	The move , to take effect early next year , subject to parliamentary approval , is seen as part of Kim 's efforts to salvage his 20-month-old administration from gridlock .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;3	The country has been wracked in recent months by a series of disasters , corruption scandals , violent farmers ' protests and political bickering .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;4	In South Korea , it is common for the president to make a Cabinet reshuffle or announce important decisions to shake up a political stalemate when the government suffers serious scandals .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;5	`` The reorganization aims at a smaller but more efficient government in an age of a global economy , '' presidential spokesman Choo Don-shik quoted Kim as telling a meeting of key government officials .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;6	The highlight of the shakeup , one of the most extensive since the republic was founded in 1948 , is the merger of the Finance Ministry with the Economic Planning Board , a government ministry in charge of drawing up the budget and coordinating economic policies .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;7	The sprawling Ministry of Trade , Industry and Energy will be streamlined to focus more on trade and industry .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;8	The Transportation Ministry and the Construction Ministry are to be merged , and the Communications Ministry will take on certain functions from other ministries to deal with the information revolution , Choo said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;9	Kim has warned that divisive internal disputes leave South Korea badly prepared as it tries to cope with a new world trade agreement in an increasingly competitive world market .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;10	Recently , farmers staged violent street protests over the government 's decision to open its markets to foreign farm produce .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;11	A major bridge in Seoul collapsed in October , killing 32 people and triggering public anger over the government 's failure to manage state facilities .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;12	Tax collectors were found to have pocketed millions of dollars in what is snowballing into a nationwide tax scandal .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;13	Also Saturday , the opposition Democratic Party staged a massive outdoor demonstration in Puchon , just outside Seoul , to press its demand that the government indict former presidents Chun Doo-hwan and Roh Tae-woo for engineering a 1979 military coup that put Chun in power .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;14	The opposition says it wo n't cooperate in approving the GATT deal and other important bills unless the government agrees to bring them to trial .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;15	Chun and Roh , while still generals , established a junta to rule the country after the death of their mentor , President Park Chung-hee .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;16	Roh succeeded Chun as president in 1988 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;17	Fearing their prosecution would trigger serious political unrest , Kim has urged the nation to let history judge the December 1979 coup .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;18	Critics say Kim , a former opposition leader , owes his political success to Roh because he became president after merging his party with Roh 's governing party in 1990 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0045;19	The political scene was further strained Friday when the governing Democratic Liberal Party snubbed the opposition and unilaterally approved the 1995 budget .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;0	Rescuers located two more survivors Saturday and recovered an additional body from a ferry with more than 600 people on board that sank after colliding with a cargo ship .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;1	The recovery of the body of an elderly woman brought the confirmed death toll in Friday 's collision to 35 .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;2	More than 110 people remained missing .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;3	Rescue efforts resumed at daybreak Saturday , as the coast guard held the freighter , the Singapore-registered Kota Suria , and its 30-man crew in custody .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;4	Coast guard spokesman Lt. Cmdr. Amado Samante said the two survivors had been taken by fishermen to the coastal town of Naic in Cavite province , a few kilometers -LRB- miles -RRB- from where the ferry Cebu City sank .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;5	The two brought the total number of people confirmed to have survived to 453 out of the 608 on board the ferry , the boat 's owners said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;6	Some discrepancies remained between the coast guard 's and the owners ' figures .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;7	The cause of the accident was not yet known , but an official of William Lines , the owners , claimed the ferry had been rammed by the freighter , which had its bow badly dented .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;8	The freighter is to be held during the investigation , which will last several weeks , Samante said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;9	Jacob Cabatuan , a crewman on the ferry , said the freighter crashed bow-first into the ship , destroying the bridge and ripping a one-meter -LRB- three-foot -RRB- hole in the lower deck .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;10	He said the ferry 's captain , first and second mates were pinned on the bridge .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;11	Passengers , many of whom were asleep after the ferry 's predawn departure from Manila , said they had no warning of the accident .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;12	The ferry sank into mud under about 25 meters -LRB- 85 feet -RRB- of water .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;13	Four teams of coast guard and navy divers were searching the ship for bodies believed trapped in the cabins , Samante said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;14	About 50 coast guard , navy and commercial sea vessels were involved in the search effort Saturday , he said .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;15	`` We are hopeful to find survivors , '' said Samante .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;16	Seaman Angel Espidido , one of 27 coast guard divers who joined navy frogmen Friday , said he could see bodies trapped inside the cabins but that divers were unable to open the doors .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;17	The 2,452-ton Cebu City had left Manila bound for the resort area of Tagbilaran , the capital of Bohol Island , about 560 kilometers -LRB- 350 miles -RRB- to the southeast , a 28-hour boat trip .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;18	The ferry , usually used by families and small business owners , sank 30 minutes after it and the 12,500-ton freighter collided .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;19	William Lines said the Cebu City had a capacity of 800 passengers .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;20	It sank near the town of Rosario , about 50 kilometers -LRB- 35 miles -RRB- southwest of Manila in Cavite province .
APW_ENG_19941203.0046;21	The Philippines ' worst peacetime ferry disaster was in December 1987 , when 4,341 people died in the collision of the ferry Dona Paz with the oil tanker Vector off Mindoro Island , about 130 kilometers -LRB- 80 miles -RRB- south of Manila .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;0	KARACHI , Pakistan -LRB- AP -RRB- - About 15,000 people , including several top Pakistani celebrities , marched through the streets of this troubled port city Saturday chanting `` Save Karachi '' and demanding an end to worsening violence .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;1	`` Karachi is bleeding and I have come to press for peace , '' said social worker Nargis Latif , who like most of the marchers dressed in white to signify peace .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;2	Political and ethnic violence has claimed hundreds of lives in Karachi this year .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;3	Government services have all but collapsed and many residents complain of a general sense of lawlessness .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;4	In the latest outburst of violence , seven people were gunned down Friday night .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;5	Three victims were fatally shot when attackers opened fire outside the house of the country 's labor minister , Akbar Lasi .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;6	The minister was in the capital of Islamabad at the time of the attack .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;7	The march , organized by the country 's leading newspaper publisher , began in the center of the city at the mausoleum of Mohammed Ali Jinnah , Pakistan 's founding father .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;8	In a festive atmosphere that included music and signing , the marchers traveled almost 10 kilometers -LRB- 6.2 miles -RRB- to the main government offices .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;9	One of the march leaders was Imran Khan , Pakistan 's most famous cricket player .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;10	Marchers threw rose petals on Khan and a number of film and television stars who took part in the procession .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;11	The army , which patrolled the streets of Karachi for the past 30 months , was withdrawn Wednesday and many fear the police force and a paramilitary unit will be unable to maintain control .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;12	The unrest has disrupted business in the country 's financial capital and frightened away potential foreign investors .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;13	Much of the violence pits the security forces against the Mohajir Quami Movement , a powerful opposition group that represents mohajirs , or Muslim immigrants from India .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;14	The MQM accuses Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto of discriminating against mohajirs .
APW_ENG_19941203.0047;15	Ms. Bhutto 's government , meanwhile , says the MQM is a terrorist organization that uses violence to advance its cause .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;0	A solar telescope to be used in an international project to monitor vibrations inside the sun is en route to the Canary Islands .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;1	In the coming months , sun-watching telescopes will also be sent to Australia , India , Chile , Hawaii and California .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;2	`` This is a great milestone , '' said project manager Jim Kennedy of the Tucson-based National Solar Observatory .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;3	`` These instruments are going to have a very major impact on our understanding not only of how our own sun works , but how other stars work as well .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;4	`` At the present time , what we know about the inside of the sun basically comes from looking at the outside of the sun and making guesses about what must be happening beneath the surface , '' he added .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;5	About 20 years ago , scientists discovered that the sun resonates like a bell , the vibrations caused by sound waves bouncing around inside .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;6	Scientists probe the sun 's interior by studying its sound waves much as geologists analyze seismic waves to learn about the Earth 's interior .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;7	The six telescopes will track the sun throughout the day .
APW_ENG_19941203.0048;8	When the sun sets at one station , the next station to the west will pick it up and continue observations , providing around-the-clock coverage .
